full_commentary: Mustafizur to Kedar Jadhav, FOUR, he has done it! Make way for the men in yellow, for there are plenty of them who are storming to the middle to jump over Jadhav. Careful of that hamstring though. Oh forget about it, no one cares anymore. Full ball from Mustafizur, drilled through the covers. What a finish. Unbelievable

Mustafizur to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, he's scooped this for six, he's scooped this for six. Kedar Jadhav.... Oh my. Imran Tahir drops his bat and runs across to hug Jadhav. There's another run to go, but he doesn't care. Good length cutter angled across off, Jadhav bends over - bad hamstring and all - and finds the leverage to lift it over short fine leg. Chennai players are clapping violently

Mustafizur to Kedar Jadhav, no run, third dot in a row. Jadhav's probably decided that he can't leave it to Tahir, which is why he isn't taking the single. Or can he run at all with a damaged hamstring? Back of length on off, steered straight to third man
Mustafizur to Kedar Jadhav, no run, back of a length delivery on leg, fine leg was up in the ring but Jadhav paddles this straight to him. What a huge opportunity goes begging
Mustafizur to Kedar Jadhav, no run, slower length ball, Jadhav defends into the on-side

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by Rohit!! A 20-run over from Bumrah has been redeemed right at the end. Bravo's gone. But has the damage been done? Short ball, Bravo swings hard but slices it up to extra-cover. Seven needed from six. Get ready to lose your mind. Dwayne Bravo c Rohit b Bumrah 68(30) [4s-3 6s-7]
Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, Wankhede is coming unglued here. The stadium is rocking for Bravo. Low full toss, he's heaved it over deep mid-wicket, just over the fielder

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, no run, this is mental, absolutely mental. The ball has actually rolled onto the stumps, but the bails stay unmoved. Brilliant yorker from Bumrah, Bravo digs it out off the toe-end but the ball still goes back towards the stumps. Is this Bravo's night?

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, 2 runs, big groan from Bravo as he steers it straight to short third man. Should they have gone for the single? Doesn't matter as there has been an overthrow and Bravo will retain strike

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, Hardik Pandya slaps the seat in frustration as he sits in the dugout. Another six. This game has come alive out of nowhere. Bumrah goes round the wicket, bowls a full toss on the pads and is whipped over mid-wicket

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, this is awesome. This is so awesome. Bumrah - one of best T20 bowlers going around - has been effortlessly creamed into the long-off stands. Fifty off just 25 balls for Bravo. Now this should set the cat among the pigeons
McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, chipped back over the bowler's head, probably off a leading edge. It will help Bravo keep strike. What a knock this has been
McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, bangs it in short seeing Bravo advance, but is still spanked away into the boundary. He's got himself in that kind of zone, where most things are disappearing
McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, 2 runs, yorker length delivery on leg, Bravo squeezes it in between two fielders at long-on and deep mid-wicket, rushes back for two
McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, back-to-back sixes! Sublime wrists from Bravo as he whips it off the pads and sends it sailing into the deep mid-wicket stands
McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, full ball on middle, Bravo gets his front leg out of the way and belts it over long-off. Not a clean contact, but this isn't the biggest ground
McClenaghan to Tahir, 1 run, glided down to third man
Hardik Pandya to Dwayne Bravo, no run, finishes off with a brilliant yorker which is jammed back down the pitch. Excellent figures of 3/24
Hardik Pandya to Dwayne Bravo, no run, slippery short of length delivery which hurries onto Bravo's thigh pad. He was too late in trying to clip it away
Hardik Pandya to Tahir, 1 run, nurdles it round the corner for one

Hardik Pandya to Mark Wood, out Caught by Mustafizur!! Oh boy, how lucky is Pandya! Filthy drag-down on leg-stump, but instead of hitting it into Churchgate station, Wood hits it straight down fine leg's throat. Pandya is struggling though as he immediately bends over in evident pain. Absolutely no joy on his face for the wicket. Mark Wood c Mustafizur b Hardik Pandya 1(3)
Hardik Pandya to Mark Wood, no run, surprises Wood with a really good short ball. It was only at 126kph, but Pandya got it nice and steep to beat Wood's pull
Hardik Pandya to Mark Wood, wide, this is even wider down leg
Hardik Pandya to Mark Wood, wide, slower ball down leg, Wood fails to tickle it away
Hardik Pandya to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, miscues this off the top-edge, but it lands safely behind square leg. Smart slower short ball from Pandya, made Bravo wait and then he went too hard
Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, clipped away through square leg for one, will keep strike
Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, no run, Bravo restrains himself from banging his bat into the pitch in frustration. He managed to slice this yorker beautifully, but it went straight to backward point
Bumrah to Mark Wood, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off, chopped to third man
Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, hangs back to a length ball and drives down to long-on
Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, no run, slower full ball on off, defended

Bumrah to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, stunning shot over extra-cover from Bravo. For once, Bumrah offers a length which the batsman can get under, and Bravo - leaning back - smokes it inside-out. How did he manage to generate that power! Hits flush on the cushions
McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, squeezes out the yorker into the off-side

McClenaghan to Harbhajan, out Caught by Bumrah!! Strange shot from Harbhajan, almost waving this short ball down to third man. Probably he got a bit too cramped for room, so he couldn't go through with this upper cut. Nothing shot in the end, just gliding it down the fielder's throat. Bravo has started well at the other end, but he's now in danger of running out of partners. Harbhajan c Bumrah b McClenaghan 8(5) [4s-1]
McClenaghan to Harbhajan, wide, completely off the mark with this delivery, bowls it well down leg. Harbhajan watches it pass by
McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, pitched up at the stumps, flicked to deep square leg
McClenaghan to Harbhajan, 1 run, back of a length delivery on leg, clipped away through square leg
McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, full ball on leg, Bravo's too early to close the bat-face and sends a leading edge towards mid-off

McClenaghan to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, Bravo keeps fighting. He charges down the track while making enough room for himself to carve this short ball over cover. It was more of a slice, but he's still able to beat sweeper cover to his right

Mustafizur to Harbhajan, FOUR, McClenaghan has let this sneak right through him. Poor from the fast bowler. Mustafizur turns around in disgust. Good length ball slanted outside off, squirted off a thick edge and should have only been a single down to third man
Mustafizur to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, defends the off-cutter into the covers
Mustafizur to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, stuck in the crease while flashing a drive away from the body, runs away off the edge for four. Third man was up in the ring
Mustafizur to Harbhajan, 1 run, back of a length delivery just outside off, goes back and works it wide of mid-on

Mustafizur to Harbhajan, 2 runs, back of a length cutter angled across off, Harbhajan punches it wide of long-off and then takes an age to get back for the second. Luckily, the ball's wide enough of Pollard to help him make it
Mustafizur to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, slower length ball on off, defensively pushed through mid-off

Markande to Chahar, out Stumped!! Oh dear. It's easy to be critical of players sometimes, but what was Chahar thinking here. First ball against a bowler who's bowling so well, he comes galloping down for an ugly slog. Completely done in by the length as this googly slips through the inside edge for an easy stumping. Chahar st Ishan Kishan b Markande 0(1)
Markande to Dwayne Bravo, leg byes, 1 run, drifting in on leg, brushes Bravo's pad and rolls away into the short fine leg region

Markande to Dwayne Bravo, SIX, good start this from Bravo. He picked the previous two deliveries and now he gets his dancing shoes on to get to the pitch of the ball. It's followed by his trademark flourish to launch it over long-on
Markande to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, goes back in the crease and works this googly round the corner
Markande to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, now a leg-break, Bravo defends softly in front of short cover. Good stride forward
Markande to Dwayne Bravo, no run, flighted googly on a length outside off, Bravo defends to short cover

Mustafizur to Jadeja, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Mustafizur is too clever for Jadeja here. He saw him coming down and bowled this cutter pretty wide. Jadeja still throws his bat at it, only managing to lob it off the toe-end. No troubles for Surya at mid-off. You never say never, but it would take something sensational for CSK to turn this around. Jadeja c Suryakumar Yadav b Mustafizur 12(13) [4s-1]

Mustafizur to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, walks down the pitch and carves this length ball down to Pollard at long-off. The idea was for a flat-batted smash, but the bat-face opened and he ended up slicing it
Mustafizur to Jadeja, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off, Jadeja is slightly surprised by the bounce and checks his cut shot down to third man
Mustafizur to Jadeja, FOUR, half-volley from Mustafizur, duly hammered back through mid-off. CSK need a flurry of these to bring some life back in this contest
Mustafizur to Kedar Jadhav, leg byes, 1 run, cutter on leg-stump, deflects off Jadhav's thigh pad behind square
Mustafizur to Jadeja, 1 run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Jadeja runs it with an open face to third man
Markande to Jadeja, 1 run, bowls the googly from round the wicket, but it's too short. Gives Jadeja enough time to pick it and then slap it through to deep point
Markande to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, shimmies out and squeezes this down to long-off
Markande to Jadeja, 1 run, shortish googly turning away from off, Jadeja steers it through point
Markande to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, flatter from Markande in response to the previous ball, Jadhav pats it through point
Markande to Kedar Jadhav, SIX, has he got enough on it? Jusssst. Shimmied down and swung hard, got it close to the bottom of the bat but the muscle behind it was good enough
Markande to Jadeja, 1 run, flighted ball just outside off, bit too full, Jadeja drives to long-on
Hardik Pandya to Kedar Jadhav, no run, slower ball to end the over. That was bowled at 109.3kph. Jadhav defends towards backward point and looks for a single. Jadeja sends him back
Hardik Pandya to Jadeja, 1 run, Jadeja waltzes down the track, plays the compulsive pull against this short ball. Off the splice and hence doesn't carry to deep mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Jadeja, no run, 129.2kph, stump-to-stump line ball, defended to cover
Hardik Pandya to Jadeja, 2 runs, leg-stump line, worked in front of square on the leg-side for a brace
Hardik Pandya to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, strays one on leg and that's been clipped away through square leg

Hardik Pandya to Kedar Jadhav, no run, good ball! Back of a length ball that bounces more than Jadhav expected it to. Arches his back to late-cut, connects with thin air. That was a pacy and skiddy delivery from Hardik Pandya
Hardik Pandya to Kedar Jadhav, wide, pitched up delivery, but the line is too wide outside off
Markande to Jadeja, no run, defended from the crease

Markande to Jadeja, no run. Another googly, a different batsman misses by a long way. The keeper takes off the bails and the TV umpire has been disturbed again. The back foot is in and Jadeja survives. Well, the CSKians are finding it one helluva task tackling Mayank Markande. It was another quick wrong 'un and Jadeja was pressing forward to block expecting it to be the in-turner. Spun past the outside edge
Markande to Jadeja, no run, flighted delivery on middle, defended into the leg-side

Markande to Dhoni, out Lbw!! Dhoni doesn't spot the googly and pinned in front of middle. Chris Gaffaney shakes his head in denial. That looked plumb. Mumbai Indians review. Fair delivery. Nothing on the UltraEdge. Three reds and Dhoni is gone for a single digit score. Markande is having a ball here at the Wankhede. Second wicket for him with the wrong 'un. Should have been three. The quickish googly and Dhoni wasn't commited - either on the front foot or on the back foot. Didn't pick it at all and got beaten on the inside edge by a fair margin. The impact was on the back leg adjacent to off and middle. Can't get more plumb than that. Dhoni lbw b Markande 5(5)
Markande to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, more flight on this occasion, Jadhav comes down the track, isn't quite to the ball. Drives to long-on off the inside part
Markande to Dhoni, 1 run, loopy ball, Dhoni comes down the track, takes on the full and flicks it to deep mid-wicket
Bumrah to Dhoni, 1 run, to third man, 140.1kph, angled in on off, Dhoni opens the bat-face and sends it down to third man
Bumrah to Dhoni, 2 runs, 143.3kph, full and outside off, Dhoni has his back knee bent as he drives it through covers for a couple
Bumrah to Kedar Jadhav, 1 run, back of a length delivery angled in on middle and leg, tucked behind square leg
Boult to Stoinis, 1 run, that's it! KXIP have won their first outing. Full delivery from Boult, Stoinis chips it over cover

Boult to Stoinis, FOUR, smashed and the scores are level. There is a man at long-off, but he is very wide, Stoinis picks the slower ball early, waits and then muscles it down the ground for a one-bounce four
Boult to Miller, 1 run, Boult goes for the wide yorker, Miller reaches out and drives it to deep cover
Boult to Stoinis, 1 run, slower ball from Boult, Stoinis drives it to long-on
Boult to Miller, 1 run, low full toss on the leg stump, Miller loses shape on the slog and hits it to deep mid-wicket

Boult to Stoinis, no ball, 1 run, very full and on the leg stump, driven to long-on. Extra fielder outside the circle, so it's been adjudged a no ball. Free-hit coming up and captain Gambhir is not happy, is shaking his head
Chris Morris to Miller, 2 runs, change of pace again from Chris Morris, Miller pulls it towards fine leg and comes back for the second
Chris Morris to Stoinis, 1 run, slower ball and Stoinis flicks to deep mid-wicket
Chris Morris to Miller, 1 run, full delivery on the stumps, Miller flicks it into the on-side
Chris Morris to Stoinis, 1 run, slower delivery from Chris Morris, Stoinis mistimes the pull to long-on

Chris Morris to Stoinis, no run, hit on the leg. Oh dear! This one's missed the pad and hit him hard on the side of the knee. He's down on the floor in pain, gets up but he is limping. That is one bad area to get and it wasn't the slower ball from Morris. That will be really painful for Stoinis. Gets some attention and he's good to continue
Chris Morris to Stoinis, no run, oh that's almost knocked the off pole out of the ground, short of length delivery just outside off stump, Stoinis tries to pull and misses

Rahul Tewatia to Stoinis, 3 runs, chopped past short third man, flatter delivery outside off stump, Stoinis tries to guide it to third man, ends up get an under edge. 11 off that over, very hard for KXIP

Rahul Tewatia to Stoinis, FOUR, no one at deep cover and Stoinis picks the gap. Went back to give himself a bit of room, the bowler dropped it short and Stoinis lofts the ball over the infield for four
Rahul Tewatia to Stoinis, no run, the reverse sweep attempted and it's down the leg-side, Stoinis makes no contact
Rahul Tewatia to Miller, 1 run, flatter delivery outside off stump, Miller guides it to short third man
Rahul Tewatia to Stoinis, 1 run, good from the bowler, he dropped it short on seeing Stoinis advance, the batsman makes the adjustment late and flicks through mid-wicket
Rahul Tewatia to Stoinis, 2 runs, Stoinis was down on one knee and ready for the paddle even before Rahul Tewatia jumped in his delivery stride, helped away to fine leg
Christian to Stoinis, 1 run, this is flicked away to long-on, almost a yorker, but Stoinis manged to hit it well

Christian to Stoinis, 2 runs, oh what a shot to begin with. Full and on the stumps, a solid straight drive from the middle of the bat, just misses the stumps and long-off cuts it off, Miller calls Stoinis through for the second

Christian to Nair, out Caught by Boult!! In the airrr and he's picked out Boult this time. He is very disappointed that he's gifted the wicket away. "These are not baby boundaries," says Pommie Mbangwa on air. Oh Nair, this is not the Chinnaswamy that you are so used to. Anyway, full credit to him for an excellent effort. Another shortish ball from Christian, Nair pulls again, hits it flatter this time and Boult moves to his right before completing the catch and tumbling.  Nair c Boult b Christian 50(33) [4s-5 6s-2]
Christian to Nair, no run, good yorker outside off stump, Nair digs it out

Christian to Nair, SIX, that's a nice way to raise the fifty. Harmless short of length delivery from Christian, Nair waits and pulls powerfully over mid-wicket. 9th IPL fifty for him and he takes the helmet off and points to the KXIP badge on the helmet. His team-mates are elated
Christian to Nair, no run, short of length delivery down the leg-side, Nair gets inside the line and wants to help it away past the man at 45 but wears it on the thigh pad and can't get a run
Mishra to Miller, 2 runs, in the gap at mid-wicket again and Miller jogs back for the second. This is sensible and good batting from Miller
Mishra to Miller, 2 runs, flicked along the ground to mid-wicket and it's an easy two this time
Mishra to Nair, 1 run, tossed up and on the leg stump, Nair flicks to deep mid-wicket, where Boult runs to his left to tidy up
Mishra to Nair, no run, fast and full, Nair under-edges the sweep to short fine leg
Mishra to Miller, 1 run, down the leg-side, flicked through backward square leg
Mishra to Miller, no run, oh the leading edge is found, but it doesn't carry to cover. Miller wanted to flick this googly on the on-side, got away with the edge
Rahul Tewatia to Miller, 1 run, short and outside off stump, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
Rahul Tewatia to Nair, 1 run, another ill-timed chip from Nair, he wanted to flick to mid-wicket off the back foot, ends up hitting the ball through the vacant mid-on region
Rahul Tewatia to Miller, 1 run, nice looking shot from Miller, had to go back to adjust for the spin and the length, did well to cut it to sweeper cover
Rahul Tewatia to Nair, 1 run, a stride forward and then a whip of the wrists on the on-drive to long-on
Rahul Tewatia to Nair, no run, pushed through quicker and forces Nair to play off the back foot, punched to cover
Rahul Tewatia to Miller, 1 run, spinning back in, Miller goes back and punches it down through mid-on
Mishra to Miller, 1 run, comes forward and then gently flicks along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Mishra to Nair, 1 run, wristed to mid-wicket
Mishra to Nair, 2 runs, in the airrr but safe! Flighted delivery outside off stump, Nair doesn't control the cover drive, lucky that he got it wide of the fielder

Mishra to Nair, no run, half shout for LBW, Mishy isn't very keen, knows the googly was probably missing leg stump, Nair played outside the line of the ball as he didn't read the variation. In fact, may have been an inside edge and looked like it was just the normal leggie from Mishy
Mishra to Miller, 1 run, very full and on the stumps, Miller drives it to long-on
Mishra to Nair, 1 run, chipped in the air but mid-off is vacant, Nair wanted to on-drive this flighted delivery, but the ball spun and took the outer half of the bat
Rahul Tewatia to Nair, 1 run, gets the outside edge as Nair tries to defend this away-spinning ball, the ball is cut off very well with a dive by the man at short third man
Rahul Tewatia to Miller, 1 run, quicker leggie, Miller doesn't come forward despite the length not being short, flicks to long-on
Rahul Tewatia to Miller, no run, Miller lets it pass thinking the ump would call that a wide but the ball went just inside the line there
Rahul Tewatia to Miller, no run, oh this keeps very low and almost runs through Miller's defences, Miller hurriedly got the bat down and then nudged into the on-side
Rahul Tewatia to Miller, no run, flatter delivery just outside off stump, punched into the off-side
Rahul Tewatia to Miller, FOUR, oh please! Test the batsman! Short and wide, asking for trouble, Miller stands tall and slaps the ball hard past cover, the fielder in the deep can't cut it off
Mishra to Miller, 1 run, googly on the leg stump, easy flick to deep square leg for Miller and he'll keep strike
Mishra to Nair, 1 run, on the pads, rotated to mid-wicket
Mishra to Nair, 2 runs, short enough for Nair to go back and nudge in the gap at mid-wicket, Miller charges across the pitch for the second run and the fielder fired a poor throw
Mishra to Miller, 1 run, drops it very short, should have been smashed, but Miller mistimes the back foot pull and it rolls to deep mid-wicket
Mishra to Nair, 1 run, flighted delivery around the off stump, Nair drives it to long-off

Mishra to Nair, FOUR, oh no! It's getting worse for Mishy! 24 in the first over and now bowls a filthy delivery down the leg-side, Nair helps it away fine past the man at short fine leg. He gets into the 30s now
Rahul Tewatia to Nair, 1 run, gives more air, overpitches it too. Nair with a front foot push to long-off
Rahul Tewatia to Nair, no run, flattish, zips through the deck and pins Nair low on the pad as he misses his flick
Rahul Tewatia to Miller, 1 run, oh, a better throw to the keeper could've had Nair in trouble. Miller punched it towards cover and set off for a quick single. Nair responded and makes it in
Rahul Tewatia to Miller, no run, tossed on middle and leg, Miller crouches low and turns it to mid-wicket

Rahul Tewatia to Yuvraj, out Caught by Vijay Shankar!! Yuvraj's struggle is over. Never looked comfortable right from the start. The time-out snaps his concentration further and he departs. Cleverly done by Tewatia, saw Yuvraj advance and dropped it short. Yuvraj smacked, it lacked timing and hits it straight to Vijay Shankar at deep mid-wicket. Much-needed breakthrough for Delhi. Yuvraj c Vijay Shankar b Rahul Tewatia 12(22) [4s-2]
Rahul Tewatia to Yuvraj, no run, quick leg-break, skids on. A fidgety Yuvi pokes and misses
Shami to Nair, no run, Shami is lucky to get away with this. Angles in a low full toss, Nair flicks it straight to mid-wicket

Shami to Nair, FOUR, hat-trick of fours. Educated edge, so deft from Nair. Off-pace delivery from Shami, too full. Nair opened his bat face, soft hands and gets an outside edge that beats the keeper to his right
Shami to Nair, FOUR, Nair called "Two, two" as soon as he pulled. But the timing and quick outfield meant that long-on had no chance. A cross-batted smash and Nair placed it nicely in the gap
Shami to Nair, FOUR, half-volley and asking for trouble. Nair leans across and slaps it over extra cover
Shami to Yuvraj, 1 run, straighter lines from Shami, on off and middle. Yuvraj breaks the monotony of dots and clips it through square leg
Shami to Nair, 1 run, cross-seam back of a length delivery just outside off, Nair chops it to the right of the keeper and hands the strike back to Yuvraj
Christian to Yuvraj, no run, Christian finishes with a dot. Fuller and curled on off, Yuvraj pushes it to extra cover. More off the outer half
Christian to Yuvraj, no run, goes a little wide of the crease and unleashes the cutter at the stumps. Yuvraj gets into the defence mode
Christian to Yuvraj, no run, pitched up and arrowing on middle, Yuvraj presents his full face of the bat and defends it back to Christian
Christian to Nair, 1 run, short on off, Nair pulls it along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Christian to Yuvraj, 1 run, from round the wicket, slants it in. Yuvraj with a feeble push and feet cemented to the crease - directs it to long-on
Christian to Nair, 1 run, begins with a cutter outside off, Nair fetches the pull from outside off and sends it down to long-on
Boult to Yuvraj, no run, full and nipping in, Yuvraj pokes it off the inner half back to the bowler
Boult to Yuvraj, no run, again, Boult peppers it short. Yuvraj tries to pull and this time gets it off the bottom of the bat. Rolls towards the keeper
Boult to Yuvraj, no run, short but not too short for Yuvraj to connect with his pull. Was a bit early in the shot there
Boult to Nair, 1 run, now stays back, opens his bat face and dinks it to third man

Boult to Nair, SIX, wow. Such a sweet sound as soon as Nair connected. Nothing wrong with the delivery at all, goodish length on off and middle. Nair manufactured room and freed his arms with a lofted swing over mid-off. Just about clears the fence and KL Rahul in the dug-out applauds it too
Boult to Nair, no run, shortish outside off, Nair gets right behind the line and offers a neat block
Chris Morris to Yuvraj, no run, another slower delivery from Morris, scoots low and sneaks under Yuvraj's horizontal slash

Chris Morris to Yuvraj, no run, full outside off, Yuvraj meets the drive off the meat, straight to extra cover, who fires a throw at the non-striker's end but misses the stumps. Nair was in anyway I guess

Chris Morris to Yuvraj, FOUR, the edges are flying as well. Attempted slower ball from Morris, wafts it well outside off. Yuvraj goes for the drive and gets a thick outside edge. Runs away to the third man fence
Chris Morris to Nair, 1 run, fuller outside off, Nair sans any feet goes hard on the drive. Inside-edges it behind square
Chris Morris to Nair, no run, Morris shortens his length, Nair stands tall in his crease and defends
Chris Morris to Nair, FOUR, lovely from Nair. He is away with a boundary. Full and tailing on middle, Nair moves across and flicks it through mid-wicket. Beautifully placed in the gap
Boult to Yuvraj, no run, a swinging in, yorker at the stumps. Yuvraj clears his front leg and jams it to the left of Boult

Boult to Rahul, out Caught by Shami!! End of Rahul's blitz. Two wickets in two overs for Delhi and Gambhir is all pumped. Roaring reception from the home crowd for Rahul, a sensational innings comes to an end. Low full toss on off, Rahul stayed low to scoop it over short fine leg. But gets a leading edge and balloons it up in the air towards short third man. Shami judges it well and pouches it safely. Rahul c Shami b Boult 51(16) [4s-6 6s-4]
Boult to Yuvraj, 1 run, full on the stumps, Yuvraj drives it with a full face of the bat to long-on
Boult to Yuvraj, no run, shortish on off, Yuvraj pulls and mistimes. Drags it to mid-on
Boult to Yuvraj, no run, oh, dear. This almost carried to mid-off. A fullish delivery outside off, Yuvraj prods forward and drives airly, just short of mid-off
Boult to Yuvraj, no run, uncertainty from Yuvraj. Was caught in two minds, changes his shot at the last instant and quells it under his nose
Chris Morris to Yuvraj, 1 run, Morris goes short just outside off, Yuvraj goes deep and guides it with an open bat to third man
Chris Morris to Yuvraj, no run, pitched up on middle, Yuvraj presents a straight bat push down the ground. Mid-on cuts it off
Chris Morris to Yuvraj, FOUR, and now he gets off the mark with a boundary. Full on leg, Yuvraj moves across and pulls it away through mid-wicket. Don't bother running for those
Chris Morris to Yuvraj, no run, oh, a bumper to greet Yuvi. Banged in short, Yuvraj ducks in time to evade it

Chris Morris to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Shami!! Gone. This will ease some nerves in the Delhi camp. An extention of the forward defence, just checked his shot and the timing is so brilliant that it went straight to mid-on. Easy grab for Shami. Subdued celebration. Morris gets a wicket off his second ball. Mayank Agarwal c Shami b Chris Morris 7(5) [6s-1]

Chris Morris to Mayank Agarwal, SIX, and Agarwal is into the act. Short of a length ball outside off, Agarwal creates room, opens himself up and stroked it nonchalantly over cover for a six. Gee, the Punjab fans are going berserk
Mishra to Rahul, no run, a dot to finish the over. Some respite for Mishra. A leg-break tossed just outside off, turns a wee bit and beats Rahul's attempted swish
Mishra to Rahul, FOUR, fastest IPL FIFTY. Take a bow, Rahul. This is incredible batting from the Karnataka lad. Floated up, Rahul uses his powerful wrists and bludgeons it past mid-on
Mishra to Rahul, FOUR, raining boundaries. Dragged short and Rahul rocks back to smoke it in front of square on the leg-side. Picked the length early and dismissed it from his presence

Mishra to Rahul, SIX, oops. He's on the floor but guess what? Still manages to time it to place it in the gap over short fine leg. Insane stuff from Rahul, tossed up on leg. Rahul gets low and in the process, loses his balance. Somehow connects with the sweep and gets it behind square
Mishra to Rahul, SIX, 10 off first two. Rahul masterclass. Just sit back and enjoy, folks. Flighted on the stumps, Rahul makes room and gets under it to launch it over mid-on. All the way!

Mishra to Rahul, FOUR, change of bowler but Rahul is leaving no stone unturned in putting away these filths to the fence. Mishra bowls a half-volley, Rahul just extends his arms and blasts it through extra cover

Shami to Mayank Agarwal, no run, a loud "Noooo" from Agarwal and Rahul is sent back. A direct-hit could've been interesting here. Knocked with a straight bat to mid-on, KLR wanted a single and was wisely sent back. No run there, where was he heading?
Shami to Rahul, 1 run, jettisons violence and treks back in his crease to glide this short of length delivery to third man

Shami to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul is already looking in fab touch. Boundaries flowing off his willow. Full and at the stumps, Rahul goes hard and mistimes. Drags it through square leg off the inner half but still earns himself a boundary

Shami to Rahul, SIX, "Don't bowl there," quips Danny Morrison. Guess what? Rahul has pulled it effortlessly over fine leg for a maximum. Short, nothing much to trouble Rahul, who's too good with the short balls. Nailed it after a clockwise spindle and muscled it
Shami to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, Shami sticks to middle and leg stump line, Agarwal gets the scorecard ticking by tucking it wide of mid-wicket
Shami to Mayank Agarwal, no run, angling on leg, Agarwal hops inside the line and turns it to mid-wicket
Boult to Rahul, FOUR, this has been quite a smacking for Boult. 16 runs to finish the over. A wide half-volley and Rahul accepts it with glee. Bends low and creams it through cover, pristine stuff
Boult to Rahul, FOUR, this was sheer class. No half measures whatsoever. Gives the charge, meets the pitch in a hurry and slams it powerfully over covers!

Boult to Rahul, SIX, there's the first maximum of the innings. Fortuitous though. A leg-stump length delivery, Rahul made a slight adjustment and looks to helped it over short fine leg. Ends up getting a fat top-edge and with modern bats these days, it flies over the fence for a maximum
Boult to Rahul, no run, crisp as a cracker! But straight to mid-off. Another tempting half-volley just outside off, Rahul drives sweetly. Finds mid-off
Boult to Rahul, 2 runs, runs and Rahul is off the mark. A gentle tuck off the hips to this back of a length delivery towards mid-wicket and easy two nabbed

Boult to Rahul, no run, teaser first up from Boult, luring Rahul into the drive. He shows intent and goes hard but without any feet movement, hence drags it off the inner half straight down the pitch. Mayank is keen for the single but Rahul sends him back

Mohit Sharma to Christian, out Bowled!! Kaboom! Who says the yorker has gone out of fashion? It never has and it never will. Lovely yorker from Mohit, on the base of off stump and Christian was making room to slam it through cover. Too good a nut for him and he fails to get his bat down in time. Timber it is! DD finish on 166/7. Is it enough? Christian b Mohit Sharma 13(13) [6s-1]

Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, 3 runs, comedy of errors! Initially a good stop by Tye, doesn't stop it cleanly as his slide ended up booting it, then Stoinis in the tag team effort nearly overruns the ball. Saves it though and finally, the umpire by mistake signals a boundary before apologizing. Gee! Fuller ball that was hacked away towards deep mid-wicket. Struck it fairly well but good fielding denied him a boundary. They get three though

Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, FOUR, just wide of Tye's outstretched hands running to his left from deep mid-wicket. Had a lot of work to do but was never really going to get to it. Slower ball on a shortish length and Morris went for the forehand smash. Mistimed it but luckily, got it in the gap. Or nearly in the gap. Doesn't matter how they come as long as they do

Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, 2 runs, continues to get his length right, does Mohit. Almost in the blockhole and Morris drags it off the inner half towards deep mid-wicket. Had to go for the second to keep Morris on strike and they do it
Mohit Sharma to Christian, 1 run, good bowling! Very full and attacking the stumps, nearly a yorker and Christian despite backing away to make room, cannot get under it. Dragged down to long-off
Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, 1 run, slower bouncer that sticks onto the surface, Morris mistimes the pull towards deep mid-wicket, just a single and KXIP won't mind these

Andrew Tye to Christian, SIX, smacked away! Takes full toll of the extra delivery, does Christian. Full and in the slot for him, he just hacks it over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. DD needed that badly, they certainly did

Andrew Tye to Christian, no ball, this is a no ball, no doubt! Immediate apology from Tye, slipped out of his hand perhaps and it's a beamer. Christian evades it and Rahul does well to get around. Free Hit loading!
Andrew Tye to Christian, no run, top ball! The wide yorker with the change of pace, Christian was backing away initially and had no way to connect in the end despite trying to reach it
Andrew Tye to Chris Morris, 1 run, not getting the timing right, is Morris. Very full and he goes hard at it, dragged down to long-off
Andrew Tye to Christian, 1 run, high full toss, almost a waist-high no ball but the umpires feel it's okay. Christian was taken aback by the full toss and mistimed the hoick towards the mid-on region
Andrew Tye to Chris Morris, 1 run, very full and attacking the stumps, powers it down the ground towards wide long-on

Andrew Tye to Christian, leg byes, 1 run, good stop by Rahul, saved a few runs for sure. Christian was charging down the pitch and this was a full toss heading down leg, brushes his pads en route to Rahul who makes a good stop

Mujeeb to Christian, 1 run, flatter and around middle, Christian moves across the stumps and whips it through deep square leg. What an IPL debut for Mujeeb, 4-0-28-2 read his figures and he also affected a vital run out of Gambhir with that direct hit
Mujeeb to Chris Morris, 1 run, very full and outside off, push-driven down the ground to long-off

Mujeeb to Chris Morris, 2 runs, continues to hit the back of the length zone, tough to get under these and Morris mistimes it through wide mid-on. Good running fetches them two as Mujeeb had to himself go behind it with long-on having a bit of work to get to it
Mujeeb to Christian, 1 run, another slider from a shortish length, Christian adjusts with a shuffle across the stumps and punches to long-on
Mujeeb to Chris Morris, 1 run, a half-tracker that skids onto Morris, mistimes the pull to deep mid-wicket
Mujeeb to Chris Morris, no run, drifting in fuller around off, Morris drives to cover but straight to the fielder. Christian wanted the single, wisely sent back
Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, 1 run, back of a length, Morris wanted to crash it off the back foot but mistimes it towards cover

Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, SIX, H-U-G-E! When this man connects well, the ball is going to fly deep into the stands. Slower ball on a good length, Morris preempted the charge down the track and had a clean golf-like swing. Way into the crowd at long-on. Much-needed one for DD

Mohit Sharma to Christian, 1 run, direct hit would have been close! Misses the target and Christian escapes. Short of a length ball that's punched to cover and he set off immediately. Had to hurry and got fortunate eventually
Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, 1 run, back of the hand slower ball, sticks on the pitch as Morris tries to hoick across the line. Drags it off the inner half towards square leg
Mohit Sharma to Christian, 1 run, very full and outside off, Christian drives it past a diving extra cover who had run across and dived to save the single. Fails and wide long-off tidies up
Mohit Sharma to Chris Morris, 1 run, back of a length around middle and leg, wristed away towards wide long-on

Ashwin to Christian, no run, the slider, skidded off the deck and caught Christian by surprise. He was pinned to the crease and is lucky to get his bat down in time. Top over from Ashwin, just 4 off it
Ashwin to Chris Morris, 1 run, very full and down leg, Morris gets across and works it through square leg
Ashwin to Christian, 1 run, a bit of turn on this leg break, Christian drives and gets it off the outer half towards backward point. Off the mark

Ashwin to Rahul Tewatia, out Lbw!! Another reverse sweep dismissal! Tewatia started his innings with a similar one but this time, like Munro earlier in the afternoon, misses it to be trapped LBW. Tewatia tries to repeat the stroke but ends up losing his balance and is all over the place as he gets pinged before the stumps. Looked dead plumb. Probably didn't pick the leg break at all. KXIP chipping away at the wickets here at the back end. DD need a strong finish. Rahul Tewatia lbw b Ashwin 9(7) [4s-1]
Ashwin to Chris Morris, 1 run, floated up around middle and leg, worked away towards long-on for a single
Ashwin to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, very full and attacking the stumps, drilled down the ground to long-on

Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, out Gambhir Run Out!! Brilliance from Mujeeb! Direct hits are always dangerous and it's proven this time. Slower ball on leg, Tye got away with this delivery as fine leg was up in the ring. Mujeeb was quick to attack the ball and threw down the stumps at the keeper's end in a flash. Initially seemed like Gambhir made it but he was just short. These direct hits I tell you. This Afghan lad is a champion, isn't he? What a debut! Gambhir run out (Mujeeb) 55(42) [4s-5 6s-1]
Andrew Tye to Gambhir, 1 run, very full and on middle and leg, Gambhir gets across a touch and muscles this to deep mid-wicket. Another single
Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, slower ball that foxes Tewatia completely, chips the drive aerially down the ground towards long-off

Andrew Tye to Gambhir, 1 run, the upper cut, over cover and lands on the bounce to sweeper cover. Gambhir is certainly trying to play shots every ball now and he has to. Doesn't time it that well as Tye opts to go short
Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, wider outside off from a good length, Tewatia powers it towards sweeper cover. The throw at the bowler's end is off target but good backing up prevents bonus runs

Andrew Tye to Gambhir, 1 run, doesn't carry! The man at short fine leg was interested for a while but in the end, the ball died on him. The premeditated scoop from Gambhir and he didn't connect well at all. Got lucky in the end

Mujeeb to Rahul Tewatia, 2 runs, floated up around off, Tewatia winds up for another big hit. Ends up dragging it off the inner half towards the mid-wicket region where are plenty of gaps. Good running fetches them a brace

Mujeeb to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, what a shot to start! Gee, Tewatia has come out with a mission. Doesn't bother to have a look at Mujeeb's variation and opts for the reverse sweep straight away. It was the same shot that got Munro but Tewatia connects well to send it soaring over backward point
Mujeeb to Gambhir, 1 run, speared fuller around middle and off, smeared down the ground towards long-on
Mujeeb to Gambhir, no run, flatter and cramps Gambhir for space, stabbed off the backfoot towards the bowler

Mujeeb to Pant, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! Mujeeb has his revenge! Must say this was an ugly stroke from Pant, lost his shape completely on the slog after using his feet. It was looped up nicely and was the one that spun across him, too much to do for the southpaw and all he managed to do was slice it high towards extra cover. What about the catch though? Tye had to backtrack with his back to the ball but judged it beautifully and timed the slide really well. Massive wicket for KXIP. Pant was looking deadly. Pant c Andrew Tye b Mujeeb 28(13) [4s-4 6s-1]

Mujeeb to Pant, FOUR, such strong bottom hand! Wow! This kid certainly packs a punch, doesn't he? Fired fuller by Mujeeb and Pant was on the charge, adjusts to drill it powerfully past the bowler. Long-on had no chance
Andrew Tye to Pant, 1 run, very full and outside off, Pant cannot get underneath it properly. Ends up jamming it down to long-off, 17 off the over

Andrew Tye to Pant, FOUR, Pant has switched onto top gear! We could be in for some real carnage if he bats for a while. Attempted slower bouncer but Pant gets inside the line in a flash and pulls it easily over short fine leg. Proactive batting and Tye is under serious pressure here
Andrew Tye to Gambhir, 1 run, slow full toss with plenty of width, Gambhir carves it with an open bat face to the right of sweeper cover
Andrew Tye to Pant, 1 run, another slower ball, dragged short and very wide outside off, Pant reaches it with a slap to sweeper cover

Andrew Tye to Pant, SIX, oh ho ho! Middles this like a dream! That sound off the blade, wow! Back of a length, sits up nicely for Pant who smokes it deep into the stands at mid-wicket. It was just a bit of a short arm jab, such power from the young man

Andrew Tye to Pant, FOUR, not entirely in control but gets the result. Another slower ball variation from Tye and Pant is early into the slog. Skies it high towards deep mid-wicket but it's in the gap. Finds the fence
Ashwin to Pant, 1 run, mistimed slog! Pant saw the flight and went hard on the heave, drags it off the inner half to deep mid-wicket
Ashwin to Gambhir, 1 run, very full and outside off, drilled down the ground to long-off, 36th IPL fifty for Gambhir! What a way to start the season! He's looked ominous right from the word go today

Ashwin to Pant, 1 run, mix up but Gambhir survives! Wanted the single desperately but was sent back very late. Fortunately for him, Rahul's throw at the bowler's end misses and they get the single eventually. Pant stepped out to hoick this but only got an inside edge onto the pads that rolled to short cover

Ashwin to Gambhir, 1 run, falls short! Big fortune for Gambhir, he didn't time this slog sweep well at all and skied it towards the leg-side. Long-on and deep mid-wicket ran across to converge on it, nearly colliding with each other. In the end, it wouldn't have carried to either of them. A single results
Ashwin to Pant, 1 run, flatter and sliding in around middle and leg, Pant sweeps it away hard to deep backward square leg
Ashwin to Gambhir, 1 run, the slider and it's a bit short outside off, pulled away off the back foot down to long-on
Mohit Sharma to Gambhir, 1 run, knuckle ball at 111kph, very full and Gambhir squeezes it down the ground to long-off
Mohit Sharma to Pant, 1 run, slower ball and speared wider outside off, Pant waits before slapping it through the covers

Mohit Sharma to Pant, FOUR, crunched away! Too full from Mohit and Pant lays into the drive, smashes it towards wide long-off where Karun put in a desperate slide. Got a hand on it but couldn't stop it cleanly. First boundary for Pant
Mohit Sharma to Pant, no run, good bouncer from Mohit, well-directed and it took Pant by surprise. He shaped for the pull initially, bailed out of the stroke in the end
Mohit Sharma to Gambhir, 1 run, skids in from a shortish length around leg stump, Gambhir adjusts to tuck it down to long-on

Mohit Sharma to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by Axar!! In the air.....gone! Went miles up in the air but unfortunately for Shankar, he hasn't got the distance on this one. It was banged in short by Mohit and Shankar went for the pull. Struck him high on the blade and flew towards deep mid-wicket where Axar settled under the skier. Easy catch. Shankar was trying to force the pace a bit but just couldn't execute the stroke well. Vijay Shankar c Axar b Mohit Sharma 13(13)
Stoinis to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, banged into the pitch, Vijay Shankar shifts back in the crease and hacks that to deep square leg
Stoinis to Vijay Shankar, 2 runs, Mayank at long-on, who runs across and cuts it off. An attempted cutter that's a full toss. Easy for Vijay Shankar to put that away
Stoinis to Gambhir, 1 run, slow and going away, Gambhir twirls it out to long-on
Stoinis to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, goes for a very full ball on middle, which Vijay Shankar's clipped away despite losing a bit of balance in doing so
Stoinis to Gambhir, 1 run, slow back of a length delivery and Gambhir had enough time to rock back and swat that to deep mid-wicket -- the very man who was sent back
Stoinis to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, full from over the wicket, nicely wristed by Vijay Shankar through mid-wicket
Axar to Gambhir, no run, drops it shot on seeing another Gambhir charge. Befuddles the batsman, who's lost track of the ball. Uses his body and everything to stonewall his stumps
Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, top-edge through fine leg. A delivery going down leg from over the wicket, the left-hander is in no shape to sweep that. Goes for it and gets lucky
Axar to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, squeezes it out through mid-wicket. More like dragged off the inside half
Axar to Gambhir, 1 run, comes down the track and has to check this shot to mid-wicket. Perhaps overcharged at the ball, meaning he didn't have much room in front to manoeuvre
Axar to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, another one but this is played straighter, so even easier for Miller at long-off
Axar to Vijay Shankar, 2 runs, nicely leans across on his front foot and chips the drive inside-out over extra cover. Good from Miller to run across from long-off and cut it off
Ashwin to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, another one rolled out of the wrists but this is flatter and quicker, which has Vijay Shankar playing it from the crease. Single to long-on

Ashwin to Vijay Shankar, no run, wow. Vijay Shankar's being beaten by a Ashwin leg break. Pitches it on off and makes Vijay Shankar come forward to play it, and then spins it square. Beaten. What other word do we have for it eh? Chahal, are you watching?
Ashwin to Vijay Shankar, wide, another leg break but he's slipped this down low. So much drift into the batsman, I swear..
Ashwin to Gambhir, 1 run, this is the one that skids on low from round the wicket, Gambhir shaves it out to deep mid-wicket
Ashwin to Vijay Shankar, 1 run,  a leg break now. We'll see more of it. And delivered nicely with a high arm action from over the wicket. Full on off, worked through mid-wicket
Ashwin to Vijay Shankar, 2 runs, skidding on leg-stump, Vijay Shankar has played around his glued front pad and come back for a stuttered second run
Ashwin to Gambhir, 1 run, another inside-out dipping piece of Gambhir genius. Merely chips it this time because there was a sweeper cover waiting. On the bounce to the fielder
Axar to Vijay Shankar, no run, pushed through the off-side. Gets forward and does it defensively

Axar to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Rahul!! Gone. Hit a six earlier in the over and now perishes in trying to drive along the ground. That's modern cricket in a nutshell. A bit of drift away from the batsman, which is why Shreyas Iyer stretched his front foot right across, but a bit of spin did him in. Something that you didn't expect out of Axar but he's produced it. Shreyas Iyer c Rahul b Axar 11(11) [6s-1]

Axar to Gambhir, 1 run, beaten by the drift here and so a leading edge into the off-side. Charged out and wasn't to the pitch of the ball. Gets away, with this leading edge rallying nicely and safely to long-off
Axar to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, flatter, quicker arm-ball clipped to mid-wicket
Axar to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's a shot with wings. Lands deep into the crowd. Time for Shreyas Iyer to use his feet. Ingests the flight and burps out an 85-meter six over Axar's head
Axar to Gambhir, 1 run, uses his feet at the sight of a left-arm spinner. Axar darts it short on leg-stump and is worked through mid-wicket
Andrew Tye to Shreyas Iyer, no run, slower delivery on a back of a length, Shreyas Iyer stands back and packs a punch into the off-side. End of powerplay: 45/1
Andrew Tye to Shreyas Iyer, wide, goes for the carrom ball but the line's down leg. Goes on the bounce to the keeper
Andrew Tye to Gambhir, 1 run, fuller on off-stump this time, Gambhir's pinched this round the corner in his typical style

Andrew Tye to Gambhir, FOUR, cracks away a pull shot. Who said he's not good with the short balls. Rises in sync with the height on this short delivery and pumps it through square leg. Another great shot today from the master
Andrew Tye to Gambhir, no run, loopy away-drifter from Gambhir delivered off the knuckles, Gambhir thumps it to mid-off
Andrew Tye to Gambhir, no run, full and there to be smacked cross-batted but Gambhir doesn't get hold of it. Drags it off the inside half towards mid-wicket
Andrew Tye to Gambhir, no run, away-angler from over the wicket.. and the noise that that push makes. Straight to extra cover but Gambhir's looking in top-notch form

Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, no run, a review for LBW. Looks high to the naked eye but gee that's hit Shreyas Iyer on the back pad, above the knee roll. Carrom ball I think, which skids on instead of turning away. Beats the batsman for pace and goes through Iyer, who's standing on his back foot to meet that. Ball-tracking is in and it's umpire's call on height, as suspected
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, wide, splays it down leg this time. The ball that Mujeeb tries to rip into the batsman. Overdoes it
Mujeeb to Gambhir, 1 run, charges out but doesn't get hold of the shot. Smacked to mid-on
Mujeeb to Gambhir, 2 runs, sweeps it round the corner to deep square leg
Mujeeb to Gambhir, FOUR, lovely shot again. Makes room as he charges out and clouts it inside-out over extra cover. He'll keep doing that all day

Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, what do we have? A run out check. Easily in. Carom ball from Mujeeb that's been stabbed to point, the fielder parries the throw to KL Rahul and he's made a pudding out of it. Tries to flick the ball onto the stumps but loses control of it and ends up dislodging the bails with the gloves. That's out, but in Peter Pan's neverland perhaps
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, no run, look at Shreyas Iyer coming nicely forward to quell Mujeeb's variation
Axar to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, leading edge. Dipping a little on off and middle, Shreyas Iyer tries to work it around and gets away. Scoots away to the long-off fielder
Axar to Gambhir, 1 run, flatter and quicker from over the wicket now. I mean we can see where Axar is coming from. Patted to cover-point for a quick single

Axar to Gambhir, SIX, wow. Just wow. This is sheer timing. Also shows you how good the pitch is. Makes some early room down leg and just chips it. Carries well over the long-off boundary. See it to believe it
Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, now a one-kneed stylish slog-whip over deep square leg. Axar fired it in and sees it flying round the corner
Axar to Gambhir, FOUR, quintessentially Gambhir. Axar was from round the wicket to the left-hander, Gambhir charges down whilst making some room and lofts it through extra cover. Superb hit
Axar to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, skids on, pumped off the front foot to long-off
Mujeeb to Gambhir, no run, Gambhir is cluless. Rahman's turning it both ways. So with him running in from round the wicket, he crouches and flat-bats a swipe to mid-on. Nothing for so much
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, wow. He's taken this away. Not sure if its's just the drift or he's done something to the ball. Jabbed off the outside half to cover-point
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, no run, Mujeeb joins in the appeal late, KL Rahul led it. This one spins in, stays a touch low and pins the pad. Going down

Mujeeb to Munro, out Lbw!! There's that early wicket that Mujeeb is so used to. Takes three balls to take his first wicket in IPL. Munro preempts the reverse-sweep but loses his balance altogether in doing so. Mujeeb ripped the ball a little extra with his index finger, meaning the ball was drifting in and gaining pace off the deck. Skids on and pins Munro on the thigh. Munro lbw b Mujeeb 4(6)
Mujeeb to Gambhir, 1 run, pushes it fuller, driven to long-off
Mujeeb to Gambhir, no run, a slip in place for him, round the wicket. Skids on from a length, blocked back

Mohit Sharma to Gambhir, 1 run, wristy. Takes this from just outside off and whips it to mid-wicket. Perhaps staying a touch low, which is why Gambhir had to squeeze it out off the inside half but full marks for the intent. Keeps strike
Mohit Sharma to Munro, 1 run, a bit confused about his footwork, so he's pushing this fullish delivery awkwardly to mid-off
Mohit Sharma to Gambhir, 1 run, a bit of room to slice this to deep backward point

Mohit Sharma to Munro, 1 run, a piece of Yuvraj Singh genius from mid-off. A botched push by Munro -- the bat turned there -- and he looked to pinch a quick single. Takes off, but there's Yuvi charging at the ball, and leaning forward into a left-handed throw. Doesn't hit, else.. Munro comes in the crease dragging his bat

Mohit Sharma to Gambhir, byes, 1 run, that's deflected off KL Rahul's gloves. Will be a test for him, this season. Extra bounce off this green-tinged pitch, takes off from a back of a length and climbs past Gambhir's outside edge
Mohit Sharma to Gambhir, no run, just a little bit of readymade width with this over the wicket angle but not enough. Gambhir slaps it to point
Ashwin to Gambhir, 1 run, and again. Flatter, coming in with the arm and clipped to deep mid-wicket
Ashwin to Munro, 1 run, skidding into the pad, single worked to mid-wicket

Ashwin to Munro, no run, okay, here's some turn. There's a stumping appeal. A bit of flight and this spins away ever so slightly. Beats the outside edge and the keeper's taken the bails off. Back foot seems to be on the line but is there something behind? Yeah, something behind the line. Not out. Munro just about survives but not before witnessing the command Ashwin has over spinning and not spinning the ball
Ashwin to Gambhir, 1 run, a bit of flight this time, and look at Gambhir coming forward and stabbing it through Ashwin's right. The dive isn't enough. Never is
Ashwin to Gambhir, 2 runs, another one that slides on  -- no turn; I mean who even expected -- and Gambhir's nicely worked it around through mid-wicket for a couple
Ashwin to Munro, 1 run, slides this in from wide of the crease, quick single to mid-on. Munro and Delhi off the mark. Time to have a look at the other left-hander

Kulwant Khejroliya to Vinay Kumar, FOUR, clears his front leg and lays the finishing marker on the game. AB at mid-on slides to his left, but realizes that's too far to fetch. So, Dinesh Karthik and KKR start off their campaign in style, a morale-boosting 4-wicket win over RCB. A typical slog from Vinay Kumar, all he needed to do was clear mid-off and boy did he hit that hard! Comfortably past mid-on
Kulwant Khejroliya to Karthik, 1 run, short of length sliding down leg, helped away towards fine leg. Doing it in singles now are KKR
Kulwant Khejroliya to Vinay Kumar, 1 run, off-cutter on the pads, clipped away wide of square leg
Kulwant Khejroliya to Vinay Kumar, wide, gets carried away with the short ball ploy and bowls it too high over the batsman, called
Kulwant Khejroliya to Karthik, 1 run, short and into the ribcage, pulled away down to long leg

Kulwant Khejroliya to Vinay Kumar, 1 run, dropped! Washington Sundar at deep cover. VK slapped this length ball over cover, Sundar came running in and seemed to have judged well to snaffle the ball under his throat, but just as he rolled over to avoid the tumble, the ball slipped out of his grasp. Unlucky!
Woakes to Karthik, no run, back of a length wide of off-stump, a swing and a miss from DK
Woakes to Karthik, FOUR, errs in line this time, short and angling into the body, DK rolls his wrists and nails the pull through mid-wicket

Woakes to A Russell, out Caught by de Villiers!! Terrific catch from AB running back. Avoided a massive collison with B-Mac there. It was bowled full and wide, asking Russell to fetch from that far, he goes after it and clubs it high into the night sky. AB from extra cover runs back, keeps his eyes on the ball and completes a splendid catch running back. B-Mac was charging from long-on, but he did well to stay low and dive to avoid bombarding into AB. A Russell c de Villiers b Woakes 15(11) [4s-2 6s-1]

Woakes to A Russell, no run, exposed his cards way too early there? Russell was aiming to go over mid-wicket, Woakes on noticing his moves bowls it short and wide, dragged off the toe-end back towards the bowler
Woakes to A Russell, wide, bowls the bumper, but gets too much height on that, called wide for the same reason. Russell watches it sail over him
Woakes to A Russell, no run, short and far from Russell's off-stump, he was standing way outside leg and couldn't reach out for the flashy cut
Woakes to Karthik, 1 run, slower and grips off the pitch, DK tucks round the corner and gets across for a quick single
U Yadav to A Russell, SIX, conceded 12 runs in his first 3 overs and now 15. T20 things! A candyfloss on middle and leg-stump, Russell muscles it many-a-mile over wide long-on for a maximum

U Yadav to A Russell, FOUR, goes full and goes for a journey! There's no-one at deep extra cover, so what does Russell do? Manufactures ample room and lifts Umesh Yadav over extra cover, the timing on the shot takes care of the rest
U Yadav to A Russell, no run, menacing stuff this from Umesh Yadav, ups his speedgun and unleashes a lethal bouncer, Russell getting into a tangle to evade that. All unorthodoxy...

U Yadav to A Russell, no run, pacy short ball, Russell shuffled too far across and just about managed to stay out of the firing line. Would have crashed him bang on the helmet grille had he lost sight (even for a moment)
U Yadav to A Russell, wide, short and speared down leg, wided
U Yadav to A Russell, no run, short and just outside off, Russell seeks to cut it over third man, fails to lay bat on ball
U Yadav to A Russell, FOUR, length ball in the slot, goodbye! Russell clears his front leg and swats him over mid-wicket, one bounce and over the ropes
Woakes to A Russell, 1 run, half-volley outside off stump, blazed away by Russell but there's a fielder protecting the extra cover fence, so he has to be content with a single
Woakes to A Russell, no run, cutter, just outside off, Russell pushes meekly in front of covers

Woakes to Rinku Singh, out Caught by de Kock!! RCB review: Rinku Singh pulled and seemed to have missed it IMO, but the opinion that matters is that of the TV umpire. So, let's wait and go through the process. Legal delivery. QDK wasn't excited after grabbing the ball. Virat Kohli and a couple of ring fielders got excited and the RCB skipper wasted no time in posing a T-sign to the onfield umpire, and he is absolutely right in doing so. A spike on the UltraEdge and Rinku Singh is gone. A very faint one that and hard to spot amidst the fuzzy environment. The decision has been reversed. OUT. This is a classic case of both batsman and bowler refusing to alter their plans. Woakes dished out a short ball and made life difficult for Rinku Singh by cutting it across him, the angle was always going against him. He ran down the pitch and fed a faint nick on the pull. Rinku Singh c de Kock b Woakes 6(6) [4s-1]
Woakes to Rinku Singh, no run, Woakes is second guessing Rinku Singh here. Knows he's gonna come down the pitch and delivers a pacy short ball to defeat him on the pull
Woakes to Rinku Singh, wide, shorter again, but to far outside off stump, signalled a wide
Woakes to Rinku Singh, no run, slips in a short ball with lack of pace, Rinku Singh aborts his instincts at the last moment, plays the half-pull and gets beaten

Woakes to Rinku Singh, FOUR, pressure? What's the spelling of that word?  This guy seems to have exactly that sort of attitude. Gallops down the pitch, doesn't matter who's bowling, stamps his authority with a rollicking thump over mid-on. Came off the cue end, but he's got it under control with strong bottom hand power
Washington Sundar to Rinku Singh, 1 run, full on the pads, glanced to fine leg
Washington Sundar to Karthik, 1 run, slower and wider of off, DK opens the bat face to dab it down to third man
Washington Sundar to Rinku Singh, 1 run, straighter delivery on middle, Rinku Singh gets an inside edge on the push which rolls down behind square on the leg-side

Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, out Lbw!! Nitish Rana has been given out lbw. He reviews after a brief contemplation with his skipper. Legal delivery. Nothing on the UltraEdge which means no bat involved. Waiting for ball-tracking... Nitish Rana though isn't waiting for anyone. He keeps walking back to the pavilion and rightly so. Umpire's call on hitting clubbed with a couple of reds. KKR won't lose the review, but they lose Nitish Rana. Cleverly bowled by Sundar there. Went wide of the crease and bowled the slider on a goodish length, beat Rana on the sweep and pinged him in line with middle stump. Looked rather close to the naked eye, but technology always finds ways to surprise us. Just brushing the top of leg peg according to HawkEye. Nitish Rana lbw b Washington Sundar 34(25) [4s-2 6s-2]
Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, SIX, Nitish Rana, gee he is some talent! Shimmies down, gets to the pitch of the ball and sends the cherry soaring straight over the sightscreen. Thwackkk
Washington Sundar to Karthik, 1 run, gets down on one knee, controls the sweep to backward square. A diving stop by the fielder there
Chahal to Karthik, 1 run, sticks to the fuller length, enables a forward chip and drive down the pitch towards long-off. DK is pacing his innings nicely
Chahal to Karthik, no run, tosses it up on off and middle, DK stays leg-side and sends the drive rolling towards cover
Chahal to Karthik, 2 runs, spins back in, might have been the slider? Karthik tucks through mid-wicket, gets two with ease
Chahal to Karthik, FOUR, overcorrects and floats one up under DK's eyes, he thumps the drive through extra cover, wowza! What bat speed..
Chahal to Karthik, FOUR, 'please hit-me,' will you? Short and wide delivery, DK rocks back and murders the cut in the gap between backward point and cover-point. See ya later...
Chahal to Nitish Rana, 1 run, 102ks, yes it is Yuzvendra Chahal bowling! Nitish Rana reaches out for the width and miscues the flat-bat drive to long-off
Kulwant Khejroliya to Karthik, no run, unveils the bouncer, angles it away from the right-hander smartly, DK attempts to swivel-pull, but gets nothing

Kulwant Khejroliya to Karthik, 2 runs, 141ks, nips back in from short of length, DK was cramped for room, but he does well to tuck it away off the splice behind square. Umesh Yadav steams in from long leg and fires a throw at the striker's end, had that hit DK was a goner
Kulwant Khejroliya to Karthik, wide, CTRL C + CTRL V of the previous delivery. Ah, that makes my life easy
Kulwant Khejroliya to Karthik, wide, lifter, gets the line wrong though, slips it down leg. Needs a reload

Kulwant Khejroliya to Nitish Rana, leg byes, 1 run, hits the deck and extracts decent bounce, catches Nitish Rana on the hip and strikes him high on the pads. Mild appeal for leg before, but the umpire ain't interested

Kulwant Khejroliya to Nitish Rana, no run, bowls a loopy slower ball which dips right under the nose of Nitish Rana, he was late to spot and thus, restrains his natural instincts to dab it gently back down the pitch
Kulwant Khejroliya to Karthik, 1 run, short and grips off the pitch before slanting in, DK swivels in his pull and slots a single through mid-wicket
Kulwant Khejroliya to Nitish Rana, 1 run, full and homing in towards middle and leg, clipped away through square leg
Chahal to Karthik, no run, faster and flatter outside off, DK throws his hand on the cut and misses

Chahal to Karthik, no run, fizzes in a googly at a quick pace to catch Karthik on the shuffle, DK was jumping back to nail the cut, dragged it off the inside edge onto his pad. Read that very late, but did well to get some wood on that
Chahal to Karthik, no run, 'How is that not a wide?' **Reading DK's expression** Gets a floater outside off and he lets it go, seemed to be a touch outside the tramline, but umpire reckons it's fine
Chahal to Nitish Rana, 1 run, flatter and wider of Nitish Rana's off-stump, he cracks it through cover for a single

Chahal to Nitish Rana, 2 runs, so, it's either short or googly? Chahal bowls the former and gets pulled away through the leg-side for a duo of runs. Nice work by Woakes at the circumference, saving two precious runs
Chahal to Nitish Rana, wide, throws a googly to the left-hander, it lands well outside off and spins away further, wided
Chahal to Karthik, 1 run, short and doesn't spin much, fizzes just outside off, DK leans on the back foot and pulls wide of long-on

Washington Sundar to Karthik, 1 run, slows his pace and bowls the conventional offbreak, DK might have played him some million times (both of them play for Tamil Nadu in domestic cricket), nicely works a single into the leg-side
Washington Sundar to Karthik, FOUR, you don't bowl full tosses to DK. Not when he's in such form. DK leans forward a touch and belts the leather through covers, blazed away...
Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, 1 run, lets the ball drift in and taps gently to nab a single wide of backward point
Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, no run, preempts the sweep and misses, was too early on the shot and got struck low on the pad. Impact outside off
Washington Sundar to Nitish Rana, 2 runs, lovely batting from Nitish Rana! Allows this floater to dip and lifts it inside out over extra cover, easy two
Washington Sundar to Karthik, 1 run, spins in from a shorter length, gives DK enough time to read it off the pitch and nudge round the corner
U Yadav to Nitish Rana, no run, another shortish delivery angled away from the batsman, Rana pokes at it only to get beaten. Fine comeback after conceding a boundary on the first ball
U Yadav to Nitish Rana, no run, Umesh is putting in a lot of effort here, never seen him bowl so many short ones. This one was aimed at the helmet as Rana ducked under that
U Yadav to Nitish Rana, no run, short ball angled away from the batsman, Rana drops his hands and sways away
U Yadav to Karthik, 1 run, back of a length outside off, DK runs it down to third man for a single
U Yadav to Nitish Rana, 1 run, short of a length around off, steered down to third man

U Yadav to Nitish Rana, FOUR, that was timed to perfection. Short of a length around off, Rana stands tall and chips this over mid-on. High elbows and poses for the camera. Not to forget the effort by AB though, sprinted back, kept his eyes on the ball and almost pulled it off

Kulwant Khejroliya to Karthik, 2 runs, short delivery aimed at the hips. Karthik nudges it towards long leg and manages to come back for the second. Good running between the wickets there, sprinted across for the first run and came back for the second comfortably
Kulwant Khejroliya to Karthik, wide, effort ball, short but too high over the batsman. de Kock leaps high up in the air to gather it. Too much pace, too much bounce
Kulwant Khejroliya to Karthik, no run, shortish again and angled away from the batsman, Karthik sways away from that
Kulwant Khejroliya to Nitish Rana, 1 run, a very high full toss on off, Rana dabs it in front of point and runs

Kulwant Khejroliya to Karthik, leg byes, 1 run, short and quick around off, hurries the batsman and Karthik gets hit on the thigh pad as he goes for a pull. The ball rolled down to third man as the batsmen changed strike
Kulwant Khejroliya to Nitish Rana, 1 run, shortish in length again, Rana pulls that off his toe end, on a few bounces to long-on
Kulwant Khejroliya to Karthik, 1 run, drags his pull to a wide and short delivery to mid-on. Sarfaraz does well to save it by throwing himself to his right, can't stop the single though
U Yadav to Karthik, 1 run, gets on his toe and tucks the length delivery to deep mid-wicket to get off the mark with a single
U Yadav to Karthik, no run, another short and quick delivery outside off, left alone by DK
U Yadav to Nitish Rana, 1 run, short of a length around off, Rana half-pulls it to deep square leg

U Yadav to Uthappa, out Caught by Brendon McCullum!! Umesh is making a huge impact on this game. Has got two big wickets so far and is looking good to get a few more, believe me. Bowls a short and quick delivery around off, Uthappa who was committed into the shot goes ahead with it. Slaps it horizontally and gets a top-edge. McCullum at point has all the time in the world to settle under the skier and take it. Uthappa c Brendon McCullum b U Yadav 13(12) [6s-1]
U Yadav to Nitish Rana, 1 run, steers the length ball down to third man and gets to the other end
U Yadav to Uthappa, 1 run, short of a length on middle, Uthappa has dragged this one past the fielder at short mid-wicket, a single taken
Kulwant Khejroliya to Uthappa, 1 run, Robbie retains strike with a gentle single down to long-on. 13 runs off that over, another expensive one
Kulwant Khejroliya to Nitish Rana, 1 run, poor fielding there. Too casual. Rana punches the shortish delivery towards cover where a misfield helps him fetch a single
Kulwant Khejroliya to Nitish Rana, FOUR, full and wide outside off, Rana plays this one with only one hand, it came off as he threw his hand at it, ends up slicing it past third man to find the fence

Kulwant Khejroliya to Nitish Rana, SIX, crack made the sound, there! Shortish in length, Rana has had enough of those. Rocks back and pulls this nicely into the night sky, high and handsome, over mid-wicket for a biggie
Kulwant Khejroliya to Uthappa, 1 run, shortish in length around off, Uthappa has all the time in order to swivel his pull to deep square leg

Kulwant Khejroliya to Uthappa, no run, a good start by the Delhite. Bowls a back of a length delivery around off and that's too quick for Uthappa. He tries to tuck it away to the leg side but gets hit on the pads. Appeal for an lbw, turned down. Probably pitched outside leg
U Yadav to Uthappa, 1 run, angles the short of a length delivery past backward point and retains strike
U Yadav to Uthappa, no run, excellent bowling by Umesh. Shortish in length and zipping away from the batsman there, Uthappa pokes at it, only to get beaten

U Yadav to Nitish Rana, leg byes, 1 run, that's nasty! He's steaming in here, is Umesh. Bowls another snorter, quick and short in pace around middle, Rana is a tad slow as he attempts a pull. The ball strikes his helmet and rolls down to third man where the fielder does well to save a boundary
U Yadav to Nitish Rana, wide, another short delivery attempted by Umesh but this is wayward and way over the batsman's head, good take by the keeper there
U Yadav to Nitish Rana, no run, welcomes Rana with a terrific short delivery, Rana does well to sway away from the firing line

U Yadav to Narine, out Bowled!! Umesh Yadav strikes. It's the ex-Knight Rider who gets his former team mate. Bowls a low full toss outside off and that's enough for Umesh to get him a wicket. Narine goes ahead with his drive and ends up getting an inside edge on to the sticks. Entertaining knock, neverthess. Some breather for the Challengers! Narine b U Yadav 50(19) [4s-4 6s-5]
U Yadav to Narine, no run, full length delivery fired outside off, Narine moves away to drive, gets beaten though

Washington Sundar to Narine, 1 run, 50 off 17 balls! Can you believe it? He has done it again. He's making a habit of it. Charges down the wicket and whips the floated delivery to deep mid-wicket. Reaches the milestone and raises the bat, acknowledges the crowd!

Washington Sundar to Narine, SIX, that's caught, but the fielder has touched the fence in the momentum. Narine whipped this gift to mid-wicket where Mandeep caught it but at the same time was in contact with the cushions. Needs only one more to complete a fifty

Washington Sundar to Narine, SIX, toying with the bowler, toying with his lines, toying with his lengths. This is a full toss and Narine simply dances down the wicket and wallops it over long-off. Six more! Can't hear anything, the crowd is loving it and so is Narine
Washington Sundar to Narine, wide, pressure for you, Sundar slips this one down the leg side, Narine doesn't bother

Washington Sundar to Narine, FOUR, he's taking down RCB single handedly, is he? Remember he scored the fastest IPL fifty against the same opposition last year (a record that was broken by a manic Rahul earlier today). Comes down the wicket and slaughters this one past mid-off
Washington Sundar to Narine, no run, moves away and drives that powerfully, can't beat mid-off though
Washington Sundar to Uthappa, 1 run, flighted delivery around off, driven along the ground to wide mid-off

Woakes to Narine, SIX, 20 runs off the over! This is boom boom Sunil Narine. Gets hold of the slower delivery yet again, it's slower in pace too. Plenty of time for the entertainer to camp back and clobber it over mid-wicket. The crowd has gone berserk
Woakes to Narine, no run, short of a length on leg, too close to be cut but looking at the mood Narine is in, he goes for it. Too quick and too close that was, gets beaten

Woakes to Narine, FOUR, beats the chasing RCB skipper this time around. It's a lightning quick outfield, just look at it. Even the fast moving feet of Kohli can't stop this. Fullish in length around off and Narine creams it through covers. The ball's lost, somewhere under the covers.
Woakes to Narine, FOUR, no stopping him, it seems. Short of a length and outside off, Narine slaps hard and evades the fielder at cover-point. He's in the zone folks!

Woakes to Narine, SIX, raining sixes already, we are already in the fourth over. This is the third six of the innings. It's a slower delivery by Woakes, Narine waits for it calmly and bludgeons it right over long-on. Off to a flier is Sunil
Woakes to Narine, no run, short and wide outside off, Narine goes for a wild slap at it, but the extra bounce beats his outside edge

Washington Sundar to Uthappa, SIX, excellent shot to end the over. He can do this, doesn't matter if Lynn is back to the pavilion. Gets sight of the loopy delivery, sets under it and smokes it right over the bowler's head. In fact a tad to his left, but it's a clean strike. Long-on is a mere spectator
Washington Sundar to Narine, 1 run, tentatively drives the low full toss to wide mid-off and gets off the strike in a jiffy
Washington Sundar to Uthappa, 1 run, quicker delivery around off, Uthappa whips it nicely, only to get a single at long-on though
Washington Sundar to Narine, 1 run, straighter delivery on midddle, Narine plays that with hard hands, throws his bat and gets an inside edge towards short mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Uthappa, 1 run, slows it down a tad and bowls a floater on middle and leg, Uthappa has whipped that down to long-on
Washington Sundar to Uthappa, no run, low full toss drifting into the batsman, Uthappa drives it along the ground to wide mid-off
Woakes to Narine, no run, low full toss with a tad of inswing on that, driven down to mid-on by Narine. With Lynn back in the hut, will Narine change his tactic? Looks unlikely

Woakes to Chris Lynn, out Caught by de Villiers!! This was always coming. Lynn never looked in tonight. Struggled a tad initially and throws his wicket away eventually. It's a slower delivery, shortish in length too. The big man goes after it with a single handed shot and gets no sort of connection. Miscues it over mid-off where de Villiers sprints to his left and gulps it down. Chris Lynn c de Villiers b Woakes 5(8) [4s-1]

Woakes to Chris Lynn, FOUR, first boundary for Lynn. Lucky to be still out there though. This was a full length delivery around off, Lynn swings hard at it and gets an inside edge, past the stumps and beats the fielder at short fine leg
Woakes to Chris Lynn, no run, gets deceived by the slower one this time around. Short and slow outside off, Lynn throws his bat at it only to get beaten. Three dots in a row now
Woakes to Chris Lynn, no run, short of a length and moving away a tad, outside off and it's a wild swing and a miss. Struggling a bit to get the timing right tonight

Woakes to Chris Lynn, no run, was that a chance? Difficult one, if at all. Full length delivery around off, Lynn drives it straight past the bowler who gets down in his followthrough as the ball evades him

Chahal to Chris Lynn, 1 run, darts it down the leg side but lucky to not concede a boundary. Lynn flicks it towards short fine leg and scampers across to the other end. Just getting a hang of things it seems, is Chris Lynn
Chahal to Chris Lynn, no run, drags the length back and Lynn is on hi back foot as he knocks it back to the bowler
Chahal to Chris Lynn, no run, 'no' is the call by Lynn as he eases the tossed up delivery down to mid-off
Chahal to Narine, 1 run, shortish outside off, Narine punches it through the gap at cover and takes a single

Chahal to Narine, SIX, a maximum! Even better than the first one. Loopy delivery around off, Narine goes down and slogs it over mid-wicket. Half a dozen more as it just clears the fence. Was a flat one!
Chahal to Narine, FOUR, here he is! Not wasting any time. He's at it. It's a tossed up delivery around off, Narine grounds his knee and pummels it dead straight over the bowler's head. Four runs!

Vinay Kumar to Woakes, out Caught by A Russell!! This has gone high, not long. Russell pedals back from extra-cover, and takes a really good catch falling backwards. Good finish to the over from Kumar. Another full and wide delivery which is skied off the toe-end by Woakes. Woakes c A Russell b Vinay Kumar 5(5) [4s-1]

Vinay Kumar to Mandeep, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! Better plans from Vinay Kumar with these last couple of deliveries. He's gone back to round the wicket and bowled this pretty wide outside off. Mandeep has to stretch out to reach it, and as he does, the timing is not the same. He slices this up into the accepting hands of sweeper cover. Mandeep c Kuldeep Yadav b Vinay Kumar 37(18) [4s-4 6s-2]
Vinay Kumar to Mandeep, no run, finds the mark this time, spears it into the blockhole wide of off. Mandeep can only dig it back down the pitch

Vinay Kumar to Mandeep, SIX, six more. 16 off the first 3 balls. Mandeep is taking serious toll of what is some very ordinary death bowling. Short of length delivery, neither here nor there. Mandeep camps back and bludgeons the pull away
Vinay Kumar to Mandeep, FOUR, now a full toss on the pads, whipped away over backward square leg. He's missed his lengths with the first two balls, and at his pace, he will disappear - as he has
