Vinay Kumar to Mandeep, SIX, full in the slot, Mandeep gets in position by clearing his front leg and then wallops it over wide long-on with a clean swing. Ordinary delivery from Vinay

Johnson to Mandeep, 1 run, short of length cutter on middle and leg, Mandeep arches back, gets inside the line of it and tries to heave it away over fine leg. Doesn't get hold of it though, and the ball bounces in front of the fielder
Johnson to Woakes, 1 run, steers this away to third man
Johnson to Woakes, no run, bounces over the stumps as Woakes is cut in half. He was aiming for the off-side again, but Johnson slanted this in sharply and denied him the room
Johnson to Woakes, FOUR, full ball outside off, Woakes flings his hands at it and carves it through backward point. It goes to the fence like a bullet
Johnson to Woakes, no run, back of a length delivery angled in, beats Woakes's angled bat as he tries to flat-footedly run it down to third man

Johnson to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Rinku Singh!! Sarfaraz looks to break free, but holes out at long-on. He was getting stuck out there, so wanted to release the pressure with a big shot. It was a full ball, probably a cutter, but Sarfaraz's bat twists in his hands as he swings down the ground. He miscues it off the inside half straight to long-on, who catches it at the edge of the ropes. Sarfaraz Khan c Rinku Singh b Johnson 6(10)

Narine to Sarfaraz Khan, leg byes, 1 run, looks very close on the leg-before, but not given. An attempted reverse-sweep from Sarfaraz, he's through with it too early though and gets pinned in front of middle. Wonder if height was the issue
Narine to Mandeep, 1 run, goes back to the carrom ball, Mandeep pushes it through cover

Narine to Mandeep, FOUR, the two off-breaks he's bowled in this over have both drifted down leg. Unlike the previous one though, Mandeep just helps this on its away and gets it fine enough to beat short fine leg
Narine to Sarfaraz Khan, 1 run, sits on the back knee and sweeps this carrom ball to deep mid-wicket
Narine to Mandeep, 1 run, fires this carrom ball on a back of length outside off, Mandeep pats it wide of cover. He was struggling on the single there, would have been gone with a direct-hit
Narine to Mandeep, FOUR, poor from Narine. Drops it very short, and then turns it into leg-stump. Mandeep is able to free his arms on the pull as he whacks it to the long leg boundary
Johnson to Mandeep, 1 run, short of length delivery on off, Mandeep flat-bats the pull down to long-on. On the bounce to Rinku
Johnson to Sarfaraz Khan, 1 run, softly dabbed into the off-side

Johnson to Sarfaraz Khan, 2 runs, cramped again by this short of length delivery, but somehow muscles the pull to the right of long-on. Superb work by Rinku Singh there, sliding across and flicking it back in
Johnson to Sarfaraz Khan, no run, gets cramped for room on the cut shot. It was angled in from round the wicket, cutting the space down for Sarfaraz. Beaten
Johnson to Sarfaraz Khan, no run, full ball angled in around off, sliced to point
Johnson to Mandeep, 1 run, back of a length delivery just outside off, dabbed to third man
A Russell to Mandeep, 1 run, low full toss at the stumps, flicked down to fine leg
A Russell to Sarfaraz Khan, 1 run, short of length delivery, hurries onto Sarfaraz's pull and catches him on the splice. Limply rolls down towards long-on
A Russell to Mandeep, 1 run, back of a length cutter outside off, dabbed down to third man
A Russell to Sarfaraz Khan, 1 run, yorker length ball tailing in at the stumps, jammed back down the pitch
A Russell to Mandeep, 1 run, full ball speared in around off, driven to long-on

A Russell to Mandeep, no run, times the cut beautifully but hits it straight to backward point. There was a fumble which prompted Mandeep to wander out for a single. However, the fielder recovers quickly and Mandeep - who was sent back - had given up
Nitish Rana to Sarfaraz Khan, no run, played back down the pitch
Nitish Rana to Mandeep, 1 run, clipped through mid-wicket
Nitish Rana to Mandeep, FOUR, shuffles across, bends on one knee and gets the sweep away fine. Races away once it beats the man

Nitish Rana to Kohli, out Bowled!! The part-timer gets AB de Villiers and Virat Kohli in consecutive balls. Floats a seam-up yorker which slips under Kohli's bat and rattles the stumps. Rana is pumped as he punches the air in delight. He'll be telling his grandchildren about this. Kohli b Nitish Rana 31(33) [4s-1 6s-1]

Nitish Rana to de Villiers, out Caught by Johnson!! What do you know, he's bowled another short ball and has got the dangerous AB. Massive break for the KKR. Probably it wasn't as short as AB thought. He went back to pull and ended up skying it off a thick top-edge. Johnson takes it nonchalantly at deep mid-wicket. de Villiers c Johnson b Nitish Rana 44(23) [4s-1 6s-5]
Nitish Rana to de Villiers, SIX, oh don't do that. Never do that. A half-tracker to de Villiers who chews it up and spits it over mid-wicket
A Russell to de Villiers, 1 run, now he's too early in his swipe, gets it off the toe-end down to long-on. Superb first over from Russell, just the five singles
A Russell to de Villiers, no run, good variety bowling this. Short ball outside off, cuts away from AB who misses his pull
A Russell to Kohli, 1 run, short of length delivery, probably a cutter, swatted away to deep mid-wicket
A Russell to de Villiers, 1 run, another excellent yorker, nothing that AB can do other than squeezing it through mid-wicket
A Russell to Kohli, 1 run, yorker length ball just outside off, squeezed to cover
A Russell to de Villiers, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off, AB slashes hard but only manages to chop it off a thick under-edge to cover
Chawla to de Villiers, 1 run, darted in flat at the stumps, nudged round the corner
Chawla to Kohli, 1 run, fired in full, Kohli drills it down to long-on

Chawla to Kohli, SIX, those wrists have carried this all the way for six. Magnificent timing. He wasn't to the pitch of it even after stepping out, but still went through with the flick over mid-wicket. Plenty of height on it, and enough distance too
Chawla to Kohli, no run, the length wasn't there for Kohli in his endeavour for an inside-out lofted drive. He's forced into a flat-batted smite, but skews it off a thick inside-edge to mid-wicket
Chawla to de Villiers, 1 run, slips in the googly on off, AB probably didn't pick it and gets a thick inside edge to short fine leg
Chawla to Kohli, 1 run, drifting in on leg, whipped to deep mid-wicket
Johnson to de Villiers, no run, premeditated the sweep, but Johnson saw him. He bangs it in short and beats AB on his improvised pull
Johnson to de Villiers, no run, short of length delivery in on off, blocked to cover
Johnson to de Villiers, no run, back of a length delivery at the stumps, defended into the covers
Johnson to de Villiers, SIX, launcheddddd! AB in this form... wow. Fullish off-cutter outside off, de Villiers sizes it up and biffs it over mid-off. Sails into the stands
Johnson to de Villiers, FOUR, dismissed to the boundary by AB. Short of length, bounces only as high as the chest and the pull shot is swatted away backward of square

Johnson to de Villiers, no run, appeal for caught behind and he's been given. AB reviews immediately. He checks with the umpire about what the decision was for. The umpire informs him he's given him caught behind. There was a noise as the ball passed the bat, but clearly the ball just touched the flap of the pad and was nowhere close to the bat or glove. It was a short of length delivery outside off stump, de Villiers tried to guide that to third man and missed. DRS saves de Villiers
Narine to Kohli, 2 runs, flicked away towards deep mid-wicket, they are running hard and Kohli is back for the second in a flash
Narine to Kohli, FOUR, he's so good with those cover-drives. Full delivery outside off stump, Kohli waits and lofts the drive over the infield and the timing was great
Narine to de Villiers, 1 run, that's nicely bowled, way outside off stump, forced de Villiers to reach out and dab to point

Narine to de Villiers, SIX, this is what he does so well. Those small movements in the crease before the bowler delivers and that puts many bowlers off. This time he backed away and Narine followed him, de Villiers swept that high in the air and all the way over deep backward square leg
Narine to de Villiers, no run, spinning back in, de Villiers misses the flick, gets hit on the pad
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, dabbed to short third man

Kuldeep Yadav to de Villiers, SIX, dances down the pitch and threatens the cameraman on one of those tiers. Flighted delivery on the stumps, de Villiers got to the pitch of the ball and launches that over long-on. AB de Villiers has nicely warmed up

Kuldeep Yadav to de Villiers, SIX, that's not a bad ball at all from Kuldeep Yadav. Not easy to time the away spinning ball. So Kuldeep Yadav bowls one full googly outside off stump, de Villiers goes for the loft over cover, slices it but the timing it good enough to clear the fence
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, shortish and just outside off stump, Kohli punches it to long-on off the back foot
Kuldeep Yadav to de Villiers, 1 run, turns it into the vacant mid-wicket region and looks for two, but the fielder at long-on quickly attacked the ball
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, plays that so late and dabs it to short third man
Kuldeep Yadav to de Villiers, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, de Villiers flicks it to deep mid-wicket
Narine to de Villiers, 1 run, that's a fumble by the man at cover. AB de Villiers cut that flatter delivery off the back foot, they think about two but Kohli yells out a loud no to his partner
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, short and wide outside off stump, Kohli mistimes the slap to long-off
Narine to Kohli, no run, hit on the pad, Kohli misses the flick to this delivery down the leg-side
Narine to de Villiers, 1 run, flatter delivery outside off stump, de Villiers pushes it to sweeper cover

Narine to Brendon McCullum, out Bowled!! It's turned and gone through the gate. Came slower than McCullum expected and he was through his pull shot early. Short and turning back in, McCullum targeted the mid-wicket boundary, but lost his sticks. Anyway, has done his job as an opener in his first outing for RCB. Brendon McCullum b Narine 43(27) [4s-6 6s-2]
Narine to Brendon McCullum, no run, flighted delivery on the stumps, McCullum defends
Johnson to Kohli, no run, soft appeal for caught behind, short and down the leg-side, Kohli misses, not given a wide. Maybe the appeal put the umpire off
Johnson to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, McCullum gets an under edge on the cut and it rolls to backward point

Johnson to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, the slower ball but it's been whacked by McCullum. This is a true surface in terms of bounce, so you can hit through the line, McCullum hits that over wide mid-off and it runs away for four
Johnson to Brendon McCullum, no run, short of length delivery on the stumps, McCullum pushes it into the off-side

Johnson to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, oh he's bludgeoned this very hard. Full and outside off stump, McCullum slices the ball hard and gets it in the gap at cover-point, the fielder in the deep had no chance
Johnson to Brendon McCullum, no run, back of a length and on the stumps, McCullum backs away and defends to backward point
Narine to Kohli, no run, oh this one swings away from Kohli and he's a bit surprised, a yorker, dug out by the batsman
Narine to Kohli, no run, the knuckle ball from Narine, Kohli pushes it into the off-side
Narine to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, very full and outside off stump, McCullum drives it to long-off
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, Kohli loses shape in trying to play the pull shot, the ball clears the infield and lands safely near deep mid-wicket
Narine to Kohli, no run, oh inside edge onto boot as Kohli tries to defend this flatter delivery, the ball rolls into the off-side
Narine to Kohli, no run, shortish and outside off stump, Kohli cuts to backward point
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, SIX, advances and lofts the ball, the timing is good enough and the ball clears the long-on fence quite comfortably. It was the googly from Chawla but McCullum read it
Chawla to Kohli, 1 run, this time he dabs it wide of backward point
Chawla to Kohli, no run, beaten. Kohli tries to guide this flatter delivery outside off stump, but the ball came just a touch quicker than he expected and he missed
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, goes back and cuts it towards point
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, no run, forward blocked into the off-side
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, no run, almost the yorker, McCullum backs away and tries to force it into the off-side, manages to dig it out
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, no run, this is driven back to the bowler, three dots and that's a good finish to the over
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, no run, tossed up and outside off stump, Kohli drives softly to mid-off
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, no run, too full for Kohli to get under the ball and he only manages to drill it to mid-off
Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, flighted delivery on the leg stump, McCullum flicks it to deep mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, no run, stumping check, but Baz is safe! He missed the sweep against this flighted delivery, Karthik whipped the bails off but the back foot was just inside the line when the stumps were lit up. Third umpire confirms the same

Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that's completely mistimed, yet McCullum will get a boundary, this game is so cruel for the bowlers. Flighted googly outside off stump, McCullum wanted to loft that over long-on, but got it on the outside half of the bat, cleared mid-off and it ran away for four

Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, 5 wides, that's a toughie for the keeper. Full and spinning down the leg-side, McCullum misses the sweep and the ball sneaks under Karthik's legs. Bonus runs for RCB
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, fullish and on the leg stump, softly glanced to short fine leg
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, this time he cuts well and gets it in the gap between cover-point and backward point. The length was just short enough for McCullum to rock back and execute the shot
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, no run, again Baz was keen on running down the pitch, but had to meet that from the crease because of the flatter trajectory, played towards point
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, no run, Baz backs away and exposes the sticks but Chawla slips in the googly and forces McCullum to defend off the front foot
Chawla to Kohli, 1 run, very full again, Kohli drives to long-on
Chawla to Kohli, no run, googly very full, Kohli drives to cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, spinning back in, Kohli works it away to long-on

Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, 2 runs, oh that's powerfully whipped away with those rubber wrists, long-on does extremely well to run to his right and push the ball back with a dive for the man at deep mid-wicket to tidy up

Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, in the airrrrr but safe. McCullum gets a leading edge that just evades the dive of the fielder at cover. McCullum wanted to flick this flighted delivery into the on-side, didn't read the googly, lucky that it didn't go to hand
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, allows the ball to come and flicks to long-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, slow and short, turning down the leg-side, McCullum flicks it to deep square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, flighted delivery on the leg stump, Kohli flicks it to deep mid-wicket
Chawla to Kohli, 1 run, shortish and on the stumps, Kohli nudges to deep mid-wicket
Chawla to Kohli, 2 runs, googly turning back in, Kohli leans forward and flicks it to deep mid-wicket. Kohli's away straightaway and he obviously got a great reception to the crease

Chawla to de Kock, out Caught by Vinay Kumar!! That's a soft dismissal and Chawla blows a kiss to the batsman on his way to the dressing room. In trying to fetch another boundary, de Kock goes for the fancy looking reverse sweep and completely mistimes it. Get a top edge and it flies slowly to short third man. A great opportunity wasted by de Kock. de Kock c Vinay Kumar b Chawla 4(4) [4s-1]
Chawla to de Kock, no run, the paddle fine from de Kock, but can't send it past short fine leg
Chawla to de Kock, no run, ah beaten! QdK had no clue about this googly that was pushed through flat, wanted to play from the crease and ended up playing inside the line

Chawla to de Kock, FOUR, that's a friendly flighted delivery full and outside off stump, de Kock leans forward and doesn't over-hit the ball, drives nicely along the ground and hits the gap at cover. The ball escapes past the diving fielder

Vinay Kumar to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, turns out to be a really poor over from Vinay Kumar, didn't bowl to the field. He bowls another one down the leg-side and you can't do that with fine leg inside the line. McCullum calmly waits and flicks the ball through square leg. Great start for RCB, 14 off the over

Vinay Kumar to Brendon McCullum, no run, and there's Baz's intent for you. Races down the pitch and wants to muscle it hard over the on-side, but Vinay Kumar with his experience drops it short and beats the bat

Vinay Kumar to Brendon McCullum, SIX, top edgeeee, but fine leg is inside the ring. Wouldn't have mattered though because it cleared the rope. Shortish from Vinay Kumar, McCullum goes for the pull and gets a thick edge, the bat swing is hard enough for the ball to have enough legs
Vinay Kumar to Brendon McCullum, no run, nice and close to the off stump, McCullum defends off the front foot
Vinay Kumar to Brendon McCullum, no run, gets it right this time. Good length delivery on the stumps, McCullum defends off the front foot

Vinay Kumar to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that's not the start Karthik would have wanted from a senior pro. A classic case of nerves from the opening bowler because it is not all that easy to control the new ball immediately. Bowls a freebie length ball down the leg-side and McCullum gleefully flicks the ball behind square past the man at 45

D Kulkarni to Dhawan, FOUR, crunchy blow to end the game! Shortish and sits up nicely for Dhawan who rocks back to slam the pull over mid-wicket. Blazed away to the fence and with that, the Sunrisers have stormed to a win in their season opener

D Kulkarni to Dhawan, no run, another dot! Dhawan was moving around in the crease and then gets across the stumps, Kulkarni though just keeps his calm to bowl a pinpoint wide yorker. Just bordering on the tramline but that's fine
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, no run, back of a length around off, Dhawan flat-bats it hard but straight to mid-off. Ah, this is taking a bit longer
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, no run, good slower ball, shortish in length and Dhawan was well early into the shot before deciding to let it pass
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, no run, short of a length and very wide outside off, Dhawan tries to reach it with a flashy cut but misses
D Arcy Short to Williamson, no run, a bit short and around off, Williamson stays back and crunches it towards cover, cannot pick the gap and seems a bit frustrated with himself
D Arcy Short to Williamson, no run, floated up around leg, Williamson gets across a bit and paddles it to short fine leg
D Arcy Short to Dhawan, 1 run, another skiddy half-tracker around off, Dhawan cuts it hard towards point where the fielder cannot make a clean stop
D Arcy Short to Dhawan, no run, flatter and shorter around off, Dhawan chops the cut towards point
D Arcy Short to Williamson, 1 run, floated up outside leg, very full and Williamson flicks it away to deep mid-wicket
D Arcy Short to Dhawan, 1 run, tossed up nicely around off, Dhawan was looking for that booming shot to end the game. Ends up mistiming it down the ground to long-on

Unadkat to Dhawan, 1 run, good work at short fine leg, the fielder gets across to his right and makes a tumbling stop to save a certain boundary. This was angling in on off, Dhawan gets across with a nice shuffle and clips it with a neat deflection off his pads
Unadkat to Williamson, 1 run, a cutter that's slightly shorter in length, Williamson makes a bit of room and whacks it to sweeper cover

Unadkat to Williamson, 2 runs, shortish and a bit of width outside off, Williamson stands tall and slaps it away. Gets it well to the right of sweeper cover who does well to stop it with a run-and-slide

Unadkat to Williamson, no run, cracking shot but couldn't pick the gap. Williamson made room by backing away and smoked this length ball with a feisty drive on the up. Straight to the fielder at cover
Unadkat to Williamson, 2 runs, back of a length on leg, Williamson swivels to pull it comfortably over a leaping mid-wicket fielder. Long-on gets around to his right to mop up
Unadkat to Williamson, no run, short of a length around middle and off, cramps Williamson whos dabs it towards the gully region

D Arcy Short to Dhawan, byes, FOUR, that's beaten everyone! For a moment, I thought it was a genuine edge but it wasn't. D Arcy Short gets this to spin away from a fuller length and the drastic turn beats Dhawan's attempted drive. Buttler also fails to react in time and with no slip in place, free runs it is
D Arcy Short to Dhawan, no run, premeditated charge down the track but the length is cleverly shortened. Dhawan misses the flick and wears it high on the pad
D Arcy Short to Dhawan, no run, slightly short and outside off, Dhawan chops the cut towards the man at point
D Arcy Short to Dhawan, 2 runs, fired in around middle and off, Dhawan tucks it with soft hands towards the vacant spaces in the mid-wicket region. Big ground dimensions as well and it's an easy two
D Arcy Short to Dhawan, no run, full and outside off, squeezed back towards the off-side
D Arcy Short to Dhawan, FOUR, that's a freebie from D Arcy Short and Dhawan isn't going to miss out. Not in this carnage mode of his. Stays back and pulls it hard to the deep mid-wicket fence

Laughlin to Dhawan, FOUR, what a sound off the blade! Gee, he just nailed that one, did Dhawan. Back of a length and plenty of width outside off, Dhawan just leant into it and slap-punched on the up. Gets it past a diving mid-off fielder and it speeds away. Considering the form he has been of late and the way he has played today, he is bound to light this IPL up
Laughlin to Williamson, 1 run, low full toss outside off, Williamson leans into the drive and carves it towards deep point
Laughlin to Dhawan, 1 run, dug in short around middle and leg, Dhawan swivels to pull it away to deep square leg
Laughlin to Dhawan, no run, very full and on off stump, Dhawan stays a touch leg-side of the ball and drives to mid-off
Laughlin to Williamson, 1 run, shortish len gth close to off, Williamson gets back and dabs it towards the gully region
Laughlin to Williamson, no run, on a length on middle and leg, Williamson shuffles and flicks but it's well stopped by short mid-wicket
Shreyas Gopal to Williamson, 1 run, a half-tracker around off, pulled away towards deep mid-wicket

Shreyas Gopal to Williamson, FOUR, kaboooooom! That's been smashed to pulp and it's Williamson who has done it. Things that an IPL season does. Even the gracious batsmen look for power. Uses his feet and smacks it hard over the bowler's head. Gopal may have thought about a return catch but there was no time at all to react, chose to wisely save himself
Shreyas Gopal to Williamson, no run, full and outside off, leans forward and pushes it towards cover

Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, not sure what prompted Rahane to take the review. Always seemed like pitching outside leg and the replays confirm it. Loopy and full around leg, Dhawan missed the sweep and was rapped on the pad. Never looked close at all. Desperation perhaps. The batsmen crossed during the appeal
Shreyas Gopal to Williamson, 1 run, fractionally short, no real width but Williamson makes some space on the back foot. Punched down to long-off
Shreyas Gopal to Williamson, no run, use of the feet by Williamson on seeing some flight, worked away towards mid-on who judges the bad bounce well
Stokes to Williamson, 1 run, another shortish delivery, sticks onto the surface and hence, Williamson mistimes the pull through mid-wicket
Stokes to Dhawan, 1 run, banged in short and Dhawan swivels to pull it away to deep mid-wicket

Stokes to Dhawan, no run, just back in is Dhawan and has his skipper Williamson to thank for it, it was a good call to send the southpaw back. Was nudged towards short mid-wicket and Dhawan wanted the single badly. Was never a run there

Stokes to Dhawan, FOUR, oh boy, that's top quality stuff! Slower ball from Stokes but Dhawan is in such a mood that he is picking everything. Waits for it and there was width on offer, so just reached out to hammer it through the covers. Rocketed away
Stokes to Dhawan, no run, short of a length outside off, punched off the back foot towards mid-off

Stokes to Dhawan, FOUR, cracker of a shot! Dhawan is in top gear and brings up his 29th IPL fifty in some style. Short and wide, he stands tall and spanks it through backward point. Power, timing and placement all in unison
Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, 1 run, googly again. Dhawan smashes it away to deep mid-wicket
Shreyas Gopal to Williamson, 1 run, touch quicker, on the stumps. Williamson backs away and knocks it away to long-on
Shreyas Gopal to Williamson, no run, Williamson steps out, meets the pitch and defends it
Shreyas Gopal to Williamson, no run, fine stop by Gopal. Googly, Williamson made room and pushed it to the left of the bowler. Gopal dives across and intercepts it
Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, 1 run, 89kph, dropped a little short. Dhawan goes on one knee and drags the sweep through square leg
Shreyas Gopal to Williamson, 1 run, flighted on middle, Williamson neatly bunts it down to long-on
Stokes to Dhawan, no run, Stokes hurls it full outside off, Dhawan goes for the flashy drive. Ends up chopping it into the off-side
Stokes to Dhawan, no run, better. Shortens his length and lasers it outside off, accompanied by some vicious bounce. Dhawan flirts by throwing his bat and misses
Stokes to Dhawan, wide, Stokes loses it again. Rifles it well outside off, outside the tramlines. Wided
Stokes to Williamson, 1 run, decides to stay back and waits for the ball to arrive. Guides it with an open bat to third man

Stokes to Dhawan, 1 run, sensible stuff. Taps this length delivery towards cover and scampers across for a quick single. There's a direct-hit at the striker's end and it has been referred to the third umpire. Williamson has safely dragged his bat inside the crease. So, it's NOT OUT
Stokes to Dhawan, FOUR, consecutive fours for Dhawan. Stokes sprays it down leg, Dhawan just gets a tickle on it and sends it very fine. Races away to the fine leg fence
Stokes to Dhawan, FOUR, no respect whatsoever for Stokes. Is greeted with a boundary. Short with no real venom, Dhawan goes back and muscles the pull over mid-wicket
Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, 1 run, spinning on leg, turned through mid-wicket
Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, no run, googly turning outside off, Dhawan backs away and punches it to extra cover
Shreyas Gopal to Williamson, 1 run, milks a single to long-on
Shreyas Gopal to Williamson, no run, floated up, Williamson leans forward and blocks

Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, 1 run, top-edgeee but falls in no-man's land. The wrong'un from Gopal, Dhawan went back for the swat - doesn't read it and gets a top-edge that drops into the vacant square leg region. Dhawan needs to thank his stars..
Shreyas Gopal to Dhawan, FOUR, horror start for Gopal. Drags it short first up, ample time for Dhawan to rock back and pick his spot. Chooses cow corner and dismisses from his sight
Laughlin to Williamson, FOUR, 50-stand comes up between the duo. Short and width are like oxygen to Williamson. Gets on top of the bounce and caresses it through cover-point
Laughlin to Dhawan, 1 run, back of a length delivery on middle and leg, Dhawan tucks it to square leg and rushes to the other end
Laughlin to Dhawan, no run, lunges across and pokes it to extra cover
Laughlin to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan is riding his luck. Banged in short on leg-stump, Dhawan swivels to pull and ends up gloving it over the keeper. Fine leg is squarer and had no chance there
Laughlin to Williamson, 1 run, waits on the back foot in his crease for the ball to arrive, tilts his bat and guides it with soft hands towards backward point
Laughlin to Williamson, no run, Williamson misses out. Shortish outside off, Williamson hangs back and swats it hard, straight to mid-on

Laughlin to Dhawan, no ball, 1 run, inauspicious start for Laughlin, but hold on. Replays show that he has got some part of his heel behind the line. Very harsh call. Peppered it short just outside off, Dhawan drops it softly into the off-side and a free-hit coming up for Williamson
Gowtham to Williamson, no run, pushed through quicker, Williamson jumps back and defends it to the left of the bowler
Gowtham to Williamson, no run, Gowtham tosses it up, around off. Williamson plays it back to the bowler
Gowtham to Dhawan, 1 run, skips back and wrists it towards mid-on
Gowtham to Dhawan, FOUR, back to back fours for Dhawan. Gowtham goes quick and flat outside off, Dhawan reaches out and slaps it through cover
Gowtham to Dhawan, FOUR, quality from Dhawan. No misjudging of the length this time, picks the long hop early and hacks it over square leg. Kind of short-arm jabbed it
Gowtham to Dhawan, no run, starts with a skiddy flatter delivery, Dhawan misjudges the length and stays back. Misses it and is knocked on the pads. Heading down leg, hence no appeal for LBW
Unadkat to Williamson, 2 runs, brilliant running. Very smart from Williamson, sees plenty of gap on the leg-side. Works it into the gap at mid-wicket and they hare back for the second
Unadkat to Williamson, SIX, wow. Dispatched with authority. Supreme pull shot from the Kiwi skipper. Spots the short ball early, camps back and pulls it witheringly into the deep square leg stands

Unadkat to Williamson, no run, Unadkat slips in the cutter, Williamson reads it and fends it to the right of the bowler. Unadkat runs up, collects the ball, turns and rifles a throw upon seeing Dhawan seeking for a single. Misses the target but direct-hit could've been close

Unadkat to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson finds the gap this time. Off the mark with a boundary. Unadkat keeps it short, just a hint of width and Williamson takes toll. Waits back and punches it through cover-point
Unadkat to Williamson, no run, "Wait on" says Williamson. Gets on his toes and forces this short of length delivery to extra cover
Unadkat to Williamson, no run, swinging in, from a short of length. Williamson keeps his eyes on the ball as he jabs it defensively from the crease into the off-side
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, no run, decking back this back of a length delivery, cramps Dhawan for room. Defended down the pitch
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, wide, oopsy. Kulkarni loses his line and sprays it miles down leg. Good collection from Buttler

D Kulkarni to Dhawan, SIX, Dhawan has not been at his best so far today, but this is a shot of highest class. Kulkarni pounds it short for the nth time - well outside off. Dhawan hops across and upper-cuts. Gets enough bat to send it sailing over the third man fielder
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, no run, moving away just outside off, Dhawan stands tall and displays his trademark punch. Straight to extra cover
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, no run, Kulkarni plants this one full and asks Dhawan to go for it once again. Dhawan flashes but misses on this occasion
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, FOUR, Kulkarni goes short and offers width again, Dhawan will not miss out on these. Goes deep and bashes it with ferocity through covers
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, 2 runs, crashed through cover, they race back for the second. The fielder at cover dived to his left and took some pace off the ball
Unadkat to Dhawan, 1 run, short down leg, pulled away to fine leg

Unadkat to Dhawan, FOUR, edged and flies over first slip. Dhawan throws the kitchen sink - comes down the track, gets an outside edge and fortunately for him, it loops over a leaping first slip fielder
Unadkat to Dhawan, no run, beauty. Beaten for all money. Unadkat shortens it and keeps it in the channel, Dhawan plays inside the line and it misses the outside edge by a whisker

Unadkat to Saha, out Caught by Laughlin!! And Unadkat strikes. So, Saha's promotion doesn't work for SRH. Fuller and slanted well outside off, Saha in quest to clear the in-field on the off-side - slices it tamely off the outer half and skies it to mid-off. Safe as houses is Laughlin. One of SRH's supporters has his hands on his mouth. Just the start RR wanted. Saha c Laughlin b Unadkat 5(5) [4s-1]
Unadkat to Saha, wide, did that hit a fuel well or something? Unadkat bangs it short and it rockets off the deck to loop over Saha's head. A leaping one-handed grab from Buttler
Unadkat to Saha, no run, shortens his length just outside off, Saha gets on top of the bounce and defends it to cover
Unadkat to Saha, FOUR, adding salt into the wounds for the Royals. Unadkat begins with a tripe delivery down leg. Easy pickings for Saha, gets across and whacks it over square leg

D Kulkarni to Dhawan, no run, edged and dropped. "One of the safest fielders in the slips has dropped a catch" is the comment from Sanjay Manjrekar on air. Huge moment in the game. Guess who's the culprit? It's skipper Ajinkya Rahane. A simple regulation take - length delivery angled across outside off. Dhawan aiming to break the dots slashes hard and outside-edges it straight to first slip. Jinks gets both hands but shells it. Kulkarni is in disbelief
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, no run, 132.2kph, Kulkarni digs it in short and gets good wheels. The line is outside off and Dhawan leaves it
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, no run, sticks to fuller length and this one swings in a wee bit just outside off. Dhawan push-drives it to mid-off
D Kulkarni to Dhawan, no run, fuller and outside off, Dhawan with a bent knee and no feet movement attempts to drive. Goes hard and finds short extra cover
D Kulkarni to Saha, 1 run, runs. Saha is away with a flick off the pads to fine leg
D Kulkarni to Saha, no run, Kulkarni hits the deck hard and extracts some bounce, just outside off. Saha rides it and quells it with an open bat face into the off-side

S Kaul to Laughlin, no run, another swing and another miss from Laughlin, they don't even think about a possible bye. That's poor from the Royals and they finish with just 125 on the board. Banged in short and on the stumps, Laughlin backed away on the pull and missed
S Kaul to Laughlin, no run, banged in short and well outside off, Laughlin was looking to cut and missed. He isn't happy that it's not called as a wide for height
S Kaul to D Kulkarni, 1 run, yorker length delivery on the stumps, Kulkarni backs away and drives it to deep cover for a single
S Kaul to Laughlin, 1 run, back of a length and on the stumps, steered behind square on the off-side

S Kaul to Unadkat, out Unadkat Run Out!! 1 run completed. Saha has demolished all the three stumps and I reckon Unadkat is short of his ground. OUT by a long way. Terrific keeping from Saha, on a good length and well wide of off, Unadkat sliced the drive behind square on the off-side. He was always coming for the second run, but was too slow in doing so. Pathan was quick on the ball and although his throw was well wide, Saha does well to gather it, turns across and throws down all the three stumps. Unadkat run out (Y Pathan/Saha) 1(2)
S Kaul to Unadkat, no run, banged in short and at the stumps, Unadkat swivels across on the pull and misses

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Gopal, out Caught by Y Pathan!! The extra ball gets Bhuvneshwar a wicket. This was a slower knuckle ball, Gopal had to go for runs, looks to tonk it over long-on, doesn't get anywhere near the middle of the bat and it's a simple catch for Yusuf - right in front of the ropes at long-on. Shreyas Gopal c Y Pathan b Bhuvneshwar 18(18) [4s-2]
Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Gopal, wide, another bouncer from Bhuvneshwar, Gopal was way too late on the pull and missed, tad too high though and it's called as a wide
Bhuvneshwar to D Kulkarni, 1 run, short and at the stumps, Kulkarni backs away and runs it down towards third man

Bhuvneshwar to D Kulkarni, no run, another short ball from Bhuvneshwar, Kulkarni had nowhere to go as he fended at that, lobbed off the gloves and fell in front of the onrushing bowler, could have so easily carried to the bowler
Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Gopal, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, driven to deep cover for a single
Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Gopal, no run, the leg-cutter from Bhuvneshwar, pitched on off, drew Gopal forward before shaping away, opened up the batsman and beat him on the outside edge

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Gopal, 2 runs, back of a length and on the stumps, dabbed towards backward point for a quick single. Hooda has a shy at the striker's end and misses, Rashid can't stop it cleanly and allows a second run
Rashid Khan to Shreyas Gopal, leg byes, 1 run, another leg break from Rashid, Gopal was done in by the flight as he came down, adjusts and gets an inside edge twoards short third man
Rashid Khan to Shreyas Gopal, no run, slower and wider of off, Gopal makes room and slices the cut to short third man

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Gopal, no run, loud shout for caught behind, but Llong says NO. SRH can't review either, the leg-break from Rashid, Shreyas Gopal was pressing forward in defence, gets beaten on the outside edge and the ball clipped his back-pad, on its way to the keeper. Thiunk the appeal was for LBW, it was pretty adjacent to the off-stump, might have just been clipping it
Rashid Khan to D Kulkarni, 1 run, the wrong 'un from Rashid, spins into Kulkarni's pads and it's worked away behind square on the on-side

Rashid Khan to Buttler, out Bowled!! That's that for Buttler, he was very circumscept, but the finishing touches never came. The leg-break from Rashid, skids through after pitching, Buttler was cramped for room on the pull, went through with the shot, the ball grazed the inside edge and the off-stump is on the floor. The Royals have never got going tonight, the Sunrisers have been all over them. Buttler b Rashid Khan 6(9)
Rashid Khan to Buttler, no run, pushed through flatter and quicker outside off, Buttler backs away on the cut and missed
Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, 1 run, full and on Buttler's pads, worked away towards long-on for a single
Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Gopal, 1 run, on a length and on Gopal's pads, tucked away behind square on the on-side for a single
Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, worked away towards long-on for a single
Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Gopal, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, dabbed away behind square on the off-side for a single

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, crunched, lovely cricket from Gopal, on a good length and just outside off, Gopal wasn't fully forward as he drove, the timing is sweet and the ball beats the fielder in the deep at cover
Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Gopal, wide, the bouncer from Bhuvneshwar, but it's too short and sails over Gopal's head, called as a wide
Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Gopal, no run, on a good length and on the stumps, Gopal gets a slight leading edge as he pushes it towards cover
Rashid Khan to Shreyas Gopal, 1 run, Rashid drops this one short and well outside off, chopped to the right of backward point for a single

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Gopal, no run, turn for Rashid , it's quick turn as well. The leg-break outside off, Gopal was prodding forward in defence and is beaten, so is Saha and Dhawan dives across to save some byes
Rashid Khan to Buttler, 1 run, pushed through quicker, another wrong 'un from Rashid, nudged away wide of mid-wicket for a single
Rashid Khan to Shreyas Gopal, 1 run, the wrong 'un from Rashid, Shreyas Gopal didn't spot it, got his bat down just in time and the inside edge rolled behind square on the on-side
Rashid Khan to Shreyas Gopal, 2 runs, very full and wide of off, Gopal gets forward and drives it wide of deep cover for a brace

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Gopal, FOUR, lovely shot, Gopal is a top all-rounder for Karnataka and this shot just certifies it, read the leg-break, opens the face of the bat, used the pace on the ball and ran it past the lone slip
S Kaul to Shreyas Gopal, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, steered square on the off-side for a single

S Kaul to Shreyas Gopal, no run, another steepling bouncer from Kaul, quick and just outside off, Gopal was pressing forward, then makes a late call to get his gloves out of the way, flew to the keeper

S Kaul to Gowtham, out Caught by Saha!! The Royals are falling away in Uppal. Exceptional bowling from Kaul, banged in short and at Gowtham, he had nowhere to go as he fended rather awkwardly. The ball ballooned off his gloves, popped straight up and it's an easy catch for Saha. The umpire wants to check for the front-foot no-ball, but Kaul is just about fine on that count. A duck on his IPL debut for Gowtham. Gowtham c Saha b S Kaul 0(2)
S Kaul to Gowtham, no run, on a good length and just outside off, Gowtham shuffles across and finds point with the drive
S Kaul to Buttler, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, eased down towards long-on for a single
S Kaul to Buttler, no run, short and wide of off, Buttler threw his bat at that and missed
Shakib to Buttler, 1 run, tossed up just outside off, Buttler plays a punchy drive past cover for a single

Shakib to Samson, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! The wheels are falling off, both the set batsmen have been dismissed, this is a smart catch from Rashid at deep cover, runs in, slides forward and takes a good catch - right in front of his chest. Nice bit of bowling from Shakib, threw this one slower and wider of off, Samson jumped down the track, was looking to go over extra-cover, ended up chipping it high and towards deep cover. Rashid does the rest and RR have lost half their side. Samson c Rashid Khan b Shakib 49(42) [4s-5]
Shakib to Buttler, 1 run, pushed through on off, Buttler backs away and finds the gap wide of long-on
Shakib to Samson, 1 run, slower and just outside off, Samson lunges forward and works it towards long-on for a single

Shakib to Tripathi, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! That's a soft dismissal, the pressure of getting quick runs does Tripathi in. He came down the track to a floater outside off, perhaps would have served him better had he gone down the ground, instead, he was looking to drag it wide of long-on, hits it a lot straighter and down the throat of Manish, who ran in from long-on. Tripathi c Manish Pandey b Shakib 17(15) [4s-2]
Shakib to Tripathi, no run, Tripathi almost yorked himself as he came down the track, jams his bat down in a hurry and squeezes it out
S Kaul to Samson, no run, tad fuller and just outside off, Samson finds cover with the punchy drive

S Kaul to Tripathi, 1 run, just short of Stanlake at third man, effort ball from Kaul, he saw Tripathi giving the charge and banged it short, the batsman was done in by the pace, gets a top-edge on the pull, went a long way in the air and towards Stanlake. He was slightly late coming forward, slid forward but the ball bounced in front of him
S Kaul to Samson, leg byes, 1 run, on a good length and shaping back into the right-hander, beat him on the inside edge as he flicked, hit the thigh and rolled away towards the off-side for a leg-bye
S Kaul to Tripathi, 1 run, fraction short and just outside off, Tripathi hacks it away without any timing towards long-on
S Kaul to Samson, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, worked away towards long-on for a single

S Kaul to Tripathi, 1 run, appeal for LBW and SRH want a review. Kaul was convinced and he forced his captain to go for it. It's a fair delivery, it's pad first, but I reckon that the impact was outside off, at best it could be umpire's call. Hawk-Eye in and the impact is well outside off, NOT OUT is the call. SRH lose their review, on a good length and shaping back in, Tripathi got across his stumps as he defended, the ball clipped the flap oif the bat before deflecting towards mid-off
Rashid Khan to Tripathi, 1 run, tossed up well outside off, Tripathi gets across and slugs it towards long-on for a single

Rashid Khan to Tripathi, FOUR, nicely played by Tripathi, fraction short and just outside off, the leg-break from Rashid, Tripathi waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and dabs it past KW at first slip, rolls away to the fence in a hurry

Rashid Khan to Tripathi, FOUR, lovely, Tripathi picked this one though, the attempted wrong'un, Tripathi gets a big stride forward, gets close to the ball and lifts it over cover, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Rashid Khan to Samson, 1 run, pushed through quicker and on off, Samson didn't pick him up as he went back, was looking to tuck it towards the on-side, gets a leading edge that pops wide of cover-point
Rashid Khan to Tripathi, 1 run, the leg-break from Rashid, but the length is short, allows Tripathi to go back and work it towards long-on
Rashid Khan to Samson, 1 run, flatter and just outside off, punched down towards long-off for a single

Stanlake to Samson, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, Samson stays back and pushes it towards backward point for a quick single. That ends a pacy debut spell from Stanlake for the Sunrisers
Stanlake to Tripathi, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, bowled at 145.6 kmph, Tripathi awkwardly jabs it in front of point for a single
Stanlake to Tripathi, no run, pace and that's getting Tripathi in some trouble, on a good length and well outside off, seams away a tad and beats Tripathi's blade once again
Stanlake to Tripathi, no run, pacy from Stanlake, this was bowled at 142.4 kmph, Tripathi saw the width and went for a flashy drive, gets beaten on the top-edge
Stanlake to Samson, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, punched down towards long-on for a single
Stanlake to Tripathi, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, Tripathi goes hard on the drive and gets it into the gap past cover-point
Shakib to Samson, 2 runs, full and flighted on middle and leg, Samson almost falls over while whipping it away to backward square leg for a brace. A misfield by Dhawan allows the second...
Shakib to Samson, 2 runs, fractionally short and skiddy angling in on middle, Samson gets deep in his crease and short-arm pulls it to long-on for a brace
Shakib to Tripathi, 1 run, a drag-down on off, Samson makes room and slaps that away past a diving point for a single
Shakib to Samson, 1 run, yorker length delivery on off, dug out off the toe-end to cover for a scampered single
Shakib to Tripathi, 1 run, loopy delivery on off, a hint of turn, steered away towards point
Shakib to Samson, 1 run, tossed up outside off, Samson gets forward and pushes it away to long-off for a single

Stanlake to Stokes, out Caught by Williamson!! Length ball outside off, Stokes drags a lofted drive through the line towards long-on where Williamson, for a fleeting moment, nearly fluffs it and you can see the look of pure terror in his eyes. But his cat-like reflexes make sure he latches on during his second attempt. He - is - pumped! Stokes c Williamson b Stanlake 5(8)
Stanlake to Samson, 1 run, slower yorker length delivery on middle and leg, a well-timed whip-drive away to long-on for a single
Stanlake to Stokes, 1 run, just about short enough to be pulled, Stokes is quick to clout that pull away to deep mid-wicket who charges in and cuts it off to keep it to a single
Stanlake to Stokes, 2 runs, length delivery on middle, @141.3km/h, and a nudge away in front of square leg for a quick brace.
Stanlake to Samson, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off and angling in, tapped away off the back foot towards long-on for a single
Stanlake to Stokes, 1 run, short one on the body, Stokes swivels into a guided pull to fine leg for a single
Rashid Khan to Samson, no run, sharp and flat googly just outside off, turning in with some skid, Samson tries to cut, gets in inside edge onto his pads. Deadly over by Rashid
Rashid Khan to Samson, no run, tossed up just outside off, Samson gets forward and drives it to cover
Rashid Khan to Stokes, 1 run, on leg and middle, tickled away to backward square leg for a single

Rashid Khan to Stokes, no run, leg-break on middle, turning in, past the inside edge of Stokes, high on the pad. Appeal, but not given, clearly going over the stumps. Hang on! There was a thick inside edge as well, basically Stokes jammed the bat onto his pads

Rashid Khan to Stokes, no run, flat googly across the left-hander, skidding on, Stokes tries to reverse-sweep, misses. A bit of discussion if there was an edge through to the keeper, but they decide against the review
Rashid Khan to Stokes, no run, leg-break but down leg, Stokes misses the flick and it hits him on the pad

S Kaul to Samson, FOUR, short of length delivery in the channel outside off, Samson tries to open the bat-face and steer it away to third man, gets a thick edge past the keeper, to the long stop fence for four. Oh, if only we had the Saha of the Australia Test series last year...

S Kaul to Rahane, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Excellent catch! Fuller one outside off, Rahane gets across and VVSes a lofted whip towards deep mid-wicket where Rashid runs across and takes a commendable sliding catch. He seems surprised that he took that! Rahane departs for a run-a-ball 13. Rahane c Rashid Khan b S Kaul 13(13) [4s-2]
S Kaul to Samson, 1 run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Samson stays in the crease and slices that away from under his eyes to deep backward point for a single

S Kaul to Rahane, 1 run, charges down! Length ball outside off, Rahane makes room, comes down the wicket and tries to loft him through the line over long-off, gets a thick outside edge to third man, and it falls just short of Stanlake
S Kaul to Rahane, wide, short one, lots of bounce and goes over the head of a swaying Rahane. Wide called. One for the over...
S Kaul to Samson, 1 run, back of a length delivery in the channel outside off, no lateral movement whatsoever, Samson stands tall and punches that away to sweeper cover for a single
S Kaul to Samson, no run, good length on middle and off, skiddy, Samson tries a cross-batted swat down the ground, gets a thick under-edge into the pitch
Shakib to Samson, 1 run, a tad short and skiddy, Samson rocks back and nails the pull to deep mid-wicket for a single
Shakib to Rahane, leg byes, 1 run, tossed up outside off, Rahane shuffles across and tries a blind sweep, gets struck outside off. Huge appeal, but they don't go for the review...
Shakib to Samson, 1 run, good length and flat on off, Samson chips it on the up to long-on for a single
Shakib to Samson, no run, a tad short on off, Samson makes room and slaps that to mid-off

Shakib to Samson, FOUR, angled in, was that armer, towards leg-stump, Samson came down the wicket, realized he wasn't to the pitch of it, but still went through with the shot Through deep mid-wicket for four
Shakib to Samson, no run, flatter in trajectory angled in towards middle, nudged off the front foot towards short mid-wicket
Stanlake to Samson, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, Samson hangs back and taps it on the head to guide it away to third man for a single

Stanlake to Samson, FOUR, length delivery just outside off, straightening a little, and taking the leading edge of the closed bat-face to deep backward point. It was in the air for a while, but through the vacant region for four
Stanlake to Samson, 2 runs, length ball on middle, turned away to backward square leg for a brace

Stanlake to Samson, wide, WHAT! @147km/h, short one, flying over the batsman, Saha jumps and collects it with a crazy leap over his head! Stanlake should be thanking him. Wide called, and thankfully it isn't five of them...
Stanlake to Rahane, 1 run, length delivery just outside off, in that corridor of uncertainly, Rahane tries to nudge it into the on-side, gets a leading edge to third man for a single
Stanlake to Rahane, FOUR, short, no width, Rahane arches back into a semi-limbo and scythes that away to the deep backward point fence for four. Expertly done
Stanlake to Samson, 1 run, a gift, a low full-toss on the pads, @147.2km/h, whipped away to deep backward square leg for a single
Shakib to Rahane, no run, another arm-ball, the in-swinging variation angling in and pitching on a length, tickled away towards backward square leg off the front foot
Shakib to Samson, 1 run, flatter delivery angled in on middle, pushed off a full-stretch to long-on for a single
Shakib to Rahane, 1 run, fuller one on middle and leg, Rahane shimmies down and whips it to mid-on for a single
Shakib to Rahane, FOUR, shortens his length as Rahane comes down the track, and Rahane just adjusts his shot to flat-bat it through deep extra cover for four
Shakib to Rahane, no run, another full one on middle and leg, nurdled away to square leg
Shakib to Rahane, no run, the in-angler on leg, Rahane manages to nudge it into the on-side
Bhuvneshwar to Samson, no run, another slowish length ball headed for off, Samson gets half-forward and wrists a soft tap to mid-off
Bhuvneshwar to Rahane, 1 run, length delivery angled into the pads, Rahane falls across a little and taps it to wide mid-on for a quick single
Bhuvneshwar to Samson, 1 run, back of a length delivery on off, good bounce, Samson drops it off the closed bat-face to mid-wicket for a scrambled single

Bhuvneshwar to Samson, FOUR, slower one, possibly knuckle, on a length outside off, Samson just picks the perfect moment in time to let leather meet willow with that authoritative whip away to deep mid-wicket for four
Bhuvneshwar to Samson, no run, good length delivery on middle, a little skiddy, nudged softly to mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Samson, FOUR, a bit of outswing on a good length outside off, a hint of seam away, but Samson just check-drives it through the line to sweeper cover for four
Stanlake to Samson, 3 runs, back of a length delivery on middle and leg, @146km/h, and a polite clip away to deep mid-wicket for three
Stanlake to Samson, no run, short and outside off, gets big on him, Samson goes for a blind pull and misses. Poor shot selection...
Stanlake to Samson, 2 runs, length delivery but errs in line, 140.2km/h, on the pads, clipped away to backward square leg for a brace
Stanlake to Samson, no run, short of length delivery just a fraction wide outside off, @146.5km/h, Samson tries to flirt with it by steering it away to third man, gets beaten
Stanlake to Samson, no run, back of a length delivery in the channel outside off @141.3km/h and seaming in slightly, Samson gets on the back foot and solidly blocks it back to the bowler
Stanlake to Samson, no run, pace! Good length ball outside off, left alone by Samson, but it carries to the keeper almost head-high

Bhuvneshwar to D Arcy Short, out D Arcy Short Run Out!! Oh, that looks out! They've gone up to the third umpire, but I think he's as dead as a dodo. A fullish one outside off, push-driven to mid-off where the cat-like Williamson runs in and scores a direct-hit at the non-striker's end. Short nods at Rahane, but not in a reassuring way. Nope, the other thing. Death knell for D'Arcy. And that's Williamson for you, after a few blinders in whites a few weeks ago. The aggression comes from within. D Arcy Short run out (Williamson) 4(4) [4s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to D Arcy Short, no run, good length delivery on of, D Arcy Short checks a tap to cover where Rashid Khan dives it save it. A mix-up between the two, but they're safely back in the end
Bhuvneshwar to D Arcy Short, FOUR, half-volley on middle and leg, D Arcy Short eases it away with a nonchalant whip off the pads in front of deep square leg for four. Blazes away...
Bhuvneshwar to D Arcy Short, wide, a hint of inswing but he has erred in line, a wide down leg-side
Bhuvneshwar to D Arcy Short, no run, length delivery on the pads, not much movement, Short nudges it at the last moment towards short mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Rahane, 1 run, good length delivery just outside off, the late inswinger this time, steered away with an angled vertical bat to third man for a single
Bhuvneshwar to Rahane, no run, some swing from the arm pitching on a back of a length outside off and jagging away off the deck. Left alone by Rahane

Vinay Kumar to Jadeja, SIX, the roof has come down at Chepauk. Jadeja seals the win with a mighty six. Did I say he's not connecting 'em well? He's just nailed this one. The slower delivery, off-cutter from Vinay, right in the arc for Jadeja, who waits before teeing off, full swing of the arms and the ball sails over the long-on fence

Vinay Kumar to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, steps out of the crease and yorks himself, well bowled by Vinay, speared it full and outside off from round the wicket, Bravo drags it off the toe-end to long-on and has to settle with a single
Vinay Kumar to Jadeja, 1 run, off-speed delivery and Jadeja is quite happy to give the strike back to Bravo, steers it with an open bat face to backward point
Vinay Kumar to Jadeja, wide, over the wicket for the left-hander, Vinay sprays it well outside off, Jadeja allows it to pass and pockets a wide. DK runs up to his bowler and has a quick word with him

Vinay Kumar to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, Bravo is livid with Jadeja. He wanted the second and is sent back. Shortens the length and angles it across, Bravo pulls it on the bounce to deep mid-wicket, there was two had Jadeja sprinted back, instead he keeps strike

Vinay Kumar to Dwayne Bravo, 2 runs, caught at long-on and the fielder takes an eternity to release the ball. Should have thrown it immediately. Full delivery angled across from round the wicket, Bravo goes through with the hack and cue-ends it to long-on. Rinku Singh was the fielder and he allowed the second to be taken

Vinay Kumar to Dwayne Bravo, no ball, SIX, terrible terrible start from Vinay Kumar. KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan affords a smile. A high full toss well above the waist, Bravo somehow managed to swing it away off the top-edge and over fine leg. What a start to the over!
Tom Curran to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, full and tailing in, Bravo flicks it to deep mid-wicket, just a single

Tom Curran to Jadeja, 1 run, slower delivery and Jadeja advances down, deceived in pace and knocks it into the off-side, wanted the second but Bravo ain't interested, puts his hand up and sends Jadeja back

Tom Curran to Billings, out Caught by Uthappa!! Uthappa pumps his fists. KKR find a lifeline once again. Full delivery and right in the slot, had Billings stayed put without moving to the leg-side, he could have connected with the loft better, instead he had to reach out and managed only a toe-end to long-off. Uthappa ran across to his left to pouch that. Nevertheless, Billings has given CSK a chance to pull this off and Chepauk might have found a new hero in him. Billings c Uthappa b Tom Curran 56(23) [4s-2 6s-5]

Tom Curran to Billings, SIX, Billings is playing a gem here. He is getting the big hit at the right moment. The slower delivery and Billings was waiting for it with a crouched stance, gets underneath it and nails the pull over deep square leg
Tom Curran to Jadeja, 1 run, slower delivery slanted across off, Jadeja steers it to third man and hands the strike back to Billings

Tom Curran to Billings, 1 run, fifty for Billings. CSK needed someone to take over the baton after Raina's wicket and the Kent batsman has taken the onus on himself to keep the chase going. Raises the bat and gets the applause from the yellow faithfuls. Walked across his stumps and Curran fired it in the blockhole, the sweep comes off the under edge and bobbles away to fine leg

A Russell to Jadeja, no run, beaten! Very rare to see a batsman get beaten off a length ball at this stage. Russell angled it across the left-hander and Jadeja with laden feet had a poke at it, beaten on the outside edge
A Russell to Billings, 1 run, banged into the surface, Billings pulls it on the bounce to deep square leg, for a single

A Russell to Billings, SIX, this is spectacular. It was the off-cutter on back of a length, Billings had moved away to the leg-side and was almost cramped for room, extended his arms and lofted it over long-on. It was more of a punch from the Englishman. Reminded me of the Kohli shot against Chris Woakes

A Russell to Billings, SIX, geez! Some skill that. He waited and waited, moved right across his stumps when Russell was about to deliver, crouched low and scooped the low full toss all the way over fine leg. The crowd find their voice again
A Russell to Jadeja, 1 run, short and at the body, Jadeja swivel and pulls it to fine leg. Two singles to start the 18th
A Russell to Billings, 1 run, short of length on off, Billings backs away and knocks it to mid-off, just a single
Chawla to Billings, 1 run, flatter and on the stumps, Billings nudges it into the on-side and retains strike

Chawla to Billings, FOUR, much needed boundary for CSK. It had been a quiet over so far. Billings didn't connect it properly but struck it in the gap, front leg out of the way and a swing of the arms, couple of bounces and into the cow corner fence

Chawla to Jadeja, 1 run, where was Jadeja going? Chawla was appealing for LBW. There was no run. Hangs back to this faster delivery and ekes out an inside edge onto the pad, the ball rolled adjacent to the wicket on the off-side and Jadeja was off, didn't even know where the ball was, Karthik got across and fired a throw at the striker's end. Missed and Jadeja survives, they eventually get the run on the overthrow

Chawla to Dhoni, out Caught by Karthik!! Dhoni walks. Pin drop silence at Chepauk. Is that the match? Well, there is still Bravo - last game's match-winner. Dhoni waits as the umpire checks for a front foot no-ball, Chawla is fine and Dhoni continues walking. Clever bowling from Chawla, slowed it up a touch and kept it outside off, Dhoni was down on his knee to play the sweep, through the shot early and the under edge is found. Karthik has a juggle before completing the catch. Dhoni didn't even wait for the umpire. Started walking as soon as he saw the catch taken. Dhoni c Karthik b Chawla 25(28) [4s-1 6s-1]
Chawla to Dhoni, wide, fired down leg and Dhoni stays his ground to pick up an extra

Chawla to Billings, 1 run, that was the seam-up delivery, bowled at 113.9kph, Billings steps out of the crease looking to heave it into the leg-side, done in for pace and the inside edge rolls away to short fine
Chawla to Dhoni, 1 run, flighted delivery that is almost near the blockhole, Dhoni squeezes the drive to long-on and Billings wanted the second, the skipper was quick to send him back. Right call

Narine to Billings, 2 runs, and Billings nudges one into the on-side ring, Dhoni was off in a flash and wanted two, he was cruising for the second when he saw the throw come to his end and decide to charge. Got it comfortably
Narine to Dhoni, leg byes, 1 run, steps out and does not pick the off-break, misses the nudge and is off the thigh pad to backward square
Narine to Dhoni, no run, carrom ball and Dhoni was looking to copy Billings - play it with loose hands, but can't get it in the gap, straight to cover
Narine to Billings, 1 run, flatter and around off, Billings wrists it down to long-on

Narine to Billings, 2 runs, that's what needs to be done against Narine. Run down the wicket and work it with soft hands into the gap, placed into the leg-side and the duo are quick to steal the second
Narine to Dhoni, 1 run, fraction short and Dhoni pulls it to deep mid-wicket, just a single

Tom Curran to Billings, SIX, and he ends it with a maximum. Another big over for CSK, 17 off it. Curran fires in a full toss around the hip, Billings was moving around in the crease, stands still at the point of contact and heaves it flat over deep backward square
Tom Curran to Dhoni, 1 run, the back of the hand slower ball, Dhoni eases it past cover and gives the strike back to Billings
Tom Curran to Billings, 1 run, nails the yorker and there is not much any batsmen could do, squeezed out to mid-off

Tom Curran to Billings, SIX, fabulous shot! To get such power behind that shot is incredible. Curran missed his yorker length by an inch or so, Billings stayed on leg-stump and went through with the inside out loft, cleared the fence quite comfortably. Nice hands!

Tom Curran to Billings, 2 runs, dropped! That should have been taken. Uthappa the culprit. Full and on the stumps, Billings makes room to go over mid-off, does not get the elevation and Uthappa does not time his jump near the edge of the circle. Parries it behind him and Rinku Singh from long-on tidies up
Tom Curran to Dhoni, 1 run, starts with a slower delivery at 121.3kph, Dhoni delays his steer and places it wide of backward point, single to start the over
Kuldeep Yadav to Billings, leg byes, 2 runs, wrong 'un and Billings did not pick it, shuffled across his sticks to play the sweep and missed it, the ball brushed his right shoulder and went fine
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, 1 run, quicker and on the legs, nurdled round the corner - to backward square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, wide, Kuldeep fires it outside off expecting Dhoni to give the charge, wide called

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, outta here! This is what the Chepauk crowd have been waiting for more than two years - Dhoni at his best. Tossed up on leg-stump, Dhoni cleared his front leg to give himself a free swing of the arms, sends the ball sailing over the deep mid-wicket fence

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, FOUR, murdered! That might get him going. Need a boundary off the middle and he's got it. Shimmies down and gets close to the flighted delivery then drills it straight down the ground, went at the rate of knots
Kuldeep Yadav to Billings, 1 run, once again on the shorter side of Kuldeep and Billings carves the cut to sweeper cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, 1 run, trifle short and Dhoni pulls it in front of square leg, just a single

Chawla to Dhoni, 1 run, Dhoni was on the charge, but saw the pulled back length and stood his ground, sliced the cut to short third man and settles with a single. Should have done better as he had the room
Chawla to Billings, 1 run, shortens the length and keeps it on, Billings opens the bat face and directs it square on the off-side
Chawla to Billings, 2 runs, once more uses his feet and works it in the gap - between deep mid-wicket and long-on, two more added

Chawla to Billings, FOUR, wow! Just a flick of the wrists and Rinku Singh, one of the quick movers, could not get around to stop it. Dances down and gets to the pitch, whipped against the turn to wide long-on, the timing was exquisite
Chawla to Dhoni, 1 run, firing 'em in is Chawla, Dhoni is late in bringing his bat down and the inside edge is squirted past the stumps to backward square leg, he was searching for the ball there
Chawla to Dhoni, no run, shade quicker and on off, Dhoni watchfully knocks it back to Chawla

Narine to Dhoni, 1 run, short and outside off, Dhoni waits before playing the cut shot to the right of point, the fielder gets a hand and deviates it in the path of the sweeper cover. Another tidy over from Narine

Narine to Dhoni, no run, runs down the wicket without much clue, closes the bat face to work it into the on-side, ekes out an inside edge onto the pad, no chance of the single and the ball goes quickly to cover
Narine to Billings, 1 run, carrom ball around off, Billings hangs back and wrists it to long-on

Narine to Raina, out Caught by Vinay Kumar!! The cramp derailed him of the momentum. He was really struggling. Limps off to a quiet stadium. The delivery was short alright and Raina picked the length early, but his feet could not make the adjustment to rock back and the pull was off the top-edge, Vinay ran across to his left from long-on and completed a straightforward catch. Might be a good thing for CSK as Raina was not able to run as well and we know that Dhoni needs someone to sprint along with him. Raina c Vinay Kumar b Narine 14(12) [6s-1]
Narine to Dhoni, 1 run, shortens the length and Dhoni punches it square on the off-side, single to sweeper

Narine to Dhoni, no run, Narine is a smart operator and he will mix it up. Important to read him from the hand rather the surface. Dhoni did not pick the off-break and lunged forward to nudge it into the on-side, beaten on the inside edge and struck around the kneeroll. The big press forward helped him there as ball-tracking showed it to be going over

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, SIX, that's what he was trying at the start of the over. Raina remains the key to this chase. Floated up outside off, Raina with a stride forward lofts it handsomely inside out over extra cover, just about manages to clear the rope
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, 1 run, not short enough to play the pull and hence the bottom hand comes off as Dhoni goes through with the shot, all along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, 1 run, dragged back length and Raina is cramped on the pull, still goes through and picks out deep mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, 1 run, flatter and around off, punched to long-off
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, no run, fraction short and outside off, Dhoni cuts it to backward point. Raina struggling with cramps is not going for that quick single

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, 1 run, dropped! Tom Curran did a remarkable job of getting to the ball. So, tough to call it a drop. Flighted outside off, Raina sans footwork went for the inside out loft, nowhere near the middle and the ball skied towards deep extra cover. Curran ran forward, dived full length and got fingertips to it
Narine to Dhoni, no run, floated outside off, played to point by Dhoni
Narine to Raina, 1 run, the off-spinner on leg, Raina has eased that down to long-on for a single
Narine to Dhoni, 1 run, that was well outside off, Dhoni had to reach for it as he slapped it to sweeper cover
Narine to Raina, 1 run, short and flat on the pads, nudged to square leg for a run by Raina
Narine to Dhoni, 1 run, this one was turning away from Dhoni and he simply ramps it down to fine leg, Chawla sprints towards the ball, gathers it and quickly releases it, denies them the second
Narine to Dhoni, no run, quicker delivery coming into the batsman, Dhoni tentatively defends it down

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, 1 run, aggression from the skipper. Flighted delivery around middle, Dhoni charges down the wicket and smacks that hard to long-on, on a few bounces to the fielder stationed there
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, no run, gives that a bit of flight on middle and leg, Dhoni walks down the wicket to flick it away, but the extra spin on that is too good for him as it clips his pads
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, no run, quicker delivery around off, Dhoni defends it off the front foot

Kuldeep Yadav to Rayudu, out Caught by (sub)Shivam Mavi!! Both the set openers are back in the hut now. That was bowled outside off and was spinning away from the batsman, Rayudu goes ahead with his chip shot and times it straight to the subsitute fielder who comes running in and takes it. Are KKR getting back in this match? With two new batsmen at the crease getting those odd boundaries might get a bit difficult. Rayudu c (sub)Shivam Mavi b Kuldeep Yadav 39(26) [4s-3 6s-2]
Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, 1 run, short and spinning into the batsman on middle, Raina nudges it to short mid-wicket and takes a run
Kuldeep Yadav to Rayudu, 1 run, short in length outside off, Rayudu punches that down to sweeper cover and changes ends

Narine to Rayudu, 1 run, only 4 runs off the over, the miserly Narine is here. Short and quick around off, Rayudu drags it down to long-on and retains strike for the next over. 8 runs have come in the two overs after the powerplay
Narine to Rayudu, no run, 'yours' is the call by DK as Rayudu knocks the quicker delivery back to Narine
Narine to Raina, 1 run, short again around middle and leg, Raina drags it down to long-on, gets a single
Narine to Raina, no run, pulls the length back around off, Raina camps back and punches it to the fielder at cover who denies them a run
Narine to Rayudu, 1 run, quick and straight outside off, Rayudu runs it down to third man for an easy run
Narine to Raina, 1 run, flatter around middle and leg, nudged to the on side by Raina for a single
A Russell to Rayudu, no run, quick and full delivery fired outside off, Rayudu tries to reach out for it, but fails to make contact, that was a good wide yorker by Russell
A Russell to Rayudu, no run, fine stop by Russell in his followthrough. Bowls a full toss but as Rayudu drives it straight back to him, Russell gets down in motion and grabs it in his right hand
A Russell to Rayudu, no run, short and quick outside off, Rayudu angles it away to point
A Russell to Rayudu, 2 runs, short and quick around off, Rayudu awkwardly pulls that down to long leg and manages to come back for the second as Rana parries the ball to Curran in the deep
A Russell to Raina, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Raina calmly steers it down to third man for a single
A Russell to Rayudu, 1 run, on a length outside off, Rayudu guides it towards short third man and gets to the other end
Tom Curran to Raina, no run, yorker on middle and leg, Raina does well to get his bat down in time and squeeze it back to the bowler

Tom Curran to Watson, out Caught by Rinku Singh!! Maiden wicket for Tom Curran in IPL. A breather for KKR there. Short of a length delivery around off and Watson pulls it hard again. But there's a fielder in the deep, it's Rinku Singh out there. He moves to his left and grabs it eventually to bring an end to Watson's blitzkrieg. CSK couldn't have asked for a better start from the Aussie all-rounder. Wait on.. the crowd at Chepauk welcomes Raina with a loud cheer. The highest run scorer for CSK in history of IPL is at the crease. Watson c Rinku Singh b Tom Curran 42(19) [4s-3 6s-3]
Tom Curran to Rayudu, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Rayudu angles it away to point and gets to the other end, wise
Tom Curran to Watson, 1 run, overthrows again. Length delivery outside off, Watson cuts it towards point but Rana has a needless shy at the bowler's end and allows the batsmen to cross over
Tom Curran to Watson, SIX, this is entertainment. Full length delivery around off, Watson keeps his head still and powers it over long-off for six more, the bowler is under pressure, straightaway

Tom Curran to Watson, FOUR, the newbie to IPL is welcomed in style by Watson. It's short again and looking at the kind of touch Watson is in he won't spare you. Pulls it nicely over mid-wicket, one bounce and into the fence she goes

A Russell to Watson, 1 run, quick short one to end the over. Watson pulls that away but is a bit late in his shot, gets a top-edge that falls well short of the fielder at deep mid-wicket. Had Watto middled that, it might have been a catch for the man in the deep
A Russell to Rayudu, 1 run, short delivery that hurries on to the batsman, Rayudu pulls that to the left of short fine and takes a single
A Russell to Rayudu, FOUR, cheeky there. Short of a length outside off, Rayudu arches back and guides it smartly towards third man, very fine and you can't keep a fielder there

A Russell to Rayudu, 2 runs, misfield! KKR feeling the heat already. Short of a length around off, Rayudu punches it to wide mid-off where a rather casual Vinay Kumar lets it past him and allows the batsmen to get two
A Russell to Watson, 1 run, back of a length on middle and leg, Watson hops a bit and tucks it towards square leg for a single
A Russell to Rayudu, 1 run, short of a length outside off, Rayudu steers it down to third man and gets across to the other end

Chawla to Watson, no run, finally a dot, *sigh*! Some relief for my fingers. Chawla bowls a quick and straight delivery around middle and off, Watson calmly blocks it down, back to the bowler that rolls
Chawla to Rayudu, 1 run, pushed through on middle and leg, Rayudu tucks it to short mid-wicket and scurries across

Chawla to Rayudu, FOUR, 50 up for CSK! CSK, CSK are the chants at the stadium. Short of a length outside off, Rayudu camps back and cuts it past the diving fielder at cover-point to add four more to the tally

Chawla to Rayudu, SIX, carnage continues! The crowd is loving this. Flighted delivery around off, Rayudu stands tall and chips it with ease right over covers, half a dozen more. These two are looking unstoppable
Chawla to Rayudu, no run, quicker delivery around off, Rayudu tries to run it down to third man but gets beaten

Chawla to Rayudu, SIX, excellent use of the feet by Rayudu. Tossed up delivery on middle and Rayudu shimmies down the wicket to pump it over the bowler's head for a biggie, that came right off the meat and met the sightscreen on the full
A Russell to Rayudu, 1 run, only six of the over. Full in length and a tad slower in pace, Rayudu flicks it tamely to deep mid-wicket and gets a single, he'll retain strike with that
A Russell to Rayudu, no run, short and quick outside off, Rayudu looks to cut that, but the extra bounce and quick pace on that beats him
A Russell to Rayudu, FOUR, poor delivery by Dre Russ. Gifts a full toss to Rayudu who clips it nonchalantly past the fielder at short fine leg, easy pickings for the batsman there

A Russell to Rayudu, no run, no need for Rayudu to do that. He can give the strike to Watson who's looking in good touch. This one is a slower delivery outside off, Rayudu walks down the track, swings and misses, no where close to making contact
A Russell to Watson, 1 run, pitches it up around the off-stump, Watson pushes it in front of mid-on and gets to the other end in a jiffy
A Russell to Watson, no run, short of a length outside off and it shoots off after hitting the deck, as Watson pokes at it, he gets beaten due to the extra bit of carry
Chawla to Watson, 1 run, drops it short and quick on middle and leg, Watson rocks back and knocks that down to wide long-on in order to retain strike
Chawla to Watson, SIX, Watto is in the house fellas! Gets down on his knee and clubs the floater over mid-wicket, clean as a whistle and it's a maximum
Chawla to Watson, no run, quicker one fired outside off as Watson guides it to the man at point
Chawla to Rayudu, 1 run, eases the tossed up delivery down to long-on

Chawla to Watson, 5 runs, overthrows! Watson will take that, they need runs, doesn't matter how they come. DK the culprit there. Gathers the ball that's tucked to the on side and fires in a wayward throw at the bowler's end,  Russell is a bit slow in backing up and it's five runs
Chawla to Rayudu, 1 run, floated around off, Rayudu dabs it in front of short third man and sets off, Watson is back on strike

Vinay Kumar to Watson, FOUR, fine end to the over! Make that 16 runs off the opening over. Vinay Kumar conceded 14 runs in the previous match off the first over, concedes two extra in this one. It's a back of a length delivery outside off and all Watson does is simply punch it through the gap at cover-point. Into the gap and away to the fence she goes. Just the ideal start for CSK in this mammoth run chase
Vinay Kumar to Watson, SIX, this is a fine shot! In the slot on middle and leg, a length delivery and Watson stays put and towers it over long-on for half a dozen, first biggie of the innings
