Vinay Kumar to Watson, FOUR, not where he intended to hit that but he'll take it. Another short delivery around off, Watson takes his eyes off the ball and pulls, ends up getting an inside edge past the fielder at short fine leg and finds the fence

Vinay Kumar to Watson, 2 runs, first runs for CSK. It's a short of a length delivery outside off, Watson stands tall and punches this nicely past the fielder at point and into the gap to gather two runs, third man tidies up

Vinay Kumar to Watson, no run, that's a wild swing. Short of a length around off, lack of bounce on that and as Watson tries to pull that off his front foot, he gets beaten all ends up. That was very close to kissing that off-stump
Vinay Kumar to Watson, no run, starts off with a length delivery seaming into the batsman on middle and leg, as Watson looks to fend it, he gets beaten and is struck on the pads

SN Thakur to A Russell, SIX, smacked, 11th six for Russell and KKR finish with 202 on the board. A slower length ball outside off, Russell  bends down low and smashes it high and over long-off for a maximum

SN Thakur to Tom Curran, byes, 1 run, Russell was always running for the buye, another slower short ball outside off, Curran was backing away on the cut and missed. Russell was scampering across for a bye, Curran was late to get going, MS throws the ball at the bowler, he turns around and misses the shy at the bowler's end, but the batsmen decide against a second run
SN Thakur to Tom Curran, no run, this is excellent bowling from Thakur, slips in the slower short ball outside off, Curran was backing away on the swing and missed, can't get the bye as well

SN Thakur to Tom Curran, no run, that's a great takes from MS, definitely saved a few runs here, Thakur followed Curran as he shuffled acrioss with a quick bouncer, the ball was swirling away and MS dived full-stretch to make the save
SN Thakur to A Russell, 1 run, short of a length and on the stumps, Russell goes hard once again and mistimes it to deep mid-wicket

SN Thakur to A Russell, SIX, Russell is having a party at the Chepauk, on a good length and well wide of off, he bends down low and drills it high and over cover for another maximum, his 10th six of the innings

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, 1 run, full-toss on Russell's pads, whipped away behind square on the on-side for a single, more importantly for KKR, he keeps strike. 21 off the over and 200 is on the cards
Dwayne Bravo to Tom Curran, 1 run, short of a good length and well outside off, chipped over cover for a single

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, 1 run, Bravo nails the yorker finally, gets it right at the base of leg-stump, Russell just about gets his bat down in time and squeezes it towards short fine, Tom Curran calls and then forces his partner for a quick single
Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, a hat-trick of sixes for Russell, length ball on the stumps, Russell backs away, clears his front leg and heaves it high and over deep mid-wicket for a maximum

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, back-to-back sixes, Bravo is getting a real pasting in Chepauk. This was the slower ball and Russell spotted it early, gets down low and smashes it high and way over long-on, gets to his highest score in IPL

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, the sixes keep flowing from the bat of Russell, length ball on his pads, he was backing away and flicks it nonchalantly over mid-wicket, sails over the head of the man in the deep
Watson to A Russell, 1 run, full and wide of off, Russell went hard on the drive, the ball bounces over Watson and Russell will get a single to long-off
Watson to Tom Curran, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, Curran backs away and slaps it to deep cover for a single

Watson to Karthik, out Lbw!! Karthik has been given OUT LBW. He talks with Russell and reviews it. Was it slipping down the leg-side? Don't think there's any bat on that, struck DK in front of leg-stump, but he's so back that the ball didn't have far to travel. Umpire's call on Hawk-Eye and Karthik is OUT. A handy knock from Karthik comes to an end, lovely yorker from Watson, followed Karthik slightly and struck him bang in front of leg-stump, it was the back-pad as well. The impact was in front of leg and would have been clipping the stumps. Karthik lbw b Watson 26(25) [4s-2 6s-1]
Watson to Karthik, wide, the high bouncer from Watson, sails over Karthik's head and it's called as a wide
Watson to Karthik, no run, short of a length and just outside off, Karthik goes hard on the pull and mistimes it towards Tahir at square leg, can't get the single to bring Russell on strike
Watson to A Russell, 1 run, full and well outside off, drilled hard and flat, one bounce and to the fielder at long-off

Watson to A Russell, SIX, just over Rayudu at deep cover and that's fifty for Russell, could Rayudu been further back, would have had a better chance at catching it. This was full and well outside off, Russell got down on one knee and sliced it powerfully over cover. Rayudu ran across from the deep, puts in the leap and only palmed it over the ropes

Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, SIX, cracking shot, huge over for KKR, this was another slower ball and DK picked the bones off it. Gets well forward, uses his wrists to good effect and whips it high and wide of long-on. More problems for MS and CSK
Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, 1 run, relief for Bravo, short of a good length and just outside off, pushed to the left of cover for a single

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, this is turning out to be a serious hammering from Russell, this was a slower full-toss, Russell bends down low and then heaves it high and over wide long-on for another maximum
Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, no run, good comeback from Bravo, slips in the slower ball that angled across the right-hander, Russell was looking to dab it late and missed

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, massive and that has gone out of Chepauk. This ball will not come back, Bravo missed his yorker by an inch, turned out to be a perfect length ball, Russell cleared his left leg and swings it high and over long-on. 105m is the distance
Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, no run, banged in short and on the leg-stump line, Russell ducks under it and lets it go, called as a one for the over
SN Thakur to Karthik, no run, Thakur gets the yorker right, but it's a tad too late in the over, full and just outside off, Karthik was looking to squeeze it out and missed
SN Thakur to A Russell, 1 run, on a good length and well outside off, Russell backs away and clubs it all along the carpet towards long-on

SN Thakur to A Russell, SIX, back-to-back sixes, Russell is on a roll now, low full-toss from Thakur, he missed out on the yorker, but Russell didn't, clears his left leg and clouts it high and over long-on

SN Thakur to A Russell, SIX, that's a bad mishit and it has still gone deep into the stands at long-off. On a good length and well outside off, this was the kuckle ball from Thakur, Russell was looking to smash it over long-on, ended up slicing it high and way over long-off for a maximum
SN Thakur to Karthik, 1 run, short of a good length and well outside off, Karthik went with hard hands on the cut and mistimed it towards third man
SN Thakur to A Russell, 1 run, full and well outside off, Russell is upset with himself as he mistimed the slug towards long-on, went off the inner half of the bat

Tahir to A Russell, 1 run, flighted delivery on the leg-stump line, Russell leans forward and eases it down towards long-on, just a single. That ends Tahir's spell, very decent figures he's managed, but nothing in the wickets coloumn
Tahir to Karthik, 1 run, Tahir gives this one more air, Karthik waits for that extra moment and then places the drive past cover for a single
Tahir to Karthik, no run, slower and just outside off, Karthik finds cover with the drive

Tahir to A Russell, 1 run, Tahir was very excited, but the ball dropped way in front of deep mid-wicket. This was the wrong 'un and Russell didn't pick it, was looking to go over long-on, got a big inside edge and the ball landed around mid-wicket
Tahir to Karthik, 1 run, the leg-break from Tahir, but the length is short and it's pulled away to deep mid-wicket
Tahir to A Russell, 1 run, fraction short and on off, punched down towards long-off for a single
Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, 1 run, good comeback from Bravo, slips in the yorker at Russell's pads, he was looking to flick and got an inside edge onto the pads, a single to square leg

Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, SIX, clubbed, length ball from Bravo and Russell sends it into the long-on stands. Gets a big stride forward, didn't get hold of the shot, but his power takes the ball miles over the man at long-on
Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, 1 run, the slower ball from Bravo, Karthik spots it early and pushes it past cover-point for a single
Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, 1 run, another low full-toss from Bravo, driven down towards long-off for a single
Dwayne Bravo to A Russell, no run, short of a length and just outside off, defended back towards the bowler
Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, 1 run, Bravo starts with a low full-toss outside off, punchy drive past cover for a single
Tahir to A Russell, no run, the leg-break from Tahir, Russell drives with the turn to point
Tahir to Karthik, 1 run, flighted on off, Karthik plays with the turn and works it past mid-wicket for a single

Tahir to A Russell, leg byes, 1 run, that's an interesting delivery from Tahir, was perhaps trying the wrong 'un, the ball slipped out and it was a long hop on Russell's pads. He seemed taken aback for an instant, makes a late adjustment and looks to tuck it fine, misses and the ball rolls off his pads towards short fine
Tahir to A Russell, 2 runs, Tahir drops one short and well outside off, Russell backs away and cuts it square past point for a brace
Tahir to A Russell, no run, slower and spinning away from off, Russell gets an extravagant stride forward in defence
Tahir to A Russell, no run, the wrong 'un from Tahir, hurried back into the right-hander, Russell went back and just about jammed it down
Watson to A Russell, 1 run, on a length and just outside off, Russell shuffles across and taps it wide of cover for a single
Watson to Karthik, 1 run, short of a length and drifting onto Karthik's pads, tucked away behind square on the on-side for a single
Watson to A Russell, 1 run, here comes Russell's slog, backs away to a short ball and mistimes the pull towards long-on, just a single
Watson to A Russell, FOUR, lovely shot, a long half-volley from Watson, full and just outside off, Russell stays in his crease and drills it through extra-cover, no need to run for those
Watson to Karthik, 1 run, tad fuller and just outside off, Karthik plays with a straight bat and finds the gap past cover, just a single
Watson to A Russell, 1 run, on a good length and sliding onto Russell's pads, nudged away wide of mid-wicket for a single
Tahir to Karthik, no run, the leg-break now, Karthik gets a big stride forward and defends it with an open face towards thew off-side
Tahir to Karthik, 2 runs, the wrong 'un from Tahir, but the length was on the shorter side, allowed Karthik to go back and pull it past square leg, back for the second run
Tahir to Karthik, no run, pushed through with a flatter trajectory, Karthik prods across and defends it with an open face
Tahir to Karthik, no run, tossed up on off, Karthik gets forward and finds cover with the drive
Tahir to Karthik, no run, slower and just outside off, Karthik gets half-forward in defence
Tahir to Karthik, FOUR, KKR will remain positive, Karthik brings out the reverse sweep with a slip in place, doesn't get hold of the shot, but has enough to get it past the fielder

SN Thakur to Rinku Singh, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! There's the jig from DJ. CSK fans will start practicing that. KKR lose their fifth wicket, with 10 overs still left. It was hurled fuller outside off and Rinku Singh goes hard on the drive. The bat turned at the point of impact and he ended up slicing it to backward point off the bottom part of the bat. Bravo won't drop those. Rinku Singh c Dwayne Bravo b SN Thakur 2(4)
SN Thakur to Rinku Singh, no run, angling away at 130.8kph from a short of length. Bounces more than Rinku Singh expected it to and the ball bounced over his horizontal blade
SN Thakur to Karthik, 1 run, shortish ball outside off, Karthik hops and runs it down to third man
SN Thakur to Karthik, no run, slants in a length ball on middle, Karthik defends it to mid-wicket with his bat close to the pad. May have come off the inside part
SN Thakur to Karthik, no run, 141.2kph bumper wide of off, Karthik ignores it. Sways away from the line of the ball
SN Thakur to Rinku Singh, 1 run, opens the bat-face to steer a short of length delivery to third man. There's a wide slip at place, but that was placed wide of him
Watson to Rinku Singh, 1 run, shortish ball, Rinku Singh walks across and turns it away to backward square leg to open his account
Watson to Karthik, 1 run, a move across towards off from Karthik and then wrists the length ball to deep backward square leg

Watson to Karthik, FOUR, cracking shot. Should settle Karthik's nerves, if any. Shortish ball wide of off, Karthik gets on top of it and cuts it fiercely through the off-side, beating the man at backward point
Watson to Karthik, no run, punched to backward point off the back foot

Watson to Uthappa, out Uthappa Run Out!! KKR have gifted away a wicket here. Bad communication between two senior members. Length ball around off and Uthappa punched it towards cover from the crease. Raina stopped it with a dive with his left hand, picks the ball and hits the bullseye at the bowler's end. Uthappa was ball-watching and Karthik was halfway down. One had to go at the danger's end, and Uthappa went for it. This is a big wicket. Raina has his arms aloft. Uthappa run out (Raina) 29(16) [4s-2 6s-3]
Watson to Uthappa, wide, bouncer, Uthappa half-ducks and that's been wided

Watson to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Dhoni!! Dhoni pouches, up goes the umpire's finger and there's the roar from the Chepauk crowd. A soft dismissal. An innocuous short of length delivery on middle and leg, Rana moved across to help it along its way. Gets a faint under-edge onto his thigh and the ball lobs up in the air. MS moves to his right to snaffle that. A straightforward catch for the captain.  Nitish Rana c Dhoni b Watson 16(14) [4s-2]
SN Thakur to Nitish Rana, 1 run, shortish ball doesn't rise much. Rana adjusts well and pulls it away through mid-wicket. A swivel too from the southpaw
SN Thakur to Nitish Rana, 2 runs, shortish ball outside off, Rana late-guides it behind square on the off-side. Bhajji, in the deep, runs across to make a tumbling stop

SN Thakur to Nitish Rana, FOUR, "that's not how you follow it up," says Ian Bishop on air. After bowling a good bumper, Thakur now bowls a fullish ball, Rana stays in his crease and hit it through the line. Lofted over wide mid-off and there is no one to stop that
SN Thakur to Nitish Rana, no run, bangs one short at 136.8kph, Rana ducks under it. A well-directed one from Thakur
SN Thakur to Nitish Rana, no run, stump-to-stump channel, Rana plays with soft hands and defends on the off-side. Can't steal a run

SN Thakur to Nitish Rana, no run, 120.9kph short of length delivery from round the wicket, Rana hops and taps it to the left of backward point, who half-stops it with his left hand. The batsmen don't risk a single
Harbhajan to Nitish Rana, 1 run, gets to the pitch with a shimmy down and then eases the drive down to long-off

Harbhajan to Nitish Rana, FOUR, superbly played! Trifle short and Rana was quick to go on the back foot and pounce on it. Waited for the ball and scythed it through backward point. The man in the deep gives a chase, but to no avail

Harbhajan to Nitish Rana, 2 runs, slower ball and gets it to drift in, Rana doesn't quite account for it as he presses forward to work it through the leg-side. Inside-edges it onto his pads and the ball rolls towards long leg
Harbhajan to Nitish Rana, no run, wasn't that short to try the cut shot. Chopped off the under-edge towards the off-side
Harbhajan to Uthappa, 1 run, flat, quick and on the stumps, patted down to long-on
Harbhajan to Nitish Rana, 1 run, pushed to square leg off the inside edge

Jadeja to Uthappa, SIX, Uthappa is turning it on here. This was bowled slightly outside off, doesn't matter to Uthappa. He crouches slightly low and clouts it over long-on. He's timing it brilliantly. Time to target him with pace?
Jadeja to Uthappa, SIX, Uthappa is in good touch! Not much flight on this ball, Uthappa spots it, gets underneath it and lofts it over wide long-on. Right off the meet of the bat
Jadeja to Nitish Rana, 1 run, Rana comes forward and works it through mid-wicket
Jadeja to Nitish Rana, no run, slower through the air, Rana defends

Jadeja to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! You miss, I hit! CSK needed this and Chepauk finds its voice. Flat ball lasered in on the stumps at 92kph, Lynn comes down the track and is beaten in the trajectory. Looked to hack across the line and the ball just sneaked through the gap between bat and pad. Crashes into the leg pole. Chris Lynn b Jadeja 22(16) [4s-4]

Jadeja to Chris Lynn, FOUR, another quick delivery, but errs in line, Lynn moves across, crouches and helps it along its way. Manages to beat short fine leg and there's no one to stop that. Not to forget, a poor effort from Harbhajan who dived over the ball at short fine

Tahir to Uthappa, SIX, that's a wonderful shot! Was darted in by Tahir, Uthappa spotted it quickly. Got down on a knee and slogged it over deep mid-wicket with a sweep shot. Off she goes into the stands and thereby silencing the crowd
Tahir to Chris Lynn, 1 run, low full toss following a backing away Lynn, driven down to long-on

Tahir to Chris Lynn, FOUR, 'catch it' cries Tahir, but Lynn has got enough wood on that. Tahir saw the batter back away and fired on following him. Lynn toe-ends the drill over and wide of mid-off. Uppish, but safe
Tahir to Uthappa, 1 run, shorter and slower, tapped in front of cover for a sharp single
Tahir to Uthappa, no run, quicker ball on the pads, Uthappa misses the flick
Tahir to Uthappa, no run, with a slip in place, Tahir starts with an in-drifter, defended off the front foot
Jadeja to Chris Lynn, no run, moves leg-side and middles the cut, can't pierce the gap in the cover region
Jadeja to Chris Lynn, no run, and once again, Lynn is cramped for room. Under-edges the cut
Jadeja to Chris Lynn, no run, backs away does Lynn, but it was darted on the stumps by Jadeja. Chopped back to the bowler
Jadeja to Uthappa, 1 run, too straight, worked through mid-wicket
Jadeja to Uthappa, no run, beaten by sharp turn! Pitches on off on a short of length and Uthappa wanted to run it down towards third man, the ball spun past the outside edge
Jadeja to Chris Lynn, 1 run, push-driven through the covers
Watson to Uthappa, no run, opens the bat-face and guides the length ball to backward point

Watson to Uthappa, FOUR, steered and just wide of the Raina at wide slip. A short of length delivery with width on offer, Uthappa opens his bat-face at the last moment and guided it to Raina's right, who dived full length. Trickles away to the fence
Watson to Uthappa, no run, seam-up good length ball, Uthappa drives on the up. Goes to mid-off off the top portion of the bat
Watson to Uthappa, FOUR, easy pickings for Uthappa! Full and straying on the pads, a lean across followed by a nonchalant flick over backward square leg. One bounce and into the fence
Watson to Chris Lynn, 1 run, there's protection in the deep. Slaps a length ball in front of square on the off-side
Watson to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that's been thrashed through extra cover. A fuller length ball, stand-and-deliver stuff from Lynn. Stood tall and hammered the drive between extra cover and mid-off
Harbhajan to Uthappa, no run, good looking sweep, but can't beat Chahar at square leg
Harbhajan to Uthappa, no run, floater on off, Uthappa presses forward in defence

Harbhajan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, flat and shortish ball, Lynn stays deep in his crease and pulls it powerfully. He would have thought that a boundary was there for the taking. But, there was Chahar at square leg, who flew full length to his left and could only get a hand on it. It will be too harsh to call that as a drop, he got both hands though, perhaps had a chance to cling on

Harbhajan to Narine, out Caught by Raina!! The ploy to bring the spinner has worked straightaway. So, Narine is gone! A dot, six, six and OUT. Good ball that from Harbhajan. A nicely tossed up delivery above the eyeline of the batsman wide of off. Narine looks to slog it over mid-wicket from there and all he manages is a top-edge, that goes miles up in the air. Raina sprinted to his left from cover and took a sharp running catch. Tumbles on the ground, but ensured that the ball didn't pop out of his hand. Narine c Raina b Harbhajan 12(4) [6s-2]
Harbhajan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, Lynn moves leg-side and Harbhajan follows him. Push-driven to long-on
Harbhajan to Chris Lynn, no run, fires a flat ball around off, pushed to backward point off the outside half

Chahar to Narine, SIX, wow! Six more and that's 18 off the opening over. Slightly fuller and got it to swing in a tad did Chahar. But, that doesn't bother Narine. He slightly backs away and clobbers it over cow corner

Chahar to Narine, SIX, Narine is off the mark with a six. I'm not surprised. Swings his bat hard and takes on the man at long-on. The fielder is made to look like a spectator. It was a length ball, Narine stood tall and thumped it well over the fielder. Hello Chennai
Chahar to Narine, no run, another inswinger that cramps Narine for room. He looked to whip it away through the leg-side, sans any feet movement. Gets an inside edge onto his front pad
Chahar to Narine, wide, 131.8kph, inswinger, slipped down the leg-side. Narine misses the glance. Called as a wide
Chahar to Chris Lynn, 1 run, stays leg-side of the ball to force this back of a length delivery to deep backward point

Chahar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Chris Lynn is underway! Typical Lynn. Shortish ball with width on offer, he'll punish you everytime. Stands tall and slashes it over point. Raced away and there's pin drop silence
Chahar to Chris Lynn, no run, Chahar, from over the wicket, starts with a back of a length delivery, that seams away a bit. Lynn watches it carefully and taps it to cover

Laughlin to Chris Morris, SIX, A six to finish. Does not matter. 9th successive win for RR in Jaipur and 7th successive win against DD. The rains might have done them a favour. That was full and the batsman clobbered it down the ground by holding his shape nicely to send it over long-on. RR win this 10 runs
Laughlin to Chris Morris, FOUR, throws his hands at it and slices it flat-footed over covers. It's all but over....

Laughlin to Vijay Shankar, out Caught by Stokes!! Another skier, another good take. The fielder at long-on came in running in and took it. The length ball was another swirler. The ball sliced up from the outer half of the blade and the fielder did the rest. Vijay Shankar c Stokes b Laughlin 3(3)
Laughlin to Vijay Shankar, 2 runs, full ball, lifts the ball over the in-field as he went inside out. The man at long-off cuts the ball off and they amble back for a brace. 21 off 3 balls..ummm

Laughlin to Chris Morris, leg byes, 1 run, shatters into the temple! Only if there was no helmet. That was banged in short and the ball climbed up to tickle the helmet. The batsman did not pick it. Gets a single
Laughlin to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, slogs the sliding in delivery on to the on-side. That was a length ball just outside off and the batsman just slugged it away. Only a single

Unadkat to Pant, out Caught by Gowtham!! The fielder takes a good one behind square on the leg-side. It's a full ball and the batsman never got really under it. Got more altitude than distance -- as Pant has today on more than one occasion -- and Gowtham charged in from the deep to take it. Good catch actually, flinging his body in front and plucking it above the ground. More importantly it is a dot ball. That might well have been another delivery where Unadkat ran his fingers on the ball. Pant c Gowtham b Unadkat 20(14) [4s-3]
Unadkat to Pant, no run, looks to play the reverse paddle and misses. The bowler gazed the plan and cramped the batsman for room. 25 needed now Gambhir is distraught. Gets his head down
Unadkat to Pant, FOUR, length slower delivery and the batsman pulls the ball away. Did not time it but gave it some good air miles. Once it landed, there was no one and it went into the fence
Unadkat to Chris Morris, 1 run, full and wide, the batsman throws his bat at it and slices the ball away to deepish point. The bowler bowling to his field and executing the delivery well. 29 needed

Unadkat to Chris Morris, FOUR, full, little wide, the batsman opens the face of the blade and beats the man at deepish point. Much needed four but they need more. Good, intelligent batting from Chris Morris. 30 off 10 balls

Unadkat to Pant, 1 run, the slower delivery is almost every second delivery in this innings. This time decks in and the batsman trying to slog it away, closes the face of the bat a bit too early to sky it up. That fell well short of the man at deep mid-wicket
Laughlin to Chris Morris, 2 runs, again too full, sliced away past point for a couple. The batsman used the pace of the bowler as Laughlin tried to go full and quick
Laughlin to Chris Morris, no run, another swirler from Laughlin. He is using his slower balls really well. The batsman trying to go for the big booming hit, misses. 37 needed now

Laughlin to Maxwell, out Caught by Buttler!! Looks to swing hard and is gone. He was never in today. The bowler cut his fingers over the ball and that tricked the batsman, who was early into his stroke. A thick edge and the keeper did the rest. Maxwell was again trying to drag it away into the on-side and lost shape completely trying to strike it hard. DD looking down the barrell. Maxwell c Buttler b Laughlin 17(12) [4s-2 6s-1]
Laughlin to Pant, 1 run, too full and has been dragged away for a single

Laughlin to Pant, 2 runs, Pant survives. No one called and three men converging around the deepish mid-on area results in Tripathi, who got closest to the ball, dropping it. Rahane, Gowtham and and Tripathi, from long-on, ran in to take that but no one caught it after the batsman skied it higher. That was an off-pace length ball which took the outer slice of the bat
Laughlin to Pant, 2 runs, clubbed down the ground and Gowtham at long-off put in the slide to stop it. That was a low full toss outside off and the batsman powered it down the ground

Unadkat to Maxwell, FOUR, that is sworded away! Full and wide, throws his bat at the leather whilst losing his balance and smears the ball over point for a four. That will do for DD. 14 of the over and that is exactly what they need in each of the rest three overs

Unadkat to Maxwell, SIX, finally, oh, finally, the wait is over. Here is the BIG SHOW!! The ball was in the zone and the batsman stayed his crease to use the long handle. The batsman again dragged the ball away and this time well over long-on
Unadkat to Maxwell, FOUR, lucky, Maxwell ain't complaining. The batsman goes for the big wild swing. The ball trims the outer half of the bat and flies over the man at short third man for a four
Unadkat to Maxwell, no run, full, in the blockhole and well outside off. The batsman fails to wood it. Three dot balls. It was supposed to be easy for DD
Unadkat to Maxwell, no run, scrambled seam and angling away, the batsman looks to go across the line and misses. Maxwell is short on practice and that is showing
Unadkat to Maxwell, no run, angled across slower delivery and the batsman misses it. The equation is 56 off 23 balls. The batsman wanted to drag it away on to the on-side and missed it by a long way
D Kulkarni to Maxwell, 1 run, full delivery, backs away and thwacks the drive off the toe-end of the bat. The man at mid-off slides and tackles it. Only a single
D Kulkarni to Maxwell, no run, slower short ball does the batsman in again. The batsman was through the pull too early and misses it. The ball was well over the sticks
D Kulkarni to Pant, 1 run, slower short delivery and the batsman trying to pull it away, gets it off the toe-end of the blade. The keeper puts in the dive and half-stops it
D Kulkarni to Pant, no run, length ball and has been spanked on the up. The man at mid-off picks the ball up. That was a full blooded drive but the batsman fails to get it in the gap
D Kulkarni to Pant, wide, too full, too wide, wided. Bad ball
D Kulkarni to Maxwell, 1 run, follows the batsman with a very full ball and the batsman backing away gets hit on the pad. They again race through for a single. There was an inside edge

D Kulkarni to Pant, leg byes, 1 run, looks to hoick the ball away into the on-side but is too early into it. The ball is slower in nature and bounces up a tad bit extra to him on the torso. They get a single
Gowtham to Pant, 1 run, no freedom to get under it and has been jammed away to the man at long-on. Good over for RR!

Gowtham to Pant, FOUR, kneels down and punishes it away. Gets it past the man at short fine leg and the ball races away between square leg and short fine leg for a four. Very well done. He preempted the angle and got it away
Gowtham to Pant, no run, inside edge on the run down the track. Pant wanted  a single and Maxwell sends him back. This time well in time
Gowtham to Pant, FOUR, spanked! Murdered! Four.. That was a little shimmy and a powerful blade smacking it down the ground
Gowtham to Maxwell, 1 run, too full, yorked away on the on-side for a single

Gowtham to Maxwell, out Munro Run Out!! The shortish ball skidded on and the batsman trying to pull, gets hit on the pads for the ball to roll away into the on-side. Munro wanted a steal but was sent back. The keeper ran to his left, picked it up and threw it to the bowler, who whipped off the bails. Dreadful start for Delhi. Munro run out (Buttler/Gowtham) 0(0)
Shami to Gowtham, 2 runs, full one drifting into the pads, a whiplash away to backward square leg for a couple
Shami to Gowtham, wide, too short, but well-directed. Far too high over the head though, and wide called

Shami to Buttler, out Bowled!! Off-cutter/yorker combo, not an easy one to get right, especially under duress, on middle, Buttler gets across to lap/ramp it away towards fine leg, misses it completely as the bails light up - and so do Shami's eyes. Brilliant delivery under pressure. Buttler b Shami 29(18) [4s-2 6s-2]
Shami to Buttler, no run, full toss, a low one, Buttler misses the glance and gets it off the pads towards Pant behind the stumps
Shami to Buttler, no run, fuller one outside leg, following the batsman trying to make room outside off, Buttler swipes and gets it off the pad towards the on-side

Shami to Buttler, SIX, fuller one on off, Buttler gets low, makes room and throws his hands at that to loft that over long-off for six. Massive hit. Great start to the over for Buttler. A bit of a slice, but with these kalyug bats, the meat is much bigger

Chris Morris to Buttler, leg byes, 1 run, full toss angling down leg, Buttler tries another savage swipe into the on-side, misses it completely and loses his shape, gets it off the pads into the off-side as they steal a leg-bye
Chris Morris to Buttler, FOUR, short-ish and wide, Buttler slashes and slashes hard, as that blazes away in front of third man for four. The spin on that shows you how hard he sliced that...
Chris Morris to Buttler, no run, fractionally short and off-pace, pulled off the under-edge towards the on-side

Chris Morris to Buttler, SIX, length delivery outside off, Buttler puts his body-weight behind it and lofts that into the night sky, Maxwell at long-on tries to take that. Jumps sideways -- in an awkward enough shape already -- and ends up dropping it into the boundary. Think that was a six even if he had taken it; Maxwell was air-borne and well beyond the ropes. Unfortunate, because that was a good effort, but that's another six
Chris Morris to Tripathi, 1 run, length delivery outside off, Tripathi reaches out for it, loses his shape, and gets an outside edge away to third man for a single

Chris Morris to Tripathi, SIX, length ball angling into middle, Tripathi lays into that slog-sweep on the up and sends that into the deep mid-wicket orbit for six! Boult takes a phenomenal catch there -- leaping and reverse-cupped -- but the momentum has him going over the ropes
Rahul Tewatia to Buttler, 2 runs, full one on middle and leg, the closest he has gotten to off-stump all over, Buttler whip-drives it down to long-on for a couple
Rahul Tewatia to Buttler, wide, seems to be in the zone but the wrong one, Tewatia. Fired down leg, wided
Rahul Tewatia to Tripathi, 1 run, another flat one, wrong trajectory, terrible line, and another hard sweep away to fine leg for a single
Rahul Tewatia to Tripathi, no run, loopy delivery on leg, Tripathi swipes-sweeps it towards short fine leg
Rahul Tewatia to Tripathi, 2 runs, flat one again and angling away towards leg, Tripathi just deflects it with a hybrid pull/tap-on-the-head for another quick couple
Rahul Tewatia to Tripathi, 2 runs, fired in flat and angling into the pads, Tripathi gets on his knees and slap-sweeps it to fine leg for a brace
Rahul Tewatia to Buttler, 1 run, comes down the track already, shortens the length on leg stump, Buttler adjusts his shot and taps it to mid-on for a single
Shami to Buttler, 1 run, almost another inch-perfect yorker, Buttler makes room and whip-drives it away to long-on for a single. Jeez the toes of these two bats have taken a severe beating
Shami to Tripathi, 1 run, perfect yorker outside off, jabbed away to cover for a scampered single. Not even the yorkers are run-free now
Shami to Buttler, 1 run, almost finds the yorker length, dugs out off the toe-end to mid-wicket for a single
Shami to Buttler, no run, full toss on the knees, a nice juicy one, but Buttler can't quite time that nudge into the on-side and gets a leading edge towards mid-off
Shami to Tripathi, 1 run, good length delivery fractionally wide outside off, steered away with an angled vertical bat in front of square for a single
Shami to Tripathi, no run, back of a length delivery on the pelvis, dropped off the back foot towards short mid-wicket. One hand taken off the bat to keep it down
Nadeem to Tripathi, 1 run, fired in flatter and shorter, Tripathi gets low in his stance and plays a watchful wristy carve towards sweeper cover for a single
Nadeem to Tripathi, no run, a little more flight just outside off, Tripathi reaches out and pushes it to cover

Nadeem to Rahane, out Caught by Chris Morris!! No no no! What are you doing Jinx? Not too short, no turn, but a little too quick and skiddy. Rahane is stuck between and pull and a flick with a bit of a swat and gets a leading edge towards Morris at point to hand him a mango dolly. Rahane c Chris Morris b Nadeem 45(40) [4s-5]
Nadeem to Rahane, 2 runs, a bit more flight and angled in towards leg and middle, Rahane had planned the reverse too long ago, gets it off the splice of the bat just over cover point for a brace
Nadeem to Buttler, 1 run, flat and quick on middle and leg, a hurried jab to long-on for a single
Nadeem to Rahane, 1 run, dragged short again, and flat, Rahane comes down the track and nudges it in front of square for a single. I think the bowler saw him coming and hence shortened the length
Shami to Rahane, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, a hint of seam movement in with the angle, and a soft nudge off the back foot towards long-on for a single
Shami to Rahane, no run, full-toss on off, Rahane tries to nudge it away towards mid-on, gets a thick leading edge towards cover. Looks like he's attempting the typical Indian sport of tip'n'run...
Shami to Rahane, no run, good length delivery fractionally wide outside off, Rahane gets low and tries to steer it away square of the wicket, misses it completely
Shami to Rahane, no run, yorker length delivery outside off, Rahane steers it with a horizontal bat towards point

Shami to Rahane, FOUR, short outside off, Rahane drags it towards the on-side with a clouted pull to deep mid-wicket for four. Boult made a lot of room, running across a few yards and diving in front, and nearly pulled off a screamer but the ball flicks his thumb and ricochets away into the fence
Shami to Rahane, FOUR, that flat-batted swipe coming down the track to a length ball. Made room, slapped it inside out to deep extra cover for four past a diving cover. He's absolutely leathered that
Rahul Tewatia to Buttler, no run, tossed up leg-break on off, a bit of a half-volley, Buttler makes room and tries to run his hands through that cover drive, can't pierce the in-field
Rahul Tewatia to Rahane, 1 run, fuller one on off, Rahane makes room and gets forward to smother the spin and push-drive it down to extra cover for a single
Rahul Tewatia to Buttler, 1 run, flat and skiddy outside off, Buttler chops it off the back foot towards cover for a quick single
Rahul Tewatia to Buttler, FOUR, master of manipulating the field. There's a leg slip now instead of silly point, and the tossed up one on off is reverse-lapped to third man for four
Rahul Tewatia to Buttler, 2 runs, tossed up outside off, Buttler premediates a lap-sweep by getting across outside off and just ramps it softly to fine leg for a brace
Rahul Tewatia to Rahane, 1 run, tossed up slightly and on the stumps, Rahane gets forward, shimmies down, and pushes it down to long-off for a single

Nadeem to Samson, out Bowled!! Oh no! Unfortunate! Tossed up temptingly on middle, angling in from round the wicket, Samson gets forward and tries to go through with the slog-sweep to negate the spin, ends up getting an inside edge onto his thigh, which then ricochets onto the off-stump. On another night, it might have missed the wickets, but the stars up above aren't aligned for him tonight. Samson b Nadeem 37(22) [4s-2 6s-2]
Nadeem to Rahane, 1 run, flat and outside off, errs in length slightly, Rahane crouches low and cuts that away to sweeper cover for a single
Nadeem to Samson, 1 run, flatter and a little short into the thighs, turned away off the back foot to deep square leg for a single
Nadeem to Rahane, 1 run, sees Rahane coming, drags the length back, Rahane comes down the track and checks a half-hearted drive to long-off for a single
Nadeem to Samson, 1 run, a bit more flight on an enticing length just outside off, Samson gets forward and push-drives to long-off for a single
Nadeem to Samson, 2 runs, drifting into leg and middle, nudged off the front foot towards wide mid-on, the bowler chases but the man in the deep comes in and picks up. They manage two though
Rahul Tewatia to Samson, 1 run, tossed up fuller around middle, wristed away towards the man at long-on
Rahul Tewatia to Rahane, 1 run, tossed up outside off, Rahane uses his feet and drives down the ground to long-off
Rahul Tewatia to Rahane, no run, very full and around middle, nudged towards short mid-wicket where the fielder puts in a good diving stop
Rahul Tewatia to Rahane, FOUR, rubbish ball and Rahane will feast on these all day. Gets a drag on around middle and leg, sits on the back foot and nails the pull through square leg. Found the gap

Rahul Tewatia to Rahane, no run, good shot but too straight and it crashes into the stumps at the other end. They aren't sending it upstairs because Tewatia admits that he hasn't touched it. Flighted ball, Rahane just used his feet to smack the drive straight back down the pitch
Rahul Tewatia to Samson, 1 run, tight single but they get it in the end with ease. Slower and outside off, Samson stays back and pats it into the gap at cover. 50-run stand is up!

Nadeem to Rahane, 2 runs, fine placement and they'll get two! Slightly short and Rahane stays back to flick it away through the leg-side. Bisected deep mid-wicket and long-on really well, the former (Boult) get across to stop it but couldn't prevent the second run. He slipped in gathering it as well
Nadeem to Samson, 1 run, flatter and fuller around middle, Samson gets across and drives easily down to long-on
Nadeem to Rahane, 1 run, tossed up outside off, Rahane reaches out to it and whips it away towards long-on
Nadeem to Samson, 1 run, very full and around middle and leg, worked away towards deep mid-wicket for a single

Nadeem to Samson, FOUR, deft touch! If the previous shot showcased his power, this is all about finesse. Slower and around off, not all that short but Samson waits for it on the back foot before essaying the late cut. Gets it very fine and just past the keeper as it races to the fence. He is in the zone, is Samson
Nadeem to Samson, SIX, half-tracker and goodbye! Cannot bowl such stuff on this pitch, easy for Samson who rocks back in a flash and deposits it into the stands at deep mid-wicket. Huge hit!

Rahul Tewatia to Samson, 1 run, drifting in around middle and leg, Tewatia has started with the basic plan of taking pace off the ball. Samson works it off the back foot towards deep mid-wicket to retain strike
Rahul Tewatia to Samson, no run, even slower this time and Samson wanted to nudge it away on the leg-side but there was hardly any pace to work with. The ball falls besides him on the pitch
Rahul Tewatia to Rahane, 1 run, slows it down and lands it on a good length, punched off the back foot down to long-on
Rahul Tewatia to Samson, 1 run, drifting into the pads, on the shorter side again and it allows Samson to work it around the corner off the back foot
Rahul Tewatia to Samson, no run, good stop at short mid-wicket, prevented the single. Slightly short around middle and leg, Samson stays back and clips it towards the leg-side
Rahul Tewatia to Rahane, 1 run, floated up around middle and leg, Rahane reaches out to it with a couple of steps down the track, wristed away to long-on
Shami to Rahane, 1 run, dug in short again, once more it isn't high enough and Rahane comfortably pulls it to deep square leg

Shami to Rahane, no run, stifled LBW shout but Rahane had got a faint inside edge on it. Was also a bit high perhaps. Full ball that was angling into middle and leg, Rahane played around the front pad and missed the flick
Shami to Rahane, no run, shortens the length a bit outside off, Rahane stays back and dabs it towards backward point
Shami to Samson, 1 run, full ball on middle and leg, Samson gets across and eases the drive down to long-on
Shami to Rahane, 1 run, short of a length ball well outside off, Rahane angles his bat to steer it down to third man

Shami to Rahane, FOUR, freebie to start from Shami and Rahane puts it away in style. Half-tracker and it's asking for trouble on this easy-paced surface. Rahane swivels on the back foot and controls the pull with elan through backward square leg
Chris Morris to Rahane, 1 run, more of the shorter length and it's around middle and leg, Rahane hops across on the back foot and whips it away through backward square leg
Chris Morris to Samson, 1 run, slanting in on middle and leg, a bit short in length and Samson nudges it towards the man at short fine leg who is on the edge of the circle. Easy single
Chris Morris to Rahane, 1 run, shortish length closer to off, Rahane dabs it down to third man and is happy to let Samson back on strike

Chris Morris to Samson, 1 run, tight single! I guess Samson was in probably even if the throw hit at the bowler's end. But Rahane needs to be careful here, seems to be in the mood to run his partners out. Fuller ball that was eased straight to the man at mid-off
Chris Morris to Rahane, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Rahane arches his back and guides it down to third man

Chris Morris to Samson, 3 runs, elegant stroke once again! Samson is such a delight when in full flow. Overpitched ball around middle and leg, he just gets across and clips it wide of mid-on. Nadeem chases it down with a desperate slide. Does well to save a run

Boult to Rahane, FOUR, just short of backward square leg! For a moment, the fielder in the ring thought he had a chance but it bounced in front of him and sneaked through. Once it got past him, the outfield did the rest. Short of a length ball that Rahane pulled without bothering to keep it down. Fortunate that it didn't go to hand
Boult to Samson, 1 run, on a length outside off, Samson leans into the drive and eases it towards sweeper cover

Boult to Samson, SIX, cracking shot! Samson isn't wasting any time to get going and is happy to target the red-hot Boult who is breathing fire. Short ball that's not high enough, sits up nicely for Samson who dismisses it over mid-wicket with a forehand smash sort of pull. Beautifully done

Boult to Samson, FOUR, sheer class! Samson had some runs in the last game and hence, is in a good space mentally. Gets a full ball that's not all that wide but Samson got a nice stride forward and eased the square drive through point. The timing was fab
Boult to Samson, no run, back of a length outside off, Samson stays back and dabs it towards the off-side

Boult to Stokes, out Caught by Pant!! What a ripper! The decision to persist with Boult has paid dividends for Gambhir. Good aggressive captaincy. But what a ball though! Phew! One of those jaffas that you get in Test cricket generally and Stokes must be wondering where it came from. Angled into him from a good length and shaped away with a spit of extra bounce. Unplayable by any means and it flies off the outside edge. Pant reacted sharply too and flung himself to his left to take a good diving catch. What a huge wicket this is! RR are jolted early. Stokes was looking to up the ante, has to depart. Stokes c Pant b Boult 16(12) [4s-1 6s-1]

Chris Morris to Rahane, no run, swing and a miss! Rahane has been unusually aggressive to start today and it doesn't seem to be suiting him. Premeditates the charge down the track and throws his bat at this fuller ball. It was a touch wide and as he had backed away a bit, couldn't reach it
Chris Morris to Stokes, 1 run, angling in around middle and off, Stokes gets across to play it but ekes out an outside edge towards point

Chris Morris to Stokes, SIX, kaboooooom! He's got this off the meat, that's for sure. Fractionally short from Morris and Stokes doesn't even bother to go on the back foot. Was on the initial forward trigger and picks up the pull with ease. Into the shorter boundary at deep square leg for a biggie
Chris Morris to Stokes, no run, very full and outside off, Stokes lowers his backlift and jams it towards mid-off

Chris Morris to Stokes, 2 runs, carved over backward point! Came off the slice as Stokes wasn't in control but he cleared the infield comfortably. Fullish ball angling across him, he just threw his hands at it with an open bat face

Chris Morris to Stokes, no run, thick inside edge! Saves Stokes as otherwise he was plumb in front LBW. Fuller ball around middle and off, swung in as Stokes looked to play across the line. Just escapes in the end
Boult to Rahane, no run, good bouncer! Hurried onto Rahane who was on the swivel to pull it away. Too quick for him though and ended up missing it
Boult to Rahane, no run, middle and leg line from a good length, Rahane is on the back foot and clips it towards short mid-wicket
Boult to Stokes, 1 run, slanting in on middle and leg, dabbed towards mid-wicket where the fielder makes a good stop. Cannot prevent the single though

Boult to Stokes, FOUR, whackkkkkkkkkk! Stokes has had enough of proding around. Charges down the track and makes room before blasting this wide of the man at mid-off. Races away to the fence in no time

Boult to Stokes, no run, beaten again! Stokes' feet is going nowhere and hence isn't able to deal with the movement that Boult is generating. Gets forward to this fuller ball that holds its line after pitching. Whizzes past the edge

Boult to Stokes, no run, cracker of a ball! Boult is definitely pumped up and the help off the pitch is aiding him. Angling in from a good length just outside off, straightens off the deck to beat the edge as Stokes hung his bat out to dry

Nadeem to Stokes, 1 run, tossed up around middle and off, Stokes worked it away to short fine leg, who attacks the ball and has Rahane diving to complete the single. What's with Rahane and runs of late eh?!
Nadeem to Rahane, 1 run, to mid-wicket,
Nadeem to Rahane, no run, fired in around middle and leg, stays back and taps it towards mid-wicket
Nadeem to Stokes, 1 run, floated up around middle and leg, nudged away towards deep mid-wicket for a single

Nadeem to D Arcy Short, out D Arcy Short Run Out!! 1 run completed. Mix up and D Arcy Short is run out yet again! Holy Molly, what's with the running between these two? Waste of a wicket really but the Daredevils won't mind it at all. It was a drifter into middle and leg, Short nudged it towards deep mid-wicket and took the first run with ease. Crazy mix up on the second run and he went for it eventually but Vijay Shankar was alert. The direct hit at the keeper's end caught the southpaw well short. D Arcy Short run out (Vijay Shankar) 6(3) [4s-1]
Nadeem to D Arcy Short, FOUR, poor ball to start! Drags it short and it's the slider as well, width on offer for Short who smacks the back foot punch through the covers. Easy pickings

Boult to D Arcy Short, 1 run, good ball! After getting the ball to swing into the right-hander, this time Boult gets it to move into the left-hander. Short is stuck on the crease and gets a faint inside edge onto the pads which saves him. Trickles towards square leg as they sneak a single. Top first over from Boult

Boult to Rahane, 3 runs, not exactly in control here is Rahane, tries to slog this away through mid-wicket but loses his shape in the process. It was another inswinger and the ball flies off the inner half of the blade through mid-wicket. Good chase by the fielder and a tag team effort saves a run
Boult to Rahane, no run, attacks the off pole with a good length ball, Rahane stands tall and blocks towards cover. This is a good start from Boult
Boult to Rahane, no run, Boult is getting some swing with this new ball. This nips in from a good length and Rahane isn't able to get the flick away. Drags a faint inside edge onto the pad
Boult to Rahane, 2 runs, a bit of shape again on the inswinger but the line is too straight, Rahane flicks it away through backward square leg. Fine leg gets around to tidy up. RR are away
Boult to Rahane, no run, starts with a full ball around off, just a hint of shape as Rahane checks his forward defence to cover-point

Cutting to Stanlake, FOUR, Billy Billy Billy... oh my days! He has lofted this slower ball over mid-wicket to seal it for SRH. What a shot to play. The fact that SRH couldn't have lost would have helped, but what a hero

Cutting to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, top-edged pull, loops up towards Bumrah at short fine leg, but falls short. SRH can't lose now. Cutting drops to his haunches as he watches Bumrah fail to get to the ball. Massive roar from the crowd

Cutting to Stanlake, 1 run, slower ball on leg, Stanlake does just about the best thing he could do. He nudges it softly in front of short mid-wicket and runs for his life. Gets a big cheer from the crowd

Cutting to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, overpitched ball outside off, drilled down towards long-off where Pollard swiftly moves to his right and is even more swift in getting rid of the throw. It now leaves the No. 11 exposed
Cutting to Deepak Hooda, no run, gets it spot on this time. A wide back of length delivery outside off, Hooda slashes at it but misses out
Cutting to Deepak Hooda, wide, now a wide. Cutting buckling under pressure. The idea is to bowl wide of off, but he's lost the angle from round the wicket and gone way too wide

Cutting to Deepak Hooda, SIX, he has clubbed this for six! What a start to the over. Low full toss wide of off from round the wicket, Hooda shuffles across a bit, bends his back knee and frees his arms. Muscles it over long-off

Mustafizur to Sandeep Sharma, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Sandeep does in fact look for the boundary. He walks across, bends his back knee and tries for the same scoop that Kedar Jadhav hit for six a few nights back against Mustafizur. But what Sandeep achieves is very different. He doesn't get it anywhere near the middle, and spoons it up to short fine leg. Mustafizur raises his arms as the MI fans go wild. Sandeep Sharma c Krunal Pandya b Mustafizur 0(2)

Mustafizur to Sandeep Sharma, no run, what an over from Mustafizur it has been. He employs the wide line again, cuts his fingers across the ball and beats Sandeep's dab. No what does he do? They surely can't take a single. So does he go for the boundary?

Mustafizur to S Kaul, out Caught&Bowled!! Taken one-handed. The Mumbai supporters in the crowd erupt. Kaul was probably surprised by the line from Mustafizur here - it was full at the stumps after the previous two which were wide of him. He chips the off-cutter straight back, where Mustafizur sticks a hand out and the ball sticks. This will be some comeback from MI if they pull it off. S Kaul c and b Mustafizur 0(4)
Mustafizur to S Kaul, no run, full off-cutter wide of off, Kaul swings his hands into a drive but it's out of his reach. Remember Vijay Shankar in the Nidahas final? This isn't an easy line

Mustafizur to S Kaul, no run, huge roar from the crowd anticipating a caught-behind, but Kaul has missed this by quite a bit. He's flat-footed on the crease as this off-cutter grips sharply and beats his dab
Mustafizur to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, length ball outside off, off-cutter, Hooda chops it through the covers - no timing
Bumrah to S Kaul, no run, full ball at the stumps, Kaul keeps it out

Bumrah to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Oh my, what do we have here! Bumrah has ripped the game open once more with two in two. Pacy full ball outside off, the punchy fellow that Rashid is, he goes for an ambitious cover drive but can only nick it to the keeper. Hat-trick ball coming up. Rashid Khan c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 0(1)

Bumrah to Y Pathan, out Caught by Pollard!! SRH are close, but this is still not over. Bumrah rushes Pathan with this short of length delivery which hurries onto his attempted pull shot. He was caught on the swivel as it spooned up off the splice, before nestling into the bucket hands of Pollard at mid-wicket. Y Pathan c Pollard b Bumrah 14(14) [4s-2]

Bumrah to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, speared in full on middle and leg, Hooda yanks his legs out of the way and drives through the covers. Hooda turns around looking for the second but is sent back by a baffled Pathan. They come together for a word after it
Bumrah to Y Pathan, 1 run, yorker length ball outside off, sliced down to third man
Bumrah to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, good length ball around off, Hooda hoicks it down to long-on

Cutting to Y Pathan, FOUR, this has been a really sensible partnership for the most part, and here comes the reward. Cutting sprays on the pads, allowing Pathan an easy release of pressure as he glances it away past short fine leg
Cutting to Y Pathan, no run, misjudges a good length delivery for a short one and misses out on his cut. Hard to play a horizontal shot against that length
Cutting to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, slower short of length delivery, a bit too slow for Hooda who's early into the swat-pull and under-edges it into the on-side
Cutting to Y Pathan, 1 run, back of a length from Cutting again, another dab to short third man
Cutting to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, slower cutter, dabbed to short third man

Cutting to Deepak Hooda, 2 runs, this is close, it's real close. Desperate dive from Hooda which could save him, but it's touch and go. Oh wow, the dive has saved him. He threw himself towards the crease from 10 yards out and just about slid his bat inside the crease by an inch or two, by the time Ishan Kishan took off the bails. Crazy running though, taking on Lewis's arm at deep mid-wicket. It was a strong flat throw too. Phew

Mustafizur to Y Pathan, no run, Pathan, on the other hand, is quite prepared to play from the crease. That's when Mustafizur's angle becomes tricky to negotiate, like is the case here. The off-cutter cuts away and beats Pathan's outside edge as he tries to dab it fine
Mustafizur to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, he's almost premeditating the line from Mustafizur and walking across even as the ball is bowled. Manages to dab this off-cutter to short third man for a single
Mustafizur to Y Pathan, 1 run, full ball slanted wide of off, slapped to sweeper cover
Mustafizur to Y Pathan, no run, back of a length delivery cutting away from off, stabbed to point
Mustafizur to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, covers the line this time as he walks across the stumps, nudges a single to mid-on
Mustafizur to Deepak Hooda, no run, back of length off-cutter angled wide of off, Hooda shuffles across to run it to third man but fails

Bumrah to Deepak Hooda, 3 runs, fuller than a good length just outside off, Hooda crashes it on the up - sending it rocketing to the right of Sangwan at sweeper cover. There's an understandable misfield, but he recovers to prevent it from rolling into the boundary

Bumrah to Y Pathan, 1 run, this is sensational from Cutting. He's saved it from going for six. Full ball around off, Pathan miscues off the inside half but such is the power that it still travels quite a way. Would have cleared the ropes too, if not for Cutting's brilliant leap at long-on. He actually took the catch, and then threw it back in after figuring out that he was landing behind the ropes
Bumrah to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, steers it down to third man
Bumrah to Y Pathan, 1 run, back of a length cutter outside off, dabbed to third man

Bumrah to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, the dive saves Hooda. But was Bumrah standing too far behind the stumps as well? Had to stretch out quite a bit to break the stumps. Back of length delivery, worked wide of short mid-wicket. There's hesitation between the two batsmen which sees Hooda try to run back for the second, but Pathan is less keen. The throw is nice and flat from Lewis, Hooda is in though
Bumrah to Deepak Hooda, no run, back of a length delivery slanted in on off, tucked to short mid-wicket by Hooda
Cutting to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, clipped away through mid-wicket
Cutting to Y Pathan, 1 run, back of length again, off-pace delivery, Pathan knocks it down to long-on
Cutting to Y Pathan, no run, slower ball on a back of length, Pathan defends down the pitch

Cutting to Y Pathan, FOUR, pivots on the back leg and whip-pulls this delivery to the left of fine leg. Ordinary short of length delivery from Cutting, sitting up comfortably around Pathan's chest to be dispatched
Cutting to Y Pathan, no run, back of a length delivery on off, blocked to mid-off
Cutting to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, back of length cutter from Cutting, Hooda dabs to third man

Markande to Shakib, out Bowled!! What a soft, soft dismissal. He had so much time on the back foot, how did he even edge it! Shortish googly from Markande, sits up outside off. Shakib is back in the crease to tamely pat it away through point, but all he does is chop it back onto the stumps. What a spell from Markande to give Mumbai hope from a pretty hopeless situation. He's done though, will the others rise? Shakib b Markande 12(12) [4s-1]
Markande to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, shimmies out and pushes to long-on
Markande to Shakib, 1 run, lovely bowling this, just not allowing them to get to the pitch. Flighted leg-break turning in from outside off, Shakib lunges out and flat-bats the drive to long-off

Markande to Shakib, no run, bowls the googly from round the wicket, Shakib was drawn into playing away from the body and he probably didn't pick it either. Squirts it off a thick edge to backward point
Markande to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, teasing flight on the leg-break, Hooda stretches out to meet it and then punches down to long-on
Markande to Deepak Hooda, no run, flicks the googly to short mid-wicket

Mustafizur to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, angles this off-cutter away on a back of length, faintest of edges from Hooda - almost a copy of the KW dismissal - but this one doesn't carry to the keeper. It falls just in front of him, and he fumbles it down towards third man
Mustafizur to Shakib, 1 run, pretty high full toss on middle, Shakib gets it towards the splice as he mistimes the flick through mid-wicket
Mustafizur to Shakib, 2 runs, back of a length off-cutter on middle, Shakib tucks it backward of square. He's placed it in the gap, allowing him the time to come back for two

Mustafizur to Shakib, FOUR, poor delivery from Mustafizur, can't afford to release the pressure this way. MI don't have much to play with. Short and wide, Shakib sizes it up early and slaps it through point
Mustafizur to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, shuffles across the stumps and works this full ball wide of mid-on
Mustafizur to Shakib, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off, Shakib back-cuts down to third man
Markande to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, charges out to the pitch of the ball and smokes it down the ground. What a way to start from Hooda. Wow
Markande to Shakib, 1 run, gets down on one knee and paddles it round the corner
Markande to Shakib, no run, slices the googly to backward point
Markande to Shakib, no run, turning in on off, cramps Shakib for room who cuts to backward point

Markande to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Rohit!! Almost a horrible bit of miscommunication between Markande and Rohit, but the Mumbai skipper just about takes it in the end. He can see the funny side now, won't have been so funny had it gone down. But what a horrible shot from Pandey. All SRH need to do here is knock Markande around, the rate is under control. But Pandey charges out for a big hit. He's done in by the flight, and skies it up off a leading edge. It was Markande's catch, but the youngster leaves it to the skipper without any indication. At the very last moment, Rohit sinks low and snaffles it off the turf. Phew. The 20-year old is inspiring the visitors and keeping them in it. Manish Pandey c Rohit b Markande 11(8) [4s-1]
Markande to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, nicely flighted leg-break from Markande, but Pandey gets to it with a good stride and drives to the left of long-off. Easy two
Krunal Pandya to Manish Pandey, 1 run, too full, Pandey reaches out and drives it to long-off
Krunal Pandya to Manish Pandey, no run, Pandey is cramped for room on this occasion. Bit of extra bounce as well. Does well in the end to keep it out
Krunal Pandya to Shakib, 1 run, turning away a tad, Shakib stays back to guide it towards backward point
Krunal Pandya to Manish Pandey, 1 run, firmly driven down to long-off
Krunal Pandya to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, jogs down and push-drives through the cover region
Krunal Pandya to Shakib, 1 run, cover-driven to sweeper cover
Markande to Manish Pandey, FOUR, shot! Too short, Pandey stays back and cuts it square of the wicket. Powerfully hit

Markande to Dhawan, out Caught by Bumrah!! In 35 balls that he has bowled in IPL, Mayank Markande has dismissed Dhoni and Dhawan. His CV will look good, for sure. So, Dhawan plays a high-risk shot and perishes. Was a quick and flattish leg-break, Dhawan goes down for the big slog sweep and top-edges straight to the man at long leg. Bumrah, the man in the deep, held his ground and took a calm catch. He was inches in front of the boundary rope. Went a couple of steps back, but looked back to find himself just in. Dhawan c Bumrah b Markande 45(28) [4s-8]
Markande to Manish Pandey, 1 run, Pandey leans forward, opens the bat-face and taps it to backward point for a single
Markande to Dhawan, 1 run, Markande shortens the length and that's been punched down to long-off
Markande to Dhawan, no run, pushed to covers
Markande to Dhawan, leg byes, 2 runs, leg-break, Dhawan misses the glance - beaten by extra bounce. The ball rolls to point and a needless shy at the bowler's end allows the duo to steal a second

Mustafizur to Williamson, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Another review from MI. This time against KW for caught behind. Fair delivery. There's a sound. We'll have Ultraedge in a short while to confirm. There's a little spike. Is that enough for the on-field call to be reversed? I wouldn't want to be the third umpire. Well, the call has been made. Overturned! Two overs, two reviews and two wickets. Mumbai are coming back. It was the cutter from Mustafizur and Williamson tried to run it down to third man. Gets a faint outside edge and Ishan Kishan pouched it with ease. The keeper and the bowler heard it. Williamson c Ishan Kishan b Mustafizur 6(4) [4s-1]
Mustafizur to Williamson, FOUR, fullish ball outside off, Williamson opens the bat-face at the very last moment and runs it down to third man. Got it very fine

Mustafizur to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan punches this back of a length delivery to cover off the back foot and sets off for a run - a non-existent one. The fielder is quick to let go of the ball, but doesn't account the direct hit. Had he found the target, Dhawan would have been a goner
Mustafizur to Dhawan, no run, short of length delivery that decks in a tad, Dhawan chops it to cover off the inside half

Mustafizur to Dhawan, FOUR, bangs one short does Mustafizur and there's no venom. Dhawan fetches it from well outside off and swivel-pulls it in front of square on the leg-side. He was in total control of the shot
Mustafizur to Williamson, 1 run, length ball, knocked towards mid-on
Markande to Williamson, 1 run, stump-to-stump line, nudged to backward square leg

Markande to Saha, out Lbw!! An appeal for lbw against Saha and umpire Nigel Llong shakes his head in denial. Well, MI have decided to review. Fair delivery. It was the quicker googly and Saha was way out of his crease and the impact is above the knee-roll. What does the ball-tracker say? Three reds and Saha has to go. Llong can't belive it and so can't I. Brilliant review from Mumbai. Saha misses the clip as he didn't the pick the wrong 'un and was also late to bring his bat down. HawkEye showed it be hitting the leg stump. There's the breakthrough and it's the 20-year-old who does the job for the visitors. Saha lbw b Markande 22(20) [4s-3]
Markande to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan comes down the track and is nowhere close to the pitch of the ball. Looks to work it through the on-side and gets it off the inside half towards backward square leg
Markande to Dhawan, no run, pushed towards mid-on

Markande to Dhawan, FOUR, crashed away! The googly from Markande, but it's short and wide outside off. Dhawan trks back and muscles the cut through extra cover. Lewis sprints across and dives to his left, in vain
Markande to Saha, 1 run, fetches the leg-break from outside off and sweeps it off the toe-end to backward square leg

Bumrah to Dhawan, FOUR, edged, missed the stumps and races away to the fence. 14 runs off the over. It was a skiddy length ball from round the wicket and Dhawan checked his cross-batted stroke. The ball trimmed the inside edge, missed the sticks and evaded the keeper to the fine leg fence
Bumrah to Dhawan, FOUR, 50 up for SRH! In a quick time. This was a pacy good length ball on middle and leg, Dhawan helps it along its way to fine leg. Runs coming thick and fast for the hosts
Bumrah to Dhawan, no run, Dhawan gives the charge. Dances down the track and looks to slash this short of length delivery through the off-side. Misses as the ball goes over the horizontal blade
Bumrah to Saha, 1 run, there's the width outside off and Saha is happy to guide it down to third man
Bumrah to Dhawan, 1 run, shifts to round the wicket and bowls the slower delivery. Tapped towards cover-point for an easy single
Bumrah to Dhawan, FOUR, Bumrah overpitches and Dhawan takes heavy toll of it. The back leg is bent, to the pitch and then creamed the cover drive. The placement was spot on too
Krunal Pandya to Dhawan, 1 run, shorter in length, punched down to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Saha, 1 run, straighter and fuller, Saha closes the bat-face to work it through the leg-side

Krunal Pandya to Saha, no run, was that a chance? Saha backed away and Pandya followed him. Got a bit of turn and Saha missed the cut. The keeper failed to catch it cleanly. Not sure if there was any bat involved

Krunal Pandya to Dhawan, 1 run, these left-handed batsmen just can't stay in the crease against the left-arm bowlers. Uses of the feet from Dhawan, is no where to pitch of the ball, drags it away to deep square leg
Krunal Pandya to Dhawan, no run, flat ball at 91.2kph, defended back to the bowler
Krunal Pandya to Saha, 1 run, darts a full ball from round the wicket, Saha walks forward and across to work it wide of mid-on
Cutting to Dhawan, 2 runs, another good looking flick from Dhawan. Full on the pads and the southpaw wristed it over the mid-wicket region. Lewis, in the deep, runs across and mops it up
Cutting to Saha, 1 run, Saha is back to running the ball down to third man. Used Cutting's pace and width to good effect

Cutting to Saha, FOUR, Cutting hurls one fuller and Saha decides to go after it. It was bowled wide of off, Saha comes down for a walk and muscles it over the bowler's head to collect his third boundary
Cutting to Dhawan, 1 run, 135.5kph back of a length delivery that doesn't rise much and Dhawan gets an under-edge on his pull. A single towards square leg
Cutting to Saha, 1 run, another off-paced delivery - at 113.6kph, Saha runs it down to third man
Cutting to Dhawan, 1 run, Cutting starts with a cutter, easily picked and tapped in front of backward point for a single
Sangwan to Saha, no run, stump-to-stump line, defended with soft hands

Sangwan to Saha, FOUR, the top-edge goes over the keeper's head and runs away for another boundary. No luck lor Sangwan, who banged one short and the bal got big on the batsman. Saha, despite not being in a good position, went with the pull shot. He will be happy with the result though
Sangwan to Saha, no run, in-angler, Saha inside-edges the push towards backward square leg

Sangwan to Saha, FOUR, dropped! Cutting is the culprit. An ugly hoick attempted from Saha and he mistimed it horribly. Cutting, at mid-on, went back and got to the ball, but couldn't hold onto it. What's worse? He allows it go for a boundary. It was a good length ball and Saha was slightly late into his shot
Sangwan to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, pacy length ball straying on the pads, Dhawan misses the flick. The ball dies down on the leg-side

Sangwan to Dhawan, FOUR, how good are those wrists? Must have learnt a bit from VVS. Wasn't a bad ball at all from Sangwan. On a good length and on middle and leg, Dhawan stayed in his crease and flicked it nonchalantly over and wide of mid-on
Bumrah to Dhawan, 1 run, tap-and-run single. Good length ball, Dhawan pushes it with soft hands to Bumrah's right. The mid-off fielder is on the edge

Bumrah to Dhawan, FOUR, second boundary for Dhawan. didn't try to over-hit, timed it well and the placement was good. The line is too straight from Bumrah - strayed on the pads and Dhawan used his wrists to glance it away in front of square on the leg-side. The man inside the 30-yard circle gives a chase, but can only escort the ball to the fence
Bumrah to Saha, 1 run, the bottom-hand comes off the handle after making contact with the ball. Length ball outside off, guided to third man
Bumrah to Dhawan, 1 run, there's the cutter at 113kph, picked by Dhawan. Shuffles and gently turns it into the on-side
Bumrah to Saha, 1 run, similar ball, the batsman hops and opens the face of his blade to steer it down to third man
Bumrah to Saha, no run, Bumrah starts with his trademark in-angler, on a length at 137.1kph, Saha rides the bounce and taps it towards point
Sangwan to Saha, 1 run, the line is too straight, Saha nudges it to backward square leg
Sangwan to Saha, no run, short of length, punched to cover off the back foot

Sangwan to Saha, no run, almost chopped on! This one decked in off the deck and Saha didn't account for the movement. Looked to push it away with hard hands and got an inside edge, that missed the stumps by a few inches
Sangwan to Dhawan, 1 run, Sangwan gets this short of a good length ball to shape away a tad and Dhawan spots it. Covers the line and taps it in front of point for a quick single

Sangwan to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan is underway! That's bread and butter for Gabbar. Too wide and he'll punish you all day. The length was on the shorter side as well - the recipe to get hit. Dhawan flashes his bat at it and slaps it through extra cover. Off the mark with a boundary
Sangwan to Saha, 1 run, Sangwan, from over the wicket, starts with a short of length delivery on the ribs, tucked towards square leg for a single

S Kaul to Markande, FOUR, cheeky! Markande decides to do something about the length Kaul was bowling, moving across the stumps and laps the length delivery over short fine leg, enough legs on that to reach the fence
S Kaul to Bumrah, 1 run, fuller and at the stumps, Bumrah crouches a bit and has big swing to the on-side, the inside edge is found and it bobbles away towards fine leg, just a single
S Kaul to Markande, 1 run, on a length and just outside off, Markande drops it into the off-side and settles with a single
S Kaul to Bumrah, 1 run, banged in short and now hurries Bumrah on the pull shot, off the splice of the bat and down to long-on
S Kaul to Markande, 1 run, on a length and outside off, Markande opens the bat face and directs it square on the off-side. Bumrah is sent back on the second, good call that by Markande
S Kaul to Bumrah, 1 run, Bumrah tees off to play the heave and the inside edge is squirted past the leg-stump, just a single
S Kaul to Bumrah, no ball, tight call on the front foot. But umpire Llong reckons there was nothing behind the line. Good length ball and Bumrah swings off his feet only to connect with thin air

Sandeep Sharma to Bumrah, 1 run, Bumrah wanted to see off the hat-trick ball and he does so. Another slower delivery and Bumrah works it in front of long-on, settles with a single. Sharma, who replaced Bhuvi today, ends with impressive figures of 4-0-25-2

Sandeep Sharma to Sangwan, out Lbw!! You can't get more plumb LBW decisions than that. Umpire Nandan messed it up. The knuckle ball once again from Sharma, Sangwan is through his slog early and is struck on the back leg, yes back leg. The ball was crashing into middle stump as per ball-tracking and for some reason Nandan didn't give that out. Sharma was quick to ask KW to take the review and the skipper obliged. Sangwan lbw b Sandeep Sharma 0(4)

Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! And another one gone. This knuckle ball epidemic is getting to every Indian pacer. Sharma the latest to show it off. Lands it on a length and Yadav thinking it was a normal length delivery, goes through the line with the loft, miscues it completely and Hooda runs forward from long-on to pouch that. Yadav was the key and even he is sent back. Suryakumar Yadav c Deepak Hooda b Sandeep Sharma 28(31) [4s-2 6s-1]

Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, once again the finger-roller from Sharma, the length was short and Yadav set himself to play the pull, this time he got an under edge to Saha. Two dots in a row
Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, leg-cutter on a shortish length, Yadav is through the pull early and the ball then sneaks under his bat

Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, full and outside off, Yadav drags the loft with a bent knee and hits it over Sharma, right in the gap to pocket a brace. He needs to keep most of the strike

Rashid Khan to Sangwan, no run, shortens the length and Sangwan is happy to see him off, stands tall and blocks it into the off-side. Magical spell from Rashid, just the 13 runs off his four overs and the wicket of Cutting
Rashid Khan to Sangwan, no run, wrong 'un and Sangwan has no idea, prods forward and is struck on the pad. Too high for an LBW appeal
Rashid Khan to Sangwan, no run, defended into the on-side and Sangwan is sent back on the single
Rashid Khan to Sangwan, wide, googly turning down leg and Sangwan can't meet with the glance, wide called

Rashid Khan to Cutting, out Bowled!! Just too good. It is hard enough for a proper batsman to pick Rashid, imagine how hard it would be for an Australian all-rounder. Cutting shimmies down the wicket without knowing what delivery it is, the wrong 'un spins in and sneaks past the swinging blade before crashing into the stumps. A well-deserved wicket for Rashid, who has bowled brilliantly without any luck. Cutting b Rashid Khan 9(9) [4s-1]
Rashid Khan to Cutting, FOUR, that is cheeky. Pushed it through did Rashid and Cutting used the pace on that, shuffled across with bent knee and scooped it fine, giving short fine leg no chance
Rashid Khan to Cutting, no run, leg-break and Cutting kneels down to play the sweep, missed and is hit high on the pad

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, lovely shot! Kaul might have been a bit too predictable with his length, Yadav moved to the leg-side and waited for the short delivery, swatted the pull backward of square leg and ended the over with a much needed boundary
S Kaul to Cutting, 1 run, full toss just below the waist, Cutting is taken aback slightly and turns it to the on-side, just a single
S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, dug in short and Yadav backs away to flat-bat it to long-on, Hooda collects it on the bounce

S Kaul to Cutting, 1 run, back of a length on off, Cutting knocks it in front of long-on and calls Yadav through, he wanted two but the latter was still recovering from the dive, denies by putting his hand up

S Kaul to Cutting, no run, direct hit and Yadav was struggling. The knuckle ball didn't arrive, Cutting chops the cut towards point and Yadav is sent back, he put in the dive but still might have been short
S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, good length ball on off, Yadav chips it to long-on

Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, quicker and no room for Yadav to work with, squirts an inside edge while playing the flick and takes a single backward of square leg. Shakib is done for the day and he ends with 4-0-34-1
Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, darted in and Yadav ekes out an inside edge on the flick, the ball rolls back after taking a deflection off the pad
Shakib to Cutting, 1 run, once more Cutting sweeps and this time from middle stump, straight to deep backward square
Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, dragged back length and Yadav whips it to long-on

Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, he remains the key for Mumbai. Flighted on off, Yadav backs away by moving to leg, give himself the opportunity to free his arms and lofted it inside out handsomely over extra cover. Cleared the rope comfortably
Shakib to Cutting, 1 run, floated up outside off, Cutting fetches the sweep and brooms it to backward square leg
Stanlake to Cutting, 1 run, fires in the wide yorker outside off, Cutting crouches a bit and steers it to third man

Stanlake to Pollard, out Caught by Dhawan!! What was that? Pollard puts his hand up in an apologetic manner towards Yadav, I guess. Back of a length delivery, clocked at 143kph, Pollard stays back in the crease and is through the shot even before the ball arrived, the ball takes the cue-end and skies to sweeper cover. Dhawan completes the catch and does his thigh slap. Pollard was so much early that his bottom hand came off the bat handle as he made contact with the ball. Timely wicket for Hyderabad and not for Mumbai as Pollard was looking in ominous form. Pollard c Dhawan b Stanlake 28(23) [4s-3 6s-2]
