Stanlake to Pollard, no run, similar kind of line and length to the previous delivery, might have been touch closer, Pollard misses the glide to third and is beaten on the outside edge

Stanlake to Pollard, FOUR, for the second time Pollard uses the pace of Stanlake to pocket a boundary. Fraction short and outside off, Pollard waits in the crease and steers it behind point, Kaul at third man should have done a better job of stopping that. He got there and allowed it to escape past him
Stanlake to Pollard, no run, banged in short and keeps it outside off, Pollard aborts from the pull shot and lets it go

Stanlake to Pollard, SIX, wow! That was just an extension of the arms and the ball flies over the fence. For a change Stanlake goes full, right in Pollard's arc, he stays rooted to the crease and presents the full bat face to loft it straight back over the bowler. Held his pose for the shutterbugs
Shakib to Pollard, 1 run, flatter in trajectory and on the pads, worked away to deep mid-wicket
Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, quicker and outside off, Yadav chips the drive sans footwork to sweeper cover
Shakib to Pollard, 1 run, steps out and Shakib keeps it close to his body, nudged into the on-side, for a single

Shakib to Pollard, SIX, into the second tier. Mumbai need to step on the pedal. Bit of air as Shakib tossed it wide of off, Pollard charged down and had the room to free his arms, smashed it over extra cover for a biggie
Shakib to Pollard, no run, darted in around off, Pollard punches it back to Shakib
Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, arm-ball that slides in and Yadav wrists a single to long-on

Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run, oh! That was a beauty. How did that miss the stumps? Rashid has his hands on his head. Gets the googly to turn in from outside off, Pollard had a big lunge forward to defend and is still beaten on the inside edge. The ball missed the off-pole by a whisker
Rashid Khan to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, another googly and Yadav sweeps to short fine leg, fumble from Stanlake allows the strike to be rotated
Rashid Khan to Pollard, 1 run, drifts on the pads and Pollard picks it away to deep square leg
Rashid Khan to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, opens the bat face and directs it to the vacant point region, quick single taken
Rashid Khan to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, flatter and around off, Yadav punches it to cover

Rashid Khan to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, KW and Rashid have a word and decide against the review. The fast wrong 'un and Yadav had no clue about it, caught in the crease while trying to play the late cut, struck on the pad and the ball lobs to KW at slip. The ball was turning too much and Rashid knew it, that's why they don't go for the review

S Kaul to Pollard, FOUR, needless. Kaul brought third man up and Pollard sends the ball there. Should have followed the mantra off the first five deliveries. On a length outside off, Pollard dabbed it late and beat short third man with ease
S Kaul to Pollard, no run, short of length on off, Pollard is back and across to defend to mid-off
S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, once more no room on offer from Kaul, keeps it around off and middle, Yadav chips the flick to long-on

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, sharp short delivery and that is another dot. Pressure building. Pollard has a word with Yadav. The ball kept rising and Yadav was trying to duck while attempting to play the hook, missed it completely

S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, Pollard denied Yadav the single. Bit casual from the big man. Yadav punches the short of length delivery back towards the non-striker, Pollard is late in taking his bat out of the way, deflects it to mid-wicket
S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, back of a length on off, Yadav closes the bat face on the punch and the ball rolls to mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run, googly that is pushed through, Pollard is late in bringing his bat down and is rapped on the pads. Turning down leg and impact was also questionable, hence no appeal

Rashid Khan to Pollard, FOUR, that is Pollard's riposte. The wrong 'un on a fullish and Pollard used his reach to good effect, pressed forward and struck it straight back over the bowler, couple of bounces and into the fence
Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run, touch too full and Pollard push-drives it back to Rashid, who is quick to bend down and stop. The duo exchange some words as Rashid flings the ball towards Saha
Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run, shortens the length and Pollard hangs back to knock it to cover
Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run, tossed up and Pollard once again greets it with a solid forward block
Rashid Khan to Pollard, no run, leg-break around off, Pollard leans forward and defends to backward point
Stanlake to Pollard, 1 run, very full and just outside off, Pollard takes a step down the track and flicks it past square leg for a single

Stanlake to Pollard, no run, this is good bowling from Stanlake, sensed that Pollard was getting itchy, goes wider and shorter of off, Pollard was a couple of steps down the track as he pushed and missed
Stanlake to Pollard, no run, nicely bowled by Stanlake, shortens his length and gets it to hold its line outside off, Pollard has a nervy poke at that and is beaten
Stanlake to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, back of a length and well outside off, steered down towards third man for a single

Stanlake to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, cracking shot, too short and well outside off, Suryakumar swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it in front of square, beats mid-wicket and rolls away to the fence
Stanlake to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, on a good length and around off, Suryakumar gets an inside edge on the drive towards short mid-on
Shakib to Pollard, no run, tossed up on the leg-stump line, Pollard nudges it towards mid-wicket and wants a single, sent back in time by his partner

Shakib to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Williamson!! Shakib has his man and MI find themselves in further trouble. This was tossed up and held its line just outside off, Krunal was looking to play with the turn, closed the bat-face early and pops a leading edge, straight to KW at cover. It's a dolly and the SRH captain doesn't need a second invitation. Krunal Pandya c Williamson b Shakib 15(10) [4s-2]

Shakib to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, cheeky and four, tossed up well outside off, Krunal bends down low, reverses his stance, uses the pace on the ball and laps it very fine, beats short third man and it's back-to-back boundaries for Krunal

Shakib to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, beautifully played, too full and too wide of off, Krunal gets close to the ball, that allows him to play against the turn, beats extra-cover with the drive and rolls away to the fence
Shakib to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, good placement from Krunal, pushes a low full-toss past mid-wicket and scampers back for the second run
Shakib to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, tossed up on off, Krunal plays with the turn and nudges it past mid-wicket, runs hard and comes back for the second run
Shakib to Krunal Pandya, wide, Shakib drifts this one down the leg-side, called as a wide
Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, Sandeep slips in the yorker at the base of off, Suryakumar jams his bat down and digs it back at the bowler
Sandeep Sharma to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, clipped back at the bowler with a closed face. Sandeep can't stop it on his followthrough and concedes a single

Sandeep Sharma to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, on a good length and angling across the left-hander, Krunal plays the angle and then whips it past mid-wicket, a long chase for Kaul from long-on, keeps the batsmen down to a brace
Sandeep Sharma to Krunal Pandya, no run, on a good length and wide of off, Krunal leans forward and finds mid-off with the drive
Sandeep Sharma to Krunal Pandya, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, Krunal plays close to his body and pushes it towards cover
Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, Suryakumar was looking to drive and gets a thick edge, no one at cover-point and it's a single to deep cover
Shakib to Krunal Pandya, no run, Shakib tosses one on off, Krunal covers for the angle and pushes it back at the bowler
Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, tad short and on the stumps, Suryakumar pulls it without any timing towards deep mid-wicket
Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, slower and on off, driven back at the bowler

Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, Shakib drifts this arm-ball around middle, it went straight on, beats Suryakumar's drive and strikes him on the pad, half-an-appeal for LBW, but the ball was always slipping down leg
Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, slower and just outside off, defended back at the bowler
Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, Shakib drops one short and wide of off, cracked to the left of cover where KW fumbles, but the batsmen decide against a single

S Kaul to Lewis, out Bowled!! Kaul has two in the over and he's chuffed to bits. He's running all around the ground in jubilation, three wickets in the powerplay for SRH and all those dropped chances will be forgotten. This was the slower knuckle ball, pitched on middle and shaped across the left-hander, Lewis didn't spot it, went for the big heave over mid-wicket, he missed and heard the sound of clatter. Lewis b S Kaul 29(17) [4s-3 6s-2]

S Kaul to Lewis, 2 runs, excellent effort from KW, but he was never going to catch this one. On a good length and just outside off, Lewis makes further rioom by backing away, slices it high and over mid-off. KW ran back, kept his eyes on the ball, but it was always landing in front of him, does well to slide and keeps the batsmen down to a brace
S Kaul to Lewis, FOUR, smashed, half-volley outside off, Lewis gets forward and drills it past the non-striker, the fielder at mid-off was a mere spectator
S Kaul to Lewis, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, Lewis was pushing forward and gets an inside edge towards square leg

S Kaul to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Y Pathan!! Oh dear! This is terrible cricket from Kishan, another blind swing and this time, he isn't reprieved. Yusuf was the fielder in the deep and he takes a good low catch. Coming to the ball, on a good length and angling across the left-hander, Kishan was eyeing the mid-wicket boundary as he hacked across the line, gets a thick edge that flew towards third man. Yusuf was perhaps unsighted by the floodlights, but does well to bend forward and takes it inches off the turf. Ishan Kishan c Y Pathan b S Kaul 9(9) [4s-2]
S Kaul to Ishan Kishan, no run, short of a length and on off, Kishan prods across and defends it towards the on-side
Rashid Khan to Lewis, no run, another wrong 'un outside off, Lewis spots it early, goes back and defends it

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, chance and dropped, Kishan was looking clueless against Rashid, but the bowler has been let-down by his fielder. He didn't spot the wrong 'un as he gave the charge, doesn't get anywhere close to the ball, gets a thick top-edge over cover, Sandeep back pedalled, looked certain to take the catch and then makes a mess of it

Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, leg byes, FOUR, appeal for LBW, but I reckon it might have pitched outside leg. Kishan was setting himself up for a reverse sweep, lost his poise in doing so, ended up with a reverse hack, the ball clipped the pads and beat the slip fielder to the fence
Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, no run, pushed through quicker and on Kishan's pads, he was looking to whip and gets an inside edge onto the pads
Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, no run, the quicker wrong 'un from Rashid, Kishan stays tall and punches it towards cover
Rashid Khan to Ishan Kishan, no run, flighted on off, Kishan gets forward and finds mid-off with the drive
Stanlake to Lewis, no run, short of a good length and tucking Lewis for room, defended towards the off-side

Stanlake to Lewis, SIX, magnificent shot, pacy length ball on the stumps, Lewis makes room by backing away, swings hard and sends it sailing over extra-cover for a maximum, flat and hard - that's what made MI shell big bucks to buy him in the auctions
Stanlake to Lewis, wide, the bouncer from Stanlake, but it's short and well down the leg-side, called as a wide

Stanlake to Lewis, FOUR, that's his answer to Stanlake, short of a length and angling across the left-hander, Lewis was backing away, has to reach out and carves it over cover, a few bounces and into the fence

Stanlake to Lewis, no run, Lewis cops a painful blow on his gloves, banged in short and at the batsman, Lewis was swivelling across on the pull, at the last moment he decided against it and tried to fend it away. Stanlake's pace is too quick and the ball thuds into his fingers. He's in some pain, but looks like he's not bothered about it - no need for the physio as he gets ready for the next ball
Stanlake to Lewis, no run, the bouncer from Stanlake, Lewis ducks under it and lets it go
Stanlake to Lewis, FOUR, short of a good length and well outside off, Lewis stands tall and punches with a straight bat, finds the gap past cover-point and the ball rolls away to the fence

Sandeep Sharma to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, edged and four, more runs for Kishan, more frustration for Sandeep. This the slower ball on off, Kishan was perhaps looking to play with an open face, he didn't look to get it that fine though, past the keeper and third man was inside the ring

Sandeep Sharma to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, streaky and four, Kishan gets lucky and gets a boundary as well, comes down the track, doesn't get anywhere close to the ball, swings through the line, the big inside edge races away past the leg-stump and into the fence
Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, Lewis stays back and punches it towards mid-off for a single
Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, no run, tad fuller and just outside off, Lewis stands tall and punches it towards short cover
Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, 2 runs, on a good length and just outside off, Lewis leans forward and places it into the gap wide of cover, beats the diving fielder and Lewis comes back for the second run

Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, SIX, Lewis gets going in some style, his first runs of IPL and it's a huge six, length ball on his pads, he swivelled across and helped it on its way, deep into the second tier at long leg

Stanlake to Rohit, out Caught by Shakib!! Smart catch from Shakib and Hooda can breathe easy. On a good length and angling into Rohit's pads, he was looking to tuck it towards the on-side, perhaps played a tad too early, the ball looped in the air and was dropping in front of short square leg. Shakib was alert though, dives forward, got both hands underneath and scooped the catch. Rohit falls cheaply once again and MI have lost an early wicket. Rohit c Shakib b Stanlake 11(10) [4s-1 6s-1]

Stanlake to Rohit, FOUR, lovely from Rohit, tad fuller and wider of off, Rohit leans forward, drives it on the up and finds the gap past cover-point, the timing is sweet and the ball rolls away to the fence
Stanlake to Rohit, no run, back of a length and just outside off, Rohit hops across and defends it towards the off-side
Stanlake to Rohit, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, defended towards the off-side

Stanlake to Rohit, SIX, lovely shot, Rohit was in complete control over this pull, banged in short and well outside off, Rohit swivelled across and pulled it high and over square leg, went a long way over the ropes
Stanlake to Rohit, no run, back of a length and just outside off, defended towards the off-side

Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, no run, run-out chance, would have been close for Lewis had Sandeep thrown the stumps down, he missed and the batsman escaped. Lewis was looking for a single after nudging it towards the on-side, sent back as the bowler hurried across to his left, turned around and had a shy at the striker's end
Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, no run, on a good length and on the stumps, defended towards the on-side

Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, 1 run, chance and Hooda has dropped it. That's a massive let-off for Rohit, no calling at all, Hooda ran back from mid-wicket, it was perhaps Rashid's catch as he came in from deep mid-wicket. Short of a length and on the stumps, Rohit was in no control over the pull, got a fat top-edge that went high and over mid-wicket. Hooda back-pedalled, wasn't in control as he went for the catch, the ball hit his palms and burst out.
Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, no run, Sandeep shortens his length outside off, Rohit gets across and defends it towards the off-side
Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, no run, tad fuller and a hint of shape back into the right-hander, defended towards the off-side

Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, no run, that's a beauty, Rohit was clueless as he poked forward, didn't miss the edge by much, didn't miss the off-stump by much either. On a good length and the ball swung in before straightening past Rohit's dangling blade, very lucky not to have edged it
Mohit Sharma to Washington Sundar, FOUR, RCB get going at home this year. A little room down leg and an inside-out lift over cover. That'll do
Mohit Sharma to Washington Sundar, no run, so not the full ball that we thought. Slow, yes, and angled across on a back of a length. Washington Sundar wafts and misses

Mohit Sharma to Washington Sundar, FOUR, scores level. Banged in short, and Washington Sundar is quick to leap into an upper-cut. Got it much finer than he intended but that'll do. Through third man. That will surely do
Andrew Tye to Woakes, no run, beaten for pace there. Preempting a slow ball from Tye perhaps, Woakes goes for the cheap single to third man and doesn't connect
Andrew Tye to Washington Sundar, 1 run, angled across the left-hander there, and pushed through cover for a single

Andrew Tye to Mandeep, out Mandeep Run Out!! 1 run completed. They take on Dagar again at deep mid-wicket and he's not going to miss out this time. Worked to him with a flat-batted swat, he hedgehops the throw to the keeper and beats Mandeep's dive back in. And just like that, RCB lose two in the over. Mandeep run out (Mayank Dagar/Rahul) 22(19) [4s-1]

Andrew Tye to Mandeep, 2 runs, a little taken aback by this knee-high full toss, Mandeep jerks the ball away to deep mid-wicket. And they've come back for the second. Dagar did well there actually, getting rid of the ball in one motion, but Woakes was brilliant with the early call and back-up
Andrew Tye to Woakes, 1 run, angled into the pad, chipped through the vacant square leg region

Andrew Tye to de Villiers, out Caught by Nair!! Chinnaswamy was just growing in decibels when de Villiers finds deep point. Short and wide, cut away intending a six, and he's not gotten enough on that. You've to say that de Villiers has done the job for RCB. And if not, something really has to go south from here. de Villiers c Nair b Andrew Tye 57(40) [4s-2 6s-4]
Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, 1 run, now gets the yorker right. Drifting into the base of middle, de Villiers jams it out to deep square leg. He's no longer seeing it as a cricket ball. 10 runs needed
Mohit Sharma to Mandeep, 1 run, not quite the length to be sitting and sweeping. A touch fuller to be doing that, and Mandeep drags it to deep square
Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, 1 run, shuffles across a touch across his stumps, de Villiers was looking for a leg-side single but gets his bat face straighter and pushes it to long-off
Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, 2 runs, sits low on his knees and half-pull half-sweeps it round the corner

Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, bowled at 109ks and de Villiers's smashed him like a spinner. A giant front foot stride and then the club of a bat-swing over long-on. Add to that de Villiers's arched back generating all the power, besides the elegance that has us drooling. That is fifty for the genius as well. Happy homecoming!
Mohit Sharma to Mandeep, 1 run, a very full ball at the base of off-stump, squeezed out through point

Mujeeb to de Villiers, SIX, now this one's been overcompensated and bowled a little short. de Villiers goes for it. On the back foot and the bat swing takes over. Sails over wide long-on. "That's the match," chirps Harsha Bhogle on air
Mujeeb to de Villiers, SIX, too full. Whatever the variation was, that was overpitched. Flown over long-off. That's de Villiers for you

Mujeeb to Mandeep, 1 run, fires the carrom ball flat, stops on Mandeep who works it to mid-on. Mujeeb was in de Villiers's way as he set for the run, with the bowler trying to field the ball, but they go for the sharp single
Mujeeb to Mandeep, FOUR, lovely from Mandeep. A googly that's a little short, and Mandeep's quick to go back and smash it over mid-wicket. Split the two fielders perfectly in the deep
Mujeeb to de Villiers, 1 run, a leg break slapped uppishly through cover
Mujeeb to Mandeep, 1 run, skids on outside off, Mandeep bunts it to mid-off and goes for a sharp single. de Villiers is in, dragging his bat back in

Andrew Tye to de Villiers, 2 runs, off the toe-end ... and safe! Banged in on a short of length, de Villiers is in no position to swish his bat at that. Wafts with footwork in a pudding, and with the ball darting away, the cue end of the bat is in business. What de Villiers does well is give  the shot a real thrust, meaning it clears the off-side infield
Andrew Tye to Mandeep, 1 run, varying his pace nicely. Back to quickish delivery, full too, and all Mandeep can do it drill it to long-on
Andrew Tye to de Villiers, leg byes, 1 run, that's off the pad. Sits low to scoop it over leg-side but he's doing that to a fuller delivery. Misses it

Andrew Tye to de Villiers, no run, away-drifting full toss and de Villiers was totally short on timing there. Waits and waits, and then reaches out with the bat. And by then, the timing goes way in a poof. Drags it back to the bowler
Andrew Tye to Mandeep, 1 run, slower back of a length delivery and Mandeep has it sorted. Swats it round the corner
Andrew Tye to de Villiers, 1 run, he's backing away but gets a 140ks full ball on off-stump. Quick wrists and hands needed. de Villiers has that. Slaps it through point
Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, 1 run, 138ks low full toss heaved to long-on
Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, FOUR, de Villiers wants this over early. That patent move where he gets his front leg across and swat-sweeps it through mid-wicket. That's power

Mohit Sharma to Mandeep, 1 run, there's a man at deep square leg. This one's the famous back-of-the-hand ball that he famously bowled in 2015 World Cup. Read by Mandeep though, who swats it round the corner
Mohit Sharma to Mandeep, no run, dragged on, nearly. Cramped for room outside off as he looked for a tempting single past short third man. Safe, all safe
Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, 1 run, dipping 135ks ball this time that forces de Villiers into a little crouch. Worked to long-on in the end

Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, 2 runs, sliding stop by Mayank Agarwal at long-off and then tag-team throw back to the center. de Villiers shuffles across early here. Gets a slow low full toss that he drills down the ground
Andrew Tye to Mandeep, 2 runs, they've smuggled a couple of runs here. Softed through vacant mid-wicket, Andrew Tye was at it. Rushing across but that was hit for a safe second run. Easy in the end
Andrew Tye to de Villiers, 1 run, shouts of catch it but there's no deepish mid-on in place. A bit of a miscue that. de Villiers tries to heave an off-pace that's too full
Andrew Tye to de Villiers, no run, de Villiers was on the back foot, having read the line, but Andrew Tye had the pace off that. Off the bottom-end into the off-side
Andrew Tye to Mandeep, 1 run, more like a leg break, this ball. Hits the pitch and spins away. Mandeep covers that and pushes a single through extra cover
Andrew Tye to de Villiers, 1 run, AB is looking to just rotate strike now. Gets a slower delivery that's wide and full, and he just eases that front-footed to long-off
Andrew Tye to Mandeep, 1 run, strewn full and worked off the front foot to wide long-on
Andrew Tye to Mandeep, wide, slow ball -- yeah, starts with it -- but it's been splayed down leg. Called.

Axar to de Villiers, no run, has to bowl it quick to de Villiers. Such fast hands. Cramped for room, and by the quick pace, but he's played that alright. Didn't have time for the placement though. Finds the fielder square on the off-side. 63 from 42 needed
Axar to Mandeep, 1 run, loops it like Powar. Wide line too, so Mandeep's reaching out on his front foot to work that through cover-point
Axar to de Villiers, 1 run, that's an audiogasm of a single. Off the front foot and that's been pushed away to long-off with a crunchhhhhhhh
Axar to Mandeep, 1 run, darts in the arm-ball that's pushed past mid-wicket
Axar to de Villiers, 1 run, spins a little, de Villiers protracts his arms and wrists that through covers
Axar to Mandeep, 1 run, slower ball on off-stump, manoeuvred off the back foot to deep mid-wicket. There's a slip in place
Ashwin to de Villiers, no run, another leg break that. Flatter and quicker and fuller on leg-stump, de Villiers fails to beat the short fine leg fielder
Ashwin to Mandeep, 1 run, flatter leg break that drifts across and straightends; run down by Mandeep round the corner
Ashwin to Mandeep, no run, the loopy full leg break but it doesn't get him the wicket. No hat-trick. Just pushed back by Mandeep

Ashwin to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Nair!! And just like that, Ashwin is on a hat-trick. First wicket with an off break, the second with a leg break. More like the top-spinner actually, for it didn't spin. Just skidded on with extra bounce, and Sarfaraz Khan lamely steers it to the slip in place. Sarfaraz Khan c Nair b Ashwin 0(1)

Ashwin to de Kock, out Bowled!! Ashwin makes a bunny out of de Kock and his footwork there. Sees him making a bit of room down leg and rips the ball a little extra. Proper off break that. Rushed into getting behind the line, front-footed de Kock tries to reach across but the ball, as fast as it was, is through the bat-pad gap. de Kock b Ashwin 45(34) [4s-7 6s-1]
Ashwin to de Kock, no run, quicker skidder that rips in with the round-the-wicket angle, and raps the pad down leg
Axar to de Villiers, no run, bunted off the front foot to the cover fielder

Axar to de Kock, 1 run, falls between three coalescing fielders: bowler Axar, cover and long-off who's running in. Cleverly bowled actually by Axar. Drifts it wider outside off, de Kock was looking for the leg-side slog and totally miscued it up in the air. And gets lucky. Of course
Axar to de Kock, FOUR, through short third man. Early to load up on the reverse-sweep and swabs that through the fielder's dive
Axar to de Kock, 2 runs, now the conventional sweep to fine leg
Axar to de Kock, no run, de Kock shaping for the reverse sweep and is nearly undone by Axar. Fired down leg, de Kock softed the shot behind point
Axar to de Villiers, 1 run, arm-ball from round the wicket, de Villiers punches it back-footed to long-off
Ashwin to de Kock, no run, quicker delivery spinning into de Kock. Blocked to short fine, intends the run but has to get back to the crease

Ashwin to de Kock, FOUR, let's say Ashwin is trying things. Lower round-armish ball from wide of the crease, and he's been nicely swept through backward square leg. Early load-up from de Kock to play that
Ashwin to de Kock, no run, quicker and wristed into de Kock's pad. Deflected round the corner
Ashwin to de Kock, SIX, wow. The red flags are out. Runs down the track and martyrs it over Ashwin's head. Sails over long-off
Ashwin to de Villiers, 1 run, now he bowls the leg break but drifts it down leg. Easy tickle to deep square leg
Ashwin to de Kock, 1 run, saw de Kock shimmy down and fired it down leg. Dragged to deep square leg for just a single. Trust me, de Kock wanted many more out of that ball from round the wicket
Axar to de Villiers, no run, good discipline from Axar, nice loop and keeps it just outside off, pushed gently towards cover
Axar to de Villiers, no run, flighted fuller outside off, AB gets across and pats it back towards the bowler
Axar to de Villiers, 2 runs, quicker and wider outside off, rocks back and powers it towards sweeper cover, in the gap and they get two
Axar to de Villiers, no run, flatter and outside off, stays back and cuts it towards the off-side

Axar to de Kock, leg byes, 1 run, close shave in the end! Hardly anything there on the margin of impact and de Kock escapes by a whisker. Spinning in from a slower trajectory and got pinged on the front pad as he missed the whip. The LBW appeal wasn't given and Ashwin went for the review. As it turned out, the decision was very, very marginal. Umpire's call on impact which is all that matters, even though it was hitting the stumps. The batsmen crossed during the appeal
Axar to de Kock, no run, soft leading edge, doesn't carry back to Axar. Fired in on leg stump, de Kock was early into the flick and got lucky

Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, FOUR, blasted away by AB! There was a man at sweeper cover and he didn't have to move much to stop this but ended up as a mere spectator. Powerful shot from the dynamic South African, shortish with a lot of width and he just slammed it on the up through the covers. Power and precision, 16 off Mohit's first over!
Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, no run, short of a length around middle and leg, de Villiers stays back and punches it to mid-wicket

Mohit Sharma to de Kock, 1 run, sensible batting, already a big over and de Kock is happy to rotate strike. Around off on a good length, he just nudges this towards cover-point and de Villiers gives him a brisk response on the single

Mohit Sharma to de Kock, FOUR, poor stuff from Mohit, there was some pressure being built but this over is easing that on RCB. Sprays this on the pads, de Kock gets across and whips it away towards short fine leg where Yuvraj also chips in with a poor effort. Late to react and lets it through
Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, 1 run, short of a length again and this is around middle, punched off the back foot down to long-on

Mohit Sharma to de Villiers, SIX, C-R-U-N-C-H! What a sound off the blade and it went flat into the stands at deep mid-wicket. 100th six of this IPL! Fractionally short from Mohit and AB rocks back in a jiffy to nail the pull, an absolutely meaty blow
Mujeeb to de Villiers, 1 run, once again backs away a bit and this is on the shorter side from Mujeeb, punched away down to long-off

Mujeeb to de Villiers, no run, what a ball! AB did well to get his bat down in time because otherwise, it was going to be timber! Spun into him from a flatter trajectory and he was backing away as well. Stabs it towards cover
Mujeeb to de Kock, 1 run, ahhh, wanted to repeat that boundary stroke but got this off the thick inside edge towards mid-wicket. de Kock used his feet but it was speard quite full by Mujeeb
Mujeeb to de Kock, no run, flatter and around middle, worked off the back foot towards the man at mid-wicket

Mujeeb to de Kock, FOUR, top quality shot! Never easy to hit an off-spinner over mid-wicket, especially when he has a mystery factor about him but this is terrific from de Kock. Charges down the track and although he had to fetch it from outside off, uses his reach to launch it over mid-wicket. Effortless!
Mujeeb to de Villiers, 1 run, flighted outside off, AB gets across and drives it down the ground to long-on
Ashwin to de Villiers, 1 run, slower and fuller around middle, de Villiers works it softly towards mid-on who is on the edge of the circle. Easy single
Ashwin to de Kock, 1 run, sliding into the pads from a fuller length, Kock nudges it towards the gap at mid-wicket
Ashwin to de Villiers, 1 run, slower and fuller around off, de Villiers leans forward and drives nicely down to long-on
Ashwin to de Kock, 1 run, very full and outside off, driven off the front foot down towards long-off
Ashwin to de Kock, FOUR, chipped away over the infield! de Kock did well not to overhit this, saw the flight and it was coming into him. Just used his feet and lobbed it over mid-wicket. Clean strike
Ashwin to de Kock, no run, flatter and around leg, de Kock misses the flick and is rapped on the pad
Mujeeb to de Villiers, no run, pushed through quicker and around middle, worked off the back foot towards short mid-wicket

Mujeeb to Kohli, out Bowled!! What a dream ball! Absolute ripper! Take a bow, young Mujeeb! He has gone through the gate with a traditional googly that's spun back in a mile. And it's the legendary Virat Kohli that he has dismissed. Hold your breath and take a moment out to applaud this young man. What an effort! Nothing really that Kohli did wrong here, got a stride forward for the drive and maybe, we can say he was a touch loose on the stroke but who could have accounted for this turn? Massive wicket! The game is wide open now I would say. We all know how big Kohli is in run chases. Kohli b Mujeeb 21(16) [4s-4]
Mujeeb to Kohli, no run, slower and a touch short around middle, Kohli wrists it a touch uppishly but well short of the man at mid-on
Mujeeb to Kohli, no run, flatter and outside off, stabbed off the back foot towards the man at point

Mujeeb to de Kock, 1 run, whoa, what was that! de Kock aimed the dilscoop kind of stroke but moved very early into the shot and Mujeeb slowed it down a lot. The result was a lob over Rahul but hardly any momentum on the stroke as short fine leg got across
Mujeeb to de Kock, no run, flatter and outside off, de Kock tries the sweep but ekes out a bottom edge to short fine leg
Andrew Tye to Kohli, no run, full and around middle, leans across and eases it towards mid-on

Andrew Tye to Kohli, FOUR, stroke from a genius! Mid-off was dropped back for the fuller ball and that's what Tye delivers, albeit with a shade of width. Kohli is too good a player as he drives this fluently through extra cover. Well wide of the man at long-off
Andrew Tye to de Kock, 1 run, slower and fuller, straight lines and de Kock eases it past Tye. Easy single by the time mid-off gets across
Andrew Tye to Kohli, 1 run, fractionally short around middle and leg, Kohli rises on his toes and flicks it in front of square
Andrew Tye to Kohli, no run, stump-to-stump line this time, on a good length and Kohli stays back to defend it onto the track

Andrew Tye to Kohli, FOUR, poor ball to start with from Tye and Kohli takes full toll. Angling into the body from a good length, wrong line with fine leg in the ring and Kohli just shuffles across to whip it away. Placed it well wide of the man in the ring
Mujeeb to de Kock, no run, the quicker one around middle and leg, de Kock stands tall and defends it with a straight bat
Mujeeb to Kohli, 1 run, on the shorter side and spinning into Kohli, worked away off the back foot to deep mid-wicket
Mujeeb to de Kock, leg byes, 1 run, fired down leg, de Kock went for the sweep but it brushes the pad and rolls towards the leg-side. The batsmen cross
Mujeeb to de Kock, no run, skids off the track and de Kock is cramped on the cut stroke, chopped to backward point
Mujeeb to de Kock, no run, slows it up considerably and lands it full outside off, de Kock checks his drive to cover
Mujeeb to Kohli, 1 run, floated up around off, a bit short and Kohli punches it down the ground to long-off
Ashwin to de Kock, no run, slower and fuller outside off, de Kock presses forward and nudges it towards cover

Ashwin to de Kock, FOUR, beautiful stroke! For a moment, it seemed like there was someone in the deep because the crowd wasn't buzzing as they normally do for a RCB boundary. Flighted off break, too full and de Kock eased the drive through the covers. Classy
Ashwin to de Kock, no run, tossed up nicely just outside off, defended with a good front foot stride
Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, the slider and a bit short, Kohli rocks back and powers it down the ground to long-on
Ashwin to Kohli, no run, flatter and around middle and leg, worked away off the back foot to short mid-wicket
Ashwin to Kohli, FOUR, deft from Kohli! Not all that short but he rocks back deep in the crease and dabs it ever so late. Very fine and beats Rahul en route to the fence for a boundary

Axar to de Kock, FOUR, creamed away! Top shot but again, the point fielder could have done better. A trifle short from Axar, de Kock sits back and slaps it away square through the off-side. Once it beat the infield, there was no stopping it
Axar to Kohli, 1 run, flatter and around leg, Kohli sits back and flicks it to deep mid-wicket. Wanted the second run but de Kock isn't interested
Axar to Kohli, no run, slower again and well wide outside off, was there to be hit but Kohli mistimes the back foot punch towards cover

Axar to Kohli, FOUR, fumble at point! Poor from Mujeeb and he lets it through for a boundary. Floated up outside off, just a gentle push from Kohli and he timed it well but this should have been stopped. Bonus runs and VK is off

Axar to Brendon McCullum, out Caught by Mujeeb!! Golden duck for McCullum! Huge blow and aren't the KXIP boys pumped! This is a massive strike and they know it. Full marks to Ashwin, bold move to start with Axar and it's paid off. Slowed up nicely and dragged outside off, McCullum was making room to go aerial on the off-side but only managed a slice. Straight to Mujeeb who gobbled it up at point. The hosts have been jolted early. Brendon McCullum c Mujeeb b Axar 0(1)
Axar to de Kock, 1 run, fired in on the pads, de Kock works it away towards deep mid-wicket to get RCB off the mark

Woakes to Mujeeb, out Caught by Sarfaraz Khan!! KXIP have been bowled out for 155. RCB will feel they have done a good job with the ball. This was short and at the stumps, Rahman was backing away on the pull, the ball was just too quick for him, gets a top-edge that lobs behind square on the off-side. de Kock went for the catch, but Sarfaraz called for it and holds on safely. Mujeeb c Sarfaraz Khan b Woakes 0(2)
Woakes to Mohit Sharma, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the stumps, Mohit gets a thick inside edge on the drive, just a single to deep mid-wicket
Woakes to Mohit Sharma, wide, Woakes floats this one miles outside off as Mohit backed away, called as a wide
Chahal to Mujeeb, no run, tossed up just outside off, Rahman prods half-forward and defends it towards the off-side

Chahal to Ashwin, out Stumped!! Has Ashwin been stumped? de Kock certainly seems confident. It's a fair delivery, the bat is in the air, Ashwin is way short as well and he's OUT. That's the end of a mighty fine cameo from the KXIP captain, will it be the clinching factor in this match? Smart bowling from Chahal, sensed that Ashwin was coming down the track, threw in a loopy leg-break, Ashwin came down the track, doesn't get anywhere near the ball, swung across the line in hope and missed, de Kock did the rest. Ashwin st de Kock b Chahal 33(21) [4s-3 6s-1]

Chahal to Ashwin, SIX, cracking shot - made it even more special as he was done in completely by the flight. Chahal saw his coming, slowed down the pace, dragged it wide of off, Ashwin reached out and slaps it back over the bowler's head, all the way for a maximum
Chahal to Ashwin, 2 runs, nicely tossed up by Chahal, Ashwin uses his feet to good effect and clips it wide of long-on for a brace
Chahal to Mohit Sharma, leg byes, 1 run, flighted on Mohit's pads, he was looking to flick and missed, rolled away off the pads towards square leg
Chahal to Ashwin, 1 run, tossed up well outside off, driven to the right of cover-point where Woakes makes a tumbling stop
Woakes to Ashwin, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, driven to the right of cover for a single

Woakes to Andrew Tye, out Caught by Kohli!! This was always coming! Tye was looking to slog everything out of the park, on a good length and just outside off, might have been the slower ball, Tye swung through the line, went off the toe-end of the bat, got plenty of height but not the distance. Kohli ran across to his left from long-on and held on to a simple catch. Andrew Tye c Kohli b Woakes 7(7)
Woakes to Andrew Tye, wide, the short bouncer from Woakes, but it's too short and too high, called as a wide for height
Woakes to Ashwin, 1 run, clever from Woakes, followed Ashwin as he shuffled right across his off-stump, Ashwin gets some bat on that and nudges it towards backward point for a run

Woakes to Ashwin, FOUR, lovely shot, this is turning out to be a fine cameo from Ashwin, comes down the track, uses his reach to good effect and clears cover with the lofted off-drive, couple of bounces and over the ropes
Woakes to Ashwin, no run, Woakes keeps it full and well outside off as Ashwin came down the track, he looks to slice it behind point and misses
Woakes to Andrew Tye, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, clubbed away towards long-on where Kohli tumbles and keeps them down to a single

U Yadav to Andrew Tye, 3 runs, length ball on the stumps, Tye shovels it over square leg, it looked like a boundary all along - until Mandeep put in the dive and saved two. His throw at the bowler's end isn't collected properly - think it's McCullum and the batsmen come back for the third
U Yadav to Andrew Tye, no run, excellent bouncer from Umesh, short and at Tye's body, he swivelled across on the pull and misses by a distance
U Yadav to Ashwin, 1 run, back of a length and on the stumps, Ashwin plays a punchy on-drive towards long-on
U Yadav to Ashwin, 2 runs, back of a length and just outside off, Ashwin is slightly hurried as he stabs it past cover, he's then hurried by his partner who wants the second run
U Yadav to Andrew Tye, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, Tye stays besides the line and pushes it square past cover-point for a single
U Yadav to Ashwin, 1 run, short of a length and on the stumps, Ashwin stands tall and works it towards long-on for a single
Washington Sundar to Ashwin, 1 run, Sundar tosses this one just outside off, Ashwin plays with an angled bat and drives it to deep point, just a single
Washington Sundar to Andrew Tye, 1 run, tossed up on the stumps, drilled down towards long-on for a single
Washington Sundar to Ashwin, 1 run, pushed through just outside off, Ashwin plays with an open face and dabs it straight to short third man, just a single
Washington Sundar to Ashwin, no run, the slider from Sundar, Ashwin gets his bat down in time and defends
Washington Sundar to Andrew Tye, 1 run, KXIP are going to slog themselves out of trouble, first delivery for Tye and he swings mightily, strikes it cleanly and wide of AB at long-on, just a single
Washington Sundar to Ashwin, 1 run, tossed up on off, Ashwin gets forward and eases it down towards long-on

Kulwant Khejroliya to Axar, out Lbw!! Axar has been given OUT LBW and he wants a review. This looked adjacent to the naked eye. It's a fair delivery and there's no bat as well. The impact seems to be in front of middle, the height isn't an issue. No edge, says Ultraedge. Hawk-Eye in, three reds and Axar is OUT. Simple call for umpire Ravi and Khejroliya has struck with his last ball. This was full and came back with the angle, Axar shuffled a long way across on the flick, once he missed, it was curtains, decided to take a chance as he reviewed, but to no avail. Axar lbw b Kulwant Khejroliya 2(3)
Kulwant Khejroliya to Ashwin, 1 run, on a good length and on the stumps, Ashwin prods across and eases it down towards long-on
Kulwant Khejroliya to Ashwin, FOUR, beautifully played, length delivery outside off, Ashwin leans forward, drives it on the up and beats the diving fielder at cover, no need to run for those
Kulwant Khejroliya to Axar, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, Axar plays with a closed face and finds long-on
Kulwant Khejroliya to Ashwin, 1 run, fraction fuller and on the stumps, Ashwin pushed forward, gets an inside edge behind square on the on-side for a single

Kulwant Khejroliya to Ashwin, FOUR, cracking shot, short and on the stumps, Ashwin swivels across, rolls his wrists and helps it on its way, the man in the deep is square and the ball beats him to the fence

Washington Sundar to Ashwin, 1 run, a rare misfield from AB, but he almost got a run-out in the bargain, Sundar tosses one around middle, nudged to the left of mid-wicket where AB fumbled. Ashwin then wanted a single and Axar responded, AB was quick to get across, but his throw is way off target, lets Axar get in comfortably
Washington Sundar to Ashwin, no run, tossed up on the leg-stump line, defended towards the on-side

Washington Sundar to Stoinis, out Stumped!! This is poor cricket from KXIP, they are losing wickets in clusters. Another unnecessary shot from Stoinis and he's stranded way outside the crease, gave away his intentions way too early, stepped down the track, allows Sundar to shorten his length. He still didn't accept defeat, swung recklessly across the line and missed, an easy stumping for de Kock. Stoinis st de Kock b Washington Sundar 11(9) [6s-1]

Washington Sundar to Stoinis, SIX, pushed through just outside off, Stoinis comes down the track, doesn't get close to the ball, went through with the swing and sends it sailing over long-off for a maximum
Washington Sundar to Axar, 1 run, flighted delivery outside off, driven down towards long-off for a single

Washington Sundar to Stoinis, leg byes, 1 run, loud shout for LBW and RCB want a review. Kohli looked very keen to challenge the call. It's a fair delivery from Sundar, it has pitched in line, but is it spinning down leg? There's no bat and Ultraedge confirms it. I don't think it straightened enough, Hawk-Eye in and it's missing the leg-stump. RCB have lost their review. This was tossed up on middle and was spinning into the right-hander, Stoinis swept and missed, was struck on the pads, in front of leg and the angle was traking it down the leg-stump. The ball rolls away towards the off-side, the fielder has a shy at the bowler's end and concedes an overthrow

Kulwant Khejroliya to Nair, out Bowled!! Khejroliya has his first IPL wicket and that's a big one as well. Nair was looking in good touch, decides to up the ante and instead has to walk back to the hut. Short of a length and on the stumps, wasn't short enough for the pull, Nair went through with the shot, connected with thin air and the ball clattered into the top of middle. RCB are beginning to boss this match now, can KXIP find an answer? Nair b Kulwant Khejroliya 29(26) [4s-3]

Kulwant Khejroliya to Stoinis, 1 run, just short of Mandeep at deep backward square leg, short of a length and on the stumps, Stoinis pulled it instinctively, didn't bother to keep it down and almost holed out to the man in the deep
Kulwant Khejroliya to Nair, 1 run, nice looking short-arm jab from Nair, but there's a man in the deep. He picked it off his hips and the timing was sweet, just a single though
Kulwant Khejroliya to Stoinis, 1 run, fuller length delivery on Stoinis's pads, whipped away past square leg for a single
Kulwant Khejroliya to Nair, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, Nair drops it in front of cover-point with soft hands and scampers across for a quick single
Kulwant Khejroliya to Nair, no run, short of a length and angling across the right-hander, Nair shuffled across on the whip and missed, rolled away off his thigh-pad
Washington Sundar to Stoinis, no run, nicely flighted on middle, Stoinis backs away and finds Chahal at cover with the back-foot punch
Washington Sundar to Nair, 1 run, slower and just outside off, pushed towards cover for a single
Washington Sundar to Stoinis, 1 run, Stoinis is looking to be attacking, comes down the track and drags the drive towards long-on
Washington Sundar to Stoinis, 2 runs, slower and just outside off, punched in front of square on the off-side and Stoinis gets going with a brace
Washington Sundar to Stoinis, no run, Sundar shortens his length as Stoinis came down the track, defended back towards the bowler

Washington Sundar to Rahul, out Caught by Sarfaraz Khan!! Oh dear! That's a horror shot from KL, he was looking so good and now plays an atrocious heave, pushed through quicker and wider of off, KL was looking to mow it over the mid-wicket fence, doesn't get anywhere near the pitch of the ball, the fat top-edge loops towards short third man where Sarfaraz takes it with glee. End of a handy knock from the KXIP opener. Rahul c Sarfaraz Khan b Washington Sundar 47(30) [4s-2 6s-4]
Chahal to Nair, no run, nicely bowled by Chahal, drops the length short and gets the ball to turn across the batsman, Nair was aiming for the pull and bails out of the shot at the last instant

Chahal to Nair, FOUR, Chahal's over is ruined once again off the last ball, this was tossed up nicely outside off, Nair bent half-forward, reverses his stance and helps it on its way to the long leg fence, make it off the fifth ball
Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, Chahal tosses one on the stumps, wristily drive down towards long-on for a single
Chahal to Rahul, 2 runs, KL gets lucky now, was down in by the flight as he came down the track, was looking to go inside out over cover, slices it over point for a couple of runs
Chahal to Nair, 1 run, Nair is looking to attack the leg-spinner, spots the leg-break, takes a step down the track and sweeps it towards deep mid-wicket, bounced in front of the fielder
Chahal to Nair, 2 runs, the leg-break from Chahal, Nair reaches out and sweeps it in front of square on the on-side, comes back for the second run
Washington Sundar to Nair, 1 run, flighted one around off, Nair drives it along the ground to wide long-off for a single
Washington Sundar to Nair, no run, flat and quick on off, Nair moves away and looks to go big, swings hard and manages to get an outside edge to short third man, could have gone anywhere that
Washington Sundar to Rahul, 1 run, drills the tossed up delivery through cover, gets a single

Washington Sundar to Nair, 1 run, ABdV, that's a good stop in the deep, a good slide there and saves a certain boundary. Floated on middle and leg, Nair dances down the wicket and flicks it to wide long-on where AB does the rest, gives away only a single
Washington Sundar to Rahul, 1 run, off spinner on the pads, nudged to deep mid-wicket for a single again
Washington Sundar to Nair, 1 run, tossed up delivery around off, Nair chips it aerially over the bowler and gets a single

Chahal to Rahul, FOUR, no... he doesn't! How often have we seen the last delivery of the over to be the spoiler! Darts it on leg and Rahul gets down on his knee to paddle it away and a chase by the fielder is not enough to stop this as the ball races away
Chahal to Nair, 1 run, that's a wristy flick against the wrong 'un, only four singles off the over so far... Can he end it nicely?
Chahal to Nair, no run, slower in pace outside off, Nair waits for it before he chops it to the man at point
Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, shortish in length on middle and leg, nudged away to wide long-on by Rahul
Chahal to Nair, 1 run, tossed up delivery on middle and leg, driven along the ground to long-on
Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, 'two' was the initial call by Rahul but the fielder sprinted towards the ball, gathered it and denied them the second once again. It was flicked to deep mid-wicket
Woakes to Rahul, 1 run, ends the over with a single. Fullish in length on middle and leg, Rahul whips it down to long-on
Woakes to Nair, 1 run, can't get the second run this time around. The fielder charged towards the ball and denied the second run. On the pads and it was flicked again by Nair, towards mid-wicket

Woakes to Nair, 2 runs, running between the wickets, fine on that occasion. Another change up delivery, slower in pace and on the pads, Nair flicks it away to wide long-on, challenges the fielder's arms and manages to get back for two
Woakes to Nair, wide, tries to bowl a slower delivery but strays in line, down the leg side and that's an easy call for the umpire

Woakes to Nair, FOUR, class apart. It's a short delivery around off, Nair arches back and guides it to perfection over the empty cordon, third man sprints to his left but it's one bounce and over the fence
Woakes to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length delivery, the slower one at 117kph that has been square cut to deep point by Rahul
Woakes to Rahul, no run, hits the deck hard and bowls a length delivery around off, Rahul knocks it back to the bowler, couldn't have played it better
Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, pushed through on middle and leg, tucks that away to the leg side and retains strike with a single

Chahal to Rahul, SIX, flat and over the fielder at deep square leg. Short and quick on leg, Rahul waits for it and drags it powerfully over the man in the deep, that went like a rocket, lot of bottom hand on that blow by Rahul

Chahal to Rahul, 2 runs, overthrows! That's a good direct hit from the deep, but as it ricochets away, the batsmen manage to steal the second run. It was played with soft hands by Rahul has he nudged that to deep mid-wicket, put the pressure on the fielder and got the second run as a result of the overthrow
Chahal to Nair, 1 run, flatter in trajectory around off and Nair has eased this down to long-off, played that nicely past the fielder at extra-cover
Chahal to Rahul, 1 run, quicker delivery on middle and leg, it's a wild heave again, and a misfield at short mid-wicket allows him a single

Chahal to Rahul, no run, flighted delivery on middle and leg, Rahul shimmies down and almost yorks himself. Goes ahead with a slog and ends up getting an inside edge on to his toe, ricochets back to the bowler

U Yadav to Nair, no run, change of pace again, a slower delivery at 109kph to end the over. Nair picks the length and pace, but all he can manage is squeeze it to point. 3-0-15-3 are Umesh's figures so far, that's gold dust from RCB's newest spearhead
U Yadav to Rahul, 1 run, brings up the team fifty with this quick single. Short of a length around off, Rahul taps it in front of point and scurries across to the other end
U Yadav to Rahul, no run, short of a length around off, bowled at 134kph, squares him up as Rahul gets a leading edge to point
U Yadav to Rahul, no run, short and wide outside off, Rahul throws his bat at it, swings it like a sword but a hint of away movement his good enough to beat his outside edge
U Yadav to Nair, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Nair angles it to backward point where a diving stop keeps them down to a single
U Yadav to Nair, no run, dishes in a full length ball on middle and leg, driven to the man at mid-on by Karun
Kulwant Khejroliya to Nair, 1 run, steers the length delivery away to third man for a single does Nair
Kulwant Khejroliya to Nair, no run, short of a length outside off, Nair plays that with soft hands, gets it off the bottom-end and towards the keeper

Kulwant Khejroliya to Nair, FOUR, Rahul, Agarwal and now Nair. All Karnataka boys have got off the mark with a boundary or six tonight. Full length delivery around off, Nair keeps his head still and drills it past the fielder at mid-off, no chance to stop that
Kulwant Khejroliya to Rahul, 1 run, pitched up on a full length around off, Rahul drives it crisply to mid-off and scampers across
Kulwant Khejroliya to Rahul, no run, short of a length around off, Rahul blocks it down

Kulwant Khejroliya to Rahul, SIX, Rahul continues to march on. Wickets falling at one end won't make him a difference. This one is a short delivery on leg, Rahul keeps his calm and pulls it over fine leg, off his hips and over the fence

U Yadav to Yuvraj, out Bowled!! Third wicket of the over. Umesh Yadav is on fire! Cleans up Yuvraj with a beautiful delivery. Comes from round the wicket and fires in a length delivery from wide off the crease. Yuvraj who looks to fend it, misses it altogether and the middle-stump is out of here. Look at Umesh's celebration, he's absolutely delighted. Just look at him. Fist pump and all! Yuvraj b U Yadav 4(4) [4s-1]

U Yadav to Yuvraj, FOUR, what was the fielder doing there? He should have been back near the fence. Could have been a straight forward catch there. Short of a length delivery around off, Yuvraj swivels and pulls it over the leaping fielder at deep square leg, guess it was Sarfaraz Khan
U Yadav to Yuvraj, no run, short and skiddy delivery around off, blocks it off his toes
U Yadav to Yuvraj, no run, no.. he doesn't! Bowls a full length delivery outside off, Yuvraj creams his drive but can't pierce the gap at covers

U Yadav to Finch, out Lbw!! Golden duck for Finch! Umesh is on a hat-trick as the umpire's call stays. It was a length delivery around middle and Finch who tried to flick it off his toes missed it and got struck on the pads. Pitching in line, impact in line and clipping - umpire's call. Can he bag the hat-trick now? Finch lbw b U Yadav 0(1)

U Yadav to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by de Kock!! Stunning catch by de Kock behind the wicket. Full length delivery in the zone around off, Agarwal goes for it, swings hard at it and ends up getting a healthy edge. de Kock flies to his right and pulls off a beauty. So just like always, Agarwal departs after getting off to a flier. Good entertaining cameo! Mayank Agarwal c de Kock b U Yadav 15(11) [4s-3]

Kulwant Khejroliya to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, in the air.. but safe! Has Sarfaraz hurt himself in his quest to pull off a diving catch. Definitely looks in some kind of pain there. Probably the wrist. It was a shortish delivery and Mayank pulled it off his hips to deep square leg where Sarfaraz Khan put in a dive forward, almost pulled it off
Kulwant Khejroliya to Mayank Agarwal, no run, back of a length outside off, dabbed in front of gully by Agarwal
Kulwant Khejroliya to Rahul, leg byes, 1 run, quick short delivery skidding on to the batsman, Rahul goes for a pull as the ball clips his pads before it rolls to the on side
Kulwant Khejroliya to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, walks down the wicket and times his drive to wide mid-off. Walking down the track against a fast bowler, that's courageous

Kulwant Khejroliya to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, errs in line after a good start. This is a shortish one on leg and Agarwal doesn't miss out on the chance. Swivels and drags it down to the fine leg fence, can't keep a fielder there
Kulwant Khejroliya to Mayank Agarwal, no run, starts off with a length ball on middle, Mayank gets inside the line and tucks it to short mid-wicket. Good start by the left arm pacer

U Yadav to Rahul, no run, good change in pace by Umesh. Rolls his fingers and bowls a slower delivery outside off, full in length and all Rahul can manage is punch it to the man at point. Still striking at 228.57 even after that dot ball
U Yadav to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, pulls the shortish delivery, but the fielder at deep square leg keeps them down to a single

U Yadav to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, textbook straight drive! Presenting full face of the bat and high elbows. Fullish in length around off, Agarwal backs away, drives it straight past the bowler and gathers a boundary more
U Yadav to Mayank Agarwal, no run, banged short on middle and leg at 135.7 kph, tucked to the fielder at short mid-wicket yet again
U Yadav to Mayank Agarwal, no run, another length delivery on middle and leg, nudged to short mid-wicket

U Yadav to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, off the mark in style, Agarwal too. Picks the length early, it's short on middle and Agarwal gets in position early to flick it over square leg, fine leg is too square and the ball wins the race

Woakes to Rahul, FOUR, 16 runs off the opening over. Couldn't have asked for a better start. On the pads again and all Rahul does is clips it past the fielder at short fine leg, he dives there but the ball is too quick for him
Woakes to Rahul, no run, back of a length with a bit of extra carry on middle and leg, Rahul hops a bit and tucks it away

Woakes to Rahul, SIX, beautiful flick that. Very less margin for error on this wicket. Full on middle and leg, Rahul keeps his eyes on the ball and flicks it over mid-wicket with nonchalance. Made that shot look effortless

Woakes to Rahul, SIX, excellent shot to get off the mark. He's in sublime touch, has carried his form into this match too. On a length outside off, stands tall and pumps that over covers for half a dozen. Flat and over the fence
Woakes to Rahul, no run, another fullish delivery outside the off-stump channel, Rahul stays in his crease and defends it, off the toe-end towards the keeper
Woakes to Rahul, no run, starts off with a full length delivery around off, Rahul takes a forward stride and defends it nicely to the fielder at cover, very solid

Mustafizur to Roy, 1 run, in the airrrrr and it lands safely! For a moment it looked as if one of the fielders had it covered, but DD were relieved to see the ball clear the infield over cover. What an anticlimax for a brilliant run chase. Slower delivery outside off stump, Roy slices the loft and that's good enough for DD to record their first win of the season

Mustafizur to Roy, no run, a hat-trick of dots, you are kidding me! Slower delivery again that spins across, Roy pokes at it and misses. MI review just like that, obviously no edge on that. Gee this is unbelievable stuff

Mustafizur to Roy, no run, another dot! Just two more dots for a Super Over. DD surely can't take this to the Super Over. Just move across the stumps and negate the angle Mr. Roy! Slower delivery outside off stump, Roy swipes and misses again
Mustafizur to Roy, no run, slog and miss! Dot ball, but it's only 1 run needed off 3. Slower delivery slanted across, Roy swings to the leg-side and misses

Mustafizur to Roy, SIX, uppish and all the way. Scores level! What a hit under pressure. With a boundary through the off-side previous ball and a field set for the leg-side, Roy knows that the bowler isn't going to bowl outside off stump, so he moves across and flicks this short of length delivery with a strong bottom hand grip to send it clear of the man at fine leg

Mustafizur to Roy, FOUR, that's a quality hit from Roy but hang on, why on earth did you bowl normal pace Mustafizur? Full and wide outside off stump, Roy drills the drive over cover and there's no one in the deep. Great start to the over for DD

Bumrah to Shreyas Iyer, no run, can you believe this! Bumrah has prised out a couple of dot balls to finish the penultimate over with 11 needed. That's some quality for you. Similar ball to the previous but and Iyer failed to make contact again
Bumrah to Shreyas Iyer, no run, beaten! 11 off 7 now. Pressure on the batsman all of a sudden. Lovely slower ball full and outside off stump, Iyer tries to squeeze it past third man but misses
Bumrah to Roy, 1 run, very full, almost the yorker, Roy drills it to long-off

Bumrah to Roy, 2 runs, how about that for perfection from Roy? Slower delivery outside off stump, Roy slices the slog, but the placement couldn't have been better, lands safely around the mid-off region. That could so easily have been hit to hand, lucky for DD that the bat swing wasn't that hard
Bumrah to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, low full toss and Iyer flicks it on the bounce to deep mid-wicket
Bumrah to Roy, 1 run, slower delivery wide outside off stump, Roy dabs it to deep backward point, was almost foxed by the change of pace, wants two but sent back and rightly so

Mustafizur to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, there is deep square leg, there is deep mid-wicket but Shreyas Iyer has expertly split them both with a well timed pull shot. Mustafizur went normal pace on this short ball and it didn't rise high enough for Iyer to be troubled
Mustafizur to Shreyas Iyer, no run, watch the ball sir! Shreyas Iyer swung so early at this short slower ball, went for the pull and almost finished the shot before the ball arrived

Mustafizur to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, this time Iyer does cut the ball with the angle from the left-armer, sends it to deep point and he's swift to come back for the second. The fielder didn't attack the ball quick enough to prevent the second
Mustafizur to Shreyas Iyer, no run, slower delivery slanted across outside off stump, Iyer tries to throw his bat at it but makes no contact

Mustafizur to Roy, leg byes, 1 run, appeal for LBW, not given, are they going for a review? No! Oopsy! There's an overthrow. Fizz was appealing and there was no one backing up Bumrah's throw from short fine leg. This was a good length delivery pitching outside leg, so can't be out, Roy missed the scoop and got hit on the thigh pad
Mustafizur to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, slower delivery just outside off stump, tapped to mid-off for a quick single
Bumrah to Roy, no run, oh Roy wanted to scoop this low full toss past short third man, but mistimes it

Bumrah to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, another catch put down and it's Fizz again. You don't deserve to win if you are going to field like that. That stare from Rohit Sharma tells it all. Silence all around the Wankhede. Good length delivery outside off stump, Iyer backs away and slices it, went to the right of short third man, easy catch and he spills it

Bumrah to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, slower ball alright, but this is way outside off stump, Iyer delays the cut shot, puts it past backward point and the man sweeping the off-side boundary could not cut it off as well
Bumrah to Roy, 1 run, almost a yorker, Roy digs it out to long-off

Bumrah to Roy, FOUR, a dropped catch and then the MI's best bowler has been carted away for four next ball. Five runs off 2 balls and the asking rate is only around 9. Short of a length delivery on the stumps, Roy pulls powerfully and there's no one at deep square leg to stop the boundary

Bumrah to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, dropped, tough chance though! Fizz the man there at short third man. Slower delivery wide outside off stump, Iyer checks the dab, gets a leading edge that flies to the left of short third, Fizz moved to his left and dived, but couldn't hold on. Massive moment in the game
Krunal Pandya to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, flatter and on the leg stump, Iyer flicks it to deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Shreyas Iyer, no run, big slog attempted on one knee but this down the leg-side ball hits Iyer on the pad

Krunal Pandya to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that should have been stopped by Rahul Chahar at deep point. Short and wide outside off stump, Iyer cuts, Chahar got there running to his left from sweeper, but he fumbled
Krunal Pandya to Roy, 1 run, punched away to long-off

Krunal Pandya to Roy, SIX, this game is so unkind to the bowlers. Krunal Pandya has actually deceived the batsman in flight and with length, Roy, who was jumping out of the crease was nowhere close to the pitch of the ball, but he's gifted with timing and has a great willow in his hands and that combo is good enough for him to back himself and go through with the lofted hit over the bowler's head
Krunal Pandya to Roy, no run, very full and outside off stump, Roy drives it to cover
Dananjaya to Shreyas Iyer, no run, that's hit really hard as well, but hit straight to the bowler, Iyer almost whipped that like a helicopter shot
Dananjaya to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, oh what a shot! The quicker delivery from Dananjaya, Iyer slogs really well and the timing is exceptional, sails into the second tier over the mid-wicket boundary
Dananjaya to Shreyas Iyer, no run, leg-stumpish delivery, flicked to the left of short mid-wicket
Dananjaya to Roy, 1 run, flicked away to deep mid-wicket
Dananjaya to Roy, wide, way outside off stump, ignored by the batsman

Dananjaya to Roy, 2 runs, that's almost another catch. Delhi are going really hard and the opportunity for a wicket is always there. Need a bit of calmness out there. 50 odd 35 balls isn't that tough, especially at the Wankhede. Very full delivery, Roy slogs, connects well, luckily it dipped on SKY who was diving forward
Dananjaya to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, poor down the leg-side delivery, Iyer flicks it to short fine leg
Krunal Pandya to Roy, no run, big slog-sweep and Roy is hit on the body as he plays the shot early, cleverly bowled slower through the air that time
Krunal Pandya to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, flattish in trajectory, punched down to long-off
Krunal Pandya to Shreyas Iyer, no run, waits on the back foot and defends
Krunal Pandya to Roy, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Roy drives it to long-on

Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Oh that's a stunning grab from brother Hardik. Unbelievable. The catch of the tournament so far. This is exactly what Markande should have done in the previous over. Turn it away outside off stump like Krunal did this time. Maxwell tries to go for a big hit, but the bat turns in his hands on impact with the ball and it's a slice that flies more towards deep extra-cover. But Hardik put his skating boots on, got there and flew full length to his left and took it with both hands horizontal to the ground. Just amazing! Krunal has given a lot of hope for MI with 2 wickets in 8 balls. Maxwell c Hardik Pandya b Krunal Pandya 13(6) [4s-1 6s-1]
Krunal Pandya to Roy, 1 run, oh the inside edge misses the sticks and rolls to short fine leg

Markande to Maxwell, SIX, another tossed up one and Maxi slog-sweeps it all the way over backward square leg. It's on the stumps and Maxi won't miss those. Markande's having an of day. Tip for you Markande: If you are bowling to Maxwell, bowl the away-spinning ones wide outside off stump, hope for Maxwell to slog and slice one up in the air

Markande to Maxwell, FOUR, the invitation there from the bowler with the flighted delivery, you can't blame him because he's going for wickets. But just that he's bowled this too full for the batsman to be troubled and Maxwell smashes it straight over the non-striker's head to take long-on out of the equation
Markande to Roy, 1 run, flighted delivery just around the off stump, Roy pushes it to cover
Markande to Maxwell, 1 run, and there comes the big slog, lucky that the inside edge rolled behind square and didn't go to hand
Markande to Maxwell, 2 runs, that's sensibly done by Maxi. Reads the googly, flicks with the turn in the vacant mid-wicket region, pushes for two and gets back comfortably
Markande to Roy, 1 run, googly on the stumps, Roy sweeps it to deep mid-wicket, fumble but they don't take the second which was on
Krunal Pandya to Maxwell, no run, flighted delivery on the stumps, watchfully defended

Krunal Pandya to Pant, out Caught by Pollard!! That's Pollard for you. Freak on the field. And Krunal roars in delight. Dangerous 69-run stand broken. This was a flighted delivery wide outside off stump, something that left-arm spinners do against left-handed batsmen to take the leg-side out of play, Pant tries to muscle the ball hard through the off-side, wanted to hit towards cover, but he hit straight and Pollard ran quickly to his left, dived and took it air-borne. Pant misses a deserved fifty by three runs. Pant c Pollard b Krunal Pandya 47(25) [4s-6 6s-2]
Krunal Pandya to Pant, no run, fires in the yorker, Pant keeps it out
Krunal Pandya to Roy, 1 run, shortish and turning away, Roy pulls it to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Pant, 1 run, that's a lovely yorker, something he does bowl well as a spinner, Pant digs it out into the off-side

Krunal Pandya to Pant, FOUR, welcome into the attack Mr. Krunal! Pant will love this - left-armer turning it back into him. Leg-side is going to be busy. This was actually bowled pretty well, very slow although full, Pant delays the lofted drive and manages to hit it straight over the bowler to split long-off and long-on
Bumrah to Pant, 1 run, allows the slower ball to come and wrists it through backward square leg, keeps strike
Bumrah to Pant, no run, change of pace and Pant calmly defends, sensible, because they've already scored the runs early in the over
Bumrah to Roy, 1 run, opens the face of the bat and steers it to third man

Bumrah to Roy, FOUR, in the airrr and if Pollard can't get there with that trampoline jump of his, nobody can. Gee these batsmen have no mercy, not even for Jas Bumrah! Well, this was a freebie ball though, full and in the slot, Roy muscles it hard over mid-off and looks like Pollard has hurt himself coming down hard on the ground

Bumrah to Roy, 2 runs, oh no! Poor fielding, but it's fifty for Jason Roy, great effort. True pitch, lovely stroke-maker, you got to expect him to come good and boy, he's done well in a stiff chase. Very full and outside off stump, Roy squeezes it out, straight to backward point and it goes right through him
Bumrah to Pant, 1 run, short of length delivery on the leg stump, Pant glances it to fine leg
Dananjaya to Pant, 1 run, flatter delivery, quick in pace on middle and leg, Pant knocks it down to wide long-on and gets a single

Dananjaya to Pant, SIX, the partnership between Pant and Roy is more than 50! Tossed up delivery around off, Pant puts on his dancing shoes and slaugters it over long-on to bring up Delhi's 100 in style
Dananjaya to Roy, 1 run, short delivery skidding on to the batsman, Roy was committed on to his back foot pull, could only manage to inside edge that to deep mid-wicket
Dananjaya to Pant, 1 run, drives that along the ground to mid-on and takes a single
Dananjaya to Pant, FOUR, and the boundaries continue to flow. Follows it up with a sweet sweep. Loopy delivery around off, Pant goes down and sweeps it firmly towards the long leg fence
Dananjaya to Pant, SIX, Pant pumps it! Shimmies down the wicket and towers the flighted delivery right over the bowler's head for six more, straight as an arrow that was
Markande to Pant, 1 run, sweeps the tossed up delivery again to square leg

Markande to Pant, FOUR, Markande is not having a good day with the ball. 10 runs in the first over, already 16 off this. Went down on his knee and swept that flighted delivery over square leg nicely, two boundaries and a six in this over
Markande to Roy, 1 run, shortish in length outside off, slapped past backward point for a single

Markande to Roy, SIX, so much power on that. Was a tossed up delivery around off, Roy went down on his knee and smoked it flat over long-off, even a leaping Pollard near the fence couldn't take the catch
Markande to Pant, 1 run, drills the floater down to long-off and changes ends
Markande to Pant, FOUR, reverse swept! Shortish delivery around off, Pant does well to reverse sweep that over short third man, gets four more

Dananjaya to Roy, no run, good catch by Kishan there, who moved to his right and dived in front of him to grab it. As Roy hacked across to pull the short one, he got an inside edge on to the boots and it had bounced too, right decision made in the end
Dananjaya to Roy, no run, quick and full around middle, Roy plays across the line, tries to whip that away, ends up getting an inside edge onto the pads
Dananjaya to Roy, 2 runs, comes down the wicket and chops the flighted delivery to the left of sweeper cover, good running between the wickets fetches him two
Dananjaya to Pant, 1 run, waits for the floater and tickles it down to fine leg, takes the first quickly but has to settle for it
Dananjaya to Roy, 1 run, short in length a slow leg spinner, Roy has punched that away firmly to sweeper cover

Dananjaya to Pant, 1 run, floated around off, Pant pushes it in front of extra-cover and scurries across for a quick run. Bails dislodged at the keeper's end too but Roy is quick enough to make it in time
Markande to Pant, 1 run, the googly well outside off, slapped away to deep covers for a single

Markande to Pant, FOUR, strong bottom hand on that. Flatter delivery around off and it's short too, Pant drags it away with a firm pull and beats the man at deep mid-wicket this time around, this was a powerful blow by the pocket-sized dynamite

Markande to Pant, FOUR, first one of the innings for Pant. This was short and wide outside off and was meant to be put away. Pant doesn't miss out, reaches for it and thrashes it away, beats sweeper cover quite comfortably
Markande to Pant, no run, has to reach out for a shortish delivery that's turning away from, slapped straight to the man at cover
Markande to Pant, no run, short in length and straighter outside off, punched off his back foot to cover
Markande to Roy, 1 run, flatter in trajectory on middle, Roy nudges that away to deep mid-wicket
Mustafizur to Pant, no run, length ball around off, keeps a bit low. Pant dabs it away to gully and calls for a single but Roy sends him back
Mustafizur to Roy, 1 run, bowls a leg-cutter at a skiddy pace, Roy gets off his bottom hand off as he punches that to extra-cover
Mustafizur to Roy, no run, rolls his fingers and bowls a back of a length delivery around off, Roy knocks it back to the Fizz
Mustafizur to Pant, 1 run, gets off the mark with an easy flick to a full length delivery, away to deep mid-wicket
Mustafizur to Roy, 1 run, full in length on middle and leg, Roy flicks it away to wide long-on and moves over to the other end

Mustafizur to Gambhir, out Caught by Rohit!! The Fizz strikes, gets the DD skipper. Gambhir was struggling and his struggle finally comes to an end. Short of a length around off and the opener goes ahead with the pull. As there's a bit extra bounce on the delivery, it catches the top edge and Rohit Sharma at short mid-wicket does the rest. Should have given the strike to Roy who's striking the ball so well. This wicket might affect Roy's mindset now! Gambhir c Rohit b Mustafizur 15(16) [4s-2]
Hardik Pandya to Roy, no run, full length delivery fired outside off, Roy drives it to cover, 21 runs came off that over

Hardik Pandya to Roy, FOUR, he's looking unstoppable, just like the MI openers were earlier in the day. Pandya dishes a full length delivery around off, Roy stays put and pummels it right over the bowler's head

Hardik Pandya to Roy, SIX, ahh, that was even better than the previous six. Short delivery again, Roy transfers his weight on to the back foot and murders it over square leg with a pull, 96 metre biggie that one, this is why he's in the team
Hardik Pandya to Roy, SIX, in the arc out of the park. Full length delivery, a knuckle ball and Roy with a lot of authority picks it up over wide long-on, would have been a six on any ground
Hardik Pandya to Gambhir, 1 run, short and wide outside off, muscled away to sweeper cover off his back foot

Hardik Pandya to Gambhir, FOUR, one bounce and into the cushions. That'll release a bit of pressure off Gambhir. Picks the length early, rocks back and pulls the shortish delivery over square leg, one bounce and into the fence

Mustafizur to Gambhir, 1 run, Pollard, what a stop! Short of a length and outside off, Gambhir slaps that hard to wide mid-off where a certain Pollard dives full length to his right and grabs it in his right hand, anyone else and this was a boundary

Mustafizur to Roy, 1 run, Mustafizur almost gets Roy there. Rolls his fingers, bowls a slower left cutter and induces a leading edge as Roy is early in his flick, that was chipped right over the bowler
Mustafizur to Gambhir, 1 run, shuffles a bit in his crease does Gambhir, clears his front leg and slaps the length delivery away to sweeper cover
Mustafizur to Gambhir, no run, length delivery well outside off, Gambhir punches that off his back foot to mid-off
Mustafizur to Roy, 1 run, full and wide outside off, Roy drives that crisply to sweeper cover, but only for a single
Mustafizur to Roy, no run, some fine display of athleticism by Rohit on the field. Dives to his left to stop the cover-drive before he has a shy at the bowler's end

Bumrah to Gambhir, no run, yes he does! Concedes only two runs off his first over. This was short again around middle and leg, Gambhir heaved that away but the fielder at short square leg stopped that, giving nothing away
