Bumrah to Gambhir, no run, quick delivery skidding on to the batsman, bowled at 143ks, Gambhir who tries to flick that away gets undone due to the pace on that and is struck on the pads. Can Bumrah end the over nicely?

Bumrah to Gambhir, no run, another wild swing, he's struggling against the delivery that's angled away. This was short of a length and leaving him, Gambhir moved away to thrash that but couldn't meet leather
Bumrah to Gambhir, 2 runs, back of a length on middle and leg, Gambhir drags that away to deep mid-wicket and manages to get two
Bumrah to Gambhir, no run, another length delivery just around the off-stump channel, angled away too and it's a wild swing and a miss by Gambhir

Bumrah to Gambhir, no run, Bumrah goes up in an appeal for caught behind. Angles it away from the batsman and as Gambhir looks to run that down to third man, gets beaten all ends up. Was close to the outside edge, but definitely there wasn't an edge
Dananjaya to Gambhir, 1 run, flat and quick on the pads, Gambhir flicks that away to deep mid-wicket
Dananjaya to Roy, 1 run, pushed through on middle and leg, Roy eases that away to mid-wicket and calls for two, however as Gambhir ain't interested, Roy has to settle only for one

Dananjaya to Roy, FOUR, the spinner put under pressure right away by Jason. Picks the length early on this short delivery, camps back and hammers it past the fielder at wide long-on, no chance of the stopping that
Dananjaya to Roy, no run, drops it short again around off, Roy has knocked that off his back foot to mid-off

Dananjaya to Roy, SIX, that's huge! Akila concedes his first six of IPL and that's only his second delivery. Nothing much he could have done about it. Flighted one around middle and leg, Roy shimmies down the wicket and smokes it for a 95 metre six over mid-wicket. Welcome to the IPL, chirps Nasser Hussain on air
Dananjaya to Roy, no run, drops it short of a length around off, Roy punches it to the man at mid-off

Hardik Pandya to Gambhir, FOUR, Pandya doesn't like it. He's not happy with himself. Bowls a shortish delivery on leg and Gambhir simply puts it away to the square leg fence with a nonchalant clip off his hips, 11 runs off the opening over

Hardik Pandya to Gambhir, no run, there's some noise there and Mumbai Indians go up in an appeal, the umpire is not interested though. It was the pads and as Gambhir missed his flick, it kissed the strap and went straight to the keeper
Hardik Pandya to Roy, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Roy gets a single with a firm back foot punch, a fielder was kept there right after that previous boundary and he's in action right away
Hardik Pandya to Roy, FOUR, that came right off the meat. On a length outside off, Roy stays put and punches this sweetly through the gap at covers, sweeper kept it place right after that shot
Hardik Pandya to Gambhir, 1 run, good sliding stop by the 'Fizz' there. On the pads and Gambhir whips it away to fine leg where Mustafizur tidies up with a slide, keeps them down to a single
Hardik Pandya to Roy, 1 run, full in length around off, Roy goes for a drive but ends up getting an inside edge towards mid-on, off the mark with that single
Boult to Markande, 2 runs, makes room and carves this full ball wide of sweeper cover. They rush back for the second, with Markande diving into the crease as his helmet falls off. But he's made it
Boult to Dananjaya, 1 run, short of length delivery, Dananjaya backs away from it and swishes it back towards Boult - who fumbles in his followthrough
Boult to Markande, leg byes, 1 run, very full ball on leg, deflects off Markande's pad towards fine leg. He was late on the flick
Boult to Markande, 2 runs, short of length delivery outside off, glided down to the right of third man where Shahbaz Nadeem has a bit of a fumble on the slide, but he does well enough to cut it off
Boult to Dananjaya, 1 run, yorker length ball outside off, sliced down to third man

Boult to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Another one falls. An off-cutter from Boult, Hardik mistimes the slog off the inside half and holes out. Iyer, it seemed like, had lost it in the sun initially. But he picked it up in time and then sunk low for the grab. Hardik Pandya c Shreyas Iyer b Boult 2(3)

Shami to Dananjaya, no run, full, quick, skimming through to the keeper outside off. Dananjaya had cleared his front leg to make room for the swing, but he almost got himself too far away from the line. What a comeback this is turning out to be for the Daredevils. Can they finish off well?

Shami to Dananjaya, 2 runs, fuller length off-cutter around off, Dananjaya clears his front leg and slices it over short extra-cover. Just managed to chip it over the leaping fielder, but there's hardly any power in the shot
Shami to Dananjaya, no run, sharp bouncer from Shami, Dananjaya - on debut - ducks under it

Shami to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! What is happening? It's been lapped straight into the hands of short fine leg, but the umpire has gone upstairs for some reason. Oh wait, his decision was not out, and so Delhi reviewed it immediately. Bizarre. It looked like it came straight off the bat-face. Krunal walks across for the scoop, gets a thick inside edge onto thigh pad and it spoons up to Tewatia. So the decision will be overturned. Krunal Pandya c Rahul Tewatia b Shami 11(10) [4s-1]
Shami to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, 141.7kph, low full toss outside off, Hardik doesn't get under it like he hopes to as he drills this to long-off
Shami to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, uses his feet and spears it down to long-off
Boult to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, good length ball, probably an off-cutter, Krunal hoicks it down to long-on. Fine over from Boult
Boult to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, back of length off-cutter outside off, dabbed to backward point
Boult to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, low full toss, flicked away through mid-wicket
Boult to Krunal Pandya, wide, aims for a wide yorker, but gets it too wide outside off

Boult to Rohit, out Caught by Roy!! Sliced up in the air, Roy lumbers across from long-off and takes it comfortably. Lovely bowling from Boult. He slanted this off-cutter away from Rohit's swiping zone, and it gripped further away from him after pitching. Despite that, Rohit doesn't quite smarten up. He swings cross-batted and slices it off the outside half. Rohit c Roy b Boult 18(15) [4s-2]
Boult to Rohit, 2 runs, low full toss outside off, sliced away through the covers. Sweeper cover is very straight, so it's a lot of ground to cover for Dan Christian who does well
Boult to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, Krunal plants himself so deep in the crease, but is still unable to get under this very full ball from Boult. Powers it down to long-on

Shami to Rohit, 2 runs, skates down the pitch to convert this into a low full toss, which he delightfully slices through extra-cover. It's skimming across the turf, before Vijay Shankar slides across and cuts it off
Shami to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, good yorker just outside off, Krunal slices it out of the dust for a single to sweeper cover
Shami to Rohit, 1 run, low full toss at the stumps, knocked down to long-on
Shami to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, overpitched outside off, smeared to sweeper cover
Shami to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, off-cutter from Shami, but it's right in the slot for Krunal to hammer it over mid-off
Shami to Krunal Pandya, no run, yorker length ball just outside off, squeezed out to cover
Christian to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, slanted in on middle and leg, Krunal flicks the hat-trick ball to deep mid-wicket

Christian to Pollard, out Bowled!! Would you believe it, Christian now has two in two. Pollard walks out to him first ball, tries to work this length ball round the corner but misses it. The ball gets stuck in his thigh pad and dips behind to knock over off-stump. These are crucial strikes as Delhi hope to reign things back. Pollard b Christian 0(1)

Christian to Ishan Kishan, out Bowled!! Switches his legs, looks for the reverse-sweep again but completely misses this full toss. It rams into middle and leg stump from round the wicket. He was doing a decent job of hitting straight, probably didn't need to do that. But a superb knock nevertheless. Ishan Kishan b Christian 44(23) [4s-5 6s-2]
Christian to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, off-pace back of length delivery, swatted to the left of long-on. Didn't get it off the middle, but they push for two and come back
Christian to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, just over extra-cover! 117kph, length ball wide of off, Kishan had to reach out for it but he throws everything and is able to smear it over the fielder
Christian to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, short of length delivery angled in on middle, 116kph, thwacked through square leg on the front foot. They amble back for two
Shami to Rohit, no run, finishes the over with a cracking yorker on middle, Rohit rushes to dig it out
Shami to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, skiddy good length ball, swatted through mid-wicket without much timing

Shami to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, these are weird tactics. Both fine leg and third man are up, so you'd expect the length to be full. But Shami's gone short more often than not. Now agreed, this one rushes Kishan on the pull as he's taken by surprise. But he swings into it and the top-edge balloons past the keeper. Always a risk with this field
Shami to Ishan Kishan, no run, length ball pushed across off, sliced to short third man by Kishan. He's dipping into that well too often now
Shami to Ishan Kishan, no run, tries to dab it to the fence again, but this time he finds short third man
Shami to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, 124kph, short of length delivery just outside off, Kishan cheekily dabs it fine of short third man

Christian to Rohit, FOUR, goes for the slower short ball again, but gets it down leg. With fine leg up, Rohit only has to help his pull past the fielder in the circle, which he comfortably does after swivelling into the shot
Christian to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, 117.9kph, slower short ball, Kishan is irked by the spongy bounce and under-edges his pull through mid-wicket
Christian to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length delivery just outside off, sliced to short third man
Christian to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, advances to a full ball and flicks through mid-wicket
Christian to Ishan Kishan, no run, slower ball at the stumps, 116kph, Kishan drives back down the pitch and hits middle-stump at the other end. Unlucky
Christian to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length delivery on middle, tucked through mid-wicket

Rahul Tewatia to Ishan Kishan, SIX, six more to finish the over, ruins the figures of Tewatia. Puts his dancing shoes on, and despite not getting to the pitch of it, he's able to drag it away over the wide long-on boundary. The key was that he went through with it

Rahul Tewatia to Ishan Kishan, SIX, oh my, he's brought out the reverse-sweep and it's gone for six. Completely switched his legs around, got blessed with a full toss and walloped it over backward point
Rahul Tewatia to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, he's bowled pretty short to Kishan so far, and unlike before, this time he's punished for it. Kishan rocks back and thumps his pull over mid-wicket
Rahul Tewatia to Rohit, 1 run, flicked wide of Roy at long-on who is quick to slide across to keep them to one
Rahul Tewatia to Rohit, no run, probably a googly this, but Rohit was done in by length anyway. He shimmied out late, wasn't able to get to the pitch and is hit on the pad as the ball snakes in
Rahul Tewatia to Rohit, wide, sliding on with the arm down leg, Rohit looks like he's about to overbalance but then he regains his balance to keep that back foot planted
Rahul Tewatia to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, makes room and cuts it to deep point
Maxwell to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, sliding in on leg, softly nudged through mid-wicket
Maxwell to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, oh poor delivery. He's fired this well down leg, Kishan sees the opportunity early and paddle-swats it to the fine leg boundary
Maxwell to Ishan Kishan, no run, came out too early, Maxwell responded by firing it in and pulling the length back. It skids on and hits Kishan on the leg
Maxwell to Rohit, 1 run, nudges it through mid-wicket

Maxwell to Rohit, FOUR, this is beautifully done from Rohit. So deft. Perfectly good delivery from Maxwell, turning in from a length towards off. Rohit's intentions are highly concealed all the way through, but just when the ball is about to pass him, he lays the softest of touches to deflect it past the keeper's glove into the third man boundary
Maxwell to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, 86.5kph, floats it in on middle from round the wicket, Kishan works it down to long-on
Rahul Tewatia to Rohit, no run, pushed back to Tewatia. End of an excellent over
Rahul Tewatia to Rohit, no run, 87.2kph, flat length on off-stump, Rohit stays leg-side of it and dabs to short third man. No single there
Rahul Tewatia to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, on the shorter side outside off, Kishan backs away and slaps it to deep point
Rahul Tewatia to Rohit, 1 run, drifting in on middle, Rohit gets his front leg out of the way and pushes to long-off

Rahul Tewatia to Suryakumar Yadav, out Lbw!! Big, big appeal from the keeper more so than anyone else. Given. Now then, Suryakumar deliberates with his partner for a reasonable amount of time, before taking the review. Did the ball straighten enough, or was it sliding down? It's clipping leg-stump according to ball-tracking. So the umpire's call will stay. What a precious spell this has been from Rahul Tewatia, standing out amid the carnage to remove both the opening batsmen. Suryakumar was quickly down on his knees to sweep this hard, but failed to connect. It didn't grip the pitch much after drifting in, but gripped just enough to be clipping the stump. Suryakumar Yadav lbw b Rahul Tewatia 53(32) [4s-7 6s-1]

Rahul Tewatia to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, shimmies out and looks to loft it down the ground, but skews it off the inside half instead. He's inadvertently placed it between long-on and deep mid-wicket, allows him to come back for the second
Maxwell to Ishan Kishan, no run, angled in on a length, Ishan Kishan softs the push back down the pitch
Maxwell to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, pushed to cover

Maxwell to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, now he's hanging the ball flat in the air. Full, worked to long-on and that's a half-century for Suryakumar Yadav off 29 balls. Second of his career. Wankhede crowd go berserk with the flags. Quite blue.
Maxwell to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, straightening outside off with some turn, Ishan Kishan punches that back-footed to long-on
Maxwell to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, overpitched on off, Suryakumar Yadav wrists it to long-on
Maxwell to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, slower outside off, Suryakumar Yadav reaches forward and bunts it to cover

Rahul Tewatia to Lewis, out Caught by Roy!! Looked like a googly but replays show it's a quick slider, angling across from over the wicket, which gets the wicket. Lewis shimmies down the track, isn't quite to the pitch of the ball and ends up slicing it to long-off, where Jason Roy runs in and takes the catch reverse-cupped. Lewis c Roy b Rahul Tewatia 48(28) [4s-4 6s-4]
Rahul Tewatia to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, now a a delivery that's been drifted in and straightens on middle-stump. Suryakumar Yadav goes back and works it to deep mid-wicket
Rahul Tewatia to Lewis, 1 run, some lack of bounce on this wrong 'un, Lewis stays leg side, protracts arms and swishes that through covers
Rahul Tewatia to Lewis, SIX, it's a slower googly from Rahul Tewatia, which allows Lewis to come down the track and lever it over straightish long-on

Rahul Tewatia to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, that's a leading edge over mid-off. Looking to play across the turn -- and there was a little on this -- but it clears the infield easily. Not that I blame the bats..
Rahul Tewatia to Lewis, 1 run, kicks his front leg un in the air and loads up into a flash through point. Another googly this
Maxwell to Lewis, 1 run, this is a good over. Just the 5 runs off it, after Tewatia's 3-run over. Whether it's Maxwell or the time-out, we don't know. This one's a push to long-off
Maxwell to Lewis, no run, blocked back from the crease
Maxwell to Lewis, wide, short and sliding down leg, Lewis couldn't quite go back to pull. and doesn't connect
Maxwell to Lewis, no run, more round-armish and into the pads, Lewis rocks back and punches to mid-on
Maxwell to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, bowling quick and full to the batters, not allwoing them to get under. Another nudge to long-on
Maxwell to Lewis, 1 run, darts it a little round-armishly into the left-hander from round the wicket. Dug out by Lewis to mid-off for a quick single
Maxwell to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, sliding on from over the wicket, Suryakumar Yadav works it from around off-stump to long-on
Rahul Tewatia to Lewis, no run, not one leg break to the left-hander. Another one spinning away, Lewis blocks it off the back foot

Rahul Tewatia to Lewis, no run, beaten. Two things working for Rahul Tewatia here: the googly (going away from over the wicket) and then the slower pace on it. Lewis went for the wild heave-ho and doesn't connect. Nothing at all
Rahul Tewatia to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, quick slider but he's splayed this on leg-stump and beyond, meaning it's an easy single past short fine leg
Rahul Tewatia to Lewis, 1 run, googly again, Lewis this time makes sure that he goes right back in the crease and chips it over Suryakumar Yadav's head through mid-off
Rahul Tewatia to Lewis, no run, googly that hangs in the air from over the wicket, Lewis pushes it out
Rahul Tewatia to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, flat and full on middle-stump, Suryakumar Yadav works it away to long-on and gives the strike back to Lewis

Christian to Lewis, SIX, this is unreal unravelling of Christian, and Delhi Daredevils. Slower on a length say, Lewis clears his front leg and sends it romping over long-off. More timing than anything else
Christian to Lewis, no run, finally bowls a slower delivery on a length, which Lewis defends off the back foot

Christian to Lewis, FOUR, another. Keep 'em counting. Another half-volley, and this one's been scorched through covers with an elegant bat flow. The deliveries remain the same, only Lewis's shots are evolving into something more telegenic
Christian to Lewis, no run, angled into leg-stump, Lewis gets his bat around his pad and checks the ball into the pitch
Christian to Lewis, FOUR, about time we saw a half-volley. All he had to do was stay leg-side of the ball and deflect it with an open bat face. Does so, and it's a boundary through cover-point
Christian to Lewis, FOUR, from over the wicket and that's been pitched full. Right there to be hit. Lewis doesn't even bother about the footwork. Stays put and slamns that through wide mid-off

Shami to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, let's say Shami's gotten obsessed with bowling yorkers. More yorkers. Better yorkers. He wants redemption for that boundary that Suryakumar Yadav hit earlier in the over. Goes for one again, bowls a low full toss on leg-stump instead -- how? why? what? -- and is flicked round the corner
Shami to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, low full toss again in a bid to redo the yorker. Gets away. Clipped to mid-wicket
Shami to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, nearly 140ks this low full toss that's been sliced to mid-off here
Shami to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, a puff of dust as Suryakumar Yadav digs this near yorker length delivery into the off-side. Dry pitch, someone said

Shami to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, now this is a fine, fine yorker.. and look what happens. Suryakumar Yadav squeezes it out with an open bat face and has that scooting to the third man fence. Who says cricket's for egalitarians?!
Shami to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, Shami does this. Drops it harmlessly on a back of a length on leg-stump, and Suryakumar Yadav's been served a pie. Helps it over fine leg with a good arm swing

Nadeem to Lewis, no run, this over the wicket angle's better to the left-hander. Cramping Lewis for some room with the iota of spin that's available. This one's on the shorter side but Lewis rocks back instead and defends it right back to Nadeem
Nadeem to Lewis, no run, bowled slower with some loop outside off, Lewis checks the push to cover
Nadeem to Lewis, wide, from over the wicket now is Nadeem. Quickish but drifting down, Lewis doesn't connect his sweep

Nadeem to Lewis, SIX, that's been hit to the ESA kids in the stands. Brings up Mumbai's fastest fifty in IPL. Dragged down from round the wicket, left-handed Lewis goes back and clouts it over deep mid-wicket. It was a pull but more casually ruthless
Nadeem to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, in-drifting onto middle, mid-on's stop means that Suryakumar Yadav has to settle for a single
Nadeem to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that's dropped a touch short, so even though it's turning the ball's hittable. Suryakumar Yadav rocks back and slaps that disparagingly wide of mid-off
Nadeem to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, arm-ball stopping a little on Suryakumar Yadav who's checked his shot to mid-on
Boult to Lewis, no run, fulla nd straight on off-stump, Lewis squeezes it out from the crease
Boult to Lewis, SIX, early signs: good pitch against the new ball. Length ball right in Lewis's arc and he goes for it. Will go, 10 out of 10 times. Swings it over long-on
Boult to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, length ball tucked round the corner

Boult to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that's box-office chic and very good thinking. Short ball angled across, Suryakumar Yadav's ducking initially, then sees that the height isn't much and ramps that over to the third man fence with utter style
Boult to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, length ball and that's been bunted to backward point
Boult to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, nicely done. He's not giving up. Pitched it right up there again, desperately hoping for some swing, but is driven handsomely down the ground

Nadeem to Lewis, 2 runs, dropped by Trent Boult but geez that was a good attempt. Top-edge on the slog-sweep -- told ya that Nadeem was bowling slower in this over -- Boult runs back from backward square leg, doesn't get beneath the ball but doesn't stay put there. Rushes in front and stops the boundary. Top class athlete with a short term memory loss for good
Nadeem to Lewis, no run, bowled slower again. Lewis was early to dab his bat in front and makeshifts a punchy push
Nadeem to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, bowled a touch slower, Suryakumar Yadav manoeuvres the length ball into the leg-side and pinches a single
Nadeem to Lewis, 1 run, at the stumps, worked to mid-on

Nadeem to Lewis, wide, nicely done by the keeper there. Quick to move down leg and collect this delivery darted far down leg from round the wicket. Nadeem struggling with the left-right combination there. Will need to bowl this again
Nadeem to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, now worked sanely to mid-on for a single. That's a tease. Back to you, Lewis
Nadeem to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, misfielded by Maxwell at mid-on. Flat from Nadeem, Suryakumar Yadav wrists it away and basks in the glory of someone else's plight

Boult to Lewis, leg byes, FOUR, leg byes given but looked like there was some bat. Hung over from the last boundary, Boult tries to cramp Lewis for room and overdoes it with a gimme down leg. Glanced away for four runs. Who cares if it's off the bat or not..
Boult to Lewis, FOUR, just a trifle short that and Lewis swivels with the incoming angle. Blasts it one-legged in front of the square leg umpire
Boult to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, drags the length back, Suryakumar Yadav dabs with an open bat face, using the angle across him for a single to third man
Boult to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, mid-off a touch squarer and this full length delivery finds a way. Driven with a straight bat. Always on with the ball nicely pitched up in your half
Boult to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, opens the half-forward drive to cover on this occasion. Boult sticking to the full length
Boult to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, pitches it full to test the air for swing, does Boult, and is driven. Half-stopped by Gambhir at mid-off
A Russell to Y Pathan, SIX, that will be it. The SRH dugout rises as Pathan pulls this short ball into the stands. SRH pull off their first win at the Eden Gardens
A Russell to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, back of a length delivery, clipped away wide of mid-wicket
A Russell to Y Pathan, 1 run, searing yorker at the stumps, great response, Pathan doesn't know where the ball is after digging it out but he runs across

A Russell to Y Pathan, FOUR, hoists this over extra-cover. Pathan's stepping up to the occasion against his former franchise. Back of length delivery outside off, he gets it close to the bottom of the bat but there's enough on the drive to clear cover
A Russell to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, full ball outside off, stretches out and drives to sweeper cover

A Russell to Deepak Hooda, no run, back of a length delivery outside off, it's an ill-advised hoick from Hooda. This is just such an ugly shot. The length wasn't there, and the fact that he had to fetch it from out wide made it worse. No contact
Johnson to Y Pathan, 2 runs, short of length delivery outside off, 132.6kph, flat-batted wide of long-off. They come back for two
Johnson to Y Pathan, FOUR, Pathan kills the crowd's enthusiasm, crashes this full ball through extra cover. What a hit. He nailed this drive to the fence
Johnson to Y Pathan, wide, bangs it in very short, the ball sails over Pathan's head. Pretty easy call for a wide
Johnson to Y Pathan, no run, back of a length delivery on middle, clipped to the right of Russell at short mid-wicket who pounces on the ball
Johnson to Y Pathan, no run, good length ball on off, defended to mid-off

Johnson to Williamson, out Caught by A Russell!! Williamson flicks this straight into the hands of square leg, what a soft dismissal! He immediately throws his head back, not able to believe what he's just done. Good length ball on leg-stump, and this is a loose shot from the captain. Just so lacklustre. This could get interesting. Williamson c A Russell b Johnson 50(44) [4s-4 6s-1]
Johnson to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, good length ball across off, 133kph, worked through square leg
Narine to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, works this down to long-on

Narine to Williamson, 1 run, another out-swinger on a good length, punched down to long-off. Brings up the fifty for Williamson. He has to finish this off for his team, lest the follow the route they took against Mumbai
Narine to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, an out-swinger from Narine, Hooda cuts it through the covers
Narine to Deepak Hooda, no run, looks to work it through the on-side but gets a soft leading edge down the pitch
Narine to Deepak Hooda, no run, turning away from Hooda who defends with the turn to point
Narine to Williamson, 1 run, flat ball turning away from a back of length, Williamson punches down to long-off. Don't expect him to be flustered by the situation

Chawla to Deepak Hooda, no run, now then, there's a review from KKR for leg-before. Hooda didn't pick a googly from Chawla and was hit on the back pad. But in real time, it looked like the impact may have been outside off. Oh wait, there's an inside edge too. So that's that

Chawla to Shakib, out Bowled!! Through him. Flat through the air from Chawla, zoots it through Shakib who's on the prowl down the pitch. Never allowed him to get anywhere close to the ball, cramped him up and it deflected off his pad onto middle stump. Do KKR still have hope here? Shakib b Chawla 27(21) [4s-2 6s-1]
Chawla to Shakib, no run, slippery googly zipping away from a length outside off, Shakib is done in by pace as well as length as he tries to cut
Chawla to Shakib, no run, nicely held back in flight. Shakib found himself in trouble for a moment there after using his feet, but then was able to lunge towards this googly to keep it out
Chawla to Williamson, 1 run, skits down the track and drives to long-on
Chawla to Shakib, 1 run, flighted leg-break on middle and leg, driven to long-on
Shivam Mavi to Shakib, 1 run, slower short of length delivery slanting down leg, Shakib helps the pull to fine leg

Shivam Mavi to Williamson, 1 run, stays low again with Williamson hopping to cut, this time he chops it back onto his pad. They rush across for the single. Mavi was just a touch slow in sprinting towards the ball, which allowed Shakib to get in comfortably before the stumps were knocked over
Shivam Mavi to Williamson, no run, stays a touch lower than Williamson expects and it sneaks under his attempted cut

Shivam Mavi to Williamson, SIX, Williamson uses the pace of Mavi, all 140kph of it, and whips the pull away over long leg. What a brilliant shot. He swivelled across, remained on the front foot while pushing his weight back and used his wrists gloriously
Shivam Mavi to Shakib, 1 run, 140kph, Shakib swivels across and helps it down to fine leg. Again, the batsman was rushed here
Shivam Mavi to Williamson, 1 run, 143kph, Williamson is rushed in his pull shot and mistimes it through square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, cuts it to sweeper cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Shakib, 1 run, didn't allow Shakib to get under this. Shakib was looking for the inside-out hoist, has to settle with jamming the ball down to long-off
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, googly on leg, Williamson gets down on his back knee and sweeps to deep backward square
Kuldeep Yadav to Shakib, 1 run, treks down the leg-side, Kuldeep follows him with a flighted leg-break and is rammed down to long-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, doesn't get hold of the pull and limply hits it to deep mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, no run, goes back to a length ball and defends back down the pitch
Narine to Williamson, 1 run, driven down to long-off

Narine to Williamson, 2 runs, well bowled this time. Made Williamson reach out on the drive, but the SRH captain is smart enough to open the bat-face and slice it through backward point once he gets to the ball. Another couple

Narine to Williamson, 2 runs, Narine's been too short this over. This one's pretty wide too and it further turns away from Williamson - adding to his room. He stretches out and cuts it through the covers
Narine to Shakib, 1 run, cut away to deep point
Narine to Shakib, 2 runs, turning away from Shakib who utilizes the width and scythes it through point. Easily saunters back for two
Narine to Williamson, 1 run, flat, turning in on middle, Williamson shuffles to leg and punches down to long-on

A Russell to Shakib, SIX, woah, the ball has gone skimming over the third man boundary. Boy he hit this hard. Short and wide, a ferocious slash from Shakib. Gets all of it. Massive over in the context of the game - 16 off it. SRH back in control
A Russell to Shakib, FOUR, now goes over mid-off! He was actually done in by the slower ball, as evidenced by his bottom hand coming off, but more importantly, he went through with it
A Russell to Shakib, FOUR, Shakib swivels into the pull but is clearly hurried by this short of length delivery. He's lucky that the top-edge has flown over the keeper's head
A Russell to Shakib, no run, yorker from Russell which swings back in a touch on off, Shakib digs it back
A Russell to Williamson, 1 run, dabbed down towards third man

A Russell to Shakib, 1 run, that's an excellent effort from Rana at backward point. It was travelling to his right, and he dived across to get a hand. Shakib had lashed at this one real hard. Will have to settle for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Shakib, 1 run, flighted ball on middle and leg, Shakib grounds his back knee and sweeps to deep backward square
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, slapped through the covers

Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, no run, the leg-break this time which turns back in from outside off. Although it's short again, Williamson is slightly cramped as he under-edges the cut back down the pitch

Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, four more. Two short balls in a row from Yadav. He'll be disappointed by this. Googly on leg-stump, Williamson picks length early, gets down low and swats it through backward square
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, Williamson puts this away. Much needed release of pressure. Short googly from Yadav, the SRH captain sits back and pumps it through mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, no run, loops it nice and high, too full, Williamson squeezes it to short mid-wicket
Chawla to Shakib, no run, beautiful wrong 'un. Shakib reads it off the pitch, manages to block it to the off-side
Chawla to Williamson, 1 run, Williamson was deep in the crease and he pushes it to short mid-wicket for a single
Chawla to Shakib, 1 run, this delivery came in after pitching, Shakib adjusts and clips it to the leg-side for a single
Chawla to Shakib, no run, straight delivery aiming at the stumps, Shakib pushes it to cover
Chawla to Williamson, 1 run, goes on the back foot and cuts it to deep point
Chawla to Shakib, 1 run, fuller length delivery at the stumps, Shakib drives it to long-off for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 2 runs, cheeky from Williamson. He sweeps it fine of the short fine leg fielder for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Shakib, 1 run, too much effort for one run. Shakib goes down on his knees and slog sweeps it to deep mid-wicket for a single

Kuldeep Yadav to Manish Pandey, out Lbw!! Pandey was chatting with Williamson regarding the review but umpire says time is up and Manish Pandey will have to depart. It was a flighted delivery which turned in after pitching, Manish Pandey's bat was behind the pads and ball raps him on the pads. It looked adjacent, the only question was whether it was going down the leg-side. Umpire thinks it wasn't and he raises his finger slowly in a stylish manner. Manish Pandey lbw b Kuldeep Yadav 4(11)
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, comes on the front foot and pushes it to long-off for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, no run, goes on the back foot and pushes it to square leg with the turn
Kuldeep Yadav to Manish Pandey, 1 run, drills it straight down the ground over the bowlers head for a single

Chawla to Manish Pandey, 1 run, to cover, Direct hit there and umpire goes upstairs. Williamson and Pandey are playing with fire with their running between the wickets. He has just made his ground. Manish Pandey pushes it to cover and takes off for a quick single. Williamson comes rushing in and completes it in the end
Chawla to Williamson, 1 run, tucks it off the back foot to short mid-wicket for a single. Direct-hit at the bowler's end would have made things interesting for Williamson
Chawla to Manish Pandey, 1 run, goes on the back foot and nudges it to square leg, bit of misfield there which allows a single
Chawla to Williamson, 1 run, comes on the front foot and pushes it to long-on for a single
Chawla to Williamson, no run, misses the paddle sweep, ball hits his pads and deflects back in the direction of the stumps. Luckily for Williamson just evades it
Chawla to Williamson, no run, Williamson plays inside the line of the straight delivery and ball beats his outside edge
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, Williamson wasn't at the pitch of the ball and outside half of the bat takes it to cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Manish Pandey, 1 run, fuller length outside off, Manish Pandey drills it to long-on for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Manish Pandey, no run, peach of a delivery from Kuldeep Yadav. Manish Pandey comes on the front foot and just manages to defend it
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, Williamson mistimes the pull, he was early in the shot, wanted to hit it through deep mid-wicket and ends up hitting it to long-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, no run, hits that drive straight to Russell at cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, no run, fuller length delivery outside off, Williamson reaches the pitch of the ball and drives it to cover
Narine to Manish Pandey, no run, away going delivery, outside half of the willow takes it to short third man
Narine to Manish Pandey, no run, that ball came in to Manish Pandey. Good variations from Narine, Manish Pandey was on the back foot and he defends it to mid-on
Narine to Manish Pandey, no run, that ball spun away from Manish Pandey. He reads it off the pitch and guides it to short third man
Narine to Manish Pandey, no run, Manish Pandey was beaten in the flight there but he manages to block it to the off-side
Narine to Manish Pandey, no run, blocks to the off-side

Narine to Dhawan, out Bowled!! Narine is on fire! His second wicket in that many overs. He is ensuring that KKR remains in the game. It was an off-spinner and Dhawan was late onto it, trying to play across the line. Ball hits his pads and goes onto hit the stumps. Dhawan will be gutted with this shot. Dhawan b Narine 7(7) [4s-1]
Narine to Dhawan, wide, sprays down the leg-side, umpire signals wide
Chawla to Williamson, no run, comes on the front foot and pushes it to mid-on.
Chawla to Williamson, no run, ball hits the bat and pads and deflects to the leg-side
Chawla to Williamson, FOUR, goes on the back foot in a flash and drives it through cover for another four. Stellar timing from the skipper
Chawla to Williamson, FOUR, beautiful use of the feet from Williamson. He comes down the track and drives it wide of the mid-off fielder for a four
Chawla to Dhawan, 1 run, not much turn on that delivery aimed at the stumps, Dhawan goes on the back foot and tucks it to the leg-side for a single
Chawla to Williamson, 1 run, wrong' un to start his spell. Williamson reads it off the pitch and clips it to short fine leg for a single
Narine to Williamson, 1 run, good first over from Narine comes to an end. It was a straight delivery at the stumps, Williamson works it to long-off and retains the strike
Narine to Dhawan, 1 run, touch short from Narine. Dhawan goes on the back foot and pulls it to the leg-side for a single
Narine to Williamson, 1 run, another ball at the stumps and Williamson nudges it to square leg for a single
Narine to Williamson, no run, straight delivery aiming at the stumps, Williamson blocks it to the off-side
Narine to Williamson, no run, hits the pads and lobs in the air to short leg, was there bat involved? Karthik's reaction suggested that as he runs to take the catch

Narine to Saha, out Caught by Karthik!! KKR gets the much needed breakthrough. Saha doesn't even wait for the finger to go up as he walks back. It was an off-spinner down the leg-side, Saha gets a faint tickle to it and Karthik behind the stumps makes no mistake.  Saha c Karthik b Narine 24(15) [4s-5]
Johnson to Saha, 1 run, good length at the stumps, Saha tucks it to the leg-side for a single

Johnson to Saha, FOUR, cracking shot!  It was touch fuller of good length, Saha lofts it wide of the mid-on fielder for a four. he played that shot with a straight bat and that made it even better. Minimum risk and effective result!
Johnson to Saha, FOUR, another slower ball outside off from Johnson. Saha reads the change in pace and drives it through the off-side for a four
Johnson to Saha, wide, slower ball outside off, too wide of off and umpire signals it wide
Johnson to Saha, FOUR, Johnson is becoming predictable here with his length. It was on a short of length again, Saha holds his shape and pulls it over square leg for another four.
Johnson to Saha, no run, punches it to the off-side and Gill at point makes a brilliant save. Top effort!
Johnson to Saha, 2 runs, fullish delivery at the stumps, Saha picks it up and hits it over the in-field over the leg-side for a brace
A Russell to Dhawan, no run, nasty bouncer! Ball goes over Dhawan as he fails to make contact

A Russell to Dhawan, FOUR, another short of length delivery, Dhawan gets into position quickly and pulls it in front of square for a four. He doesn't time it as well as he would have liked but the placement is good enough
A Russell to Dhawan, no run, short of length outside off, Dhawan misses the cut shot and ball thuds into the gloves of Karthik
A Russell to Saha, 1 run, opens the bat and guides it to the off-side for a single
A Russell to Saha, FOUR, just over of the square leg fielder. It was on a good length and outside off, Saha pulls it off the front root, manages to clear the fielder and ball races for a four
A Russell to Dhawan, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, Dhawan is in such good form that he seems to have extra time. He waits for the ball and guides it to third man for a single
Johnson to Saha, no run, fuller length delivery at the stumps, Saha gets a stride forward and drives it to mid-off. Decent first over from Johnson
Johnson to Saha, FOUR, first runs off the bat from Saha and SRH. It was on the stumps, Saha gets in the position quickly and whips it wide of the fine leg fielder for a four
Johnson to Saha, no run, good length delivery at the stumps, Saha defends it to the off-side
Johnson to Saha, no run, good length delivery on the stumps, Saha taps it to the off-side with soft hands
Johnson to Saha, wide, wayward delivery down the leg-side, poor delivery from Johnson. Umpire signals it wide, unlike last call this is the right one
Johnson to Saha, no run, wild swing from Saha, He tries to pull it to the leg-side. Johnson's pace was too hot to handle for Saha and he was late on the shot and ends up missing it
Johnson to Saha, no run, taps that good length ball to the off-side with soft hands, straight to the fielder
Johnson to Saha, wide, good length delivery angling away from Saha, hint of away movement and umpire gives a wide. It was just inside the guide line, harsh call from the umpire

S Kaul to Shivam Mavi, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Imagine Bhuvneshwar escaping a collision with Stanlake.. he offers a smile but I think it's for more than just pulling off this catch. It's relief personified. Another knuckle ball this from Kaul, Shivam Mavi reaches out and pops it behind off the toe-end. It's Bhuvi's catch at short fine leg but there's Stanlake, rushing past the keeper to attempt to take this. Just about evades his teammate to my relief. Shivam Mavi c Bhuvneshwar b S Kaul 7(8)
S Kaul to Shivam Mavi, no run, digs in the ball short at 141ks and Shivam Mavi misses his upper-cut which he was trying to execute with bent knees
S Kaul to Johnson, 1 run, lined up the lack of pace well there. Has some room outside off that he uses for a slap to long-off
S Kaul to Johnson, no run, slower ball angled across, Johnson makes some room and carts through thin air. Good from Kaul so far
S Kaul to Shivam Mavi, 1 run, dabs to cover and runs. And Johnson denies the second. Wasn't there to be honest
S Kaul to Shivam Mavi, 2 runs, clears his front leg to Kaul's knuckle ball, rams it over the infield. Dhawan runs across and cuts it off, flicking the ball in with one hand while in motion
Bhuvneshwar to Johnson, 2 runs, swats across, gets a top-edge that's fallen wide of third man

Bhuvneshwar to Shivam Mavi, 1 run, now what's that. Looked like he was shaping for the cut on his back foot and gets a top-edge that drops in front of long-on. Thank goodness this was the free-hit delivery. And about the trajectory of that ball, I'll blame physics

Bhuvneshwar to Johnson, no ball, 1 run, Williamson takes it at long-off but Kumar has overstepped again. Slower delivery from Bhuvneshwar that. Johnson made a bit of room but could never time it. But for Bhuvneshwar overstepping..

Bhuvneshwar to Johnson, no run, from over the wicket. Back of a length delivery kicking off and cramping the batsman's cut. Bhuvneshwar appeals but SRH don't have reviews left. Missed the bat by a mile

Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, out Caught by Saha!! These knuckle balls are sticking in the pitch and darting away. Karthik gets a top-edge on his attempted flat-batted swish, for the keeper to take a good catch few paces to his right. Karthik c Saha b Bhuvneshwar 29(27) [4s-2 6s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, no run, lovely ball. Another slower delivery but he's bowled it from wide of the crease, meaning Karthik is playing a different line. Straightens and beats the outside off
Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, SIX, what a price to pay. Slower ball again, Karthik picks it up and mauls the free-hit ball over long-off
Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, no ball, it's a front foot no-ball and it's free-hit time. Karthik throws his hands at this knuckle ball and has the miscue bounce in front of onrushing long-off

Rashid Khan to Shivam Mavi, 2 runs, Rashid thinks he has Shivam Mavi LBW and Williamson reviews.. Missed his sweep there, deflecting the ball to short fine leg. And guess what, he hasn't missed it. It's taken the under-side of the glove and gone to short fine leg, who with a wide throw at the bowler's end allowed the second
Rashid Khan to Karthik, 1 run, drags the sweep wide of the short fine leg fielder
Rashid Khan to Karthik, FOUR, another leg break, Karthik waits and waits before dabbing that just wide of the keeper. Boundary through third man
Rashid Khan to Karthik, no run, beats him with a bit of turn on this leg break. Karthik dabbling off the front foot, and Rashid Khan getting the ball straightening inches past the off-stump
Rashid Khan to Shivam Mavi, 1 run, glances this leg-side googly to short fine leg
Rashid Khan to Karthik, 1 run, slower and loopier outside off, reverse-paddled to short third man
Bhuvneshwar to Shivam Mavi, no run, beaten outside off. Pace and bounce outside off, Shivam Mavi looks for the third man single and misses
Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, 1 run, dabs an open-batted single to point

Bhuvneshwar to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Shakib!! Bhuvneshwar is too good for a debutant. Takes the pace off again with his knuckles and gets the ball to dart away. And Shubman Gill, overcommitted on the front foot, reaches out, only to slice that over to extra cover. Shubman Gill c Shakib b Bhuvneshwar 3(9)
Bhuvneshwar to Shubman Gill, no run, gets this off-pace delivery drifting and cutting away off the pitch, Shubman Gill ends up dabbling away from the body and gets an inside edge
Bhuvneshwar to Shubman Gill, no run, cutting/slapping off the front foot, and Shubman Gill gets no timing on another slower one from Kumar
Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, 1 run, slower back of a length delivery, Karthik waits and works that to mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Karthik, 1 run, quicker googly, Karthik picks it and rocks back for a punch through mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Shubman Gill, 1 run, dragged-down googly worked around to backward square leg
Rashid Khan to Shubman Gill, no run, slow and making Shubman Gill reach on his front foot. Blocked
Rashid Khan to Karthik, 1 run, skids on from middle to leg, Karthik gets some bat into the leg-side
Rashid Khan to Shubman Gill, 1 run, goes for the very wide and full ball but dishes out room for the drill-drive through the off-side
Rashid Khan to Karthik, 1 run, tossed up slower & fuller, worked to long-on
S Kaul to Karthik, leg byes, 1 run, angles this length ball into the pad, Karthik overbalances and is rapped on the thigh
S Kaul to Shubman Gill, 1 run, slices the ball to mid-off; buys time for a single
S Kaul to Karthik, 1 run, late outswing for Kaul here, Karthik ekes an outside edge that's safely traveling wide of backward point
S Kaul to Karthik, no run, now a front foot punch but it's straight to mid-off
S Kaul to Karthik, FOUR, back of a length delivery, punched exquisitely behind point
S Kaul to Karthik, 2 runs, 132.9ks outside off, Karthik jabs out the drive through covers
Stanlake to Shubman Gill, no run, pace and bounce from Stanlake and Shubman Gill will take some getting used to. Goes for the upper cut and doesn't connect
Stanlake to Shubman Gill, no run, full and onto off-stump, Shubman Gill keeps it out. First ball for Shubman Gill in IPL
Stanlake to Karthik, 1 run, pinches a single through cover
Stanlake to Karthik, no run, back of a length delivery, Karthik blocks back to Stanlake

Stanlake to A Russell, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Manish Pandey, that's some catch. But what's Russell upto? Another one that he totally wanted to hit into the stands. Stays leg-side of the ball and wafts, and ends up slicing it. Into the night sky, Manish Pandey runs back from backward point, with his back to the ball, and leaps in front to take that. There was third man in the vicinity too but he just leaves it to Manish, and for the right reasons. A Russell c Manish Pandey b Stanlake 9(5) [6s-1]

Stanlake to A Russell, SIX, Hooda's flown in the air, caught it reverse-cupped and strewn that back in the playing field. Or has he? Nah, the left foot just hits the deep point ropes. Russell throws his arms at the width, with weight still on the front foot. Just throwing his arms..
Shakib to Karthik, no run, beaten for pace there. Skimming in with the arm again, Karthik tries to work it off his thigh but is early in the shot
Shakib to A Russell, 1 run, no mid-on, so a safe chip through the vacant region
Shakib to A Russell, no run, see what short leg can do. Stretching in front to offer a straight bat
Shakib to A Russell, 2 runs, skidding in with the arm -- there's a short leg waiting -- and Russell works it behind the fielder to deep square leg

Shakib to Chris Lynn, out Caught&Bowled!! Shakib's stretched into double his height with this sideways dive and taken this left-handed inches above the ground. A bit of replays there to ascertain the dismissal but that's out. Kolkata crowd knows it. Arm-ball again that sticks a bit in the pitch, Chris Lynn's making room down leg and can only tamely pop it back down the pitch. And then Shakib takes over. Chris Lynn c and b Shakib 49(34) [4s-7 6s-1]
Shakib to Karthik, leg byes, 1 run, arm-ball overbaked into something just down leg, worked off the pad to short fine
Rashid Khan to Karthik, 1 run, another one kicking off the turf, another run to mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Karthik, no run, darts it flat and full on middle-stump, Karthik drops it defensively at his feet
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, extra bounce outside off that Chris Lynn rides to mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Karthik, 1 run, even quicker. Wrong 'un, hurrying Karthik for pace at 89ks and forcing him into an urgent wristwork to mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, spins the googly into Chris Lynn's pads. Worked to backward square leg
Rashid Khan to Karthik, 1 run, quick straightener on off-stump, worked to mid-wicket
Shakib to Karthik, 1 run, overflighted delivery that's a full toss, Karthik throws his bat at it and covers the off-side infield
Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, pushes a single to long-off

Shakib to Narine, out Caught by Williamson!! This is just a culmination of what was brewing. Shakib's getting the ball to drift away, Narine's throwing his bat and getting lucky. Not this time. Off the toe-end, there's Williamson at wide long-on, having covered some ground from mid-wicket and tumbling behind to take this one. Lovely catch. He's on fire in the field, is Williamson, this IPL. Narine c Williamson b Shakib 9(10) [4s-1]
Shakib to Narine, FOUR, throws his hands at another ball drifting away and shoots an outside edge over the two fielders behind square on the off-side

Shakib to Narine, no run, stumping appeal. Narine seems to be out here. or is he? An arm-ball that drifts away, Narine is out of the crease to meet that. Totally misses the slog. Back foot just on the line, it seems. The curious case of a missing frame, and Narine gets the benefit of doubt. Not out
Shakib to Narine, 3 wides, drifting full toss down leg, Billy covers a lot of ground and puts a sliding stop at fine leg
Shakib to Narine, 2 runs, diving stop by Yusuf at long-on to stop this shimmying on-the-up lift-drive from Narine
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, no run, short and quick around off, swings hard and almost chips it to the man at cover, on the bounce
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, another inside edge and Lynn survives. Fullish around off, Lynn swings hard at it and gets an inside edge past the leg-stump, moves on to 46* with that boundary
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, no run, full in length around off, drilled to the man at cover by Lynn

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, SIX, that's high, miles up in the air... Was the knuckle ball and Lynn went hard at it, towers it up towards long-off where Rashid settles underneath but goes for it only with his left hand, gets a bit on that and eventually parries it over the fence. Was a very tough chance that, difficult to spot those in the night sky
S Kaul to Narine, 1 run, hurries the batsman with a short one and Narine goes ahead with the pull shot, gets a top edge that falls well short of the fielder at deep square leg

S Kaul to Narine, no run, how did that miss the stump? Pitched outside leg on a length, Narine clears his front leg, swings hard at it and gets an inside edge as the ball goes past the leg-stump and Saha gathers it with a dive to right

Shakib to Narine, 1 run, Manish Pandey is on fire in the field tonight, as he almost pulls off yet another stunner. Leaps up in the air near the boundary, takes the catch and parries it away as he's about to hit the ground. Narine walked down the track and lofted that to long-on where Pandey plucked it, parried it and tried to take it on the second attempt with a desperate dive, but hard luck. Could have been six on any other day.
Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, backs away and drills the shortish delivery down to long-off
Shakib to Narine, 1 run, straighter delivery around off, Narine tries to flick that to the on side, ends up getting a leading edge in front of cover
Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, well outside off and it's been cut away to sweeper cover
Shakib to Chris Lynn, no run, this is darted outside off and Lynn cuts it hard to cover-point, dot ball again
Shakib to Chris Lynn, no run, floated outside off, Lynn goes ahead with powerful drive, can't beat the man at cover though
Stanlake to Narine, no run, short and quick again, bit of away movement on that and Narine thinks it's better to leave that, lifts his bats and lets it through to the keeper
Stanlake to Narine, no run, welcomes Narine by pitching it short around off, the batsman has to hop a bit in order to block that

Stanlake to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Excellent grab by Manish that, fumbles on the first attempt but manages to hold on as he's about to hit the ground. Was short and wide outside off, Rana cut that hard to point where a rather sharp Manish pulled off a screamer. Replays confirm that the catch was taken and SRH strike right aftter the break. Stanlake is absolutely loving this, bounce and pace has helped him put the pressure on Rana as he gets his scalp. Nitish Rana c Manish Pandey b Stanlake 18(16) [4s-2 6s-1]
Stanlake to Nitish Rana, no run, that's a shooter. Bangs it short on leg and aims at Rana's helmet who does well to duck underneath that, sharp take by Saha
Stanlake to Chris Lynn, 1 run, length ball angled into the batsman, Lynn plays it with soft hands, fends it on the pitch and scurries across to the other end

Stanlake to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, sloppy work by Yusuf at third man. Was a short delivery outside off, Lynn steered it away to third man and put the pressure on the fielder there, managed to get two as a result of that fumble
Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, retains strike as he eases the flighted delivery down to long-on. Tidy over by Shakib as he concedes only three singles off it
Shakib to Chris Lynn, no run, pushed through again, sliding on with the arm around leg, Lynn tries flicking that away, gets an inside edge on to his pads
Shakib to Nitish Rana, 1 run, darted outside off, Rana cuts it away to deep point and gets a single
Shakib to Nitish Rana, no run, pushed through delivery outside off, Rana pokes at it only to get beaten
Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, skidding on, Lynn goes ahead with a cut shot and gets it off the inside half towards short mid-wicket
Shakib to Chris Lynn, no run, flat and quick around off, knocked to the man at cover
Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, FOUR, ends the over with a cracking boundary. This was short and width was there, enough for the batsman to go ahead with his square cut and find the fence
Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, no run, loopy delivery around middle and leg, Rana defends it off his front foot
Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, SIX, that's massive. Such sweetly it was timed. Picks the googly early, gets down on his knee and slog sweeps it over mid-wicket, high and handsome that was
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, tossed up delivery around off, Lynn tamely flicks it to deep mid-wicket and wisely gets to the other end. He doesn't want to face Rashid, it seems
Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, 1 run, quicker delivery around middle and leg, Rana flicks it over short mid-wicket, was in the air for some time but in no man's land
Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, no run, quicker delivery spinning into the batsman, Rana looks to cut that but gets cramped for room, ends up getting it off the inside half towards short third man

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, glorious! He's off to a flier, like always. This is a full length ball and well outside off, Lynn doesn't miss out and drills it through covers, right into the gap, Kaul greeted with 14 runs, quite expensive.
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, no run, full and wide outside off, Lynn has to reach out for it, but as he's way outside leg, he fails to do so
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, full and wide outside off, Lynn reaches for it, square drives it and as the fielder at point gets his hands to it, he ricochets that away to deep point

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, lucky favoring Lynn tonight. This is a slower delivery again, full in length around off, the big man swings hard at it and manages to get an inside edge, past the stumps, past the man at short fine leg and into the fence
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, slapped away! Knuckle delivery, fraction short and outside off, Lynn frees his arms and goes aerial, evades cover-point with a cut and manages to get four runs
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, no run, starts off with that short length, does Kaul. Around the hip area and as Lynn looks to pull, that catches his top edge and falls short of short fine leg

Stanlake to Nitish Rana, no run, a ripper to end the over. Stanlake was simply unplayable there. Bowls another shortish delivery and makes it jag away from the batsman, Rana who was in two minds there, pokes and gets beaten. Only 2 runs off the over, this wicket looks a seamer's paradise. Would be interesting to see how other SRH pacers bowl here
Stanlake to Nitish Rana, no run, no is the call from Rana now. Lynn wanted a single but the fielder charging in from point made it difficult for him. Was tapped in front of point by the batsman
Stanlake to Nitish Rana, no run, another excellent delivery. Almost got Rana's outside edge. Angled away around the off-side channel, Rana feels for it but it's too quick for him
Stanlake to Nitish Rana, no run, short and quick outside off, angled away from the batsman and Rana lets it through
Stanlake to Chris Lynn, 1 run, good length ball outside off, Chris Lynn steers that down to square third man

Stanlake to Nitish Rana, 1 run, that was a quick short one. Takes Rana by surprise as he looks to evade it. Short in length around off, Rana tries to take evasive action but the extra bounce on that, catches the handle and flies over the fielder at backward point, another day and this was an easy catch
Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, 1 run, short of a length outside off, Rana taps that in front of point for a single and retains strike

Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, crunched away! Good length delivery angled away from the batsman, Rana rocks back and slams that through the gap at point, lightning speed on that as the batsman gets his first boundary, on the first ball. Positive start for the southpaw

Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, out Caught by Saha!! Uthappa thought that he would get away with it but DRS comes to Sunrisers' rescue. Short delivery outside off, Robin tries to run that down to third man but ends up getting a slight edge to that. UltraEdge confirms the same and the ploy to open with Uthappa has back fired. Uthappa c Saha b Bhuvneshwar 3(8)
Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, 1 run, Lynn has dabbed that length delivery in front of mid-on for a single

Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, the power of Lynn on that shot will take that away to the fence. Slower delivery, the knuckle ball by Bhuvi, Lynn backs away and goes through with his horizontal slap, beats the man at mid-on and finds the fence. Wasn't middled properly but those muscles help him
Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, 1 run, angled into the batsman on that shortish length, Uthappa plays it with soft hands in front of point and calls for a single again, gets it eventually
Stanlake to Chris Lynn, no run, on a length and outside off, Lynn chops his cut to the fielder at point, 9 runs off the over
Stanlake to Chris Lynn, no run, tad extra zip and bounce on that, Lynn who's on the back foot blocks that down

Stanlake to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Williamson pulls off a blinder, almost. Good length delivery around off, Lynn goes ahead with his lofted shot and miscues it over mid-off, Williamson goes back running, extends his right arm but can't take the catch, the ball crawls away to the long-off boundary

Stanlake to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that's a cracking shot. Width on offer and Lynn makes the most of it. Short and wide outside off, throws his bat at it and crunches it past the fielder at point, races away to the fence in no time
Stanlake to Chris Lynn, no run, pitched up and moving away from the batsman, Chris Lynn moves away, swings and misses

Stanlake to Uthappa, 1 run, another quick run. Uthappa is taking quite a few risky singles here. It's a length delivery with a tad of extra bounce on leg, Uthappa nudges it in front of short square leg and completes a single

Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, no run, only 1 run off the over. Bangs it short again around off, Lynn who's facing his first ball decides to calmly block that away in front of point. The skipper is pleased with Bhuvi's effort

Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, 1 run, here is the first run of the match. That'll get the Kolkata crowd going. Camps back, taps the shortish delivery in front of point and calls for quick single, Lynn obliges and gets across in a jiffy

Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, no run, excellent bowling by Bhuvi to start off the innings. Bowls another short of a length delivery around off, Uthappa blocks it off his back foot to point, four dots in a row
Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, no run, shortish delivery on leg, Uthappa tries to tuck that off his hips, however the extra bounce does him and strikes his thigh pad
Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, no run, 'no' is call from Lynn, loud and clear. Fullish in length and moving away again, Uthappa taps it in front of point and calls for a run, sent back by his partner
Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, no run, swing on offer straight away, length ball moving away from the batsman as Uthappa takes a forward stride and eases it to cover
Laughlin to Mandeep, no run, slower ball outside off, swings away to beat Mandeep's violent hoick. Rajasthan Royals come out on top by 19 runs
Laughlin to Mandeep, 2 runs, very full outside off, sliced away through point
Laughlin to Mandeep, FOUR, just short of the yorker mark, and Mandeep takes toll by hammering it down the ground for four. Really good showing from him, even though in a losing cause
Laughlin to Mandeep, FOUR, slower ball which swings away from Mandeep. He gets down low, uses the swing and slices it past short third man. Wonderful batting

Laughlin to Mandeep, FOUR, gets inside this short of length delivery and helps the pull over short fine leg. It was really well done because this was a slower ball and there really wasn't a lot of pace to work with
Laughlin to Mandeep, 2 runs, nice and full from Laughlin, prevents Mandeep from getting under it as he drills the drive to long-off
Stokes to Woakes, no run, pretty high full toss outside off, Woakes swings and misses

Stokes to Washington Sundar, out Bowled!! How unlucky is this for Sundar. He's lapped this full toss right off the bat-face onto middle stump. Walked across, got down low, and set himself up perfectly. But just couldn't get under it unfortunately to gain the elevation needed. Washington Sundar b Stokes 35(19) [4s-1 6s-3]
Stokes to Washington Sundar, 2 runs, speared in full at the stumps, drilled back down the ground to the left of long-off

Stokes to Washington Sundar, no run, huge roar in disapproval of the umpire's decision, but this wasn't even close to a wide. Because Sundar had backed away so far, he wasn't able to reach out to this back of length delivery giving the impression that it might have been a wide

Stokes to Washington Sundar, SIX, now carves this slower ball inside-out for six. Wow. Clean strike from Washington Sundar who picked the variation early and smoked it into the crowd. Brings the crowd to life

Stokes to Washington Sundar, FOUR, these are all useful runs to reduce the margin of defeat. Surely they can't win this can they? Stokes misses his yorker by a couple of inches and is sliced away over backward point
Laughlin to Washington Sundar, 1 run, skies this off a thick top-edge, but it lands safely. Slower short ball, there's some spongy bounce which climbs on Sundar's pull shot. Lucky
Laughlin to Washington Sundar, 2 runs, gets it wide of long-off this time for a couple

Laughlin to Washington Sundar, SIX, parried over the ropes for six! Gowtham was standing around 5 yards inside the boundary, stretched his arm out while back-pedaling but never looked like taking it. May have been a different story had he been all the way back. Slower short of length delivery, sits up for Sundar who thwacks it down the ground
Laughlin to Mandeep, 1 run, cannons the yorker in towards the stumps, Mandeep digs it out towards backward point
Laughlin to Mandeep, 2 runs, gets duped by this wide slower ball and chips it up. But he's still got it off the middle, which takes it over extra-cover's head
Laughlin to Washington Sundar, 1 run, wide yorker outside off, squeezed to sweeper cover
Unadkat to Mandeep, no run, hits the blockhole wide of off, Mandeep digs it back down the pitch
Unadkat to Mandeep, 2 runs, full and wide from Unadkat, creamed through point. Sweeper cuts it off this time
Unadkat to Mandeep, FOUR, Unadkat not having a great time here. Bowls this full and wide outside off, Mandeep stretches across and slices it for another boundary, this time wide of third man

Unadkat to Mandeep, FOUR, short of length delivery outside off, Mandeep slices the cut away through backward point. The ball spun away from sweeper cover who dived too early and fell at least 3 feet short of getting to it
Unadkat to Washington Sundar, 1 run, short of length delivery on off, Sundar short-arm pulls to deep mid-wicket
Unadkat to Washington Sundar, SIX, punishes the slower ball this time. He set himself up for it and launched it over wide long-on

Stokes to Washington Sundar, 3 runs, slower ball, miscued off the toe-end towards D'Arcy Short at deep mid-wicket. He fumbles, inadvertently kicks it away from himself and then sets after it again. Amid all this, the batsmen take three
Stokes to Washington Sundar, no run, nails the yorker outside off, Sundar swishes and misses

Stokes to Washington Sundar, no run, 123kph, good length ball coming in with the arm from round the wicket, totally deceives Sundar for the lack of pace and goes past his inside edge. Not far from off-stump either
Stokes to Washington Sundar, no run, back of a length delivery angled very wide of off, Sundar is unable to reach out. Was close to a wide
Stokes to Mandeep, leg byes, 1 run, 143kph, Mandeep loses his shape as he looks to swipe across the line, gets it off the pad towards point
Stokes to Washington Sundar, 1 run, 128.8kph, length ball across off, Sundar clears his front leg for the drive and hits it well, but fails to beat the diving mid-off
Stokes to Washington Sundar, wide, angles this well wide outside off, beyond the wide marker
Laughlin to Washington Sundar, 1 run, tries shovelling this through mid-wicket, only to get a thick inside edge onto pad
Laughlin to Washington Sundar, no run, tries backing away to this off-cutter but it grips and climbs on him, leaving him puzzled. He can only fend it down the pitch
Laughlin to Washington Sundar, wide, wild delivery down the leg-side, at least a couple of feet away from Sundar
Laughlin to Mandeep, 1 run, back to the off-pace delivery, pulled through backward square
Laughlin to Mandeep, FOUR, normal pace from Laughlin this time, Mandeep uses those extra 10kph and slices it away through backward point. Nicely done
Laughlin to Washington Sundar, 1 run, slower ball outside off, Sundar chips the drive through cover

Laughlin to Negi, out Caught by Buttler!! Done in by the off-cutter. Negi tries flicking it through mid-wicket, but there was enough cut on the ball to take a thick outside edge. Good take from Buttler diving forward, should help his bruised confidence. Negi c Buttler b Laughlin 3(4)
Gowtham to Mandeep, no run, fired in on leg, 103kph, beats Mandeep for pace in his attempted pull and strikes the pad
Gowtham to Negi, 1 run, fired in short, holds up on Negi as he clips it through mid-wicket
Gowtham to Mandeep, 1 run, darting them in now, back of length outside off, chopped to backward point
Gowtham to Negi, 1 run, skidding on from a back of length, Negi rushes into the pull through backward square
Gowtham to Mandeep, 1 run, cut away through point
Gowtham to Mandeep, SIX, nailed over long-on. Gentle off-break from Gowtham which is right in the slot. Mandeep grounds his back knee and wallops it through the line

Shreyas Gopal to Mandeep, 1 run, miscued in the air, drops short of deep mid-wicket. There's something about these short ones from Gopal today, it has tended to produce the mistimed shots. Mandeep gets away
Shreyas Gopal to Mandeep, no run, stays flat-footed and tries for a late dab against this leg-break, but the ball fizzes past the outside edge
Shreyas Gopal to Negi, 1 run, turns it behind square for one

Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, out Caught by Unadkat!! Shreyas Gopal has turned this game right on its head. First Kohli, and now de Villiers. RR should really back themselves from here. Another half-tracker really, but de Villiers doesn't get hold of his pull and hits it straight towards long leg. Unadkat seemed to have misjudged it initially, but he's able to make amends by taking an excellent low catch. Wry smile on de Villiers's face. He could have hit this anywhere. Just not his day. de Villiers c Unadkat b Shreyas Gopal 20(18) [4s-1 6s-1]
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, no run, hangs back again, the ball does stay a touch low but he probably should have been forward. Misses out on the cut
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, no run, doesn't look like he's picking him. Stays back in the crease to a length ball, reads the leg-brteak late and then defends
Unadkat to de Villiers, 1 run, looks to take on the slower ball but miscues it down towards long-on

Unadkat to de Villiers, FOUR, slower back of length ball again, this time there's a little bit of width which allows AB to carve it away between backward point and short third man. It was uppish, but the placement was spot on
Unadkat to Mandeep, 1 run, back of a length delivery at the stumps, off-pace ball again, Mandeep nudges it round the corner
Unadkat to de Villiers, 1 run, slower length ball on off, AB hops to leg and powers this to long-off. No real timing
Unadkat to Mandeep, 1 run, slower back of length delivery outside off, dabbed down to third man
Unadkat to de Villiers, 1 run, back of a length delivery slanted across off, punched to sweeper cover
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, 1 run, pushes the leg-break through on middle and leg, AB clips it down to long-on
Shreyas Gopal to Mandeep, 1 run, cut away through the covers
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, 1 run, flat at the stumps, worked to long-on
Shreyas Gopal to Mandeep, 1 run, pushes it down to long-off

Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, out Caught by D Arcy Short!! He's got him, he's got him. Shreyas Gopal is running around with an arm raised. Pretty much a half-tracker which Kohli pulls in the vicinity of deep mid-wicket. It's D'Arcy Short there, who leaps across for an excellent take. Oh what a game-changer this. Kohli c D Arcy Short b Shreyas Gopal 57(30) [4s-6 6s-2]
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, 1 run, eyes a sweep but recognizes the length isn't there and then adjusts to push down to long-off
Laughlin to de Villiers, 1 run, wants to sweep it but then decides to drag it down to long-on
Laughlin to de Villiers, SIX, only one hand on that. Full length delivery outside off, de Villiers goes for it with full swing and manages to clear covers
Laughlin to de Villiers, no run, fullish in length around off, de Villiers does well to keep that out
Laughlin to Kohli, 1 run, plays the length delivery to deep mid-wicket and takes a single

Laughlin to Kohli, no run, yes-no-yes-no! It's all happening here. Kohli squeezed out the yorker nicely but de Villiers was almost half way done in his quest to complete the run, Buttler overruns and makes a mess out of it again, misses out on a run out chance. de Villiers is living a charmed life tonight!
Laughlin to de Villiers, 1 run, full length delivery around off, de Villiers who was looking to scoop it makes last minute adjustments and drags it to wide mid-wicket

Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, SIX, insult to injury! Missed on a wicket on the last ball and goes for a six on the very next ball. Shortish delivery, a half-tracker and Kohli pummels it over wide long-on for a towering six, that was huge again

Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, byes, 1 run, missed stumping! How costly will this prove to be? Oh, Buttler what have you done! de Villiers can hurt you, big time. de Villiers came down the wicket to play this but got deceived in the flight but the keeper can't gather it. What a big let off!
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, no run, floated delivery around off, de Villiers does well to block it
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, 2 runs, goes down on his knee to sweep the loopy delivery away to deep mid-wicket, a fine effort in the field saves a certain boundary
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, no run, almost chips it to short mid-wicket, a lot of flight on that and de Villiers flicks it towards short mid-wicket, almost chips it as he is early on to his shot
Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, 1 run, 31st IPL fifty for Kohli! RCB want him to get a big one tonight, he's not done yet. Was a loopy delivery that was driven down to long-on

D Arcy Short to de Kock, out Caught by Unadkat!! Failed with the bat earlier today but makes up for it with this huge wicket. Bowls a shortish delivery on the pads and de Kock who looks to put it away with a pull finds the fielder in the deep, it's Unadkat who grabs it. Wait on... it's AB who walks out to bat in next. Get ready for some more fireworks! de Kock c Unadkat b D Arcy Short 26(19) [4s-4]
D Arcy Short to Kohli, 1 run, darted on the pads and Kohli tickles it away to deep square leg, only a single
D Arcy Short to de Kock, 1 run, flatter one outside off, de Kock punches it away to sweeper cover
D Arcy Short to Kohli, 1 run, whips the tossed up delivery away to deep mid-wicket

D Arcy Short to Kohli, SIX, smoked it! Kohli's one hand came off but then too he manages to get a six. One hand or two hands, doesn't matter. Was a floated delivery around off and Kohli towered it over long-on
D Arcy Short to de Kock, 1 run, fires in a quick delivery but down the leg side, de Kock pulls it away to deep mid-wicket
Shreyas Gopal to de Kock, 1 run, shortish in length again and it's de Kock who turns that away to deep mid-wicket this time around
Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, 1 run, tossed up delivery on middle and leg, Kohli whips it away to deep mid-wicket
Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, no run, flighted delivery around middle and off, Kohli plays across the line and gets rapped on the pads. Lbw appeal turned down by the umpire there
Shreyas Gopal to Kohli, FOUR, right into the gap there! Shortish delivery on middle and leg, Kohli goes back and pulls it with authority beating the man at deep mid-wicket
Shreyas Gopal to de Kock, byes, 1 run, there wasn't an edge there, was turning away from de Kock and he tried to cut it, gets beaten and Buttler fails to gather it too
Shreyas Gopal to de Kock, no run, tossed up delivery off and de Kock knocks it back to the bowler, in fact miscues it back to him
Stokes to Kohli, 2 runs, 64 runs off the powerplay! Bowled outside the off-stump channel and Kohli guides it past backward point and ends the over with a couple of runs
Stokes to Kohli, wide, that's pressure, a slower delivery gone wrong and sprayed down the leg side

Stokes to Kohli, FOUR, can't bowl such freebies to a batsman of this class. It's a juicy full toss outside off, Kohli brings his bat down in time and angles it past the fielder at point, he's toying with the field here, finding those gaps with ease
Stokes to Kohli, 2 runs, another slower delivery, on the pads this time around middle and leg, Kohli waits for it and flicks it to the wide of mid-wicket as he gets two more
Stokes to de Kock, 1 run, slower delivery and full in length outside off, drives it tamely through covers for a single
Stokes to Kohli, 1 run, 50-run stand up with that single as Kohli drags it away to deep mid-wicket, the crowd thought it was in the gap, but it wasn't
Stokes to Kohli, FOUR, "welcome into the attack Mr Stokes," says Kohli. Picks the length on that short one early and makes sure to pummel it over mid-wicket, he's in the zone guys.
Gowtham to de Kock, no run, short and quick around off, de Kock chops it to cover-point

Gowtham to de Kock, FOUR, another one! The bowlers have no answers to this brilliance by the RCB pair. The left hand - right hand combination is make it difficult for the bowlers. This was floated on middle and de Kock went down on his knee to sweep it through square leg
Gowtham to de Kock, FOUR, there's no stopping these two. Tossed up delivery around off, de Kock reaches for it with a shimmy and times his chip over long-off, quality shot
Gowtham to Kohli, 1 run, another pushed through delivery on middle and leg, Kohli drags it away to deep mid-wicket, he won't be pleased with that shot, was meant to be put away to the fence
Gowtham to de Kock, 1 run, sharp off spin on that, pitches on middle and turns away sharply as de Kock gets a leading edge to point
Gowtham to Kohli, 1 run, tossed up delivery around off, Kohli shimmies down the wicket and wrists it down to long-on
Unadkat to Kohli, 1 run, another change up delivery, slower in pace around off and it's Kohli who gets a single in the similar way, with a gentle push in front of cover-point
Unadkat to de Kock, 1 run, slow in pace and on a length around off, de Kock taps it in front of point for a single
Unadkat to de Kock, no run, fires in a full length delivery around middle and leg, de Kock who was moving across can only squeeze it to wide mid-off, good delivery by Unadkat there
Unadkat to de Kock, FOUR, beautiful! Pitches it on middle and leg, de Kock makes sure to send it to the long-on fence with a fine on-drive, RCB... RCB... are the chants all across the stadium

Unadkat to de Kock, 2 runs, poor line by Unadkat on that delivery. Full one and on the pads, de Kock has no trouble to flick it through mid-wicket, the fielder is quite squarer hence can't stop the second
Unadkat to Kohli, 1 run, length delivery angled away from the batsman around off, Kohli dabs it towards cover and sets off for a quick run, manages to get it

Gowtham to de Kock, FOUR, first one of the innings for de Kock. He has joined the skipper now. Flatter in trajectory and outside off, de Kock doesn't miss out on it and slaps it through the gap at covers, he needs to play along with Kohli if RCB want to make a match out of it. Can't be chased alone this target
