Gowtham to de Kock, no run, flatter on middle and leg, nudged to short mid-wicket by de Kock
Gowtham to Kohli, 1 run, takes a single by tapping the tossed up delivery down to long-on
Gowtham to Kohli, no run, tossed up on middle and leg, tucked towards short mid-wicket
Gowtham to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli continues to deal in boundaries. Rocks back, picks the length early and punches it through the gap at covers again, away she goes, into the fence
Gowtham to de Kock, 1 run, a low full toss around off, de Kock drives it to wide mid-off for a single
D Kulkarni to de Kock, 1 run, slower in pace around middle and leg, de Kock tucks it towards short fine leg and gets his first run
D Kulkarni to Kohli, 1 run, gets off the strike, eases the length delivery towards wide long-on and takes a single

D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, another impressive shot. After two shots on the off-side, Kohli gets one through the on side. Moves towards the pitch of the delivery, keeps his eyes on the ball and flicks it over mid-wicket. Three boundaries already in the over. This is going to be an exciting run chase if Kohli keeps playing like this

D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, Chinnaswamy erupts as Kohli smokes one. Backs away, reaches for it and slams the length delivery over covers, one bounce and into the fence. Was middled to perfection, sweet sound of the willow too
D Kulkarni to Kohli, no run, on a length and outside off, Kohli comes forward again and knocks it to cover

D Kulkarni to Kohli, FOUR, elegance personified there. Full length delivery outside off, Kohli walks down the track and creams his drive, through the gap at cover and there's no stopping that, such was the precision in the placement
Gowtham to Kohli, 1 run, the RCB skipper gets off the mark with an easy single down to long-on, was a flighted delivery on middle and leg
Gowtham to Kohli, no run, tossed up delivery again spinning into the batsman, Kohli tries to nudge that away, gets struck on the pad though, was going down the leg side that

Gowtham to Brendon McCullum, out Caught by Stokes!! Whatta catch that! Eye-candy that take was. Was a short delivery around off, McCullum rocked back and pulled it hard to deep mid-wicket where Stokes timed his jump and he was in the air as he reverse cupped it. Probably one of the best catches of the season. Brendon McCullum c Stokes b Gowtham 4(4) [4s-1]
Gowtham to Brendon McCullum, no run, spinning delivery into the batsman and McCullum nudged it towards short mid-wicket
Gowtham to Brendon McCullum, no run, floated on middle and leg, tucked to the on side by McCullum

Gowtham to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, McCullum is off the mark and so is RCB, that too in style. Short and wide outside off, Brendon punches it hard towards cover and a misfield by Samson results in a boundary. He has scored 91* but can't take fielding lightly
U Yadav to Samson, 1 run, almost in the blockhole, Samson jams it out towards cover for a single. Despite this anti-climax, what a finish from RR! They end on 217/4! Brilliant finish!

U Yadav to Samson, SIX, this time over deep extra cover! Incredible stuff from Samson, it's been an exhibition from him this afternoon. Full and wide outside off, he just makes room to lift it over the sweeper cover fence for a boundary. Unstoppable!
U Yadav to Samson, SIX, no stopping Samson here! As if he needed a Free Hit to hit them big. Very full from Yadav and Samson gets under it with ease, clubbed comfortably over long-off. Ho ho ho!!

U Yadav to Tripathi, no ball, 1 run, good slower ball but he has overstepped! And by some distance too! Not Umesh's day at all. Tripathi swings through mid-wicket for a single. Free Hit coming and it's Samson to face it
U Yadav to Tripathi, FOUR, bleeding runs! Slower and short, the leg stump line doesn't help and Tripathi swivels to pull it easily over square leg. Another boundary

U Yadav to Tripathi, SIX, H-U-G-E! For a change, it's not Samson who hits a biggie. The young Tripathi joins in the fun now and boy, he has clubbed this almost into the top tier of the ground. Slower and fuller, tries to follow the batsman but Tripathi is equal to the task. Makes room and clubs it easily over long-on. The crowd had to take cover there
U Yadav to Tripathi, 2 runs, fuller ball on the pads, Tripathi makes a bit of space on the leg-side and swings through mid-wicket. In the gap and they get two

Woakes to Samson, FOUR, didn't I tell you that this is his day? Samson survives once more. Fuller ball and he goes for the lofted stroke over cover. For a moment, the man at sweeper cover thought he had a chance but was late I guess. Put in a late dive and it bounced before him, then sped through to the fence

Woakes to Samson, FOUR, gets it away very, very fine! Didn't intend to get it that fine perhaps but he won't mind, will he? The perfect yorker from Woakes but Samson digs it out with an open bat face. Manages to slice itwell past a diving de Kock to the fence. When it's your day, it's just your day!

Woakes to Samson, SIX, hammered into long-on! Samson's merry ways continue. He is batting on another level now. Slower ball on a shortish length, he just waits for it and slaps through the line. No real effort there, at least not visible but gee the timing, ever so perfect! Another biggie
Woakes to Tripathi, 1 run, Woakes' yorkers have been bang on today, most of the time. Another perfect one and Tripathi can only jam it towards cover. Gets off strike

Woakes to Buttler, out Caught by Kohli!! Soft dismissal! Woakes tried the yorker but ended up delivering a pacy low full toss. Buttler just tried to check the lofted stroke, perhaps got a touch late on it and ended up chipping it straight to mid-off where the RCB skipper swallowed it up. He's wearing an animated look on his face as well. Vital wicket this for RCB, Buttler could easily have a made a difference of about 10 runs. Buttler c Kohli b Woakes 23(14) [4s-2 6s-1]
Woakes to Buttler, 2 runs, full toss outside off, Buttler carves it over point with a slice. Sweeper cover has a bit of work to do and Jos eggs Samson back for the second

Khejroliya to Samson, SIX, Samsonnnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn! What quality strokeplay! Fullish ball around middle and leg, Samson makes room by backing away lot and just goes through with the extension of the loft down the ground. Such timing and over long-off again it is, deeper this time. 16 off the over!

Khejroliya to Samson, SIX, what a beautiful shot! Jeepers, this kid is such a delight to watch when on song. Such class! Full and outside off, his bat face did turn in his hands but he got it dead straight even then. Cleared long-off easily
Khejroliya to Buttler, 1 run, low full toss quite wide outside off, almost the perfect wide yorker and Buttler can only dig it out to sweeper cover
Khejroliya to Samson, 1 run, very full and on middle and leg, Samson cannot quite get under it. Drills it down to long-on
Khejroliya to Samson, 2 runs, full and on the pads, heaved away towards the right of deep mid-wicket. A couple of taken

Khejroliya to Samson, no run, sharp work by de Kock, he's been kepy busy behind the stumps today due to some good balls and equally bizarre ones. This was a full toss, close to being a waist high no ball and Samson somehow failed to connect. Good diving take by the keeper

Woakes to Buttler, SIX, deep into the crowd! Buttler has activated the beast mode, danger signs for RCB if they don't get him quickly. Back of a length around middle and off, Buttler sat on the back foot and smoked it way over deep mid-wicket. Huge biggie

Woakes to Samson, 1 run, another excellent yorker, it's been a top over from Woakes thus far. Samson squeezes it out towards point to get to his 8th IPL fifty! Is this the breakthrough season he wanted? Has definitely started that way

Woakes to Buttler, 1 run, fine wide yorker outside off, Buttler still managed to get a fair chunk on it as he sliced this through point. Couldn't get the placement well enough though, sweeper cover tidies up
Woakes to Samson, 1 run, very full and wide outside off, Samson opens the bat face to slice it down to third man

Woakes to Samson, SIX, just over deep mid-wicket! Slower and a fraction short from Woakes, Samson sits on the back foot and went through with the pull shot. Didn't quite middle this as much as he would have wanted, still got it over McCullum who tried with all his might
Woakes to Samson, no run, lovely yorker, off-stump line and Samson cannot do much except dig it out

U Yadav to Samson, 1 run, near escape for Samson! A direct hit at the bowler's end could have been curtains for him. Fuller ball on the pads, he clipped this straight to square leg and egged Buttler across for the run. Survives in the end as the shy missed the target
U Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, back of a length and Buttler rises on his toes to push it towards mid-off who is on the edge of the circle

U Yadav to Buttler, 2 runs, very full and on middle and leg, lovely wristwork by Buttler as he bisected long-on and deep mid-wicket nicely. McCullum stationed at the former position got across to parry it to Negi who tagged well in the effort. A couple of runs saved
U Yadav to Samson, 1 run, good work by Woakes at third man, dived to his right to save a few runs. Short and wide, Samson cut it away and sliced it towards the deep with a fair amount of timing
U Yadav to Samson, no run, full and on the pads, leans across and flicks it away towards mid-wicket
U Yadav to Samson, SIX, gobbles up the Free Hit! Umesh is having a horror day. This is a full toss on leg, Samson just shuffles a touch and mows it over deep mid-wicket. Deep into the crowd

U Yadav to Samson, no ball, there's another! This was almost a dangerous ball as well, probably slipped out of Umesh's hands. Ends up as a beamer and Samson did well get out of the way. Free Hit loading!
U Yadav to Samson, wide, shocker from Umesh right after the break. Spears this way down the leg-side, de Kock had to use his sharp reactive skills to stop this with a full length dive
Chahal to Samson, 1 run, slower and short outside off, sticks onto the surface a bit as Samson punches it off the back foot to sweeper cover
Chahal to Buttler, 1 run, slow leg break from a shorter length, Buttler waits for it to spin and slaps it towards deep extra cover
Chahal to Buttler, no run, another of Buttler's reverse sweep attempts, doesn't connect that well and this trickles towards point
Chahal to Buttler, wide, has to reload this one. Drags it wide outside off and past the tramline as well, left alone
Chahal to Samson, 1 run, quicker and fuller around off, drilled down the ground towards long-off
Chahal to Samson, no run, more turn! Negi got it last over, Chahal's chance this time. Lovely leg break very wide outside off, spins away further to beat Samson's expansive drive
Chahal to Samson, no run, flatter and on middle, Samson makes room and punches it towards point, cannot find the gap

Negi to Buttler, FOUR, edged but no slip! You don't expect one at this stage of a T20 inning either for most bowlers. Lovely piece of bowling from Negi, floated up nicely to invite the drive from Buttler and forced the edge as well. Too hard for de Kock and it raced past him to the fence
Negi to Buttler, no run, a hint of turn, on the shorter side and quite wide outside off as well, Buttler wanted to fetch it with a flick but mistimed it towards the short mid-wicket region
Negi to Samson, 1 run, drifting in on a length outside off, driven down the ground towards long-off
Negi to Samson, SIX, hammered away! Samson is on the rampage now. Of course, half-trackers like these help as well. Was on the back foot in a jiffy and smashed the pull over deep mid-wicket
Negi to Samson, no run, flatter and around off, low full toss and Samson drags it off the inner half down to long-on

Negi to Samson, 2 runs, in the air.......falls safe! Negi almost strikes with his first ball of the season. Slowed this down around off and Samson went for the lofted inside out stroke. Got a bit more height on it than he would have liked. Luckily for him, well short of sweeper cover

Chahal to Buttler, byes, FOUR, geee, that's beaten everyone! Comedy of errors really. Buttler went for premeditated paddle, de Kock anticipated and was en route to his left already but guess what, the stroke didn't connect and the ball went through the yawning gap between first slip and the keeper

Chahal to Samson, 1 run, off the outside half and was in the air for a while but well short of the man stationed at short third man. Slower and wider outside off, Samson made room for the cut but couldn't middle it. Will get a single though
Chahal to Buttler, 1 run, floated up around middle and leg, Buttler gets across and nudges it towards mid-wicket

Chahal to Buttler, FOUR, signature Buttler start! Wastes no time to get going. Brings out the reverse sweep and takes this on the full, makes enough connection to beat a diving backward point. Finds the fence

Chahal to Stokes, out Bowled!! Chopped on! Massive strike from Chahal, just like he did in his previous over. The leg spinner to a left-hander is always a double-edged sword, this wicket proves it. Slows this down and drags it wider outside off, Stokes wanted to fetch it with a slog sweep but only managed a thick under edge that clattered onto the woodwork. Just when this partnership was gearing up to go up another level, it was been halted. Stokes b Chahal 27(21) [4s-2 6s-1]
Chahal to Samson, 1 run, flatter and on leg stump, Samson nudges it towards the man at short fine leg, brisk single

Khejroliya to Stokes, 2 runs, excellent stuff from Woakes, saves a couple for his side. RCB's ground fielding has been superb today. This was an attempted yorker that turned into a low full toss on the pads, Stokes got a neat deflection that was racing away towards the fine leg fence but Woakes stationed a lot squarer made enough ground with a slide. Well done!
Khejroliya to Stokes, wide, full and angling in on leg, slides further down leg to beat Stokes' attempted flick

Khejroliya to Samson, 1 run, had to hurry! Negi at mid-wicket was quick to gather it and fire the throw at the bowler's end, misses though. Samson was a goner if it had hit! Back of a length ball around middle and leg, nudged towards the leg-side and promptly wanted the single. Could have been suicidal
Khejroliya to Stokes, 1 run, angling in on middle and leg, worked away through backward square leg
Khejroliya to Stokes, SIX, ahhhh, this is vintage Stokes! Back of a length around middle and leg, easy for him as he swivels just a touch before drop kicking this over deep fine leg. Easy pickings

Khejroliya to Stokes, FOUR, high quality shot! Why move around the in the crease and swipe when you can play shots like this. This was full and quite wide as well, Stokes played the square drive late to bisect short third man and backward point with precision. Top stuff!!

Khejroliya to Stokes, no run, he is really getting edgy out there, is Stokes. Gave the charge and make room for the big flat-batted stroke. Only managed a bottom edge that went on the bounce to de Kock
Washington Sundar to Stokes, 1 run, speared into the pads, Stokes gets across and clips it behind square leg for a run
Washington Sundar to Samson, 1 run, pushed through quicker and a touch short outside off, effortless back foot punch down to long-o
Washington Sundar to Stokes, 1 run, the cat-and-mouse game between Stokes and Sundar continues. The southpaw was backing away a lot but the offie followed him with a darter. Punched down to long-off
Washington Sundar to Stokes, no run, saw Stokes giving the charge and fired it with a stump to stump line, patted back towards the bowler
Washington Sundar to Samson, 1 run, flatter and just around off, wristed away down the ground to long-on

Washington Sundar to Samson, SIX, blimey, what a blow! Some momentum into the RR innings now. This was fired fuller around middle and leg, Samson held his shape and swung through the line. Sent it soaring over long-on for a biggie
U Yadav to Stokes, FOUR, that sitting up length. On the tummy, quite Stokes' staple. He stays up, lets it get in his arc and heaves. Those muscles .. through mid-wicket
U Yadav to Stokes, 2 runs, walks across, spots the pitch up and drills it through the covers. Only for a tumbling man at the deep to cut it off. Oh and that man is Kohli
U Yadav to Stokes, no run, charges, barely where he wants to be. But can't resist, mis-carves and luckily for him it doesn't carry to mid-off
U Yadav to Stokes, no run, 139kph, goes up tall, higher elbows in knocking a defence to short mid-wicket
U Yadav to Samson, 1 run, 132.9kph, on the hop up as he flicks one off his thighs from outside the line of off down to long-on. More of an airy chip
U Yadav to Stokes, 1 run, 138.2kph, one-handed, swinging through an on-drive

Washington Sundar to Stokes, 1 run, continues exposing his stumps, and three more of them with his shuffles. Sundar continues to follow him as well. Off the legs in tapping it through mid-wicket. Calm singles these
Washington Sundar to Samson, 1 run, on his toes, helping the slanter coming in round the corner
Washington Sundar to Stokes, 1 run, 87.1kph, slows. Stokes backing away, Sundar's stalking him. And both settle for a knock down the ground
Washington Sundar to Samson, 1 run, 100.8kph. Stands his guard, opens up his bat face to dab
Washington Sundar to Samson, no run, much flatter. Whipped out to short mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Stokes, 1 run, presses forward, and Sundar's slowed it up considerably. A checked defence down to long-off
Khejroliya to Stokes, 1 run, 138.3kph, shuffle, tall and a straight bat to run it down to long-on
Khejroliya to Samson, 1 run, gentle wrists, waiting on it to work it behind square
Khejroliya to Samson, SIX, spots the length. It's that in-between one, and Samson makes it look worse. Swivels, pulls and heaves without bothering to keep it down. All brute
Khejroliya to Samson, no run, leans into the drive, through the line to mid-off
Khejroliya to Stokes, 1 run, loads up a short arm jab of sorts. Early through it, quite what a premeditate does to you. Under-cuts it to the keeper's left
Khejroliya to Stokes, no run, sharp in-nipper. Stokes stays stuck, his feet refuse to move. Bat flicks all around it. But again .. the angle's taking it down
Chahal to Stokes, leg byes, 1 run, some shuffle, almost caught up in front of the stumps as he nudges. Never mind Quinton's appeal, it was always slipping well down

Chahal to D Arcy Short, out Caught by de Kock!! Oh dear. A teasing half-tracker, with generous width, asking to be slapped. Short does the needful, gets deep in the crease, lines up and throws his bat out in looking to cut it away. There's a hint of spit up, enough to grope a fat chunk on the top-edge. And Quinton's ever-so-sharp. D Arcy Short c de Kock b Chahal 11(17) [4s-1]
Chahal to D Arcy Short, no run, floaty wide tease. Massive drive, nails it too. Couldn't have found cover better
Chahal to Samson, 1 run, pulls his length back. All the time for Samson to get deep, punch it back down
Chahal to Samson, no run, low again on the drive, opens up his bat face, steering it eventually to short third man
Chahal to Samson, no run, a hint of drift into leg. And short cover cuts off Samson's drive. And Chinnaswamy errupts. Guess who's there ..
Woakes to Samson, 1 run, on a good length around the fourth stump channel. Angled-batted punch, sweeper again. First runs
Woakes to D Arcy Short, 1 run, on his toes, riding the bounce to punch it through sweeper
Woakes to D Arcy Short, wide, full, gaining in angle as it flies down leg. Past the flick

Woakes to Rahane, out Caught by U Yadav!! There's the miscue. It was coming. This entire stay was so un-Rahane. Slogging, but with good reason. So he gets a fuller-slower one now, he's camping on his back foot, goes to smoke it straight over. Doesn't time, gets it off the bottom half, flies high. And down mid-on's backtracking reverse cup. Rahane c U Yadav b Woakes 36(20) [4s-6 6s-1]

Woakes to Rahane, FOUR, he's toying around. May his leg never recover. Makes Woakes bowl straight, threatening a move around. But sways inside the line, flat-batted and hammers it round the corner. Pile on the powerplay

Woakes to D Arcy Short, 1 run, first the crack in timing. And then the dive to cut it off. Woakes messes up the shorter one, allows Short to pull. But Mandeep's sweeping deep mid-wicket, and he dives one-handed, keeps out the rebound from rolling over too
Woakes to Rahane, 1 run, makes him stretch, and Rahane obliges in slapping it through sweeper
Chahal to D Arcy Short, FOUR, oh these nice float-ups. Short ain't getting foxed, lets it dip. Loads up. Might swing. And flat down the ground
Chahal to D Arcy Short, no run, reaches low to adjust to the drift in helping it out to cover
Chahal to Rahane, 1 run, follows his feet moving away. Drilled to long-on

Chahal to Rahane, FOUR, on the sweep. Never mind the top-edge, the powerplay is his ally. His stride doesn't quite get him to the pitch of it, the spin's big too. But these big bats allow him to clear square leg, and that's enough
Chahal to Rahane, no run, 80.3kph, backs, stabs, point
Chahal to D Arcy Short, 1 run, floated up on middle, helped along with the turn. Thank the wrists
U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, hoick. Mid-wicket. Again. It's getting familiar. Another friendly length for Rahane to get under and smoke it down
U Yadav to Rahane, wide, the other side now. Rahane continues walking away, Umesh throws it outside off. A little too much
U Yadav to Rahane, no run, follows the moving away Rahane, ties him up. Can only keep it out
U Yadav to Rahane, FOUR, backs away in the crease, converts it into one in his slot and goes all bottom-handed in lofting into cow corner. One way of avoiding run-outs

U Yadav to D Arcy Short, 1 run, the confusion. Version three of the afternoon. So Short whacks it to deep mid-wicket. And he shows sympathy for Rahane's injured knee. Rahane doesn't want any, runs half way down, and back
U Yadav to D Arcy Short, no run, 130.6kph, middle. Cramps Short up for room, nipping back in as he's hurried into a bunt to leg
U Yadav to Rahane, 1 run, 133.3kph, in the fifth stump channel, getting a hint of away swing as well. Rahane lines, waits late, lets the ball get parallel and guides it down to third man
Washington Sundar to Rahane, 1 run, the typical dart on the pads. Rahane turns it round the corner, doesn't turn the strike
Washington Sundar to Rahane, SIX, now downtown. Sundar overcorrects going fuller, Rahane steps away, gives his hands room. And they swing, into the sightscreen
Washington Sundar to Rahane, FOUR, thank the injury. When you can't run, you slog. Rahane sits, uses the line already down leg to sweep. Hard. Behind square. One-bounced
Washington Sundar to D Arcy Short, 1 run, polite tuck, using the angle to deep mid-wicket. Rahane's running gingerly
Washington Sundar to Rahane, 1 run, on the move, takes it on the full and carves it to mid-off, who for some reason is very deep
Washington Sundar to D Arcy Short, 1 run, 103.5kph, quick, flat, on leg. Nurdled, wristly in front of square
Woakes to Rahane, no run, 117.5kph. Slower sucker, full, swinging away. Squirted out off the outside half behind point. And some usual running confusion
Woakes to D Arcy Short, 1 run, he's off. Five troubled balls, and a drop in front of cover point to sneak a quickie
Woakes to D Arcy Short, no run, wobbly seamed, groping up some extra steam off a length, kicking well over Short's flat-footed flash
Woakes to Rahane, leg byes, 1 run, 135.7kph, shuffles big time for a clip off his thighs. Misses. Enough for a ricochet nevertheless
Woakes to Rahane, FOUR, juicy. He's in some weird mood, happy to go horizontally right away, gets that length that sits up, hoping to be smacked. Obliged. Airy over mid-wicket
Woakes to Rahane, no run, hits the hard good length, a touch sticky for Rahane's toed-glance to come out right. Leading-edges it back onto the pitch
Woakes to Rahane, wide, 132.8kph, well down leg. The wide of the crease not helping the line either, taking it further down
Washington Sundar to D Arcy Short, no run, doesn't even try to spin. Another slider, another watched defence. Cover this time
Washington Sundar to D Arcy Short, no run, 101.1kph, knocks it to mid-on. And yes-no-yes.. thankfully no. Some things never change
Washington Sundar to D Arcy Short, no run, around middle, this time the defence tap is down the pitch
Washington Sundar to D Arcy Short, no run, skidding on from round the wicket, Short stays back late, tickling it to leg
Washington Sundar to Rahane, 1 run, jumping down now. Wow. Goes after the not-so-short length in trying to pull. Under-halved out to long-on
Washington Sundar to Rahane, no run, starts with a reverse. Yeah, it's Rahane. Can't quite connect cleanly, off the inside half to point

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, SIX, he's hit this all the way but it won't matter - full ball outside off stump, Dhoni lofts it to over long-off. KXIP have escaped home by 4 runs. Oh these CSK games and run chases. They get so deep. You got to admire this man - MS Dhoni. Injured very early in the innings, takes some treatment, takes it upon himself and almost takes his side home.

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, no run, hit to deep backward point and it's been stopped at third man. Dhoni is not running, it's not happening tonight for CSK, the crowd go berserk and the KXIP management are relieved
Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, no run, the wide yorker and Dhoni can't make contact. It's a dot ball. Dhoni moved across but couldn't make contact

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, FOUR, he's squeezed this in the gap. There were three fielders behind square on the off-side - point, backward point and short third man, yet Dhoni finds the gap. Can't blame the bowler for bowling a wide yorker, he bowled to the field
Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, wide, he's tried to repeat the wide yorker but goes beyond the wide line. 15 needed off 4. Gee, this is tense
Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, no run, that's a clever ball, full and wide outside off stump, Dhoni can't stretch his back because of the injury and he swings and misses
Mohit Sharma to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, he gets the yorker right, Bravo swings to deep square leg, Dhoni doesn't want the second, wants the strike

Andrew Tye to Dhoni, SIX, can you believe it? An injured MS Dhoni has hit a six with one hand. Take a bow sir! Low full toss, no one at deep square, Dhoni backs himself, has an excellent willow in his hand and swings across the line and over the boundary line
Andrew Tye to Dhoni, 2 runs, low full toss and Dhoni mistimes this hit, chipped to long-off, not to hand and he limps back for the second

Andrew Tye to Dhoni, FOUR, talk about presence of mind and there's Dhoni with a bit of deftness. Short ball with third man inside the ring, unbelievable from the bowler. Dhoni spots the field, just guides the ball over the infield to the third man fence. Sehwag smiles from the dug out

Andrew Tye to Dhoni, SIX, smashedddd! Why are you not bowling slower balls Andrew Tye? Strange! Length ball, goodbye! You are asking for trouble. Dhoni actially felt some pain after launching this over deep mid-wicket

Andrew Tye to Jadeja, out Caught by Ashwin!! That's mistimed and only goes as far as cover. Normal seam-up delivery, full again for a big hit, Jadeja wanted to go over long-off, sliced it high in the air and the KXIP makes no mistake. Important thing is Dhoni has crossed over and will be on strike now. Jadeja c Ashwin b Andrew Tye 19(13) [4s-1 6s-1]
Andrew Tye to Dhoni, 1 run, oh he's missed a big hit here. Full and outside off stump, better of going over cover but knowing Dhoni, he believes in muscling the ball rather than lofting over cover

Mohit Sharma to Jadeja, SIX, he's smoked that away, Jaddu! This is the second time he's hit a big shot despite being off balance. Slower delivery from Mohit Sharma, Jadeja somehow connects and gets enough power to clear long-on

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, 1 run, that was a wide ball but Dhoni chose to have a swing at it, mistimed with one hand to long-off and that's fifty for the captain. No celebrations but he gets a big applause from everyone

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, SIX, oh that's gone a loooong way into the stands. Stand and deliver stuff! Full and in the slot, Mohit Sharma goes for the yorker, misses the yorker by some mark and Dhoni gets under it to send it over deep mid-wicket
Mohit Sharma to Jadeja, 1 run, wide slower ball and Jaddu can only toe-end it towards long-off
Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, 1 run, low full toss and Dhoni has hit this along the ground to wide long-off

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, FOUR, in the airrr, could be out, oh the fielder makes a mess of it. Low full toss, Dhoni slogs, should have been held at deep mid-wicket, Dagar the sub wasn't quick enough to move forward, he dived but let it pass. He's immediately moved out of that position

Andrew Tye to Jadeja, FOUR, oh that's a timely hit! Slower ball on the shorter side, Jadeja made room, lost balance but managed to cut that nicely over cover-point and there's no protection in the deep. 12 off the over, 55 more needed

Andrew Tye to Dhoni, 1 run, brute power but placement was needed. Juicy full ball, could have been chipped inside-out over cover, but decides to go for raw power and smashes it hard along the ground to long-off

Andrew Tye to Dhoni, FOUR, he's muscled that! Look at that ball go so flat and one bounce into the wide long-off fence. Slower delivery outside off stump, Dhoni steps out and the ball sat up nicely for Dhoni to free his arms and smash
Andrew Tye to Dhoni, wide, that's a slower ball gone wrong, way outside off stump, Dhoni lets it pass
Andrew Tye to Jadeja, 1 run, steps out and pulls this short ball to fine leg
Andrew Tye to Dhoni, 1 run, oh that ball almost knocked Jadeja's head out. Hit so hard to long-on from a fuller length, and Dhoni is still moving gingerly with that lower back
Andrew Tye to Dhoni, no run, beaten! Good luck reading Andrew Tye's slower ones. Dhoni had no clue about this one on a fuller length, played and missed
Barinder to Jadeja, 2 runs, and now he hits a full toss to hand at deep cover, maybe not his day! And look at Dhoni racing across the pitch with an injured back
Barinder to Jadeja, no run, another dot ball. Asking rate above 15, Jadeja has scored 5 off 7, not what CSK wanted. Wide yorker outside off stump, dug out to backward point
Barinder to Jadeja, 2 runs, KXIP won't mind this. Jadeja struggling to meet short balls, mistimed pull to backward square leg and what's more concerning is MS Dhoni still stretching his lower back
Barinder to Jadeja, wide, harsh call for a wide. That's wide outside off stump, maybe over the line, marginal

Barinder to Jadeja, 2 runs, steeply rising short of a length delivery, Jadeja mistimes the pull to backward square leg. Oh hang on, run-out check here. KL Rahul calmly just collected the ball with his left hand and knocked the bails off, but Jadeja was home
Barinder to Jadeja, wide, the slower ball goes down the leg-side, so Jadjea gets that extra ball
Barinder to Jadeja, no run, wide full ball and Jadeja can't put bat on ball. Precious dot ball, Jadeja shadow-practices the slice he wanted to play originally
Barinder to Dhoni, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Dhoni cuts it to sweeper cover
Ashwin to Dhoni, 1 run, wanted to tickle it fine, gets an inside edge onto pad and it rolls to short fine leg
Ashwin to Jadeja, 1 run, back to the off-spin action for Jadeja, on the leg stump, glanced to backward square leg
Ashwin to Dhoni, 1 run, short and slow, probably expected Dhoni to advance, but the captain just flat-bats this from the crease to long-off

Ashwin to Dhoni, SIX, that's why he eats those dots. He knows he can make up for it big time. Flighted delivery on the leg stump, Dhoni gets down on one knee and slog-sweeps it from the middle of the bat over square leg
Ashwin to Dhoni, no run, another dot from the captain. Stands tall and tries to muscle the ball, cut to cover
Ashwin to Dhoni, no run, highly optimistic LBW appeal, the flipper again, hit on the pad, missing leg

Barinder to Jadeja, no run, another mix-up, it's Ashwin again but this time Jadeja had enough time to rush back. Why would you run after hitting a ball straight to hand. The slower ball and Jadeja tapped it towards short mid-wicket. Great comeback from Barinder after being hit for a six. Just 6 of the over in total
Barinder to Jadeja, no run, guides the short of length delivery to backward point

Barinder to Rayudu, out Rayudu Run Out!! Mix-up and the captain fires a direct-hit from extra-cover. Look at him roar. CSK's best batsman on show thus far has been sent back. Massive setback. Rayudu drove this full ball straight to Ashwin at extra-cover and set off, Dhoni said no straightaway - probably because of the niggle on the lower back. But Rayudu had already covered a lot of distance and Ashwin's throw was spot on. Rayudu run out (Ashwin) 49(35) [4s-5 6s-1]

Barinder to Rayudu, no run, now that is a brilliant comeback by Barinder. Rayudu didn't read that back-of-the slower ball, jumped out and also made room, Barinder bowled wide outside off stump and Rayudu, who had a long way to cover, let it pass

Barinder to Rayudu, SIX, finally a maximum! The asking rate is up high, the runs weren't flowing and Rayudu gets a much needed six. Read the slower ball very early, moved across the stumps and waited for the short ball to come and smashed the ball into the backward square leg fence

Barinder to Rayudu, no run, that's a very good delivery from Barinder, saw Rayudu racing down the pitch and cramped him for room with a short of length delivery very close to the body, Rayudu only manages to play it back to the bowler
Ashwin to Rayudu, 1 run, Rayudu comes down the track again, but can't get the connection right on this big hit, the ball rolls to long-off
Ashwin to Dhoni, 1 run, fullish and outside off stump, Dhoni guides it towards point
Ashwin to Rayudu, 1 run, knocked away to backward square leg
Ashwin to Dhoni, leg byes, 1 run, appeal for LBW, not given and rightly so, this flipper was slipping down the leg-side
Ashwin to Rayudu, 1 run, steps out but manages to adjust to the shortened length and drives to sweeper cover
Ashwin to Dhoni, 1 run, the flatter trajectory for this leggie, Dhoni backs away and cuts to backward point
Mujeeb to Rayudu, 2 runs, fullish and on the stumps, Rayudu pulls it to deep mid-wicket, can't split the fielders there
Mujeeb to Dhoni, 1 run, low full toss and Dhoni drives it to deep cover, Dhoni still stretching his back after taking that run
Mujeeb to Dhoni, no run, beaten, the quicker delivery outside off stump, Dhoni was late on the cut shot, could so easily have been the edge to the keeper

Mujeeb to Dhoni, 2 runs, he's a rocket between the wickets. Dhoni taps this leg-side delivery to fine leg, calls Rayudu through for the second run and beats the direct-hit. Slight pause in play, looks like Dhoni has hurt his back in that rush for the second. Does some stretching and then he's ready to carry on
Mujeeb to Rayudu, 1 run, the googly and the batsman stays back to punch the ball away to long-off
Mujeeb to Dhoni, 1 run, back footed push into the off-side for a single as the ball skidded on

Andrew Tye to Dhoni, 1 run, fuller length delivery outside off and has been pushed away to deep cover with an open face of the bat for a single. Still 104 needed off 54 balls. The required rate ain't going to rest at all
Andrew Tye to Rayudu, 1 run, slower delivery and the batsman picks the ball late. The batsman throws his hands into the push to long-off
Andrew Tye to Rayudu, FOUR, short ball, this time Yuvraj does not have time to react. The ball races away towards his right and into the fence
Andrew Tye to Dhoni, 1 run, short ball outside off and has been tapped away with a horizontal bat for a single. Yuvraj at point was slow to react
Andrew Tye to Rayudu, 1 run, stays behind a length ball and pushes the ball away into the off-side for a single
Andrew Tye to Dhoni, 1 run, cutter of a delivery and has been turned away into the on-side for a single
Mujeeb to Dhoni, 1 run, a hurried up flick, through mid-wicket
Mujeeb to Rayudu, 1 run, half a pull, getting into position to hack it into square leg in the deep
Mujeeb to Dhoni, 1 run, straighter. Quickly on the back foot to run it behind square
Mujeeb to Dhoni, no run, scoots along. Dhoni crouches, sticks his bat out, just about keeps it out
Mujeeb to Dhoni, no run, front of the hand stuff. Dhoni needs a sighter, settles to block it out
Mujeeb to Rayudu, 1 run, 94.7kph, shuffle, behind, punchy. Long-on
Ashwin to Dhoni, FOUR, oh the deft. Some width, Dhoni's surgical, waiting on it, shedding that brutal muscle, putting some nerves to use, dabbing it between point and short third
Ashwin to Rayudu, 1 run, an opened up steer, it's almost a punch square
Ashwin to Rayudu, wide, another lost line. Rayudu does his best to pile on with a heave
Ashwin to Rayudu, no run, genuine leg-break. Draws out Rayudu's outside edge on an uncertain poke, to short third man
Ashwin to Rayudu, wide, down leg, holding its line past the glance
Ashwin to Rayudu, FOUR, doesn't matter what spinner this is - it's a full toss, down leg. Rayudu's on a knee, sweeping, slogging, everything
Ashwin to Dhoni, 1 run, wants to charge, decides to rock back and stab it square
Ashwin to Rayudu, 1 run, 90kph, leggie, full on middle. Rayudu gets to the pitch of it with his lean, flicking into mid-wicket
Yuvraj to Rayudu, 1 run, 90kph, loop on middle. Down to long-on. Some single-milking taps these
Yuvraj to Dhoni, 1 run, slows it up, Dhoni works it through square leg off the back foot
Yuvraj to Dhoni, wide, fires it into the pads, but it doesn't turn, goes straight past the glance
Yuvraj to Dhoni, FOUR, drags the length down. Very defensively. Dhoni doesn't have time to pat things back tonight. He chases, hard, and powers it behind point
Yuvraj to Rayudu, 1 run, straighter on middle. Nudged away into mid-wicket
Yuvraj to Dhoni, 1 run, runs down right up. Not quite to the pitch, but doesn't hold back. Drills it, almost taking Rayudu's head with it to long-on
Yuvraj to Rayudu, 1 run, generous toss up, wide, sliced away through sweeper
Ashwin to Rayudu, 1 run, leg-spin. Rayudu goes against it to work it in front of square
Ashwin to Dhoni, 1 run, a sighter, straight-batting it to long-off

Ashwin to Billings, out Lbw!! Ashwin runs to appeal. He wants an LBW. But the umpire's given runs. When you are the skipper and the bowler, you don't consult anybody. We're upstairs. It started with Billings shuffling, exposing his stumps and sweeping. Ashwin smartly slips in the quicker one, bang in line with the stumps. UltraEdge shows no edge. And HawkEye shows it to crash into off. Massive review. Massive moment. Billings lbw b Ashwin 9(8) [4s-1]
Ashwin to Billings, no run, another leg-break. Slapped out to cover
Ashwin to Billings, 2 runs, leg-break. The run-up is a dead give away. Billings knows better, he runs down and knocks it into mid-wicket, into one of its wide gaps
Ashwin to Rayudu, 1 run, to long-off, off-break to start. Doesn't turn anyway. Deep in the crease to tap it straight back
Mujeeb to Rayudu, 1 run, with the turn coming in to whip it round the corner
Mujeeb to Rayudu, no run, another wrong 'un. Damn short for Rayudu to get deep, open up his stance in an attempted pulled launch. No connection. Thigh pad. Appeal. Down leg. Yes
Mujeeb to Rayudu, no run, sliding in with the angle. Rayudu waits, checks his push square
Mujeeb to Billings, 1 run, shuffles behind, adjusting to the skidder as he punches it wide of mid-on

Mujeeb to Billings, FOUR, a heap of runs. A half-tracker, then the googly starting from middle and spinning well down leg. Billings isn't happy pocketing a wide, he reaches leg-sided, connects and heaves it into fine leg
Mujeeb to Rayudu, 1 run, draws the edge. Loopy outside off, enticing a drive. Where's the slip?
Andrew Tye to Billings, 2 runs, too full, curving into the pads as well. Whipped away, that bottom hand helping matters too. Square leg
Andrew Tye to Billings, no run, some extra steam off the pitch. Billings adjusts, calmly stabbing it to point
Andrew Tye to Billings, no run, 130.5kph, drags the line from around off to flick it around to short mid-wicket
Andrew Tye to Rayudu, 1 run, lines up, dabbing it down to third man

Andrew Tye to Rayudu, FOUR, too straight. Never an ideal follow up delivery, never an ideal any delivery. Rayudu's quick to pounce, shuffles inwards and tucks, splitting the gap between the keeper and short fine

Andrew Tye to Vijay, out Caught by Barinder!! So damn ungainly. Vijay sheds his grace, well you have to when you are chasing 200, ends up one-handed. So it was the knuckle ball, Tye's staple, Vijay gets down the track in trying to dispatch it into long-off. Loses shape, loses timing, and Sran's there at mid-off, waiting to gobble up the skier. Vijay c Barinder b Andrew Tye 12(10) [6s-1]
Mohit Sharma to Vijay, 1 run, tummy-lined. Worked away through square leg. Eight an over is quiet
Mohit Sharma to Rayudu, 1 run, cramps him up with the in-nip. Blunted out in front of cover
Mohit Sharma to Rayudu, FOUR, on the charge, converts the length into his arc and on-tonks. Not the legs, but nobody's cutting this off with nobody in the vicinity of long-on
Mohit Sharma to Vijay, 1 run, rides the bounce, but there's a hint of a stick in the pitch, forcing Vijay to check his on-the-up punch. Wide of mid-off eventually
Mohit Sharma to Rayudu, 1 run, 136.9kph, punches it into the turf, lets the bounce take it over Mohit. And then the single
Mohit Sharma to Rayudu, no run, 137.3kph, fullish on the stumps. Rayudu gets behind, chipping an on-drive to mid-on
Barinder to Vijay, SIX, roll back the clock - it's that Vijay of the old. Sran goes short, eventually sitting up and Vijay smokes, flat-batting it big into cow corner
Barinder to Vijay, 2 runs, 125kph, opens up his drive, steery rather through point
Barinder to Rayudu, 1 run, another shuffle, nudged away neatly in front of square
Barinder to Rayudu, FOUR, all timing. Back, lining himself behind and drills it to mid-off's right. Ashwin isn't the quickest, manages a palm. The outfield isn't Punjab's ally either
Barinder to Vijay, 1 run, 100.6kph. Slow, Vijay stays back, has no pace to work around with, poking it to point
Barinder to Vijay, no run, walks across to try and flick it round the corner. Misses

Mohit Sharma to Watson, out Caught by Barinder!! Too cute, and that's never ideal. Mohit gets his line wrong, slipping into the legs, but he's neatly disguised this slower back-hander. Watson's fooled as he loads up and commits to swipe it, knowing there's nobody at fine leg. Goes through early, gets a fat splice and short fine pockets the balloon. Watson c Barinder b Mohit Sharma 11(9) [4s-2]
Mohit Sharma to Watson, no run, 137.5kph, around the good length. Watson tries opening his dab behind point. Nah, the timing ain't there
Mohit Sharma to Watson, no run, nice high elbows, carving it out to point

Mohit Sharma to Watson, FOUR, 137.7kph. Turns cheeky. Mohit tries to correct, getting the channel close to off, but Watson's not getting foxed. He stays back, arches and ramps it ever so late, teasing the man at short third
Mohit Sharma to Watson, FOUR, throws his hands out. He's already given himself width with his exposed stance. Swings, uppish and slices it with ease over point. Never mind the mistime
Mohit Sharma to Watson, no run, 136.2kph, length, off-stumped. Driven on the up, bottom-handing it to extra cover
Barinder to Watson, 1 run, too straight. So Sran's hit every line in his spell. Tickled away to short fine this time, and quick legs
Barinder to Vijay, 1 run, 136.8kph, fuller, on middle. Flicked away in front of square. Some runs in yellow after a four year exile
Barinder to Watson, 1 run, width. Watson goes one-legged, riding and cutting it over point. Mujeeb sweeps across from third man, sticks a palm out. And the ball finds it
Barinder to Vijay, leg byes, 1 run, 132.9kph, on the pads now. Vijay misses it as well, falling over on his glance. He'll pocket ricochets, a couple of them through square leg
Barinder to Vijay, no run, 131.2kph, big shuffle, crisply timing his punch to cover. Oh the sound
Barinder to Vijay, wide, back falling away. Vijay not even keen on wasting a glance
Barinder to Watson, 1 run, 143.9kph. Hits his channel, off a back of a length around the fourth stump as it cramps Watson in. Bunted out, softly into off
Barinder to Watson, 3 wides, yea, some shape to start. But couldn't have got the radar any wrong-er. Down leg, swinging further down. KL can't collect either

Dwayne Bravo to Andrew Tye, 2 runs, 132.8kph, low full toss, meant to be the yorker, Tye stayed leg-side of the ball, cleared his front leg and hammered it to deep mid-wicket for a couple. Top-class stuff from Dwayne Bravo - just 4 runs and a wicket off the final over
Dwayne Bravo to Andrew Tye, no run, that's a mighty swing of the bat. He backed away a long way as well. It was the slower delivery and the ball went past his inside edge

Dwayne Bravo to Nair, out Caught by Jadeja!! Dwayne Bravo is good. He is too good, specially at the death. It's the slower back of a length delivery from Bravo. Nair knew that was coming, still couldn't put it away. Went deep in his crease and went too hard on the pull. Mistimed to deep mid-wicket. Straightforward catch for RJ. Nair c Jadeja b Dwayne Bravo 29(17) [4s-2 6s-1]
Dwayne Bravo to Andrew Tye, 1 run, yorker length, jams the drive to long-off
Dwayne Bravo to Andrew Tye, no run, Tye is bamboozled. 101.5kph slower ball, the cutter. Tye comes down the track and swings his bat hard. Connects with thin air
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, 1 run, clears the front leg and hacks over mid-wicket. Finds the man in the deep. Just a single

SN Thakur to Nair, 3 runs, drilled through covers and Chahar dives full length to his left to pull the ball back into play. And that's after sprinting across for a quite a long distance. In the end, saves a run

SN Thakur to Ashwin, out Caught by Dhoni!! Dhoni catches and Ashwin has to walk back to the dressing room. That's not something we are used to. A shortish ball, slightly off-paced and Ashwin was back and across to pull it away. Top-edges and MS runs towards the square leg region to snaffle that. Ashwin c Dhoni b SN Thakur 14(11) [6s-1]

SN Thakur to Ashwin, SIX, Vijay was waiting for the ball, but it goes over his head. A 62m six! Slightly wayward from Thakur. Short of a good length straying down leg, Ashwin stays deep and moves towards off to help it along its way. A superb pick-up shot over fine leg
SN Thakur to Nair, 1 run, knuckle ball, miscued pull to deep mid-wicket, who takes it on the bounce. Nair is not happy;  he reckons he should have put it away
SN Thakur to Ashwin, 1 run, drives a length ball hard. Straight to mid-off, who stops but doesn't know where the ball is. Rotates around the ball and Ashwin nabs the run
SN Thakur to Ashwin, 2 runs, 141.6kph, in-angling length ball on the stumps, Ashwin is back and across to force it to deep extra cover
Dwayne Bravo to Ashwin, 1 run, 100.3kph, cutter outside off, Ashwin drives it to long-on off the inside part of the bat
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, 1 run, slower ball on the pads, wristed away in front of square leg
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, 2 runs, jabs the length ball towards mid-wicket for a brace
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, FOUR, bad ball and Nair takes full toll of it. Length ball on the pads, tickled away fine to fine leg

Dwayne Bravo to Nair, SIX, RJ runs across and palms it over the boundary rope. Hit his thumb - his bowling hand as well. Hope it's not serious. It was a full toss and Nair hacked it over mid-wicket. Jaddu covered a lot of distance and the momentum was taking him futher across. Stuck his left hand out, couldn't hold on, despite a jump
Dwayne Bravo to Ashwin, 1 run, 101.5kph, cutter, Ashwin walks forward and across to tap it towards cover-point. Played with soft hands

Tahir to Ashwin, 1 run, slightly on the shorter side and that allows Ashwin to go back and work it to mid-wicket. Tahir finishes with figures 4-0-34-2. It's been a day for the leg-spinners. Isn't it? Chahal, Gopal and now Tahir
Tahir to Ashwin, no run, 93kph, attacking the stumps, another push back to the bowler
Tahir to Ashwin, no run, flat ball on the stumps, pushed to the right of the bowler, Tahir makes a good stop in his followthrough
Tahir to Nair, 1 run, lots of flight on this delivery, slightly too full. Nair drives it all along the carpet to long-off
Tahir to Nair, 2 runs, flat ball on the stumps, Nair backs away and punches towards cover. Bravo tumbles over the ball, can't stop it cleanly and Nair comes back for the second
Tahir to Ashwin, 1 run, Ashwin leans forward and closes his bat-face to nudge it to mid-wicket
SN Thakur to Nair, 2 runs, mistimed pull against the bumper and the ball lands in the no-man's land at the mid-wicket region. A couple taken
SN Thakur to Nair, no run, this one keeps a tad low and Nair is beaten trying to play the cross-batted stroke. Through to the keeper
SN Thakur to Ashwin, 1 run, in-angler, tucked to backward square leg off the inside half

SN Thakur to Yuvraj, out Caught by Dhoni!! The CSKians go up, Yuvraj starts to walk. Doesn't wait for the umpire's decision. The cross-seamed short ball from Shardul Thakur and that's the reason for the extra bounce. Yuvraj read the length and line, but couldn't account for that tad extra bounce. Looked to ramp it towards third man and got a feather on it. MS won't drop those. Yuvraj c Dhoni b SN Thakur 20(13) [4s-2 6s-1]
SN Thakur to Yuvraj, 2 runs, short and wide outside off, Yuvraj stays back and cuts hard. Bhajji, at backward point, dives to his left and gets a hand on it. The sweeper cover fielder mops it up
SN Thakur to Nair, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, Nair gets on top of the bounce and runs it down to third man
Tahir to Nair, 1 run, darted down the leg-side, glanced away fine, can't beat the man at 45, who makes a diving stop. Two wickets and five runs off that over
Tahir to Nair, FOUR, good shot to get off the mark. In-drifter, slightly errs in line. Too straight and Nair's wrists does the rest. Flicks it through mid-wicket
Tahir to Nair, no run, a defensive push into the off-side
Tahir to Nair, no run, the hat-trick is negotiated. Another googly, Nair spotted that. Went back and pushed it into the cover region

Tahir to Finch, out Lbw!! Aaron Finch is given OUT lbw. Back-to-back golden ducks for him. He has reviewed. That looked plumb. Let's see. Fair delivery. No bat. Three reds and he is outta here. Here's the comeback from CSK. It was the quick googly from Tahir and Finch definitely didn't pick that. Presses forward to block and got rapped on the front leg in front of off. That's plumb. Tahir is pumped. Runs with the arms aloft and slaps the CSK symbol with on his shirt. That's the passion with which he plays. Finch lbw b Tahir 0(1)

Tahir to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Jadeja!! Agarwal holes out! A mistimed loft and he finds one of the safest pairs in the world. The leg-break on the stumps and Agarwal moved leg-side to go downtown. The bat face turned at the point of impact and hence lost his timing. Goes miles up in the air, but straight to RJ at long-on. Mayank Agarwal c Jadeja b Tahir 30(19) [4s-1 6s-2]

Dwayne Bravo to Yuvraj, FOUR, follows the bumper with a yorker and Yuvraj brings his bat down at the right time. Manages to get some wood off the cue end and the ball goes fine of the man at short third man. Bravo is appealing! For what? Bat before the wicket? Was clearly off the bat
Dwayne Bravo to Yuvraj, FOUR, picked the gap beautifully did Yuvraj. Short ball at 123.6kph, Yuvraj picked the length early. Stood tall and pummeled the pull between long-on and deep mid-wicket
Dwayne Bravo to Yuvraj, 2 runs, another slow, dipping full toss, below the waist and Yuvraj helps it away to deep mid-wicket
Dwayne Bravo to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, wristy! Fullish ball wide of off, Agarwal opens his bat-face at the point of impact and slices it over covers. Murali Vijay mops it up
Dwayne Bravo to Yuvraj, 1 run, pitched up outside off, firmly driven, but off the bottom part of the bat. Well in front of square on the off-side
Dwayne Bravo to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, 102.3kph, dipping full toss, Agarwal is slightly surprised by that. Swings his hard to heave it towards wide long-on
Tahir to Yuvraj, no run, flatter and quicker on off, Yuvraj brings his bat down hurriedly to keep it out
Tahir to Yuvraj, no run, follows up with a googly and Yuvraj is cemented in his crease to chop it on the off-side

Tahir to Yuvraj, SIX, there's the trademark Yuvraj shot! Flighted wide of off, Yuvi, with a huge back-lift, lofts it handsomely straight down the ground. The long-on fielder moves to his right, can only watch the ball sail over his head
Tahir to Yuvraj, no run, punched firmly, Tahir makes a sharp catch moving to his left
Tahir to Yuvraj, no run, floater on the stumps, a solid forward defence
Tahir to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, flat leg-break at 93.6kph, driven uppishly to long-off
Watson to Yuvraj, no run, 128.9kph, short of length, Yuvraj hops and turns it to square leg, off the top portion of the bat. Good comeback from Watto after conceding a six off the first ball
Watson to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, 129.6kph, length ball just outside off, Agarwal waits and waits before opening his bat-face to guide it to third man
Watson to Yuvraj, 1 run, back of a length delivery, tucked to square leg and Yuvraj opens his account

Watson to Gayle, out Caught by Tahir!! Watto strikes! Removes his former RCB teammate. It was banged short by the Australian and the line was on leg. Gayle went for the pull half-heartedly as he was slightly cramped form room and all he could manage was a top-edge that lobs straight to short fine leg. A dolly for Tahir. Watson has his arms aloft. End of a superb knock from 'Universe Boss'. Gayle c Tahir b Watson 63(33) [4s-7 6s-4]
Watson to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, the length is shortened and Agarwal scythes it to sweeper cover

Watson to Mayank Agarwal, SIX, hit through the line and off she goes into the stands. Seam-up, half-volley on the stumps, Agarwal bends his back knee and smokes it over long-on. Off the meat of the bat
Dwayne Bravo to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, Agarwal walks forward and acrodd to work this shortish off-paced delivery to deep mid-wicket. Just 5 off the over.
Dwayne Bravo to Mayank Agarwal, no run, pitched up at 130.9kph, square-driven straight to backward point
Dwayne Bravo to Gayle, 1 run, slower ball at 103.9kph, on-driven to long-on
Dwayne Bravo to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, a fumble and they steal a run there. Agarwal stayed back and tapped a short of length delivery straight to cover, who made a mess of it. Gives away a run
Dwayne Bravo to Gayle, 1 run, 126.4kph, low full toss, Gayle gently drives it down to long-off. All along the carpet
Dwayne Bravo to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, Bravo starts with a slower ball, full and wide of off, slapped to sweeper cover
Harbhajan to Gayle, no run, defends it out as the ball as the ball was flighted up. Mayank Agarwal wanted a single but was sent back
Harbhajan to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, top-edge on the sweep and the ball dribbles away for the man at deep backward square to pick it up. Only a single
Harbhajan to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, sliced away! No respect for the veteran spinner and the ball races away into the fence. Man at sweeper cover had no chance
Harbhajan to Mayank Agarwal, SIX, comes down the track and lifts the ball away over long-on. The big hitting has spread like an epidemic. The intentions and the application was superb and in sync
Harbhajan to Gayle, 1 run, pushes the ball away into the on-side for a single as the ball drifted into the pads
Harbhajan to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, the leading edge and the ball goes over the non-striker for a single. The flighted ball on the pads and the batsman closed the face of the bat a bit too early
Watson to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, little nip into the batsman and Mayank Agarwal stayed leg-side of the line of the ball to push the ball away into the off-side for a single
Watson to Gayle, 1 run, presents the full face of the bat and pushes the ball away to cover for a single. Played it with soft hands
Watson to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, another short ball was welcomed with a swatted pull and the man at deep mid does the rest. Only a single
Watson to Mayank Agarwal, no run, short ball..Why? Mistimes the pull away into the on-side for the man at mid-on to stop it

Watson to Mayank Agarwal, 2 runs, stays on the front foot and drop kicks the ball over cover. Did not time it the best and the man at sweeper cover gets around it to cut it off. Not a bad start for sure
Watson to Gayle, 1 run, push and run! Gayle can do no wrong today. The throw came in at the bowler's end but Gayle seemed in

Harbhajan to Rahul, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! That is a steal. Full toss outside off and the batsman chips the drive to cover. DJ Bravo takes it and breaks into a jig. For a moment he has forgotten about the damage done. That was a poor delivery but Rahul got carried away and lifted the ball aerially for the man at cover, who was on the edge of the circle, to take it. CSK have a small ray of hope. Rahul c Dwayne Bravo b Harbhajan 37(22) [4s-7]
Harbhajan to Gayle, 1 run, flattish ball on the pads and has been on-driven down to long-on for a single
Harbhajan to Rahul, 1 run, on the pads now and has been tucked away behind square for a single
Harbhajan to Rahul, no run, straighter lines are the need of the hour for CSK and Rahul pushes a straighter one back to the bowler
Harbhajan to Gayle, 1 run, throws it up wide and the batsman cuts the ball away to deep cover for a single
Harbhajan to Rahul, 1 run, driven to the long-on region as the ball was bowled flatter
Tahir to Gayle, SIX, unfurl the noise now! Slammed down the ground over long-off. Well flighted ball and the batsman spanks it over the fence. He ain't holding back. KXIP are unstoppable
Tahir to Gayle, no run, that was the googly and the batsman is beaten outside off as the ball ripped away. Quiet till the next ball

Tahir to Gayle, FOUR, fifty on KXIP debut! The big boss is owning the evening. That was in the zone, too full and the batsman thumped it down the ground for a four. One bounce and it escapes into the fence. And look at the big man, he does the cradle act with both his arms. He is thrilled to bits
Tahir to Rahul, 1 run, little too full and has been on-driven to the man at long-on. Single
Tahir to Rahul, 2 runs, short ball, cut away, past point and they come back for a brace as the man at sweeper cover gets around it
Tahir to Rahul, FOUR, full toss on the pads and Rahul adds four to his tally. That was clipped away and the slide from the man at deep mid is not good enough
Chahar to Gayle, no run, right up there. Jangling nerves but he still manages to end it well does Chahar. The batsman digs the ball out into the off-side. 75 off the first 6 overs

Chahar to Gayle, SIX, where are the seat belts? The Gayle show is here. Full ball and the batsman hammers the ball over long-off for a huge six. This man has made a statement. A big one. 46 off 19 balls!
Chahar to Gayle, wide, the bowler is hesitating now. Bowls it too short and the batsman does not make an attempt of playing at it. Wided
Chahar to Gayle, FOUR, punched and K.O! That was actually a pile driver down the ground. Picks the short of length delivery and punishes it down the ground, uppishly, for a four past mid-off

Chahar to Gayle, FOUR, crafty and controlled. The short ball, the batsman gets on top of it and guides it past short fine leg for a four. The man at short fine leg and deep square leg tried to cut it off but in vain

Chahar to Gayle, SIX, that is into a parallel universe from the universe boss. Length ball was like a dead meat and Gayle picks the bones out of it. Over cow corner for a mighty six. That was poor bowling
Chahar to Rahul, 1 run, slower delivery and tickled away into the on-side for a single as the man at mid-on picks the ball up
SN Thakur to Gayle, FOUR, short ball again, the batsman does not time the pull away. But he gets enough meat on it and sends it past mid-on for a four. Fifty up for KXIP. All carnage at Mohali
SN Thakur to Rahul, 1 run, skips out and punches the ball on the up and into the covers for a single as the man at deep cover picks the ball up
SN Thakur to Rahul, FOUR, CSK have not done their homework. That was short again and the batsman stays back to pull the ball away with a lot of control. The man at deep fine had no chance
SN Thakur to Gayle, 1 run, drifts on to the pads and has been clipped away to deep mid for a single
SN Thakur to Gayle, no run, looks to go big again and misses. Got a bit carried away with the fuller length and misses the attempted heave down the ground

SN Thakur to Gayle, FOUR, edged and gone! Gone for a four. Dhoni does not go for it to his left. Should be classified as a chance even if it might have been touch and go. The slip was wide and the ball goes between the keeper and the slip for a four. That is a huge reprieve for Gayle

Harbhajan to Rahul, FOUR, if it is power from one end, it is all grace from the other. The batsman leans into the drive and threads the ball away like a seasoned tailor. The man at mid-off had no chance even with the dive to his left. Superb bit of batting
Harbhajan to Rahul, no run, charges out and plays the drive on the up. This time finds the man at cover
Harbhajan to Rahul, FOUR, did I sanity? Pardon me. Gayle's partner-in-crime joins the act and creams the full toss outside off away into the covers. The ball raced away into the fence
Harbhajan to Gayle, 1 run, stays back and turns the ball away on the on-side for a single. Sanity for the next few balls
Harbhajan to Gayle, SIX, drop-kicked! Gone for a sixer. The batsman goes with the turn and muscles the ball over long-off for a maximum. Gayle is up and away!!
Harbhajan to Gayle, FOUR, drops the ball short and that is a sin! The huge bat of Gayle comes down on it and swords the ball away past cover point for a four
Chahar to Rahul, no run, back of a length delivery outside off and looks to play a punch off the back foot. Loses his shape a bit on contact and finds the man at cover

Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, short ball, bad ball and put away. The batsman was waiting for it and swats the pull away fine on the on-side for a four. Crisply timed and it ran away. Rahul has run into a massive purple patch

Chahar to Gayle, 1 run, back of a length delivery and has been pushed away into the off-side for a quick single. Rahul responded early enough to make it to the other end. The throw though was at the bowler's end. Gayle also would have made it if it was a direct hit
Chahar to Gayle, no run, too full, the batsman looks to slam the drive but misses it again. That should have been put away but it seemed that he picked it slightly late
Chahar to Gayle, no run, too full this time. A lame poke outside off and the batsman misses it. Not committing on a push there
Chahar to Gayle, no run, wide delivery outside off and has not been penalised. The bowler getting away there as that angled across too wide outside off
Harbhajan to Rahul, no run, saw the batsman preempting a move down the track and bowled it flatter. The batsman punches the ball back to the bowler. Only 5 of it
Harbhajan to Gayle, 1 run, treks back, waits for the ball and then turns the ball away into the on-side for a single. Quiet it has been from Gayle
Harbhajan to Gayle, no run, pushes the ball out into the off-side and looks for a single. Rahul sends his partner back as Gayle wanted a single
Harbhajan to Gayle, no run, skips down the track and pushes the ball away to mid-on as he was cramped for room
Harbhajan to Gayle, no run, forward push as the ball was tossed up on the sticks

Harbhajan to Gayle, FOUR, leaning drive! Classical touch play with a big stride forward and the ball screams past cover for a four. Slightly flatter it might have been and the batsman got it away. That would help

Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, ho ho ho!! That was creamed away. Length ball, dangling away and the batsman eases the cover drive away into the gap. The ball speeds away into the fence. Again the ball curved away but the neat footwork towards the line of the ball ensured the batsman had it covered. Action-packed start

Chahar to Rahul, no run, rib tickler! Ouch! That hurts. Short ball, skids on and the batsman misses the pull. And is down on the ground. The physio has wasted no time in running out to treat the batsman. The ball skidded on and the batsman was late on the pull. That is a lot of pain going by the grimace on the face of the batsman. A mini-break!!
Chahar to Rahul, no run, ends up playing the drive well outside the line of the ball. Pitched up and tunnelling away, the batsman played down the wrong line as it did not move away that much

Chahar to Rahul, 2 runs, the delivery nudges in a bit after landing and takes the inner half of the blade to run away behind square. The man at deep fine leg covers good ground and cuts it off. Only a brace
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, breaks the barrier of respect and drives it on the up, uppishly. Over cover and into the fence. The ball was in the zone and the batsman did not hold back to smack it away
Chahar to Rahul, no run, and nice shape going away has been patted back to the bowler. Rahul respectfully played it away

Kuldeep Yadav to Boult, out Caught&Bowled!! It's over. Flighted delivery attacking the stumps, Boult chips it straight back to the bowler. Kuldeep Yadav gobbles it just above his head. Kolkata Knight Riders win by 71 runs. Boult c and b Kuldeep Yadav 0(2)
Kuldeep Yadav to Nadeem, 1 run, the length is too full and that's been forced to deep extra cover
Narine to Boult, no run, Boult brings his bat down hurriedly to block the offie

Narine to Shami, out Caught by A Russell!! Shami departs. This was on the cards. He slogged from ball one and perishes. Chips down the track to smash the offie over deep mid-wicket. No timing whatsoever - courtesy the bat turned at the point of impact. Russell runs to his left from mid-wicket and pouches it with ease. Shami c A Russell b Narine 7(6) [4s-1]
Narine to Nadeem, 1 run, Nadeem plays in the direction of the spin to wrist this ball to deep mid-wicket
Narine to Shami, 1 run, the carrom ball, Shami jogged down and had to adjust as the length was shortened. Shami did well there to open his bat-face and guide it square of the wicket
Narine to Nadeem, 1 run, shorter in length, Nadeem stands tall and forces it to sweeper cover
Narine to Nadeem, no run, in-turner from a length, Nadeem is early to close his bat-face, gets hit on the body. Going down
Kuldeep Yadav to Shami, FOUR, more flight on this ball and Shami eyes the mid-wicket region. Swings hard and gets a fat outside edge that goes over the slip fielder. Runs away to the third man fence
Kuldeep Yadav to Shami, no run, pushed through wide of off, Shami clears his front leg and misses the cut
Kuldeep Yadav to Nadeem, 1 run, shortish googly, mistimed slap to sweeper cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Nadeem, no run, pushed to covers
Kuldeep Yadav to Shami, 1 run, there's the mighty swing of the bat from Shami and the ball balloons up off the edge. Went miles up, luckily for the batter, falls in the no-man's land - around mid-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Nadeem, 1 run, juicy full toss, Nadeem mistimes the clip horribly wide of long-on. That was tossed above the batter's eye-line
Narine to Nadeem, 1 run, very full outside off, squeezed to sweeper cover

Narine to Vijay Shankar, out Lbw!! Vijay Shankar is given out lbw and he reviews. Fair delivery. No bat involved. The impact was just above the kneeroll in front of off. What does the ball-tracker say? Three reds and Shankar goes off taking the only review with him. DD are falling apart here, without a fight. Turns in from a short of length and beats Shankar's clip/flick. He wasn't forward as well. The umpire raised the finger quickly. Vijay Shankar lbw b Narine 2(4)
Narine to Shami, 1 run, turns the off-break to backward square leg

Narine to Chris Morris, out Bowled!! 100 IPL wickets for Sunil Narine! No reaction from the Caribbean; as usual. The off-break from Narine doesn't spin much. Goes straight and crashes into the off-pole. And what was Morris doing? He backed away a long way to loft it over covers. Missed it by a mile. Beaten on the outside edge. Seven down. Chris Morris b Narine 2(3)
Narine to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, shorter and flatter, punched down to long-on
Narine to Chris Morris, 1 run, off-break on middle and leg, worked to deep mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Chris Morris, 1 run, in-turner, push-driven to long-on

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, out Caught by Uthappa!! Tries to go for the third maximum on the trot and perishes. Hey bowlers, need a wicket? Bowl half-trackers. That's what Kuldeep did. He's bowled two and has two wickets. Was the short leg-break from the left-arm spinner, Maxwell spotted it and went deep in his crease. Pull too hard and loses his shape. Miscued and picked Uthappa at deep mid-wicket. A big wicket, this. Maxwell c Uthappa b Kuldeep Yadav 47(22) [4s-3 6s-4]
Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, SIX, back-to-back sixes. Quicker delivery, too straight as well, that's been bludgeoned over deep mid-wicket with a mighty swing of the bat

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, SIX, that's been palmed over the ropes! Mavi, the fielder. Was a slow, flighted delivery. Slightly too full, Maxwell goes hard on the lofted on-drive and doesn't time it too well. Mavi moved to his right and probably didn't time his jump well. Gets a hand, but that's been parried away. SIX
Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, no run, tries the reverse-sweep and misses
Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, 2 runs, drifting across, Maxwell stays back and heaves it away, muscled. Mavi, from long-on, sprints to his right and makes a diving stop

Tom Curran to Vijay Shankar, no run, fuller length delivery outside off, Vijay Shankar plays with an open face and finds backward point. There's a fumble from Rana and the batsman wants a run, sensibly sent back by Maxwell
Tom Curran to Maxwell, 1 run, the slower ball from Curran, driven square on the off-side for a single
Tom Curran to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, short of a length and on Shankar's hips, nudged away behind square on the on-side for a single

Tom Curran to Rahul Tewatia, out Caught by A Russell!! That's a tame dismissal for Tewatia and the Daredevils have lost half their side. This was full and this was wide of off, Tewatia saw the opportunity for a few runs, got his left leg out of the way and was looking to smash it over cover. He went so hard that he lost all the poise and flow, ended up slicing it straight to Russell at short extra-cover. As easy as it comes. Rahul Tewatia c A Russell b Tom Curran 1(2)
Tom Curran to Maxwell, 1 run, short and well outside off, slapped away towards deep point for a single
Tom Curran to Maxwell, SIX, smashed, the back of the hand slower short ball from Curran, but it sat up to be smacked. Maxwell swivels across and pulls it high and way into the stands at long leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, 1 run, another wrong 'un from Kuldeep, Maxwell didn't pick it as he stayed back, gets a thick edge behind square on the off-side for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, 2 runs, tad fuller and wider of off, Maxwell shuffled across and hacked it wide of long-on. Mavi does well to slide across and keep them down to a brace
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, the wrong 'un from Kuldeep, not sure he picked it, got his bat just in time and the inside edge rolls away wide of mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Pant, out Caught by Chawla!! Oh dear! We saw this yesterday for RCB, now Pant falls to a long hop. Dropped short and on the stumps, begging to be smacked, Pant swivelled across and nailed the pull, hard and flat - straight into the hands of Chawla at deep mid-wicket. The Eden Gardens finds its voice once again, Pant falls after an impressive knock. Pant c Chawla b Kuldeep Yadav 43(26) [4s-7 6s-1]
Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, 1 run, the wrong 'un from Kuldeep, but it's too short and wide of off, chopped away towards deep cover for a single

Kuldeep Yadav to Maxwell, FOUR, reverse sweep and four, flighted delivery outside off, Maxwell bends down half-way and then gets it past the keeper, no chance for short third man and the ball rolls away to the fence
Tom Curran to Pant, no run, the slower bouncer from Curran, Pant ducks under it and lets it go, DK collects it on the bounce
Tom Curran to Maxwell, 1 run, on a good length and a hint of slant back into the right-hander, Maxwell prods across and works it towards long-on for a single
Tom Curran to Maxwell, no run, much better from Curran, tad fuller and just outside off, Maxwell wasn't forward as he pushed at that, can't get it past short extra-cover
Tom Curran to Maxwell, SIX, easy pickings for Maxwell, short and at his body, he gets inside the line, uses the pace on the ball and helps it way over the ropes at long leg
Tom Curran to Pant, 1 run, Curran shortens his length outside off, steered to the left of cover-point. Pant waits for the ball to pass the fielder and then jogs across for a single
Tom Curran to Pant, FOUR, cracking shot, full and well outside off, right in the slot for Pant as he drives it past cover, the fielder in the deep has no chance
Chawla to Pant, leg byes, 1 run, tossed up well outside leg, Pant was looking to sweep and missed, rolled away off the pads past the keeper and there's an optimistic appeal for LBW

Chawla to Maxwell, 1 run, the quicker ball from Chawla, pushed through flatter and quicker, sliced away behind square on the off-side where Lynn makes a tumbling one-handed stop, saved three runs for his team
Chawla to Pant, 1 run, flatter and on the stumps, stayed a bit low as well, pulled away without any timing towards backward square leg
Chawla to Pant, no run, flighted quicker and angling across the left-hander, left alone

Chawla to Pant, FOUR, this is excellent batting from Pant, Chawla dropped this one short and just outside off, Pant makes room, lets the ball go past him and then cuts it square behind point for a boundary

Chawla to Pant, SIX, lovely, tossed up well outside off, Pant gets a good stride forward, picks the wrong 'un, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and sends it soaring over extra-cover for a maximum
Narine to Pant, 1 run, Pant shimmies down the track to a well flighted delivery and pushes it in front of mid-on, calls his partner across for a quick single
Narine to Pant, no run, tossed up on off, Pant gets half-forward and defends it towards the off-side
Narine to Pant, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Pant, gets down low to a well flighted delivery outside leg, rolls his wrists and sweeps it behind square on the on-side for a boundary

Narine to Pant, FOUR, much needed for DD, very full and around off, Pant gets his left leg out of the way, brings his bottom-hand into play and drills it wide of mid-on, beats the fielder in the ring and rolls away to the fence
Narine to Maxwell, 1 run, slower and just outside off, Maxwell was back on the pull, gets an inside edge behind square on the on-side
Narine to Pant, 1 run, tossed up on off, Pant bends down low, rolls his wrists over and sweeps it to deep mid-wicket for a single
Shivam Mavi to Maxwell, no run, the bouncer from Mavi, Maxwell was caught in two minds, makes a late call to abort the attempted ramp shot, the ball sailed through to the keeper
Shivam Mavi to Maxwell, FOUR, short, wide and four, no one moved after Maxwell flashed it behind square on the off-side, a poor ball and Maxwell took full toll of it
Shivam Mavi to Pant, 1 run, nice change of pace from Mavi, slips in the slower ball now, worked away in front of square on the on-side for a single

Shivam Mavi to Maxwell, leg byes, 1 run, short of a length and angling back into the right-hander, beat Maxwell for pace on the tuck and rolled behind square on the off-side, another leg-bye added to the total
Shivam Mavi to Pant, leg byes, 1 run, Mavi shortens his length on Pant's pads, he was looking to flick and missed, rolls away off his thigh-pad towards square leg
Shivam Mavi to Pant, no run, short of a length and angling across the left-hander at 142.4 kmph. Pant threw everything he had on the drive and missed by a distance

A Russell to Maxwell, FOUR, just over cover and the small Eden Gardens outfield means it's a boundary for Maxwell. He backed away to a short and wide ball, had to reach out for the slap, didn't get it off the middle, but has enough to clear the infield
A Russell to Maxwell, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, Maxwell was hanging back, that meant he wasn't fully forward on the drive, hits it straight to the fielder at mid-off

A Russell to Pant, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, Pant drops it in front of point and calls his partner across for a quick single. There's a direct hit at his end, but he was home by then

A Russell to Pant, FOUR, Pant has been lucky in this innings so far, pitched up and well wide of off, he saw the width and threw his hands at that, slices it high and over cover, couple of bounces and over the ropes
A Russell to Pant, wide, loud shout for a caught behind, but the umpire isn't fooled as he signals a wide. Short and angling down the leg-side, Pant was late on the pull and missed
A Russell to Pant, FOUR, much better from Pant, full and just outside off, Pant brings his bat down and drills it back past the non-striker. Mid-off is very wide and has no chance
A Russell to Pant, no run, that's an ugly looking shot from Pant, reverses his stance and looks to play a reverse swat, the ball hit him high on the pad and rolls away towards slip

Shivam Mavi to Gambhir, out Bowled!! First IPL wicket for Mavi and he's chuffed to bits. Short of a length and angling across the left-hander, Gambhir was cramped for room as he went for the cut, gets an inside edge and the ball clatters into the stumps. Mavi is pumped and so are KKR. DD in dire straits now. Gambhir b Shivam Mavi 8(7) [4s-1]
Shivam Mavi to Pant, 1 run, Pant is clearly uncomfortable against the short ball, once again he's hurried into the pull, manages to fend it away towards square leg

Shivam Mavi to Pant, FOUR, change of pace from Mavi, but Pant spotted it well, waited on the short ball, rolled his wrists and helped it behind square on the on-side, beat short fine and raced away to the fence

Shivam Mavi to Pant, 2 runs, pace from Mavi and that hurried Pant into the pull, was in no control over the shot - but he got it in front of square on the on-side. Curran was the fielder at deep backward square leg and he keeps it down to a brace
Shivam Mavi to Pant, wide, pace from Mavi, that was bowled at 144.5 kmph, but it's short and well down the leg-side, called as a wide
Shivam Mavi to Pant, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, pushed towards cover
Shivam Mavi to Gambhir, 1 run, short of a length and on Gambhir's pads, tucked away behind square on the on-side for a single
A Russell to Pant, no run, full and just outside off, Pant brings his strong bottom-hand into play as he drives it straight to mid-on
A Russell to Pant, wide, the bouncer from Russell, but it's well down the leg-side and it's called as a wide once again
A Russell to Pant, wide, full and sliding down the leg-side, Pant lets the ball go through and it's called as a wide

A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Nitish Rana!!
