The Daredevils have been rocked early, excellent ball from Russell, hit the deck hard and got the ball to deviate away from outside off, drew Shreyas Iyer into a limp poke, the edge was found and it was travelling quickly. Rana dived across to his left at first slip, went with both hands and holds on. Shreyas Iyer c Nitish Rana b A Russell 4(3) [4s-1]
A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, short, wide and four, Shreyas Iyer's eyes lit up as he saw the width, got on top of the bounce and cracked it square past point, no need to run for those

A Russell to Gambhir, 1 run, short of a length and on Gambhir's hips, helped away behind square on the on-side. Mavi nearly made a mess of the simple stop, but he gets his body behind the ball and stops it
A Russell to Gambhir, FOUR, cracking shot, overpitched and well outside off, Gambhir leans forward and places it into the gap past cover-point, beat the man in the ring and rolled away to the fence
A Russell to Gambhir, no run, on a good length and on middle, Gambhir gets half-forward on the on-drive, gets a soft leading edge towards mid-off
Chawla to Shreyas Iyer, no run, the drifter from Chawla, kept coming back at the right-hander, clipped straight to the fielder at short mid-wicket

Chawla to Roy, wide, out Stumped!! Smart stumping from Karthik and the last match hero falls cheaply. Nicely bowled by Chawla as well, he pre-empted that Roy was coming down the track and slid this one down the leg-side, Roy stepped forward, the momentum took him further ahead, he turned around in panic, but Karthik had by then removed one of the stumps. A cheap dismissal for Roy and Delhi have lost an early wicket. Roy st Karthik b Chawla 1(3)
Chawla to Roy, no run, pushed through flatter and quicker of off, Roy backs away and mistimes the cut towards the off-side
Chawla to Gambhir, 1 run, Chawla tosses one on the stumps, driven to the left of mid-on where Russell makes a tumbling stop, just a single
Chawla to Roy, 1 run, Chawla drifts this one onto Roy's pads, clipped away in front of square on the on-side for a single
Chawla to Roy, no run, very full and just outside off, Roy was looking to flick it against the angle, gets an inside edge onto the boot
Chawla to Gambhir, 1 run, tossed up on the stumps, Gambhir gets forward and flicks it to deep mid-wicket for a single

Rahul Tewatia to Tom Curran, out Caught by Maxwell!! Rahul Tewatia is pumping his fist and punching the air. Three wickets in that over and just one run off it. Fantastic effort from the leggie. Tom Curran too like Chawla charges the bowler and can only find long-on. Tom Curran c Maxwell b Rahul Tewatia 2(3)

Rahul Tewatia to Chawla, out Caught by Pant!! Chawla comes and goes. Without scoring. Cleverly bowled by Rahul Tewatia, saw Chawla charging out, pulled his length back, Chawla skies the lofted hit straight up and Pant calls for it to take it. Chawla c Pant b Rahul Tewatia 0(3)
Rahul Tewatia to Chawla, no run, now takes one on the body. Tries to hit too hard - his shape all wrong and the ball strikes him on the abdomen region. Probably got an inside edge on the slog as well
Rahul Tewatia to Chawla, no run, Chawla who has come out without a cap or a helmet, tries to slog-sweep and misses. It turned away from him

Rahul Tewatia to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Chris Morris!! "Catch it buddy" shouted someone and it has been caught at point. All too simple really. Short and wide outside off, Shubman Gill fails to keep the cut down and gives Morris an easy opportunity inside the ring. Shubman Gill c Chris Morris b Rahul Tewatia 6(5) [4s-1]
Rahul Tewatia to Tom Curran, 1 run, tossed up outside off, wider of Tom Curran's reach, hit to long-off. Tom Curran wants two, but Shubman Gill sends him back

Chris Morris to Shubman Gill, leg byes, FOUR, poor delivery and deserved four. High full-toss sliding down leg, brushes the thigh pad of Shubman Gill and beats Pant's dive to his left. Runs away fast to the fine leg fence. Chris Morris has been disappointing with the ball tonight
Chris Morris to Tom Curran, 1 run, full and a hint of tail back in, Tom Curran drives straight down the ground, hits the stumps, but it's still a single only
Chris Morris to Shubman Gill, 1 run, tailing in late, from a fuller length, clipped behind square for a single

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Gambhir!! Deception from Chris Morris and he dismisses Nitish Rana. The slower delivery just outside off, Nitish Rana this time scooped it straight up in the air and Gambhir tracked back from cover to settle under that. Nitish Rana c Gambhir b Chris Morris 59(35) [4s-5 6s-4]

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, no run, good comeback. A yorker just outside off, Nitish Rana may have chipped the toe of his bat while trying to dig it out. Immediately has a look at his willow. For now will continue with that one

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, FOUR, how good is he with those cuts and carves on the off-side. Sits deep in his crease, waits for the full delivery and then at the last moment opens the face of the bat to drive in the air, there's a fielder placed exactly for that shot, but the ball bounces wide of him and speeds to the fence
Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, wide, way outside off, almost missed the cutstrip on the pitch
Boult to Nitish Rana, 1 run, now shuffles across towards off and clips this full ball to deep square leg to keep strike

Boult to Nitish Rana, FOUR, this guy has talent. Make no mistake about it. Turns a near yorker into a boundary. Special skill when you can do that. Backed away a tad and directed it with an open face, just wide of short third, who didn't get across. Should've done better
Boult to Shubman Gill, 1 run, full on the stumps, Shubman Gill makes room and lofts cleanly, but straight to the fielder at long-off
Boult to Shubman Gill, FOUR, goes short and Shubman Gill gets off the mark with four. On the body, pulled hard through mid-wicket and Gill finds the gap

Boult to A Russell, out Bowled!! Gone now. If anyone needed a sample of how to get Russell out, just watch this from Boult. No fuss or drama. The old-fashioned yorker - still gets you wickets even today. Will do so after 100 years as well. Just that you have to get it right. Boult did, slipped it under A Russell's swinging bat and it clipped middle and leg. Superb bowling and that wicket could mean a difference of 20 at least to the eventual score. No big celebrations from Boult, just a fist pump. Replays show that it was delivered cross-seam as well.  A Russell b Boult 41(12) [6s-6]
Boult to Nitish Rana, 1 run, full on off, Nitish Rana looks to flick and the leading edge dribbles to backward point. 50 for Nitish Rana and it's his first one in KKR colors

Shami to A Russell, SIX, straight up in the air, can someone get under this one. What! It has landed over long-off's head. What does he have everyday? Just pass that to all those who want to put on weight. This is jaw-dropping stuff from Russell. Looked like he had pulled the short ball straight up in the air, but such is the power he possesses that it has landed beyond the boundary. What more can I say?

Shami to A Russell, SIX, my word. There's so little margin of error against this beast from Jamaica. A man-mountain. Shami errs by slowing the pace down, lands right in the swinging range of Russell who sends it high into the deep mid stands. Such clean striking!
Shami to Nitish Rana, 1 run, went for the wide yorker, almost nailed it spot on, but since he didn't get it perfectly right, Nitish Rana carves it to the sweeper, who is strategically stationed by GG
Shami to Nitish Rana, no run, slower delivery on off, Nitish Rana pushes it to cover, no run there as it went straight to the fielder
Shami to A Russell, 1 run, good comeback by Shami. Fires in the perfect yorker on off, dug out wide of Shami

Shami to A Russell, SIX, that is the flattest square-driven six you'll ever see. Trust me on that. Unbelievable stuff from Russell. Sees the slower delivery outside off and gets low to carve it over deep point. The ball never took off from a height after it left the bat

Chris Morris to A Russell, 1 run, well bowled. Fooled Russell completely. Way too early into the leg-side swipe, the slowness of the delivery meant that the ball came later than what Russell expected. Off the toe end and dribbles away towards cover
Chris Morris to A Russell, no run, length off-pace ball, Russell was aiming for a big hit and setting himself for that too, but adjusts and steers it straight to the fielder at short third man

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, 1 run, round the wicket and fires in a yorker around off, thick inside edge to the left of Chris Morris and there's certainly something going on between him and Nitish Rana, the South African having a go at the other end
Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, FOUR, went for the short delivery again, but took the pace off it, sits up for Nitish Rana who slashes over point and beats sweeper cover running across

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, no run, good response by Chris Morris. Puts in more effort into the short ball, Nitish Rana makes room to slash, but it is too pacy and too quick for him, over the attempted steer

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, SIX, now Nitish Rana gets into the act. Short ball and Nitish Rana pulls handsomely over deep mid. Looked like he was waiting on the back foot for that one and when it came, didn't miss out

Shami to A Russell, SIX, he is unreal. When it comes to hitting a cricket ball. The predictable short delivery arrives, with no pace or height, brutalised over mid-wicket. The Kolkatans have gone mental at the Eden

Shami to A Russell, SIX, holds the pose. Take that Shami seems to say Russell. Overpitched and right in teeing off zone for Russell, who lofts ever so cleanly and sees the ball till the last moment as his eyes and the bat are transfixed at the target. It lands in the long-off stands. Someone take a pic of that, frame it and present it to Russell

Shami to A Russell, 2 runs, fantastic work by Roy from long-on, but he can't get to the ball, in fact gets a fingertip on that on the dive forward. A horrible miscue from Russell as he swipes at a slower delivery, got lucky as Roy had too much to do after sprinting forward. Isn't happy with that shot, slaps his thigh after completing the second

Shami to A Russell, SIX, that is a magnificent shot. For a moment he was cramped by the short of length delivery into the body, but he adjusted at the last moment and slashed it into his team's dugout at the third man fence. Needed to get it fine and did so
Shami to Nitish Rana, 1 run, pitched up outside off, Nitish Rana drives and gets a thick inside edge through backward square leg
Shami to A Russell, 1 run, short of length outside off, Russell drops it wide of cover and takes the single on offer

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, no run, slower delivery on off, dabbed wide of Iyer at backward point, Nitish Rana is sent back by Russell and Chris Morris has a go at the former. Certainly didn't like what he saw from Nitish Rana in that over

Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, SIX, length delivery outside off and Nitish Rana launches it over long-on. Clean bat-swing and the ball sails over the fielder's head. The wicket of his skipper hasn't put Nitish Rana off at all

Chris Morris to Karthik, out Caught by Boult!! That is so poor from DK. No game awareness at all. Switched off at the wrong moment and didn't spot the change in field. Flicks and holes out to deep mid. Went for the same shot that got him two boundaries, but found the fielder. Chris Morris raises his arms in delight and sports a big smile on his face. Had his man finally. Karthik c Boult b Chris Morris 19(10) [4s-2 6s-1]

Chris Morris to Karthik, FOUR, an action replay of the previous delivery. Chris Morris just stares in despair. At DK who has flicked him again over mid-wicket. Sheer timing and nearly went all the way, one bounce over the ropes. What form he is in at the moment
Chris Morris to Karthik, FOUR, this is classy. Effortless batting by DK. Length delivery angling in to middle and leg, Karthik flicks over mid-wicket and leaves deep mid a spectator
Chris Morris to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slower delivery from Chris Morris, Nitish Rana defends with bat and pad close together, the ball runs wide of his feet and another quick single taken
Shami to Nitish Rana, 1 run, off-cutter, Nitish Rana dabs to third man to keep strike

Shami to Karthik, 1 run, wild hoick to a knuckle ball, Karthik again gets lucky as it ricochets off the body off a top edge, onto the helmet? and then drops in front and wide of backward point. Nitish Rana responds and they steal a quick single
Shami to Nitish Rana, 1 run, off-cutter now, he is trying everything now, Nitish Rana waits for it and dabs it from off wide of backward point for a single
Shami to Karthik, 1 run, length delivery just outside off, Karthik classily opens the face of the bat and runs it down to third man
Shami to Karthik, 2 runs, ooh! Late swing and the leading edge is found, pacy full delivery on off, Karthik looked to flick it and got lucky as the ball dribbled wide of backward point

Shami to Karthik, no run, DK has been given out lbw. By umpire Nand Kishore. Looks a dodgy decision. That's why the KKR skipper went for the review straight away. UltraEdge shows a big spike and the crowd cheer. Huge inside edge onto the pads. How did Nand Kishore miss that? Shami was pumped, but all that celebration now turns sour! Was a length delivery cutting back in, raps Karthik above the kneeroll, but there was an edge before that

Vijay Shankar to Nitish Rana, no run, flicks the pad and a smiling Anil Chaudhary - ever the cool dude - signals over. Vijay Shankar and Pant went for the caught behind appeal with the keeper convinced that it was bat when it clearly came off the pad. Maybe a ploy to distract the ump from not signalling a wide
Vijay Shankar to Karthik, 1 run, short of length outside off, Karthik pushes it wide of cover for a single

Vijay Shankar to Karthik, SIX, DK knows all about Vijay Shankar. Both play together for Tamil Nadu, a step towards the ball and then swung it from his hips over deep backward square, was a back of a length delivery but such is the form that DK is in, he has hit it for six
Vijay Shankar to Nitish Rana, 1 run, flicked in the air, wide of short fine, Nitish Rana slips while turning for the second, so has to settle for a single

Vijay Shankar to Nitish Rana, FOUR, right in between deep mid-wicket and deep backward square. The short ball sits up for Nitish Rana, who swivels on the back foot and though he pulls in the air, he hits the gap
Vijay Shankar to Nitish Rana, no run, full on the pads, clipped straight to the fielder at mid-wicket
Shami to Karthik, no run, the off-cutter, grips and pitches on off, beats Karthik on the inside edge and strikes him on the thigh pad, no real appeal for lbw as it would've gone over

Shami to Karthik, wide, good welcome to the skipper and Shami can't believe that it has been called a wide. He is standing there, with the double teapot pose staring at the ump. Shakes his head as he walks back. Fair call as the ball went over the head of Karthik in a standing position, who bailed out of the hook at the last moment

Shami to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Roy!! Good catch by Roy at long-on and another set KKR batsman departs. Got under the full delivery too much - that's why couldn't get the elevation he wanted. It was the knuckle ball as well - something Shami has developed recently, it swings away too, coming to the catch, Roy made it look easy - that's because he judged it to a nicety and took it with both hands without breaking a sweat. Chris Lynn c Roy b Shami 31(29) [4s-4 6s-1]
Shami to Chris Lynn, no run, now misses the heave. Good pacy delivery, goes over Chris Lynn's bat and didn't miss the stumps by much

Shami to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, that is hit like a bullet. Boult at sweeper cover is surprised at how much the ball skidded off the turf. Mentions it to someone with a smile on his face. Chris Lynn is powering those cuts now, went at the rate of light

Shami to Nitish Rana, 1 run, he cuts so well. Plays the shot nicely and for a moment I was fooled into thinking the fielder was Shami at third man. How can that be when it is him bowling, but Tewatia looks almost a mirror image of the pacer. Have a look and see. Good work by the leggie to keep it to one as the ball was travelling
Shami to Chris Lynn, 1 run, short of length and cramping the backing away Chris Lynn, who pushes it to long-on

Nadeem to Nitish Rana, no run, Nadeem is jumping for an lbw appeal. Does not get it and Gambhir takes it. To the naked eye, looked like an under edge. Need UltraEdge to confirm. No bat. So we move on. Impact? Outside the line and that is such a poor review and DD burn their only review. Was very full to be sweeping, Nitish Rana went for it and managed to get himself outside the line
Nadeem to Chris Lynn, 1 run, makes room and cuts the length ball from middle to sweeper cover
Nadeem to Nitish Rana, 1 run, fired in on middle, clipped to long-on

Nadeem to Nitish Rana, FOUR, now shows his intelligence by sweeping wide of short fine leg. Knows deep square is too square and won't get there, got outside the line and knelt down to play the sweep well
Nadeem to Nitish Rana, SIX, comes down the track and launches into the lofted hit, gets good height and the desired elevation over deep mid. Clears the fielder

Nadeem to Nitish Rana, 2 runs, what fielding by Boult running to his right from sweeper cover. Pushed the ball back with one hand even as he was sprinting. Saved two after that fierce cut by Nitish Rana
Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, 1 run, drifting into the pads, nudged to short fine leg. Easy single

Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, no run, now tries to be too cute and misses the reverse sweep. May have got a glove on that, the stifled appeal for lbw dies down. The impact looked like just outside off too
Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, SIX, the slog-sweep from Nitish Rana and he has sent it over Morris' head at deep mid. Right in the range for that shot and Rana sent it into the stands
Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, no run, another googly, pushed to short cover
Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, no run, beautiful delivery, the googly, tossed up too, turns away, produces the edge on the square drive, but rolls to backward point
Rahul Tewatia to Nitish Rana, no run, dabbed to short third and Pant's screeching for the fielder to get in and prevent the quick single. Chris Lynn does the right thing by sending Nitish Rana back
Nadeem to Nitish Rana, 1 run, quicker and the trajectory is flat too, Nitish Rana gets off the mark with a single wide of mid-wicket
Nadeem to Chris Lynn, 1 run, the slider, may even be seam-up from Nadeem, it cramps the backing away Chris Lynn, who cuts to sweeper cover
Nadeem to Chris Lynn, no run, slower and Chris Lynn pushes to short cover. Again made room but respected the delivery

Nadeem to Uthappa, out Caught&Bowled!! That is Nadeem's wicket. Full marks for slowing it down and getting purchase from the wicket, which brought about Uthappa's downfall. He had swept Nadeem last over for a big six over mid-wicket, but this turns slightly and the top edge goes straight up. This time into the hands of Nadeem. Just when Uthappa was looking dangerous he gets out. Has been the story of his life.  Uthappa c and b Nadeem 35(19) [4s-2 6s-3]
Nadeem to Chris Lynn, 1 run, slower and on the stumps, Chris Lynn makes room and belts the cut to the sweeper cover fielder
Nadeem to Uthappa, 1 run, fraction short around off, Uthappa is sitting on the back foot, pulls to long-on
Rahul Tewatia to Chris Lynn, no run, the googly, Chris Lynn pushes it back to Rahul Tewatia. Picked it late
Rahul Tewatia to Uthappa, 1 run, shorter than the previous one, punched off the back foot to long-on
Rahul Tewatia to Chris Lynn, 1 run, tossed up on middle, Chris Lynn gets forward to push to long-on

Rahul Tewatia to Uthappa, 1 run, how lucky is Uthappa. Gets a leading edge on the pull and it drops right in between short third and short fine. Both men frantically running towards to catch it. Inch perfect placement if that was intended. Rahul Tewatia was shouting "catch" as he induced the mistake, but Uthappa gets very very lucky
Rahul Tewatia to Uthappa, SIX, slog-swept by Uthappa and six over deep square. Went down quickly and sheer timing on the shot sees the ball sail into the crowd
Rahul Tewatia to Chris Lynn, 1 run, flicked off the front foot to deep mid-wicket
Nadeem to Uthappa, no run, slower and tossed up on off, Uthappa gets forward to defend with bat and pad close together

Nadeem to Uthappa, FOUR, drags it short, the arm-ball went wrong. Fired it outside off, Uthappa cuts that hard and eludes a diving cover-point to his left. As soon as he got it past the fielder, it was four

Nadeem to Uthappa, SIX, sheer power. That's all made in the gym. What a shot this is. Must be contending for one of the shots of the tournament so far. This is a length ball on off, Uthappa went back and used his forearm power to great effect as he flat-batted it dead straight back over the bowler. A flat six. Nadeem shouldn't feel too disheartened with that hit, it wasn't a bad ball by any stretch of the imagination
Nadeem to Uthappa, 2 runs, tucks it to deep square, wants two and gets it. It is Maxwell who is the fielder, but even he isn't quick enough as Uthappa retains strike
Nadeem to Uthappa, SIX, heaved over deep mid. Sliding on, on the middle and leg line, Uthappa sunk under that and clouted it high and over mid-wicket
Nadeem to Uthappa, no run, slower and beats Uthappa. Pitches around off and turns away, nothing shot from Uthappa again, trying to steer it late and missing

Boult to Chris Lynn, FOUR, nearly holed out. But gets four thanks to Morris' fumble. At long-on. He went for the catch, but the ball bounced in front of him and since he didn't get his body behind the line of the ball, it runs away. Was a full-toss and Chris Lynn biffed that in the air

Boult to Chris Lynn, FOUR, clobbered by Chris Lynn. Boult went round the wicket to cramp up the batsman, but provided the ideal length for the Aussie to hit, brutalised past the stumps at the other end. The ball was gone before Boult could stick his boot in
Boult to Uthappa, 1 run, short of length around off, Uthappa opens the face of the bat and steers it wide of backward point, easy single

Boult to Uthappa, FOUR, shot. Slightly fuller than a good length on the stumps, Uthappa just biffed it over the bowler's head. Not a very good connection, but good enough to clear everyone. Breaks the shackles a bit
Boult to Uthappa, no run, beaten again. But nothing shot from Uthappa, there's a slip in place and he is trying to run it down. Heavy-risk shot that one, this angles away and beats Uthappa's poke
Boult to Uthappa, no run, length delivery with a hint of inswing, Uthappa pushes it off the front foot to mid-on

Nadeem to Chris Lynn, no run, that's beautiful bowling. Slower and it gripped the surface, Chris Lynn was surprised and jabs at it, as it turns across him, from middle and leg, the leading edge falls well short of the cover fielder
Nadeem to Uthappa, 1 run, drifting into the pads, tucked to deep mid
Nadeem to Chris Lynn, 1 run, ooh! The arm-ball. Swinging in too, at pace, Chris Lynn mistimes it back to Nadeem, who fumbles and allows the single

Nadeem to Chris Lynn, FOUR, he wants to go only one way - through the off-side. This is a good shot, hammers it hard and wide of extra-cover, who didn't dive. It was a quicker one and on the stumps, but Chris Lynn found the gap
Nadeem to Chris Lynn, no run, backs away, it holds up a little on the pitch and he punches to mid-off. Sort of checked his shot at the last moment
Nadeem to Uthappa, 1 run, "catch" was the cry but well wide of short mid, sliding on to middle, clipped in the air to long-on
Boult to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that is smashed. Belted by Chris Lynn as he saw the short of length delivery outside off and didn't hold back. Went aerial over cover-point and gets four
Boult to Uthappa, 1 run, short of length on off, Uthappa is a tad squared up but manages a single as it runs off the open face wide of slip, off the mark with that single

Boult to Uthappa, no run, beaten. Lovely delivery and has Uthappa groping on the front foot, it keeps going away with the angle and beats the batsman. Beautiful seam presented and a good one to bowl first up to the new batsman

Boult to Narine, out Caught by Maxwell!! Tag-team work and Narine is gone. They are checking the height on this. But Boult is fine on that count. Narine didn't get bat on the last delivery, this one he gets a thick edge on the slash and Pant tipped it over the bar, but great anticipation from Maxi at slip who tracked back and pouched it. Alert mind and good cricketing nous from the Australian. Deserved wicket for Boult.  Narine c Maxwell b Boult 1(4)
Boult to Narine, no run, beaten. Shortens the length and beats Narine's attempt to slash that over point. Extra pace and bounce beat Narine there
Boult to Narine, no run, what a yorker. Tailing in at the base of middle. Narine who was making room has to get the bat down quickly to dig it out and does so
Chris Morris to Chris Lynn, no run, connects but hits the length ball straight to the fielder at mid-off. Another good over for DD

Chris Morris to Chris Lynn, no run, back to missing. He is missing straight balls. This was pitched up on off, swung away from his bat swing and didn't miss off by much. Again he gave himself room to go over the off-side, but fails to get bat on ball

Chris Morris to Chris Lynn, SIX, off the mark with a six. That's what he can do. Can recover momentum and up the rate so quickly. This was a full delivery on the stumps, Chris Lynn connected well and sent the ball over wide long-on, he needed that for his own confidence and for the team's sake

Chris Morris to Chris Lynn, no run, Chris Lynn is struggling. Really badly. This was a back of a length delivery on the stumps, Lynn looked to pull hard and can only mistime it to mid-wicket. That was there to be put away

Chris Morris to Chris Lynn, no run, Chris Lynn is swinging and missing for now. Extra pace and angled in by Chris Morris, Lynn went for a big heave to leg, missed and the ball bounced over his leg stump
Chris Morris to Narine, 1 run, short of length on the stumps, Narine gets a thick inside edge on the punch, the ball rolls to deep square leg. Narine is off the mark in a streaky way

Boult to Chris Lynn, no run, that is a maiden to start things off. Boult should thank his cover-point fielder for that. Low full-toss on off, Chris Lynn carved that, again hit hard, but the fielder dives to his right and saves a certain boundary. Boult went for the yorker but missed out

Boult to Chris Lynn, no run, ooh! How close to off was that? A coat of paint. Full and right up there, Chris Lynn made a hint of room to open up the off-side, but didn't connect. Very very close to nicking the off-stump

Boult to Chris Lynn, no run, beaten. Length ball outside off, Chris Lynn looks to knife that on the rise and misses. Flies over the edge. No footwork from Lynn and he never looked like connecting there

Boult to Chris Lynn, no run, shot. But straight to the fielder. To cover-point. Length ball on off, Chris Lynn drives well and firmly, can't beat the fielder though. There's a ring of men on the off-side
Boult to Chris Lynn, no run, pulls the length back and cramps Chris Lynn for room, who hops and steers it straight to the fielder at short third man. Either side of the man and it would've been four
Boult to Chris Lynn, no run, it does swing! First up. Not extravagant, but a hint of inswing, starts middle and leg, turned watchfully to mid-wicket

Bumrah to Kohli, no run, oopsy! This has smashed into Kohli's right thigh and he's limping in pain. Not the kind of finish he would have expected. MI win by a convincing margin of 46 runs and end their 3-match losing streak. Back of length ball at pace it was from Bumrah and Kohli was beaten by the incoming angle
Bumrah to Kohli, no run, oh he's mis-hit this short ball off the bottom of the bat and doesn't run even as the ball rolls to long-on
Bumrah to Kohli, SIX, down the one knee and smashed! Back in the crease with a step and then he picked the bones out of this slower delivery and sent it over long-on
Bumrah to Kohli, no run, beaten! Lost shape the helmet moved on his head. That tells you he had a real go at this back of a length delivery

Bumrah to Kohli, FOUR, outside edge and third man is inside the ring, the ball flies over him as Kohli goes hard on the attempted lofted drive. Can he get a hundred? 14 to get, 4 more deliveries to go
Bumrah to Kohli, 2 runs, short of length delivery outside off stump, Kohli drives off the back foot to deep cover
Mustafizur to Kohli, 1 run, mistimes slog to deep mid-wicket and he'll keep strike
Mustafizur to Siraj, 1 run, low full toss, Siraj drills it to long-off

Mustafizur to Siraj, SIX, oh he's connected this brilliantly! Give him a promotion next match! Slower delivery sat up nicely, Siraj hangs back and pulls powerfully over deep mid-wicket and easily clears the fence. Will this make Kohli smile?
Mustafizur to Kohli, 1 run, yorker on the stumps, Kohli digs it out to cover
Mustafizur to Siraj, 1 run, short of length delivery, Siraj hits the free-hit to deep mid-wicket
Mustafizur to Kohli, no ball, 1 run, whipped to deep mid-wicket, overstepping no ball
Mustafizur to Kohli, SIX, cracking sound. Full and in the slot, Kohli muscles that way back over the long-on fence

Bumrah to U Yadav, out Caught by Rohit!! Another one. Catching practice. They are checking for the no-ball. Oh no! More than half of his foot is inside the line. Why check that? It was a shortish delivery, Umesh slices the slog and skies it to cover. Hang on, the replay looks like it's not the wicket taking delivery. Umesh is at the non-striker's end. U Yadav c Rohit b Bumrah 1(2)
Bumrah to Kohli, 1 run, Kohli wanted to loft this short of length delivery to overmid-off but he ended up toe-ending to long-on
Bumrah to U Yadav, 1 run, short of length delivery on the stumps, Umesh pushes towards mid-on

Bumrah to Woakes, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! Soft dismissal. Slower delivery outside off stump, Woakes plays early and slices it straight to short third man. Bumrah gets his name into the wickets column to please himself and the ones who have taken him in their fantasy teams. By the way, that was Bumrah's 50th IPL wicket. Woakes c Krunal Pandya b Bumrah 11(11) [6s-1]
Bumrah to Woakes, no run, slower delivery outside off stump, Woakes slogs and misses
Bumrah to Kohli, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Kohli flat-bats it to long-off
McClenaghan to Kohli, 1 run, slower low full toss outside off stump, Kohli slices it to deep point and keeps strike
McClenaghan to Kohli, 2 runs, Tennis kind of pull shot from Kohli. Short ball from McClenaghan, Kohli places it wide of long-on
McClenaghan to Kohli, 2 runs, steps out and flat-bats this short of length delivery to extra-cover, a needless shy at the stumps at the bowler's end and there's no one backing up
McClenaghan to Woakes, 1 run, slower delivery from McClenaghan, Woakes slogs it to the deep for a run
McClenaghan to Kohli, 1 run, oh inside edge onto pad and it almost rolls back and hits the stumps, Woakes calls through for a run
McClenaghan to Kohli, SIX, take that! Short of a length delivery on the off stump, Kohli shows no respect and pulls the ball handsomely over mid-wicket. Brilliant hit
Mustafizur to Woakes, no run, he wanted to pull that over the mid-wicket fence as the length was short but missed
Mustafizur to Woakes, SIX, that's a lovely hit! Hit on the rise, the bat made a good sound as it made contact with the ball. Slower delivery again and Woakes went straight towards the sightscreen
Mustafizur to Kohli, 1 run, whipped uppishly with those wrists, there is protection at deep mid-wicket
Mustafizur to Kohli, FOUR, he's middled this alright, doesn't bother running! The off-cutter, Kohli launches it over the bowler's head and beats long-on
Mustafizur to Woakes, 1 run, slower delivery on the stumps, run down to third man
Mustafizur to Kohli, 1 run, there's an angry slog from Kohli, full ball on the stumps, mistimed to long-on
Hardik Pandya to Woakes, no run, slower delivery outside off stump, Woakes guides it to short third man
Hardik Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, oh the ball hits Kohli high on the bat. VK jumped out and loaded up for a big hit, the full toss got big on him, mistimed to mid-off
Hardik Pandya to Woakes, 1 run, fullish from Hardik Pandya, Woakes drives it to mid-off
Hardik Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, fifty for VK, but he won't celebrate. Doesn't even raise the bat. Just nudges this length ball into the on-side and gets to the milestone
Hardik Pandya to Woakes, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Woakes steers it to third man
Hardik Pandya to Woakes, no run, short delivery on the off stump, Woakes pulls and misses
Markande to Woakes, 1 run, googly just outside off stump, Woakes drives it to long-on

Markande to Sarfaraz Khan, out Stumped!! Blind swinging from Sarfaraz Khan. Advances and goes for an almighty swing, but Markande is clever enough to bowl this wide outside off stump and force the batsman to reach out, completely missed and Tare, the sub keeper, does the rest. Sarfaraz Khan st (sub)Tare b Markande 5(6) [4s-1]
Markande to Kohli, 1 run, flighted delivery on the leg stump, Kohli drives it to long-on

Markande to Kohli, 2 runs, is Sarfaraz Khan home? Kohli nudges to mid-wicket, pushes the youngster for the second and hey, you got to drag the bat in. Schoolboy stuff. He's plonked the bat inside the crease, luckily the bat was grounded just before the stumps were lit up
Markande to Kohli, no run, turn again, pitches on off and then spins sharply, Kohli defends off the back foot

Markande to Kohli, SIX, that's classic Virat Kohli for you! Flighted delivery just outside off stump, Kohli lofts the inside-out drive from the middle of the bat, hits the rope on the full. Stand and deliver stuff

Bumrah to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, he's guided this in the gap past backward point and it's running away for four. It was the slower delivery outside off stump, Sarfaraz gets the placement right by opening the bat face at the last moment

Bumrah to Sarfaraz Khan, no run, what was that from Sarfaraz Khan? Slower delivery outside off stump, Sarfaraz was down on one knee to scoop the ball and then he changes his mind and lets the ball pass. Looked funny and Bumrah absolutely loved it

Bumrah to Kohli, 1 run, pulled uppishly and that's brilliantly half-stopped by the man diving at short mid-wicket. Oh dear! The throw has bounced awkwardly from nowhere and smashed into Ishan Kishan's face. He's not wearing a helmet. He's in serious pain. The physio and the team-mates rush to him. He's on the ground. Hope he's alright. Hit him side of the face, just missed the right eye luckily as he turned his head. Hardik Pandya, who threw the ball, looks puzzled. Ishan Kishan walks off. Swelling near the right eye. Gets a roar from the crowd as he is up on his feet. That's a very nasty injury, but in a way, thankfully missed the eye. The ball just hit the rough patch on the side of the pitch and jumped steeply at him
Bumrah to Sarfaraz Khan, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Sarfaraz taps it softly towards backward point
Bumrah to Kohli, 1 run, defended with an angled bat towards point
Bumrah to Kohli, no run, good length delivery just outside off stump, Kohli defends off the back foot
Krunal Pandya to Sarfaraz Khan, no run, very full and on the stumps, Sarfaraz drives it to the right of the bowler, who dives and stops the ball

Krunal Pandya to Sarfaraz Khan, no run, lovely delivery! Gee this Wankhede pitch. Has turn, seam, runs and the ball swings as well. Brilliant cricket wicket. This one pitches on the stumps from a round the wicket angle and spins past the bat as Sarfaraz tries to defend
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, low full toss, Kohli glances it to short fine leg

Krunal Pandya to Washington Sundar, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! He got smashed in the first over, but he's got three wickets now. The widish delivery across the left-hander, Sundar mistimes the lofted drive over cover, hits it high and straight to long-off. Celebration time for Krunal Pandya. Washington Sundar c Suryakumar Yadav b Krunal Pandya 7(8) [4s-1]
Krunal Pandya to Washington Sundar, no run, wants to play this late to third man, but the ball jumps on him and goes past the bat
Krunal Pandya to Washington Sundar, 2 runs, flicked off the back foot to deep mid-wicket

Markande to Washington Sundar, byes, 1 run, oh beaten! Didn't pick that alright. Spins back in sharply from a good length, Sundar played outside the line trying to guide the ball to third man, could so easily have been a chop on
Markande to Kohli, 1 run, leading edge but doesn't carry, flighted delivery from Markande, Kohli plays across the line, gets it on the outer half and gets lucky that it fell well short of long-off
Markande to Washington Sundar, 1 run, he's reading the wrong 'uns alright, fullish from Markande, Sundar drives it to point
Markande to Washington Sundar, FOUR, lovely hit inside-out by Washi! The googly from Markande, seemed to have picked that from the hand, got a stride forward and lofted that beautifully over cover
Markande to Washington Sundar, no run, widish delivery outside off stump, Sundar slices it to backward point
Markande to Kohli, 1 run, driven off the front foot to long-off
Krunal Pandya to Washington Sundar, no run, flat and quick on leg, Sundar stands tall and defends it
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, quicker on leg, Kohli works it away to long-on

Krunal Pandya to Corey Anderson, out Caught by (sub)Duminy!! Anderson departs for a blob. Not a sweet IPL 2018 debut for the Kiwi all-rounder. Pandya gets two in two. Slowish and lured Anderson into a big shot. The batsmen went low and slogged, no timing whatsoever and he ended up hitting it straight to deep mid-wicket. Pandya is chuffed, so are rest of his team-mates. RCB digging a hole for themselves here. Corey Anderson c (sub)Duminy b Krunal Pandya 0(1)

Krunal Pandya to Mandeep, wide, out Stumped!! Once bitten twice shy. No mistake whatsoever from Ishan Kishan this time. Mandeep has been hokey-pokeyed for the second time and no repreive on this occasion. Very smart from Krunal; Mandeep announced his intent of stepping out early. Krunal sees it and lasers it wide of off. Very similar to the last over, Ishan Kishan doesn't panic, grabs it cleanly and whips the bails off. RCB lose their third wicket. Mandeep st Ishan Kishan b Krunal Pandya 16(14) [4s-1]
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, knocked softly to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Mandeep, 1 run, high-batted punch to long-off

Krunal Pandya to Mandeep, 2 runs, fab stop by SKY at long-on, certainly saved a boundary for his team. Flighted on the stumps, Mandeep marched out and blasted it down the ground. SKY runs across, dives full-length and prevents it from reaching the ropes
Markande to Mandeep, 1 run, flat and quick, Mandeep clears his front leg and flicks it away to deep mid-wicket
Markande to Kohli, 1 run, slapped to long-off
Markande to Mandeep, 1 run, swept away behind square on the leg-side

Markande to Mandeep, wide, drama. Ishan Kishan fluffs a stumping chance. Superb deception from Markande, saw the batsman step out and rifled it well wide of off, forcing Mandy to reach. Mandeep threw his bat and almost lost his balance which made him lose momentum. Ishan Kishan failed to collect it cleanly and grants Mandeep a lifeline
Markande to Kohli, 1 run, drifter on leg, Kohli tickles it away to fine leg and is now the leading run-scorer in IPL, overtaking Suresh Raina
Markande to Kohli, no run, flatter at the stumps, punched back to the bowler
Markande to Kohli, no run, the leggie, turns a wee bit and Kohli slices it - off the outer half to point
Krunal Pandya to Mandeep, 2 runs, tucked into the gap at mid-wicket and they put on the jetpack to scamper back for the second
Krunal Pandya to Mandeep, no run, good stop by Fizz at short fine leg. Tossed on leg, Mandeep stayed low and swept it to the left of Fizz, who gets across quickly and stops
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, stays in his crease and twirls his wrists to place it to deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Mandeep, 1 run, muscled away to deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, 1 run, slower outside off, Kohli waits and dabs it to short third man

Krunal Pandya to Mandeep, 1 run, fired it in quick on off, Mandeep pushes it to the right of Rohit at extra cover, who swiftly moves across and releases the throw in one motion. Hits the target but Mandeep's makes it in by dragging his bat
Markande to Mandeep, leg byes, 1 run, Mandeep dances out and fails to read the googly. Gets it away to the leg-side - off the pads
Markande to Kohli, 1 run, more air given, crunched to long-off
Markande to Mandeep, 1 run, generously tossed wider of off, Mandeep presses across and drives it to long-off
Markande to Kohli, 1 run, flights it full, Kohli lunges forward and extends his defence to long-off
Markande to Kohli, no run, googly from Markande, Kohli reads it well by hanging back and tucks it to short mid-wicket
Markande to Kohli, no run, Markande begins with a floater on off, Kohli push-drives it to the left of the bowler, who dives across and intercepts it
Mustafizur to Kohli, 1 run, Kohli takes a few strides down the pitch and flicks it into acres of gap on the leg-side
Mustafizur to Mandeep, 1 run, leg-stump line, Mandeep whips with no power. Airly to deep square leg
Mustafizur to Mandeep, no run, superb reply from Rahman. Dupes Mandeep with a cutter that grips and breaks away off the deck. Mandeep was playing for the original line and is beaten all ends up

Mustafizur to Mandeep, FOUR, cracked. Rohit isn't happy, asks Rahman to bowl towards the stumps. Fizz overpitches and offers it outside off, minimal effort from Mandeep. Shifts his weight forward and caresses the drive that beats extra cover
Mustafizur to Kohli, 1 run, driven fluently to long-off

Mustafizur to Kohli, FOUR, edgy but looked like it was intentional from Kohli. The slower ball from Rahman, ends up as a wide yorker. Kohli digs with an open bat face, runs it more off the outer half and it beats short third man
McClenaghan to Kohli, 1 run, pushed towards sweeper cover. The fielder sprawls in and fires a throw at the non-striker's end, breaks the stumps but the batsman was in anyway
McClenaghan to Mandeep, 1 run, Mandeep is off the mark with a tickle through square leg

McClenaghan to de Villiers, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! de Villiers perishes. Huge blow for RCB. Two wickets in the over and McClenaghan is turning it on here. Seemed like a certain ploy and de Villiers fell into the trap. Dug in short and there was a fielder positioned at deep mid-wicket. AB forgets, goes for the pull, doesn't bother to keep it down either. Flat and straight to Hardik, who cupped it. Straight down the gullet, didn't even had to move there. MI on top. de Villiers c Hardik Pandya b McClenaghan 1(2)
McClenaghan to Kohli, 1 run, trims his pace and wafts it just outside off, Kohli pokes it towards cover and races to the other end
McClenaghan to de Villiers, 1 run, full on middle and leg, de Villiers whisks it to mid-on

McClenaghan to de Kock, out Bowled!! And call it the text commentator's curse. McClenaghan snuffs out de Kock and Wankhede erupts. Nothing shot from de Kock. It was full and a semblance of tail back in. The batsman stepped forward and swung, completely down the wrong line and enough gap for the ball to sneak through to knock the off-stump. RCB lose their first wicket. de Kock b McClenaghan 19(12) [4s-2 6s-1]
Mustafizur to de Kock, 1 run, stabbed with a straight bat to mid-off

Mustafizur to de Kock, SIX, de Kock has found his bearings. Rahman errs, bowls it full on QDK's strong zone. Just bent forward and lifted it through the line. Ah, all timing as it sails over the ropes over mid-on
Mustafizur to Kohli, 1 run, they take the single on this occasion. Rahman cramps Kohli for room with this back of a length delivery on off. Dropped in front of cover and easy single there
Mustafizur to Kohli, no run, a bit of yes-no situation, no harm done in the end. Kohli patted it towards point, took off for a moment but QDK wasn't interested and sends him back
Mustafizur to de Kock, 1 run, Rahman shortens his length and keeps it just outside off, de Kock stands tall and punches it to sweeper cover

Mustafizur to de Kock, FOUR, this wasn't timed as he would've liked, but de Kock will still earn a boundary. The slower delivery from Fizz, de Kock didn't pick it as he was through the shot early. Still managed to get enough wood to place it over mid-on. There's no stopping that

McClenaghan to Kohli, FOUR, su-sweet. Ends the over with a boundary. Juicy half-volley from McClenaghan, well outside off. Kohli isn't sparing those. Leans across, plants his front foot towards the ball and slashes it through extra cover. Beats a crowed off-side field
McClenaghan to de Kock, 1 run, worked off the pads through square leg
McClenaghan to de Kock, no run, very full outside off, de Kock goes for the drive but mistimes it to point
McClenaghan to Kohli, 1 run, banged in short, Kohli rolls his wrists and controls the pull through mid-wicket

McClenaghan to Kohli, no run, McClenaghan and MI fielders are excited but they aren't reviewing this. McClenaghan nearly snuffed out Kohli for the fifth time here. Decked back in from a length, Kohli was caught in amidships because of the spongy bounce. Fails to connect with the nudge and seems like it brushed the thigh pad there. Yup, no bat. Clearly off the thigh pad
McClenaghan to de Kock, 1 run, fullish on middle and leg, de Kock gets across and taps it towards mid-on
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, no run, pushed to mid-on
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, FOUR, this is tripe. Gift packed and delivered to Kohli. Flat and short outside off, Kohli goes back and thrashes it through cover
Krunal Pandya to Kohli, no run, slowish on leg, strangely Kohli's offers no shot and takes it on the thigh pad

Krunal Pandya to Kohli, FOUR, uppish and through Pollard's hands at short mid-wicket. Trademark Kohli whip. Clears his front leg and swats it off his pads. Pollard leaps but in vain. Races away to the boundary at deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to de Kock, 1 run, on the pads, flicked softly through square leg

Krunal Pandya to de Kock, FOUR, is greeted to the crease with a boundary. Flighted on the stumps, de Kock gets and sweeps. Gets it more off the top-edge but it sails over behind square. No-one there and they'll collect a boundary

Bumrah to Kohli, FOUR, what a shot. Bumrah overdoes, overpitches and that's too easy for Kohli. Gets forward, with a full face of the bat and creams it past mid-on. That boundary will ruin a decent over by Bumrah
Bumrah to Kohli, no run, the inducker from Bumrah, Kohli is rightly behind the line and defends it solidly
Bumrah to de Kock, leg byes, 1 run, slips in a cutter at 112kph. Gains some iffy bounce and knocks de Kock on the thigh pad. Rolls to the leg-side and they sneak in a leg-bye
Bumrah to de Kock, wide, Bumrah's radar loses signal momentarily. Splays it down leg

Bumrah to de Kock, no run, half-hearted appeal by Bumrah, but he aborts it soon. Full and curved in sharply, de Kock was shuffling across and misses the clip. Is struck on the pad but it's heading down leg
Bumrah to Kohli, 1 run, Kohli is away. Bumrah goes a little wide of off, Kohli opens his bat face, uses the pace and steers it to third man
Bumrah to Kohli, no run, Bumrah starts with an outside off stump channel to test Kohli, who has a sturdy poke with soft hands and guides it with a tilted bat to point
Corey Anderson to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, finishing touches. Make it 21 off the over -- and Pandya's done it with a flash straight down. 213 it will be ..

Corey Anderson to McClenaghan, 2 wides, moves away, Anderson goes the other way. Past the line, and the carnage means that the keeper's slow enough to deny them the sneaked bye as well. Pandya has his strike back

Corey Anderson to Rohit, out Caught by Woakes!! Real quick. Talk about timing even when you are getting out. Rohit backs away, smacks it down long-on's throat. And it's so flat that Pandya can't even cross over. Rohit c Woakes b Corey Anderson 94(52) [4s-10 6s-5]
Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, another juicy full toss. Oh dear. Oh dear. Flat-batted, heaving it downtown. Oh the bleeding, it's getting painful to watch

Corey Anderson to Rohit, SIX, makes him bowl a full toss. Misses the yorker, the dew isn't helping him either. And Rohit doesn't need these, really. You don't have to be this kind. Carved away, deep extra cover
Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, clears his front leg. Goes conventional. Full meat, over the bolwer, and trickling further in. Deadly death batting this
Corey Anderson to Rohit, no run, tries some extravaganza. Goes down to paddle, can't get low enough. Uncharacteristic
Corey Anderson to Rohit, wide, too wide. Almost cutting the line of the pitch in the process
Woakes to Rohit, 1 run, lines himself up to drive it over sweeper
Woakes to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, opens up his bat face to smear it through point
Woakes to Hardik Pandya, SIX, and now length. The cardinal length. Pandya rubbing it in and how. Holds his pose, lets the ball get close and clears long-off with his lofted shovel
Woakes to Hardik Pandya, SIX, feeds him a revenge gift. Short, on the body, and Pandya swivels, almost base-balling it into the second floor. Where else, but behind square

Woakes to Hardik Pandya, no run, a peach. Oh it doesn't get better. And to imagine it coming in the death in the midst of an onslaught. Oh and amidst all this noise, the umpire's heard a tickle. He's given him caught behind. But Pandya isn't amused, he goes up instantly. Why bother consulting your partner with 10 balls to go in the day. And UltraEdge is a murmur all through, but when it passes the bat it gets a little bigger. The sound's deaf. Oh and forget the spikes, the third umpire overturns

Woakes to Pollard, out Caught by de Villiers!! Smart slower stuff. Pollard never comfortable when he has to slog without getting set. Today's no different. Doesn't quite get his power right on the cutter that Woakes digs into the pitch on length. Tries whacking it over long-on, but AB's there. And he's good to take it reverse-cupped. Pollard c de Villiers b Woakes 5(7)
Woakes to Pollard, wide, 135.8kph, goes full, but way outside off. Pollard watches as he walks in his leave
Siraj to Pollard, 1 run, another tailing in one in the blockhole. Squeezed away off the inside half down to square leg
Siraj to Pollard, no run, back to his yorker. Oh he's doing these really well. Swinging in late and Pollard can only jam it out
Siraj to Rohit, 1 run, big shuffle in a very unlike-him ramp to short fine. Siraj's keen on an LBW appeal - there's nothing on the pad, not even a deflection onto it

Siraj to Rohit, SIX, wow. Okay Google - search for descriptions. Siraj errs for a change, letting the length sit up in Rohit arc .. and that arc's ever-expanding. Flat-bats, high and into long-on. Save your faces
Siraj to Pollard, 1 run, full, into the crease on middle. Jammed down the ground
Siraj to Pollard, 2 runs, on a back of a length, rib-lined. Bunted in front of square
U Yadav to Rohit, 2 runs, low full toss, drifting into the boots. A pick-up-shovel through mid-wicket, where Chahal slides
U Yadav to Rohit, 2 runs, 113.2kph, slower again. A jump down, riding the bounce to jab it to a palming extra cover. And that palm's saved a couple
U Yadav to Rohit, wide, 106kph, goes slower, looking for that sucker impulsive loft. But it's way outside off, enough for Rohit to withdraw
U Yadav to Rohit, no run, wide yorker. Much, much better. Squeeze-sliced to point. Couldn't have found him any better
U Yadav to Pollard, 1 run, an outside-halved drive down to third man. He's happy watching the show
U Yadav to Rohit, 1 run, nails the yorker. Wow. Binaries, see. Dug down

U Yadav to Rohit, SIX, oh my. As if the half trackers weren't enough, the hospitality has stretched out to dishing out full tosses on the hips. All Rohit has to do is impart direction and that's swiping it into fine leg. A railway tragedy wouldn't be far
Corey Anderson to Pollard, no run, length, tightening up on off. He wants a defence, and it's bat-pad stuck
Corey Anderson to Rohit, 1 run, presses forward, adjusts to the sticker to biff it down to long-off

Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, that short-wide combo. And Rohit has no shortage of time on anything. Gets in line, angry bat, angry hands on the revenge from the run-out he's caused. And into deep point

Corey Anderson to Rohit, out Krunal Pandya Run Out!! 1 run completed. More running troubles. Anderson standing in the way and Krunal has to take a step away to ensure he doesn't collide again. Can't afford getting injured. Well the tournament can't afford anyone else getting injured, the replacements aren't leaving their Counties. Right, Rohit smashed it down the ground, wants the strike. Pandya has to sacrifice. Hesitated for the second, stopped and takes the longer route. Alas, the dive is too late. Krunal Pandya run out (Woakes/Corey Anderson) 15(12) [4s-1 6s-1]

Corey Anderson to Rohit, no run, yorker. Jammed out just past the pitch into the off-side, and they try sneaking in the single. But Corey's and Krunal's timing is right up there .. perfectly in collision

Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, angling wide across. Rohit in some form, he leans, frees up his hands, taking it head-on in hammering it square. Oh the way he opens up the face in slicing,check the leather!
U Yadav to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, and now feeds the pads for some reason. Umesh's dealing in binaries here. Whipped away, typically bottom-handed, teasing fine leg
U Yadav to Krunal Pandya, no run, neat bumper. From over the wicket, into Pandya's ear as he manages to sit
U Yadav to Rohit, 1 run, pitched up on middle. Drilled powerfullu, opening up the bat face to get it through sweeper
U Yadav to Rohit, no run, toe-ends a low full toss to mid-wicket

U Yadav to Rohit, FOUR, now compensated with width too. The length stays short and friendly. Rohit carves, doesn't even bother keeping it down, given how fine third man is. And yes, it's a fifty .. his first of this season
U Yadav to Rohit, SIX, raw meat. That length, you are obliged to smack. Rohit smokes, swinging flat-batted, into the first tier over square leg

Chahal to Krunal Pandya, no run, 84.3kph, just short. Everything a moral victory here for Chahal, who's floated it wide, playing around with Pandya's ego, his lack of timing and forces him to reach out. Stops at the very last minute as he tries going through a lofted slap, miscues and falls inches short of a diving Kohli at extra cover
Chahal to Rohit, 1 run, 91.4kph, fired into the pads, gently knocked away in front of square
Chahal to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, goes wider. Quicker. Pandya has to reach out to power it to cow corner

Chahal to Krunal Pandya, SIX, connects. Cleanly at last. And then it's going only one way. Chahal tries a flipper, but Krunal with his shuffle gets under, sits under and dispatches it into long-on. Nothing subtle
Chahal to Rohit, 1 run, gentle leg-break. Starting short, going wide, Rohit reaches to stab it through sweeper
Chahal to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, muscled slog. No timing - as usual tonight. A couple of bounces down to long-on
Siraj to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, full, wide, makes Krunal stretch. And he can only mis-drag-slog it to long-on. A couple of quiet overs being sneaked in here
Siraj to Krunal Pandya, no run, cutting back in off a length, ties Pandya's flat-footed glance, beating the bat to rap him high on the pad
Siraj to Krunal Pandya, wide, bangs it in. And there's enough bounce, even with the 12-over old ball to go just over the umpire's threshold
Siraj to Krunal Pandya, no run, hitting the right top-of-off spot. A punch down the pitch, all of it in a settled defence
Siraj to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, a hint of a walk, decides to take it on-sided. Picks and hacks, full-blooded. If only the timing would've been as good. Meek ramble in the wide cow corner gap
Siraj to Krunal Pandya, no run, too close to be chopping, the angle here from Siraj keeps nipping back in and Pandya nearly inside-edges it back
Siraj to Krunal Pandya, no run, 140.4kph, very tight on off, keeping it on a hard good length. Covers the line to block
Corey Anderson to Rohit, no run, checks an open-faced dab to point. This fielder isn't worth taking on. Rohit knows, sends Krunal back
Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, rubbing insult. A nothing half tracker, drifting down leg and Rohit loads up on the back foot, swivelling as he swats it powerfully behind square. One-bounced

Corey Anderson to Rohit, 2 runs, 136.5kph, too hard. Loses shape, loses timing and carves it off the outer half down to third man. Sarfaraz has never been the quickest .. Kohli's happy to let him know
Corey Anderson to Rohit, no run, pitched up around off. Rohit strokes through the line, rather lovingly to mid-off

Corey Anderson to Lewis, out Caught by de Kock!! And the twist comes from a stress-fractured off-cutter. They've realized there's no point in bowling your best ball, and Anderson smartly floats up a slower change up. Lewis can't wait, he commits to a lofted slice, loses timing, has the ball grab the upper half of his bat and fly. Fly higher. Over Quinton, who's already messed up a few. He runs behind, under the swirl, comes back and collects. Lewis c de Kock b Corey Anderson 65(42) [4s-6 6s-5]
Corey Anderson to Lewis, no run, gets that front leg away. Slaps through the line to mid-off
Chahal to Rohit, no run, squeezes an attempted inside-out back down the pitch
Chahal to Lewis, 1 run, tightens on off, Lewis stays stuck for a change, pokes away from his body towards short third
Chahal to Lewis, SIX, typically dragged down. Lewis' smart, he sits, gets it in his slot and heave-sweeps. Checks the railway tracks behind square leg..the ball's there

Chahal to Lewis, SIX, he's done waiting for something deft. He's down, running, Chahal's gone slower as well for some reason. Swings, big time, and it's more a miscue .. never mind when you've got hands like these. Way over long-off
Chahal to Lewis, no run, another walk across, Chahal's smartly darting them wide. Can't connect, again
Chahal to Lewis, no run, quick wide slider. Lewis does his best reaching out, cuts all over it

Corey Anderson to Lewis, 1 run, had to put in the dive! And he does. Rohit's turn to face the heat as the dodgy running between these two continues. Short of a length and guided towards backward point. Lot of hesitation in the running and a direct hit might have got the MI skipper maybe

Corey Anderson to Rohit, 1 run, direct hit would have been close! Lewis was certainly in double but Mandeep's throw at the keeper's end misses by a whisker. Was a goner if it had hit. Wide yorker that was squeezed by Rohit towards backward point
Corey Anderson to Rohit, no run, very full on middle and leg, jammed back towards the bowler

Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, does it again! Rohit is determined not to let his former MI teammate settle. Stays in the crease this time and just gets leg-side of the ball a touch before launching it inside out over extra cover. Delicious strokeplay!

Corey Anderson to Rohit, FOUR, how hard has he hit this one! Boy, that's some power from Rohit. Charges down the track and makes room to create width. The length wasn't all that short but he clobbered it over cover. Rocketed away
Corey Anderson to Rohit, no run, fullish and angling across Rohit who drives it well off the front foot. Straight towards mid-off
Chahal to Lewis, no run, a repeat of the previous ball! Another slider from Chahal and Lewis is stuck on the crease, trying to cut. Beaten
Chahal to Lewis, no run, skids off the track from outside off, Lewis wanted to cut it away but is beaten

Chahal to Lewis, SIX, that's hugeeeeeeeeeeeee! Lewis continues on his merry ways. Picks the top spinner quickly and brings out the imperious slog sweep. Huge maximum over deep backward square leg. Brings up his 50! He is looking deadly tonight
Chahal to Lewis, no run, slows it down considerably but spears this well wide outside off, left alone. Lewis wanted the wide but didn't get it
Chahal to Lewis, 2 runs, slower and short outside off, made a cracking sound off the bat as Lewis crashed the cut through backward point. Sweeper cover gets around to mop up
Chahal to Rohit, 1 run, floated up on leg, Rohit uses his feet and whips it past a diving Chahal towards long-on

Washington Sundar to Lewis, FOUR, not Sundar's night at all. Another drag-on, leg-stumpish and these are easy pickings for Lewis. Sits back and swivels across to clatter the pull to the deep mid-wicket fence. The offie has been unusually erratic so far

Washington Sundar to Rohit, 1 run, once again Rohit is surprised by the extra bounce off the deck. There was a bit of turn as well and Sharma checked his stroke off the back foot. In the air for a while but it was always going to long-off on a few bounces at least
Washington Sundar to Lewis, 1 run, very full on off stump, Lewis leans across and drives it down the ground to long-on
Washington Sundar to Rohit, 1 run, flatter and outside off, stays on the back foot and dabs it towards short third man

Washington Sundar to Rohit, SIX, down the pitch and bang! The MI skipper has decided to up the ante a little. Shimmies down the track on seeing the flight and the leg-stump line helped as well, launched into the stands at deep mid-wicket. Super shot
Washington Sundar to Rohit, no run, floated up around middle and leg, turning in a touch. Rohit was surprised by the extra bounce and tapped this to short mid-wicket

Siraj to Lewis, no run, excellent stop by Kohli at extra cover, dives to his left to save a few runs for his side. Fullish ball and Lewis was kind of open up on the drive although he did still pack a punch on the stroke. Fine comeback from Siraj after the hammering in his first over. In fact, it's been a couple of tidy overs for the visitors
Siraj to Lewis, no run, another slower ball and it's dragged wider outside off, Lewis mistimes the back foot punch back towards Siraj
Siraj to Rohit, 1 run, on a length wider outside off, Rohit opens the bat face to run it down to third man
Siraj to Rohit, no run, on a good length just outside off, nips in a fraction to cramp Rohit. Off the bottom edge towards de Kock
Siraj to Lewis, 1 run, slower and short outside off, Lewis cuts it away but there is protection in the form of a deep point. Just a single
Siraj to Rohit, 1 run, on a good length just outside off, Rohit stays back and steers it down to third man

Woakes to Lewis, no run, yes he does! Excellent over from Woakes to put a cap on the run flow. Slower and very full outside off, just inside the tramline as Lewis lets it pass. The southpaw expected a wide perhaps but it certainly wasn't one

Woakes to Lewis, no run, excellent bowling! Keeps it very full and attacks the stumps, Lewis can only squeeze it towards extra cover. Four dots on the bounce after that boundary first ball. Can Woakes finish this well?
Woakes to Lewis, no run, another slower ball, back of a length and Lewis dabs it towards the right of the backward point fielder who reacts quickly to prevent the single
Woakes to Lewis, no run, change of pace and outside off, Lewis stays back and guides it towards the fielder at short third man
Woakes to Lewis, no run, tries the yorker and it ends up as a dipping full toss, Lewis throws his bat at it and fails to connect

Woakes to Lewis, FOUR, raining boundaries! Cannot understand this ploy though, back of a length outside off with third man in the ring. Lewis stays back and glides it, just had to beat that man in the 30-yard circle and he does it with ease
Siraj to Lewis, 1 run, full and around off, dug out towards mid-on and they steal a quick single as the shy at the bowler's end misses

Siraj to Lewis, FOUR, bleeding runs here! This is a fab counterattack from these two and the RCB bowlers are wilting under the onslaught. Slower but short with a lot of width, allows Lewis to chance his arms with a slap cut through backward point

Siraj to Lewis, 5 wides, poor from Siraj and nothing much de Kock can do about the bad bounce. Tries the variation and it slips outside off, could say that the wide call was marginal but the uneven bounce means that de Kock couldn't get down in time. Races away to the fence
Siraj to Lewis, no run, lovely ball, Siraj cranks up his pace with this yorker. Lewis had to react swiftly and just about dug this one out. Clocked approximately 143kph!
Siraj to Lewis, no run, whacked hard but straight to Kohli at extra cover. Fuller length and Lewis made room to blast the drive. Just couldn't pierce the gap
Siraj to Lewis, no run, full and on off stump, jammed off the front foot towards the off-side

Siraj to Lewis, SIX, welcome to the attack Mr.Siraj! Lewis is absolutely nonchalant as he dispatches this rubbish short ball way into the stands at deep backward square leg. At his pace, Siraj needs to be careful about the lengths he bowls, especially in the Powerplay

Washington Sundar to Lewis, 1 run, close shave for Lewis! Didn't put in the dive and trusted his long reach to bail him through. The direct hit at the bowler's end did test him to be frank but the West Indian got through in the end, only just though. It was a nicely floated off break to start with, gripped a touch and forced a leading edge towards backward point. There was a slight stutter in the running before they eventually decided to go ahead with it. No harm done in the end

Washington Sundar to Lewis, FOUR, this is getting disastrous for the young off spinner but he has only himself to blame. Another fuller ball down leg, this time Lewis doesn't fail to connect. Sweeps it very fine down the leg-side and past the fielder who was in the ring

Washington Sundar to Lewis, 5 wides, horror stuff from Sundar! He is feeling the heat, that's for sure. In a bid to overcorrect the length, he loses the line as well. Fired full and down leg, Lewis misses the sweep and de Kock cannot get to it either. Free runs

Washington Sundar to Lewis, FOUR, super shot! Sundar is being put under pressure here. Flatter and a touch short outside off, Lewis waits on the back foot and punches this through the gap at backward point. Lovely stuff! Even Kohli cannot help but applaud the stroke
Washington Sundar to Rohit, 1 run, soft leading edge and dribbles towards cover. Floated up on off, Rohit probably closed the bat face a touch early. They sneak a quick run
Washington Sundar to Rohit, no run, slows it down and keeps it around off, blocked off the back foot towards the bowler

Washington Sundar to Rohit, FOUR, doesn't start well and on this pitch, there is little margin for error. Slightly short and a bit of width as well, Rohit sits back and crunches it through the covers. Found the gap and the outfield did the rest
U Yadav to Rohit, 1 run, short of a length just outside off, Rohit allows the ball to come to him and dabs it down to third man to retain strike
U Yadav to Rohit, no run, back of a length and climbs onto Rohit as he tries to defend off the back foot. Spliced towards the fielder at point

U Yadav to Lewis, 1 run, pitched up outside off, Lewis drives this wide of the long-off fielder who is equal to the task as he quickly moves across to his right. Prevents the second run with his agility
U Yadav to Lewis, no run, very full and outside off, driven off the front foot but straight towards mid-off

U Yadav to Lewis, FOUR, wrong line and is duly punished. Short of a length and is down leg as well, cannot do that with fine leg in the ring. Lewis swivels across for the pull and although it came off the inner half, was always a percentage shot. Beats the fielder in the ring comfortably and races away
U Yadav to Lewis, no run, tries the yorker but ends up as a low full toss, Lewis gets his bat down in time. Off the toe end towards mid-off

Woakes to Lewis, 1 run, stayed down a fraction perhaps and a bit of inward movement as well from a good length. Lewis was stuck on the back foot and just about got his bat down in time. Off the inside edge towards backward square leg and Rohit calls him across

Woakes to Lewis, SIX, dumped over deep backward square leg! Doesn't take long for Lewis to launch. Gets one that's fractionally short and he is on the back foot in a jiffy. Swivels to absolutely clobber the pull. Went deep into the stands
Woakes to Lewis, no run, on a good length around off stump, Lewis stays on the back foot and nudges it with a slightly open bat face towards point
Woakes to Rohit, 1 run, another very full ball outside off, smeared towards mid-off as they scamper through for a brisk single. AB was quick to gather it and have a shy, misses. Rohit was in though

Woakes to Rohit, FOUR, classy shot! He has been out of form but strokes like these should set Rohit up nicely. Half-volley and not all that wide, but he leans nicely to caress the drive through the covers. Raced away to the fence in no time
Woakes to Rohit, no run, pitched up just outside off, Rohit gets across and drives well towards mid-on who is swift to react to his left
U Yadav to Lewis, no run, shortens the length a bit outside off, Lewis hops across on the back foot and meets it with a straight bat in defence. Top over from Umesh to start! Simply brilliant
U Yadav to Rohit, 1 run, walks down the track, does Rohit and eases this fullish ball towards mid-off. Runs through with the stroke and gets off the mark
U Yadav to Lewis, 1 run, good ball! Lewis was equal to the task though. Lovely inswinger around off, very full and it's driven off the front foot past the bowler towards mid-on

U Yadav to Rohit, leg byes, 1 run, the MI skipper keeps out the hat-trick ball, only just though. The inswinger but the line is too straight, Rohit misses the flick and it rolls off the pads to backward square leg

U Yadav to Ishan Kishan, out Bowled!! Got himmmmm, yess goneeee! Umesh is breathing fire I tell you. If the first one was a good nut, talk about this one! What a corker! Goes full and it's almost the ideal inswinger that lands around off, Kishan plays around it, quite like Suryakumar did and sees the off stump go for a walk. Fab sight for any fast bowler and Umesh is on a hat-trick now, folks! RCB have started this game with a bang. Pressure mounting on the hosts. Ishan Kishan b U Yadav 0(1)

U Yadav to Suryakumar Yadav, out Bowled!! What a cracker to start! It's a golden duck for Suryakumar Yadav. A beaut from Umesh to begin, gets this to nip in a touch from a straightish off stump line. It was full and drew Suryakumar forward but he didn't anticipate the late movement. As a result, ended up playing around it and missed it completely. The woodwork is disturbed and up go the RCB players in jubilation. Umesh is absolutely pumped. Suryakumar Yadav b U Yadav 0(1)
Laughlin to Karthik, SIX, hoisted over long-on to wrap up a clinical win for KKR. Set himself up for this length ball and launched it into the night sky, falls way back into the stands
Laughlin to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slower short ball wide of off, Rana loses shape as he's forced to wait on his cut. Ends up chopping it off a thick under-edge towards point
Laughlin to Karthik, 1 run, powers the slower ball down towards long-on
Laughlin to Nitish Rana, 1 run, chips the slower ball down towards long-on
Laughlin to Nitish Rana, wide, length ball down leg, Rana misses out. But they'll collect a wide
Laughlin to Nitish Rana, 2 runs, an inswinging slower ball on middle and leg, Rana clears his front leg and drives to the right of long-off
Stokes to Nitish Rana, 1 run, dabs this length ball down to third man

Stokes to Nitish Rana, no run, backs away to a short of length delivery, but still doesn't get the requisite amount of room to slash it away over point. Stokes's extra miles were too quick for him as well. Beaten
Stokes to Karthik, 1 run, slower length ball just outside off, dabs it in front of backward point
Stokes to Karthik, FOUR, full toss outside off, 144kph, Karthik carves it away through backward point. Rocketed off his bat
Stokes to Karthik, 2 runs, the leg-cutter drifts in at Karthik's hips, he shuffles across and whips it away wide of long leg
Stokes to Nitish Rana, 1 run, short-arm jab through square leg for one
Unadkat to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slower length ball on off, defended wide of cover

Unadkat to Nitish Rana, SIX, pretty full from Unadkat, and this is brilliant use of the crease from Rana. He takes a step back which allows him to get under the ball. Mid-off was up in the ring, so the idea was to just loft it over him. And despite the bat turning in his hands, it still clears the ropes
Unadkat to Karthik, 1 run, back of a length delivery slanted across off, punched through point

Unadkat to Karthik, SIX, oh what a freebie, and what a time for it. Any pressure that had built on KKR has evaporated. Slower short ball on leg-stump, Karthik whip-pulls it witheringly over the long leg boundary
Unadkat to Nitish Rana, 1 run, full and straight, prevents Rana from getting under the ball. Driven along the ground to long-on
Unadkat to Karthik, 1 run, walks down the pitch and flicks this length ball towards deep mid-wicket. Almost similar to how he got out against DD. But this one's gone on the bounce to Stokes
Laughlin to Karthik, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, Karthik cracks a back-cut to third man
Laughlin to Nitish Rana, 1 run, very full just outside off, smeared to the left of sweeper cover who covers good ground very swiftly and keeps them to one
Laughlin to Nitish Rana, no run, good length ball on middle, 133kph, Rana clears his front leg and drives to short cover
Laughlin to Karthik, 1 run, back of a length delivery, works it down to long-on
Laughlin to Karthik, no run, driven straight to cover

Laughlin to Karthik, 2 runs, short of length delivery at the chest, Karthik works it softly into the vacant mid-wicket region. Senses the opportunity for two, with the deep fielder having a lot of ground to cover
Unadkat to Karthik, 1 run, back of a length off-cutter on middle and leg, tucks it round the corner for one
Unadkat to Karthik, no run, slower ball on off, defended into the off-side
Unadkat to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slower short ball outside off, Rana's feet are in the air as he scythes it over point. Only a single

Unadkat to Nitish Rana, no run, slower length ball on off, Rana defends back towards the bowler and sets off for a single. Ridiculous judgement. Karthik obviously sends him back, but even a dive wouldn't have saved him if Unadkat had hit the stumps direct. Michael Clarke calls it the worst attempted single in the history of cricket
Unadkat to Karthik, 1 run, clatters the pull shot but hits it straight to deep mid-wicket. Unlucky there. Five yards either side would have been an easy four
Unadkat to Karthik, 2 runs, crisp back-foot punch from Karthik through the covers, "two two two" is the call. And sure enough, they race back for the second
Shreyas Gopal to Karthik, 1 run, 92kph, length ball on off, Karthik nudges it through mid-wicket. He looks for the second but it's not there
Shreyas Gopal to Nitish Rana, 1 run, shovels the googly down to long-on
Shreyas Gopal to Karthik, 1 run, googly on middle and leg, only slightly short but it's enough for Karthik to swivel it away through square leg
Shreyas Gopal to Karthik, no run, nicely on top of this as he defends into the off-side
Shreyas Gopal to Karthik, 2 runs, flat leg-break on middle, Karthik goes right back and nurdles it softly behind square. He hurtles back for the second and dives into the crease
Shreyas Gopal to Nitish Rana, 1 run, swatted on the bounce to deep mid-wicket. He pulled this very hard, but couldn't get much elevation

Gowtham to Karthik, FOUR, oh lovely. He's already showing some excellent touch out there. 102kph delivery from Gowtham, Karthik stays back to it and then dabs it out of the keeper's gloves. So so late and really really fine
Gowtham to Karthik, 2 runs, now he cuts this ball to the right of the man in the deep, they have to rush back for the second this time as the fielder gets to it quickly. Not a great throw
Gowtham to Karthik, 2 runs, flat and short outside off, Karthik back-cuts through backward point and comes back for two as sweeper cover cuts it off

Gowtham to Uthappa, out Caught by Stokes!! Superb catch at the boundary from Stokes, showing great awareness here. It was drilled back hard by Uthappa, and Stokes had plenty to do at long-on. Initially, he had to take a brilliant overhead catch while making sure that he times his jump nicely. And then he had to toss the ball back in as his feet were going to encroach the cushions. He judges the situation to a nicety and the execution is spot on. Uthappa c Stokes b Gowtham 48(36) [4s-6 6s-2]
Gowtham to Nitish Rana, 1 run, goes down on the back knee and sweeps to fine leg
Gowtham to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Gowtham darting them in real quick - 95kph this one. Rana goes back, uses the pace of it and tickles it nice and fine. Bit too straight this one from round the wicket
Laughlin to Nitish Rana, 1 run, 137kph, yorker on middle, Rana hops back and works it through square leg
Laughlin to Uthappa, 1 run, this slower ball swings away from Uthappa who toe-ends the flick to deep mid-wicket. He took it on the full, but had no timing on it
Laughlin to Uthappa, no run, slower good length ball, Uthappa gets forward and defends
Laughlin to Nitish Rana, 1 run, 112kph, slower back of length delivery going across off, Rana pats it wide of Rahane at short cover and calls for a tricky single. He makes it comfortably in the end
Laughlin to Nitish Rana, no run, slower length ball at the stumps, blocked back
Laughlin to Nitish Rana, FOUR, low full toss outside off, Rana puts bat to ball and it skims away through the covers. Didn't go too hard on the drive, just focused on timing which was spot on

Gowtham to Uthappa, no run, they've gone upstairs for a stumping check, but the Royals don't seem too excited. Oooh, Uthappa's back foot was out for a bit. But he's able to plonk it back inside the crease by the time the bails are taken off. He had stretched out to fetch the cross-batted swipe from outside off, but it skidded on from a length and sneaked under his bat
Gowtham to Uthappa, no run, 97kph, length ball on off, bunted back in the air by Uthappa but it falls just short of Gowtham as he dives across - on the half-volley
Gowtham to Nitish Rana, 1 run, sliding in on middle and leg, 93kph, Rana nudges into the vacant square leg region
Gowtham to Uthappa, 1 run, fired in on a length at 100kph, Uthappa works it down to long-on
Gowtham to Uthappa, no run, flat length delivery skidding on around off, punched back to Gowtham
Gowtham to Nitish Rana, 1 run, dances down and pushes back to Gowtham who misfields and lets it through to long-off
Stokes to Nitish Rana, 1 run, another slow and short delivery outside off, Rana has to wait for ages as he connects it cut past the man at point, only a single though
Stokes to Uthappa, 1 run, full length delivery on middle and leg, Uthappa chips it down to long-on for a single, that was in the air for a while but well short of the fielder
Stokes to Uthappa, wide, slower delivery gone wrong. Sprays it down the leg side and Uthappa leaves it alone
