Stokes to Nitish Rana, 1 run, right into the blockhole there, on middle and leg, Rana digs it out to mid-on for a single
Stokes to Uthappa, 1 run, on middle and leg, Uthappa drags it to deep mid-wicket for a single

Stokes to Uthappa, FOUR, misfield by Unadkat and Stokes isn't pleased by that. Was a back of a length delivery outside off, Uthappa went for it with hard hands, threw his bat at it and got an outside edge. Unadkat slips at square third man and misfields as the ball goes through him
Stokes to Nitish Rana, 1 run, on a length outside off, guides to backward point by Rana

Shreyas Gopal to Uthappa, SIX, a biggie to end the over! Excellent timing on that. Full and floated on middle, Uthappa doesn't miss out on the chance to slog it over mid-wicket, a meaty blow that was. That'll spoil the over for the bowler
Shreyas Gopal to Nitish Rana, 1 run, flighted delivery around middle and leg, tucked to the on side by Rana to get off the mark

Shreyas Gopal to Narine, out Narine Run Out!! Poor piece of running there. First of all he tried to reverse sweep it and as it went off the pads to short third man. Narine wanted the run but Uthappa sent him back. There was no chance that Uthappa would have completed the run. Unadkat is the man who throws it at the keeper's end to catch Narine well short of his crease. Narine run out (Unadkat/Buttler) 35(25) [4s-5 6s-1]
Shreyas Gopal to Narine, no run, loopy delivery around off, Narine comes down the wicket and decides to defend as Gopal bowls a googly and shortens the length

Shreyas Gopal to Uthappa, 1 run, tossed up delivery outside off, Uthappa guides it to short third man and gets across to the other end. The throw came in at Narine's end and deflected away off his bat to long-off, hence Narine decided against taking the second, in the right spirit of the game...
Shreyas Gopal to Narine, leg byes, 1 run, flat and quick on the pads, Narine tries to nudge that away to the on side, gets struck on the pads but makes sure to change ends

Stokes to Uthappa, no run, only 6 runs off Stokes' first over! Was a fine over by him, apart from the edge that went to the boundary. This was short and quick outside off, Uthappa poked at it, got beaten all ends up
Stokes to Uthappa, no run, good delivery that one. Yorker outside off, too good for Uthappa who gets beaten as he tries to squeeze it out
Stokes to Narine, 1 run, fires in a full length delivery around off, Narine drives it past the diving fielder at extra-cover, gets a single

Stokes to Narine, FOUR, another edge, another boundary. On a length around off, Narine goes hard at it and gets an outside edge that makes it fly past the keeper. Even a dive by Buttler wouldn't have helped his cause
Stokes to Uthappa, 1 run, length delivery on middle and leg, Uthappa nudges it to deep mid-wicket for a single

Stokes to Uthappa, no run, shout for an lbw, turned down by the umpire. Short of a length around middle and off, Uthappa looks to flick it away but gets beaten due to pace and is struck on the pads. Stokes goes up in an appeal but the umpire thinks it was going above the stumps. Or maybe, there was an inside edge

Shreyas Gopal to Narine, 2 runs, this was full in length and a straighter one outside off, Narine chips it towards wide long-off and gets two as Stokes sprints to his right and stops it with a fine effort in the outfield
Shreyas Gopal to Narine, no run, another googly by Gopal, Narine guides it back to the bowler
Shreyas Gopal to Uthappa, 1 run, flatter around off, Uthappa flicks it away to deep mid-wicket and gets off the strike
Shreyas Gopal to Uthappa, SIX, short and punished! Gopal drops it short on off, Uthappa camps back and times his pull over mid-wicket, an impressive blow
Shreyas Gopal to Uthappa, no run, loopy delivery outside off, Uthappa has punched it to the man at cover
Shreyas Gopal to Uthappa, no run, floater outside off, a googly in fact and Uthappa angles it away to point

Laughlin to Narine, SIX, 50-run stand up between Narine and Uthappa! Short of a length around off, Narine clears his front leg and pulls it over mid-wicket to end the powerplay with a maximum. Good recovery by KKR after the loss of Lynn in the first over of the innings
Laughlin to Narine, no run, fine yorker by Laughlin there. Narine was backing away, he cleared his front leg but the bowler follows him, spears it on leg and Narine digs it out
Laughlin to Uthappa, 1 run, drives the full length delivery down to mid-off for a single
Laughlin to Narine, 1 run, short of a length around off, Narine pulls it away to deep mid-wicket
Laughlin to Uthappa, 1 run, knocks the length delivery down to long-on and takes a single

Laughlin to Uthappa, FOUR, poor line! Can't bowl such freebies when a batsman is in good touch. This was a shortish delivery on the thigh and all Uthappa wanted to do is get it past the fielder at short fine leg, manages to do so. Drags it past the fielder and gets another boundary

Unadkat to Uthappa, 1 run, fine stop by Laughlin at mid-off, saves three runs for his team. Was a full length ball around off, Uthappa drove it to mid-off and Laughlin dived to his right and grabbed the ball with his right hand. Expensive over, nevertheless

Unadkat to Uthappa, FOUR, cheeky. That's Uthappa's experience for you. Shortish in length around off, Uthappa simply guides it down to third man and finds the fence again, can't keep a fielder so fine
Unadkat to Uthappa, FOUR, slower delivery and that's been put away to the fence again. Just outside off and on a length, Uthappa stands tall and pumps it right over the bowler's head
Unadkat to Uthappa, no run, angled away from the batsman on a length outside off, Uthappa tries to run it down to third man, but misses
Unadkat to Uthappa, FOUR, pulled away! Short of a length on middle and leg, Uthappa picks the length on it and pulls it neatly over mid-wicket, on a bounce and over the fence there
Unadkat to Uthappa, no run, on a length around off, Uthappa knocks it back to the bowler

D Kulkarni to Narine, no run, good comeback by Kulkarni after conceding three boundaries. Pitches this one full and outside off, Narine tries to squeeze it out but that ball was probably too quick for him

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, hat-trick of boundaries. Kulkarni put under pressure by Narine. Picks the length early on that short one, transfers his weight on to the back foot and pummels it through mid-wicket, the fielder there was too square to cut this off

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, this was even better than the previous one. No fielders moved, just mere spectators. Short of a length outside off, Narine throws his hands at it and times his drive through the gap there, that came right from the meat

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, finally manages to get a boundary. Was trying it since a while. This was a tad on the slower side but short enough for Narine to thrash it, goes aerial over covers and finds the boundary, his first convincing shot of the day
D Kulkarni to Narine, no run, short of a length outside off, punches that firmly off his back foot but straight to the man at cover-point

D Kulkarni to Narine, no run, sprays in a full length delivery outside off, Narine tries to reach for it with a drive, can't make any connection though. Royals are bowling well to Narine tonight, making life difficult for him to get off to a flier
Gowtham to Narine, 1 run, comes down the wicket and flicks the slider to mid-wicket
Gowtham to Narine, no run, short again around off and Narine has punched it to the same man again
Gowtham to Narine, no run, flat and quick around off and middle, Narine rocks back to punch it to extra-cover
Gowtham to Uthappa, 1 run, mistimed... but safe again. Had this been timed would have been straight to Stokes at long-on. Short in length around off and Uthappa pulls it to long-on, on a bounce
Gowtham to Uthappa, no run, short again around off, punches it into the off-side, can't find the gap though at cover
Gowtham to Uthappa, FOUR, showed glimpses of form in the previous game too. This is short around off, Uthappa camps back and punches it well past the fielder at mid-off, placement was bang on there
D Kulkarni to Uthappa, 1 run, length delivery seaming into the batsman right at the stumps on middle, Uthappa nudges it in front of mid-on and retains strike with a quick single
D Kulkarni to Narine, 1 run, on a length outside off, Narine eases it towards mid-off and gets across to the other end

D Kulkarni to Narine, FOUR, edged but safe! A short delivery around off, too close to cut and Narine goes ahead with the shot. Gets a top edge that eludes the leaping keeper and finds the fence. Lucky to be still out there, but this is how he plays
D Kulkarni to Narine, no run, short and outside off, Narine goes for a cut, mistimes it to the off-side

D Kulkarni to Narine, 2 runs, almost a mix-up there. Narine wanted the third too but Uthappa wasn't interested in it, sends him back. Coming to the delivery it was a slower delivery outside off and Narine check-drove it over covers. The throw came in at the bowler's end, had it been to the keeper's end, it might have been a run out
D Kulkarni to Narine, no run, full and outside off, Narine tries to reach for it but the ball is too wide to make contact

Gowtham to Uthappa, no run, excellent opening over by Gowtham! Concedes only a single off it, gets a wicket too. This one is short and wide outside off and all Uthappa can do is punch it to the man at point
Gowtham to Uthappa, no run, another short one, a tad quick outside off, Uthappa camps back and punches it to wide mid-off
Gowtham to Uthappa, no run, short and quick on leg, Uthappa tries to flick that away but gets struck on the pads

Gowtham to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! Duck for Chris Lynn! Couldn't have been a better start for the Royals, this. Lynn not having a great time, dropped a catch earlier and departs without troubling the scorers. It's a short delivery and with a bit of off-spin, Lynn goes back to cut and gets undone due to the lack of bounce and spin on that. No Lynn special tonight and the crowd at Jaipur erupts. Chris Lynn b Gowtham 0(2)
Gowtham to Chris Lynn, no run, short and flat around off, Lynn knocks it back to the bowler
Gowtham to Narine, 1 run, starts off with a slider on middle and leg, Narine gets an inside edge towards mid-wicket as he looks to drive

Shivam Mavi to Buttler, no run, is that wide again? No the umpire allows it. The first slower delivery that hasn't slipped wide of the tramline. Shivam Mavi beats Buttler on the slog and it is a legal delivery according to the umpire

Shivam Mavi to Buttler, out D Kulkarni Run Out!! 1 run completed. Almost a royal mess-up. But Shivam Mavi recovers to run Kulkarni out. Driven to long-off. No way the second was on, not with Kulkarni running like that. Shivam Mavi fumbled the throw but recovered to run Kulkarni out, who couldn't make it. But importantly Buttler will be on strike. D Kulkarni run out (Shubman Gill/Shivam Mavi) 3(3)
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, 2 runs, fires it full and makes Buttler reach out, to his full extension, squeezed out and again off the toe end through cover, Buttler comes back for two
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, wide, at this rate, this over will take all night long to complete. Third slower delivery and third one fired outside the tramline. DK and Shivam Mavi have a small chat
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, no run, goes short and beats Buttler's pull. Flies over the top edge and DK likes it. Claps in appreciation
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, wide, Shivam Mavi grimaces. Another wide, another slower delivery gone wrong
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, wide, the slower delivery goes wrong. Way outside off and beyond the tramline
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, 2 runs, short of length and Buttler mistimes the pull, off a thick inside half, takes on Tom Curran at deep mid and easily done in the end as the throw goes wide of DK
Shivam Mavi to D Kulkarni, 1 run, Lynn at backward point drops a simple catch. Kulkarni sliced it and Lynn drops it. What's more it brings Buttler on strike too
Tom Curran to Buttler, FOUR, slightly off-line and four. Can't err in any way to Buttler. Low full-toss and swung to the left of long-on, one bounce over the ropes
Tom Curran to Buttler, 2 runs, wide slower delivery outside off, made Buttler reach out, forehanded by Buttler wide of long-off and comes back for two
Tom Curran to D Kulkarni, 1 run, swinging low full-toss, Kulkarni drives to sweeper cover
Tom Curran to Buttler, no ball, 1 run, Buttler missed out on the no-ball call. Just over too. Right call from umpire Abhijit Deshmukh. Full on off, driven to long-off
Tom Curran to D Kulkarni, 1 run, no hat-trick. Kulkarni uses Tom Curran's pace and opens the face of the bat to run the length delivery to third man

Tom Curran to Shreyas Gopal, out Bowled!! Both Karnataka men gone in consecutive balls. To Tom Curran. He takes off his aeroplane and Mitch Johnson is seen clapping from the dugout. Pacy length delivery, on off, Shreyas Gopal was late on the defence and it knocked the stump out of the ground. Played a bit inside the line and had no footwork to deal with that sharp delivery. Tom Curran is now on a hat-trick. Shreyas Gopal b Tom Curran 0(1)

Tom Curran to Gowtham, out Caught by Shivam Mavi!! Easy for backward point. Back of the hand slower delivery, Tom Curran bowls that well. He is so confident with that delivery that he regularly and surprisingly bowled it in the Ashes Test. To not great effect it must be said. But here he gets Gowtham slicing it off a thick outside edge and grabs a wicket. Gowtham c Shivam Mavi b Tom Curran 12(7) [6s-1]
Narine to Buttler, FOUR, brutal. Fraction short and that's enough for Buttler, who marmalises the back foot forcing shot. Long-off wasn't even in the picture. A rare off night for Narine

Narine to Gowtham, 3 runs, poor effort by Chawla at short fine leg. He didn't account for the spin away and lets it go. One becomes three. A thick inside edge on the heave, Chawla charged forward and the spin beat him
Narine to Gowtham, no run, slogs blindly and misses this offie, was looking at mid-wicket

Narine to Gowtham, SIX, can Gill get there? He can but can only parry it over the ropes. Good effort from him running to his left at long-off. Not easy at all as Gowtham lofted it superbly after using his feet. Had enough to get it over the left-hand of the diving fielder
Narine to Buttler, 1 run, mistimes the big cut, but manages a single wide of cover
Narine to Buttler, no run, fired the offie into the pads, Buttler misses out on the flick. Sliding down
Chawla to Buttler, 1 run, flat and sliding on, Buttler punches to sweeper cover for a single. End of Chawla for the night - he has been outstanding

Chawla to Gowtham, 1 run, this comes off a thick inside edge as he looked to slog, was there in the slot, but Gowtham didn't connect as he would've liked to. Gets Buttler back on strike with a single to deep mid
Chawla to Gowtham, 2 runs, gets forward and times the drive well, placed wide of long-off for two
Chawla to Gowtham, no run, the toppie, which slides straight on outside off, Gowtham cuts straight to the fielder at point
Chawla to Buttler, 1 run, another googly, punched wide of cover for a single

Chawla to Stokes, out Caught by Nitish Rana!! Chawla has bowled very well tonight and gets the dangerous Stokes out. To the left-hander he has been bowling mainly googlies and this one is the same as well. Stokes was charging Chawla and it kept on going away from him. Sliced it high up in the air and Rana backtracking from cover takes a good catch. Not easy to judge that in the lights. Stokes c Nitish Rana b Chawla 14(11) [6s-1]
Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, 1 run, Stokes calmly drives it to long-off to keep strike. Despite that six, a pretty good over by Kuldeep Yadav
Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, SIX, as soon as he saw the tossed up delivery, a chinaman, Stokes goes downtown. Kneels down and then slogs it miles back into the long-on stands. That's what Stokes can do
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, kept a bit low, but Buttler was already in position to pull and gets it to deep mid
Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, 1 run, now Stokes rocks back to punch to long-off for another single
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, rocks back to punch this flattish delivery wide of long-off, wants two but it isn't there this time
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, no run, pre-meditated reverse sweep, connected well but finds point. A dot
Narine to Stokes, 2 runs, forced off the back foot, wide of long-on, who is straight for some reason, easy two in the end
Narine to Buttler, 1 run, too full on the stumps, Buttler gets forward and drives to long-off
Narine to Buttler, 2 runs, a soft tap to a regulation off-break, wide of deep mid and perfectly placed for a well-run two
Narine to Stokes, 1 run, just a forward block, wide of short mid and the strike turns over
Narine to Stokes, no run, well bowled. May have seen Stokes stepping down, so shortened the length and darted it in, in the end, Stokes defends it back down the track
Narine to Stokes, no run, tucks it straight to the fielder at mid-wicket. Was on the middle and leg line, Stokes couldn't find the gap

Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, out Caught by A Russell!! Good catch by Russell at short cover. Leapt at the right time to catch. Tripathi went inside out but couldn't keep the in-to-out shot down, bit more elevation and he would've got a couple at least. Tripathi c A Russell b Kuldeep Yadav 15(11) [4s-2]
Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, no run, slower and it hangs in the air for a bit, Tripathi defends off the front foot

Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, FOUR, this is a proper pull. Dragged down by Kuldeep Yadav and Tripathi was onto the back foot in a flash, pulled it between wide long-on and deep mid. Found the gap to perfection. Hit hard as well
Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, 1 run, good bowling. Followed the backing away Stokes, who punches it to long-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Tripathi, 1 run, Tripathi was setting himself for a big pull, but the ball suddenly held up and kept low, eventually Tripathi adjusts and bunts it wide of deep mid
Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, 1 run, tossed up on middle, Stokes drives to long-off
Nitish Rana to Stokes, 1 run, another drifter, rushes into Stokes, who flicks to deep mid and gets off the mark with that run

Nitish Rana to D Arcy Short, out Bowled!! D Arcy Short's painful innings comes to an end. A fist pump from Nitish Rana. Bowled the slider and it rushed past the cross-batted hoick of D Arcy Short. Clipped off and credit to DK for getting Nitish Rana back on. The bowler has justified that move with another wicket. D Arcy Short b Nitish Rana 44(43) [4s-5 6s-1]
Nitish Rana to D Arcy Short, no run, well bowled. Slowed it down and got it to slide back in to the backing away D Arcy Short, mistimed back to the bowler
Nitish Rana to Tripathi, 1 run, pushed through on middle and leg, heaved to deep mid-wicket. Lots of bottom hand on that shot
Nitish Rana to D Arcy Short, 1 run, flat and skidding on, outside off, punched square of the wicket, for a single
Nitish Rana to Tripathi, 1 run, pushed to long-off, wanted two, but they settle for just a single

Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, 2 runs, bit more oomph from Shivam Mavi on this one, as he banged it in, on a shortish length, D Arcy Short forces it off the back foot wide of mid-off, but there's a dive and it's only two this time

Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, FOUR, he can do finesse too. Not only raw power. Used the pace of Shivam Mavi to full effect. Watched the back of a length delivery onto his bat and steered it to the right of the diving backward point, beats him and gives third man no chance

Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, SIX, what a blow that is. This is what D Arcy Short can do. Backs away and Shivam Mavi follows him with a back of a length delivery, but D Arcy Short clobbers the pull miles into the deep square stands. At one point looked like clearing the crowd and going out of the stadium

Shivam Mavi to Tripathi, 1 run, that's right off the top draw but straight to the fielder at sweeper cover. Tripathi gorging on a fullish delivery outside off, timed it so well as he threw the hands through the line of the ball
Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, 1 run, off-pace delivery, D Arcy Short waits for it and then tucks it to deep backward square, just a single
Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, no run, short of length and sliding across D Arcy Short, he flat-bats it straight back to the bowler. Playing too many dots is D Arcy Short
Narine to Tripathi, FOUR, this is so unlike Narine. He hasn't looked himself tonight. Another drag-down, Tripathi controls the pull and beats Mavi to his left at deep mid. 10 off that over
Narine to D Arcy Short, 1 run, on the middle and leg line, tucked away to deep mid
Narine to D Arcy Short, no run, another dot. Slower again, defended to cover off the front foot
Narine to D Arcy Short, no run, Narine comes back well, slower and it is pushed back to Narine

Narine to D Arcy Short, FOUR, this is another short-arm jab, one bounce over the ropes at deep square. Way too short by Narine, on middle and leg, D Arcy Short picked him off easily, bisected the two men either side on the leg-side
Narine to Tripathi, 1 run, tossed up outside off, driven to long-off

Tom Curran to D Arcy Short, FOUR, well-timed and four. Sliding down and D Arcy Short didn't miss out. Short fine was inside the ring and deep square back, he beat the latter with a beautiful flick off the hips. That should hopefully get him going
Tom Curran to D Arcy Short, 2 runs, thick inside edge to the left of deep mid. Was a length ball on off, D Arcy Short swung hard and gets two even as Kuldeep runs around to prevent the boundary
Tom Curran to Tripathi, 1 run, short of length on the body, Tripathi runs it down to third man. Good work by Mavi, who is sharp in the field too

Tom Curran to D Arcy Short, 1 run, D Arcy Short is putting pressure on Tripathi as well now. Tripathi wanted two but D Arcy Short was busy looking at the ball and the fielder at deep mid. In the end Tripathi had to dive back to get in. Just a single for all that fuss
Tom Curran to D Arcy Short, no run, good length on the stumps, D Arcy Short defends to mid-wicket, he is struggling here
Tom Curran to Tripathi, 1 run, goes full on the stumps, Tripathi almost fell over, but managed to flick it to long-on
Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, no run, another good ball. Right up there, full on off, D Arcy Short hits the drive onto the boot and the ball ricochets back to the bowler

Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, no run, direct hit from Russell and D Arcy Short may well have been walking back. Bit lazy there the batsman. Flicks to the right of short mid, wants a single, but Tripathi isn't moving. The throw comes at his end and misses, was plonking his bat there, trying to get in at the last instant

Shivam Mavi to Samson, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! Gone now. As soon as he hit that, Samson knew he had made a mistake. Good short of length delivery on the hips, rising, Samson cannot keep the short-arm jab pull down and picks out deep square to perfection. Kuldeep didn't move a muscle there. Samson c Kuldeep Yadav b Shivam Mavi 7(8) [4s-1]

Shivam Mavi to Samson, FOUR, he attempted that off the first ball and missed. Not now. Uses the pace of Shivam Mavi to great effect. Steers late and with an open face, right off the middle of the bat and Uthappa running around from third man can only watch it run away
Shivam Mavi to Samson, no run, hits the pitch hard on a back of a length outside off, pushed back to Shivam Mavi who dives to his right and stops the ball
Shivam Mavi to Samson, no run, loose from Samson. Fuller than a good length outside off, pacy too, Samson tries to run it down and misses. So easily could've edged that
Kuldeep Yadav to D Arcy Short, no run, tossed up outside off, D Arcy Short gets forward to block
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, 1 run, strokes it past the right-hand of Kuldeep Yadav

Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, no run, loud shout by Kuldeep Yadav, but that has pitched an inch or two outside leg for it to be nullified then and there. Spins past the outside edge and raps Samson on the back leg. Replays show that it pitched outside leg. Good call from the umpire
Kuldeep Yadav to D Arcy Short, 1 run, the wrong'un now, too short, punched to long-on off the back foot
Kuldeep Yadav to D Arcy Short, no run, slides straight on, quicker too outside off, D Arcy Short mistimes the cut to the off-side
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, 1 run, tossed up on middle, Samson nudges it through square leg

Nitish Rana to Samson, 1 run, may have been the attempted carrom ball. Certainly flicked it from the front of the hand, slides straight on though and Samson punches past the diving bowler to get himself off the mark

Nitish Rana to Rahane, out Stumped!! Brilliant from DK but felt that Rahane gave up all too easily. Could've put pressure on DK by attempting to dive, none of that and he goes. Was down the track looking to flick, richocheted off the pad and went in front of DK who calmly collects the ball and then backflicks to hit direct. One glove was off quickly and that made it easier for DK. Can't understand why it has been changed to stumped. According to the laws of the game, when a batsman is attempting a run - Rahane surely was - it should be declared run-out. Weird! Rahane st Karthik b Rana 36(19) [4s-5 6s-1]
Nitish Rana to D Arcy Short, 1 run, punches it off the back foot to long-on

Nitish Rana to D Arcy Short, no run, has that lobbed straight off the boot and then to DK? They are asking for it. Umpire Abhijit Deshmukh goes upstairs. The soft signal is not out. Not out! Onto the front leg as D Arcy Short tried to drive, then into the ground before DK caught that. Waste of time!
Nitish Rana to D Arcy Short, FOUR, sliding down, just needed bat on that and D Arcy Short gets the glance going. Fine leg is too square and he had no chance
Nitish Rana to Rahane, 1 run, tossed up around off, Rahane gets forward to drive to long-on
Chawla to Rahane, 1 run, bowled from the front of the hand, Rahane dabs to short third and takes the single
Chawla to D Arcy Short, 1 run, tossed up and D Arcy Short drills the drive straight down the ground, but there's long-off who gets around to cut it off
Chawla to D Arcy Short, no run, punches off the back foot and finds the diving extra cover. Was again sliding across D Arcy Short
Chawla to Rahane, 1 run, knocks this to long-on for a single

Chawla to Rahane, FOUR, magnificent cover drive. When Rahane is on song, there are few better timers of the ball in India. This is overpitched and he leans forward to caress the drive wide of cover and extra cover. Threaded the needle there
Chawla to D Arcy Short, 1 run, too full on the stumps, D Arcy Short gets forward and flicks to the left of long-on for a single

Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, 1 run, skiddy back of a length delivery on the stumps, D Arcy Short looks for a flamingo pull, gets an inside edge onto the thigh, Rahane is quick to call him through for a single and easily done in the end
Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, FOUR, first one he has timed tonight. Picks the slower delivery from a length and swings cleanly over mid-off's head

Shivam Mavi to Rahane, 1 run, Shivam Mavi bends his back a bit more to extract bounce from a back of a length, surprises Rahane a tad, but the RR captain adjusts and dabs it wide of backward point for a single

Shivam Mavi to Rahane, SIX, smashed. That's some way to treat a bloke who's bowling at over 140 clicks. Down the track and flat-batted the short of length delivery straight back over the bowler's head. Had enough on it to go all the way
Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, 1 run, back of a length on the hips, another short-arm jab, pulled to deep square
Shivam Mavi to D Arcy Short, no run, short of length around off, skids on, short-arm jabbed cross-batted by D Arcy Short, but straight to the fielder at mid-on
Narine to D Arcy Short, 1 run, punched off the back foot to retain strike. 18 came off that over
Narine to Rahane, 1 run, calmly gets forward and knocks this to long-on

Narine to Rahane, FOUR, four more. This is brilliant batting. Without any risk too. That's 16 runs off the over. The last two balls have been short, even though this bounced from a back of a length, Rahane was back and across, cuts again and does so well, to find the gap between point and cover-point. An injection of momentum, so badly needed by RR
Narine to Rahane, FOUR, three in a row. Too short outside off, Rahane has played around with Narine's mind. Takes full toll of this, by cutting this wide of point and cover-point
Narine to Rahane, FOUR, lovely batting. Down the track and to the pitch before slamming it in the air, but wide of the diving Russell at mid-off. Consecutive boundaries
Narine to Rahane, FOUR, first ball from Narine and Rahane takes the seam-up delivery and sweeps it through backward square leg, hit well and found the gap too

Chawla to D Arcy Short, no run, beaten again. Chawla has mixed them up really well here, another flat googly, which turns from middle to off, beats D Arcy Short on the back foot who was looking to cut
Chawla to D Arcy Short, no run, now tucks this delivery sliding down straight to the fielder at square leg
Chawla to D Arcy Short, no run, flat googly, D Arcy Short is all at sea, misses the cut as the ball slid across him
Chawla to Rahane, 1 run, sort of drags it as he uses his feet, aimed to go over long-on, got too close to the pitch
Chawla to Rahane, no run, Rahane plays a poor shot and doesn't connect with the pre-meditated reverse sweep, was tossed up outside off, the shot was on but he failed to connect
Chawla to D Arcy Short, 1 run, slides straight on, defended into the open space at mid-wicket for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to D Arcy Short, leg byes, 1 run, sliding down, catches the pad and they take the run. Good opening over from Kuldeep Yadav
Kuldeep Yadav to D Arcy Short, no run, flat outside off, cut off the back foot, but finds extra cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, 1 run, comes down the track and drives to the right of mid-off. Quick single taken

Kuldeep Yadav to D Arcy Short, 1 run, almost sneaked through. D Arcy Short hasn't picked this one too, spins in a bit, Short just pushed out in hope and the inside edge sneaked past the stumps. Kuldeep Yadav and the others went up for a stifled appeal, but that died down quickly too
Kuldeep Yadav to D Arcy Short, no run, almost dragged it back on, very full on the stumps, D Arcy Short went for a big heave, the inside edge thudded into the pads and rolled away
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, 1 run, tossed up outside off, swept to deep mid. Was a bit too full
Chawla to Rahane, 1 run, may have been another googly, tucked off the back foot to deep mid

Chawla to Rahane, no run, ooh! Rahane shimmied outside leg even before Chawla was about to deliver, a nice googly that stayed low as well, in the end Rahane is lucky as he cuts and misses. The ball not missing off and the under edge by much
Chawla to D Arcy Short, 1 run, now back and across before punching this flat delivery to long-off
Chawla to D Arcy Short, no run, slides across D Arcy Short and he is beaten on the back foot punch, the feet didn't move and the ball wasn't far from the edge
Chawla to D Arcy Short, no run, very full on off, dug out to extra cover
Chawla to Rahane, 1 run, starts with a high full-toss, on the stumps, Rahane gets forward and drives to long-on to get off the mark
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, 1 run, uses his feet and pats that to deep extra cover. And that's that. KXIP beat SRH at Mohali for the first time ever

Ashwin to Shakib, 1 run, dropped by Mujeeb at deep mid-wicket. Ashwin actually did well by spinning it into Shakib but Shakib's in that mood. Carved across the line, only to be let off. That's the long side of the boundary and that should have been taken
Ashwin to Shakib, SIX, another one pretty much there. A bit slower you'd think, and Shakib goes straighter here
Ashwin to Shakib, SIX, switches to the off break and Shakib launches him over deep mid-wicket. Just the length you can swing across
Ashwin to Shakib, wide, hey Ashwin, what's that? Tried the Jadhav slingy round-arm delivery but this is way, way down the leg-side
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, 1 run, carrom ball. Manish Pandey steps out and is hurried into makeshift clip to wide long-on
Ashwin to Shakib, 1 run, slowish length ball from round the wicket, Shakib smacks that to the fielder at long-on

Mohit Sharma to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, another slower delivery and now Mohit Sharma is hurling them intelligently wide of off-stump, making Manish Pandey reach for it. Another half-shimmy down the track to work that down to long-off. 4-0-51-2 for Mohit tonight then

Mohit Sharma to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, using his feet.. only to be hoaxed by another slower ball. Has to reach out further, is overbalanced, and just about manages to get some bat through wide mid-off
Mohit Sharma to Shakib, 1 run, swivels this shortish delivery with a pull round the corner

Mohit Sharma to Shakib, wide, why's that a wide? Shakib is long way down the leg-side, and Mohit Sharma has just bowled the slower-ball bouncer over him. Not sure what the umpire was thinking there. Well. it's been difficult to tell anyway this tournament..
Mohit Sharma to Manish Pandey, 1 run, takes the pace off this time and befuddles Manish Pandey, who's using his feet. Slaps at that and under-edges it behind the wicket

Mohit Sharma to Manish Pandey, SIX, a 37-ball fifty for Pandey. 40 from 10 needed now, which means literally every ball has to be a boundary. A bottom-handed loft from Manish Pandey that, getting under that full ball and launching it over long-on
Mohit Sharma to Shakib, 1 run, off-paced back of a length delivery, Shakib swivels it to deep square leg
Barinder to Shakib, 1 run, finishes with 0/22. And caps the night superbly. Slower delivery this, and Shakib didn't read it. Punched at it early and top-spun that to long-on
Barinder to Manish Pandey, 1 run, jumps to a round the wicket angle now. Gets it nice and full at 137ks, Manish Pandey makes room for a squeeze-out to wide long-off

Barinder to Manish Pandey, wide, now misdirects it again. Wanted to bowl the yorker that pitches just inside the tramline outside off. Just overdoes it from this over the wicket angle to the right-hander
Barinder to Shakib, 1 run, another yorker. Barinder's bowling well here. Shakib makes some room but has to urgently jam it out to long-off
Barinder to Shakib, 2 runs, reversing it here, is Sran. On a length with a little bit of curl into Shakib, who punches it down to long-on
Barinder to Shakib, no run, and the free-hit is a dot ball. Goes back to the good 'od yorker that swings in and rams into Shakib's right foot. Ouchie..
Barinder to Shakib, wide, free-hit will continue because this is a wide. Tries the slower delivery but it's outside the off-side tramline
Barinder to Shakib, no ball, FOUR, that's above the waist, and hence a no-ball. Shakib nicely arches away before realizing that he can get some bat on this. Glides it uppishly through third man
Barinder to Manish Pandey, 1 run, starts with a full and dipping slower delivery from over the wicket, Manish Pandey works it to long-on
Andrew Tye to Shakib, no run, slower delivery angled across, Shakib gives himself some room and swishes thin air
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 1 run, comes down the track and punches it on the up through cover

Andrew Tye to Deepak Hooda, out Caught by (sub)Manoj Tiwary!! That's been hit high but SRH here are unravelling, surrendering to Mohali's big dimensions. Knuckle ball, another one yeah, and Deepak Hooda finds long-on with this big loft. Manoj Tiwary there, who takes it and then kicks the ball away in celebration... Deepak Hooda c (sub)Manoj Tiwary b Andrew Tye 5(5)
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 1 run, steps down the track and chips it to long-on

Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, slower delivery flung wide outside off on seeing Manish Pandey advance and make room. Manish Pandey doesn't get hold of the cut at all. Off the cue end through the off-side
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, no run, yorker delivery, dug out back to Andrew Tye
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, too full, worked round the corner with a forward press
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, wide, googly spinning down leg
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, skidding on, worked through vacant mid-wicket
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, FOUR, deftly played. Googly but it's wide, and Manish Pandey waits and glides it just wide of the keeper
Mujeeb to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, carrom ball? Spins away and elicits a leading edge to backward point
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, walks down the track and checks the punch to cover
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, slow and skidding on with the arm, Manish Pandey works a single through mid-wicket
Andrew Tye to Deepak Hooda, no run, Hooda's failing miserably at calibrating Andrew Tye's pace, or the lack of it. Swishes out a pull but where's the ball? It's on its way. Misses it totally
Andrew Tye to Deepak Hooda, 2 runs, chipped away through vacant staright mid-on. Cute little couple here
Andrew Tye to Deepak Hooda, 2 runs, stays in the crease, not taking a leaf out of Manish Pandey's book, and opens the face of the bat through cover. Just a bit of width on that
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 1 run, Tye'ng him down with pace. Slower delivery on a back of a length, Manish Pandey uses his feet and ends up dragging it down to long-on

Andrew Tye to Williamson, out Caught by Finch!! Williamson will now know that this is a big, big ground. Steps out to a slower delivery -- knuckle ball, actually -- but can you blame him? Mistimes this attempted loft and there's long-off waiting, secretly thanking the big dimensions that this ground entails. Williamson c Finch b Andrew Tye 54(41) [4s-3 6s-2]
Andrew Tye to Williamson, FOUR, 129ks on a back of a length, and veering down, there's only one way the ball's going. To the boundary. Pulled behind square
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, no run, slapped off-side but straight to the fielder inside the ring. No single. 85 needed off the last 6 overs
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, wide, he's trying something there but splays this wide down leg. Umm...
Ashwin to Williamson, 1 run, back to off breaks, is Ashwin. Williamson slaps it to sweeper cover to hoist a fifty
Ashwin to Williamson, SIX, some turn on this leg break but Williamson stays put and swipes this over deep mid-wicket. Just a little short, which allowed Williamson to go against the spin there

Ashwin to Manish Pandey, 1 run, Manoj Tiwary does well to stop a boundary there. Manish Pandey uses his feet and hits this uppishly to long-on, where Tiwary knew that he won't get to the pitch even with a dive, so throws himself behind the ball and saves a few runs
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, wide, that quicker delivery went wrong. Flung way outside off
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, steps out and works this round the corner. Looks like the quick slider from Ashwin there
Ashwin to Williamson, 1 run, works a single to long-on
Mohit Sharma to Manish Pandey, FOUR, room offered outside off and Manish Pandey's sliced it without fuss to the third man boundary. That will do

Mohit Sharma to Williamson, 1 run, another off-pace delivery that has this flat-batted hit miscued to long-on. And Mayank Agarwal's not happy with KL Rahul here. Took his time to pick the end, threw it to 'keeper Rahul, who's way behind the stumps. Could have been close had he been more alert in collecting the ball. Anyway
Mohit Sharma to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slower delivery at 113ks from Mohit Sharma. Manish Pandey was shaping for the big hit, is made to wait front-footed and check his flat-batted hit to deep cover
Mohit Sharma to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, thick inside edge there. Pretty sure he didn't intend that to go so square. Still, will make do with this wristwork (and the two runs) into the leg-side

Mohit Sharma to Manish Pandey, FOUR, 50-run stand up. Goes for the yorker but he's bowled a nice little full toss here -- something that Manish Pandey uses to hit his first boundary. Scythed round the corner, that full toss
Mohit Sharma to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, flung full outside off, Manish Pandey drives that with uber timing to sweeper cover. SRH need big hits..
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slow and skiddin in with the arm, Manish Pandey softs the clip into the leg-side. Easy single
Mujeeb to Williamson, 1 run, quick slider, Williamson runs down the track and pushes a single to cover
Mujeeb to Williamson, no run, googly, slapped to cover

Mujeeb to Williamson, 2 runs, deep mid-wicket was in with a chance, had he hit the stumps.. So Williamson and his single survive. Mujeeb saw him making room, skid it on a shorter length and saw Williamson work it into the leg-side
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, wrong 'un spinning in, Manish Pandey checks the drive to cover
Mujeeb to Williamson, 1 run, skids on the wristy delivery and raps Williamson, who was trying to sweep this, on the pad
Andrew Tye to Williamson, 1 run, makes room for the inside-out shot but the ball's been pitched a little too full, so he makeshifts a thrusty push to long-off instead. Just the 4 runs from this over
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slower delivery stopping in the pitch, jabbed to cover
Andrew Tye to Williamson, leg byes, 1 run, shapes across his stumps fro the scoop but doesn't get it off the bat
Andrew Tye to Williamson, no run, slashed to the left of the bowler. Nothing in that bat throw from Williamson

Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 1 run, long-on's overrun this and dropped it. Charges down the track, there's Miller in the deep who's attacking the ball and lets it through. He's diving in front, almost has it covered but lets it slip through
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, no run, stays leg-side of the ball and packs a punch to cover
Mujeeb to Williamson, no run, goes on the back foot and drives the off-spinner to the off-side
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, pushes it to cover and takes a single
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, no run, blocks it to the off-side, he is on the back foot as he isn't reading him
Mujeeb to Williamson, 1 run, pushes it to long-on for a single
Mujeeb to Williamson, 2 runs, hangs back and nudges it to deep mid-wicket for a brace

Mujeeb to Williamson, no run, Punjab have gone for a review. Williamson is a long way down the ground. Ultra edge shows no edge and DRS shows ball is just hitting the leg stump. Punjab retains the review again. Williamson comes down the track on the ball and misses the bat totally, ball hits his pads
Ashwin to Williamson, 1 run, ball moved away after pitching, Williamson fails to read it off the hands but he was on the back-foot which allows him to adjust. He pushes it long-off for a single
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, 1 run, straight delivery at the stumps, Manish Pandey mistimes the lofted shot to the leg-side for a single
Ashwin to Williamson, 1 run, makes good use of the crease and cuts it to to the off-side for a single
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, 1 run, pushes it to long-on for a single
Ashwin to Williamson, 1 run, goes on the back foot and punches it to deep cover for a single

Ashwin to Williamson, SIX, Williamson sends it into the crowd. It was an off-spinner from Ashwin, Williamson comes down the track, reaches the pitch of the ball and lofts it over the long-off for a maximum. Clean connection!
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, no run, peach of a delivery from Mujeeb! Manish Pandey is not picking him off the hand at all and plays inside the line of the ball, goes past his outside edge
Mujeeb to Williamson, 1 run, hangs in the crease and pushes it wide of the bowler who chases it but fails to curtail a single
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, that delivery came in, Manish Pandey gets his bat down in time and nudges it to square leg for a single
Mujeeb to Williamson, 1 run, again comes down the track and clips it to the leg-side for a single
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, that ball kept a tad low, Manish Pandey adjusts and nudges it to long-off for a single
Mujeeb to Williamson, 1 run, dances down the track and pushes it to long-on for a single
Ashwin to Williamson, 1 run, goes on the back foot and cuts it to the off-side for a single

Ashwin to Williamson, FOUR, gorgeous shot! Pure class from Williamson. It was a leg-spinner from Ashwin, Williamson comes down the track and lofts it with the turn over cover for a four. One of the toughest shots to play but he reached the pitch of the ball and made it easier for himself
Ashwin to Williamson, 2 runs, makes good use of the crease and punches it to deep cover for a brace
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, 2 wides, erring in line down the leg-side, keeper fails to collect it cleanly and batsmen take a single
Ashwin to Williamson, 1 run, clips to the leg-side for a single
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, 1 run, leg-spinner at the stumps, Manish Pandey drives it to long-off for a single
Ashwin to Williamson, 1 run, at the stumps and Williamson drives it to long-on for a single

Barinder to Manish Pandey, no run, change in the action at the last moment as he delivered the ball. Manish Pandey misses the ball again and ball goes back to the keeper who also fails to collect it cleanly. This has been a gem of a spell from Barinder
Barinder to Manish Pandey, no run, yorker outside off, Manish Pandey drives it back to the bowler
Barinder to Williamson, 1 run, Williamson comes down the track, Barinder sees that and bowls a slower ball on the pads. Williamson waits for the ball and nudges it to short fine leg
Barinder to Manish Pandey, 1 run, hangs back in his crease and steers it to the third man for a single
Barinder to Williamson, 1 run, drifting on the pads and Williamson clips it to square leg for a single
Barinder to Williamson, no run, good length outside off, Williamson drives it to cover

Mohit Sharma to Y Pathan, out Bowled!! Chops it back onto the stumps. This is a back of the hand slower ball from Mohit Sharma and Pathan was completely foxed by it. He wanted to drive it through the off-side but gets a thick inside edge and ball comes back in the direction of the stumps. Clever variation in pace from Mohit Sharma, he is having a good night thus far.  Y Pathan b Mohit Sharma 19(13) [4s-3]
Mohit Sharma to Y Pathan, 2 runs, wanted to hit this short of length ball through deep square but mistimes it badly and drags it wide of the mid-on fielder for a brace
Mohit Sharma to Y Pathan, no run, brilliant slower ball outside off, Pathan fails to pick it up and couldn't even attempt a shot. He was forced to let it go to the keeper
Mohit Sharma to Williamson, leg byes, 1 run, Williamson misses the clip, ball hits him on the pads and deflects wide of the keeper for a single
Mohit Sharma to Y Pathan, 1 run, pulls it to deep mid-wicket for a single
Mohit Sharma to Y Pathan, FOUR, no one moved on that ball. It was a good length delivery outside off, Pathan swats it wide of the mid-off fielder for a four. Power and placement from Pathan
Andrew Tye to Williamson, no run, good length delivery around off, Williamson stays in the crease and defends it to the off-side
Andrew Tye to Y Pathan, 1 run, drives it to the right of mid-off for a single
Andrew Tye to Y Pathan, FOUR, slower delivery at the stumps, it was fuller in length and Pathan picks up the slower ball early. He gets in a good position and hits it over mid-wicket for a four
Andrew Tye to Williamson, 1 run, good length delivery outside off, Williamson opens the face of the bat and guides it to the third man for a single
Andrew Tye to Y Pathan, 1 run, slower delivery at the stumps, Pathan nudges it to the leg-side and takes a single
Andrew Tye to Y Pathan, no run, checks his drive and ball falls short of Andrew Tye, Pathan is not timing it at all
Barinder to Williamson, no run, driven to cover where Yuvi stops it this time

Barinder to Y Pathan, 1 run, what are you doing Yuvi! He drops a sitter. This is as easy as they come. Pathan mistimes the cut shot and he hits it straight to cover point where Yuvi makes a mess of it. Reacted very late as he went reverse-cup style and it popped out
Barinder to Williamson, 1 run, good length delivery on the pads, clipped to deep mid-wicket gently by Williamson
Barinder to Y Pathan, 1 run, slower ball on the pads, Pathan nudges it to the leg-side and takes a single
Barinder to Y Pathan, no run, plants his front foot forward and plays a compact defensive shot to the off-side
Barinder to Williamson, 1 run, short of length ball, Williamson pulls it to deep mid-wicket for a single

Mohit Sharma to Y Pathan, FOUR, Ashwin mistimes the jump and ball goes over him at mid-off for a four. It was fuller length ball at the stumps, Pathan lofts it over mid-off, just gets enough blade on the ball to clear mid-off

Mohit Sharma to Saha, out Bowled!! Saha wasn't timing it at all and this was always on the cards. It was a good length delivery at the stumps, Saha wanted to play it across the line, his willow misses it totally and ball disturbs the furniture. Punjab are off to a dream start here. The ball just brushes the off stick. Saha b Mohit Sharma 6(7) [4s-1]
Mohit Sharma to Saha, FOUR, picks up the slower ball early but doesn't time it as well as he would have liked, but he gets enough bat onto it to get a four to fine leg
Mohit Sharma to Williamson, 3 runs, on the stumps and Williamson uses his wrists and flicks it to deep mid-wicket and takes three runs

Mohit Sharma to Williamson, FOUR, we have seen brute power from gayle earlier but this is total touch play from Williamson. It was a good length delivery outside off, Williamson gets in a good position and drives it on the up, ball beats the mid-off fielder for a four
Mohit Sharma to Saha, 1 run, fuller length ball aiming at the stumps, Saha turns it to square leg using his wrists and goes to the non striker's end

Barinder to Williamson, no run, 2 slips for Williamson, attacking captaincy from Ashwin. It was again a short of length ball and came into Williamson who manages to tuck it to square leg. Fiery first over from Barinder comes to an end

Barinder to Dhawan, no run, Dhawan is hit on the elbow! Ouch! That would have hurt. It was a short of length ball that came sharply and hits him. It will take a while for Dhawan to get smile back on his face. He's taken the helmet off and is in serious pain. Physio is out in the middle, I hope Dhawan will be fine soon. Barinder is generating some serious pace. Dhawan is going off the field  after being struck near the left elbow. SRH camp will be a worried unit.
Barinder to Saha, 1 run, short of length delivery, Saha mistimes it and hits it to the leg-side for a single. Saha has mistimed almost every ball of this over, its high team he strikes one cleanly
Barinder to Saha, no run, this ball held in the surface a bit and Saha almost gifts a catch to cover, ball falls just short of him

Barinder to Saha, no run, Punjab have gone for a review. My naked eyes tell me this is high and it might be going down the leg side. Saha is jumping in the crease when ball strikes him on the back pad. It is clipping the stumps -- the top of middle and leg -- but just clipping so it is umpire's call and Punjab retain their review. Good inward shape from Barinder on that back of a length ball
Barinder to Saha, no run, a tuck sound off Saha's bat but he hits it straight to point
Barinder to Saha, wide, wayward delivery down the leg-side, umpire signals it wide

Rashid Khan to Gayle, 1 run, tad quicker and spun back in, Gayle went for a cross-batted heave, gets an inside edge onto his pad. Rolls into the off-side. Saha gets across, grabs the ball and fires a needless throw at the non-striker's end. Rashid fails to collect it and no backing up meant that they will nab the single. 1/55 is the most runs conceded by Rashid in a T20, going past 52 vs Zimbabwe in 2015
Rashid Khan to Finch, 1 run, whacked away to deep mid-wicket and they will settle for a single
Rashid Khan to Finch, SIX, Rashid has been taken to the dry cleaners today. Proper pasting. Went too full this time does Rashid, Finch was waiting for it. Muscles it straight down the ground
Rashid Khan to Finch, FOUR, Finch gets into the act. Backs away, makes room and Rashid helped him by slanting it on the stumps. Golf-swung over cow corner
Rashid Khan to Gayle, 1 run, quicker on off, blasted to long-on

Rashid Khan to Gayle, no run, big appeal for a LBW by Rashid, but umpire Nigel Llong shakes his head. Looked close. Flighted from round the wicket and it turned in a bit, Gayle set himself for a slog and missed. Hit low on the pad, guess the angle was slightly taking it down leg
S Kaul to Gayle, 1 run, full toss, clipped to deep mid-wicket
S Kaul to Finch, 1 run, gets the yorker right, squeezed down to long-on

S Kaul to Gayle, 1 run, oh this was nearly a run out! A highish full toss miscued to extra cover, who with a direct hit could have gotten Gayle. Throw is right on cue to Kaul but he's not in a position to under-arm the ball onto the stumps. Chance missed, Gayle makes it back in...
S Kaul to Finch, 1 run, flat-batted to long-on

S Kaul to Gayle, 1 run, put your hands together for the universe boss! Christopher Henry Gayle brings up his 6th IPL hundred. Off comes the helmet, raises his bat to soak in the applause from the Mohali crowd and unleashes the 'Baby in the arms' celebration. Reached the landmark with a squeezy drive to point
S Kaul to Finch, 1 run, driven neatly to long-off and the crowd cheer because Finch finally gets off the mark
Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, SIX, Gayle moves to 99. Spoils a good over by Bhuvneshwar. Pitched up just outside off, Gayle spots it early and smokes it disdainfully over long-off. High and handsome

Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, no run, veering down leg, Gayle helps it with a swivel-pull it short fine leg. Bhuvneshwar is lucky to get away with this because either side of the fielder, it would'be zoomed away to the fence

Bhuvneshwar to Nair, out Caught by Dhawan!! Nair targets the longest boundary and holes out. Bhuvneshwar gets his man, finally. Length delivery just outside off, Nair moved across and whiplashed it. Needed to generate more power to clear the ropes. Fails and hits it straight to Dhawan at deep mid-wicket, who grabs it and does the thigh-five celebration. Nair c Dhawan b Bhuvneshwar 31(21) [4s-3 6s-1]
Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, 1 run, wide yorker outside off, Gayle throws his bat horizontally and slices it to cover
Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, wide, Bhuvneshwar's knuckle ball goes awry. Plants it well outside off and it's called a wide
Bhuvneshwar to Nair, 1 run, Nair takes the aerial route but doesn't find the sweet spot. Chips it over extra cover, messed up the timing there as bat handle got twisted in his hand

Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, 1 run, SRH have been ragged on the field today. Here's more evidence. Full outside off, Gayle push-drove it to extra cover, skipper Williamson collects the ball and lasers an unnecessary throw at the non-striker's end. Bhuvi doesn't back up and they sneak in a single eventually. Nair took a couple of yards for the single before he was sent back by Gayle

Jordan to Nair, no run, couple of dots to finish the over. Some respite for Jordan. Tailed back in on a fuller length, just outside off. Nair was shuffling across and plays it down the wrong line. Fails to connect
Jordan to Nair, no run, nice comeback from Jordan. Rifles in the wide yorker and makes Nair reach for it. He throws his bat but misses it by a long way

Jordan to Nair, FOUR, mid-off inside the ring and Jordan bowls it right in the arc for Nair. He just gets under it and tonks it with a straight bat and clean swing over mid-off. Beautiful hands from Nair. Ah, poses for the paparazzis as well
Jordan to Gayle, 1 run, corrects himself does Jordan, full outside off. Gayle squeezes it to long-off

Jordan to Gayle, SIX, Jordan doesn't get the landing rights in Mohali. The slower delivery, bowls it half-way down the pitch. Seemed as though Gayle was waiting for it. Rocks back and bulldozed it into the deep square leg stands. "Catching practise for the crowd," says Pommie Mbangwa on air. 14th maximum for the universe boss
Jordan to Nair, 1 run, harpoons in the outside off yorker, Nair digs it to mid-off
Jordan to Nair, wide, not a great start to Jordan's new spell. Wafts it outside the tramlines, miles outside off. Nair leaves and umpire Anil Kumar Chaudhary spreads his arms
Bhuvneshwar to Nair, 1 run, around fifth stump line this time, Nair opens the bat face and guides it through cover
Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, 1 run, chopped to point and they scamper through for a tight single
Bhuvneshwar to Nair, 1 run, Nair walks across his stumps, looking it hoick across the line. Misread the slower delivery and hacks it along the ground to fine leg

Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, 1 run, this looked like the off-pace delivery, not sure if it was the knuckle ball or the cutter. Didn't arrive at all and holds up on the surface. Gayle stabs his bat forward and sends it down to long-on
Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, 2 runs, drifts it on leg-stump line, Gayle tucks it into the vacant mid-wicket region and they run like wind to steal the second

Bhuvneshwar to Gayle, 2 runs, Bhuvneshwar begins his new spell with a length delivery angled across outside off. Gayle throws his bat and laces it behind point. The veteran Yusuf runs across from third man and cuts it off
S Kaul to Gayle, 1 run, toe-crusher from Kaul, Gayle manages to clear his front leg out of the way and flicks it away to deep mid-wicket
S Kaul to Gayle, no run, Kaul tries for the wide yorker, Gayle sans any feet slices it to point
S Kaul to Nair, 1 run, fuller on middle and off, whipped away down the ground towards long-on

S Kaul to Nair, FOUR, does it again! This time, Jordan at mid-off thought he had a chance and leapt full length but the ball sailed over him. Short of a length outside off, Karun flat-batted it with all the power and although he didn't keep it down, didn't matter at all. Runs bleeding at the moment
S Kaul to Nair, FOUR, up and over! Good batting from Karun, saw mid-off up in the ring and decided to go over the man. Succeeded easily. Fuller ball outside off,
S Kaul to Nair, 2 runs, mistimed but clears mid-wicket with ease! Short of a length around middle and leg, drags this flick off the inner half and clears the infield

Rashid Khan to Gayle, 2 runs, some sanity to the proceedings, a slider that's a bit short, Gayle whacks it off the back foot towards long-off and gets a brace. 27 off the over! The mayhem has begun here at Mohali

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, it keeps coming! It keeps coming! 4 out of 4 for Gayle! Floated up on middle and off, he gets across on one leg and clobbers the slog sweep over deep mid-wicket for a maximum. Oh boy, this is some exhibition!

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, 3 in a row! Has Rashid ever been hammered like this? I cannot remember at all but this is what Gayle does. He can destroy the best of bowlers. Fuller length once more and he just lifts it straight down the ground. Into the sight-screen! He is in the savage mode

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, this is off the middle alright! Gayle storm alert! The shorter length and Gayle sits on the back foot to flat bat it straight down the ground. As straight as an arrow and well over the ropes

Rashid Khan to Gayle, SIX, not off the middle really but who cares? He has enough power! The googly and Gayle decided to go with the turn, sliced it away over long-off and easily cleared the fence! Whoa!
Rashid Khan to Nair, 1 run, the slider and it skids through a touch low. whipped away off the back foot to deep mid-wicket

Jordan to Nair, 1 run, full toss but Karun cannot feast on it. Tries to heave it away and ends up dragging it off the inner half to fine leg. He'll be unhappy to have missed out. Tidy over from Jordan
Jordan to Nair, no run, tucked him in, there. Short of a length slanting into the body, Karun wanted to whip it away but got cramped and was rapped on the thigh pad
Jordan to Nair, no run, short of a length outside off, punched off the back foot towards point
Jordan to Gayle, 1 run, slower and shorter outside off, cut away towards deep point for a single
Jordan to Nair, 1 run, angling in on a length outside off, driven on the up through the off-side to rotate strike

Jordan to Gayle, 1 run, slower and very full on the pads, nudged towards the big spaces at mid-wicket. Jordan has to chase it himself and that allows the single. 23rd IPL fifty for Gayle, second on the trot to start a new season. The Jamaican is making a statement, that's for sure
Shakib to Gayle, 1 run, speared in on middle and leg, heaved away towards deep mid-wicket for a single

Shakib to Gayle, SIX, he has got under this one, oh yes! Shakib was trying to steer clear of Gayle's arc but misses it for once. Full and on middle and off, the big West Indian just clears his front leg and launches it over long-on for yet another six
Shakib to Gayle, no run, fired in on leg, Gayle tries the paddle but gets it straight to short fine leg
Shakib to Gayle, no run, flatter and around middle and off, no room for Gayle as he digs it out
Shakib to Nair, 1 run, fired in around middle and leg, slapped away down the ground towards long-on

Shakib to Nair, SIX, "Will he catch it? Yes, he will! No, he won't!", yelps Mbangwa on-air! Good effort by long-off but too difficult in the end. Pandey was the man there, leapt to take it one-handed but the momentum was taking him past the ropes and in the effort to throw it back into play, fails to do so. Floated ball and was lofted down the ground by Karun, gets a maximum
S Kaul to Nair, 1 run, angling in on middle and leg, good length delivery and Nair shuffles across to flick it through mid-wicket to retain the strike
S Kaul to Gayle, 1 run, more of the shortish length and it's slower as well, Gayle crashes it off the back foot towards long-off who is placed wider for this kind of stroke
S Kaul to Gayle, no run, slower and shortish outside off, Gayle trusts his hands as he goes for the cut, no room though and only gets a bottom edge onto the track

S Kaul to Nair, 1 run, fullish and outside off, Karun gets started with a flowing drive through the covers. A bit of work for Dhawan at sweeper cover but with Gayle as partner, you won't get many twos

S Kaul to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Deepak Hooda!! Such a soft dismissal! Often been the story with Agarwal, gets a good looking start and then weirdly, throws it away. Slower ball from Kaul and it was a bit short, Agarwal was in two minds whether to go hard at it or just use his touch. In the end, all he managed was to spoon it straight to Hooda at backward point. A dolly that is and once again, SRH get a wicket at just about the right time. Mayank Agarwal c Deepak Hooda b S Kaul 18(9) [4s-2 6s-1]
S Kaul to Gayle, 1 run, slower and short outside off, very wide and Gayle reaches out to slap it to sweeper cover
Shakib to Gayle, 1 run, speared in around leg, tickled away through backward square leg for a run
Shakib to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, wanted to repeat the shot but didn't time it well and this went to long-on after a few bounces. Fuller on middle and leg, heaved away by Agarwal

Shakib to Mayank Agarwal, SIX, clobbered away! Agarwal is wasting no time in switching to top gear. Floated up around off, he just clears his front leg and deposits this over the long-on fielder for a maximum. Good proactive batting
Shakib to Gayle, 1 run, fired away on leg stump, Gayle gets across and whips it away down to long-on
Shakib to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, slower and just outside off, punchy drive down the ground towards long-off

Shakib to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, beautiful placement! Tossed up generously from Shakib but it's too wide and Agarwal executes the inside out lofted stroke with finesse. There was a man at long-off but he's got this well wide of that man
Deepak Hooda to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, slower and outside off, Agarwal gets across on the front foot and sweeps nicely to deep mid-wicket

Deepak Hooda to Gayle, 1 run, he is winding up to hit every ball for a six, such is the mood but doesn't get hold of this. Fired in around middle and off, Gayle swings wildly and gets this off the inner half to the left of deep mid-wicket
Deepak Hooda to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, drifting in around middle and leg, wristed away down the ground towards long-on

Deepak Hooda to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, almost carried to backward point! Reprieve for Agarwal, he went after this flighted delivery on seeing the width but couldn't connect the drive well. Sliced it in the air and it just fell short of the diving fielder. Sneaked past him eventually and sped to the fence
Deepak Hooda to Gayle, leg byes, 1 run, flatter and around leg, Gayle was down the track but couldn't connect the flick. Off the pads and rolls towards short fine leg
Deepak Hooda to Gayle, SIX, booooooom! Cannot bowl it in his arc when he is in this mood. Full and in the slot on off, he just lofts it down the ground effortlessly. Crashes into the sightscreen
Deepak Hooda to Gayle, wide, looped up fuller outside off, a bit wide and Gayle lets it through expecting the wide. Gets it

Rashid Khan to Mayank Agarwal, no run, floats the googly around off, fuller length and Agarwal defends off the front foot. Stifled LBW shout from Rashid who thought it was pad first but that was totally bat and nothing else. Top over though!

Rashid Khan to Rahul, out Lbw!! Rashid draws first blood! SRH needed this and not surprisingly, it's their star spinner who does the job. The slider that shoots through a touch low, Rahul wasn't anticipating the lack of bounce and went through with a pull. Got pinged on the pad and that's as plumb as it gets. End of a smooth opening stand but KXIP haven't really been allowed to get away. Rahul lbw b Rashid Khan 18(21) [4s-3]
Rashid Khan to Rahul, no run, flattish leg break outside off, Rahul stays back and stabs it towards the man at backward point
Rashid Khan to Gayle, 1 run, another googly on off, Gayle winds up for a big hit but drags it off the inner half towards deep mid-wicket

Rashid Khan to Gayle, no run, flatter googly around off, Gayle backs away and mistimes the drive back to Rashid who in a show of aggression fires a direct hit at the keeper's end. Gayle was never out of the crease though
Rashid Khan to Rahul, 1 run, tossed up around off, Rahul gets across and clips it through mid-wicket for a run

Deepak Hooda to Gayle, no run, another mild appeal for LBW, closer than the previous shout but again perhaps just going down leg with the angle. This skids off the deck as Gayle tries to defend off the front foot, got pinged on the front pad
Deepak Hooda to Gayle, no run, tossed up very full outside off, Gayle squeezes the drive towards mid-off
Deepak Hooda to Gayle, no run, stifled LBW appeal, especially from Saha but this is going down leg. The slider around leg, Gayle missed the paddle and was rapped on the pad
Deepak Hooda to Rahul, 1 run, crashed away hard but straight to sweeper cover. Rahul skipped down the track and as the length was shortened, flexed his arms to bash it on the up through cover
Deepak Hooda to Gayle, 1 run, saw Gayle giving the charge and smartly shortened the length around middle and leg, eased away down to long-on. 50 up for KXIP

Karn Sharma to Laughlin, out Caught by Dhoni!! Faint tickle from Laughlin, and that's it. RR bowled out with nine balls to go. Flat leg-break, Laughlin makes room to drive off the back foot but it climbs on him due to the overspin imparted. Dhoni takes care of the edge. Laughlin c Dhoni b Karn Sharma 0(1)

Karn Sharma to Unadkat, out Bowled!! Clatters the stumps with a googly. Unadkat has had his fun, no more. Tries for another slog-sweep but probably didn't pick the variation. Unadkat b Karn Sharma 16(10) [4s-3]
Karn Sharma to Unadkat, FOUR, quickly onto the back knee to swat this leg-break through mid-wicket. Plenty of muscle from Unadkat as he swishes it to the boundary
Jadeja to Shreyas Gopal, no run, slices this to backward point

Jadeja to Shreyas Gopal, 2 runs, skips down the pitch to swipe it with the angle, but sends a thick inside edge wide of long leg. The fielder was quick there, Gopal had to dive into the crease in order to make it
Jadeja to Unadkat, 1 run, 98kph, darting it in from round the wicket. Unadkat leans back and cuts to cover
Jadeja to Shreyas Gopal, 1 run, sliding in at the pads, Gopal mistimes it off a thick leading edge through mid-wicket
Jadeja to Unadkat, 1 run, quick and flat outside off, Unadkat chops it off a thick under-edge towards short third man
Jadeja to Shreyas Gopal, 1 run, driven to long-off
Karn Sharma to Unadkat, FOUR, the width on this delivery spelled it out for Unadkat's inside-out loft. He frees his arms to cream it wide of long-off
Karn Sharma to Shreyas Gopal, 1 run, pulled to deep mid-wicket
Karn Sharma to Unadkat, 1 run, skidding on from a back of length, Unadkat glances it behind square
Karn Sharma to Shreyas Gopal, 1 run, uses his feet and nudges it through mid-wicket
Karn Sharma to Unadkat, 1 run, timid sweep from Unadkat, spoons it off a thick top-edge into the mid-wicket region
Karn Sharma to Shreyas Gopal, 1 run, clipped away through mid-wicket
SN Thakur to Unadkat, FOUR, oh shot. Nailed this pull shot through mid-wicket. Solid response after the previous ball
SN Thakur to Unadkat, no run, short of length delivery, Unadkat looks to pull but gets a thick under-edge onto his thighs
SN Thakur to Unadkat, no run, full ball, chipped towards mid-off. Falls well short of the fielder though

SN Thakur to Binny, out Caught&Bowled!! This is a brilliant one-handed return catch from Thakur, who is absolutely fired up. He rushed Binny with the short ball, and then rushed forward in his followthrough before diving and taking it with his right hand. It was flapped up off the splice by Binny, after getting severely cramped. Binny c and b SN Thakur 10(8) [4s-1]
SN Thakur to Shreyas Gopal, 1 run, hangs back to a length ball and dabs it wide of the keeper
SN Thakur to Binny, 1 run, speared in full and straight, Binny drives powerfully to long-on
Watson to Shreyas Gopal, no run, slower back of length delivery outside off, dabbed to short third man
Watson to Shreyas Gopal, no run, nails the cut shot but finds backward point to perfection

Watson to Gowtham, out Caught by Dhoni!! Slower short ball, Gowtham swings into a pull but all he manages is a top-edge through to Dhoni. The Royals sinking rapidly now. Hardly any celebrations from CSK. Dhoni just throws the ball back and waves his players to their respective positions. Gowtham c Dhoni b Watson 1(2)
Watson to Binny, 1 run, back of a length delivery, 117kph, heaved away to deep backward square
Watson to Binny, no run, off-pace back of length delivery outside off, some spongy bounce for Watson which takes it over Binny's attempted cut
Watson to Gowtham, 1 run, 115kph, good length delivery outside off, patted through backward point
Tahir to Binny, 2 runs, fires in the yorker on off, Binny slices it through point

Tahir to Stokes, out Caught by Billings!! Stokes's head dropped as soon as this left his bat. Knew he hadn't got it off the middle. Flighted leg-break from Tahir, it comes off a thick top-edge as Stokes looks to slog-sweep and it's calmly taken at the mid-wicket boundary. Stokes c Billings b Tahir 45(37) [4s-3 6s-1]
Tahir to Stokes, SIX, stretches out to reach this googly and then flat-bats it over long-off. Brute power
Tahir to Stokes, no run, backs away and cuts it off the stumps to cover
Tahir to Binny, 1 run, wanted to go much straighter, but this lofted hit is skewed off the inside half. Long-on runs to his right and cuts it off
Tahir to Stokes, 1 run, eases the googly down to long-off
Dwayne Bravo to Binny, FOUR, he's somehow glanced this yorker into the fine leg boundary. Really well done from Binny. The line - which was on leg-stump - helped his cause
Dwayne Bravo to Stokes, 1 run, back of a length delivery on leg, clipped through square leg
Dwayne Bravo to Binny, 1 run, dipping full toss on leg, nudged round the corner
Dwayne Bravo to Stokes, 1 run, drives the low full toss to long-off

Dwayne Bravo to R Tripathi, out Caught by Billings!! Goes down on the back knee, wanting to unleash a big slog-sweep against this slower ball, but he's miscued it off a thick top-edge. He'll be taken at deep mid-wicket. Yes. So Bravo has his second, and there's more moves from him. R Tripathi c Billings b Dwayne Bravo 5(5)
Dwayne Bravo to R Tripathi, wide, short ball down leg, no bat on the attempted pull from Tripathi
Dwayne Bravo to Stokes, 1 run, slower length ball outside off, dabbed to cover
Tahir to Stokes, 1 run, short and wide, slapped away to deep extra cover
Tahir to R Tripathi, 1 run, bit too full from Tahir, Tripathi drives to long-on
Tahir to Stokes, 1 run, 93kph, leg-break on leg stump, this time Stokes works it closer to Rayudu. Only a single
Tahir to Stokes, 2 runs, pushes the leg-break through on middle and leg, Stokes clips it off the back foot wide of long-on. Comes back for the second

Tahir to Stokes, FOUR, drilled straight back, goes right through Tahir and then sneaks through Rayudu as well. Clumsy sliding effort at long-on there, but considering his bruised knee, we'll cut him some slack
Tahir to Stokes, no run, flat googly outside off, Stokes backs away and slices it to cover
Tahir to Stokes, wide, fires the googly really wide of off, Stokes happy to collect the wide
Dwayne Bravo to R Tripathi, 2 runs, full off-cutter at the stumps, Tripathi works it wide of long-on. Comfortable two
Dwayne Bravo to R Tripathi, wide, normal pace ball which slips down the leg-side, Tripathi fails to tickle it away
Dwayne Bravo to Stokes, 1 run, slower ball outside off, defended into the cover region
Dwayne Bravo to R Tripathi, 1 run, slower fuller ball outside off, sliced to sweeper cover
Dwayne Bravo to Stokes, 1 run, full at the stumps, flicked to deep mid-wicket
Dwayne Bravo to R Tripathi, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, steered through point

Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, out Caught by Tahir!! Bravo is on his way with those celebrations, shaking it real nice. Completely deceived Buttler with this slower ball. It was a short of length delivery well wide of off, Buttler was looking to drag it away through the on-side. But by the time it arrived, he had completely lost his shape. The top-edge balloons towards short third man where Tahir moves a few yards back and settles under it comfortably. Buttler c Tahir b Dwayne Bravo 22(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

Tahir to Buttler, 1 run, tries the ambitious shot - reverse sweep. Luckily gets some bat on it as it was fired in at a quick pace. The ball rolls to cover and they collect a single. 128 needed off the 10 overs
Tahir to Stokes, 1 run, short ball, pulled to long-on
Tahir to Buttler, 1 run, drifting away wide of off, drilled to long-off

Tahir to Stokes, 1 run, quick again, Stokes looks to drive and gets it off the outside half. A misfield at backward point allows the batters to nab the run. Karn Sharma, the culprit. There would have been a run-out chance, had he collected the ball cleanly
Tahir to Stokes, FOUR, cracking shot! Stokes backed away even before the ball was delivered and that allowed him to free his arms. It was darted outside off and Stokes crashed it through extra cover
Tahir to Stokes, 2 runs, quick leg-break on leg, wristed to long-on
Watson to Stokes, 1 run, low full toss wide of off at 135.8kph, Stokes crouches low and drives it to sweeper cover
Watson to Buttler, 1 run, good ball. Cramps Buttler for room with this cutter. Too close to cut and Buttler inside-edges it to fine leg
Watson to Buttler, wide, Watson saw the batsman back away and hurled a wide yorker. Just outside the tramline and that's been wided. Watson isn't happy. He knew that it was just an inch away
Watson to Stokes, 1 run, shortish again and Stokes pulls it hard to backward square leg

Watson to Stokes, FOUR, poor delivery and that's been put away. First boundary for Stokes! With fine leg inside the circle, he bowls a short ball down the leg-side. Stokes gets a glove on the pull and the ball goes fine of the fielder at 45
Watson to Buttler, 1 run, quick hands from Buttler to cut the length ball to sweeper cover. Went to the fielder in a flash
Watson to Stokes, 1 run, pitched up around off, driven all along the carpet to long-off

Tahir to Buttler, SIX, 14 off the over! Buttler has ensured that Tahir is not settled. For the third time in as many balls, he comes down the track. It was the googly from Tahir, but Buttler made it into a half-volley and bludgeoned it over the bowler's head. A gigantic hit
Tahir to Buttler, 2 runs, a dance down, followed by a clip to deep mid-wicket. Stokes has put in the dive at the bowler's end. A direct hit would have made things interesting
Tahir to Buttler, FOUR, hit hard! Buttler uses his feet to good effect. Dances down the ground to convert it into a half-volley and drills it down the ground. Long-on had no chance to mop that up
Tahir to Stokes, 1 run, quick leg-break at 95kph, Stokes stays back to tuck it to mid-wicket
Tahir to Buttler, 1 run, fetches the leggie from outside off and drags it to mid-wicket
Tahir to Buttler, no run, too full, drilled back to the bowler

Chahar to Stokes, no run, Deepak Chahar almost had his third wicket here. A well disguised slower delivery that drifted in a tad and Stokes had no clue about it. He was walking forward to work it through the leg-side and got beaten on the inside edge. Wasn't far away from the off-pole as well

Chahar to Buttler, 1 run, back-of-the hand slower ball and that's been hammered to extra cover, where Rayudu takes a blow on his right knee as he tried to stop the ball. He was striding towards the dug-out, but in the end decides against it. Fields in the deep now
Chahar to Stokes, 1 run, 124.2kph length ball wide of off, Stokes flashes hard at it. Connects well, but there's protection in the deep. A single to sweeper cover
Chahar to Buttler, 1 run, once again, Buttler shuffles across towards off, closes the bat-face to work it to deep mid-wicket. Just a single
Chahar to Buttler, 2 runs, 121.2kph, Buttler walks forward and across to clip this fullish ball to long-on's right
Chahar to Buttler, wide, quick bumper at 137.1kph, goes above the batsman's head. Wided for height
Chahar to Buttler, wide, another slower ball at 110.4kph, Buttler moves off-side to scoop. Misses as it well down the leg-side
Chahar to Stokes, 1 run, off-paced short of length delivery, punched to long-on

Watson to Buttler, no run, follows it up with a slower ball. This ball at 123kph totally deceived Buttler - who was early to swing his bat hard. He was targeting the long-on fence. Connects with thin air. Just 35 off the powerplay
Watson to Buttler, no run, very full and wide of off, just inside the tramline. Left alone
Watson to Buttler, no run, swing and a miss. Length ball swinging away a tad, Buttler looks to drive with hard hands. Beaten on the outside edge
Watson to Stokes, 1 run, slower ball at 117.8kph, Stokes steps out of his crease and in the process moves leg-side to free his arms. Scythed straight to Karn Sharma at extra cover, who mocks a throw
Watson to Stokes, no run, pitched up delivery, driven straight to cover
Watson to Stokes, no run, punches a short of length delivery to mid-wicket
Chahar to Stokes, 1 run, yet another slower ball, Stokes uses his wrists to turn it to mid-wicket
Chahar to Stokes, no run, slower bouncer, Stokes spots it late and decides to let it go
Chahar to Buttler, 1 run, normal-paced short of length delivery, Buttler walks across to tuck it around the corner

Chahar to Rahane, out Bowled!! Another knuckle ball, another wicket. Simple, right! Rajasthan are now in deep trouble.
