Chahar changed the position of the ball in his hand at the last moment and Rahane had no clue about it. Waltzed down the track and wanted to pull it away. Early to swing the bat and the ball scoots under the blade. 32/3! Rahane b Chahar 16(11) [4s-1 6s-1]

Chahar to Stokes, 1 run, Chahar saw the batter come down and shortened his length. Stokes adjusts by hopping and dabs it to backward point, where Rayudu is quick to let go the ball. Fails to hit the target and Stokes makes his ground with a dive
Chahar to Stokes, no run, 136.8kph, slanting away on a length, a mistimed cut that goes straight to the man at cover-point
SN Thakur to Stokes, 1 run, slower ball, pitched up, wide of off, Stokes leans and drives straight to the fielder at cover
SN Thakur to Stokes, no run, a jog down the track from Stokes, and is beaten for pace. The ball nips in a tad, beats the inside edge and hits him high on the thigh
SN Thakur to Rahane, 1 run, quick short ball on the body, Rahane hurriedly pulls it to deep square leg
SN Thakur to Stokes, 3 runs, walks forward and across to work the length ball through mid-wicket
SN Thakur to Stokes, no run, sees the length wide of off and he is happy to shoulder arms
SN Thakur to Rahane, 1 run, punched to cover-point off the back foot and the fielder fires an unnecessary throw at the bowler's end. Results in an overthrow

Chahar to Samson, out Caught by Karn Sharma!! Two down! Samson is distraught as he walks off. He has picked the man in the deep perfectly. Short of a length delivery on the body and Samson went aerial on the heave. Got it off the top portion of the bat and found Karn Sharma at deep backward square leg. As he walks off, mocks the pull shot (to be played along the ground). Too late! Samson c Karn Sharma b Chahar 2(3)
Chahar to Samson, 2 runs, shortish ball, hurriedly pulled to deep mid-wicket. Didn't quite get it off the middle
Chahar to Rahane, 1 run, bit of extra bounce and Rahane mistimes the glance to square leg off the top part of the bat. Uppish, but safe
Chahar to Rahane, 2 runs, fuller than a good length, clipped through mid-wicket

Chahar to Rahane, no run. Another appeal for lbw and this time CSK decide to review. Fair delivery. The knuckle ball and Rahane didn't pick it. Was early into the shot and got struck on the back thigh. Was there any bat involved? A light spike on the UltraEdge. An inside edge. CSK lose their only review. It was on a length and Rahane walked forward to work it through the on-side. Didn't pick it, on that occasion did Rahane
Chahar to Rahane, no run, 135.8kph, length ball on the stumps, a tentative push into the off-side

SN Thakur to Samson, no run, full and angling in on the pads, Samson misses the flick and is struck on the front leg in front of leg. Shardul Thakur goes up for an lbw appeal straightaway. MSD has a word with the bowler and decides not to go for the review. Six runs and a wicket off the over

SN Thakur to Klaasen, out Bowled!! Gone! Shardul Thakur strikes. A nothing shot from the South African. No feet movement either. A cross-seamed length ball attacking the stumps, Klaasen stays leg-side of the ball and plays down the wrong line. The stumps get shattered. CSK have an early breakthrough. Klaasen b SN Thakur 7(7) [4s-1]
SN Thakur to Klaasen, 2 runs, slower ball, following a backing away batsman. Clipped to deep square leg
SN Thakur to Klaasen, no run, half-volley on the pads, wristed straight to the fielder at 45. Thakur got away
SN Thakur to Klaasen, no run, walks down the track and punches the length ball back to the bowler

SN Thakur to Klaasen, FOUR, through the gates! That won't please the bowler, nor the captain. A fullish ball on middle and leg, Klaasen flicks it superbly, but was straight to the man at mid-wicket. Karn Sharma there allows it to go through his legs. First boundary in IPL for Klaasen

Chahar to Rahane, FOUR, edged and four. 14 off the opening over. Streaky, but Rahane wouldn't mind much. The ball came in with the angle and Rahane got an inside edge on his push, runs away to the fine leg fence

Chahar to Rahane, SIX, shot! One of best shots played today. The RR skipper gives the charge by coming down the track and then offers a straight bat to thump this length ball over long-on. Off the middle and off she goes into the stands. Poses for the photographs too
Chahar to Rahane, wide, slips one down the leg-side
Chahar to Rahane, no run, back of a length delivery on the stumps, Rahane attempts the cross-batted stroke and inside-edges it. Lucky not to drag it back to the stumps
Chahar to Klaasen, 1 run, straighter lines and Klaasen opens his account by bunting the length ball to mid-wicket

Chahar to Klaasen, no run, dropped! Deja vu! Watto was dropped in the first over at first slip and he does the same now. A beautiful delivery from Chahar. Seam-up delivery on a good-ish length that decks away a tad and Klaasen dangled his bat out. The thick outside edge carries to Watson, but that's been put down. Klaasen survives. The centurion wasn't quite ready - was late to react
Chahar to Rahane, 1 run, Rahane and RR are underway. 136.2kph, short of length on off, Rahane hops and taps it with soft hands wide of the slip fielder. A sharp single
Chahar to Rahane, wide, back of a length delivery, shaping away. Bit of extra bounce as well. Rahane misses the cut. Called as a wide

Laughlin to Jadeja, 2 runs, low full toss outside off, Jadeja cue-ends the drive to long-on and Bravo puts on the skates to sprint back for the second, Laughlin does not collect the ball as he lights up the bails and allows the second to be completed. Had he collected the ball and broken the stumps, Bravo was a goner

Laughlin to Watson, out Caught by Buttler!! Edged and taken. Some of the RR players run up to Watto and congratulate him. He was one of them for eight years and walks off to a standing ovation from the yellow army. Fine innings from the Australian. Fuller and outside off, Watson with his typical bent knee looks to smoke it over long-off, only manages an outside edge to Buttler. Watson c Buttler b Laughlin 106(57) [4s-9 6s-6]
Laughlin to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, close to the blockhole and Bravo squeezes it into the off-side
Laughlin to Dwayne Bravo, wide, sprays it well outside off and Bravo swings and misses, Laughlin is not happy with the umpire. He gestures to the umpire that Bravo is standing well outside off

Laughlin to Dwayne Bravo, 2 runs, 200 up for CSK. Second time this season they have breached that mark. Slower delivery and Bravo drags it off the inner portion wide of deep mid-wicket, Stokes tidies up
Laughlin to Dwayne Bravo, wide, bouncer which is too short and it flies over Bravo's head, wide called
Laughlin to Dwayne Bravo, no run, edge falls short of Buttler. Bravo advances and has a mighty swing at the off-cutter, the outside edge lands in front of Buttler, who gloves it on the bounce
Laughlin to Watson, 1 run, 114kph low full toss outside off, Watson shuffled across and lapped it off the cue-end through backward square, just a single

Stokes to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, ends the over well. Made room while dancing down, the width on offer made him free his arms and send the ball sailing over the extra cover fielder. Rocketed away to the fence

Stokes to Watson, 1 run, what was Gowtham doing? He should have gone for the catch, but held himself back. Another miscue for Watson as he goes after the length delivery, gets it high on the bat and spoons it towards long-on, Gowtham is happy to take it on the bounce
Stokes to Watson, 2 runs, missed out there. The perfect swinging length and Watson dragged the heave off the inner portion of the bat in front of square leg, jogs back for the second
Stokes to Watson, no run, sharp bumper from Stokes, clocked at 140kph, Watson was hurried on the hook and the ball flies over the top-edge. That was too quick for the Australian
Stokes to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, races down and is followed by a short of length delivery, lifted on the bounce to long-on

Stokes to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, one-handed pull from Bravo. He was deceived by the slower delivery and the bottom hand comes off the bat handle, but the placement is behind square and a desperate dive from Klaasen is not enough to stop the boundary

Unadkat to Watson, 2 runs, just short of Gopal. Unadkat went over the wicket and slanted it outside off, Watson went for the inside out loft and the thickish outside edge flew down to third man, Gopal went for the catch and when he knew he wasn't getting there, stuck his right hand out to stop it on the half volley, saved a couple

Unadkat to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, dropped! Samson the man who puts it down. Bravo tried to repeat the previous shot, but does not get the elevation on the cut shot, Samson jumps up at backward point and parries it over him. Should have done a better job there. RR have not had a good day in the field

Unadkat to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, offers room on this slower delivery and Bravo is quick to capitalize, he waits before unleashing the cut shot over backward point, no one in the deep to stop that. Much needed boundary for Bravo
Unadkat to Dwayne Bravo, no run, change of pace and Bravo is into the heave early, missed it by a mile

Unadkat to Watson, 1 run, hundred for Watson. Two in two days in this IPL. Gayle yesterday and Watson today. The helmet comes off and the bat is up in the air to acknowledge the applause of the traveling fans. There was also a little fist pump as soon as he placed it in the gap. He scored a hundred for Royals while playing against CSK and now he's done the vice versa - the first player to do that. Coming to the ball: Back of a length around off, Watson knocks it wide of point and reaches the milestone
Unadkat to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, angled in from round the wicket and Bravo flicks it to deep square leg
Laughlin to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, change of pace and Bravo nudges it in front of deep mid-wicket to retain strike
Laughlin to Dwayne Bravo, no run, dug in short as Laughlin saw Bravo giving him the charge, the latter misses the cut shot and it is another dot
Laughlin to Dwayne Bravo, no run, bouncer from Laughlin and Bravo sways away from the line of the delivery

Laughlin to Dwayne Bravo, FOUR, delicate! Slower back of a length delivery, Bravo walked across his stumps to get inside the line and then glances it off the hips past the short fine fielder, just a roll of the wrists to pocket a boundary
Laughlin to Watson, 1 run, fuller on off and middle, Watson drives it crisply to long-on, onto 99

Laughlin to Watson, FOUR, Watson needs to keep going for CSK. The runs have dried up a bit in the last few overs. Trifle short and outside off and Watson waits before playing the cut shot past the diving backward point fielder

Shreyas Gopal to Watson, 1 run, Watson sensibly knocks the final delivery off Gopal's spell into the off-side and collects a single. The leggie is done for the night and what amazing figures he's got, 4-0-20-3 when everyone else is going at over 10 per over
Shreyas Gopal to Watson, no run, fraction short and outside off, Watson chops the cut to point

Shreyas Gopal to Watson, 2 runs, flatter and on off, Watson resists the temptation of going for the pull, whips it wide of long-on and scampers back for the second. He so easily could have gone the Billings way
Shreyas Gopal to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, wrong 'un and Bravo wrists a single down to long-on
Shreyas Gopal to Dwayne Bravo, no run, tossed up around off, blocked back to Gopal

Shreyas Gopal to Billings, out Caught by Stokes!! Third for Gopal. He's been exceptional today. Standout bowler by far for Royals. It was the sort of half-tracker that got Kohli and de Villiers couple of matches ago, Billings went deep in the crease to play the pull and hit it straight to deep mid-wicket. The big England all-rounder ain't dropping that. RR fighting back with a couple of wickets. Billings c Stokes b Shreyas Gopal 3(7)
Unadkat to Billings, 1 run, another slower delivery and Billings made room to whack it over the off-side, but the change of pace made him check his shot and tap it in front of mid-off, just a single
Unadkat to Watson, 1 run, rolls his fingers across the ball and since the length is short, Watson is able to pull it along the ground to deep square leg
Unadkat to Billings, 1 run, fuller and outside off, Billings chips the loft on the bounce to sweeper cover
Unadkat to Billings, no run, walks down the wicket and taps the length delivery to backward point
Unadkat to Watson, 1 run, off-speed short of length delivery and Watson pulls it on the bounce to deep square leg

Unadkat to Watson, FOUR, edged and four! Not where he intended, but when luck is on your side, everything goes your way. Unadkat comes round the wicket and cramps Watson for room, he attempts a cut shot and the outside edge runs away to the right of Buttler

Shreyas Gopal to Watson, 1 run, excellent over. Just what RR needed to get their spirits back. Three runs off it and the wicket of Dhoni. Wrong 'un and Watson nurdles it round the corner - to backward square leg
Shreyas Gopal to Billings, 1 run, nothing but googlies from Gopal, Billings hangs back and directs it with an angled bat wide of point
Shreyas Gopal to Billings, no run, Billings does not pick the googly as he steps out of the crease, misses the nudge and is hit on the pad
Shreyas Gopal to Billings, no run, flighted outside off, Billings comes down the track and pushes it to cover

Shreyas Gopal to Dhoni, out Caught by Gowtham!! Juggled and taken. Gowtham must be a relieved man. For a second it seemed like he parried it over. Dhoni shimmies down and gets close to the wrong 'un, smokes it flat and hard towards long-on, Gowtham times his jump and goes reverse cup, but the ball bursts out and luckily for him goes straight up, he gathers himself and completes the catch. Dhoni c Gowtham b Shreyas Gopal 5(3) [4s-1]
Shreyas Gopal to Watson, 1 run, googly dragged down, Watson swivel and pulls it to deep backward square, good sliding stop from Tripathi
Binny to Dhoni, FOUR, 19 runs off the over. Raina's wicket has done nothing to slow down the scoring rate. Off-cutter on a length, Dhoni just guides it past backward point and short third man
Binny to Watson, 1 run, another slower delivery and Watson nudges it to deep square leg

Binny to Watson, FOUR, third boundary of the over. Binny is going for plenty. Short delivery and at 132 clicks it is not going to trouble Watson, who pulls it along the ground in front of square, the placement was perfect
Binny to Watson, wide, slower delivery gone wrong, down leg and Watson still tried to go after it, wide called

Binny to Watson, FOUR, consecutive boundaries and this was not a poor delivery. Fab shot from Watto. Spotted third man inside the ring, waited for the back of a length delivery on off and dabbed it past a diving backward point, the quick outfield takes care of the rest

Binny to Watson, FOUR, easy pickings! Back of a length on middle and leg, Watson waits and gently tickles it fine, the man is inside the ring at 45 and it was well wide of him, raced across the lightning outfield
Binny to Dhoni, 1 run, first ball and Dhoni is charging down, that is what runs does to a batsman, on the pads and glanced away to fine leg
Shreyas Gopal to Watson, no run, tossed up around off, Watson presses forward and defends it back

Shreyas Gopal to Raina, out Caught by Gowtham!! Stunner! Needed something like this to break this partnership and the two Karnataka lads combine to send Raina back. Another wrong 'un from Gopal and Raina once more spotted it early, sat down on his knee to play the slog and sweep, struck it powerfully and flat towards deep mid-wicket, the ball was dying in front of Gowtham, who covered good ground, dived full length and took it inches from the ground. Raina c Gowtham b Shreyas Gopal 46(29) [4s-9]

Shreyas Gopal to Raina, wide, what happened there? Raina was searching for the ball and when he saw it kicked it away. But the umpire calls it a wide. Googly turns in from outside leg, Raina missed the whip and Buttler does not glove it cleanly either, the ball drops somewhere in between the two men and it is Raina who spots it first. But why did he have to kick it away? He thought it hit his body and was rolling back on the stumps
Shreyas Gopal to Raina, no run, fired in outside off, clocked at 115kph, Raina misses out on the cut shot. He was undone for pace

Shreyas Gopal to Raina, FOUR, fabulous shot! It was the wrong 'un and Raina picked it right out of the hand. Got into position to play the inside out shot and struck it handsomely over extra cover. The timing was exquisite
Shreyas Gopal to Raina, no run, googly and Raina fails to meet with the sweep shot, hit on the pad and the ball rolls back

Shreyas Gopal to Raina, FOUR, streaky! But that's how Raina plays. No half measures. Darted in outside off and Raina threw his bat at that, sliced the drive over backward point and started another over with a boundary
Laughlin to Raina, 1 run, Laughlin has resorted to change of pace and Raina check drives it to long-off
Laughlin to Watson, 1 run, off-speed slower delivery and Watson chops the cut wide of point, scampers across

Laughlin to Watson, SIX, flat six! That barely left the ground. Banged in and at Laughlin's pace it sat up for Watto, who was quick to rock back and nail the pull in front of square, right between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket
Laughlin to Raina, 1 run, full and on the legs, tickle down to fine leg and there is protection, just a single
Laughlin to Raina, wide, strays down leg while trying to follow Raina, but the southpaw moves inside the line and pockets an extra

Laughlin to Raina, FOUR, the boundaries continue to flow.. Room to leg and that opens up the off-side field nicely for him, even though it is back of a length, Raina thumps it on the up over extra cover. No chance for the sweeper
Laughlin to Watson, 1 run, fuller and bit off-pace, Watson delays his drive and sends it racing to long-off

Unadkat to Raina, FOUR, these runs are hurting Royals, really bad. Both batsmen are looking unstoppable. Shortish delivery on leg, Raina swivels his pull past the fielder at short fine and ends the over with a boundary again. How often has that happened tonight!
Unadkat to Raina, FOUR, that's the second 50-run partnership of the match. Short and wide outside off, Raina beautifully cuts it over point and adds four to his tally
Unadkat to Watson, 1 run, waits for the shortish delivery, goes back in the crease and guides it in front of point
Unadkat to Raina, 1 run, length delivery on middle and leg, Raina eases it past the bowler and scurries across to the other end. Again he was early in his shot

Unadkat to Raina, no run, another leading edge. Good couple of deliveries by Unadkat to start the over. Takes the pace of the ball and drops it short on off, Raina who's early in his flick, gets a leading edge but that falls well short of the bowler though
Unadkat to Raina, no run, short of a length around off, shoots up after hitting the deck, Raina looks to nudge it away but gets a leading edge that falls just on the pitch
Gowtham to Raina, 1 run, Raina tucks the shortish one to the on-side and gets a single
Gowtham to Watson, 1 run, shortish delivery outside off, punched through covers for a single
Gowtham to Watson, SIX, smoked it! Tossed up delivery around off, Watson slogs this over mid-wicket for half a dozen
Gowtham to Watson, FOUR, there's no stopping him tonight. This is short again outside off, Watson goes back in his crease and slams it through the gap at covers

Gowtham to Watson, SIX, gets to his fifty in style! It's a short delivery and Watson camps back and slaughters it over Stokes at long-on. Reaches the milestone and raises his bat, acknowledges the crowd

Gowtham to Raina, 1 run, a risky single!  What was Raina thinking here? Knocks the flatter delivery to the left of the bowler and takes a single. Gowtham had the time in the world to parry it to Rahane but he decides to go for a direct hit and misses out on a run out opportunity. Raina had given up
Shreyas Gopal to Raina, 1 run, bowls another floater on leg and Raina sweeps it away to deep square leg to retain strike
Shreyas Gopal to Raina, no run, fired on leg, Raina tries to sweep it but is rapped on the pads due to the quicker one. Gopal goes up in an lbw shout but this was clearly missing leg
Shreyas Gopal to Watson, 1 run, drops it short on middle and leg, Watson rocks back and drags it down to long-on again
Shreyas Gopal to Raina, 1 run, a googly on the pads as Raina simply nurdles it away to square leg
Shreyas Gopal to Raina, no run, flat and quick around off, Raina gently guides it back to the bowler
Shreyas Gopal to Watson, 1 run, lot of flight on that delivery as Watson whips it down to long-on, lot of bottom hand on that shot

Gowtham to Watson, 1 run, in the air... but safe. Tossed up delivery outside off, Watson takes him on and chips it firmly to long-off. On a single bounce to the fielder in the deep. Had he timed that, it might have been a catch
Gowtham to Raina, 1 run, pushed through on middle and leg, nudged to the on-side for an easy single
Gowtham to Raina, no run, a slider on the pads, Raina fails to connect his flick and gets rapped on the pads
Gowtham to Watson, 1 run, shortish in length on middle and leg, Watson goes back in his crease and drags it down to fine leg
Gowtham to Watson, no run, short and quick on the pads, Watson doesn't attempt a shot as the ball flicks his pads and rolls down to fine leg, the umpire signals a dead ball
Gowtham to Watson, 2 runs, flat and quick on middle, Watson gets down on his knee and scoops it down to fine leg. A good effort by the fielder in the deep keeps the batsmen down to two

Stokes to Raina, FOUR, brilliant! That's Raina's experience for you. This was a length delivery angled away from him and Raina played it late in order to guide it down to third man, the fielder was too square to cut it off. 16 runs of the over, all in boundaries!

Stokes to Raina, FOUR, commits the same mistake again. Fires in a low full toss on the pads and Raina makes sure to get some bat on that. Tickles it away to the fine leg fence and gets four more, that's the third boundary of the over
Stokes to Raina, FOUR, short one on the thigh and Raina drags it down to the fine leg fence. Stokes has struggled with his lines so far. Bowled a few looseners in his first over too
Stokes to Raina, FOUR, typical Raina there. Full length delivery around off, gets down on his knee and sweetly times his inside out shot over covers, looked pleasing to the eye that shot
Stokes to Raina, no run, very full delivery around off, Raina knocks it back to Stokes

Stokes to Raina, no run, inside edge, a clear inside edge there. Length delivery angled away from the batsman, Raina looks to fend it and gets a huge inside egde on to the pads. Umpire was quick to pick that and hence the lbw appeal was turned down by him
Laughlin to Raina, 1 run, that might have gone anywhere. Short ball again, that troubles Raina. He tried to hook the short one but got a top edge as the ball lobbed towards short mid-wicket
Laughlin to Watson, 1 run, length delivery on middle and leg, Watson tucks it away to backward square leg
Laughlin to Raina, 1 run, Raina gets off the mark right away. Tucks the shortish delivery in front of mid-wicket and sets off

Laughlin to Rayudu, out Caught by Buttler!! Laughlin strikes in his first over and sends Rayudu back to the hut. It was a length delivery outside off, too close to the body and Rayudu attempted a cut, he got an edge to it. Buttler behind the wickets makes sure to hold on to it. The batsman was in two minds there, whether to guide it to third man or play a cut shot. The dilemma resulted in his downfall. Rayudu c Buttler b Laughlin 12(8) [4s-2]
Laughlin to Watson, 1 run, 50-run stand up with that single! Short of a length on middle and leg, Watson nudges it away to short mid and scurries across to the other end
Laughlin to Rayudu, 1 run, a bit of swing on that full length delivery, pitches on leg and comes it as Rayudu plays an on-drive and gathers a single

Stokes to Watson, FOUR, all bowlers are proving to be expensive. CSK openers are making the most of the powerplay. Again this was a gift of a delivery. Fullish and on the pads as Watson flicks it nonchalantly away to the fine leg region

Stokes to Rayudu, 1 run, gets it right this time. Failed to connect the shot on the previous delivery but does well to connect on this delivery. On a length and outside off, Rayudu cuts it to point and scampers across to the other end
Stokes to Rayudu, no run, full length ball outside off, quick in pace as Rayudu moves to his right to reach for it, gets undone and is beaten on the steer to third man
Stokes to Watson, 1 run, back of a length on middle and leg, Watson turns this away in front of short mid-wicket for a single, a quick one
Stokes to Rayudu, 1 run, Rayudu advances down the wicket but as Stokes drops it short, the batsman bunts it towards short mid-wicket
Stokes to Rayudu, FOUR, boundaries continue to flow. Short and slow on middle and leg, Rayudu swivels and pulls it past the fielder at short fine leg, does well to get it past him

Unadkat to Watson, SIX, last ball of the over fetches six more. Unadkat wouldn't like this. He's the most expensive buy of this IPL among Indian players. Short of a length around off, Watson camps back and hammers it over mid-wicket for a flat six
Unadkat to Watson, no run, another full length delivery outside off, Watson has tapped it to the off side, not a convincing shot again as he got undone by the lack of pace
Unadkat to Watson, no run, full in length outside off, Watson looks to chop it and gets an inside edge towards the slips

Unadkat to Watson, SIX, Watto is off to a flier. Although he has been dropped twice, he's continuing to take on the bowlers. This was a length delivery around off, Watson stood tall and clobbered it over the extra cover fence for half a dozen more
Unadkat to Watson, no run, length delivery outside off, Watson looks to cut, ends up getting it off his bottom edge
Unadkat to Watson, no run, on a length outside off, punched off the back foot firmly to Samson at cover

Gowtham to Watson, 1 run, dropped! Short and wide outside off, Watson cuts it firmly to point but a diving effort by Tripathi saves a certain boundary. In fact it was a chance, Tripathi got his hand to it but couldn't take it
Gowtham to Watson, SIX, first maximum of the match! Loopy delivery around off, Watson backs away, makes room and towers it cleanly over long-off for his first big one of the night

Gowtham to Watson, 2 runs, flatter in trajectory around off, Watson gets down and slogs it away to deep mid-wicket where Stokes sprints to his right and puts in a valiant effort to keep them down to two
Gowtham to Watson, no run, slider outside off, Watson comes on the front foot and pushes it to the man at cover
Gowtham to Rayudu, 1 run, another single at mid-wicket as Rayudu tucks the floater away
Gowtham to Watson, 1 run, flatter on middle and leg, Watson flicks it to mid-wicket for a single

Binny to Rayudu, FOUR, who would want to be a bowler in this format? Dropped catch just on the previous ball and this one has been belted away. Full in length outside off, Rayudu advances down the wicket and smokes it over cover for a boundary

Binny to Watson, 1 run, edged and dropped! Rahul Tripathi the culprit on that occasion. Puts down a sitter. Was a full length delivery outside off, Watson goes for a drive and the away swing induces an outside edge. However, Tripathi - the lone slipper makes a mess out of it
Binny to Watson, no run, rises high in the crease and offers a solid back foot to a shortish delivery, straight to the man at cover again. Good comeback by Binny after being belted for two boundaries
Binny to Watson, no run, on a length outside off, Watson gently punches it to the fielder at cover

Binny to Watson, FOUR, that's bread and butter for Watto. Back of a length delivery outside off, Watson camps back, transfers his weight on the back foot and crunches this through the gap at covers, no fielder moved there
Binny to Watson, FOUR, he won't miss out on that, will Watson! Waits for the slower delivery, rocks back and pumps it right over the bowler's head to get off the mark in style
Binny to Watson, no ball, starts off with a no ball! Nothing better Watson would have asked for. It's full in length around off, Watson stays put and bunts it towards point. Free hit coming up!

Tom Curran to Gayle, SIX, that's in the airrr, mistimed, the fielder jumps and it just escapes him. So that's the game for KXIP. They top the points table. Fittingly Gayle hits the winning shot. Length ball, Gayle went for the loft straight, long-on ran to his right and jumped but couldn't get a hand on it
Shivam Mavi to Gayle, 1 run, low full toss, Gayle drills it to long-on, keeps strike
Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run, wild swing, short of a length delivery outside off stump, Gayle slogs and misses

Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run, oh this is a very different kind of slower. Not the knuckle ball, not the back-of-the-hander, but he's just released this in a way that it back spins it bounced on Gayle as well. The checked defence almost goes back as a catch to the bowler

Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run, oh he should have knocked over Gayle, deserves the wicket, for he's bowled really well to Gayle, but luck is with Gayle and the inside edge hits the pad and rolls past the stumps. Gayle didn't read that slower but tried the cut shot
Shivam Mavi to Gayle, wide, full and down the leg-side, easy call for the umpire
Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run, that's a very good yorker, targetting the base of leg stick, Gayle just about managed to dig it out and avoid damage to his toe
Shivam Mavi to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, fuller length delivery outside off stump, Mayank drives it to sweeper cover
Narine to Gayle, no run, shortish and on the leg stump, Gayle knocks it into the on-side
Narine to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, shortish delivery on the leg stump, Agarwal tucks it to square leg

Narine to Rahul, out Caught by Tom Curran!! He's mistimed this high in the air and deep mid-wicket takes it. Short ball, Rahul went for the pull, came off the bottom of the bat as the ball came slowly onto him. Walks off to a great applause, raises the bat to the crowd. He really wanted to end this game in a hurry. What a top knock though. It was so good to watch him score quick runs with proper cricketing shots. Rahul c Tom Curran b Narine 60(27) [4s-9 6s-2]
Narine to Rahul, FOUR, cut away fiercely past point and a big roar from the crowd! Who are they supporting? Quicker delivery outside off stump, Rahul goes back and cuts really hard

Narine to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul wants to finish this off early. Bravely races down the pitch and forces Narine to shorten the length, it was well outside off stump, but Rahul reached out and cut it away past cover

Narine to Rahul, SIX, crunched! A 24-ball fifty for KL Rahul. How well has he played thus far in the tournament! Shortish delivery from Narine, Rahul pulls off the back foot, hit flat and hit over the mid-wicket boundary
Chawla to Gayle, no run, shortish in length, Gayle sends this towards short fine leg
Chawla to Gayle, no run, defended to the right of the bowler
Chawla to Gayle, no run, oh he targets a maximum again, but this time Chawla beat him with a quick delivery

Chawla to Gayle, SIX, full toss and smashed. A hat-trick of fifties for Gayle and this is a bloke who went unsold originally and was picked last minute at base price. He hits this straight and does the "baby celebration" of his. Gets a great round of applause from the crowd

Chawla to Gayle, SIX, that ball stayed up for an eternity. The fielder at long-on thought he was in with a chance, but it is Chris Gayle who is batting and even a miscue from him will clear the rope. Went after the wrong 'un and cue-ended the loft, just about managed to clear the field
Chawla to Rahul, 1 run, flighted and Rahul taps it into the off-side, for an easy single
Narine to Rahul, 1 run, hangs on the back foot and wrists the offie towards long-on. Sensible batting - play out Narine and attack the rest. That seems to be the mantra for these two
Narine to Rahul, no run, bit of air on this one and Rahul is right on top of the delivery to play the drive, straight to cover
Narine to Gayle, 1 run, flatter and on the stumps, a push to the left of Narine and a single to long-on
Narine to Rahul, 1 run, rides the bounce on this occasion and nurdles it into large vacant spaces in the leg-side
Narine to Rahul, no run, quicker, shorter and outside off, Rahul cuts and misses. He was undone by the pace on the delivery, bit of extra bounce as well
Narine to Rahul, no run, fraction short and Rahul cuts it straight to backward point, either side and that would have been four

Kuldeep Yadav to Gayle, no run, shortish and just outside off stump, Gayle goes back for the punch, hits it in the air but unfortunately for the bowler there's lack of power behind this shot and it doesn't carry to cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahul, 1 run, flighted delivery on the leg stump, Rahul sweeps it to fine leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Gayle, 1 run, punched to long-on

Kuldeep Yadav to Gayle, SIX, got to feel for the bowlers who are forced to bowl a defensive line with these big bats and small boundaries. Can cricket be kind on them please? Kuldeep Yadav did the right thing by spinning the ball away from Gayle and bowling wide outside off stump, but he bowled too full and the big man got under it to smash it over long-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahul, 1 run, wristed to square leg

Kuldeep Yadav to Rahul, FOUR, absolutely no mercy from Rahul. Well, a rank long hop doesn't deserve respect anyway. Rahul quickly rocks back and pulls powerfully, splits long-on and deep mid-wicket quite easily
Chawla to Rahul, 1 run, advances and drives it to long-on

Chawla to Rahul, FOUR, this guy is striking them at 264 and bits but doesn't play rash shots. That's the feature of his batting. Spots the field, fine leg is inside, so he allows the ball to come, the line was down the leg-side and he just helped it away fine past the keeper

Chawla to Rahul, FOUR, hey Sunil! Gotta move buddy! Rahul went back and pulled this short ball fine, Narine was at short fine leg, he hardly moved, should have tried at least, instead he put his arm out to the man in the deep, who clearly had no chance
Chawla to Gayle, 1 run, driven hard to cover, who dives to his left and stops the ball
Chawla to Gayle, no run, wooo! That was a lot of air there from Gayle. Chawla bowls the slider flat, across and full, very lucky that Gayle didn't connect with that golf swing of his
Chawla to Rahul, 1 run, steps out and nudges to mid-wicket

Narine to Gayle, FOUR, that's the over spoiled, tried the offie again but sprayed it down the leg-side, fine leg was inside the ring and Gayle happily helps it on its way over short fine leg. Gee he's looking ominous
Narine to Gayle, no run, the offie again and Gayle struggles off the back foot, somehow manages to dab it into the off-side

Narine to Gayle, no run, in no mood to come forward to Narine, is only reading the spin from the pitch, just opens the bat face late and guides it towards point. Come on Sunil, slip in the knuckle ball
Narine to Gayle, no run, Gayle's very watchful against Narine, stands still and punches towards mid-off
Narine to Gayle, no run, the offie, that's very very carefully punched off the back foot to cover
Narine to Rahul, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Rahul punches it down to long-on

Nitish Rana to Gayle, no run, oh he almost knocks him over first ball. Nitish Rana has bowled well this IPL, hasn't he? Surprised Gayle with a seam-up length ball that swung back in late from round the wicket, Gayle just about makes contact with the ball in time

A Russell to Gayle, SIX, the upper cut and it's gone all the way. This guy averages around 50 in T20s at this venue I guess! Oh Dre Russ is down on the floor after delivering that ball. Looks like he's done a hammie here. Anyway, this was a short ball that came at pace and Gayle's leg-side movement gave him the space to free the arms and slice the ball over third man. The connection was spot on

A Russell to Gayle, FOUR, look at the frustration on Russell's face. He thought of outsmarting Gayle by taking pace off the ball, but Gayle cleverly delayed the shot. He moved leg-side early, but held the pose for a bit and then cut it between point and cover-point. Expertly done
A Russell to Rahul, 1 run, almost a yorker, Rahul digs it out to mid-on, the throw goes to the striker's end as Gayle was a touch slow
A Russell to Gayle, 1 run, Russell hits the pitch hard with this short of length delivery and gets it to jump on the batsman, Gayle, cramped for space, manages to pull on one leg to deep mid-wicket
A Russell to Gayle, SIX, nope! Please don't bowl there Russ! You know it's all too easy if you bowl full against a power-hitter. Gayle easily gets under this ball and launches it wide of long-on

Shivam Mavi to Rahul, SIX, that's inexperience for you from the bowler. He was troubling Rahul with the inswingers, this is the final ball of his second over, he may not be given the third, so now he tries something different from what was working and gets smashed. Short and rising, Rahul nonchalantly pulls over square leg. How good a shot was that?
Shivam Mavi to Gayle, 1 run, oh he's hurried Gayle with a fast short ball, luckily for Gayle the ill-timed pull shot doesn't carry to mid-wicket

Shivam Mavi to Gayle, FOUR, that's sloppy from Narine, should have been stopped. Again Gayle fails to time the ball, this was a good length delivery that rushed, the ball took the inside edge of the bat and escaped wide of mid-wicket

Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run, beaten! This is brave from Shivam Mavi to back himself to bowl the outswingers to Gayle and the big left-hander only connected with thin air. Wild swing of the bat to try and smash the leather, but the swing did him in

Shivam Mavi to Gayle, FOUR, a boundary but this was hardly middled by Gayle. The bowler actually won a mini battle there, tried the outswinger, but that didn't swing much, the angle away troubled Gayle, who wanted to smash this over long-off, the ball hits the outside half of the bat and flies over cover-point

Shivam Mavi to Rahul, 1 run, and there it is! Rahul almost foxed by that sharp inward movement starting outside off stump and finish on off stump, awkwardly managed to fend with one hand towards backward square leg
Shivam Mavi to Rahul, wide, come on buddy, get that in the fourth/fifth stump line. The attempted inswinger is sprayed down the leg-side
A Russell to Gayle, no run, the yorker followed by a pacy bumper, Gayle ducks under it. The asking rate is that big for Gayle to have a go at everything. He's calm and those are danger signs for KKR
A Russell to Gayle, no run, now he nails the yorker outside off stump, Gayle fails to make contact

A Russell to Gayle, FOUR, Dre Russ vs Gayle and Gayle hits a four first ball. Russell missed the yorker there, bowled a juicy full ball and Gayle just placed the square-drive to the left of point, didn't try to hit that hard and this outfield is quick enough
A Russell to Rahul, 1 run, short of length, worked away to deep square leg

A Russell to Rahul, FOUR, this is unfair on the bowler. He's actually surprised Rahul with extra bounce on this short of length delivery, but Rahul managed to play with an angled bat at the last moment, third man was inside the ring again and there was no protection in the deep

A Russell to Rahul, FOUR, this is the thing about classy batsmen. They have this silken touch. Rahul hardly had a real go at this length delivery, just came forward and went through with an extended forward push, but found the middle of the bat or close to it and got it wide of the man at cover

Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run, play and miss again! Wow! Bhuvi Kumar will love that! Good length ball pitching and moving away from the left-hander, Gayle had to play at it for the line, but he has no clue about the outswing on this ball, could so easily have been an edge through to DK
Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run, that's way outside off stump and Gayle obviously wont be flashing at those

Shivam Mavi to Gayle, no run, beaten first up. Chris Gayle was completely squared up and was very late to read this outswinger on a fuller length, lucky that it wasn't close to the off stump, the ball sails through to DK
Shivam Mavi to Rahul, 1 run, again shape back into the right-hander for Shivam Mavi, Rahul manages to cover the line and turn it to square leg

Shivam Mavi to Rahul, FOUR, now that's brilliant placement from Rahul. Third man up, so Rahul uses the width on offer on this good length delivery, allows the ball to come and guides it to the left of backward point and it came from the middle of the bat as well

Shivam Mavi to Rahul, FOUR, oh almost chopped on and what a good first ball that was Shivam Mavi the young Shivam Mavi. Pacy, good length, seam pretty straight and just tailing back in and it seriously tests Rahul. He wanted to go for the drive, the feet weren't fully forward, lucky that the edge escaped past the off stick. Troubled by the movement in to him on that occasion
Andrew Tye to Shubman Gill, 1 run, on a good length and on the stumps, Gill was down the track and meekly pushes it towards cover. KKR finish with 191
Andrew Tye to Chawla, 1 run, fuller length delivery outside off, drilled down towards long-off for a single
Andrew Tye to Shubman Gill, 1 run, on a good length and on the stumps, shovelled away towards long-on for a single

Andrew Tye to Chawla, 1 run, chance and Mujeeb has dropped a dolly, short and just outside off, Chawla backed away and dabbed it in the air towards short third man. Mujeeb didn't spot it early, the ball was dying in front of him, he bends down low and can't hold on. He then has a shy at the striker's end as the batsmen sneak in a single and misses, but Shubman Gill was always in
Andrew Tye to Chawla, wide, the slower ball from Tye, but it's well wide of off and called by the umpire

Andrew Tye to Tom Curran, out Caught by Rajpoot!! KKR are losing some momentum towards the end. Tye has another wicket to his name, this was a yorker length delivery outside off, Curran jammed his bat down hard, gets a thick outside edge and the ball loops to Rajpoot at short third man. Some other day, it might have gone either to his left or right, but not today. Tom Curran c Rajpoot b Andrew Tye 1(3)
Andrew Tye to Tom Curran, no run, excellent change of pace from Tye, the slower ball outside off, Curran was way too early on the slog and missed

Barinder to Tom Curran, 1 run, short of a length and angling across the right-hander, Curran was beaten for pace as he slashed, gets it high off the bat and rolls away to deep point. They think about a second run, but the fielder is quick on the ball and his throw is pretty accurate

Barinder to Karthik, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! KKR are not finishing on a high! Karthik falls after a fine cameo, this was a slower length ball from Sran, Karthik was deep in the crease as he shovelled it towards the on-side, went off the inner half of the bat and straight to Tye at deep backward square leg. He takes it reverse cupped and KXIP continue to chip away at the wickets. Karthik c Andrew Tye b Barinder 43(28) [4s-6]
Barinder to Karthik, wide, the wide yorker from Sran, but he slips it well outside the tramlines, called as a wide

Barinder to Shubman Gill, 1 run, on a good length and well outside off, driven straight to the fielder at cover, Karthik was backing up for a single and  is sent back. There's a shy at the bowler's end and the batsmen do get the single they were looking for
Barinder to Karthik, 1 run, short of a length and well wide of off, the knuckle ball from Sran, Karthik was looking to pull and mistimes it towards long-on, went to the fielder on the bounce
Barinder to Shubman Gill, 1 run, loopy slower ball on Gill's pads, he has no pace to work with and nudges it towards short fine for a single
Barinder to Karthik, 1 run, the slower ball from Sran, looks like Karthik didn't spot it, was setting himself up for a big slog - adjusts and drops it wide of point

Rajpoot to Shubman Gill, FOUR, beautifully played, too much of width on offer and Gill doesn't let it go. Prods across and crashes it square past cover, the man in the deep has no chance. 17 runs from the over, a terrible one from Rajpoot
Rajpoot to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, short of a length and well outside off, slapped away to the left of long-off for a couple of runs
Rajpoot to Shubman Gill, wide, Rajpoot is losing it in this over, high full-toss that slid down the leg-side, given as a wide
Rajpoot to Shubman Gill, wide, the slower bouncer from Rajpoot, but it's too wide of off, called by the umpire
Rajpoot to Shubman Gill, no run, much better from Rajpoot, fires in the yorker at the base of off-stump, Gill gets his bat down and digs it out
Rajpoot to Karthik, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, the slower ball from Rajpoot, Karthik guides it straight to short third man
Rajpoot to Karthik, FOUR, cheeky and four, this is excellent cricket from Karthik, fraction too short and wide of off, Karthik waits on it, opens the face of the bat and runs it past the keeper
Rajpoot to Karthik, FOUR, that's a poor start from Rajpoot, short and wide of off, Karthik waited on that, played with an open face and beat Mujeeb's dive at short third man
Barinder to Shubman Gill, FOUR, cracking shot, short and wide of off, Gill gets on top of the bounce and cuts it square past point, beat the diving fielder and raced away to the fence in a hurry

Barinder to A Russell, out Caught by Nair!! That's a big wicket for KXIP! That might turn out to be a difference of 20-30 runs. This was another yorker from Sran, he missed his length by a bit, Russell brought his bat down like a sledge-hammer and heaved it back over the bowler's head. Only the timing wasn't as great as it normally is. Good captaincy from Ashwin to have long-off fine as well, straight down the throat of Karun and KKR have lost their fifth wicket. A Russell c Nair b Barinder 10(7) [4s-2]
Barinder to A Russell, wide, short and angling down the leg-side, Russell gets his body inside the line and lets it go, called as a wide

Barinder to A Russell, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Russell, the slower short ball from Sran, but it was short and way down the leg-side, Russell swivels across and pulls it over backward square leg, couple of bounces and over the ropes

Barinder to A Russell, FOUR, easy pickings for Russell, Barinder misses the yorker by an inch, turns out to be a swinging full-toss, Russell cleared his left leg, got his bat down and punched it back past the non-striker
Barinder to Karthik, 1 run, on a good length and on the stumps, Karthik prods across and works it towards long-on for a single
Barinder to A Russell, 1 run, very full and on Russell's pads, clipped away to deep mid-wicket for a single
Andrew Tye to Karthik, no run, excellent over from Tye, just two runs and a wicket. Caps it off with another slower bouncer, Karthik was way too early on the pull and missed
Andrew Tye to A Russell, 1 run, Tye goes for the yorker and offers a low full-toss on Russell's pads, whipped away to deep mid-wicket for a single
Andrew Tye to A Russell, no run, the slower short ball outside off, Russell was looking to waft it through point and missed
Andrew Tye to A Russell, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, Russell shuffles across and defends it back at the bowler

Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Rahul!! Edged and caught! A pre-meditated slog from Lynn as he shuffled right across the stumps, Tye saw it coming and fired it wide of off, Lynn was aiming for the mid-wicket fence, gets a thick and audible edge through, KL doesn't drop those and it's a much needed wicket for KXIP. They have got rid of one dangerman, but here comes the bigger danger - it's Andre Russell. Chris Lynn c Rahul b Andrew Tye 74(41) [4s-6 6s-4]
Andrew Tye to Karthik, 1 run, slower short ball on off, Karthik waits on it and runs it down towards short third man
Ashwin to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, the carrom ball from Ashwin, but the length is way too short, allows Lynn to stay back and flap it wide of long-on, comes back for the second run

Ashwin to Chris Lynn, FOUR, dropped short and wide of off, Lynn makes room and cuts it square past point. Sran has a lot of distance to cover, he slides and pulls the ball back in. The third umpire has several looks and reckons that his boot was touching the ropes as he pushed it back into play, given as a boundary
Ashwin to Karthik, 1 run, the off-break on off, Karthik prods forward and gets an inside edge past mid-wicket, just a single
Ashwin to Chris Lynn, 1 run, the leg-break from Ashwin, his first of the day, punched down towards long-off for a single
Ashwin to Karthik, 1 run, flighted wide of off, Karthik reaches out and drives it to long-off for a single
Ashwin to Karthik, no run, Ashwin drops one short and wide of off, cracked straight to the fielder at point
Ashwin to Karthik, wide, Ashwin tosses this one wide of off and it's called by the umpire. Tough for a bowler in T20 cricket
Mujeeb to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, slower and wider of off, Lynn went hard on the drive once again and mistimed it wide of long-off, that actually allowed the batsmen to come back for the second run
Mujeeb to Chris Lynn, no run, Rahman drifts this one on Lynn's pads, he was looking to pulverise it over square leg, went too hard and gets beaten
Mujeeb to Karthik, 1 run, fraction short and wide of off, chopped to the right of point where Ashwin makes a tumbling stop, saved three runs for his team
Mujeeb to Chris Lynn, 1 run, the wrong 'un from Rahman, Lynn spotted it late and then dabbed it towards short third man. An overeager Rajpoot rushed forward and fumbled, allows a single
Mujeeb to Karthik, 1 run, tossed up just outside off, Karthik prods half-forward and drives it down to long-off

Mujeeb to Karthik, FOUR, the boundaries are flowing for KKR, fraction short and sliding down the leg-side, Karthik went half-way down and pulled it behind square on the on-side, the man in the deep was square and has no chance

Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, chance and Sran has dropped it. He did all the hard work, ran across to his left from deep cover, got both hands as he slid across, but fails to hold on. A life for Lynn, how costly will it prove to be? This was short of a good length and well outside off, Lynn threw his hands at that and carved it over cover, no real timing on the shot and it should have been gobbled up
Andrew Tye to Karthik, 1 run, back of a length and well outside off, Karthik waits on it, gets on top of the bounce and dabs it behind square on the off-side for a single
Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, 1 run, the slower short bouncer from Tye, Lynn reaches out and mistimes the slap towards backward point
Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, FOUR, cracking shot, Tye is running out of ideas, back of a length and well wide of off, Lynn gets on top of the bounce and clatters it over cover-point

Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, SIX, smashed, length delivery and Lynn is all over it like a rash. Lynn was waiting on it, plays with the angle and sends it high and deep into the stands at long-on, 103 m hit - the second longest of IPL 2018
Andrew Tye to Karthik, 1 run, on a good length and on the stumps, worked away towards long-on for a single

Yuvraj to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, 4th IPL half-century for Lynn, he gets a big applause from the crowd, the dug out seem relaxed as well. This was pushed through flatter and quicker, Lynn had to reach out as he hacked it wide of long-off, hurries back for the second run
Yuvraj to Karthik, 1 run, pushed through well outside off, Karthik backs away and finds deep cover for a single
Yuvraj to Chris Lynn, 1 run, Yuvraj drops this one shorter and wider of off, flat and hard, but straight to the fielder at long-off, just a single for Lynn
Yuvraj to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that's powerfully struck! Yuvraj dropped this one short and just outside off, Lynn backs away and bludgeons past the bowler, the fielder at long-off had no chance
Yuvraj to Karthik, 1 run, very full and wide of off, driven towards deep cover for a single
Yuvraj to Karthik, FOUR, cheeky and four, slower and wider of off, Karthik waits on it, opens the face of the bat at the last moment and runs it past short third man, no need to run for those
Ashwin to Karthik, 1 run, 13 from the over, slower and just outside off, eased down towards long-off for a single
Ashwin to Karthik, 2 runs, this is superb running from Karthik, drops a well flighted delivery in front of square on the on-side and hurried back for the second run
Ashwin to Karthik, 2 runs, slower and on the stumps, nudged away past square leg and Karthik scampers back for the second run

Ashwin to Karthik, FOUR, lovely, has to be the shot of the day so far. Even Ashwin looks perplexed, this was tossed up nicely outside off, Karthik leant forward, played with the turn and drove it wide of mid-wicket, split the two men in the deep to perfection

Ashwin to Karthik, FOUR, nicely played by DK, this was flighted well outside off, Karthik went down low, rolled his wrists over and slog sweeps it past mid-wicket, beats the fielder getting across from deep mid-wicket
Ashwin to Karthik, no run, tossed up just outside off, Karthik gets half-forward and defends it towards the off-side
Mujeeb to Karthik, 1 run, keeps it short again, Karthik punches it away to sweeper cover
Mujeeb to Karthik, no run, tossed up just outside off, defended

Mujeeb to Nitish Rana, out Nitish Rana Run Out!! Oh, what happened there? KKR have gifted a wicket away to the visitors. Hare-brained running from the duo. Complete break in communication results in a run-out. Flatter outside off, Rana went back and laced the cut to backward point. Rana set off without even looking at his partner. Lynn wasn't interested and sends him back. Both were ball-watching and Rana had no chance of returning there. Rajpoot gathers it and fires a neat throw to the keeper, who does the rest. Rana, the man in form for KKR has to depart. Punjab clawing back here. Nitish Rana run out (Rajpoot/Rahul) 3(5)
Mujeeb to Nitish Rana, no run, quick and straighter, Rana is on the front foot to block it
Mujeeb to Chris Lynn, 1 run, touch outside off, Lynn stays back and pats it away to long-on
Mujeeb to Nitish Rana, 1 run, floated outside off, Rana fetches the sweep from there and sends it away to deep square leg
Ashwin to Chris Lynn, no run, the carrom ball from Ashwin, holds up on the deck and was breaking away. Lynn closed the bat face early to nurdle it to leg. Skews a soft leading edge down the pitch
Ashwin to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slider on leg, clipped through square leg
Ashwin to Chris Lynn, 1 run, milks a single to long-on now
Ashwin to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, rifled quick on middle and leg, Lynn puts it into the gap at mid-wicket and gets back for the second with ease
Ashwin to Nitish Rana, 1 run, Rana is away with a staby push to long-off

Ashwin to Uthappa, out Caught by Nair!! Straight down the gullet of Nair. The time-out has broken Uthappa's concentration. Was looking so good and has thrown it away. Flat and shorter from Ashwin, Uthappa rocked back and hammered it off the sweet spot. Hit it flat and didn't have enough wings to clear the ropes. Nair didn't have to move an inch at deep mid-wicket as he cupped it. Eden Gardens has been muted. The half-trackers working well for the spinners throughout this tournament so far. Uthappa c Nair b Ashwin 34(23) [4s-5 6s-1]
Barinder to Chris Lynn, SIX, 23 runs to cap off the over. Back of the hand slower ball goes awry for Sran. Lynn bent low to free his arms and launched this over deep square leg once again
Barinder to Chris Lynn, no run, Sran shortens his length, looked like the slower ball outside off. Lynn quells it to point

Barinder to Chris Lynn, SIX, woah! Has he launched this one into the moon or what? What a shot. 97-metre hit. Length ball in the slot for Lynn, Lynn set himself and whacked it with ferocity, behind square on the leg-side and into the crowd

Barinder to Chris Lynn, FOUR, brute force from Lynn. Such quicksilver hands. Was a decent delivery as Sran saw Lynn back away to leg and fired it wider of off. But the Australian threw the kitchen sink and managed to stroke it over extra cover
Barinder to Uthappa, 1 run, goes back to opening his bat face to glide this back of a length delivery outside off away to third man

Barinder to Uthappa, SIX, bosh! Shot. Never bowl short to Uthappa, Sran finds out why. Short ball aimed at the torso, Uthappa was ready for it. Picked the bones out of it and muscled it way back into the deep square leg stands
Ashwin to Uthappa, 1 run, quicker again, skidded through the deck. Uthappa went back and played it a little late. Directs it to deep square leg
Ashwin to Uthappa, no run, carrom ball from Ashwin, Uthappa had no clue as he closed his bat face early. Nearly popped a leading edge back to the bowler, just about drops short of Ashwin
Ashwin to Chris Lynn, 1 run, Ashwin continues to stray on leg, whisked off the pads to deep square leg
Ashwin to Uthappa, 1 run, these two are milking singles now. Another one nudged into the mid-wicket region
Ashwin to Chris Lynn, 1 run, quicker on middle, Lynn works it along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Ashwin to Uthappa, 1 run, 88kph, armer on leg-stump line. Uthappa goes back and tickles it through square leg
Andrew Tye to Uthappa, 1 run, shortish outside off, Uthappa uses the pace on offer and dinks it away to third man to bring KKR's fifty

Andrew Tye to Uthappa, FOUR, this was out of the top draw. The slower delivery from Tye, on a short of length around middle and leg. Knuckle ball to be precise. Uthappa picked it early, with a roundhouse and helped it over short fine leg. Easy-peasy
Andrew Tye to Uthappa, no run, bosh! Crunching sound of the willow as Uthappa spanks it hard, can't beat extra cover
Andrew Tye to Uthappa, no run, pitched up around off, Uthappa stomps on the front foot and drives, Tye with his big fingers stops it in his followthrough
Andrew Tye to Uthappa, no run, short of length outside off, climbs off and beats Uthappa's attempted steer to third man
Andrew Tye to Chris Lynn, 1 run, harpoons in a yorker, excellent. Lynn was backing away, went hard and could only manage to blast it to long-on. All along the ground

Andrew Tye to Uthappa, no ball, 1 run, inauspicious start for Tye, begins with a no-ball. But wait! This is a harsh call by the ump. Some part of his heel was behind the line definitely. Comedy of errors as they have seen it on the big screen and perhaps seeking a review for it. Nothing doing. A free-hit coming up for Lynn. Coming to this ball, it was a full ball at the stumps, Uthappa pushed it with a full face of the bat to long-on
Barinder to Chris Lynn, no run, more wider lines, forces Lynn to reach for it. The batsman throws his bat and guides it with a horizontal slash to point
Barinder to Chris Lynn, no run, dupes Lynn with a back of the hand slower ball. Angled it wide of off, Lynn swung blindly but the ball was in a different zip code

Barinder to Chris Lynn, no run, knocked off Lynn's head, almost. Rip-roaring short ball, took off from a length and Lynn had to take his head out of the way as it sniffed past his helmet. Good collection from KL Rahul

Barinder to Chris Lynn, FOUR, the slower version of Sran's slower ball, Lynn didn't read it as he was early into the shot. But got it off the meat as he went for the pull and sent it behind square on the leg-side. No-one there and he'll collect a boundary
Barinder to Chris Lynn, no run, switches his line to outside off, Lynn creams the drive, but extra cover intercepts it
Barinder to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, off-pace delivery to start off with from Sran, extracts some bounce and Lynn tucks it towards deep square leg. Runs hard and hares back for the second
Mujeeb to Chris Lynn, 1 run, flat, short and at the stumps, Lynn whisks it through mid-wicket. Expensive over for KXIP
Mujeeb to Uthappa, 1 run, better. Straighter lines, Uthappa wrists it through square leg
Mujeeb to Uthappa, wide, dodgy from Rahman. Another tripe down leg, this time wided

Mujeeb to Uthappa, FOUR, this was more streaky and Uthappa won't mind. Hat-trick of fours. Quick and skidded through, Uthappa was stuck on the back foot, looked to work it to the leg-side. Ends up squirting it more off the inner half and it eludes short fine leg, who's chase is vain in the end

Mujeeb to Uthappa, FOUR, two fours in a row for Uthappa. Sliding down leg as Rahman corrects his line. Uthappa drags the sweep, more of the bottom. But it beats short fine leg and races away to the fence

Mujeeb to Uthappa, FOUR, adventure from Uthappa. Deals another flatter ball by bringing out the reverse sweep. Picked the length early and broomed it away to the third man fence. Key was he rolled his wrists there
Mujeeb to Uthappa, no run, 83kph, seemed like the carrom ball that zipped across the deck. Uthappa casually pressed forward and plays down the wrong line. Is hit on the pad, heading down leg

Rajpoot to Chris Lynn, SIX, third short ball in a row and Lynn punishes it with ease. No venom on this occasion, Lynn gets under it and hacked it comfortably into the fine leg stands. First maximum of the innings

Rajpoot to Uthappa, 1 run, another short ball and this time Uthappa takes it head-on, doesn't time it as he would've liked. Was late into the shot and gets it off the top-half of the bat. Dies in no-man's land in the mid-wicket area
Rajpoot to Uthappa, no run, bangs it short, gets steep bounce and Uthappa takes evasive action by ducking under it
Rajpoot to Uthappa, no run, beaten soundly. Full and seamed away a fraction, Uthappa couldn't combat the away swing as he went for a drive. The ball moved away a fraction and beats him
Rajpoot to Uthappa, no run, steered with an open bat face to point

Rajpoot to Uthappa, FOUR, edged but just eludes Gayle's outstretched right-hand. Rajpoot gains trampoline bounce outside off with this back of a length delivery, Uthappa pokes with hard hands and outside-edges it towards Gayle, who was at a widish slip. Gingerly stretched his right hand but it escaped away to the fence
Mujeeb to Chris Lynn, no run, slanting on middle, Lynn abandons violence and defends it with a straight bat down the pitch
Mujeeb to Chris Lynn, FOUR, loosener from Rahman and Lynn puts it away with ease. Stand and deliver stuff. Short, wide and outside off, Lynn says thank you very much and bashes it through cover
Mujeeb to Chris Lynn, no run, crunched hard, straight to extra cover

Mujeeb to Narine, out Caught by Nair!! No Narine show today. Falls cheaply and it's the youngster from Afghanistan, who has struck in his first over. Full credit to Ashwin, perfectly set a trap and Narine has fallen into it. It was the googly from Rahman, Narine cleared his front leg and whacked across the line, forgets there is a fielder in the deep. Nair nearly made a hash of it as he misjudged it initially. Recovers in time by diving head first at deep mid-wicket and pouched it superbly. Narine c Nair b Mujeeb 1(4)
Mujeeb to Narine, no run, little quick and wide of off, Narine throws his bat and laces the cut, finds point
Mujeeb to Chris Lynn, 1 run, skiddy flatter delivery outside off, Lynn punches it away to mid-off
Rajpoot to Chris Lynn, 1 run, attacks the stumps and giving no room for Lynn to free his arms. A gentle wristy nudge to mid-on and Lynn will keep the strike. Good start for Rajpoot

Rajpoot to Chris Lynn, no run, play and a miss. Sliver of away movement for Rajpoot, goes a touch fuller and draws Lynn into a flashy drive. Lynn goes hard without much feet movement and is beaten on the outside edge

Rajpoot to Narine, leg byes, 1 run, 141kph, pacy fuller length delivery angling down leg. Strikes Narine on the pad as he misses the flick. But he will get the leg-bye though as it rolls to the vacant mid-wicket region
Rajpoot to Chris Lynn, 1 run, short of length and at the body, Lynn hops across and softens his grip to tickle it through square leg
Rajpoot to Narine, 1 run, drifts it a bit on leg-stump line, lucky to get away with that. Narine moves across and tucks it neatly to fine leg

Rajpoot to Chris Lynn, 1 run, runs in amid a deafening noise and keeps it on a length just outside off. Not much of a movement and Lynn with a little hesitant push from the crease through point to get the scorecard ticking
Boult to de Villiers, FOUR, it's it. Lays into a half volley, screeching it through the covers, beating the leather off it. And RCB begin their move up
Boult to de Villiers, FOUR, beautifully played, fraction short and just outside off, AB arches back and then ramps over third man, couple of bounces and over the ropes
Boult to Mandeep, 1 run, on the pads, flicked away past square leg
Boult to de Villiers, 1 run, doesn't quite get up and hence a mistime on the cut, wide of cover-point and AB sneaks in a single
Boult to Mandeep, 1 run, 135.1kph, soft tap into the covers. Into single digits ..
Boult to Mandeep, 2 runs, 134.3kph. Full toss again. Knocked straight back, and the lack of legs mean the second
Chris Morris to Mandeep, 1 run, loopy slow full toss on middle. Turns it in front of square

Chris Morris to Mandeep, FOUR, blame Mandeep for stealing AB's century. A fullish length and he throws every ounce of his muscle to cart it straight down. Roy chases, dives, and has probably cut himself on the rope. Yeah, none of it could stop the boundary though
Chris Morris to Mandeep, no run, tight on the sticks. Ahh, a defensive push, you've been missed
Chris Morris to de Villiers, 1 run, 129.3kph, dipping full toss, taking AB by surprise, can still pinch the single, with a tickle down to fine leg
Chris Morris to Mandeep, 1 run, to third man, 129.2kph, on the hop, riding the bounce to stab it to third man. 18 off 22. AB needs 20
Chris Morris to Mandeep, wide, tries a cutter drifting down leg. Mandeep can't connect with his flick

Chris Morris to Mandeep, SIX, these massive bats. So Mandeep's done in with the lack of pace, he swings across the line, gets the back of the bat. And it finds a way to fly high and into the fence behind the keeper
Boult to Mandeep, 1 run, tummy-lined. A delicate run down to third man

Boult to Corey Anderson, out Bowled!! Another twist. That ideal ball in the times of misery. Full, straight, bang in the blockhole. Anderson backs away, gives himself some room to go downtown. Misses. Big time. And the ball sneaks under to make a mess of the timber. And they take the time-out. The only strategy RCb need now is to find ways of giving AB his strike. And his century. Corey Anderson b Boult 15(13) [6s-1]

Boult to de Villiers, 1 run, oh the running. And this drama script has some comedy mid-way. Okay so AB pokes it to point, he takes off for the single, Anderson kindly responds. But with the ball going straight to Gambhir, both of them freeze, run wrong ways after almost having made it in. And Corey decides to surrender .. true friend like. Never mind, the throw's wild, Boult's dive too can't get a hand to it
Boult to Corey Anderson, 1 run, leg full toss. Whipped away to long-on
Boult to Corey Anderson, no run, nails the wide yorker. Everything right for a change. Anderson can't stretch enough
Boult to Corey Anderson, SIX, nobody's getting it right. Boult returns with a full toss, nice and high, and Anderson's reversing roles. Smokes it into cow corner
Chris Morris to Corey Anderson, 1 run, full toss, politely steered to point, who's right at the edge. And they take the single
Chris Morris to de Villiers, 1 run, tucks him up with the bumper. On the ribs and pulled away. Ugly. One-handed. Ballooning up, but in no man's land in mid-wicket. It's his day
Chris Morris to de Villiers, wide, tries going round the wicket. Tries going short. A sign of relief. Turns. Spots the umpire's hands stretched. Who's game is this
Chris Morris to de Villiers, FOUR, the carnage. Morris loses it down leg, the last hit has mentally scarred him. And is mowed away, fine

Chris Morris to de Villiers, SIX, the second tier tonks have become boring. So AB goes into the third. Once that front leg goes out of the way, it's always into the orbit. And then the ball's on the meaty length too. Whacked, straight down
Chris Morris to de Villiers, no run, hurries him in with the cramper. Off the sticker to short fine
Chris Morris to Corey Anderson, 1 run, stays beisde the line, opens up the bat face. Square
Rahul Tewatia to Corey Anderson, 1 run, wrong 'un. Short enough for Anderson to read and jab it in front of square
Rahul Tewatia to de Villiers, 1 run, sets up for the across the line mow again, but it's wide now. And damn quick. Adjusts to slap it to a wide long-off

Rahul Tewatia to de Villiers, SIX, spectator down - into her jaw. Now who's missing Gayle when AB can break jaws as well. Back on a knee, under the swinging tonk, and into the second tier at cow corner
Rahul Tewatia to Corey Anderson, 1 run, 86.5kph, too straight. Tickled away round the corner. And he's doing his job perfectly
Rahul Tewatia to de Villiers, 1 run, angry hands, chasing the width, but finds the man in the deep at sweeper
Rahul Tewatia to Corey Anderson, 1 run, wide tease, carved away through sweeper. He wants to watch the show
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, SIX, there's his arc. You genius. Reads the fuller sucker that's to follow, sits, shuffles and it's behind square. In less than a second. Oh the nerve!
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, no run, 130.3kph of a bouncer. AB tries arching back to upper cut it of sorts. Beaten on pace. Now, now
Harshal Patel to Corey Anderson, 1 run, 122.2kph, Anderson takes a cue, goes swinging. But he's no AB, he can get edges. Fat outside one this time, on the bounce to third man
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, 1 run, nails it in the blockhole. AB has to make his peace with a squeeze down the track

Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, gets well across, wanting to go over mid-wicket. And typically changes his mind, like only he can. Ruins a wide yorker, slicing it through extra cover all of a sudden. Just sublime. And yes, a fifty .. he's killing the contest
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, SIX, continues his fun tirade. Keeps getting nothings on the pads, sitting up to be smacked. Obliged. Fiercely swatting into deep mid-wicket
Rahul Tewatia to de Villiers, 1 run, low crouch, creaming it through the covers
Rahul Tewatia to Corey Anderson, 1 run, dragged down. Corey on it hard, and it's that man Boult again, diving at cow corner to cut it off
Rahul Tewatia to Corey Anderson, no run, bites, turns, spits. Oh it's a minefield all of a sudden. Somehow avoids kissing the poky-glove
Rahul Tewatia to de Villiers, 1 run, very full, almost a squeeze out down to long-on
Rahul Tewatia to Corey Anderson, 1 run, moves back, for a mistimed slap of sorts. Long-off again
Rahul Tewatia to de Villiers, 1 run, a dig-out-drive down to long-off

Harshal Patel to Kohli, out Caught by Boult!! Just the worst of full tosses. No forget that. It's never going to be remembered. Boult has clinched that 10 lakh cheque for the end of the season. It's a catch for the ages. A viral catch. So Kohli quite obviously whips the innocuous, without bothering to keep it down. Over square leg. Boult comes out of nowhere, sticks his right hand up. And it sticks. With him eventually falling in a millimeter in front of the FBB prismic sponsor on the rope. Nobody can seem to believe. Yeah, muggles, it's true. Kohli c Boult b Harshal Patel 30(26) [4s-2 6s-1]
Harshal Patel to Kohli, 2 runs, slower-short. Sits up for Kohli to go into some wierdly effective forehand, only into the widely vacant mid-on. And they still pinch the second
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, 1 run, width outside off. Stabbed square, and even that has wrists on use
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, 2 runs, nipping back in off a length. Yet again on the pads, and this time a neat wrist round the corner. Oh and they almost collide while on the second
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, 137kph on the pads. And it doesn't even pitch. Oh my. de Villiers's swipes, heaving it into square leg, flat
Harshal Patel to Kohli, 1 run, a nice pitch up on middle. Kohli gets his front leg out, stroking it down to long-off
Rahul Tewatia to Kohli, 1 run, slightly had to reach out for this pull shot, drags it through square leg
Rahul Tewatia to de Villiers, 1 run, flicks it through mid-wicket
Rahul Tewatia to de Villiers, no run, defended into the off-side

Rahul Tewatia to de Villiers, SIX, smashes the roof of Chinnaswamy! Rank long-hop from Tewatia, just the ball which got rid of Kohli and de Villiers in their previous home game. But de Villiers is having none of that today. Rocks back and hoists it away over mid-wicket
Rahul Tewatia to Kohli, 1 run, flat one on the pads, Kohli flicks it away to square leg for a run
Rahul Tewatia to de Villiers, 1 run, eases the tossed up delivery down to long-on, just a sighter
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, 1 run, full toss on middle stump, de Villiers whips it to deep mid-wicket
Harshal Patel to Kohli, 1 run, short ball outside off, flat-batted down to long-on
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, leg byes, 1 run, speared in full on leg, 137kph, de Villiers falls over on the flick and it deflects off his pad towards backward point
Harshal Patel to Kohli, 1 run, slower back of length ball outside off, dabbed to short third man
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, 1 run, hangs back to a wide length ball and carves it through point
Harshal Patel to Kohli, 1 run, walks down to this back of length delivery and clips it through mid-wicket
Chris Morris to Kohli, 1 run, yorker length ball at the stumps, squeezed away through mid-wicket

Chris Morris to de Villiers, 1 run, deceives de Villiers with the dipping full toss, and the leading edge balloons back over his head. De Villiers wanted to flicked it through mid-wicket, but got done in by the lack of pace
Chris Morris to Kohli, 1 run, short of length delivery on off, 136kph, pulled off the front foot to deep mid-wicket
Chris Morris to de Villiers, 1 run, short ball, de Villiers doesn't get hold of the pull and mistimes it to deep mid-wicket
Chris Morris to Kohli, 1 run, nudges a single through mid-wicket this time
Chris Morris to Kohli, FOUR, now Kohli joins in the fun. Not great from Morris actually. Can't feed him on the pads with a length ball, gets flicked away in a flash to the boundary

Nadeem to de Villiers, FOUR, hat-trick of fours! Nadeem is clueless against AB at the moment. He tosses this up wide - the best thing he can think off - but AB still walks across and powers the sweep through square leg. Crowd going wild

Nadeem to de Villiers, FOUR, my word, how's this gone for four! Crazy. Unbelievable power with the bottom hand. He seemed to be cramped on the back foot but is somehow able to whip it between long-on and deep mid-wicket
Nadeem to de Villiers, FOUR, swept away for four. De Villiers has started off brilliantly. Nadeem lands it on a length for him and is dispatched
Nadeem to Kohli, 1 run, punched away for a single through the covers. Nadeem keeping it flat on a back of length
Nadeem to Kohli, no run, wants to dab it fine, and gets it very very fine. Pant - the keeper - lunges out with his right leg and is able to stop it with the thigh
Nadeem to de Villiers, 1 run, arm-ball on middle, de Villiers goes back in the crease to work it round the corner
Chris Morris to Kohli, no run, spelled out his charge for the bowler, came too early. Morris bumps it in and beats Kohli on the upper-cut
Chris Morris to Kohli, no run, flicked to mid-wicket

Chris Morris to Kohli, SIX, just over the fielder. Length ball around off, Kohli whips it away and he had the whole of Chinnaswamy concerned for a bit. But they shouldn't have been. Not with those wrists
Chris Morris to Kohli, no run, banged in short, Kohli sways away and sits underneath it
Chris Morris to Kohli, no run, uncertain poke from Kohli away from the body. It's been a nervous start from the skipper. Length ball outside off, holds its line and wasn't far from kissing the edge
Chris Morris to Kohli, no run, good length ball just outside off, defensively pushed into the off-side

Nadeem to de Villiers, FOUR, now clears his front leg and lofts it inside-out over the covers. The off-side field is up and Nadeem has bowled to his field by drifting it in on middle, but AB is just too good
Nadeem to de Villiers, FOUR, there he goes. De Villiers is underway. Walks across the stumps, gets down low and wallops the sweep through square leg
Nadeem to de Villiers, no run, chopped into the off-sidee

Nadeem to Kohli, out de Kock Run Out!! De Kock is gone by a mile. Dreadful running. There's a tremendous mix-up between the two batsmen and de Kock ends up around halfway down the pitch before the bails are taken off. The ball was patted towards backward point, Kohli started running, stuttered to look at his partner, and then ran through. But de Kock never really took off. de Kock run out (Vijay Shankar/Pant) 18(16) [4s-1 6s-1]

Nadeem to Kohli, FOUR, massive moment in the game. Tentative defence from Kohli, the ball turns away from him to take the edge which goes between keeper and slip. Was Morris standing too wide? He barely had time to move before it went through. Nadeem doesn't know what to do
Nadeem to de Kock, 1 run, flat, turning in at the stumps, de Kock works it through mid-wicket
Maxwell to de Kock, 1 run, gets too close to the ball after using his feet, jams it wide of mid-on
Maxwell to de Kock, no run, not much intent with this cut shot, plays it to point

Maxwell to de Kock, SIX, swept all the way over short fine. Shuffled across slightly to get inside the line of this off-break, Maxwell drifted it in on leg to aid the batsman further, and gets swatted into the stands with a powerful sweep shot
Maxwell to Kohli, 1 run, floated up on off, flicked to deep mid-wicket
Maxwell to de Kock, 1 run, shimmies out but Maxwell pulls the length back to stop him from getting to the pitch. Defended into the off-side
Maxwell to de Kock, no run, hangs back to a length ball turning away from him, Maxwell almost squared him up with his round the wicket angle. De Kock is able to adjust to defend towards point
Boult to de Kock, 1 run, back of a length delivery on middle and leg, bunted in front of mid-on for one
Boult to Kohli, 1 run, nudged into the mid-wicket region
Boult to de Kock, 1 run, they've cordoned off de Kock's strong zones. Fielder back at deep cover and deep mid-wicket. This one's full at the pads, flicked away stylishly to deep mid-wicket
Boult to Kohli, 1 run, short of length delivery bending back in on off, Kohli dabs it down to third man
Boult to de Kock, 1 run, short of length delivery wide of off, cracked away to sweeper cover
Boult to Kohli, 1 run, looks to drive through the covers but gets an inside edge onto pad, dribbles away in front of point. His shot was foiled due to Boult's inswing

Maxwell to Vohra, out Caught by Roy!! Roy almost makes a mess of this at long leg, but he's recovered fantastically to take a superb low catch diving forward. They've referred it upstairs, but there's nothing wrong with it. Clean catch. His fingers are underneath it. The Englishman initially misjudged this top-edged sweep from Vohra, stalled in his position when he should have been moving forward. But makes up with a dive. Vohra c Roy b Maxwell 2(5)
