Maxwell to Vohra, no run, pushed through on middle and leg, glanced to backward square leg. Gets away with this does Maxwell
Maxwell to Vohra, wide, turning down the leg-side, wided
Maxwell to Vohra, no run, defended into the on-side
Maxwell to Vohra, 2 runs, flat on leg stump, whipped away backward of square for Vohra. He gets it past backward square leg who probably should have stopped it
Maxwell to de Kock, 1 run, length ball on off, turns away a touch. De Kock defends in front of backward point and calls for a quick single
Maxwell to de Kock, no run, drops it short and wide, lucky to get away. De Kock tamely cuts to point

Boult to Vohra, no run, beautiful inswinger to Vohra first up, just the ball he looks for against the right-hander. He plays across the line of it and is smashed on the front pad. The only thing which isn't ideal for the leg-before appeal is the line, which is leg-sidish. Boult's shout is turned down
Boult to de Kock, 1 run, full ball angling in on middle and leg, works it to the left of mid-on
Boult to de Kock, no run, back of a length delivery slanted into middle and leg, cramps de Kock up and he gets a thick inside edge onto thigh pad

Boult to de Kock, FOUR, that's sweet from de Kock. Exquisite timing. Good length ball curling away from off, de Kock caresses it on the up through the covers. Just had to find the gap there, races away on this outfield
Boult to de Kock, no run, length ball curving away from off, confident stride forward from de Kock to push to mid-off
Boult to de Kock, no run, pitches it right up on off, looking for swing. There's just a little bit of curl away from de Kock who jams it back down the pitch

Corey Anderson to Rahul Tewatia, no run, dot to end. Anderson leaks only 11 runs off the last over. Much better from him. It was the wide yorker and Tewatia can't lay bat on that, they also don't try to risk a bye. Should have gone for it

Corey Anderson to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, premeditation from Tewatia. Walked across his stumps even before Anderson bowled the ball, it was outside off and he still managed to lap it over short fine. Umesh gives chase and can only escort it to the fence

Corey Anderson to Pant, out Caught by de Villiers!! AB clings on to the skier and a fine knock comes to an end. He has put his team in the ascendancy here. The cross seamer from Anderson, seemed to have held up on the surface, Pant went for the loft back over the bowler, skewed it off the base of the bat to long-on. AB ain't dropping those. Tewatia also pats his partner on the back as he walks off. Pant c de Villiers b Corey Anderson 85(48) [4s-6 6s-7]

Corey Anderson to Pant, no run, why? Anderson fires in a wide yorker, keeps it just inside the tramline and beats Pant's attempted reverse scoop, he would have been better off hammering it straight back over the bowler

Corey Anderson to Pant, SIX, smoked! Pant is smashing them to all parts. Small shimmy to convert it into a length delivery, once he did that the rest was easy, went through with the shot and pummeled it over long-on for half a dozen
Corey Anderson to Rahul Tewatia, leg byes, 1 run, fired in and Tewatia misses the heave, off the pad and into the off-side to get Pant back on strike

Woakes to Pant, FOUR, another costly death over for RCB, 18 off it. The off-pace short of length delivery, Pant spotted it early, shuffled across to get inside the line and pulled it over short fine, once it cleared the fielder there was no stopping that

Woakes to Pant, FOUR, geez! AB would be proud of that shot. The reverse scoop. Yes, he has played a reverse scoop off a fast bowler. Woakes went full and wide outside off, Pant kept his balance and spooned it over short third man. Even Kohli seemed impressed with that shot

Woakes to Pant, leg byes, FOUR, does not matter how they come as long as the runs keep coming for DD. The back of a length delivery on middle and leg, Pant swivels to play the pull, misses and the ball lobs off thigh pad over de Kock

Woakes to Pant, no run, now the wide yorker, just aim for more that, does Woakes. Fired it outside off and Pant bends down to squeeze it out, misses it by a fair margin. Two dots after conceding a six

Woakes to Pant, no run, shortens the length and keeps it around off, Pant flashes hard and fails to make contact. The extra bit of bounce did him in there, could not get on top of the ball to play the cut

Woakes to Pant, SIX, raining sixes at the moment. Good length ball outside off, Pant had the space to work with and he accepted the width gleefully, smashed the inside out loft over extra cover for a maximum
Siraj to Pant, 1 run, full and on the stumps, Pant whips it with plenty of bottom hand to deep mid-wicket, on the bounce to Woakes

Siraj to Pant, SIX, wow! What power. It was the slower delivery and Pant had to manufacture all the power, he waited and waited before standing tall and smoking it over long-off, cleared the rope comfortably as well

Siraj to Pant, no run, now the bouncer. He is mixing them up nicely. But still has two balls to go. It was right on the stumps, Pant arched back and swayed away from the line. After letting it go he practices the ramp over the keeper
Siraj to Pant, wide, change of pace and whenever he has tried that, Siraj has slipped it outside off, Pant tries to swing it off his feet but is unable to reach it, umpire Gaffaney stretches his arms
Siraj to Pant, no run, very full and around off, Pant drills it straight back to Siraj, who stops it in his followthrough. More deliveries in that area

Siraj to Pant, SIX, flat six! That was just a flick of the wrists and Woakes had no chance. Siraj missed the yorker and the low full toss was right in the arc for Pant, who crouched a bit and whipped it over deep square leg
Siraj to Rahul Tewatia, leg byes, 1 run, low full toss and Tewatia is beaten for pace, the ball strikes the front pad and bobbles away backward of square leg, that was a pacy delivery

Woakes to Pant, FOUR, fifty for Pant. Mighty fine innings from the youngster. But with three overs to go he needs to keep going. Short of length delivery and Pant was early into his swivel-pull, off the toe-end and past the man at 45

Woakes to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, off-pace delivery and Tewatia drills the drive uppishly to extra cover. Siraj was moved there after the previous boundary and the ball follows him. Lands just in front of him and he does well to stop it by getting his body behind. Kohli runs up from mid-off and pats Siraj on the back

Woakes to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, just over. A mistimed shot that clears the backtracking mid-off fielder. Slanted across off, Tewatia made a bit of room and sliced the drive over Siraj, who put in a desperate dive and still couldn't get there
Woakes to Rahul Tewatia, no run, shortens the length and keeps it on the stumps, Tewatia knocks it to cover and sends an eager Pant back
Woakes to Rahul Tewatia, no run, similar sort of delivery to the previous, tad closer and Tewatia is beaten on the drive, he went with hard hands and missed the outside edge by an centimeter or so

Woakes to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, edged and four. Third man is square and Tewatia got it fine enough to beat him. Just a good length delivery angled across the left-hander, Tewatia went hard on the drive and the outside edge went away quickly to the fence
Chahal to Pant, no run, stifled appeal for LBW. Umpire Gaffaney is not interested. The googly pitched outside leg and turned, Pant sat down to play the slog sweep, missed and is struck on the pad

Chahal to Pant, SIX, back to back sixes and this was superb. The reverse sweep that goes all the way. Chahal pushed it through after being hit over his head, Pant spotted that and used his pace to broom him away over the third man fence

Chahal to Pant, SIX, fabulous shot! It was the wrong 'un and Pant seemed to have picked it from the hand, didn't try to go across the line, went straight and the boy packs a punch, cleared long-off with ease

Chahal to Maxwell, out Caught by Siraj!! Chahal has his bunny. He has made it a habit of removing the Aussie. Had the better of him during the ODI and T20 leg in 2017. Now also was held back by Kohli specifically for this. Flighted leg-break on off and middle, Maxwell tries the fancy reverse sweep and is undone by the extra bounce, the top-edge balloons towards short third man, Siraj runs to his right, dives full length and manages to cling on. Maxwell c Siraj b Chahal 4(6)
Chahal to Pant, 1 run, flatter in trajectory and Pant is happy with a knock down to long-off
Chahal to Maxwell, 1 run, flatter and quicker, Maxwell nudges it to deep mid-wicket

Siraj to Pant, no run, Siraj appeals for LBW. But that ball had clearly pitched outside leg. Pant winds up for a big mow by clearing his front leg, was beaten for pace as he missed the heave to the leg-side, pinged on the back thigh where there is no protection. He is down on the ground grimacing in pain. Meanwhile, RCB take the review and waste it. Not sure who prompted them to challenge the decision as it had pitched miles outside leg. Nonetheless, the good thing for DD is Pant is back on his feet and is ready to resume..
Siraj to Pant, no run, low full toss and it was pacy, Pant wanted to flick but was late on the shot, the bat turned on impact and the shot lacked power, straight to Anderson at mid-wicket
Siraj to Pant, wide, slower delivery goes wrong, slips it well outside off, Pant thought about going after it but restrained himself, wide called
Siraj to Maxwell, 1 run, once more it is the short of length from Siraj, Maxwell pulls without much conviction to long-on
Siraj to Maxwell, no run, keeps it on the shorter side and close to Maxwell, blocked to cover

Siraj to Maxwell, 2 runs, back of a length angled in, Maxwell with cemented feet blocks it near his feet, the backspin on the ball takes it past the stumps and Pant calls him through, de Kock fires a direct hit at the bowler's end but Maxwell was safe. That take an extra run from the deflection
Siraj to Pant, 1 run, full and on the stumps, whipped with plenty of bottom hand towards deep mid-wicket, just a single

Washington Sundar to Maxwell, no run, quicker delivery, bowled at 102kph, Maxwell just about manages to bring his bat down and squirt it off the inside edge to short fine. Sundar ends his spell, 4-0-31-1 and he would be kicking himself for conceding those two sixes. Deviated from the actual plan and ended up leaking 14 off his final over

Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Siraj!! Soft soft dismissal. And the sea of red is alive again. The momentum is broken and Iyer has himself to blame. That would have been a wide had he let go, instead reaches out for the full delivery and slices it to short third man. There was no need for him to play that. Could have picked up a wide and then made use of the extra delivery. Instead he loses his wicket. RCB needed that wicket as the partnership  had started to flourish and was looking dangerous. Shreyas Iyer c Siraj b Washington Sundar 52(31) [4s-4 6s-3]
Washington Sundar to Pant, 1 run, slower and on off, Pant kneels and sweeps to deep backward square
Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, over the wicket and fires in a low full toss, flicked to deep mid-wicket

Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, fifty for Iyer. Gets there in style. First for him in this IPL. Needs to keep going though. Fetched it from well outside off, might have been a wide had he let go, but he doesn't and swipes it across the line flat over cow corner

Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, massive! For a second it seemed to be traveling out of Chinnaswamy. Sundar changes his line of attack - comes round the wicket and slants it right in the slot, Iyer clears his front leg and heaves it deep into the mid-wicket stand

Siraj to Pant, SIX, good over for DD, 12 runs off it. They need plenty more of it. Slower delivery and Pant picked the bones out of that one, delayed his loft and smashed it straight back over, pinged the ad boardings on the full
Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, back of a length on off, Iyer drops it wide of cover, quick single taken

Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, top shot! Full delivery at 146kph, but Iyer had made some room to open up the off-side field, lofts it without much footwork over extra cover and pocketed a much needed boundary

Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, no run, back of a length just outside off, Iyer tries to force it from the crease and is beaten. The ball does not bounce as much as he expected and also barely carries to de Kock

Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, no run, banged in and Iyer gets into an awkward position, he was looking to duck initially but then sees the ball not climb up much and decides to play the pull, straight to mid-wicket
Siraj to Pant, 1 run, short of length around off, Pant back cuts it to third man. The 50-run stand comes up and the rebuilding work is done, now they need to kick-on and to get a par total

Washington Sundar to Pant, leg byes, 1 run, yes he can. Fired in and giving Pant no space to work with, the quicker delivery beats the flashing blade and thuds into the thigh pad, rolls away into the on-side for a leg-bye
Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, short of length and Iyer punches it to long-on. Five singles. Can Sundar finish it well?
Washington Sundar to Pant, 1 run, thought about stepping out but Sundar darted it in, no room to work with and Pant nudges it through mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, once again the shortish length does not allow Iyer to get under it, wristed to wide long-on
Washington Sundar to Pant, 1 run, tap and run, Sundar drifted it in from round the wicket and Pant opened the bat face to direct it to backward point, Iyer was off quickly
Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, dragged back length and Iyer is content with a knock to long-on

Woakes to Pant, FOUR, that four evens out the over. Once more Woakes goes for the fuller length and with mid-off inside the ring he was taking a risk, Pant hammers the drive straight of mid-off and collects the boundary

Woakes to Pant, 2 runs, pitched up and Pant also had the space to free his arms, drills the drive past cover but the sluggish outfield denies him a boundary, Chahal gets across and keeps it to a brace
Woakes to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, back of a length and Iyer dabs it with an angled bat to third man
Woakes to Pant, 1 run, another off-pace delivery from Woakes and Pant slaps it square on the off-side, sweeper tidies up
Woakes to Pant, no run, change of pace now, the length is a tad short and Pant delays his bunt towards point, sends Iyer back on the single
Woakes to Pant, no run, angled across the left-hander from over the wicket and Pant goes hard on the drive, the angle kept taking the ball away from him and he is beaten on the outside edge
Washington Sundar to Pant, 1 run, comes down the wicket and drills it down to long-on for a single
Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, pushes the tossed up delivery to cover and takes a single again
Washington Sundar to Pant, 1 run, bowls it with a sidearm action on a quick pace outside off, Pant eases it to the right side of the bowler and gets to the other end
Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, short and quick on middle and leg, Iyer flicks it away to deep mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Pant, 1 run, bowls a flatter delivery on middle and leg, Pant nudges it to the on side and gets off the strike
Washington Sundar to Pant, no run, slider on middle and leg, nudged towards square leg by Pant

U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that six will spoil Umesh Yadav's figures. He had conceded only 13 runs off his 3 overs, ends with figures of 4-0-27-1. Was a full length ball on leg as Iyer nonchalantly flicked it over the mid-wicket fence, was timed to perfection by the youngster

U Yadav to Pant, 1 run, that's a brilliant stop by Mandeep at point. Saves a certain boundary with a dive to his left. Was a short and wide delivery outside off, Pant played a perfect square-cut but couldn't get it past Mandeep Singh
U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, follows the boundary with a single. Sensible batting. Steers the shortish delivery to third man and wisely gets off the strike

U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, width on offer and that's been put away. Short and wide outside off, Iyer goes back in the crease and cuts it nicely through point. Sweeper cover sprints across in order to save it but fails in his quest
U Yadav to Pant, 1 run, this was short and wide outside off, Pany cuts it away to sweeper cover for a single
U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, full length delivery on middle and leg, Iyer flicks it to wide long-on
Washington Sundar to Pant, no run, full and quick on middle and leg, Pant flicks it in front of short mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, pushed through outside off, Iyer punches it towards cover-point for a single
Washington Sundar to Pant, 1 run, loopy delivery around off, Pant waits for it and guides it away to the off-side

Washington Sundar to Pant, FOUR, reverse swept! Flighted one around off, Pant goes down on his knee and reverse sweeps it past the man at backward point to score a boundary, did well to connect his shot and past the fielder

Washington Sundar to Pant, no run, spin for Sundar too. It was only Chahal few moments ago, it's Sundar who beats the batsman with his spin now. That pitched on off and Pant was on his back foot as he got beaten on defence
Washington Sundar to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, starts off with a shortish delivery outside off, Iyer guides it in front of point and gets to the other end
Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, fires in a full length delivery on leg, Iyer flicks it away to deep mid-wicket for another run
Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, no run, full length delivery around off, Iyer plays a straight drive but Siraj does well to get down in his followthrough and stop it
Siraj to Pant, 1 run, length ball angled away from the batsman, Pant runs it down to third man with ease
Siraj to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, that was a quick and short delivery outside off, Iyer chops his cut to third man for a single
Siraj to Pant, 1 run, another short one outside off, Pant steers it past the diving fielder at backward point to get off the strike
Siraj to Pant, no run, short and wide outside off, Pant cuts it firmly to the fielder at point
Chahal to Pant, 1 run, tossed up delivery on middle and leg, tickled away to short fine leg for a single

Chahal to Pant, FOUR, slammed away! Rishabh Pant announces his arrival at the crease in style. Picks the length early, camps back and punches it firmly through the gap at cover to get off the mark with a boundary

Chahal to Roy, out Bowled!! Knocked him over. Gambhir departed early and it's Roy who departs now. That was a flat and quick delivery on leg, Roy goes back in his crease to drag it away but gets undone due to the lack of bounce. The ball skids on and takes down his leg-stump. Fine display of bowling by RCB this has been so far. Both DD openers are back in the pavilion now. Onus on the middle order batsmen to get them out of trouble. Roy b Chahal 5(16)
Chahal to Roy, no run, this track is a good one for spinners. Plenty of turn on that one. Pitches on off and turns away sharply again, Roy has no clue about it
Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, loopy delivery on middle and leg, Iyer goes back in his crease to turn it away to deep square leg
Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, no run, shortish length around off, Iyer pulls it hard to the fielder at short mid-wicket
U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, full and wide outside off, square driven past the man at backward point by Iyer
U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, back of a length well outside off, Iyer reaches for it and slams it through the gap at covers, that's his second boundary, and Delhi's second boundary too
U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, no run, short of a length on middle and leg, tucked off his hips to short mid-wicket
U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, first one of the night! Short one on middle and leg, Iyer drags it away to deep square leg to score the first boundary of the match

U Yadav to Roy, 1 run, direct hit. In fact, direct hits! Short of a length outside off, Roy chops his cut to point and asks for a single, however Iyer ain't interested and sends him back. That was the right decision as the fielder scored a direct hit at the batsman's end. Umesh Yadav scored a direct hit at the bowler's end too, but Roy was well in
U Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, times his drive to wide mid-off and completes a quick single. Was a full length ball well outside that off-stump channel
Chahal to Roy, no run, slider on off, Roy plays a reverse sweep but can't find the middle of his willow

Chahal to Roy, no run, Chahal is asking a lot of questions. Roy needs to break the shackles, he's struggling big time. Another fine leg spinning delivery that pitches on off, spins away and beats Roy's defence
Chahal to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, darted on leg, Iyer nudges that away to deep mid-wicket for a single
Chahal to Roy, leg byes, 1 run, flat and quick on middle and leg, Roy comes down the wicket and tries to flick it away, gets beaten though as he is struck on the pads
Chahal to Roy, no run, a perfect leg spinning delivery around off, Roy moves away and creams his drive to the fielder at cover
Chahal to Roy, wide, fires it down the leg side, Roy tries to flick that away but can't make any sort of connection

Chahal to Roy, no run, not out! Fine delivery by Chahal there. Bowls a perfect leg spinner. Pitched on middle and turns away sharply to beat Roy's defence. de Kock whipped off the bails in a flash but Roy was equally quick to drag his back foot in the crease
U Yadav to Roy, 1 run, short of a length outside off, Roy plays the square cut and gathers a single to end the over
U Yadav to Roy, no run, slower delivery on middle and leg, Roy flicks it towards short mid-wicket, was a bit early in his shot
U Yadav to Roy, no run, another sweet shot. This was a length delivery outside off and Roy punched it to perfection towards the fielder at cover
U Yadav to Roy, no run, fires in a full length delivery on middle and leg, Roy plays a perfect on-drive to find the man at mid-on

U Yadav to Gambhir, out Caught by Chahal!! This was bound to happen. Gambhir was struggling to get going and finally throws it away. Probably the pressure of the dot balls created by the pacers. This was short in length and hurried on to the batsman, and although Gambhir picked the length early he couldn't middle the pull. Gets it off the splice towards short mid-wicket where Chahal completes an easy catch. Gambhir c Chahal b U Yadav 3(10)
U Yadav to Gambhir, no run, full length delivery outside off, Gambhir drives it firmly to wide mid-off. That was timed well but not quite in the gap

Woakes to Gambhir, 1 run, an ideal yorker to end the over. Was bowled right into the blockhole by the lanky pacer and Gambhir did well to dig it out at the last moment. Was a little late in bringing that bat down, the stumps would be all over the place
Woakes to Roy, 1 run, length delivery around off, Roy knocks it firmly down to long-on

Woakes to Gambhir, leg byes, 1 run, shortish delivery on middle and leg, Gambhir looks to pull that away but gets deceived due to the lack of pace. The ball thuds into his arms before it lobs towards gully
Woakes to Gambhir, 2 runs, drops it short this time but on leg, Gambhir tucks it away to backward square leg for a brace

Woakes to Gambhir, no run, another wild shot by Gambhir. He's struggling to meet leather tonight. This was a full length delivery angled away outside the off-stump, Gambhir tries to drive it but gets beaten again

Woakes to Roy, 1 run, that was a glorious straight drive by Roy. Was full in length around off, Roy stood tall and drilled it straight back, however the stumps at the other end get in the way and deflect it away to wide mid-off. Meanwhile the batsmen change ends in a jiffy

U Yadav to Gambhir, no run, excellent over to start off! Bangs short on middle and leg, Gambhir hops a bit in the crease as he tucks it towards short mid-wicket. Umesh Yadav is at it again. Got two wickets in the first over against MI, concedes only a single in this one
U Yadav to Gambhir, no run, almost an edge! Pitched around the off-stump channel and shapes away sharply, Gambhir offers a tentative poke as the ball whizzes past his outside edge
U Yadav to Gambhir, no run, this one comes back in sharply. Length delivery on middle and leg, Gambhir nudges it to the on side
U Yadav to Gambhir, no run, swing again! This swung away as it was about to reach de Kock's gloves. Was full and well outside off, Gambhir went for a drive but got beaten due to the away movement

U Yadav to Roy, 1 run, there's that inside edge. Could have gone anywhere. On a length outside off and shaping away, Roy looks to punch it on the up and ends up getting an inside edge that flicks his pads before rolling away into the leg side
U Yadav to Roy, no run, starts off with a length ball with a bit of away swing outside off, Roy doesn't flirt with it
Dwayne Bravo to Rashid Khan, 1 run, champion stuff from Bravo, holds his nerve and sends down a smashing yorker. No way Rashid is hitting that for six. CSK have just about hung on by four runs
Dwayne Bravo to Rashid Khan, FOUR, they're still in this. Quite unbelievable. Full length ball outside off, Rashid swings for the rafters and sends a thick edge flying past short third man

Dwayne Bravo to Rashid Khan, SIX, this is a length ball and it has disappeared. Drama. Two sixes in two balls from Rashid. He's striking it at 600. Swivels across and heaves it away over deep backward square
Dwayne Bravo to Saha, 1 run, walks out to a full toss and swings it past short fine leg. But it's close enough for deep backward square to be able to cut it off. What an over so far

Dwayne Bravo to Saha, 2 runs, now he uses his feet to counter the yorker, takes it on the full and drives straight to cover. Should have been just one, but the pressure gets to Thakur. His fumble allows the second
Dwayne Bravo to Saha, no run, brilliant, just brilliant. Another yorker from Bravo, goes right through Saha outside off

SN Thakur to Rashid Khan, SIX, whacked down the ground for six. First ball Rashid faces, he leans back and pummels the slower ball. Brings the equation down to 19 needed off the final over. The way this game has gone, don't rule it out
SN Thakur to Saha, 1 run, slower ball, back of length outside off, Saha swings it to deep mid-wicket

SN Thakur to Y Pathan, out Caught by Raina!! Sliced up in the air, and that should be it. Raina isn't dropping that at extra cover. It's the knuckle ball in action again, Pathan swings hard at this length delivery but it comes right off the outside half. He immediately hangs his head. SRH running out of gas. Y Pathan c Raina b SN Thakur 45(27) [4s-1 6s-4]
SN Thakur to Y Pathan, no run, full toss again, but this one's pretty wide of off. In his bid to reach out for it, Pathan loses his timing. Tamely bunted back down the pitch
SN Thakur to Y Pathan, SIX, oh what a horrible delivery. Delicious full toss on off stump, Pathan gobbles it up as he whiplashes it over the mid-wicket boundary. Keeps SRH afloat
SN Thakur to Saha, 1 run, length ball wide of off, driven off the toe-end down to long-off

Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, out Caught by Jadeja!! Taken. Taken, taken, taken. It's a brilliant catch from Jadeja, sprinting forward from long-on and diving in front with two hands. Oh Williamson. He's done in by this slower ball. Back of length from Bravo, the ball stops on Williamson who miscues his flat-batted swipe off the splice. Bravo shows off with his dance moves. CSK will back themselves from here. Williamson c Jadeja b Dwayne Bravo 84(51) [4s-5 6s-5]
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, 1 run, another yorker, Pathan squeezes it into the on-side

Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, 2 runs, short of length delivery outside off, Pathan with a flat-batted biff down the ground. Didn't get it all that well, but managed to place it to the left of long-on. Hobbles back for the second

Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, 2 runs, Dhoni flicks it back onto the stumps, but Pathan has dived into the crease and is home comfortably. His body in some discomfort though. Pretty good yorker from Bravo again, Pathan skewed it off a thick inside edge and almost short fine leg before the fielder dived and parried it towards deep backward square. The throw was wide of the stumps, which allowed Pathan to get back in time
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, no run, nails the blockhole outside off, Pathan digs it out

Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, FOUR, very wide on the crease goes Bravo, but he loses his line. He strays this short of length delivery right into Pathan's chest. There's no fine leg in place, or if there is, it's not fine. Pathan helps this pull into the ropes

SN Thakur to Williamson, no run, another excellent yorker to finish the over, it was outside off and Williamson wanted to slice it down to third man but couldn't lay bat on it. He got four yorkers right in the over, which is a decent percentage. But geez that should have been a no-ball off the second ball
SN Thakur to Williamson, no run, anticipates the yorker and walks across for a paddle. But Thakur follows him and hits Williamson on the pad
SN Thakur to Y Pathan, 1 run, good response from Thakur, yorker outside off. Pathan digs it into the off-side for one
SN Thakur to Y Pathan, SIX, free-hit or not, Pathan doesn't care. He smokes this full toss over long-on. He is starting to middle these now, nice and clean

SN Thakur to Williamson, 1 run, very high full toss, Williamson limply swings it away through square leg. Williamson is completely baffled it wasn't given as a no-ball. Clearly over the waist with the replays coming in

SN Thakur to Williamson, 2 runs, brilliant yorker outside off from Thakur, but look at Williamson charge back for the second run. Point was completely vacant and Williamson squeezed the ball right through there
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, SIX, bludgeoned! He gets absolutely stuck into this slower ball and mows it over cow corner. Wow. Bravo goes for 14 in his first over
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, no run, slower ball wide of off, doesn't rise up as much as Pathan wants and it sneaks under his slog-sweep
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, SIX, deep into the crease to be able to get under the ball, and get under the ball he does. Pathan has launched this over long-off. Boy have SRH come roaring back
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, no run, good surprise option, the bumper to Pathan. Pathan is happy to duck under it
Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, 1 run, slants this wide of off, another slower ball, Williamson has to manufacture his own pace. Cut away to sweeper cover
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, 1 run, off-pace short of length delivery on leg, Pathan swishes it to long leg. No pace on the ball from Bravo who's coming from round the wicket

Karn Sharma to Williamson, SIX, lays into it again, and it's six more. This is some lovely batting from the SRH captain. He didn't overhit the ball this time, just an extension of the off-drive, and it sails over long-off
Karn Sharma to Williamson, SIX, woah, that's massive. Williamson! He sat on his back knee and whacked this slog-sweep way back into the square leg stands. Do we have a match on here?
Karn Sharma to Y Pathan, 1 run, not much timing from Pathan as he cuts this over cover, probably came off the toe-end
Karn Sharma to Williamson, 1 run, drops it short outside off, cut away through backward point

Karn Sharma to Williamson, SIX, this time Williamson goes leg-side, and collects six. He planted his back foot outside off, got a delivery which landed right in the slot, and shovelled it over wide long-on

Karn Sharma to Williamson, 2 runs, again, that wide line from Karn. Williamson reaches out for it and chips it over extra-cover. Just a chip, the intention was never to go all the way. Comes back for two
Jadeja to Williamson, 1 run, darted in on middle and leg, back of length, tucked away through mid-wicket

Jadeja to Williamson, SIX, doesn't look comfortable doing this, but he's somehow muscled it over wide long-off. Length ball just outside off, Williamson had set himself up by clearing his front leg. Opens his body up and carves it inside out
Jadeja to Williamson, no run, hangs back to a length ball, gets his front leg out of the way and drives to cover
Jadeja to Y Pathan, 1 run, 102kph, fired in on a length on middle, Pathan works it to long-on
Jadeja to Y Pathan, wide, round-arm delivery, fires it pretty wide of off. Pathan fails to reach out, but it's given as a wide
Jadeja to Williamson, 1 run, short ball outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
Jadeja to Y Pathan, 1 run, backs away and cuts it off the stumps to deep point
Karn Sharma to Y Pathan, 1 run, pushed through flat on off, nudged into the on-side for one

Karn Sharma to Y Pathan, 2 runs, goes after this flighted leg-break, but Karn is bowling very smartly here. The line is very wide outside off, meaning that Pathan has to really stretch out for it. Even so, he's only able to slice it off the outside half over point
Karn Sharma to Williamson, 1 run, defends the leg-break softly into the off-side

Karn Sharma to Y Pathan, 1 run, top-edged sweep towards deep backward square, Bravo lets it land in front of him. He didn't attack the ball like he should have. He surely would have got to it had the intent been there, but he's happy to take it on the bounce

Karn Sharma to Y Pathan, no run, drifting in on a length on leg, Pathan is probably through with the sweep too early. This top-edge could have gone anywhere, but luckily for Yusuf, it loops into his shoulders and deflects away from slip
Karn Sharma to Williamson, 1 run, shimmying down to the pitch of this flighted leg-break, pushes it down to long-off. It's fifty for the SRH captain, but has he given up on this chase?
Jadeja to Y Pathan, no run, more round-arm than usual from Jadeja, slides it in from wide of the crease. It takes a thick inside edge in Pathan's forward defence
Jadeja to Williamson, 1 run, hops back and punches this delivery down to long-off
Jadeja to Y Pathan, 1 run, patted away with the turn into the covers
Jadeja to Williamson, 1 run, goes back in the crease to this flatter trajectory and tucks it through mid-wicket
Jadeja to Y Pathan, 1 run, length ball gripping away outside off, Pathan tentatively bunts it down to long-off. Was in the air for a bit, but only for a bit
Jadeja to Williamson, 1 run, on the shorter side outside off, Williamson cuts to deep point
Karn Sharma to Williamson, 1 run, clipped away through square leg
Karn Sharma to Y Pathan, 1 run, drifting in on middle and leg, works it round the corner for one

Karn Sharma to Y Pathan, no run, beautifully flighted leg-break outside off, Yusuf is tempted by the flight and looks to slog first ball. But this one turns away rapidly and beats his outside edge. Yusuf had thrown everything at it, leading to his back foot dragging out of the crease. But just before Dhoni took off the bails, he was able to squeeze it back behind the line. Not out

Karn Sharma to Shakib, out Caught by Raina!! Gets him with the googly. 100th T20 wicket for Karn Sharma. It was flighted up on leg-stump, once Shakib saw that line he knelt down to sweep. But there was a bit of extra bounce with this delivery which produced the top-edge. Raina accepts the dolly at short fine leg. Shakib c Raina b Karn Sharma 24(19) [4s-2 6s-1]
Karn Sharma to Shakib, no run, looped up on middle, Shakib drills it back to Karn
Karn Sharma to Shakib, no run, totally cramped on the cut. He was looking to play it from middle stump, ends up squirting it off a thick edge to short third man
Watson to Shakib, 1 run, eases the length delivery down to long-on for a single
Watson to Shakib, 2 runs, full and wide outside off, Shakib creams it to wide mid-off with an extended drive and a stop by Bravo at mid-off keeps them down to two
Watson to Williamson, 1 run, bowled on middle and leg, Williamson plays a flick to deep mid-wicket, gets only a single this time around
Watson to Williamson, 2 runs, works the length delivery away to deep square leg and takes two more

Watson to Williamson, 4 runs, comedy of errors there. Was a good effort by Jadeja near the fence but as he flicked that away into play, the ball rolled away towards long-on. He had to run all the way from mid-wicket to long-on and by that time, the batsmen had run four. Was a shortish delivery around off and Williamson flicked away to deep mid-wicket. Excellent running between the wickets again. They'll need a few drinks to hydrate again
Watson to Shakib, 1 run, flicks the full length ball away to deep mid-wicket and takes a single
Jadeja to Shakib, 1 run, it's a single and umpire signals time-out.  Short in length outside off and Shakib chops it away to sweeper cover
Jadeja to Williamson, 1 run, knocks the tossed up delivery down to long-on

Jadeja to Williamson, 2 runs, goes back in his crease and punches the short one away to deep point. As the fielder in the deep tidies up, Williamson manages to come back for two. Good running between the wickets
Jadeja to Williamson, no run, flat and quick on middle and leg, guided back to the bowler by Williamson

Hardik Pandya to Gowtham, SIX, it's in the orbit. It's into the car park. And Gowtham turns hero - coming right at the climax, scoring at a strike rate of 300. Gets a juicy back of a length ball, in the slot and flat-bats it across the line. Into the clouds. And then cow corner
Hardik Pandya to Gowtham, no run, does a Pollard. Can't beat extra cover with his push, doesn't want to let go of his strike
Hardik Pandya to Gowtham, FOUR, top thinking. He's spotted third man inside the ring, and ramps his bat out to shove it over. Wrong line, wrong length

Hardik Pandya to Jofra Archer, out Caught&Bowled!! Another twist. Agatha Christie would be so damn proud. Pandya lets out the bouncer, neatly directed into the head, and Archer's pulls in desperation, top-edging it high. Pandya takes matters into his own hands. Calls and holds his nerve. Jofra Archer c and b Hardik Pandya 8(9) [4s-1]

Bumrah to Gowtham, FOUR, goes pulling. And goes into the gap. Doesn't get enough meat, and thank heavens for that. It goes a lot finer, beating square leg in the ring. It's 10 off the final over. And you thought this was over, twice
Bumrah to Gowtham, no run, slower, cutting under Gowtham's lined up slog into the orbit. It turns, does it?
Bumrah to Gowtham, FOUR, utter disdain. Take that .. width, pace and it is back in that point zone. Thumped hard. How things turn
Bumrah to Gowtham, 2 runs, the free-hit's on the pad. Under the bat, but Mumbai's fielders day dreaming grabs them the second too
Bumrah to Jofra Archer, no ball, 1 run, the pressure. Massive overstep. A cool few inches over. Murdered back over his ducking running for cover
Bumrah to Jofra Archer, 2 runs, chipped up, taking it off his pads and lofting it to long-on

Bumrah to Jofra Archer, FOUR, very, very Caribbean. Okay former Caribbean. Archer transfer back, lets the ball get on par and waits on his drive, opening it to pierce the gap behind point. And that gap is huge

Mustafizur to Gowtham, FOUR, edge. And the Royals have a massive edge of life. 15 off this one and all of a sudden there's oxygen still there in this one. A low full toss, across Gowtham, who throws his bat out in an attempt to slice. He'll make his peace with the edge, running past the keeper
Mustafizur to Gowtham, SIX, rocks back, deep in the crease, getting that front leg out once again. And targets the smallest part of the ground - cow corner. And swings. Smoking
Mustafizur to Gowtham, 2 runs, clears his front leg, carving it through the covers
Mustafizur to Jofra Archer, 1 run, slower one on the free-hit. And he's slogged it down long-on's throat
Mustafizur to Jofra Archer, no ball, over waist. Over the shoulders in fact. Wide outside off thankfully to cause damage. A yorker missed .. by a mile
Mustafizur to Gowtham, 1 run, not quite the bounce he'd lined himself up for. Mis-pulled towards long-on

Mustafizur to Klaasen, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! The bridge is falling. The fortess is falling in dramatic fashion. Klaasen gets himself a golden duck on his home debut. Fizz comes up with his go-to ball - a cutter slanting across. Klaasen with flat feet looks to drive away from his body, gets the customary edge and Ishan's diving low to his right to collect. Yes his black eye doesn't stop him from judging these perfectly. Klaasen c Ishan Kishan b Mustafizur 0(1)
Bumrah to Jofra Archer, no run, 147.7kph. Wow. It's a show guys. Yorkers don't get any better. Jammed down the pitch, not enough in it to go past Bumrah either. Archer getting a taste of his medicine
Bumrah to Jofra Archer, no run, closes it out. Full, blockhole, just outside off. 148kph. Can't squeeze
Bumrah to Jofra Archer, no run, no, no hat-trick here as well. Archer's behind the line, defending

Bumrah to Buttler, out Bowled!! Perfect peach. And Rajasthan are well and truly doing a death over Mumbai. Bumrah's the Jofra in the remake. Nothing slow here, full paced, 144kph, hitting the good length, seaming in sharply and staying low to go through the bat and pad on Buttler's meek prod forward. Buttler b Bumrah 6(8)

Bumrah to Samson, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! It was all timing till it lasted. The moment it deserts him, he falls. It was Bumrah's famed slower gripper, Samson tries hoicking it into cow corner. Gropes only the toe-end, spoons high and Hardik runs in. Nah, he ain't messing these up. Samson c Hardik Pandya b Bumrah 52(39) [4s-4]
Bumrah to Buttler, 1 run, 131.7kph. On the shorter side, slapped under a diving extra cover. The RRR's crept over 11
Krunal Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, backs again, but manages to keep it out with a knock down the ground. There's the old Pandya's spell - 4-0-33-1
Krunal Pandya to Buttler, no run, big dot. Spots Buttler making room and follows him in. Under the wild swing across
Krunal Pandya to Samson, 1 run, to deep extra cover, 111.4kph. Into the crease, shoved out through extra cover
Krunal Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, pulls his length back, darting it quicker into the thighs. Glanced
Krunal Pandya to Samson, 1 run, tight lines on off. Clipped away, and long-on runs in to keep it to a single
Krunal Pandya to Samson, 2 runs, grips on a length, turning away slowly. Samson merely defends, and its into the vast mid-off gaps to pinch a couple. And a ninth IPL fifty
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, 2 runs, flows through the line, finds a sweeping extra cover. But Samson's timing everything perfectly, his twos in particular
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, no run, skewed up drive, off the outside half in the miscue to backward point, where despite Markande's dive it ends up short
Hardik Pandya to Samson, 1 run, now delicate. Clipped away from the line of off. In front of square

Hardik Pandya to Samson, FOUR, latches on. It's that sitting up length, and Samson goes flat-batted, riding the bounce and timing the leather off it through cow corner, splitting the two men converging. In the hope of converging
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, neat timing, driving it through down to sweeper

Hardik Pandya to Stokes, out Bowled!! It's in the blockhole. Stokes has been walking all across, but has been getting down in time to dig things out. Until this one. It's full, it's into the base of leg, and Stokes' walked across, freezing in front of the stumps as he tries using the angle to swipe it behind square. Done in for pace. Done in for dip. This is exactly where Rajasthan need to avoid doing a Mumbai. Stokes b Hardik Pandya 40(27) [4s-3 6s-1]
Mustafizur to Samson, no run, 133.2kph, foxes Samson for the lack of pace in the air. And he takes one hand off the handle as he drives it to cover
Mustafizur to Stokes, 1 run, 135.3kph, goes for the blockhole. Stokes has it on the full, bottom-handing it straight down
Mustafizur to Samson, 1 run, 124.3kph, leg-lined cutter going across. Swatted, with once again the crunchiest of timing. Picks out deep mid-wicket
Mustafizur to Stokes, 1 run, on the move, charge rather. Slammed down to long-off
Mustafizur to Stokes, FOUR, sits up perfectly. Stokes up there tall, already given himself loads of room and carts it over the covers. Nothing streaky here

Mustafizur to Stokes, 2 runs, slanting cutter. Stokes chases, swinging through the line, but with some extra bounce in it, gets a fat outside half sliced over cover doing his best to run back and reach
Bumrah to Samson, no run, 143.3kph. Low quick full toss. Driven back, and Bumrah mock throw threat is enough to send Samson backtracking
Bumrah to Samson, 2 runs, 119.9kph, slower, nipping back in from a shortened good length. Wrists. Mid-wicket. Brace. Predictable
Bumrah to Stokes, 1 run, pitched up on off. Dug out to a deepish mid-off
Bumrah to Stokes, no run, some cheek. Almost an Ishan in what he does. So he gets across to try scooping, realizes it is wide and decides to go into third man. Does neither
Bumrah to Samson, 1 run, that sound. High elbows, punching it on the up through sweeper
Bumrah to Stokes, 1 run, 139.8kph from over the wicket. Cramping Stokes up as he down on the move, opens up his drive towards mid-off
Krunal Pandya to Samson, 2 runs, and again. Oh he's toying around, why bother with boundaries when you can do this. The softest of hands in flicking it straight of mid-wicket. And then the legs
Krunal Pandya to Samson, 2 runs, delicately turned away in front of square. And Samson knows his field, measures, calls Stokes back. And perfectly
Krunal Pandya to Stokes, 1 run, slapped away through the covers, crouched
Krunal Pandya to Stokes, wide, another dart going across, absolute zero turn, surely not at the pace Krunal's been throwing them at
Krunal Pandya to Stokes, no run, width again. Stabbed out to point
Krunal Pandya to Stokes, wide, gets a step across his stumps, Krunal follows him dragging it wide. And he plays into Stokes' trap .. all he wants is the wide
Krunal Pandya to Samson, 1 run, 94.3kph, keeps it straight. Quietly knocked round the corner
Krunal Pandya to Samson, 2 runs, drifting into middle. Whipped down the ground, and long-on's sloppy

McClenaghan to Stokes, FOUR, now the overcook. McClenaghan tries sneaking in a quiet one, wide, full. Can't. Stokes' up there smart, reaching out and drilling it through extra cover. Here's the move on .. 16 runs in it

McClenaghan to Stokes, SIX, all the innocous-ity. 92kph, dug in half way into the pitch, turning into him down leg too. Stokes waits. And waits. And swivels, rejecting the wide to pull it into fine leg
McClenaghan to Samson, 1 run, a touch shorter, tucking him up for room. A meek pull, deep mid-wicket
McClenaghan to Samson, 2 runs, 121.9kph, slows it up, keeping it on a length this time. Samson uses the soft pace, with his soft wrists to nudge it in front of square. Massive gaps
McClenaghan to Stokes, 1 run, slow-sticking-bumper into the pitch. Heaved, all muscle. There's a deep square leg
McClenaghan to Stokes, 2 runs, runs at him, almost yorking himself in the process. Just about manages a tickle off the toe-end to fine leg
Hardik Pandya to Stokes, 1 run, lack of pace has put a cap on the run-rate, that's for sure. Stokes waits and punches this to long-off
Hardik Pandya to Samson, 1 run, slowish and spinning in, Samson works it to backward square leg

Hardik Pandya to Samson, wide, Samson's confused him. Goes into an early shuffle and tempts Hardik Pandya into bowling a wide yorker outside off. But Hardik Pandya's overdone it and gets a wide against his name. Bowl that again, Pandya, because this is a batsman's game
Hardik Pandya to Stokes, 1 run, off-cutter angled across Stokes, who's brought his wrists into play last minute and whipped it to long-on
Hardik Pandya to Samson, 1 run, quickish length ball that Samson plays from the crease. Packs a punch through covers
Hardik Pandya to Stokes, 1 run, 121ks cutter that pitches outside leg and skids onto the left-hander. Stokes tucks it round the corner

Hardik Pandya to Samson, 1 run, not the unlikeliest of balls. First ball of the spell and he's banged it in. But Samson's alert. Swivels and pulls that to backward square leg. Didn't look cent percent on top of that but he did the right things just enough
Markande to Samson, 1 run, drifts it into the pads. Easy leg-side gimme. Samson keeps strike to deep mid-wicket. Rajasthan Royals need 105 runs in 66 balls

Markande to Samson, no run, he's spinning it tonight. Pitches on off-stump and goes away, and Samson's in no position to play that. Is on the back foot as he tries to pinch that through covers, and gets it off the inside half back to Markande
Markande to Stokes, 1 run, slower googly this time. Stokes rocks back and slaps the ball to long-off
Markande to Stokes, 2 runs, steps out to a googly and pushes it to long-off
Markande to Samson, 1 run, now some turn. He wanted to turn it; you can see it from how he bowled. But it's slow and carved along the ground through cover-point
Markande to Samson, no run, drifts it in on middle and extracts a forward push back down the pitch from Samson
Mustafizur to Samson, 1 run, he's covered the movement nicely. On his front foot to reach out and then opens the bat face to point. Quick single
Mustafizur to Stokes, 1 run, full and attacking the pads of Stokes, who's nicely held his balance on this flick. Single through mid-wicket
Mustafizur to Samson, 1 run, back of a length but it's a leg-stump line. Nudged down to backward square leg for a single
Mustafizur to Stokes, 1 run, was coming forward but is arrested midway. Adjusts and punches the length ball to mid-off

Mustafizur to Stokes, no run, Mustafizur is excited but that looks high. Traps Stokes on the shuffle with this delivery. Oh they've gone for the review. It's hit the knee-roll bang in front of off-stump, so the impact is alright. But as we doubted, the bounce in this Jaipur deck is taking the ball over the stumps -- the ball-tracking confirms. So not out it'll be and Mumbai lose their review
Mustafizur to Samson, 1 run, easily gets to the ball on his front foot -- Mustafizur is bowling the cutter from over the wicket -- and pats that through covers
Markande to Samson, 1 run, googly spinning down, Samson nurdles it to fine leg and keeps strike. I don't mind..

Markande to Samson, 2 runs, bowls it pretty full and outside off, and is driven through covers. Good from Markande there actually. Sees that the second run's gonna be hurried, and nicely gets into a position behind the stumps to gather that throw from deep extra cover
Markande to Stokes, 1 run, punches it away to long-off with the spin

Markande to Stokes, 2 runs, Markande resorts to the leg break that straightens within the line of the stumps and look what Stokes does: reverse-sweeps. Doesn't find the boundary, for it's been cut off at deep backward point, but Markande now knows what Stokes can do
Markande to Stokes, FOUR, this spins more, so this is the googly from back fo the hand. Stokes gets into a shape to sweep nicely and brooms it away through mid-wicket
Markande to Stokes, no run, skidder from over the wicket to the leg-side, finds mid-wicket

McClenaghan to Samson, FOUR, that's why you can't not like him. McClenaghan strategy is pretty obvious: Bowl it slow and angle it across, because there's third man and backward point waiting to cut the runs off. And Samson here has found the tiniest of gaps between the fielders. Beautifully done, opening the bat face just enough to cleave the fielders
McClenaghan to Stokes, 1 run, single to mid-wicket this time. Could have been another slower delivery. Yeah, was

McClenaghan to Rahane, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! McClenaghan had pared down Rajasthan with pace, or the lack of it. Three slower deliveries in a row and that was it for Rahane. Takes it on with a flat-batted swat and all he manages is a toe-end to mid-wicket. Krunal's tall and leaps a little to take this screamer. It's a pun alright, because you should have seen Krunal screaming. Rahane c Krunal Pandya b McClenaghan 14(17) [4s-1]
McClenaghan to Rahane, no run, he's left his pace back in the dressing room. On the pads this time, Rahane finds square leg with his nudge
McClenaghan to Rahane, no run, another slower delivery that's been softly sliced to backward point

McClenaghan to Rahane, 2 runs, okay, lots happened here. Slower cutter that's angling away to start with. Rahane finds short third man with this glide, the fielder hits the stumps in riposte but Samson was home. And then they run another single off the deflection. So much for intent
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, angled into the pads. It's a perennial square leg-feeder. Rahane's no different. Rajasthan Royals need 132 runs in 90 balls

Krunal Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, proper Rahane. Early to load onto the front foot and then drills it away through covers. Nothing Krunal Pandya could have done, except maybe pitching it a bit shorter. But then Rahane might have come up with something else
Krunal Pandya to Samson, 1 run, full and flat -- the kind of ball you can't get under. Samson moves a little off-side and wrists the ball to mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, went back to a flatter length but ends up whipping it wide of mid-on
Krunal Pandya to Samson, 1 run, sliding on with the arm, Samson works it to deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, stopping onto Rahane, who delays his wristwork to mid-wicket
Mustafizur to Rahane, 1 run, stays in the crease and slices it to mid-off. The intention was to buy some time for the single, and he does that with an easy single on offer
Mustafizur to Rahane, no run, back of a length on leg-stump, but square leg intercepts it. No run

Mustafizur to Samson, 1 run, now he's just tried to find the gap here. In the late 120s from Mustafizur, Samson again is reaching across on his front foot but instead opens the bat face and runs the ball to deep backward point

Mustafizur to Samson, FOUR, full and wide, and the long-limbed Samson is not going to miss out. Reaches out, with footwork into a snooze, but who cares. It's all hands. Creams the drive through covers. Bullets it. Surgeons it. Whatever. It's Samson, okay? We're allowed to drool this season

Mustafizur to Samson, no run, 125ks ball that decks away just a touch. And it's troubled all right-handers in world cricket. A bit of an outside edge from Samson too, but does well to slice it and soften the impact

Mustafizur to Samson, no run, 134ks on a back of a length from over the wicket to the right-hander. And if you're not inundated by the tech details. I'll tell you that Samson's found the short third man with this attempted glide
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, no run, ends the over with a dot ball. Skids it on and into Rahane, who pierces it to mid-on

Krunal Pandya to Samson, 3 runs, slows the pace down and extracts that tiny bit of turn. But it's slow, and the line's wide, so Samson could stretch on his front foot and pat that through covers. Two fielders give the chase but the tag-team work's kinda okay. Samson races for the third

Krunal Pandya to Samson, FOUR, now what do I call that.. Will be an outside edge to the naive but this has been cleverly played late and just wide of the keeper. Bat face opens at the last minute and Krunal Pandya's grounded. Sort of. We'll see
Krunal Pandya to Samson, no run, full ball drilled towards straight mid-off

Krunal Pandya to R Tripathi, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Even Krunal Pandya cannot believe it. Gets that rainbow-from-this-palm-to-other pose dead right. A bit of loop after that first ball, and Tripathi middles this straight to mid-on. Straight to him. Would have wanted to go over the fielder but times it right into his hands. Well, this debut at the top doesn't go so well.. R Tripathi c Suryakumar Yadav b Krunal Pandya 9(8) [4s-1]
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, darted flat and full from round the wicket, Rahane works it to mid-on and gets to the other end
Bumrah to Rahane, 1 run, how late has he played that. Uses Bumrah's extra bounce outside off and glides it to fine third man
Bumrah to R Tripathi, 1 run, he's bowling from over the wicket and trying to bring the ball in, so every chance he'll splay it down leg. Like here. Easily worked to deep square leg
Bumrah to R Tripathi, no run, 142ks fuller delivery that Tripathi bunts into the pitch. Looks a bit hurried but all well in the end
Bumrah to Rahane, 1 run, brings the ball in but the line's a touch wide, and it's been shunted to the third man fielder
Bumrah to Rahane, no run, angles this in from wide of the crease, Rahane checks the defence back down the pitch
Bumrah to R Tripathi, 1 run, kicks up from a back of a length and takes the outside edge to third man
McClenaghan to R Tripathi, 1 run, hat-trick of slower deliveries. Tripathi, this time, punches a quick single to mid-off
McClenaghan to R Tripathi, 2 runs, another slower delivery that's been beamed onto leg-stump. Better but not better enough. Two runs to fine leg
McClenaghan to R Tripathi, wide, doesn't yet have his radar right. Slower delivery but it's been sprayed down leg to the right-hander
McClenaghan to R Tripathi, no run, angling across, Tripathi stays leg-side of the line and stabs it into the off-side
McClenaghan to R Tripathi, FOUR, there's a short fine leg in place but this leg-stump delivery deserves nothing less than a boundary. Tripathi crouches and glances it wide of the fielder at 45
McClenaghan to Rahane, 1 run, drags the length back and witnesses Rahane run it round the corner for a single. That means Tripathi is on strike
McClenaghan to Rahane, no run, goes full and across, and Rahane is leaning to his right in order to cover the stumps and get behind the line
Stokes to Pollard, 2 runs, slipping down leg, Pollard hacks it towards fine leg, puts on the skates and comes back for the second
Stokes to Pollard, no run, Stokes follows Pollard, who was backing away to leg. Cramped for room, Pollard can only slam it away to deep mid-wicket, wisely doesn't take the single
Stokes to Pollard, FOUR, Stokes is not happy with the effort by Gowtham. Should've stopped definitely. Pollard whacked it wide of long-on, Gowtham gets across, puts in the dive but doesn't stop it

Stokes to Pollard, no ball, bam! Stokes loses this. Must've slipped out of his hands as he bowls a beamer outside off. Sweaty hands? Could be but he apologises immediately. Strangely Pollard backed away and lets it pass
Stokes to Pollard, no run, uff! How close was it to kiss the stumps? Not very much, to be honest. Stokes' cutter refuses to rise. Scooted low, Pollard swings and no way he could've connect that
Stokes to Pollard, 2 runs, 144kph, ushered in short. Pollard pulls albeit without any timing. Gets it into the gap at deep mid-wicket and picks up two
Stokes to Pollard, no run, Stokes takes a cue from Archer and nails the yorker at the stumps. Pollard digs it out to long-on
Jofra Archer to Markande, no run, Markande somehow keeps this out. Another tailing in full ball, Markande shuffles across and clips it through square leg

Jofra Archer to McClenaghan, out Bowled!! Wow. Wow. 149.2 thunderbolt from Archer. Demolishes the stumps. What an over this is turning out to be. Two wickets in two balls and he's on a hat-trick now. Harpooned it full and at the stumps, McClenaghan had no clue and failed to negate it. Straight through him to shatter the stumps. McClenaghan b Jofra Archer 0(1)

Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, out Bowled!! Jofra has his revenge. Sweet. Rip roaring yorker, angling on leg. Hardik is beaten for sheer pace (145.6kph). Couldn't get his bat down in time, the ball slams his pad and deflected back onto the stumps to clatter the middle stump. MI losing steam towards the end. Hardik Pandya b Jofra Archer 4(2) [4s-1]

Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, ouch. Take cover Rod Tucker, Hardik knocked off his head nearly. Very full on off, the slower ball at 123.1 kph, Hardik gets under it and hammered it straight down the ground ferociously. Tucker take evasive action and is on the floor

Jofra Archer to Pollard, 1 run, oh, almost had two in two here. Archer drops a tough chance. Fuller ball at 145.1kph just outside off, Pollard smacked it straight back at him, Archer got both hands but it slipped out

Jofra Archer to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Klaasen!! Maiden IPL wicket for Archer. Archer will be chuffed to bits. Krunal loses shape as he winds up for a slog. Archer slips in a knuckle ball that holds up a touch on the pitch. Krunal went for the longer boundary - the deep mid-wicket area. Lacked timing and power, straight to Klaasen. Look at Archer, he breaks into a jig. Krunal Pandya c Klaasen b Jofra Archer 7(6) [4s-1]

Unadkat to Pollard, no run, top-class yorker from Unadkat. Double-bluff, eh? Pollard was expecting a slower ball again, but Unadkat outfoxes him and unleashes a wide yorker outside off that slides under Pollard's bat
Unadkat to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, slower balls on loop. This cutter squares up Krunal as he closes his bat face a little early and pops a leading edge towards mid-off
Unadkat to Pollard, 1 run, slower delivery on leg, Pollard swivels and helps it behind square on the leg-side
Unadkat to Pollard, SIX, pure muscle from Pollard. Finally, gets going. Cutter slanted wide of off, Pollard waited and waited before butchering it over long-on. Flat-batted powerfully!
Unadkat to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, angling on middle and leg, Krunal nudges it to mid-wicket

Unadkat to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, excellent from the senior Pandya. How late he played that? Didn't have any room there at all to free his arms. So, he stayed back, opened his bat face and glided it in the gap between short third man and backward point

Jofra Archer to Pollard, 1 run, leg-cutter from Archer, Pollard nudges it through square leg. Spots the fielder a little slow towards the ball and races back for the second. Oh wait, they cross over twice but the umpire has given it a run short, so just the single off this ball
Jofra Archer to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, shifts his line wide of off, Pandya waits and dabs it to short third man
Jofra Archer to Pollard, 1 run, very full delivery, at 146kph. Nails Pollard on the pad. Rolls to point
Jofra Archer to Pollard, no run, slower ball from Archer and Pollard does a 360. Spindles too early aiming for the pull and gets hit on the forearm. He's really struggling here
Jofra Archer to Pollard, no run, bangs it short, steep bounce for Archer. Loops over Pollard's head. One-bouncer called for the over
Jofra Archer to Pollard, no run, full and snaking in, Pollard presses forward and blocks
Unadkat to Krunal Pandya, no run, short of length delivery rising just outside off, Pandya with an open bat face guided it to the left of Buttler, wanted a single but Pollard sends him back
Unadkat to Pollard, 1 run, a yes-no again, but no harm done in the end. Pollard patted it to point, a slight hesitation between the two. They take the single eventually

Unadkat to Rohit, out Rohit Run Out!! Now, now. Two wickets in a span of three balls and this is a prized scalp for Rajasthan. Rohit is livid with himself, punches his bat in anger. It was his call and he has to pay the price. You just cannot underestimate Rahane in the field. A meeky tap to the right of Rahane. He moved across in a flash, picked it up with one-hand and released the throw in one-motion to break the stumps. Only one stump to aim at and bingo! Rohit wasn't even in the frame. Goner! Rohit run out (Rahane) 0(1)
Unadkat to Pollard, 1 run, an extention of forward defence to long-off

Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Buttler!! RR are pegging back MI here. Suryakumar Yadav has looked out of sorts since a last couple of overs and finally, he decides to throw his wicket away to Unadkat. Again the off-cutter, slanted around off. Suryakumar Yadav in a bid to step up the pedal, miscues it totally. Top-edges it into the night sky, was swirling in the air. Buttler called for it, moved across to his left and safely grabbed it. Suryakumar Yadav c Buttler b Unadkat 72(47) [4s-6 6s-3]

Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, Yadav has looked off-color in the last couple of overs. Clever change of pace from Unadkat, hurled it full and the angle took it away further outside off. Yadav swings and misses
D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, low full toss again outside off, blasted away to long-on
D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, wide, and again. Same delivery, fires it miles outside off forcing Yadav to reach for it. The batsman with a bent-knee went hard at that, however he couldn't connect
D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, wide, tries for the wide yorker but overdoes it and splays it outside the tramlines. Has to reload
D Kulkarni to Pollard, 1 run, wider lines from Kulkarni, low full toss outside off. Pollard leans into a crispy drive to sweeper cover
D Kulkarni to Pollard, no run, fullish ball with a bit of curl in towards middle. Pollard with a nice stride forward defends it
D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, banged in short on middle, Yadav pulls it along the ground to deep mid-wicket

D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Buttler!! Oh my word, unnecessary cheekiness from Kishan doesn't come off well. Tried to emulate Rishabh Pant's reverse scoop and fails miserably. Nonetheless, brilliant innings from him comes to an end. Second wicket for Kulkarni. Went full and wide, turned out to be a low full toss. Kishan was ready to scoop it over short fine, but messes it up and spoons it up in the air. Easy-peasy for Buttler. Ishan Kishan c Buttler b D Kulkarni 58(42) [4s-4 6s-3]
D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, fuller length delivery wafted outside off, Yadav kneels down and sweeps it along the ground to deep square leg

Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, shaved away wide of long-on, they will have to settle for a single because Stokes is quick onto the ball. Rifles a flat and bullet throw to the keeper; cripes! Buttler can't collect that throw from Stokes and no back-up meant that they will take the second run eventually
Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, no run, play and a miss. Pacy short of length delivery outside off, good variation in pace from Unadkat. Kishan slashes and misses
Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, no run, oopsy. Unadkat tumbles in his followthrough as he wafts this full ball outside off. Kishan crashes it straight to extra cover

Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, more clumsy effort from RR in the field. Gopal, the guilty culprit this time, who lets it through. Kishan moved across on this occasion and helped this short of length delivery to short fine leg. Gopal was lazy to bend low and didn't get his body behind the line of the ball. Sneaked through his legs and off to the fence
Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, no run, nice. The slower delivery from Unadkat, hoodwinks Kishan as he swung early and fails to connect

Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, fuller to start his new spell. Kishan backs away and slaps it over point. Archer cuts it off and unleashes a flat throw to the keeper's head which on the way nearly cleaned up Heinrich Klaasen's head. Archer smiles and apologizes
Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, another swinging in low full toss from Archer, at the stumps. Yadav can't get that away. Pushed it straight back to the bowler

Jofra Archer to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, 143.3kph, low full toss on leg. Kishan with a full face of the bat wrists it to mid-wicket, where Stokes dives across and intercepts it. And that will be a half-century for Kishan. His second IPL fifty. So both batsmen who were dismissed for a first-ball duck in the previous match has made it count today. Raise of the bat from the youngster to soak in the applause from the dug-out
Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, tad fuller outside off, stayed a touch low as well. Yadav accommodates for the low bounce by shifting his weight forward and taps it down to long-on

Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, lovely again from Yadav. Knew the third man was inside the ring, so he waited on this short of length delivery and steered it very fine. A late dive from the fielder, half-stop and they take a couple
Jofra Archer to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, veering on leg-stump, Kishan places it to mid-wicket

Jofra Archer to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, wonderful from Kishan. "Such a dynamic player he is" is the comment from Isa Guha on air. Greets Archer to the crease by chipping down the track, takes it on the full and lofted it with a clean swing of the arms over mid-off

Gowtham to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, oh, funky from Kishan. Brings out the reverse sweep, Gowtham fired it down leg and the batsman had to fetch it from there. He rolled his wrists and directed it to sweeper cover
Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, lasered full, Suryakumar whacks it down to long-on

Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, Yadav shows off his cheekiness. Manufactured room out of nowhere. Pushed through quicker outside off, Suryakumar went deep and sliced it in the gap between short third man and backward point. Threaded the gap beautifully
Gowtham to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, Kishan charges out and wrists it away to long-on
Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, crunchy single to long-off

Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, drifted on leg, tickled to short fine. Ishan was keen for a single but SKY was still and sends him back. The fielder was swift to release the throw to the bowler's end. Ishan turns back and makes it in easily despite Gowtham taking the bails off in a flash

Stokes to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, this is great running from the duo. Stokes from round the wicket, hurls it full around off. Kishan set himself for a heave across the line, ends up getting an inside edge onto his pad and it dribbbles away to mid-wicket. Stokes gives the chase but can't prevent the two as these two ran like men possessed for a brace
Stokes to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, pitched up and lures Suryakumar, driven crisply to long-off
Stokes to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, smashed away wide of long-on, they scamper back for the second

Stokes to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, oh, what a clanger. Krishnappa Gowtham, what have you done? Spills a straightforward catch at long-on. This is going to hurt RR, for sure. A slower ball from Stokes, Suryakumar took it on and miscued it completely. Gets it off the top half of the bat towards long-on. Gowtham had to move across a bit, went with both hands but it pops out of his hands. Tried grabbing it on the second attempt, in vain

Stokes to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he's been superb with the pick-up shots today. Anything on the pads, SKY has dispatched it disdainfully. Here's another instance. Full down leg, Suryakumar gets across and whips it cleanly behind square. In the gap and zooms away to the fence
Stokes to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, high full toss, wasn't this over the waist, this seems to be a no ball missed. Had one in the SRH-CSK game. Suryakumar crashed this straight to cover
Shreyas Gopal to Ishan Kishan, SIX, he's upping the strike-rate as well. Flighted delivery down the leg-side, Ishan gets to the pitch of the ball by advancing and slogs over wide long-on
Shreyas Gopal to Ishan Kishan, no run, shortish delivery outside off stump, Ishan cuts to point
Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, googly from Shreyas Gopal, Suryakumar goes back and knocks it to long-on

Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, whata a way to bring up the fifty - off 29 balls. Flighted delivery outside off stump, Suryakumar leans forward and lofts the drive inside-out handsomely over cover. Gentle raise of the bat to the team and the crowd
Shreyas Gopal to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, races down the pitch and slogs this to deep mid-wicket
Shreyas Gopal to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, Ishan knows he's going to bowl short, it's down the leg side and he helps himself to a boundary with a pull shot behind square on the on-side
Stokes to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, slower delivery outside off stump, Ishan cuts it towards point, actually chops it off the under edge
Stokes to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, slower delivery on the stumps, Suryakumar drives it to mid-on
Stokes to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, that's clever placement, just opens the bat face at the last moment and guides this past point, big ground and they easily come back for the second
Stokes to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, jumps out and yorks himself, hit to mid-off

Stokes to Ishan Kishan, SIX, oh shot! Hit on one leg. Stokes tried a similar ball to the previous one, Ishan connects with the pull this time despite being cramped for room and it hits the backward square leg rope on the full
Stokes to Ishan Kishan, no run, Stokes comes round the wicket and gets this short of length delivery to angle into Ishan, the flick shot missed and it hits the thigh pad and rolls into the on-side
Shreyas Gopal to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, needless to say that it's another short ball from Shreyas Gopal, Ishan pulls to long-on
Shreyas Gopal to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, is this a bit of strategy - to bowl short and get the bigger boundaries in play? Kishan pulls off the back foot to deep mid-wicket
Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, another short ball that's too short, the googly again, Suryakumar pulls to deep square leg

Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, Archer dives but fails to stop the ball at deep mid-wicket. Short delivery on the stumps, Suryakumar pulls, deep mid-wicket runs to his left, actually got there but made a mess of it
Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, wide, oh what was that? The seam-up ball bowled at 115kph goes down the leg-side and tests Buttler, who manages to do well
Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, way too short, pulled off the back foot, Gowtham runs to his right from long-on and cuts it off
Shreyas Gopal to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, lovely hit from the middle of the bat for this sweep shot, but deep mid-wicket tidies up

Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, this time he connects with the sweep, he actually played this with one hand. This line is a little more straighter than the previos one, Suryakumar hits the big gap at deep backward square leg
Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, shout for LBW, shake of the head from ump Tucker, maybe impact was outside off. Suryakumar misses the sweep to this full ball, lucky that it hit him outside off
Gowtham to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, shortish and on the stumps, Ishan mistimes the pull through mid-wicket
Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, spinning back in, Suryakumar goes back and drives to long-on
Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, Suryakumar gets a thickish inside edge that rolls toward deep mid-wicket and they rush back for two, this is a big outfield
Gowtham to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, flatter and on the leg stump, Ishan goes back and punches it through mid-on
Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, oh this swung back in late and hurried Ishan on the flick, the ball rolls towards mid-wicket off the inside edge of the bat
Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, change of pace, Suryakumar gently pushes this wide of mid-off for a run
Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, slower delivery just outside off stump, Ishan taps it wide of point for a run
Unadkat to Ishan Kishan, no run, good comeback from Unadkat, saw Ishan jumping out and kept him calm with a short of length delivery with no space, Ishan hops and defends

Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, direct-hit but Ishan Kishan is home despite a late take off for his partner's call. Suryakumar worked this to mid-on and set off, Ishan waited for a wee bit before running

Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, massive space for sale beyond mid-wicket and Suryakumar Yadav, who is not afraid to walk across the stumps, meets this length ball with a flick to the right of mid-wicket and greets Unadkat with a boundary first up

D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, looked like it was going to either short third man or backward point for a moment, but Ishan Kishan has managed to split them with this uppish cut. Poor delivery from Kulkarni, gave too much width. Mumbai have picked up pace
D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, fullish and just outside off stump, Suryakumar works it away to long-on

D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, unbelievable hit! Suryakumar Yadav is very, very good with that pick up shot of his. He's moved across a touch to this fullish delivery on the stumps and whipped away with his lovely wrists with great timing, all the way over the long-leg boundary
D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, fullish and outside off stump, Ishan drives it towards deep point

D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, SIX, has he hit that alright? Oh yes he has! Been trying a few shots, but he's bravely raced down to a bowler who's kept him calm, the best part about it was he picked this slower ball, got into great position and absolutely smashed that over long-on. First six of the night for Ishan
D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, no run, superb-looking off-drive, but hit straight to mid-off
Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, 145.1kph, nice and straight, pushed towards mid-on

Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, 144.5kph, that's nicely picked away off the hips by Suryakumar Yadav. Another pacy short of length delivery, actually on the stumps, but Suryakumar got inside the line and helped it away past the man at 45

Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, oh dear! Nasty blow, a 141kph shortish ball has smashed straight into the box. Jofra Archer was appealing for LBW. This one stayed down than Suryakumar expected, he was looking for the pull, but the lack of bounce foxed him. Is in pain, but looks okay

Jofra Archer to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, tap-and-run single from Ishan Kishan. Plays this to point off the back foot and set off, 148kph on that from Jofra Archer. Direct-hit at the bowler's end but the batsman was well home
Jofra Archer to Ishan Kishan, no run, 140.8kph, Ishan Kishan is struggling for timing here, again tries to pull another short ball, but doesn't get hold of it, played to mid-wicket
Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, leg byes, 1 run, 138.3kph, short of length delivery from Jofra Archer, Suryakumar misses the flick, the ball rolls behind square on the on-side

D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, no run, oh that's a brave hit from Ishan Kishan. He's got down low to a length ball from a pacer to try and guide it past short third man, unfortunate that he hit it straight to the fielder
D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, no run, slower delivery outside off stump, Ishan Kishan guides it into the off-side

D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, no run, in the airrr and just in front of short mid-wicket. Short ball on the stumps, Kishan loses shape on the pull shot, the ball hits him high on the bat and the ball doesn't carry to the diving fielder
D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, no run, a very watchful forward defence from Ishan Kishan, normally is free to play his shots, but he wants to get his eye in
D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, leg stump line and Suryakumar flicks this short of length delivery to deep square leg

D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, Suryakumar is a free-flowing player, tough to keep him calm and Kulkarni, in trying to search for swing, bowls a touch fuller and disappears. The outswinger doesn't swing, Suryakumar gets under it and lofts it easily over long-on, hit on the rise to an extent
Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, fullish and on the stumps, driven to long-on
Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, that's cleverly bowled by Gowtham. Didn't turn but gave this a bit more air and tempted Suryakumar to go for a big booming drive, play and a miss
Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, fullish and outside off stump, Suryakumar drives it to mid-off
Gowtham to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, flatter delivery on the stumps, Ishan leans forward and knocks it to mid-on
