Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, crahsed nicely off the back foot but the man at cover dives to his right and half-stops the ball, the length is again the shorter side from Gowtham

Gowtham to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, that's a freebie ball that Suryakumar has missed out. Flatter and down the leg-side, Suryakumar flicks, but finds the man at backward square leg, fine leg was in as well, so just needed to hit the gap
D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, no run, this lad seems to be having trouble against inswingers early on in his stint, was late in bringing the bat down and almost chopped this into the off-side
D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, no run, wow! That's a brilliant inswinger first up to Ishan Kishan, who bagged a golden duck previous game, just about manages to keep this out

D Kulkarni to Lewis, out Bowled!! This is what swing up front will bring you. Such a blunder it was from RR to bench Dhawal against CSK on a wicket that had a bit of grass. Lovely inswinger outside off stump, Lewis is not a keen mover of the front foot, just throws his bat at it to thrash the ball through cover, only manages an inside edge that shatters the sticks. Dream start from Dhawal Kulkarni. Lewis b D Kulkarni 0(1)

D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, uppishly pulled to short mid-wicket, Gowtham the fielder there diving forward, Yadav mistimed the shot against this shortish delivery and the ball landed in front of him, the ball ricochets away towards square leg
D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, this time the outswinger is a touch more wide, but it's not wide enough for Suryakumar to have a real crack at it, blocked off the back foot
D Kulkarni to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, gentle outswinger, but keeps the line very tight, just outside off stump and Suryakumar respects with a defence

Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Finch!! In the air, hasn't hit this well and Finch runs around to his left from long-off to take the catch. What a squeeze this is from KXIP. Shreyas Iyer is distraught and he looks towards the sky. The flatter delivery outside off stump, Shreyas slices the loft high in the air as the ball spun away from him. He wanted to go over long-off. Shreyas Iyer c Finch b Mujeeb 57(45) [4s-5 6s-1]

Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, inside edgeeee and it's past the dive at short fine leg. Lucky boundary and it's down to 5 runs off the last ball. Shreyas races down the pitch and slogs, gets a thick edge
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, not good contact again, shortish delivery on the stumps, Shreyas pulls to deep mid-wicket, in the gap, should have two and it's a fumble
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, no run, mistimed to long-off and he denies the single
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, smashed, short and outside off stump, Shreyas flat-bats the loft over long-off. Fifty up for Shreyas Iyer, good knock but he needs to connect them well from here on
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, no run, precious dot ball. Flatter and down the leg-side, Shreyas tries to pull and misses, gets hit on the pad

Barinder to Mishra, no run, oh he's missed the ball completely. The best ball for a batsman to smash one in the stands in the entire over. Mishra jumped out and gave his all, but only connected with thin air
Barinder to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, swings hard but doesn't connect well, slower ball outside off stump, Shreyas is unable to find the middle of the bat again
Barinder to Mishra, 1 run, Mishra moves across and tries to ramp it past short fine leg, but only hits it to the keeper. Could so easily have been bowled as well

Barinder to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, slower ball, swung away in the air and falls short of Finch at long-on. Good thinking from Barinder to bang the slower ones into the pitch and force the batsman to manufacture pace

Barinder to Plunkett, out Caught by Nair!! And what does he do first ball? Advances and connects well, but finds the fielder at deep backward square leg. It was a short slower ball, Plunkett wanted to flick that in the gap wide of deep mid-wicket, but hit it too square and too well. Plunkett c Nair b Barinder 0(1)
Barinder to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, slower ball on the short of length zone, Shreyas pulls and gets an under edge that rolls to mid-wicket

Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, out Caught by Rahul!! Got to be a slower into the pitch and it's done the trick. Maybe Andrew Tye won't mind about bowling the extra ball now with the wide call earlier. This was cleverly angled across the left-hander on a good length, Tewatia goes for a big slog and gets an edge that goes slowly to Rahul. Rahul Tewatia c Rahul b Andrew Tye 24(21) [4s-1 6s-1]
Andrew Tye to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, low full toss, Shreyas drills it to cover

Andrew Tye to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, talk about pendulum swing, this is exactly it. Shreyas guides this full ball straight to Yuvraj at backward point and sets off, Yuvi has a shy at the bowler's end and there's no one backing up, the man at deep mid-wicket now has a shy again and the ball goes to Yuvi again
Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, fuller length delivery on the leg stump, Tewatia flicks it to deep mid-wicket
Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, wide, Andrew Tye is not happy with this call from the umpire, has a chat with him, but that's just missed the mark with the line outside off stump and it's a fair call

Andrew Tye to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, in the airrrrr and just short of the incoming Finch. Full delivery on the stumps, Shreyas swings for a loft over the long-off fence, mistimes it, lucky that he didn't hit this well enough to carry to hand
Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, short ball, sliced in the air, doesn't carry to third man, Mujeeb keeps it down to a run
Barinder to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, very full, Tewatia tries to back away and swing, gets an inside edge that rolls to point

Barinder to Rahul Tewatia, 2 runs, slaps hard, hit pretty well, wide of long-off, oh no, Barinder fumbles the throw and Shreyas was well short of the crease. The bowler didn't realise he had to come close to the sticks, rushed very late and wasn't in a great position to collect the throw

Barinder to Rahul Tewatia, FOUR, what a timely hit! He's moved across the stumps, got down on his knees and paddled the fast bowler around the corner through backward square leg. Brave hit! Barinder missed the yorker again and offered a full ball on the stumps
Barinder to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, slower delivery just outside off stump, Shreyas goes back and flicks wide of long-on
Barinder to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, full toss and Tewatia is kind enough to mistime the slog to deep mid-wicket

Barinder to Rahul Tewatia, SIX, that's a brilliant hit under pressure. Barinder, why did you run in and bowl a full ball in the slot? He followed Rahul Tewatia who was backing away, but landed perfectly for Tewatia to tee off over long-off
Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, again cuts decently well, hits the gap this time but finds sweeper cover. Just five off that over
Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, no run, slower delivery, hit well after delaying the cut shot, but straight to backward point
Andrew Tye to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, length ball on the stumps, flicked to deep backward square leg
Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, leg byes, 1 run, that should have been put away, down the leg-side freebie, Tewatia misses the glance, the ball rolls to short fine leg off the thigh pad
Andrew Tye to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, rises tall and nudges this slower delivery behind square on the on-side

Andrew Tye to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, he's got down to a pacer and literally slog-swept him, that's because this slower but from Andrew Tye was way too short, hit powerfully but on the bounce to deep mid-wicket
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, cut well, test for the fielder at deep backward point and he does well with a sliding save. That was nicely crunched
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, overpitched and Shreyas drills it straight down the ground between the sticks and the non-striker, long-on and long-off had no chance
Mujeeb to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, nudged off the inside half of the bat to square leg
Mujeeb to Rahul Tewatia, no run, the googly and Rahul Tewatia has no clue. Fullish and outside off stump, spinning away outside off stump, Tewatia leans forward and tries to push, makes no contact
Mujeeb to Rahul Tewatia, no run, oh almost rolls back and hits the stumps. The one that comes back in, Tewatia was rushed in his defence, the ball this the pad and rolls towards the keeper
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, very full, spinning away, flicked nicely and wide of long-on, just a single though
Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, carrom ball to finish the over, Shreyas punches to long-off

Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, no run, it's only leggies or carrom balls to Shreyas Iyer at the moment, flicked to short mid-wicket, Rahul Tewatia takes off blindly, rightly sent back and he had to dive back in before Ashwin lit the stumps up at the bowler's end
Ashwin to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, the slider, punched down to long-off
Ashwin to Rahul Tewatia, no run, leans forward and defends, offies for the leftie by the way
Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, shortish and on the stumps, punched down to long-on
Ashwin to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, nudged to mid-wicket

Barinder to Shreyas Iyer, no run, the appeal was so loud and confident that the umpire was under a lot of pressure, fair on KXIP's part because they thought it was a genuine edge, but the fact that Shreyas Iyer immediately smiled and reviewed clearly suggested he didn't hit this. Maybe the ump should have originally given the benefit of doubt to the batsman, because the bat also hit the ground. Wide yorker, Shreyas Iyer tried to squeeze, missed it completely and there's no spike on UltraEdge. Review saves Shreyas Iyer
Barinder to Shreyas Iyer, wide, sprays it down the leg side this time, third wide of the bowler
Barinder to Shreyas Iyer, no run, good length delivery on the stumps, Shreyas defends it to the right of the bowler
Barinder to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, that's nicely steered down to third man past backward point by opening the bat face at the last moment
Barinder to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, tries the normal pace bumper, but mistimes the pull to long-on
Barinder to Rahul Tewatia, wide, that was a very late call for a wide. The slower ball bumper, yes, that's over the head, fair call
Barinder to Rahul Tewatia, no run, slower delivery outside off stump, Tewatia defends to the right of the bowler
Barinder to Rahul Tewatia, wide, that's well past the line outside off stump, easy call for the umpire
Barinder to Rahul Tewatia, 2 runs, top-edged pull shot, the short slower ball from Barinder, Tewatia fails to read the change of pace, gets away with it as there was no one at backward square leg

Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, out Christian Run Out!! 1 run completed. Ashwin was confident after whipping the bails off and he was spot on. Shortish from Ashwin, Shreyas flicks it wide of long-on, Mayank rushed to the ball and fired in a perfect through on the bounce and adjacent to the sticks. Ashwin shatters the stumps. The second run was on and Christian should have been a touch more quicker. TV umpire has a look and catches Christian a few inches short. Christian run out (Mayank Agarwal/Ashwin) 6(11)
Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, no run, a hat-trick of carrom balls, Shreyas punches it ito the off-side
Ashwin to Christian, 1 run, carrom ball again, Christian didn't pick that, wanted to drive through the off-side, the ball rolls towards mid-wicket
Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, the carrom ball now, spinning away, Shreyas punches it to cover-point

Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, off-spin was working alright against Shreyas Iyer in the previous over for Ashwin and he gets whacked trying to bowl leg-spin. Short and wide, Shreyas absolutely nails it off the back foot wide of cover
Ashwin to Christian, 1 run, and the leggie to the right-hander from Ashwin. Spins away, Christian goes back and drives through point
Mujeeb to Christian, 1 run, driven off the front foot to extra-cover, Ashwin fumbles and allows the run
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, very full and outside off stump, Shreyas digs it out to cover
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, no run, shortish and angled in, defended
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, no run, flatter delivery on the stumps, Shreyas defends
Mujeeb to Christian, 1 run, run-out check sent upstairs, the drive from Christian brushed Mujeeb's fingers and hit the stumps at the bowler's end, but Shreyas was always in, NOT OUT is the call
Mujeeb to Christian, no run, goes back and tries to flick, gets an inside edge onto pad
Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, no run, and again. He's not treading him much, so is coming in front and blocking to leg-stump
Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, no run, shuffles across his stumps and gets behind this one

Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, no run, Ashwin implores the umpire for an lbw. But the umpire's unmoved. Spun a long way from outside off and rapped Shreyas Iyer bang in front of off-stump. And the umpire's right. Ball-tracking shows that it's spinning down leg. Ashwin, then, is short of a review to waste. Not such a bad thing
Ashwin to Christian, 1 run, flights this a touch full and Christian lays into it with a drive to long-off
Ashwin to Christian, no run, blocked to cover. Was the carrom ball from Ashwin
Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, top-spinner on middle and off, Shreyas Iyer shuffles across a touch and clips it through mid-wicket
Mujeeb to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, carrom ball, Shreyas Iyer opens the face of the bat and picks a single to point. End of a stunning over that gave away two runs and sent back Pant first-ball
Mujeeb to Christian, 1 run, wrong 'un but the starting line is wrong. Starts on leg-stump and is an easy work-away to fine leg
Mujeeb to Christian, no run, carrom ball with a bit of bounce, and all Christian could do was go back and punch it back to Mujeeb
Mujeeb to Christian, no run, another one similar, Christian does the same. Blocks to mid-wicket and then shakes his head in frustration
Mujeeb to Christian, no run, googly that spins into the right-hander. Christian gets behind

Mujeeb to Pant, out Bowled!! Through 'im! Carrom ball from round the wicket this, and it spins in to cleave Pant into two. He's trying to clip it through mid-wicket, doesn't have his head around this variation (or Mujeeb's stock ball?) and succumbs. Pant b Mujeeb 4(7)
Ashwin to Pant, 1 run, slow and very full outside off. There's turn here again. Pant opens the face of the bat and picks a single to point
Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, bowling slow here again. Skids on and is clipped around into the leg-side
Ashwin to Pant, 1 run, skiddy ball that's been romped into the pads. Easy peasy. Turned round the corner
Ashwin to Pant, no run, gets some turn here. Flighted on off-stump, hits the deck and spins away. But not enough. Pant could open the bat face and control the spin
Ashwin to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, skids on on off-stump and stays a bit low, Shreyas Iyer plays it off the back foot and runs it round the corner
Ashwin to Pant, 1 run, starts with a slip. Slow and skidding on, Pant tucks that through mid-wicket

Rajpoot to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, beautifully sliced wide of backward point's leap and that's been let through by Mujeeb, who's running across from third man. Covers the ground, slides but can't stop the ball. Was almost in control but then wasn't
Rajpoot to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, short ball sitting up, and Shreyas Iyer pulls it with authority through deep mid-wicket
Rajpoot to Shreyas Iyer, no run, stays back and defends this back of a length delivery to mid-wicket
Rajpoot to Shreyas Iyer, no run, stretched on his front foot and defends to mid-off
Rajpoot to Shreyas Iyer, no run, again. The ball's at him before he reacts. they appeal but there's no review. Who knows. High, the ball-tracking says
Rajpoot to Shreyas Iyer, no run, a controlled outside edge off the back foot as Rajpoot is pace again. Beaten for pace more than anything

Andrew Tye to Shreyas Iyer, 5 runs, oh dear, that's runs on a platter. Shreyas Iyer waits for the leg cutter and nudges that away to mid-wicket, where Miller is in some hurry. He does well to run in all the way from the deep but gets rid of the ball in haste to try and stop the second. Aaaaand his aim's horrendous here. Spews it along the ground and in front of the wicket at the non-striker's, and that runs away. Past the bowler's hands but wait.. there's Finch backing up right next to the bowler. He'll field it, right? Nah. He lets it away too. Gee. The ball hits the boot and deflects away into oblivion
Andrew Tye to Pant, 1 run, cramps him for room with a shortish delivery and Pant arches back beautifully to tap that with a 135-degree bat to third man
Andrew Tye to Pant, no run, all cutters. Decking away, Pant reaches across and bunts it away

Andrew Tye to Gambhir, out Caught by Finch!! They all want to go home. Gambhir is a bit early into tucking this seam-up delivery on a back of a length, and pops a leading edge to mid-off. Sticky Kotla? Certainly for Delhi, now. Gambhir c Finch b Andrew Tye 4(13)
Andrew Tye to Gambhir, no run, knuckle ball perhaps that's been strewn across Gambhir. Patted awkwardly to cover
Andrew Tye to Gambhir, no run, fast leg break with extra bounce, and all Gambhir could do was be chained in his crease and tap it into the ground
Rajpoot to Gambhir, 1 run, pulls it round the corner and keeps strike to deep square leg

Rajpoot to Maxwell, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! They're checking Rajpoot's front foot but he's fine. A bit of a sudden rush of blood from Maxwell, but he bats like that, doesn't he? Didn't read the cutter that was pitched on a back of a length, went for the mightly hack across the line and sliced it off the toe-end to deep mid-wicket. There were two other fielders running back from inside the ring but that was Tye's catch all the way.  Maxwell c Andrew Tye b Rajpoot 12(10) [4s-1 6s-1]
Rajpoot to Maxwell, no run, a bit taken aback by the pace there. Extra bounce on this cross-seam delivery, and Maxwell gets it off the inside half as he looks to work it around
Rajpoot to Gambhir, 1 run, 139ks on a back of a length, Gambhir tucks it to backward square leg

Rajpoot to Gambhir, wide, now goes full throttle with pace and overdoes the short length. Flies across Gambhir, who was first interested in dragging the pull from outside off but then lugged out of it. Imagine if the length was alright and not too ambitious..
Rajpoot to Gambhir, no run, cuts his fingers across the seam, so this fullish delivery is staying low. Gambhir keeps it out, closing the bat face to square leg
Rajpoot to Gambhir, no run, full ball, Gambhir checks the drive back at the bowler
Andrew Tye to Maxwell, no run, another ramp and another fail. He's lost his balance this time as he goes for another pacy delivery that's been banged in. Misses it by a mile. No sound

Andrew Tye to Maxwell, no run, where did the sound come from? But no appeal from KL Rahul. A pacy delivery from Andrew Tye that Maxwell wanted to ramp over the keeper. Probably got a toe-end on it but nobody heard. Ashwin was in two minds but he had to trust KL there. Pull those cotton plugs out from his ears, Ash!
Andrew Tye to Maxwell, no run, he's been outsmarted by Andrew Tye here. Maxwell makes room and takes a step down the wicket, only to be utterly embarrassed by the slower delivery

Andrew Tye to Maxwell, SIX, that's flown away like it belongs to the stands. Full pace at 136ks and steaming into the pads, and Maxwell's just flunked it over backward square leg with a bat swing. Sounds easy, right?
Andrew Tye to Gambhir, leg byes, 1 run, knuckle ball that invites an lbw shout. but this pitches outside leg and then there could have been an inside edge, as Gambhir looked to work it leg-side
Andrew Tye to Gambhir, wide, even slower. Down leg and Gambhir has no chance at tha. Keeps that low outside leg-stump

Andrew Tye to Maxwell, 1 run, and now takes a single to get off-strike. Footwork in a bit of a mishmash, so he's stayed back in the crease and sliced a length ball to mid-off. Perhaps checked his shot to made do with Tye's cutters
Rajpoot to Maxwell, 1 run, keeps strike to mid-on here
Rajpoot to Maxwell, no run, a vintage Yuvraj dive at cover-point saves a boundary here. Was hit pretty well by Maxwell but Yuvi flings sideways and puts a plug on even the single

Rajpoot to Maxwell, FOUR, timing isn't something Maxwell has made a name out of, but if these continue, we'll need a rethink. Archaism, I tell you. Gets a delivery on the pads and times the hell out of it through mid-wicket

Rajpoot to Prithvi Shaw, out Bowled!! That's not a bad debut at all. Dropped a catch in the first innings but walked in to bat in all his elements. Was a bit overamibtious here, you could say, and Rajpoot has beaten him with a 134ks delivery. Shaw tried a hack across the line, missed the seam-up delivery and lost the top of his off-stump. Prithvi Shaw b Rajpoot 22(10) [4s-4]

Rajpoot to Gambhir, 1 run, oh dear. Typical Gambhir running. Taps it to point and runs a risky single. The intent is right -- to get Prithvi Shaw on strike -- but the non-striker rushes back in as the fielder misses his throw. A direct-hit could have been fun, I'm telling you
Rajpoot to Gambhir, no run, around off-stump and Gambhir nudges it to square leg. Wanted the single that wasn't there. Hurries back into the crease

Barinder to Prithvi Shaw, 2 runs, uppish, ambitious and smells like teenage. Swivels on his toes and pulls this short ball uppishly over mid-wicket. Lands safe and is pulled back in the deep (if there's something like that at Kotla!)

Barinder to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, that's a bit ambitious.. and he's gotten some lucky runs here. Stays back and wants a stylish and uppish back foot punch through covers. Not in control of the bounce and the outside edge flies over the lone slipper in place
Barinder to Gambhir, 1 run, GG nicely tucks one off his pads and hands the strike back to Shaw. He's got such a mature head on his shoulders

Barinder to Prithvi Shaw, 3 runs, back of a length and Prithvi Shaw would have liked to do more with it. Dragged wide of mid-on, but he had his weight wrong there. Not quite back, so not in control of this pull shot

Barinder to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, wow, get the thesaurus out. That's been cracked away with utter disdain. Short and wide yeah, but look at the sound the bat makes. Pinches the slightest gap at point and lasers it away
Barinder to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, throws his hands at this wide ball that's been angled across by Barinder from over the wicket. And gets away. Backspins and beats the keeper to his left

Rajpoot to Gambhir, no run, Ashwin reviews. Makes sure first with the keeper that it was straight enough and then goes for it. Last ball from Rajpoot  was the one that shaped away and beat Gambhir, and this straightened and slithered on to rap Gambhir's front pad's flap. But tell you what, this is just a bit naff, this review. Pitches almost a foot outside leg-stump, and it's not out -- just as the on-field umpire thought

Rajpoot to Gambhir, no run, Gambhir's in that phase of his career. But if you talk about it, he's made a career out of it. Fiddling outside off to a ball skidding across him. Too wide. Shouldn't have tried to defend it. He does and is beaten
Rajpoot to Gambhir, wide, it's an inswinger from over the wicket to the left-hander but it's been sprayed down leg. Just the wrong starting line. Keeper does well with a leap to his right
Rajpoot to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, goes full and is flicked wide of mid-on

Rajpoot to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, pumped over mid-off for first IPL runs. It wasn't as close as you want to hear it was. Chipped the loft over Ashwin, who's tall enough. Good use of the length ball and the slight width that Prithvi Shaw used to use his arms into effect
Rajpoot to Prithvi Shaw, no run, fuller at 135ks with a bit of shape. Swings away and Prithvi Shaw closes the bat face towards mid-on
Rajpoot to Prithvi Shaw, no run, starts with a back of a length delivery that does a bit off the pitch. Skids on and decks away, and a back-footed Prithvi Shaw taps it back with a flat bat

Boult to Andrew Tye, out Bowled!! Dragged on. Boult goes back to his trusted full-wide yorker. Tye loads up for yet-another-hoick, giving it his all in his swing. Gets some bat for a change, it's the inside-edge and it's chopped onto off. A four-run-wicket final over, you really can't get greedier. Andrew Tye b Boult 3(9)
Boult to Andrew Tye, no run, another almighty heave. Another almighty miss. The lack of pace the undoing. Yet again
Boult to Andrew Tye, 2 runs, fullish on the pads. Flicked away wide of long-on. Never mind Maxwell, he takes him on, and does it well
Boult to Andrew Tye, no run, hits a good length on middle. Shaping back in after threatening to go across, under the flat-bat, off a pad kiss. Nah, no leg bye now, it's to the keeper
Boult to Barinder, leg byes, 1 run, full, straight, slow. Sran misses, but his pad's good enough to send it into a gap

Boult to Ashwin, out Caught by Rahul Tewatia!! Wide yorker, well in the allowed-zone this time. Ashwin stretches, and he knows there's nobody square of the wicket in the deep. All he has to do is clear point. Tries squeezing his steer, but ends up spooning it out to backward point, where Tewatia times his jump superbly, reverse cupping. Ashwin c Rahul Tewatia b Boult 6(7)
Boult to Ashwin, wide, angling across, a little too much so
Plunkett to Andrew Tye, no run, he's having fun. Full, slow, Tye like a true tailender wants to swing and launch it into the stands, anywhere. The ball sneaks under
Plunkett to Ashwin, byes, 1 run, 113.5kph, well-directed bumper. Dug in, taking pace off, and subsequently taking Ashwin's timing off from his lined up pull. Pant's messy behind though
Plunkett to Ashwin, 2 runs, goes after the width, slicing it to sweeper. Shaw's arm isn't the quickest to deny them the second
Plunkett to Ashwin, wide, 135.1kph, hopes to follow Ashwin's backing away blockhole again. Just that he's shuffling in, stealing a wide
Plunkett to Andrew Tye, 1 run, slower predictably. Tye goes through another heave across the line, chipped up to deep square leg
Plunkett to Andrew Tye, no run, 133kph. Wild slog. Never mind the wide line, never mind the fullish length. Tye's going through. And obviously not getting anything
Plunkett to Ashwin, 1 run, low full toss, following Ashwin's move-away. Hacked down to long-on
Christian to Ashwin, 1 run, continues cramping for room, getting it to zip back in. Knocked down to long-on
Christian to Andrew Tye, leg byes, 1 run, nipping into the thighs again, slowly. Tye's on the big-hoick this time. Misses but it's off the body to short third
Christian to Andrew Tye, leg byes, FOUR, slower in on the pads. Tye can't connect, flicking well before it gets there, rebounds and runs very fine, under Pant's late dive

Christian to Miller, out Caught by Plunkett!! Add another to his repertoire. When he doesn't have the ball in hand, the ball will follow him in the field. A full floater from Christian, inviting an away from the body drive. Sliced uppishly, flat and Plunkett at deep sweeper dives forward. The catches can be taken again. Miller c Plunkett b Christian 26(19) [4s-1 6s-1]
Christian to Miller, 2 runs, heaved away, all muscle in front of square

Christian to Miller, FOUR, to third man, splits the slips. One slower ball too many, Miller's already standing exposing his stumps, swings in desperation and the fat edge is enough to run through the cordon. Who'll plug these in the 18th over ..
Plunkett to Miller, 1 run, 118.9kph. Slower again. Miller's doesn't read, commits to going across the line in a hurry and drags it onto his pads. Quiet five runs
Plunkett to Ashwin, 1 run, bouncer. Delhi's slow enough, so is 119.3kph on this one to allow Ashwin to go up tall, wait and work his wrists to fine leg
Plunkett to Miller, leg byes, 1 run, 141.3kph. Nipping in sharply off a length, cutting back in to beat the bat, find the pad. They'll pinch the ricochet
Plunkett to Ashwin, 1 run, 123.8kph, slowed up again. Inside-chopped towards slip
Plunkett to Miller, 1 run, slower cutter. Miller waits to open up his bat face in guiding it behind point

Plunkett to Nair, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! The time-out syndrome. Nair had to kick on, and he decides to do it with a lofted whip. The ball just doesn't come on, sticks, grabs the inside half of his bat and for a change somebody can catch. But Iyer almost keeps up with the trend - running across from long-on and juggling. Just. Nair c Shreyas Iyer b Plunkett 34(32) [4s-4]
Mishra to Nair, 1 run, keeps up with the darts. Slapped away to long-off. 16 off this one

Mishra to Nair, FOUR, another one in anger. Oh Mishra, typically after a catch being put down takes his frustration out by going fast, on the pads and Nair cashes in with a sweep, drilling it perfectly to split the two fielders behind square
Mishra to Miller, 1 run, another flat dart on middle. Worked away with the turn round the corner
Mishra to Miller, wide, free wide googly, he's firing it in anger. Not bothered
Mishra to Miller, SIX, downtown. Talk about rubbing it in. Two lives, and a celebration with a hoick straight down. All muscle, perbably denting the sightscreen
Mishra to Nair, 2 wides, fired well down leg. Too much so for Nair's paddle to come out right as well
Mishra to Miller, 1 run, to the pitch, using the spin to work it down the ground

Mishra to Miller, no run, now Prithvi. Oh these catches keep going down -- the simplest of them. Miller is foxed by the wrong 'un, again, as he goes deep in the crease to some-sort-cut. Chipped up, straight to extra cover in the ring. Shaw gets both hands, perhaps closing them a little too early. Debut nerves
Rahul Tewatia to Miller, 1 run, tries going after another drag down. It's the common under edge, this time to short third man
Rahul Tewatia to Miller, 2 runs, on the move as he backs away and flat-bats this down to long-off
Rahul Tewatia to Nair, 1 run, sweeps, nailing it behind square

Rahul Tewatia to Miller, 1 run, put down. Maxwell of all people. Miller decides to go onto his back foot, slaps, uppishly without control and extra-cover couldn't have been found any better. Maxwell's surprised too, and the surprise means there's nobody backing up his throw as well

Rahul Tewatia to Miller, no run, 85.2kph, darted wide, way outside off. Miller doesn't need to reach out, but he still does. And by the time he realizes it's already late .. too much so to widthdraw. Has to make his peace with the inside edge
Rahul Tewatia to Nair, 1 run, opens up his bat face, clearing the front leg to cream it to a wide long-off
Mishra to Nair, 1 run, goes back sweeping. Picks out the man behind square
Mishra to Nair, 2 runs, gets a full toss. Nair's one-legged mow is also cleanly timed, but the man at cow corner is way too quick to run across and intercept
Mishra to Nair, no run, down to sweep, trying to put the drift going down leg to good use. Gloves it to the keeper. It's all going Delhi's way
Mishra to Miller, 1 run, flighted fuller going across outside off, 82.8kph. Miller leans, gets to the pitch of it in driving it to long-off
Mishra to Miller, 2 runs, a lot more in front of square this time. Similar rocking back cuts
Mishra to Miller, 2 runs, 81.5kph, rocks deep, uses the spin going away to slice it giving Shaw at deep sweeper some mopping
Avesh Khan to Miller, 1 run, 145.4kph, walks into the line, knocks it in front of mid-off. And takes him on
Avesh Khan to Miller, no run, 145kph. Oh the fizz. Spits up off a length, angling across perfectly and Miller welcomes himself with a tentative forward prod, only for the ball to zip past

Avesh Khan to Yuvraj, out Caught by Pant!! The inside-edge luck runs out. And eventually the inside-edge takes him to his doom. Blame it on his feet refusing to move, yet again. Avesh keeps it on a back of a length, Yuvraj loads up again to flat-bat across the line. Inside-tickle, and no matter how loud Kotla is, the nick is louder. Yuvraj c Pant b Avesh Khan 14(17) [4s-1]

Avesh Khan to Yuvraj, FOUR, 141kph. And an inside edge allows Yuvraj the move on. He tries going against the line, pulling, without judging the length not being short enough .. inside half, and Pant diving behind deflects it into fine leg
Avesh Khan to Nair, 1 run, fuller on middle. A squeezy-flick down to long-on
Avesh Khan to Nair, FOUR, inside-out. That's some welcome. A wobbly seam off a length, looking to follow Nair as he backs away. But he goes uppish, lofting up a drive over extra cover
Mishra to Yuvraj, no run, down leg. But such has been Yuvi's stay that he reaches out to it, sticks his bat down, ruins a wide, ruins some free runs, merely digging it out. He's surprised himself
Mishra to Nair, 1 run, 88kph, off the toe end in his wrist to long-on
Mishra to Yuvraj, 1 run, too full. Drilled down the ground
Mishra to Yuvraj, no run, now the googly. Yuvraj's in the middle of a troubled stay, tries poking. The feet refusing to move doesn't help either
Mishra to Yuvraj, no run, 86.2kph, slider. Yuvraj has no clue, waits for it to turn in with a commited ramp, realizes it isn't. Dunce
Mishra to Yuvraj, 2 runs, back deep, ticking it very fine. And the softness of it allows him to pinch the other
Maxwell to Nair, no run, tries reversing. The timing still stays lost
Maxwell to Nair, no run, giving no pace out. Just can force his drive through
Maxwell to Yuvraj, 1 run, 94.1kph, scooting low. Yuvraj's closed up early too as he tries turning it round the corner, more a leading edge towards cover
Maxwell to Nair, 1 run, 95.5kph, on the move down, gets cramped up to knock it through mid-wicket
Maxwell to Yuvraj, 1 run, low slingy float up outside off. Yuvraj lays in, carving it down to sweeper in the deep
Maxwell to Nair, 1 run, lean, stoop, whip to long-on

Mishra to Nair, 1 run, slower and outside off, skids off the deck as Karun punches this towards extra cover where Iyer makes a fine stop. Fires the throw towards the bowler's end but misses. There was a slight hesitation between the two batsmen, Karun was back in just in time
Mishra to Yuvraj, 1 run, slows it down around middle and leg, Yuvraj gets across and uses his reach to whip this down to long-on
Mishra to Yuvraj, no run, flatter trajectory once more, three of them on the trot after the toss up first ball. Yuvraj sits back and punches this towards cover
Mishra to Yuvraj, 2 runs, another quicker one and it's outside off, Yuvraj sits back and cuts it through backward point. In the gap and an easy brace
Mishra to Nair, 1 run, the slider around leg, Karun gets across and paddle sweeps it away towards fine leg
Mishra to Nair, no run, drifting in on a fuller length around off, Karun gets across and dabs it back towards the bowler. Soft leading edge
Christian to Nair, 1 run, back to the slower ball stuff, on a good length and it's punched down the ground towards long-on
Christian to Nair, no run, the bouncer from Christian and it's the normal pace delivery, Karun wanted to play the ramp but couldn't connect

Christian to Yuvraj, 1 run, back of a length outside off, the extra bounce surprises Yuvraj who adjusts to guide it towards short third man. The fielder there slipped on the slide and fumbled while gathering it, allowed the single easily
Christian to Yuvraj, no run, shortish and sliding into the thigh pad, Yuvraj gets across on the back foot and taps it towards square leg
Christian to Yuvraj, no run, beaten on the drive! Slower ball from Christian, expect loads of these from him especially on this pitch. Yuvraj went for the flashy front foot drive and got beaten
Christian to Yuvraj, no run, back of a length just outside off, Yuvraj stays back and dabs it towards point
Plunkett to Nair, no run, back of a length wider outside off, Nair stays back for the cut and chops it towards cover
Plunkett to Nair, no run, angling in from just outside off, defended well off the back foot
Plunkett to Yuvraj, 1 run, very full and just around off, Yuvraj times the drive well towards mid-on and gets off the mark with a quick single

Plunkett to Mayank Agarwal, out Bowled!! The off pole has gone for a walk! What a sight for any fast bowler and Plunkett is thrilled! Horror stroke from Mayank though and he has wasted another start. Slightly short of a good length around off, this was just above 145kph and that's what probably foxed Mayank who was expecting the slower ball. No excuse for the shot though, a wild slog across the line and misses it completely. Ruffled his pad before crashing into the stumps. DD are right on top here. Mayank Agarwal b Plunkett 21(16) [4s-3]

Plunkett to Nair, 1 run, slower bouncer and Karun got inside the line nicely before guiding the pull down the leg-side. Avesh at fine leg was squarer but covered a good amount of ground to ensure that just a single was taken. Great effort!

Plunkett to Nair, no run, kept a tad low! Early signs that this is a slightly two-paced surface. At least, it seems so. Back of a length around off, Karun was on the back foot and just got his bat down in time. Stabbed to mid-wicket
Christian to Nair, 1 run, fuller ball on middle and leg, worked away through mid-wicket for a single

Christian to Nair, FOUR, smart from Christian but Karun is smarter. Slower and short outside off, probably foxed the batsman initially but he adjusted well in the end. Stood tall and waited before guiding it past short third man. Mishra was probably a bit slow as well to come down on the slide and Christian clearly wasn't happy with the effort
Christian to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, smashed away hard but straight towards sweeper cover. Shortish and wide outside off, Mayank cracked this right off the middle but couldn't place it better
Christian to Nair, 1 run, back of a length angling into Nair, this is the normal pace delivery and punched off the back foot towards long-on
Christian to Nair, no run, another slower ball that sticks onto the pitch a touch, pushed off the back foot towards Christian
Christian to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, slower ball on a good length, Mayank gets back and flicks this through square leg
Avesh Khan to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, wanted to flat-bat this away but couldn't time it at all. Fractionally short and Mayank was on the front foot for the stroke. Mistimed it towards mid-on

Avesh Khan to Mayank Agarwal, 2 runs, more of the off-pace deliveries and it's short as well, Mayank waits on the back foot and slaps this through the covers. A bit of work for sweeper cover to do and the batsmen run two
Avesh Khan to Mayank Agarwal, no run, slower and shortish outside off, Mayank doesn't time the cut at all and gets a bottom edge towards backward point

Avesh Khan to Nair, 1 run, had to hurry! Had Maxwell's throw from backward point hit the target at the keeper's end, Mayank Agarwal could have been in trouble. He was a bit laxy in the running. Short of a length ball that was chopped towards the off-side, Karun wanted the single instantly and it was a regulation run too
Avesh Khan to Nair, no run, full once more and Karun gets forward to drive it nicely. This time straight towards short cover

Avesh Khan to Nair, FOUR, glorious! Top quality stuff from Nair! Half volley from Avesh but look at the execution. Textbook front foot cover drive on the up. Brilliantly timed and picked the gap as well
Plunkett to Mayank Agarwal, no run, very full and outside off, Agarwal gets his bat down in time and jams it to cover
Plunkett to Mayank Agarwal, no run, slower one from Plunkett once more, a bit wide and Agarwal waits before executing the cut. Straight to point

Plunkett to Nair, 1 run, off the edge! No slips at the moment and hence, Karun survives. Full and wide, he throws his bat at it without any footwork and the slice flies down to third man. Mishra makes a mess of the simple stop and nearly palmed it past the ropes. Luckily, the veteran gathered himself just in the nick of time

Plunkett to Rahul, out Caught by Avesh Khan!! Excellent catch! It's the young man Avesh Khan, you cannot keep him out of the action and this is a massive wicket for DD. The dangerous Rahul needs to depart. Clever from Plunkett, the slower ball on a shorter length and I don't think that Rahul picked this variation. Went across on the back foot for the short arm jab but got no pace to work with at all. Mistimed it badly and Avesh at short fine leg judged it brilliantly with a dive forward. Plucked it inches above the ground. Brilliant! Rahul c Avesh Khan b Plunkett 23(15) [4s-3 6s-1]

Plunkett to Rahul, FOUR, up and over! Cannot bowl this length in the Powerplay, not on a true surface like this one. Half-volley and Rahul lifts it straight over the bowler's head. Perhaps not middled as much as he would have liked but still got enough on it
Plunkett to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, very full and on the pads, nearly a yorker and Mayank jams it out towards mid-wicket

Avesh Khan to Rahul, no run, fails to connect! Third man was in the ring and Rahul fancied the slash over that man. To Avesh's credit though, he took pace off this shortish length delivery and that's what foxed the batsman in the end perhaps
Avesh Khan to Rahul, no run, back of a length just outside off, angling in and Rahul defends firmly off the back foot towards the bowler
Avesh Khan to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, back of a length wider outside off, a bit slower and steered through backward point for a single

Avesh Khan to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, kabooom! Mayank is off the blocks in a flash once more. Short of a length outside off, he just backs away a bit and hammers it on the up through the covers. Found the gap well and nobody really budged
Avesh Khan to Rahul, 1 run, slower and shortish around middle, pulled away through square leg for a single

Avesh Khan to Rahul, SIX, terrific stroke! Rahul is in some serious form and we've seen it already this season. Dug in short and angling into the body, he just shuffles across to get inside the line and uses the pace to control the pull. Easily over fine leg for a biggie

Boult to Mayank Agarwal, no run, cramped for room! This good length ball that kept coming in with the angle, Mayank wanted to run it down to third man and instead got a bottom edge that rolled towards short third man
Boult to Rahul, 1 run, tries the yorker but ends up as a dipping low full toss, Rahul shuffles across and glances it down to fine leg

Boult to Rahul, FOUR, would have been a wide if Rahul left this but he chooses to go after it. Didn't time it well enough, still clears the infield on the off-side comfortably. Shorter length slower ball that was lifted over cover
Boult to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, round the wicket and full outside off, nudged towards mid-off and they sneak a brisk single

Boult to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, delicious, absolutely delicious stroke! More width and the length is shorter as well, Mayank doesn't go hard at it, instead relies purely on timing and boy, didn't he time this or what? Stays back and guides it past the left of the backward point fielder and it raced away. Third man had no chance at all
Boult to Mayank Agarwal, FOUR, crashed away! Short of a length angling across Mayank, a bit of width and he stands tall to flay the cut through point. Cracking stroke!

Avesh Khan to Rahul, FOUR, streaky runs! Terrific end to what has been a sensational over from Avesh. On a good length just outside off, 143.7kph and Rahul was late on the forward push. Got a thick inside edge that just flew past leg stump and with fine leg really square, bonus runs for KXIP

Avesh Khan to Rahul, no run, what a cracker! Avesh is cranking it up big time (142.6kph) and is getting some spice off this Kotla surface as well. Back of a length just outside off, straightened with extra bounce after the initial inward angle. Rahul just poked tentatively at it and was beaten on the edge
Avesh Khan to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, full and on the pads, Agarwal works it away through backward square leg for a single

Avesh Khan to Finch, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Huge wicket! Just like Rahul, Finch is also beaten for pace in his first ball against Avesh and the young lad has knocked the Aussie off. Superb stuff and he is pumped up. Back of a length outside off, clocked 148.7kph and it did seem really fast off the surface as well. Finch too didn't help his cause as he just tried to use his hands to lift this away down the ground. Wasn't there for that shot, not with this kind of pace and he was late as well. Popped an easy catch towards extra cover. Finch c Shreyas Iyer b Avesh Khan 2(4)
Avesh Khan to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length and slightly wider this time, Rahul stays back and guides it down to third man

Avesh Khan to Rahul, no run, just short of mid-on! Good start for Avesh, this short of a length ball climbed onto Rahul who was late on the pull. Clocked 141.8kph on the speed gun and Rahul is lucky that this didn't go straight up. Heavy ball from the young man to start with

Boult to Finch, no run, woah, that was quite funny! Bouncer just around leg, Finch got across a bit and let it pass, expecting a wide but had to really stretch himself. The umpire makes a fair call though, that wasn't very far away from leg stump in terms of the line

Boult to Finch, 2 runs, finds the gap at cover! Full and angling across Finch from just outside off, he just uses his hands to time the drive and placed it well. Good tag team effort from the men in the ring who chased it down and saved a couple
Boult to Rahul, 1 run, pitched right up attacking the sticks, jammed off the front foot towards mid-on and they sneak a quick single
Boult to Finch, leg byes, 1 run, it's back to the traditional over-the-wicket stuff from Boult for Finch. Fuller ball on middle and leg, misses the flick and this rolls off the pads down to fine leg

Boult to Rahul, 1 run, direct hit could have removed Rahul! Hesitation in the single and in the end, he is lucky that Gambhir's throw from point at the bowler's end misses. Back of a length ball that was steered towards the off-side with soft hands, the DD skipper slided to his right and recovered quickly to fire the throw. Couldn't hit the target though
Boult to Rahul, no run, straightaway Boult starts from round the wicket. Interesting! Angles this full ball on off, accurate stuff and Rahul defends off the front foot towards mid-on

Basil Thampi to Mustafizur, out Caught by (sub)Deepak Hooda!! Sunrisers have pulled this off miraculously. Fifth loss for MI. Second lowest ever total defended in IPL history. What.A.Thriller. Final wicket razzmatazz: Short ball angled in, Mustafizur top-edged the pull before mid-wicket swallowed the swirling ball. Easy as you like. Mustafizur c (sub)Deepak Hooda b Basil Thampi 1(3)
Basil Thampi to Bumrah, 1 run, clears his front leg and clatters the ball off the splice of the bat, the ball keeps crawling down to long-on. Only a single
Basil Thampi to Bumrah, no run, Basil Thampi following Sid Kaul's footsteps, bowls it in that vulnerable zone outside off and beats the bat comfortably
Basil Thampi to Mustafizur, 1 run, 142ks, hurries onto the batsman from round the wicket, Mustafizz drags the pull wide of short mid-wicket to his left, could only gather a single
Basil Thampi to Mustafizur, no run, length ball in the channel, no feet from the Fizz, swishes the willow in hope and gets beaten on the outside edge
S Kaul to Bumrah, no run, full and swerving in at 129ks, Bumrah plants his front knee forward and swings, misses by a country mile
S Kaul to Bumrah, FOUR, angled in, all Bumrah needed to do was help the ball finds its direction, he swivels and manages decent contact on the pull to slam the ball backwards of square leg

S Kaul to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Basil Thampi!! Caught at third man. That's the end of Hardik Pandya and most probably the game for MI? Sid Kaul, you bewdy. Look at him go. Oh, give him a machine or else he might end up digging the pitch with his fists. Nice change of pace from him, bowls it far from off-stump of Hardik Pandya asking him to fetch from there. Pandya slogs and could only lob it as far as third man. Good running catch from Thampi. Hardik Pandya c Basil Thampi b S Kaul 3(19)
S Kaul to Hardik Pandya, no run, it gets more uglier now, aims the legside and throws everything at it, but the extra zip and bounce off the surface defeats Hardik Pandya

S Kaul to Hardik Pandya, no run, lovely bowling this from Siddarth Kaul, hits the seam hard and gets the ball to wobble slightly around fifth stump, an ugly swipe from Hardik Pandya, makes no connection whatsoever

S Kaul to Bumrah, 1 run, half-a-chance. Seam-up delivery, gets great bounce outside off, Bumrah runs it off the splice of the bat and it evades Dhawan to his right, he dived full length but could only manage a fingertip on that
Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, no run, a maiden over. Quicker legbreak, skids in and catches Hardik inside the crease as he defends gently
Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, no run, quicker delivery on off, Hardik can't get it away, forces the ball off the splice into the off-side
Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, no run, drifts in with the arm, Hardik works it to short fine off the bat face, thinks of a quick single and decides against it almost instantly
Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, no run, tosses it up just outside off stump, Hardik gets forward and blocks under his nose
Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, no run, legspinner outside off, bowled on a goodish length and takes the ball away from the batsman, Hardik pokes in hope and is beaten
Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, no run, flighted full on off-stump, Hardik drives to long-off and denies the single

S Kaul to Markande, out Lbw!! Can't get more plumb than that. Easier one for the umpire too. Full and straight from Siddarth Kaul, Markande went for the cross bat shot and missed the line completely. Gets hit low on the pad and looked guilty straightaway. No reviews left for MI. Siddarth Kaul is pumped up and so is the entire SRH team. Markande lbw b S Kaul 1(2)
S Kaul to Hardik Pandya, leg byes, 1 run, drifting into the pads from short of length, Hardik misses the flick and they steal a legbye as the ball rolls behind square
S Kaul to Hardik Pandya, no run, on a good length outside off, Pandya punches it towards cover
S Kaul to Markande, 1 run, short of length just outside off, Markande opens the bat face slightly and guides it down to third man

S Kaul to McClenaghan, out Lbw!! Nowhere near the line of the delivery, played all around it and was a dead duck. Siddarth Kaul got the ball to hold its line around middle stump and the ball didn't rise as much, McClenaghan was searching for it but couldn't prevent the ball from smashing his pads. Plumb. Just below the knee roll. Umpire S Ravi's finger went up instantly and in the meantime the duo looked to steal a non-existent single. McClenaghan was sent back and had to put in a dive.  McClenaghan lbw b S Kaul 0(2)
S Kaul to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, short ball outside Hardik's off-stump, he rides the bounce and runs it down to third man off the face of the bat
Basil Thampi to McClenaghan, no run, fuller and wider of off-stump, McClenaghan raises his arms and lets it go

Basil Thampi to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Huge wicket in the context of the game. Back of a length, angling into the hip, SKY's eyes lit up on seeing the short ball in that channel and he fell back onto his favourite shot in the cricket dictionary - the whip pull. Hit it too good and looped up in the air for deep square to take a straightforward catch. Suryakumar Yadav c Rashid Khan b Basil Thampi 34(38) [4s-4]

Basil Thampi to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, had Shakib collected the ball cleanly one of Hardik Pandya or Suryakumar Yadav would have been in trouble. Tapped from the crease, the ball just drops in front of Shakib at short cover before the duo took off in anticipation of a quick single
Basil Thampi to Hardik Pandya, no run, 139ks, tightens the screw around off and middle, in that in-between channel, blocked from the crease
Basil Thampi to Hardik Pandya, no run, pulls his length back and slants it around middle and leg, Hardik Pandya's front knee gets stuck in and he just plods at the ball tentatively into the leg-side
Basil Thampi to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, pitches if full and keeps it closer to off, SKY drives firmly with a straight bat towards long-on

Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, no run, nearly chopped on! The googly from Rashid, Hardik went back trying to cut that in front of his off-stump, the late spin and grip off the pitch caught his inside edge before popping over the bails. A classic case of so close, yet so far
Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, no run, 89.5ks, full and drifting in, bent forward in defence
Rashid Khan to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, plays against the spin this time, gets across, covers for the off-stump line and forces it down to long-on
Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, gets some width outside off, Hardik drives through cover and is off the mark with a single
Rashid Khan to Hardik Pandya, no run, legbreak, spinning away outside off, Hardik strides forward and lets it go

Rashid Khan to Pollard, out Caught by Dhawan!! Reminiscent of Sarfaraz Khan's dismissal against KXIP. Neatly guided down to lone slip. KP hung back to this legbreak and was wanting to glide the ball past the slip, the ball arrives much quicker and lobs low off the splice off the bat. Five down MI. Well judged catch from SD considering the pace and height on that. Pollard c Dhawan b Rashid Khan 9(6) [6s-1]

Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, that magical whippage from SKY. Don't think anyone plays the whip shot as good as this lad. Allows the ball to skid off the pitch and times the pants of it, deep mid-wicket and long-on nearly collide before a dive from the latter saved two
Shakib to Pollard, 1 run, getting too predictable is Shakib, just spraying it on the pads with the arm, KP manoeuvres him round the corner for an easy single
Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, full and very minimal amount of spin, SKY strides forward and rolls his wrists on the flick. Easy single
Shakib to Pollard, 1 run, shortens his length and darts the ball in with the angle, KP flails and manages an inside edge that nutmegs him before scurrying past short fine
Shakib to Pollard, SIX, full and right in KP's arc, he has no second thoughts. Just dismisses it out of his presence by using those long levers to full effect, sent into the galaxy. Over long-on
Shakib to Pollard, no run, slider, stays low on middle, pushed back gently down the pitch

Rashid Khan to Pollard, 1 run, first ball and KP thumps it down the ground, to the right of long-on where Manish Pandey shows good late reflexes to clasp the ball off and take the pace off. Slight misjudgment at that point would have resulted in a boundary

Rashid Khan to Krunal Pandya, out Lbw!! Much-needed wicket for SRH. Never looked close to the naked eye, but technology - as ever - always finds a way to surprise us. That quick release off the wrists from Rashid Khan, that canny variations off the front of the hand... Krunal Pandya unfortuantely didn't read it well. Was playing for the ball spinning into him and was a tad late in bringing his bat down. The ball zoomed back in at a rapid pace to catch him close for a lbw call. Not a confident appeal, but SRH make full use of the DRS system. Krunal Pandya lbw b Rashid Khan 24(20) [4s-4]
Rashid Khan to Krunal Pandya, no run, blocked
Rashid Khan to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, short and wide, Krunal takes full toll of it, rocks back and nails the cut behind square

Rashid Khan to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, dropped? Just grazes his fingertips. Fizzes in the quicker one on a fuller length, SKY got forward and got sucked into the drive, he miscued it off the cue end and the ball just evaded Rashid in his followthrough. He did well to bend low, but just couldn't lock his wrists
Rashid Khan to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, and guess what! He bowls a rank full toss, gets away with it though. Krunal went with the angle and hacked it through mid-wicket, there is protection in the deep
Shakib to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, uses those whippy wrists to work the ball down to long-on
Shakib to Krunal Pandya, no run, bowls that in-between length to keep the batsman honest, forward and defended
Shakib to Krunal Pandya, no run, Shakib sees Krunal jumping down the pitch and drops it short and wide, Krunal was made to fetch, adjusts well and blunts the ball down the pitch
Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, floated in full on middle and leg, clipped through mid-wicket

Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, drops it slightly short, but there's no turn. It just keeps sliding into SKY's pads and hits him around the thigh pad, SKY was tripped up by the lack of pace and couldn't connect with the pull
Shakib to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, sliding into the pads, Krunal tucks with soft hands into the leg-side and nabs a quick single
Rashid Khan to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, miserly opening over by Rashid Khan. Concedes only two runs in it. This was shortish around middle and leg, Pandya flicked it away to deep mid-wicket for a single
Rashid Khan to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, shortish delivery around off, Suryakumar has plenty of time to go back in his crease and pull it away to deep mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, full and fast around off, Suryakumar comes ahead and fends it
Rashid Khan to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, another quicker delivery outside off, Suryakumar pokes at it and gets beaten, could have easily edged that
Rashid Khan to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, inside edge but safe. Was the quicker googly perhaps. Around the off stump channel, Suryakumar brings his bat down and gets an inside edge past the stumps
Rashid Khan to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, starts off with a quicker delivery around off, Suryakumar plays an off-drive

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, poor delivery to end the over. Tries for a yorker and ends up bowling a full toss. Pandya doesn't miss out on the gift and drills it past the diving Williamson to gather the third boundary of the over. Expensive over by Kaul and Mumbai fans get their voice back
S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, good competition between bat and ball, this. Short of a length around off, Pandya does well to pummel it past the man at mid-on and get a four more

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, no run, Kaul certainly didn't like that boundary he conceded on that first ball. Bowls another shortish delivery and aims the helmet of the batsman, Pandya does well to sway from it. Loses balance and falls down
S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, no run, length ball around middle and off, Pandya camps back and eases it down to mid-on

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, no run, good comeback by the bowler after conceding a boundary on the first ball of the over. Pulls the length of the delivery back and angles it away outside off, Pandya looks to fend it but gets beaten due to the away movement

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, beautiful. What a cracking cover-drive that was. Full length delivery around off, Pandya transfers his weight on his right knee and creams it through cover. Right into the gap and the fielders could do nothing but admire the timing and placement on it

Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, comedy of errors in the deep. Slight misfield by Pandey at wide long-on but he's managed to save the boundary. Suryakumar flicked the shortish delivery to wide long-on where Pandey almost made a mess of it but Shakib gathered the ball quickly and kept the batsmen down to two

Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for the opener. Picks the length early on the shortish delivery, rocks back and slams it into the gap at cover. Sweeper cover is too square to cut it off as the ball wins the race

Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, he's been playing so well since he has been promoted. This was played very late by Suryakumar. Was a quicker delivery outside off, he went back in his crease and guided it sweetly past the man at short third man. No chance of stopping that
Nabi to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, bowls an arm-ball on leg, Pandya works it in front of square leg and gets off the strike
Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, short and quick outside off, Suryakumar is equally quick to camp back and punch it away to sweeper cover
Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, floated on middle, Suryakumar flicks it to short mid-wicket where a sharp stop by Williamson denies them a single

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, no run, so close to that outside edge again. Sandeep bowled a similar delivery to Lewis earlier in the innings. Full and swinging away from the batsman, Pandya is tempted into the drive and gets beaten in the end
S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, full length delivery outside off, Suryakumar times his cover-drive but Williamson is quick to sprint to his left and put in a slide and keep them down to a single
S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, shuffles a bit in the crease, moves to his right and plays the on-drive against a full length ball, straight to mid-on though

S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, this is what Mumbai Indians are in need of. Need a partnership and these two are trying to build one. Length delivery angled away outside off and Krunal runs it down to third man again
S Kaul to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, a wristy flick against a length delivery, fielder at backward square leg in action. Keeps them down to a single
S Kaul to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, starts off with a shortish delivery outside off, Krunal steers it down to third man off his back foot, jogs and gets to the other end

Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, terrific over, says Simon Doull on air. It indeed was. Only two runs and a wicket in Shakib's opening over. This was a flat and quick delivery, probably the arm ball as Suryakumar defends it down watchfully
Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, comes forward now. It's full and tossed up around off, Suryakumar comes forward and defends it calmly
Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, floater around off, Suryakumar goes back in his crease and keeps it down with a back foot defensive block
Shakib to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, flighted delivery on middle and leg, Krunal drives it down to deep mid-wicket and gets off the mark

Shakib to Rohit, out Caught by Dhawan!! Edged and taken! Shakib likes that, claps hard after getting the MI skipper. A flighted delivery outside off, Rohit looks to go big, tries to loft it over the in-field but as the ball turns away, it catches his outside edge and flies straight to the lone fielder in the slip. Dhawan makes no mistake and takes it. Mumbai Indians need a Pollard special tonight, it seems. Rohit c Dhawan b Shakib 2(6)
Shakib to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, a flighted delivery on middle and leg, Suryakumar drives it firmly to mid-on where Thampi stops it and keeps them down to a single
Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, no run, fullish on middle and leg, swinging into the batmsan too, Rohit pushes it back to the bowler. The required run rate is inching closer to the 7-run mark.

Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, 2 runs, off the mark is the Mumbai skipper. It was a shortish delivery outside off, Rohit went back in his crease and punched it towards cover-point where Shakib's failed attempt to stop the ball resulted in a couple
Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, no run, length ball around middle and leg, shaping into the batsman, Rohit has played that off his front foot to the right side of the bowler
Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, no run, pitches it up on a full length and well outside off, Rohit times his off-drive but can't beat Williamson at mid-off
Sandeep Sharma to Rohit, no run, length delivery outside off, Rohit stands tall and angles it away in front of point
Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, short of a length on middle and leg, nudged to short mid-wicket

Nabi to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by (sub)Deepak Hooda!! Duck for Kishan! This is why Nabi is in the team. There are many left handed batsmen in Mumbai's batting line-up, gets one of them. Tosses it up nicely and invites the batsman to come down the track. Kishan does so, goes for it and ends up spooning it up to long-off where the sub calls for it and hangs on to it. These wickets are making the match interesting. So far, so good. Ishan Kishan c (sub)Deepak Hooda b Nabi 0(3)
Nabi to Ishan Kishan, no run, tossed up delivery outside off, Kishan comes forward and blocks it down
Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, flatter one on middle, Suryakumar tucks that away to deep mid-wicket for a single

Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, shot, good shot! Picks the length early on that. Was a shortish delivery outside off, Suryakumar doesn't miss out on it and slaps it towards mid-off. Thampi who's manning that position slips as the ball beats him and goes through. That won't please the bowler
Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, another shortish delivery on middle and leg, Suryakumar camps back and whips it to mid-on
Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, short and quick outside off, Suryakumar rocks back and knocks it nicely to mid-off
Sandeep Sharma to Ishan Kishan, no run, a solid front foot defence by Kishan against a full length delivery to end the over.

Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! That's a well deserved wicket for Sandeep. Lewis never looked comfortable against him. This was another full length delivery with away swing written on it, as Lewis tried to flick it away, he got a leading edge to the man at point. Manish wouldn't miss out on that. Another failure for Lewis in his maiden IPL season, second on the trot. Lewis c Manish Pandey b Sandeep Sharma 5(9) [4s-1]
Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, no run, leading edge but safe. Full in length around middle and off, Lewis reaches for it and gets a leading edge towards the off-side, was on the ground though

Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, no run, this is an exhibition of swing bowling by Sandeep. How good he's with that. This was on a length around middle and off, Lewis tried to fend it off his back foot and got struck on the back leg, around the thigh region
Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, no run, so close to that outside edge again. Full length delivery outside the off-stump channel teasing the batsman, Lewis pokes at it and gets beaten all ends up

Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, FOUR, timed to perfection that was. Short of a length delivery angled away with a bit of away swing too, Lewis sits back in his crease and punches it through the gap at cover. Was in the air for a while but the placement was pretty good

Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, goes back in his crease against a shortish delivery and whips it nicely to the fielder at mid-on. Had it been a tad right to the fielder there, would have been a boundary
Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, flatter in trajectory on middle and leg, camps back and knocks it down, does Suryakumar
Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, another slider with a slingy action outside off, Suryakumar rocks back and punches it firmly to mid-off

Nabi to Lewis, 1 run, quicker delivery on leg, Lewis nudges it towards short mid-wicket and gets off the strike. That's his first run. Got out for a duck in the last match, this run will make him feel better
Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, sharp turn on that, pitched on middle and turning down leg, Yadav fends it awkwardly to short fine leg and gets to the other end
Nabi to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, poor delivery to start off. Short and wide outside off, Suryakumar Yadav reaches for it and punches it firmly through the gap at cover

Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, no run, ends the over with another fine delivery. Fullish in length and shaping away around off, gets struck on the pads as he fails to connect. A mild lbw appeal turned down by the umpire. An ideal start for SRH, this. Needs support from the other end if Sunrisers are to make a match out of it
Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, no run, another beautiful delivery by Sandeep. Full and shaping away from the batsman outside the off-stump channel, Lewis offers a tentative poke only to get beaten

Sandeep Sharma to Lewis, no run, that was in the air for a while, lucky that Lewis is still out there. Angled away from the batsman, swinging away, Lewis is on his back foot as he guides it in front of cover-point, was early on his shot there
Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, bowls a length delivery on middle and leg, Suryakumar tucks it away to deep mid-wicket to get off the mark with a single
Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, length delivery on middle and leg, Suryakumar stands tall and knocks it back to the bowler
Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, extra bounce on that occasion. Pitches it on a shortish length on middle and Suryakumar fends it down
Sandeep Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, wide, swing on offer straightaway. Bowls a full length delivery with a bit of inswing but it's down the leg side, Surya fails to connect his flick

Mustafizur to Y Pathan, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Good catch and that's the end of the innings. Pathan really smashed the pull but Rohit has kept all his athletic fielders on the fence. Hardik at deep mid judges it to a nicety as he takes it reverse-cup over his head. A smile breaks out after he completes the catch. Pathan can't believe that he hasn't cleared the fielder. Y Pathan c Hardik Pandya b Mustafizur 29(33) [4s-2 6s-1]

Mustafizur to Y Pathan, SIX, a smile from KW after that big hit. On a length and around off, too predictable these cutters from Mustafizur, Pathan stays back and lofts cleanly miles into the stands at long-on

Mustafizur to Y Pathan, no run, low full-toss outside off, Pathan thrashes it between extra cover and long-off, Markande runs and then dives to field the ball. Pathan isn't quick to come back for two, so he stays at his end
Mustafizur to Y Pathan, no run, looks to paddle the cutter angled across him, misses. There's a gap at deep backward square leg

Bumrah to Y Pathan, 1 run, had Evin Lewis hit direct, Sandeep Sharma would've been out. Steered to the West Indian and his throw misses to give Sandeep Sharma a reprieve. More importantly for SRH, Pathan is on strike

Bumrah to Y Pathan, no run, what fielding by Markande. At short third. Saved four. Dives to his left and comes up with the ball. Appreciated by Bumrah. Yorker length outside off, Pathan wanted to get it wide of the leggie, but failed to

Bumrah to Y Pathan, 2 runs, flat-bats the slower delivery straight down the ground, the ball has gone to Pollard at long-off. In the end he has to dive back to make it for two. Pathan didn't realise that the throw was coming to his end and then had to put in the dive. Anyway Ishan Kishan didn't collect the throw properly. Pathan was looking to see if Sandeep Sharma was safe or not
Bumrah to Y Pathan, no run, back of a length around off, Pathan muscles the pull in front of long-on. Again he can't place it to get back for two
Bumrah to Y Pathan, no run, short of length and at pace, angling in, defended with an open face to backward point
Bumrah to Y Pathan, no run, slower delivery outside off, crashed to sweeper cover and he won't take the single
Mustafizur to Sandeep Sharma, no run, yes he can. Angled in on a good length, on off, Sandeep Sharma defends it back down the track

Mustafizur to S Kaul, out S Kaul Run Out!! Confusion. Chaos. Gone. Long way out too. Finally Kaul gets bat on ball, driven to backward point where there's a slight fumble, Kaul is desperate to get to the other end, Pathan sends him back but Pandya has all the time to direct his throw back to Ishan Kishan who does the rest, even as he almost lost the ball while attempting the run-out. After he flicked the bails off, the ball slipped out. The third umpire completes the formalities. S Kaul run out (Hardik Pandya/Ishan Kishan) 2(9)
Mustafizur to S Kaul, no run, this is closer to the edge than the previous two, so close that it makes Mustafizur go up in a mild appeal for caught behind. Third cutter and you know the rest
Mustafizur to S Kaul, no run, he will bowl that all night, if he has to. Easy for Mustafizur, to bowl the cutter and beat Kaul with the natural angle across the batsman
Mustafizur to S Kaul, no run, cutter, angled across Kaul who drives and misses
Mustafizur to Y Pathan, 1 run, fullish around off, Pathan gets forward to drive to sweeper cover and takes the single on offer
Markande to S Kaul, no run, beaten. Lovely tossed up leggie, Kaul is beaten as he is ages late on the attempted front foot push to the off-side
Markande to S Kaul, no run, quicker leggie now, Kaul defends off the back foot to backward point
Markande to S Kaul, no run, quicker googly, Kaul somehow manages to get bat to prevent the ball from crashing into off
Markande to S Kaul, 2 runs, googly, spins appreciably into Kaul, who nudges it to the right of fine leg, scampers back for the second

Markande to S Kaul, no run, full on the middle and leg line, Kaul nudges to the right of short mid, Pathan doesn't want to take a quick single especially after what happened with his hammy in the last game against CSK

Markande to Basil Thampi, out Bowled!! Looks like Basil Thampi has only one shot in his arsenal. The cut. Very risky against a promising Markande. The leg-spinner fizzes off the deck and beats the late-cut, knocks the off-stump back. Not a very wise shot when he should be looking to give the strike to Pathan. Basil Thampi b Markande 3(6)

Mustafizur to Y Pathan, no run, the late dab to third man doesn't come off and Pathan has to be off strike for the next over. This cutter pitches around off and then grips the surface before bouncing over the attempted shot

Mustafizur to Basil Thampi, 1 run, Basil Thampi is living a charmed life. This sliced lofted hit eludes Evin Lewis at backward point, went over his head and then fell in front of Mitch M at sweeper cover. All this for a single
Mustafizur to Basil Thampi, no run, short of length on middle, Basil Thampi backs away and steers it straight to the fielder at backward point

Mustafizur to Y Pathan, 1 run, slower delivery, well wide of off, Pathan smashes the cut but manages to get just the single to the left of sweeper cover. Belted that, would've ideally liked to have found the gap
Mustafizur to Basil Thampi, 1 run, Evin Lewis sinks to his knees at backward point after the ball didn't miss him by much. Basil Thampi getting lucky with the cut, takes the single to third man
Mustafizur to Y Pathan, 1 run, a cutter, off-pace, on a good length, Pathan punches to the sweeper cover
Bumrah to Basil Thampi, no run, pitched up outside off, nice square drive, but straight to Evin Lewis at backward point. Either side of him and there would've been runs for the taking
Bumrah to Y Pathan, 1 run, back of a length outside off, run down to third man
Bumrah to Basil Thampi, 1 run, short at the body by Bumrah, Basil Thampi is lucky that he didn't time the upper cut, or else would've found the Fizz at third man

Bumrah to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Gone. Bumrah jumps up and down in delight. Angled in on a short of length on off, Rashid Khan was trying to run it down between the keeper and the wide slip. But finds Ishan Kishan who hangs on. He is catching all the snicks tonight, apart from those, his keeping has been shoddy. Rashid Khan c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 6(9)

Bumrah to Y Pathan, 1 run, Rashid Khan is hit on the right-thigh by a throw from Evin Lewis at backward point. Looks to be fine though. Risky single as they took on the West Indian, who missed the stumps but didnt' the leggie
Bumrah to Rashid Khan, 1 run, good length delivery outside off, Rashid Khan just uses the pace on that and lets it slide off the face for a single to third man
Krunal Pandya to Rashid Khan, 1 run, another quick delivery, Rashid Khan defends and gets it to the backward square leg region to keep strike
Krunal Pandya to Y Pathan, 1 run, quicker on middle and leg, Pathan nudges it wide of Ishan Kishan and looks at Rashid Khan, they take the single
Krunal Pandya to Y Pathan, FOUR, poor delivery and cut away. Short and wide outside off, Pathan had to miss backward point and he did that. Races away once it moved past that fielder
Krunal Pandya to Rashid Khan, 1 run, uses the feet and pushes it to long-off
Krunal Pandya to Rashid Khan, 2 runs, down leg again, Rashid Khan sweeps and the Fizz at deep backward square does well to get his body behind the ball to stop the boundary. Saved two
Krunal Pandya to Y Pathan, 1 run, down leg, swept wide of short fine leg
Krunal Pandya to Y Pathan, wide, down leg, Ishan Kishan fumbles and Pathan yells out to Rashid Khan to stay at his end. Rashid Khan was looking for the single off the fumble
Markande to Y Pathan, 1 run, half-stopped at backward point, but that's enough to keep it to one. Pathan cuts late and a diving backward point pushes it to the sweeper cover man coming forward
Markande to Rashid Khan, 1 run, connects with the sweep this time, brooms it to deep square leg
Markande to Rashid Khan, no run, slower and Rashid Khan picks it off the pitch, hangs on the crease and watchfully blocks
Markande to Rashid Khan, no run, goes for a sweep to another ripping leggie, misses. Turns away from the bat

Markande to Rashid Khan, no run, now rips the leggie, extra bounce too, Rashid Khan was backing away to cut and had to pull out of the shot at the last moment. The ball fizzed into Ishan Kishan's gloves

Markande to Nabi, out Bowled!! Nabi doesn't want to go. But he has to. He has been bowled here. He can't believe that the ball has hit the stumps. Superb googly, tossed up and invited Nabi to play the big shot. An almighty hoick to leg but only after the ball has missed the inside edge and clipped the top of middle and leg. Top-class bowling. Nabi b Markande 14(10) [4s-2]
Krunal Pandya to Y Pathan, no run, quicker and fired in on leg, Pathan pushes it back to Krunal Pandya
Krunal Pandya to Y Pathan, no run, slower and turns a bit, Pathan has it covered on the front foot
Krunal Pandya to Nabi, 1 run, quicker on off, defended towards the short mid region, wide of the fielder for a single
Krunal Pandya to Nabi, no run, this stops on Nabi who was looking to nudge it to leg. Soft leading edge and this time it falls in front of short mid. The ball is teasing that fielder
Krunal Pandya to Y Pathan, 1 run, chipped in the air but well over the short mid fielder, single to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Nabi, 1 run, tossed up on off, Nabi drives to long-off

Markande to Y Pathan, no run, that is a very ambitious appeal for lbw. Pathan is a huge man and with that big stride of his, always will get his front foot outside the line, this one is the leggie and the impact looks outside off and what's more it is spinning away. Hang on - MI have taken the review. Could well lose it. Replays show that the impact is outside off and that's MI's review gone down the gutter
Markande to Nabi, 1 run, tossed up outside off, Nabi eases it into the gap at cover
Markande to Y Pathan, 1 run, another googly, Pathan hangs on the back foot and works it to the leg-side

Markande to Y Pathan, FOUR, googly but wrongly directed, starts from middle and goes down, Pathan helps the sweep with one hand off the bat handle, good enough though to take the ball away from the man at deep backward square
Markande to Nabi, 1 run, slides straight on to middle, nudged to the leg-side
Markande to Nabi, FOUR, too short and begging to be hit. Nabi rocks back and finds the gap between long-on and deep mid with a hard pull. Right into the gap
Hardik Pandya to Y Pathan, no run, looked high and over the head of Pathan, but seems ok to the umpires. So Hardik Pandya will get away with that bouncer
Hardik Pandya to Y Pathan, wide, the short ball goes down leg, wide called
Hardik Pandya to Nabi, 1 run, now hangs back and slides this with an open face wide of the diving backward point
