Because it was so wide, it took Saha a little extra time to gather and then get to the stumps, which was enough for Gayle
Nabi to Rahul, 1 run, slightly uppish from Rahul as he lazily punches it back down the pitch, falls short of Nabi who can't gather cleanly
Nabi to Gayle, 1 run, length ball, skidding in towards off. Gayle lofts it on the bounce to long-off. He got it pretty high on the bat, which robbed him of the timing
Nabi to Gayle, no run, fired in on leg, glanced to short fine leg
Nabi to Gayle, SIX, down the track he comes and clobbers it! Just a casual swing of the arms to send it rocketing back over the bowler's head
Nabi to Gayle, no run, slides it in at the stumps from round the wicket, Gayle defends back
Sandeep Sharma to Gayle, 1 run, fair bit of respect shown to Sandeep by both these players. Gayle opens the bat-face to this outswinger and pats it behind point for a relatively quick single
Sandeep Sharma to Gayle, no run, good length ball curving away from off, tentative prod to point
Sandeep Sharma to Gayle, no run, swings away sharply outside off, Gayle deliberately gets his bat well inside the line to let it go. There are two slips waiting in case he decides to poke
Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, 1 run, ducking in on middle and leg, back of length, clipped away neatly to deep square leg
Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, no run, inswinger on a good length, bends into middle. Rahul is back in the crease this time, works it to short mid-wicket
Sandeep Sharma to Rahul, no run, Rahul straightaway walks down the pitch, trying to counter the swing. Good length ball, defended back

Rajpoot to Nabi, out Caught by Mayank Agarwal!! Lofted up, not much timing, and a good catch running in from Agarwal. He covered decent ground at long-off before diving forward with both hands. Five-fer for Ankit Rajpoot. Nabi c Mayank Agarwal b Rajpoot 4(2) [4s-1]
Rajpoot to Nabi, FOUR, sliced away over backward point for four. Useful from Nabi. Full and wide delivery, Nabi just about reaches it and then cleverly opens the bat face

Rajpoot to Manish Pandey, out Bowled!! Brilliant bowling. Turning out to be a great final over so far. He's varied it up nicely, so as to not become predictable. This one's almost in the blockhole and it's tailing in at a good pace. Slips under Pandey's slog and crashes into the stumps off the pad. Manish Pandey b Rajpoot 54(51) [4s-3 6s-1]

Rajpoot to Y Pathan, byes, 1 run, very smart. Pathan isn't expecting the bouncer and he's totally caught off-guard, to such an extent that he's ducking underneath the delivery in the final over. Pandey calls him through and nabs a bye
Rajpoot to Y Pathan, no run, full toss wide of off, Pathan flings his hands at it and edges it on the bounce to the keeper. Good planning from Kings XI. Going really wide
Rajpoot to Manish Pandey, 1 run, very wide delivery outside off, would have been called had Pandey not gone for it. Instead, he stretches out and toe-ends into the off-side
Andrew Tye to Y Pathan, no run, good ball to finish with. It's really full, stops Pathan from getting under it. Jammed back to the bowler
Andrew Tye to Y Pathan, FOUR, back of a length delivery on leg, Pathan helps it away past short fine leg. Tye immediately turned away, knew he had missed his mark horrendously
Andrew Tye to Y Pathan, no run, short ball, Pathan swings furiously for a pull but misses it. Good height on it from Tye outside off
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 1 run, pitched right up at the pads, whipped to deep mid-wicket

Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, FOUR, had to make a big effort to get to this wide slower ball, and then manufactures remarkable power to cover it over extra-cover. Highly valuable fifty from Manish Pandey. It's given the Sunrisers a score
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, no run, low full toss speared in on leg, beats Pandey's bat-swing and smashes him low on the pad
Ashwin to Y Pathan, no run, flat and wide, fires this carrom ball well outside off and out of Pathan's arc. Just inside the marker too. Well bowled
Ashwin to Y Pathan, 2 runs, cut away wide of sweeper cover, Pathan makes it back for the second. Good flat throw back to the keeper, but Pathan was quick
Ashwin to Y Pathan, 2 runs, played through mid-wicket, in the gap and they come back for two

Ashwin to Y Pathan, SIX, another one goes down, albeit a much difficult one. Mistimed slog from Pathan, Manoj Tiwary skirts along the square leg boundary, and then tips it over the ropes. His mind was occupied by his proximity to the ropes which made him fluff the chance too
Ashwin to Y Pathan, 2 runs, softly cut to point, they rush through for a single. Bad throw from Nair, concedes an overthrow
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, 1 run, works this flat carrom ball through mid-wicket

Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 1 run, dropped! It took an age for the ball to come down from the sky, and it bursts right through Agarwal's hands in the deep. Another big swipe from Pandey which he mistimes to deep mid-wicket. And another repreive

Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, slower back of length delivery outside off, sliced past backward point where Ashwin makes a sloppy effort. Shouldn't have let it go past him, but he does. Gives away two
Andrew Tye to Y Pathan, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, biffed down the ground. Toe-ender from Pathan, allows long-off to cut it off
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 1 run, full ball, Pandey hoicks and gets a thick inside edge onto pad. Lost his shape in going too hard
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, no run, slower ball outside off, lands in the blockhole and sneaks through Pandey

Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, no run, completely unbalanced in the crease as he tries slashing this away through point. His feet were in the air. Short of length ball, probably too close for the shot anyway. Beaten
Mujeeb to Y Pathan, no run, beaten again. Wonderful from Mujeeb. Bit more flight, making Pathan stretch on the front foot and turns it away from a length
Mujeeb to Y Pathan, no run, prods forward to a length ball which turns away from him, beaten on the edge. Clueless
Mujeeb to Y Pathan, no run, again, flat and quick from Mujeeb, pushed Pathan back in the crease and because he's not picking him, he's already forced to defend
Mujeeb to Y Pathan, no run, walks across in the crease and defends
Mujeeb to Y Pathan, 2 runs, paddled round the corner, played it nice and fine. Comes back for two
Mujeeb to Y Pathan, no run, hangs back to a back of length ball and blocks
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, SIX, he's tonked this over mid-wicket. Finally the acceleration from Pandey. Picks the ball from outside off and slogs cleanly
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, no run, in the blockhole, squeezed back

Ashwin to Manish Pandey, FOUR, bad misjudgement from Rajpoot in the deep. He lets this bounce in front of him and then weakly stretches out his hand, only to parry it over the ropes. Carrom ball on leg-stump from Ashwin, Pandey stood still and swiped it through square leg. Good contact
Ashwin to Y Pathan, 1 run, now a flighted leg-break, overcooks it in flight and is driven on the full down to long-off
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, 1 run, nowhere near the length after stepping out, another carrom ball, patted down to long-off
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, makes room against this short carrom ball and slaps it wide of long-off. Good sliding stop by Nair to cut it off
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, flighted well outside off, Manish gets a big stride forward and drives it to long-off
Mujeeb to Y Pathan, 1 run, that's risky from Yusuf, backed away to a slider, waited on the ball and then dabbed it towards short third man
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 2 wides, pushed through and drifting down the leg-side, Manish was looking to help it on its way and missed, so did Rahul, an extra run on offer

Mujeeb to Shakib, out Caught by Mayank Agarwal!! This was coming!  Shakib was struggling to get the young Afghan away, goes for the big mow over mid-wicket and holes out to long-on. He didn't pick this wrong 'un, came down the track, didn't get anywhere close to the ball, was eyeing the mid-wicket fence, got a fat leading edge on the lofted drive, high and towards long-on. Mayank settled under it and holds on. Shakib c Mayank Agarwal b Mujeeb 28(29) [4s-3]
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, tossed up on the stumps, Manish comes down the track and eases it down towards long-on
Mujeeb to Shakib, 1 run, the off-break from Rahman, came back with the angle and cramped Shakib for room, chopped away behind square on the off-side for a single
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, tossed up on the stumps, Manish backs away and punches it to long-off for a single
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 1 run, full and at the stumps, punched down towards long-on for a single
Andrew Tye to Shakib, 1 run, the slower ball from Tye, Shakib shuffles a long way across the stumps on the flick, gets an inside edge towards short fine
Andrew Tye to Shakib, 2 runs, yorker length delivery on the stumps, Shakib gets his left leg out of the way and clipped it past square leg, runs hard and comes back for the second run
Andrew Tye to Shakib, no run, that's a juicy full-toss and Shakib has missed it. Came down the track, got too close to the ball and it slipped past the outside edge

Andrew Tye to Shakib, FOUR, nicely played by Shakib, much needed boundary for SRH. Banged in short and just outside off, Shakib swivels across and helps it on its way, beats short fine and rolls away to the fence
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slower wide ball outside off, Manish reaches out and slaps it towards long-off for a single
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, Mujeeb tosses one on the stumps, worked away past mid-wicket for a single
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, tad too short and wide of off, Manish waits on it and runs it past the keeper. A diving stop at short third man prevents the boundary
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, no run, nicely bowled by Mujeeb, drifted this one back into the right-hander, Manish was looking to dab it late and is beaten past his outside edge
Mujeeb to Shakib, 1 run, Mujeeb dragged his length back and skids it through - wide of off, Shakib had to reach out for the cut and toe-ends it towards Gayle at short third man
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, fraction short and just outside off, punched down towards long-off for a single
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, no run, pushed through outside off, Manish backed away on the cut and mistimed it back at the bowler
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 1 run, yorker length delivery outside off, Manish brings his bottom-hand into play as he drags it towards long-on
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, no run, back of a length and just outside off, ideal pace for Manish and he only manages to find the fielder at short third man
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, no run, another slower short ball and Manish is beaten all ends up. Tries to dab it towards third man, but the ball never came and he ended up with a limp waft

Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, another slower short ball and Manish is done in by the lack of pace. But the mistimed shot allows him to come back for the second run after the ball trickled towards square leg
Andrew Tye to Shakib, 1 run, banged in short and just outside off, hurried Shakib on the pull, he mistimes it towards mid-wicket for a single
Andrew Tye to Manish Pandey, 1 run, the slower leg-cutter from Tye, Manish was through with his shot even before the ball arrived, ended up clumsily stabbing it towards point for a single
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, nicely tossed up on middle, Manish gets half-forward and works it behind square on the on-side for a single
Mujeeb to Shakib, 1 run, slower and shorter of off, Shakib drags it down towards long-on for a single
Mujeeb to Shakib, no run, tossed up just outside off, driven back at the bowler
Mujeeb to Shakib, no run, pushed through flatter and quicker, extra bounce for Rahman and that beat Shakib's attempted cut
Mujeeb to Shakib, no run, the off-break, but it's dropped way too short and wide of off, cut straight to the fielder at point
Mujeeb to Manish Pandey, 1 run, flighted on Manish's pads, nudged away wide of mid-wicket for a single
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, 1 run, Ashwin drifts one just outside off, driven down towards long-off for a single
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, no run, slower and on off, pushed back at the bowler
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, the carrom ball from Ashwin, driven towards cover where Mujeeb makes a mess of a simple stop, concedes two runs in the process

Ashwin to Manish Pandey, no run, that's an ugly looking mow from Manish, the off-break from Ashwin, slower and just outside off, Manish swung across the line and missed, didn't miss the off-stump by much
Ashwin to Shakib, 1 run, fraction short and on the stumps, worked away in front of square on the on-side for a single
Ashwin to Shakib, no run, tossed up on off, Shakib gets half-forward and finds cover with the back-foot drive
Manoj Tiwary to Shakib, 1 run, that's nicely bowled, the slider which kept coming back at Shakib, he backed away and then punched it square past point for a single
Manoj Tiwary to Manish Pandey, 1 run, a delivery that's bowled with an orthodox action now, flighted well outside off, Manish eases it wide of cover for a single
Manoj Tiwary to Shakib, 1 run, slower and well outside off, driven down towards long-off for a single
Manoj Tiwary to Shakib, 3 wides, Tiwary slides this one down the leg-side, Rahul can't collect it cleanly and allows a couple of extra run

Manoj Tiwary to Shakib, 2 runs, I can't really explain this bowling action, he's almost at ground level when he releases the ball, more than Jadhav does, very full and wide of off, driven past cover for a couple of runs
Manoj Tiwary to Manish Pandey, 1 run, another low slingy delivery from Tiwary, flatter and well outside off, punched square on the off-side for a single
Manoj Tiwary to Shakib, 1 run, a slingy low-hands delivery from Tiwary, nudged away behind square on the on-side for a single

Ashwin to Shakib, 1 run, appeal for run-out. A lazy single from Shakib and this might cost him. Oh dear! Shakib is short, but Ashwin has missed the ball and broke the stumps with his hands, NOT OUT is the call. That's poor cricket all around, the drifter from Ashwin, spun away from outside off, Hasan pushed it to the right of cover-point and set-off for a quick single. He was very casual in his running, took the big steps when he spotted the danger, but was still short of making his ground
Ashwin to Shakib, no run, the slider from Ashwin, kept coming back at the left-hander, Shakib backs away and jabs it towards the off-side
Ashwin to Manish Pandey, 1 run, Ashwin drifts this one on Manish's pads, tucked away past square leg for a single
Ashwin to Shakib, 1 run, flatter and on the stumps, punched down towards long-on for a single
Ashwin to Shakib, no run, tossed up just outside off, Shakib prods forward and gets an inside edge towards short fine leg
Ashwin to Shakib, no run, Ashwin comes from round the wicket and drops one short and wide of off, cut straight to the fielder at point
Barinder to Manish Pandey, no run, on a good length and well outside off, driven straight to the fielder at cover-point
Barinder to Shakib, 1 run, on a good length and well outside off, driven to the left of cover where Tiwary makes a half-stop, saved three runs for his team

Barinder to Shakib, FOUR, short, wide and four, Shakib gets going after some luck, short and wide of off, he gets on top of the bounce, used Sran's pace and cracked it square behind point. Third man has no chance
Barinder to Shakib, no run, on a good length and just outside off, defended towards the off-side
Barinder to Shakib, FOUR, the free-hit and it has been smashed away, high full-toss on Shakib's pads, he pulled it without much timing, but the placement was good, past square leg and into the fence

Barinder to Shakib, no ball, Shakib is OUT, but it's a no-ball. A reprieve for Shakib, that's a front-foot no-ball from Sran and he looks gutted. But that was a horror shot from Shakib, short and wide of off, Shakib saw some runs on offer as he threw his hands at that, gets a thick edge that flew into the hands of third man. Celebrations in the KXIP camp, distraught faces in the SRH camp, but that was only for a while
Barinder to Shakib, no run, on a good length and well outside off, driven without any timing towards cover

Rajpoot to Manish Pandey, no run, chance and Tye has dropped a dolly. That should have been four for Rajpoot, short and just outside off, Manish swivelled across and nailed the pull, straight into the hands of Tye at mid-wicket - who somehow clangs a sitter

Rajpoot to Saha, out Caught by Andrew Tye!! Another terrible slog and Rajpoot has three now. Change of pace has done Saha in, this was a slower ball outside off, Saha was looking to slog it over mid-wicket, he has no pace to work with, hit high on the bat and lobs a simple catch to Tye, jogging back from mid-wicket. Rajpoot is on a roll and SRH's batting looks very flaky once again. Saha c Andrew Tye b Rajpoot 6(9) [4s-1]
Rajpoot to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, a hint of slant back into the right-hander, Manish arches back and nudges it wide of cover

Rajpoot to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, short of a length and well wide of off, Manish makes room and then punches it square past cover. A much better effort from Ashwin as he tumbles and makes the stop, can't save the second run though
Rajpoot to Saha, 1 run, back of a length and well outside off, dabbed away behind square on the off-side for a single
Rajpoot to Saha, no run, on a good length and shaping away from well outside off, pushed towards cover

Barinder to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, chance and Ashwin puts in a laborious dive, don't think he even got his fingers onto the ball. A badly mistimed shovel from Manish as he looked to go back over the bowler's head, went very high and over mid-off. Ashwin ran back, kept his eyes on the ball, stretched out as it lobbed over his shoulders and can't quite complete the catch
Barinder to Manish Pandey, no run, on a good length and slanting across the right-hander, Manish watchfully lets it go by

Barinder to Manish Pandey, FOUR, whipped, length delivery on the leg-stumnp line, Manish makes room, gets his left leg out of the way and flicks it wristily past mid-wicket, off the mark with a boundary

Barinder to Saha, 1 run, Saha didn't know much about this ball, was once again almost cut in half as he played with an angled bat, the inside edge rolled in front of mid-wicket and they sneak through for a quick single
Barinder to Saha, no run, Sran shortens his length and angles this one across the right-hander, Saha doesn't get completely on top of the bounce as he pushes it to point
Barinder to Saha, no run, full and wide of off, almost a half-volley length, Saha drives and finds cover
Rajpoot to Manish Pandey, no run, fraction fuller and a hint of shape back into the right-hander, Manish prods across and pushes it back at the bowler. Another fine over from Rajpoot
Rajpoot to Manish Pandey, no run, back of a length and just outside off, Manish hops across and defends it towards the off-side
Rajpoot to Manish Pandey, no run, on a good length and shaping away from well outside off, left alone
Rajpoot to Manish Pandey, no run, short of a good length and well outside off, Manish covers the line and lets it go

Rajpoot to Dhawan, out Caught by Nair!! Edged and caught! That bounce from Rajpoot, it's the undoing of yet another SRH batsman, they have lost both openers now. Banged in short and curving away from the left-hander, Dhawan didn't cover for the angle as he fended at that, doesn't get on top of the bounce and gets a thick outside edge. The ball looped and was dying on its way to Karun, but he bends forward and takes a good low catch. Dhawan c Nair b Rajpoot 11(8) [4s-2]
Rajpoot to Dhawan, FOUR, chopped, short of a good length and just outside off, too close for Dhawan to play the cut, he gets a toe-edge and beats the lone slip, third man is square and has no chance

Barinder to Saha, FOUR, that's a poor ball from Sran, too full and on Saha's pads, all he had to do was to get some bat on that, he does and beats fine leg with ease. Expensive start from Sran, 11 came from the over
Barinder to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, fuller length delivery on Dhawan's pads, he was looking to flick and missed, sneaks in a leg-bye as the ball rolled wide of Rahul
Barinder to Dhawan, FOUR, cracking shot, width on offer from Sran and Dhawan was all over it. Reaches out on the drive and flat-bats it past cover, beat the infield and rolled away to the fence
Barinder to Dhawan, no run, the bouncer from Sran, banged in short and at the stumps, Dhawan was swivelling across on the pull and missed
Barinder to Dhawan, 2 runs, too straight and on Dhawan's pads, he picks the length early and clips it past square leg, back for the second run

Barinder to Dhawan, no run, Sran shortens his length and gets this one to angle back into the right-hander, Dhawan was looking to steer it towards third man and gets an inside edge towards the on-side
Rajpoot to Saha, no run, back of a length and just outside off, Saha hops across, plays with a loose bottom hand and defends. That's a fine start from Rajpoot
Rajpoot to Saha, no run, on a good length and a hint of shape away from outside off, Saha gets half-forward in defence

Rajpoot to Williamson, out Caught by Ashwin!! The SRH supporters look stunned as the captain departs. That's a poor looking shot from KW, but it was the extra bounce that was his undoing. Banged in short and a hint of away movement from outside off, KW was in a terrible position as he went for the pull, would have been better had he tried to cut, gets a top-edge that lobbed in the air and Ashwin has a simple catch at mid-off. Williamson c Ashwin b Rajpoot 0(3)
Rajpoot to Williamson, no run, back of a length and well wide of off, Williamson stands tall and punches it to the right of backward point
Rajpoot to Williamson, no run, on a good length and shaping away from outside off, Williamson watches it all along, lifts his bat and lets it go

Rajpoot to Dhawan, 1 run, top-edge and safe, a gentle loosener from Rajpoot, short and wide of off, Dhawan threw his hands at that, gets a thick edge towards third man. Mujeeb lost it under the lights and aborts his attempt to catch it, doesn't gauge the bounce either and is smacked on the face

Boult to Johnson, FOUR, slogged away off a length ball towards the deep mid-wicket fence but does not matter. DD win this by 55 runs. This has been a superb show from DD, ably led by their new skipper - Shreyas Iyer. Two vital points and KKR have been jolted badly by this
Boult to Johnson, FOUR, does not miss out on the timing despite backing away. Too full and the batsman screamed the drive away through the cover region for a four
Boult to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run, low swinging in full toss and the batsman inside halves the ball away into the on-side for a single
Boult to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, another yorker, the batsman backs away and misses it. The keeper throws it back to the bowler. Clinical stuff from DD it has been
Boult to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, short ball, the batsman is late on the shot and misses it
Boult to Kuldeep Yadav, wide, down leg, wided. That was a poor ball, well down leg
Boult to Johnson, 1 run, too full, right up there and the batsman trying to muscle the ball away, gets it off the toe-end of the blade to send it to fine leg
Maxwell to Kuldeep Yadav, 2 runs, looks to drive it outside off and the inside edge runs away fine on the on-side. Mishra ji and Avesh Khan almost mess it up but only a couple

Maxwell to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, wants to slog sweep and the ball pops up in front of him off the inside half of the blade. The keeper wanted the bowler to make an effort. Maxwell never could have reached that
Maxwell to Kuldeep Yadav, FOUR, down leg, swept fine and that will run away to the fence
Maxwell to Johnson, 1 run, wristy thump on to the on-side and a single it is towards deep mid

Maxwell to Chawla, out Caught by Munro!! The DD boys can do nothing wrong tonight. Slog swept and the man at deep backward square leg jumps up and grabs it with the tip of his fingers. Superb take at the boundary line. That was hit flat and well but the fielder did well to keep his balance at the fence and grab it. In the end, the momentum on the shot almost meant the ball would explode through his fingers but it did not. Chawla c Munro b Maxwell 2(4)
Maxwell to Johnson, 1 run, chips down the track and clips the ball away into the on-side for a single
Avesh Khan to Johnson, 1 run, low full toss, the batsman backs away and slices the ball away to deep third man for a single. Only 12 balls and 75 needed

Avesh Khan to A Russell, out Bowled!! The base of the off-pole has been struck hard. Yorkerish delivery and the batsman trying to create room, misses it. Avesh Khan gets carried away as well after the wicket. Shouts a mouthful at the batsman. Can't interpret that. But that is GAME.SET.MATCH for DD. First Shaw, then Iyer, now Avesh Khan. DD being pulled along by the young guns. A Russell b Avesh Khan 44(30) [4s-3 6s-4]
Avesh Khan to A Russell, no run, angles across the short delivery and the batsman misses the pull. That was sharp and the ball soars over the bat
Avesh Khan to A Russell, no run, short, quick ball, the batsman backs away to pull the ball away but fails to get the freedom. Goes to long-on
Avesh Khan to A Russell, no run, highish full toss, legal one and has been mistimed away to deepish long-on for a dot ball. Russell does not take the single again
Avesh Khan to Chawla, 1 run, short, angling away, steers the ball away to deep third man for a single

Plunkett to A Russell, no run, short delivery again. The short stuff has worked on this slightly sluggish wicket. The batsman misses the pull and the ball goes through to the keeper. Only two runs of the over. Last 2 overs, three runs have been added

Plunkett to A Russell, no run, mmmm. Interesting. A wide down leg not called because the batsman was moving in the crease. Short ball down leg and the batsman dodged the ball by moving away to the off-side. Russell is furious
Plunkett to A Russell, no run, and he refuses the single! That was right up there and the batsman yorked the ball out into the off-side
Plunkett to Chawla, 1 run, round the wicket short ball and the batsman fends the ball away into the off-side. The ball almost touched the handle as Chawla jabbed it away
Plunkett to Chawla, no run, slower bumper outside off and the batsman trying to poke the ball away, misses it. 78 needed now
Plunkett to A Russell, 1 run, low full toss, on the pads, dipping and has been clipped away on the on-side for a single

Mishra to Shivam Mavi, out Bowled!! This has been a nightmare. Finally, it ends for Shivam Mavi. That was a slow googly, the batsman was too early into the pull and misses it. The ball takes its time to tickle the leg-stick. To make matters worse for KKR, maiden over from Mishy! The three dots also would not have helped the equation for KKR. DD look set to break their jinx. Shivam Mavi b Mishra 0(3)
Mishra to Shivam Mavi, no run, flighted outside off and the batsman misses the leg-break as he went for a slog sweep
Mishra to Shivam Mavi, no run, gloves the ball down as the ball was headed towards the sticks. Another flighted delivery it was

Mishra to A Russell, out Shubman Gill Run Out!! The young man is gone. The calling between the two had been poor and Shubman Gill to suffer. That was chopped away into the off-side, sans any timing and despite not a great throw and desperate dive, Gill does not make it. The keeper did well to whip the bails off. Shubman Gill run out (Shreyas Iyer/Pant) 37(29) [4s-3 6s-1]

Mishra to A Russell, no run, Appeal for a stumping. The leggie turned away past a defending blade. The keeper gathered it and whipped the bails off. The back foot though was in the crease. The batsman will survive this and he does. That was some sharp turn for the veteran spinner
Mishra to Shubman Gill, leg byes, 1 run, looks to be cheeky and tries a reverse hack only to miss it. The ball takes the ball pads on its way towards the short third man area for a single
Rahul Tewatia to A Russell, no run, quicker, well outside off and the batsman throws his bat at it only to miss it. Might have slipped under the bat
Rahul Tewatia to A Russell, no run, well aired up and the ball bounces a little extra to beat the cut. That was very well done
Rahul Tewatia to A Russell, no run, short, slightly quicker, cut away but finds the man at point

Rahul Tewatia to A Russell, FOUR, more perspiration on the part of the DD team. Well tossed up delivery and the batsman this time thumps the ball over the bowler's head for a four. That was brutal again
Rahul Tewatia to A Russell, SIX, inside out and it is a mighty one! Flighted well outside off and the batsman gave it more air-time by plundering the ball over covers. DD will start to sweat
Rahul Tewatia to Shubman Gill, 1 run, starts with a flattish leggie and that was cut away. The man at point puts in the dive to stop the four for his team. Only a single
Mishra to Shubman Gill, 1 run, back footed punch into the covers and a single it is as the ball was bowled flatter
Mishra to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, fifty of the partnership comes up as the batsman chopped the cut away to pick up a couple. The man at sweeper cover was a little too square
Mishra to A Russell, 1 run, front of the hand low full toss and the batsman clips the ball away behind square for a single

Mishra to A Russell, 2 runs, off the under edge and between the keeper's legs it goes. That was well flighted outside off and the batsman trying to drag the ball away, managed an under-edge for a brace
Mishra to Shubman Gill, 1 run, drives it with the turn as it was flighted well outside off. The man at deep cover picks the ball up
Mishra to Shubman Gill, FOUR, dances down the track, picks up the googly and hoicks the ball away through mid-wicket and long-on for a four. KKR will take it, with open arms

Boult to Shubman Gill, 1 run, another dicey single attempted and completed. That was short, wide as well, chopped away and the man at point was on to it in a flash. He released the throw but missed the target. Interestingly, Russell would have made it
Boult to Shubman Gill, no run, short, slow, chopped away and finds the man at point

Boult to A Russell, 1 run, almost a run-out. Lots of yes and no and in the end, an overthrow to get Russell off strike. He tapped the ball away to point, went a few steps down the track and then was sent back. The throw came in and Russell had to stretch back into the crease

Boult to A Russell, FOUR, not all brawn with this man. Stands up and steers the ball over point for a four. That runs away into the fence. The ball was short and outside off, the room was there to send it away

Boult to A Russell, SIX, Ho ho! This man. Brute.. That was in the zone, pitched up and the batsman backed away to murder that over long-on. The Russell show has started. Bring on your crash helmets, folks!!
Boult to A Russell, wide, slower delivery outside off and the batsman makes a tame effort to reach it. In the end, the ball goes away wide outside off for a wide
Boult to Shubman Gill, 1 run, angles the slower delivery away and the batsman pats the ball away into the off-side for a single

Avesh Khan to A Russell, SIX, Russell will go down fighting. Correction - swinging.. That was short, at the body from round the wicket but Russell was ready. Opens his stance, and then muscles the ball over the on-side for a huge six. The second tier stand at deep square leg was peppered
Avesh Khan to A Russell, wide, slower delivery but the radar is wrong. Slips the ball down leg and it has been wided. Pressure of the six?
Avesh Khan to A Russell, SIX, thwack, thwack, thwack! That ball had wings. Infact Russell lent wings to it. Short delivery, sat up and the batsman thumped the ball away over mid-wicket for a maximum
Avesh Khan to A Russell, no run, that was sharp! Quick delivery and the batsman can only duck under it and let it go
Avesh Khan to Shubman Gill, 1 run, back foot punch after backing away. The man at sweeper cover picks the ball up
Avesh Khan to A Russell, 1 run, banged in short, clumsy pull down the ground as the ball was close to the body. The batsman again seemed to be a little late on the pull
Avesh Khan to A Russell, no run, hits the deck hard with a short ball. The turf eats up a lot of pace and the batsman is through with his pull a bit too early

Plunkett to Shubman Gill, no run, back of a length delivery and the ball straightens after landing. Again went wide of the crease, tucked the batsman up and the soft leading edge on the attempted tuck takes the ball back to the bowler

Plunkett to A Russell, 1 run, back to the slower stuff. The batsman waits on that 120kph delivery and knocks it away into the on-side for a single. Plunkett went really wide of the crease to deliver that
Plunkett to A Russell, no run, banged in short..better from Plunkett as the ball goes over the bat on the attempted pull. The ball dipped on the keeper as it reached him

Plunkett to A Russell, FOUR, no fooling around this time! Stays back for the slower delivery and then thumps the ball away between mid-wicket and long-on for a four. That was out of the top-drawer from Russell

Plunkett to A Russell, no run, another slower delivery and that turns in literally as the batsman looks to back away and slog wildly. The bowler saw the batsman moving away and bowled the off-cutter at the body of the batsman
Plunkett to Shubman Gill, 1 run, slower delivery angling in, tucked away off the hips into the on-side. Singles aren't going to hurt DD much
Mishra to Shubman Gill, 1 run, slower and wider of off, Gill sits deep inside the crease and cuts behind point for a single

Mishra to Shubman Gill, FOUR, tad short and keeps eerily low on middle, but Gill does well to keep his eyes on the ball and slam the pull along the ground through mid-wicket. A diving effort by the fielder at deep mid-wicket goes in vain
Mishra to A Russell, 1 run, quicker on middle and leg, Russell's off the mark with a flick to mid-wicket

Mishra to Karthik, out Caught by Boult!! Plays against the spin and perishes. Looks to go over long-on/mid-wicket with a wild swing and ends up slicing a dolly of a catch to backward point. Half the side back in the hut now. Karthik c Boult b Mishra 18(18) [6s-1]
Mishra to Karthik, no run, plays the sweep to a full ball and drags it off the inside edge onto his pad. It was in the air for a fleeting moment, but too far for Pant to reach
Mishra to Shubman Gill, 1 run, short and spinning away outside off, Gill cuts late to the left of Boult at backward point who dives to keep it down to a single
Vijay Shankar to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 135ks outside off, Gill punches off the cue end in front of point
Vijay Shankar to Karthik, 1 run, slanting into the pads, DK flicks uppishly behind square leg for a single
Vijay Shankar to Shubman Gill, 1 run, fuller again, Gill drills it to the left of the diving bowler, manages a single

Vijay Shankar to Shubman Gill, SIX, time for Shubman Gill to show what he's got. Pitched up and right in the swinging zone outside off, Gill marmalizes it over long-off with a clean swing of the willow
Vijay Shankar to Karthik, 1 run, jumps down the pitch and biff-drives the full ball to long-on
Vijay Shankar to Karthik, no run, nice channel to start with, on a good length and swerving towards middle, DK's punch goes straight to mid-off
Mishra to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, short and wide, Gill flays it wide of backward point; Sweeper had a lot of distance to cover to his left, but Boult does well to slide and prevent the boundary
Mishra to Shubman Gill, no run, googly, Gill stays back and drops it into the leg-side off the splice of the bat
Mishra to Karthik, 1 run, touch fuller outside off, driven down to wide of long-off
Mishra to Karthik, no run, drops the legbreak wide of off-stump, DK goes hard and miscues it to cover. Hesitation for the single and they decide against it
Mishra to Shubman Gill, 1 run, quicker on leg stump, eased down to long-on
Mishra to Karthik, 1 run, short and sliding onto off, DK clears his front leg and hammers it past the non-striker
Plunkett to Shubman Gill, no run, denies the room for the batsman, Gill strolls forward to push it back to the bowler
Plunkett to Karthik, 1 run, sprays on the pads once again, DK times the clip and could only manage a single to deep square
Plunkett to Karthik, SIX, short and in his arc. DK swivels a touch and plays the pick-up pull over short fine. All the way for a maximum
Plunkett to Shubman Gill, 1 run, rides the bounce and closes his bat face before guiding it down to third man
Plunkett to Karthik, 1 run, back of a length, enough width for DK to free his arms, cut away to deep point
Plunkett to Shubman Gill, 1 run, full on fifth stump channel, Gill slams the drive straight of mid-off and calls for a quick single
Avesh Khan to Shubman Gill, 1 run, typical finish to the over. Stays on his heels and taps the ball to third man for a strike-retaining single

Avesh Khan to Shubman Gill, FOUR, one bounce and over the ropes. Making batting look so simple is Shubman Gill. Waits for this length ball to arrive and lifts the punch over mid-off with impeccable timing
Avesh Khan to Shubman Gill, no run, another short ball, too high outside off, Gill hops and slashes hard. Was nowhere near it
Avesh Khan to Shubman Gill, no run, pacy length ball outside off stump, Gill mistimes the drive to cover
Avesh Khan to Shubman Gill, no run, good length on off and middle, punched straight to mid-on

Avesh Khan to Nitish Rana, out Caught&Bowled!! KKR are falling apart. Another wicket off a short ball. Nitish Rana was in no position to play the pull, still goes for it and pays the ultimate price. It came onto him quickly and was cramped for room to play the pull; loops up off the splice and the bowler takes the simplest of catches running forward. Nitish Rana c and b Avesh Khan 8(7) [4s-1]
Plunkett to Nitish Rana, 1 run, 120ks arrowing into middle, Rana tries to clip into the leg-side and gets a soft leading edge towards cover
Plunkett to Karthik, 1 run, Plunkett continues to hit the deck hard, DK rises on his tippy toes and glides a single to third man
Plunkett to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slower around middle and leg, Rana reads it late but adjusts well to work it into the leg-side with soft hands
Plunkett to Karthik, 1 run, goes searching for the punch outside off, the ball decks away a touch to click the outside edge before dribbling towards third man
Plunkett to Karthik, no run, looks to cash on the width outside off, slices the cut and it drops just short of the man at backward point
Plunkett to Karthik, 2 runs, fullish and angling into the pads, DK flicks uppishly to the left of deep square. Easy two

Avesh Khan to Nitish Rana, FOUR, that ball went searching for the middle of the blade. Nitish Rana was in such a good position, everything right about it; reads the length early, punches crisply in the gap behind point with a still head. Take four
Avesh Khan to Karthik, 1 run, shorter and wider of off, DK hangs back and runs it down to third man
Avesh Khan to Karthik, no run, short and far away from off-stump, DK refuses to go after it. Cautious approach and fair enough considering the position his team is in
Avesh Khan to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slanting away outside off, Rana uses the angle to guide it down to third man with an open bat face
Avesh Khan to Nitish Rana, no run, back of a length around middle and leg, pushes Rana back in his crease and forces a defensive poke
Avesh Khan to Karthik, 1 run, punched off the meat of the blade, to the right of mid-off and they sneak a single

Boult to Narine, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! Boult seems to have come out with a clear plan against Narine which is to bowl short and only short. One swing too many from Narine, not in the best of positions (having cleared the front leg) to flay the ball over the off-side ring; goes for it and lobs it off the toe-end. Iyer calls in early from mid-off, runs forward and grabs it with a slide. Narine c Shreyas Iyer b Boult 26(9) [4s-1 6s-3]
Boult to Narine, no run, slashes at a short and wide delivery, misses
Boult to Narine, SIX, same result! Boult persists with the shorter length, Narine whistles it into the same area with a mighty bat swing
Boult to Narine, SIX, pressure? Narine just doesn't know what that means. Sets himself up for a shorter length delivery, clears his front leg and goes tonkkkkkkk straight of long-off
Boult to Nitish Rana, 1 run, glides back and runs it off the face down to third man. Off the mark

Boult to Uthappa, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! Trent Boult is such a good operator with the ball. Does have plenty of variations to nip out wickets at will. Bowls it short and creates that uncomfortable angle for Uthappa - around middle and off - no room whatsoever. A horrible mistimed shot that, the pull, spoons straight to Prithvi Shaw at mid-wicket. Uthappa c Prithvi Shaw b Boult 1(2)
Maxwell to Uthappa, 1 run, slides in with the arm, Uthappa stays back and tucks it round the corner, off the mark with a single

Maxwell to Chris Lynn, out Bowled!! Wah! Look at beaming smile on Maxi's face. Boy, is he delighted! Lands this on a length and gets the ball to drift back slightly around off, Lynn wasn't fuly committed on the forward push, plays tentatively and inside-edges it back onto his stumps. Chris Lynn b Maxwell 5(6) [4s-1]
Maxwell to Narine, 1 run, width again, Narine hits it well, but doesn't hit the gap, extra cover dives (to his right) and takes the pace off to keep it down to a single
Maxwell to Narine, FOUR, no-one's preventing this one. Halftracker outside off stump, Narine transfers his weight onto the back foot and hammers it powerfully wide of extra cover
Maxwell to Narine, 2 runs, drops it short and wide, Narine uses his fast hands to clobber that wide of long-off, a diving stop from Boult prevents the boundary
Maxwell to Narine, SIX, that ain't coming back. Woof! What.A.Strike.Sunil.Narine. Doesn't move an inch, keeps himself steady and lifts Maxwell high into the night sky. Way back over the sightscreen
Boult to Narine, 1 run, makes room early and slaps the length ball to the right of mid-off. Easy single. A tidy over from Trent
Boult to Chris Lynn, 1 run, back of a length wide of Lynn's off-stump, he flatbats the drive, no timing on that. Dribbles down to mid-off for a single
Boult to Chris Lynn, no run, swinging away from a fuller length, Lynn goes for the drive but inside-edges it onto his back pad
Boult to Chris Lynn, no run, back of a length on middle, Lynn tucks it in front of mid-wicket
Boult to Chris Lynn, FOUR, wrong lines from Trent Boult, pounds it short and sprays it around the ribcage, Lynn swivels and smacks the pull behind square
Boult to Chris Lynn, no run, back of a length angling across the right-hander, no feet from Lynn, just offers a straight blade punch to cover

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, ends the innings in style! Take a bow, Shreyas Iyer! Phenomenal stuff! Mavi loses his length (once more) and sprays this outside off on a good length, Iyer sits deep in the crease and flat-bats this merrily over long-off. What a way to finish! DD end on 219/4!

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, what a shot! He's been playing breathtaking strokes for fun tonight. Here is another of those. Fullish length and Iyer sits in the crease before and blasts it down the ground towards long-off. No chance for the fielder there
Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, wide, tries to go wide and outside off, beyond the tramline though and it's been signalled

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, massacred away! The Shreyas Iyer show continues. Full and in the slot, poor bowling and it's been punished as well. Shoveled away over deep mid-wicket for another huge six

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, out Maxwell Run Out!! Sharp from Mavi! Was quick to gather this in his followthrough from Karthik's throw and threw the stumps down at the bowler's end. Maxwell was backing away for the single and was never going to make it back. Slow off cutter outside off, Iyer tried to slog across the line but only got a bottom edge towards Karthik. Maxwell wanted the bye but in the end, had to go. Maxwell run out (Karthik/Shivam Mavi) 27(18) [4s-1 6s-2]

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, makes no difference! It won't as well if he continues with this length, Mavi. Fullish attacking the sticks, Iyer just shuffles across a touch and sends this flying over deep mid-wicket for a biggie. Another six that had plenty of height on it. Two towering strikes! Perfect start to the over for DD

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, high in the air....well over the fence! Booming stroke! Mavi isn't hitting the right length, fuller ball outside off and Iyer was already making room for the inside out stroke. Sends this into orbit with that bat swing of his

Johnson to Maxwell, FOUR, hammers this! Very full and outside off, Maxwell holds his shape and lifts it straight over the bowler's head. Dead straight and it rockets to the fence. 11 off the over, a good one but those three dot balls, will they hurt on this seemingly belter of a pitch? Another over left though to make up for it
Johnson to Maxwell, no run, 3 in 3! This is excellent stuff from Johnson. Slower ball around off, Maxwell is early into the heave and was never going to connect
Johnson to Maxwell, no run, another play and a miss! Johnson is spearing them wider outside off and although Maxwell shuffled across for the slog, fails to put bat on ball
Johnson to Maxwell, no run, what was that! Typical innovation from Maxwell but doesn't connect. Shuffles across a bit and tries the switch hit but too quick for him to make a connection

Johnson to Maxwell, SIX, that's a flat hit! Tells you what one confident stroke can do. Maxwell is now striking them well. The short ball and he swivels to get inside the line before pulling over short fine leg. Clears the ropes as well
Johnson to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, full on middle and leg, gets across a bit and whips it away towards deep mid-wicket. Slight fumble by Gill but just a single

Narine to Maxwell, SIX, gets hold of this one! Finally, Maxwell has middled one and sends this way over long-on for a six. Huge strike! Was backing away to make room and Narine shortened the length to help the Australian's cause. Blasted away over the long-on fence
Narine to Maxwell, 2 runs, ah, the switch hit from Maxwell. He is trying everything tonight but not middle. Squeezes this towards point for a single
Narine to Shreyas Iyer, leg byes, 1 run, floated up outside off, spinning in as Iyer looks to pull. Off the thigh pad towards short third man

Narine to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, dropped again! Rana is the man again and he fails to judge this skier well. Ends up tipping it over the ropes at long-on for a biggie. Floated up around middle, Iyer went for the lofted stroke down the ground and this went high up into the night sky before setting towards a confused Rana who ended up putting it down
Narine to Maxwell, 1 run, flatter and around middle, worked away on the leg-side for a single

Narine to Maxwell, 2 runs, just short of long-on! Another mishit from Maxwell and Rana did well but couldn't get to it despite putting in a dive. Slightly short and around middle, Maxwell made room to flat-bat it but didn't middle it well at all
Shivam Mavi to Maxwell, 1 run, cannot put the Free Hit away. A full toss and Maxwell used all his power to slam this down the ground. Straight towards long-on

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, no ball, 1 run, oh ho, can't do that Mavi! Probably slipped out of the hand and ends up delivering a very high full toss. Jabbed to the off-side and the umpire signals the no ball. Free Hit coming up

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, scorching stroke! Iyer is going bonkers here. Expecting the shorter length and makes room before launching it over wide long-off. There was a fielder there but this was wider and higher as well. Back to back biggies for the skipper. He is having a ball on captaincy debut

Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, chance goes down! Uthappa the man at long-on, don't think he would have managed to stay inside the ropes even if he caught this. Fuller ball and it was lofted down the ground by Iyer. Didn't quite get the elevation on it anc went flat. Luckily for him, just about manages to go for a biggie. Brings up the 50 for Iyer! What a way to start his IPL captaincy stint!

Shivam Mavi to Maxwell, 1 run, another agricultural hoick from Maxwell but he is finding the fielders at the moment. Slower and a bit short around off, the Australian had made up his mind before the ball was bowled, to slog and he squirts it to deep mid-wicket
Shivam Mavi to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, good ball! Fine yorker just around off, Iyer squeezes it out towards short third man to sneak a single
Shivam Mavi to Maxwell, 1 run, starts with a slower ball on a good length, dragged wider outside off as well and Maxwell can only slap this to sweeper cover

Chawla to Maxwell, 1 run, can sense Maxwell getting itchy here. Wants to get on with it but not quite getting his radar right. Moves around in the crease and slaps this away hard but straight down to long-off
Chawla to Maxwell, no run, another flattish slider, angling in from wide of the crease and Maxwell misses the pull to get hit near the groin
Chawla to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, flatter trajectory on middle and leg, a touch short and it's worked through backward square leg
Chawla to Maxwell, 1 run, flighted up around middle, Maxwell drives it sweetly straight back past the bowler. Long-on gets across to his left quickly to restrict them to just a single
Chawla to Maxwell, no run, the seam up from Chawla, fires this down around off. Stabbed towards short third man but Maxwell cannot get the single
Chawla to Maxwell, no run, slower and outside off, punched off the back foot towards extra cover

A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, absolutely bludgeoned! We have seen quite a bit of these flat-batted strokes tonight and this one from Iyer is another cracker. Shortish and outside off, he makes room a touch on the back foot and smears this over long-off. All the way
A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, no run, dug in short around off, Iyer arches his back to evade this

A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, great placement! Nobody in the deep behind square on the off-side and all Iyer had to do was beat the man in the ring. That he does with a fine back foot cut. Too short and wide, got the treatement
A Russell to Maxwell, 1 run, on a good length wider outside off, jammed down towards third man for a single

A Russell to Pant, out Caught by Karthik!! What was that, Mr.Pant? We have seen Indian batsmen get out to the bouncer but trust me, this has to be one of weirdest ways of getting out. Lovely bouncer and Pant was stuck on the crease, probably beaten for both pace and bounce. Fails to drop his wrists in time and it flies high off the glove. It's a dolly for the KKR skipper and suddenly, the visitors are right back in this with the twin strikes. The in-form Pant has to go. He has a wry smile on his face as he walks back. Knows that it looked comical. On second viewing, the ball didn't bounce much at all but Pant wasn't looking at the ball in any case. 'Never take your eyes off the ball', they say. Pant c Karthik b A Russell 0(1)
A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, full and outside off, Iyer reaches out on the front foot and powers it towards long-on
A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, wide, sprays this well down the leg-side, that;s a wide

Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, out Bowled!! Chawla strikes! KKR badly needed this one because this partnership was getting ready to go bonkers. This was the quicker one from Chawla and it skidded through low, Shaw didn't expect it to keep that low and his wild pull across the line didn't help his cause either. Misses it completely and the woodwork is disturbed. Nevertheless, a top quality innings from the young man. He's made a statement here in the IPL. This dismissal might actually worry KKR as they have to chase and it has started to keep low. Prithvi Shaw b Chawla 62(44) [4s-7 6s-2]
Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, no run, flatter and around middle, jammed off the back foot towards the bowler
Chawla to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, sloppy from Russell! Slightly short and outside off, slapped hard towards backward point where the West Indian fumbled to concede the single
Chawla to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, good running! Iyer nudges this softly through the spaces at mid-wicket and he has an equally energetic partner in Prithvi Shaw. So, they convert one into two
Chawla to Shreyas Iyer, no run, very full and around middle, stabbed back towards the bowler

Chawla to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's H-U-G-E! Into the top tier! Whoa, what a strike! Iyer has decided to join in the fun as well. Tossed up nicely by Chawla and it's blasted high down the ground. One of those sixes that had good height and distance. Lovely

Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, launched over square leg! Shaw continues in his merry ways. Fractionally short in length and he swivels a touch before propelling this with a strong bottom hand. In the air for quite a while and had enough legs to clear the fence. He is switching gears here, is Shaw and DD do need to up the ante. Looks a good batting surface
Johnson to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, back of a length and closer to off, guided towards the right of third man

Johnson to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, this time he does! Iyer gets third time lucky. Another shorter length delivery from Johnson and was perhaps a touch closer to Iyer who connected the ramp nicely. Over Karthik and very fine which means third man has no chance. Nice innovation
Johnson to Shreyas Iyer, no run, and another! This time the ramp attempt as Johnson goes further short but no real room for Iyer to work with. In the end, he couldn't connect

Johnson to Shreyas Iyer, no run, play and a miss! Iyer tried to get cheeky there, wanted to run this down fine towards third man but just a bit of extra bounce there perhaps for Johnson. The angle across also did him in I guess
Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, back of a length just outside off, Shaw stands tall and thumps it past Johnson. Down to long-on

Kuldeep Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, does it again! Another half-tracker from Kuldeep, Iyer sits back and mauls the pull. This time, deep mid-wicket had a bit more work to do running to his right but did well to save a couple
Kuldeep Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, slightly short and around middle, Iyer stays back and flicks it away towards the right of deep mid-wicket. Excellent running and they pick up a brace
Kuldeep Yadav to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, floated up wider outside off, Shaw reaches out and taps it towards cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, skips down the track and finds the length shortened, adjusts with a tuck towards deep mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, no run, slightly short and outside off, crashes the cut off the back foot but off the slice. Towards backward point

Kuldeep Yadav to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, ahh, the new DD captain doesn't think so. What a way to greet the mystery spinner in his new spell! Floated up around off, Iyer did well to go with the spin and executed the slog sweep beautifully. Easily over deep mid-wicket

A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, oh glorious! Another classy stroke! Not all that full but Shaw reaches out and absolutely pumps the drive straight back past the bowler. Mid-off could only see it whistling away to the fence. Gee!
A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, fuller and attacking the stumps, wristed away towards long-on for a single

A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, guided down towards third man. 50 for Prithvi Shaw! Joint youngest to score an IPL fifty. No surprises there if you have heard of him before. A definite prodigy

A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, cracking shot! This lad is putting up an exhibition tonight. Fractionally short from Russell and Shaw doesn't bother going on the back foot. Is on his initial front foot trigger as he clobbers the pull over mid-wicket. High quality!
A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, no run, clever bowling! Saw Shaw backing away for room and fired the wide yorker. Just inside the tramline and it was left alone by the young man
A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, no run, short of a length outside off, Shaw was winding up for a big shot but adjusted and jammed this towards mid-off
Narine to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, Narine drops this one short and wide of off, cracked away square on the off-side for a single
Narine to Prithvi Shaw, 2 runs, nicely tossed up on off, Prithvi gets close to the ball and then whips it wide of long-on, comes back for the second run
Narine to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, fraction shorter and wider of off, dabbed away towards short third man for a single

Narine to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, tossed up and drifting into the right-hander, flicked away stylishly behind square on the on-side. Russell tumbles and doesn't stop it properly, but the batsmen decide against a second run
Narine to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, flighted on the stumps, eased away towards long-on for a single
Narine to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, Narine drops one short and well outside off, chopped away square on the off-side for a single

Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, that's very unconvincing from Prithvi, the Test match bouncer from Johnson, banged in short and at the batsman. Prithvi looked very awkward as he fended it away, a FSL would have gobbled it up, but this is T20, not a Test match

Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, the helicopter is out, MS will be proud of this shot. Length delivery on the stumps, Prithvi waits on it, then brings his wrists into play and flicks it stylishly over mid-wicket, all the way over the ropes

Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, that's nicely played by Prithvi, let the ball come onto him, used the pace on the ball and then nudged it behind square on the on-side, beat the man in the ring and rolls away to the fence
Johnson to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, Iyer plays with an open face and dabs it towards third man
Johnson to Shreyas Iyer, no run, back of a length and on the stumps, dabbed towards backward point and Iyer wanted a single, sent back by his partner
Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, on a good length and angling across the right-hander, a mistimed drive towards mid-off lets Prithvi get a single
A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, no run, the bouncer from Russell, Iyer ducks under it and lets it go
A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, on a length and on Iyer's pads, clipped away behind square on the on-side and Iyer comes back for the second run
A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, no run, fuller length delivery outside off, driven straight to the fielder at cover
A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, short and wide of off, slapped away to deep point for a single
A Russell to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, Iyer plays with a soft bottom hand and pushes it in front of cover
A Russell to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, on a length and on the stumps, chipped away towards long-on for a single

Shivam Mavi to Munro, out Bowled!! Lovely delivery from Mavi and he gets rid of the dangerous Munro. This was very full and on the stumps, bowled at 143 kmph. Not quite the yorker, but good enough for Munro, he was making room for the slog, gets a bottom-edge and the ball clatters into the base of middle-stump. A send off from the youngster and KKR get their first wicket. Munro b Shivam Mavi 33(18) [4s-4 6s-2]

Shivam Mavi to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, that's an ugly mow from Prithvi and he limps across for a single, back of a length and just outside off, he went hard on the pull and got a thick inside edge onto his shin
Shivam Mavi to Prithvi Shaw, no run, change of pace from Mavi, slower short ball outside off, flat-batted cut from Prithvi, but straight to the fielder at mid-off
Shivam Mavi to Prithvi Shaw, no run, on a good length and just outside off, driven straight to the fielder at cover

Shivam Mavi to Munro, 1 run, pacy from Mavi and that caused trouble for Munro, he got into a tangle as he went for the pull, got a bottom edge that ricoheted off his thigh pad and rolled away behind square on the on-side
Shivam Mavi to Munro, no run, Mavi shortens his length and angles this one across the left-hander, Munro threw his bat at that and missed
Johnson to Munro, 1 run, tad fuller and on the stumps, driven towards cover for a single
Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, Johnson shortens his length on Prithvi's pads, nudged away past square leg for a single
Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, lovely, full and wide of off, Prithvi needs no second invitation as he threw his hands at that, clears cover-point and races away to the fence

Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, no run, that's a sharp bouncer from Johnson, banged in short and at the stumps, Prithvi was way too late on the pull and missed. A stunning one-handed leaping grab from DK, saved four byes for his team. Plenty of pace from Johnson in his first over

Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, no run, Prithvi isn't reading Johnson at the moment, on a good length and angling across the right-hander, Prithvi was looking to tuck it towards the on-side, closed the bat-face early and the leading edge dropped in front of short third man

Johnson to Prithvi Shaw, no run, on a good length and a hint of shape back into the right-hander, Prithvi was looking to work it towards mid-wicket, closed the bat-face and got a thick leading edge, well short of cover
Narine to Munro, no run, Narine drifts this one across the left-hander, Munro was looking to shovel it over mid-wicket, ends up dragging it towards mid-on
Narine to Munro, no run, pushed through flatter and quicker of off, Munro was making room on the cut and missed

Narine to Munro, SIX, lovely from Munro, he's showing why he's the number one T20I batsman in the world. This was tossed up on the stumps, Munro bent down on his knees and swept it high and over deep mid-wicket, deep into the crowd for a maximum

Narine to Munro, FOUR, nicely played! It wasn't a bad ball from Narine, slower and on the off-stump line, Munro made room by backing away, waits on the ball and finds the gap past cover with a blazing drive
Narine to Munro, no run, tad short and on Munro's pads, flicked straight to the fielder at mid-wicket
Narine to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, tossed up on off, Prithvi gets well forward and works it wide of mid-wicket for a single
Shivam Mavi to Munro, no run, much better from Mavi, shortens his length and tucks Munro for room, defended towards the off-side
Shivam Mavi to Munro, FOUR, clobbered, Munro comes down the track, that allows him to free his arms and deposits it back past the bowler, beat mid-on to his right and races away to the fence
Shivam Mavi to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, short of a length and well outside off, eases it square on the off-side past point for a single
Shivam Mavi to Prithvi Shaw, no run, Mavi gets lucky now, short and wide of off, Prithvi smashed it to the left of Rana at backward point - who makes a smart stop
Shivam Mavi to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, cracking shot, back of a length and just outside off, Prithvi stands tall, plays with a straight bat and punches, beats point and rolls away to the fence
Shivam Mavi to Prithvi Shaw, no run, short and well outside off, Prithvi was looking to steer it towards third man and is done in by the extra bounce

Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, nicely bowled by Chawla, got this one to skid through after pitching, stayed a bit low as well, Prithvi was backing away on the cut - played against the turn and almost chopped it back onto the stumps, just past the keeper and they take a single. 18 from the over

Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, back-to-back boundaries for Prithvi, Chawla dropped this one short and on the leg-stump line, pulled away hard and past square leg, beats the fielder getting across from the deep

Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, lovely, how well did Prithvi read this leg break? This was tossed up well outside off and spun away, Prithvi gets a big stride forward, plays with the turn and goes inside out over cover, one bounce and over the ropes
Chawla to Munro, 1 run, pushed through quicker and just outside off, stayed a bit low as well, punched towards mid-off for a single

Chawla to Munro, FOUR, streaky but four, tossed up slower and spinning away from outside off, Munro was making room on the inside out drive, doesn't cover for the spin and slices it over backward point, couple of bounces and over the fence

Chawla to Munro, FOUR, beautifully played, nicely tossed up on off, Munro gets a big stride forward, gets close to the ball and drives it back past the non-striker, beats mid-off and rolls away to the fence
Kuldeep Yadav to Munro, 1 run, another wrong 'un from Kuldeep, but the length is on the shorter side, lets Munro stay back and punch it to the right of cover for a single

Kuldeep Yadav to Munro, SIX, smashed, that's a long hop from Kuldeep, it was the attempted wrong 'un, sat up to be smacked. Munro stayed back and flat-batted the pull, high and over long-on for a maximum
Kuldeep Yadav to Munro, no run, tad short and just outside off, Munro goes back and defends it towards the off-side
Kuldeep Yadav to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, tossed up on the off-stump line, Prithvi bends down low, rolls his wrists and sweeps it to deep mid-wicket for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Munro, 1 run, flatter and just outside off, punched down towards long-on for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, the wrong 'un from Kuldeep, but the length is on the shorter side, worked away towards long-on for a single

Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, flighted well outside off, Prithvi went down on his knees as he played the slog sweep, went right off the bottom of the bat and drops in front of the fielder at deep mid-wicket, just a single
Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, no run, tad short and wide of off, Prithvi cuts it straight to the fielder at backward point
Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, no run, appeal for LBW, but the angle was taking the ball well down the leg-side, pushed through quicker and on the stumps, Prithvi was looking to flick and missed
Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, 2 runs, Chawla drifts this one across the right-hander, Prithvi spots it early, plays with the turn and works it wide of mid-wicket for a brace
Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, no run, the wrong 'un from Chawla, Prithvi spotted it early and found point with the drive
Chawla to Prithvi Shaw, no run, tossed up just outside off, Prithvi hangs back and pushes it back at the bowler
Tahir to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, that's the win for Mumbai as Pandya dabs this googly past short third man. That storied MI comeback is still on
Tahir to Rohit, 1 run, a bit too eager to finish it off with this pull. Gets through with it early and toe-ends it through mid-wicket. Scores level nevertheless
Tahir to Rohit, 2 runs, shimmies out and picks this dart off the pads to clip it behind square. They rush back for the second. Huge roar
Tahir to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, length ball, sliding in on middle, Pandya eases it down to long-on

SN Thakur to Rohit, FOUR, kills the game off, surely. Tremendous batting from Rohit Sharma. He picks the bowler's mind, reads the incoming yorker and sweeps it away through backward square. Raises a fifty
SN Thakur to Rohit, no run, skiddy back of a length delivery outside off, rushes Rohit on the cut and beats him

SN Thakur to Rohit, FOUR, hat-trick of fours. Rohit's doing it for Mumbai. Short of length ball outside off, slower one, and the MI skipper is able to thread it through backward point and third man. Brilliantly glided
SN Thakur to Rohit, FOUR, that previous ball has messed his line up. This time he goes full at the stumps, Rohit shuffles inside the line of it and whips it away to the fine leg boundary. Top batting

SN Thakur to Rohit, FOUR, low full toss outside off, Rohit ingeniously slices it away over backward point. Shades of the shot Dhoni played the other night, but not quite as good. He just about clears Harbhajan though. Thakur must be crestfallen, this was a perfectly good ball
SN Thakur to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, brilliant yorker outside off, all Pandya can do is to squeeze it through the covers for one

Watson to Rohit, 2 runs, it's a good wide yorker but Rohit has countered it by using his feet. He stretches out and slices it away through the covers. Work for Murali Vijay to do, who is there at sweeper cover in place of Tahir, and he does well
Watson to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, nails the blockhole this time, squeezed away to deep mid-wicket

Watson to Hardik Pandya, SIX, misses his length big time and Pandya laaaaaunches into it. It's a monstrous six over long-on. Probably aimed for the yorker there but ended up bowling right in Pandya's slot. Disappears
Watson to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length, eased down to long-on

Watson to Rohit, FOUR, not the best effort from Tahir in the deep, lets the ball sneak through for four. He's immediately removed from that position. Good length ball outside off, Rohit doesn't get all of it but does enough to carve it away through sweeper cover's dive
Watson to Rohit, wide, oooh, tight call from umpire Gaffaney but the right one. Watson just encroaches the wide marker with his yorker. Good awareness from Rohit too
Watson to Rohit, no run, good length ball, Rohit stands tall and hammers the drive but finds extra cover. He smashed that
Dwayne Bravo to Hardik Pandya, no run, slower ball at the stumps, blocked back down the pitch
Dwayne Bravo to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, crisply punched through extra cover, the sweeper has plenty of work to do to his right, in which time they amble the second
Dwayne Bravo to Rohit, 1 run, steered away through point
Dwayne Bravo to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, slanted in on middle, back of length, Pandya has to rush his bat down from an angle to jab it down to long-on
Dwayne Bravo to Rohit, 1 run, sharp short ball on leg, hurries Rohit in the pull and he gets it off the gloves down to fine leg

Dwayne Bravo to Lewis, out Caught by SN Thakur!! Slices it up a mile in the air, really cool pressure catch from Thakur at long-off. Big wicket for CSK, straight after the time-out. Good length ball wide of off, gets it out of the batsman's swinging arc. Lewis flings his hands at it, slicing it up right off the bottom. Excellent bowling. Bravo coming to the fore again. Lewis c SN Thakur b Dwayne Bravo 47(43) [4s-3 6s-2]
SN Thakur to Lewis, 1 run, skids on sharply from a short of length, rushes the pull, and it's flapped up in the air by Lewis. But it drops well short of long-on
SN Thakur to Lewis, no run, clears the front leg to open himself up for the off-side. But because this ball from Thakur was pretty full, Lewis couldn't get under it. Driven straight to mid-off
SN Thakur to Rohit, 1 run, delightfully flicked off the pads to deep mid-wicket
SN Thakur to Rohit, 2 runs, full ball on off, Rohit closes the bat-face on it to place it wide of long-on. "Two two two" is the call straightaway. And it's comfortable
SN Thakur to Rohit, no run, charges down and mistimes his flat-batted drive to short cover. Thakur one-upped him there by shortening his length, causing the error in timing
SN Thakur to Lewis, 1 run, short of length on middle, skids on rapidly. Lewis fends it in front of cover
Dwayne Bravo to Lewis, 1 run, clipped away off the hips to deep square leg
Dwayne Bravo to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Rohit opens his body up and flat-bats it to sweeper cover
Dwayne Bravo to Lewis, 1 run, slower ball on leg, nudged into the on-side
Dwayne Bravo to Rohit, 1 run, full ball angling into the pads, Rohit wants to pick it away with his wrists but he ends up with an inside edge onto pad. Deflects towards point, they take the run
Dwayne Bravo to Rohit, no run, defended to the right of Bravo who stretches across and tosses it back towards the stumps while losing balance

Dwayne Bravo to Rohit, FOUR, the Mumbai captain is up for it tonight. He's taking control of this chase now. Short of length ball, only chest high, and Rohit dismisses it with an authoritative pull backward of square. Huge cheers. It's a split crowd here
Dwayne Bravo to Rohit, wide, strays down the leg-side, wide called
Watson to Rohit, 1 run, eased down to long-off
Watson to Rohit, no run, back of a length delivery outside off, gently punched to short cover

Watson to Rohit, SIX, wow, what execution! Gets right under this full ball and lap-sweeps it all the way over short fine leg. Just never looks hurried at all. Quickly took a step across, got down low and again, lovely timing

Watson to Rohit, no run, the extra bounce surprises Rohit. He was lining up to dab this short of length delivery down to third man, but the ball climbed on him, and he has to check it to backward point
Watson to Rohit, no run, fuller than a good length outside off, driven to Raina at short cover

Watson to Rohit, SIX, lofted for six with one hand. How well has he timed this. It appeared that Rohit might have been beaten for the lack of pace and was into the loft too early, evidenced by his bottom hand coming off. But mid-off was up, so he had the confidence to go through with it. Ends up getting it right off the middle
Dwayne Bravo to Lewis, FOUR, spoils a good over by smearing the ball into the wide long-off boundary. To be fair, Bravo was asking for it by bowling this gentle full toss outside off. Duly punished
Dwayne Bravo to Rohit, leg byes, 1 run, skids on quicker than Rohit expects. He's late on the flick and it deflects off his pad into the square leg region
Dwayne Bravo to Lewis, 1 run, 136kph, full ball on middle, Lewis pushes it down the ground to long-off
Dwayne Bravo to Rohit, 1 run, 132.9kph, back of a length delivery angling in on off, cramps Rohit up a touch but he gets the back-cut away down to third man
Dwayne Bravo to Lewis, 1 run, wide full toss outside off, Lewis belts it straight to sweeper cover. Left a vapour trail, but Rayudu didn't have to move
Dwayne Bravo to Lewis, no run, back of a length delivery outside off, steered straight to backward point. Third man was inside the ring and Lewis was looking for the gap. Couldn't find it
Harbhajan to Lewis, 1 run, another one fired in full, Lewis pats it into the cover region. Six singles off the over
Harbhajan to Rohit, 1 run, eased down to long-on
Harbhajan to Lewis, 1 run, 102kph, no tossing it up to Lewis at this stage. It's pretty full too, almost in the blockhole. Lewis jams it down to long-off
Harbhajan to Rohit, 1 run, quick and flat, at the stumps from Harbhajan. Rohit nurdles it round the corner for one. He's happy to play himself in right now
Harbhajan to Lewis, 1 run, 100.7kph, darted in on a back of length, Lewis punches it through the covers
Harbhajan to Rohit, 1 run, flat at the stumps, works it down to long-on
Tahir to Lewis, no run, well bowled. Slows the googly down outside off, makes Lewis reach out to it and then turns it past the outside edge. 16 off the over though. Lewis has come alive
Tahir to Lewis, SIX, my word, what power down the ground. Short from Tahir, Lewis thwacks it straight back over long-on. It's off the back foot too. Stunning
Tahir to Rohit, 1 run, pushed on the front foot to long-off
Tahir to Lewis, 1 run, missed out. Short ball, swatted hard but straight to deep mid-wicket
Tahir to Lewis, wide, now over the wicket, fires the googly very wide of off, left alone. Happy to collect the wide. Tahir under pressure

Tahir to Lewis, SIX, carves this googly high and mighty over extra cover. Probably a bit too predictable from the leggie. This is what he was doing against Lewis in the entire last over. This time Lewis anticipates it, sizes it up and smokes it
Tahir to Rohit, 1 run, googly spinning in at the stumps, Rohit hangs back and nudges it softly in front of short mid-wicket
Harbhajan to Lewis, 2 runs, fired in on middle, tucked to deep square leg

Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Jadeja!!Gone! There's the breakthrough and is that the opening CSK were looking for? Game on. What a catch that was from Jaddu. It was a shortish ball and Yadav struck it pretty well. Went back in his crease to pull and got it off middle of the bat. But, in comes Ravindra Jadeja, CSK's best fielder. Sprinted across to his left from deep mid-wicket, had his eyes on the ball and slided to snaffle with both hands. Bhajji runs towards the fielder to applaud the effort. Suryakumar Yadav c Jadeja b Harbhajan 44(34) [4s-5 6s-1]
Harbhajan to Lewis, 1 run, 99.5kph! Fired in and cramps Lewis for room. The batsman brings his bat down at an angle and manages to force it wide fo backward point
Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, Yadav allows the ball to turn in and drives it to long-on
Harbhajan to Lewis, 1 run, flat ball, from a short of length, cut square of the wicket
Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, 91.7kph offie, wristy drive down to long-on

Tahir to Lewis, FOUR, a gift dished out and Lewis accepts it with both hands. He needed that. Connects and collects four. A rank full toss fired by Tahir and Lewis thumps it down the ground. Over the bowler's head and long-off had no chance

Tahir to Lewis, byes, FOUR, through Dhoni and that runs away into the fence. Very rare from MS. It was the googly from Tahir and Lewis tries another lofted shot. Is nowhere close to the bat and misses. Was marginally outside the tramline as well. Brushed the CSK skipper's pad and that's four bonus runs for MI
Tahir to Lewis, no run, fuller ball, driven firmly, straight to extra cover
Tahir to Lewis, no run, now, he wants to send one into the Pune-Mumbai expressway. Misses it completely. Another away-drifter, Lewis swings and misses
Tahir to Lewis, no run, Lewis has no clue. The quick leggie that drifts away, doesn't turn much. Lewis stuck his bat out and got beaten on the outside edge
Tahir to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, 95.6kph, in-drifter, full ball on middle and leg, on-driven to long-on
Harbhajan to Lewis, no run, four dots in a row! And the asking rate is now 9.5. The length was shortened and Lewis stays in his crease to bunt it back to Harbhajan
Harbhajan to Lewis, no run, and again. This was looped up and Lewis drove hard. Raina at extra cover, is quick to move to his left and make a tumbling stop

Harbhajan to Lewis, no run, superb stop by Raina at extra cover! Shortish ball and Lewis punched it hard off the back foot, can't beat Raina, who dives full length to his left and saves a run for his team
Harbhajan to Lewis, no run, fired in on the stumps at 99.5kph, patted to extra cover
Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, going down leg, helped on its way to deep backward square leg
Harbhajan to Lewis, 1 run, off-break outside off, Lewis moves across, stays deep and forces it through point. Rayudu runs across and keeps the batters down to a single
Watson to Lewis, 1 run, hurled full and wide of off, Lewis throws his bat and the outside edge flies towards third man, who takes it on the bounce
Watson to Lewis, no run, 131.3kph length ball, Lewis moves off-side and pushes it back to the bowler
Watson to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, back of a length delivery on the stumps, Yadav hops and pats it to the left of the cover fielder
Watson to Lewis, 1 run, that made a cracking sound off the bat, but there's protection in the deep. Full and outside off, Lewis reaches out and middles the drive to sweeper cover
Watson to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, width served outside off and that's been guided to deep backward point
