Watson to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, seam-up short of length delivery around the fifth stump line, punched off the back foot. Extra cover moves to his right to stop that

SN Thakur to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, fuller in length and attacking the stumps, the bat-face is closed to nudge it towards square leg. Off the inside half. This is a good start for MI - 50 in the powerplay!
SN Thakur to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, the length ball and that might have held onto the pitch a tad. Yadav pushed with hard hands and the ball eluded the bowler in his followthrough

SN Thakur to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, wow! That's delicious. The bottom hand power, my goodness. Was a full ball on the pads, Yadav just walked across and flicked it over deep backward square leg. Top shot
SN Thakur to Lewis, 1 run, inwinger on middle, turned to backward square leg

SN Thakur to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, full ball wide of off, the cutter, Yadav wanted to dribe through covers and was way too early into his stroke. The inside edge rolls towards Vijay at mid-wicket and the batsmen decide to take him on. Vijay has a shy at the bowler's end and misses. Yadav was in
SN Thakur to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, short of a good length delivery on off, Yadav covers the line and blocks
Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, slower ball, bit of turn, Yadav wrists it down to long-on

Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, width served and Yadav doesn't miss out. Was on the shorter side as well and Yadav used the bowler's pace to good effect. Opened the bat-face to punch it through covers. Excellent placement
Harbhajan to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, Yadav is cramped for room by this shortish dart, patted to cover

Harbhajan to Lewis, 1 run, that ball had four written all over it. But, hang on! There's Rayudu, who sprints to his left from deep square leg and makes a superb stop. Harbhajan applauds. There's history between those two as well - not a fond one though. A half-tracker from Harbhajan, Lewis pulled it away powerfully behind square
Harbhajan to Lewis, no run, no flight, flat ball angling in on off, pushed to mid-on off the inside edge
Chahar to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, slower ball at 119.1kph, Yadav shuffles across a long way to nurdle it down to fine leg
Watson to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, fuller ball on middle and leg, a walk across, followed by a glance to deep square leg
Watson to Suryakumar Yadav, 2 runs, in-angler, Yadav uses his wrists to turn it through mid-wicket for a couple
Basil Thampi to Jofra Archer, 1 run, it's it. Full, tailing in, whipped away .. doesn't matter where it goes. Hyderabad top tables

Basil Thampi to Gowtham, out Caught by Dhawan!! There's the nail. The unlikeliest of ties is out of the equation too. Quite a half volley this, Gowtham can't get under the length though, drills it uppishly, without elevation. This time Dhawan at long-off need not tumble, he can stay and collect. Gowtham c Dhawan b Basil Thampi 8(5) [4s-1]

Basil Thampi to Gowtham, 2 runs, full, straight, right out of the death bowling manual. Gowtham goes straight down, drilling it to a tumbling Dhawan. And he's high-fiving .. it's sealed guys. 13 off 2
Basil Thampi to Rahane, 1 run, keeps it in the blockhole. Rahane can only get a toe-end, down the pitch
Basil Thampi to Gowtham, 1 run, tailing in, another attempted yorker. Squeezed out only as far as extra cover waiting in the ring

Basil Thampi to Gowtham, FOUR, gets his line wrong. Gets his length wrong. A yorker in the form of a half volley, the line stays on middle and Gowtham's hoick gets a fat inside edge, through his legs and through a vacant square leg
S Kaul to Rahane, no run, low, bent, wanting to hoick into the night sky. Nah. Can't. Inside-tickle is all he gets to the keeper
S Kaul to Rahane, 2 runs, 115.2kph. Ugly. Across, opened up and carves it away through point. You can trust a Bengali with footie skills, Shakib shows them at the boundary. Oh neat
S Kaul to Gowtham, 1 run, swivels, pulling it away round the corner. 23 off 8 and Rahane has his strike

S Kaul to Lomror, out Caught by Saha!! Wide knuckle ball, angling way across -- tempting Lomror to chase, take on the big boundary. Well he has to. Throws his bat out .. he wouldn't have had a problem even with some sort of a big edge. Gets it off the outside, yes, but not past a flying Saha to his left. Lomror c Saha b S Kaul 11(12)

S Kaul to Lomror, 2 runs, this drama. In a match that's set to remembered for a drop, here's Pandey almost pulling off a stunner. So Lomror slog-slices high up. Pandey reverse-cups right at the edge of long-off. Realizes he's slipping over and throws it back in. He's making a habit of these
S Kaul to Rahane, 1 run, knuckle, length, middle. Rahane makes room, slaps hard, but straight to backward point
Rashid Khan to Rahane, 1 run, dragged short. Sits up for a heave into mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Rahane, no run, so he has a reverse sweep too. Oh dear, save the sanctity, somebody. It's down leg, and Rahane's missed. And the umpire's not amused
Rashid Khan to Lomror, 1 run, takes it on the full. Muscling, bottom-handed through mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Lomror, no run, goes googly, Lomror trapped with flat feet, just can't slap it right. Can't slap it at all in fact
Rashid Khan to Rahane, 1 run, another sweep. Nailed away in front of square
Rashid Khan to Rahane, SIX, and there. Crunch. Targets the smaller leg-side, premeditates a sweep, slogging it uppishly, deep into mid-wicket. That should simplify things
S Kaul to Rahane, 1 run, 120.5kph. Opens ups his stance, baseball-like, quietly knocked around in front of square
S Kaul to Lomror, 1 run, clears his front leg, bit can't get under this fuller length. Hammers it down the ground
S Kaul to Rahane, 1 run, 118.6kph knuckle ball. Rahane walks, shuffles and there's no pace to be doing anything fancy. So another one of his staple whips through mid-wicket
S Kaul to Lomror, 1 run, 114.5kph, hard drive, through the covers. Sensible singles these
S Kaul to Rahane, 1 run, ramps out to the width to guide it to short third
S Kaul to Rahane, 2 runs, full, tailing back in, dug out to long-on -- credit the second to slow timing and the massive outfields
Rashid Khan to Rahane, 1 run, delicate dab, expecting it to run away. But Yusuf's diving, putting his body on the line at short third man
Rashid Khan to Lomror, 1 run, 96.1kph, some sort of a cramped cut through the covers. Super-quick hands
Rashid Khan to Lomror, 2 runs, reverse, sweeping, does clear point, but not quite the legs to beat sweeper
Rashid Khan to Rahane, 1 run, bigger shuffle, ensures he's behind the line as he takes matters leg-sided
Rashid Khan to Rahane, no run, from the back of the palm, drawing Rahane into the drive. Only to fox him with the spit up, beating him comprehensively
Rashid Khan to Rahane, 2 runs, 97kph leg-spinning skidder. Rahane whips it off his sticker, and nobody quite bothers chasing as it meekly rolls through mid-wicket. Rashid eventually has to
Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, 1 run, 111.4kph. Consecutive knuckle number three. But it's short, allowing Rahane to wait on his back foot, read, shuffle, and whip it down to long-on
Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, 2 runs, slow again. Rahane's wrists are softer, knocking it into mid-wicket, where the fielder's right at the boundary to pinch him for a second
Sandeep Sharma to Lomror, 1 run, so he has a knuckle ball too. Floated up wide outside off, making Lomror wait in a steery push through point
Sandeep Sharma to Lomror, no run, stabs at the width, finding point
Sandeep Sharma to Lomror, 2 runs, jumps down, away, gives himself room and carves it to sweeper's left. Rahane wants the second, and he doesn't mind putting in the dive
Sandeep Sharma to Lomror, no run, 124kph, good length on middle. Lomror starts off with a checked defence off the back foot

Rashid Khan to Buttler, out Caught by Dhawan!! They're falling. Buttler tries forcing the run-rate, but against Rashid, seriously? Gets a floater around off, tries going downtown with a full-blooded swing. Mistimes, and Dhawan's waiting at long-off, with a pre-loaded thigh slap celebration ready to come out. Buttler c Dhawan b Rashid Khan 10(11)
Rashid Khan to Rahane, 1 run, fat leading-edge drawn as he tries flicking it against the turn. And Buttler calls him across for a quick one
Rashid Khan to Buttler, 1 run, angry charge down, not quite to the pitch though. Drilled in adjustment to long-on
Rashid Khan to Rahane, 1 run, uses the angle in to clip it behind square. More of a toe-end this
Rashid Khan to Buttler, 1 run, 94.2kph. On the reverse. Dragging it from outside leg to sweeper
Rashid Khan to Rahane, 1 run, juicy toss up outside off. Rahane reads the googly, covers the line with a long stride and tickles it softly to the on-side, just past the pitch
Y Pathan to Buttler, 2 runs, too straight, too full, too easy. Flick. Square leg
Y Pathan to Rahane, 1 run, shows the full straight bat, punching it down the ground
Y Pathan to Rahane, no run, another floated up drifter down leg. This time he however picks out short fine with his sweep
Y Pathan to Rahane, FOUR, slipping down. That's the customary loose stuff a part-timer dishes out. Quick sweep, ensuring it goes very fine
Y Pathan to Buttler, 1 run, short again. Hacked again. Long-on again
Y Pathan to Rahane, 1 run, dancing down. Pathan's smart, he's seen him, he goes short. Rahane has to adjust to half-slap it to long-on
Shakib to Buttler, 2 runs, in with the arm and Buttler works it softly, deliberately, through mid-wicket. And takes on the sweeper's arm
Shakib to Rahane, 1 run, on the move again, but Rahane takes it to cow corner with a whip
Shakib to Buttler, 1 run, a walking through-the-line squeeze out to long-off
Shakib to Buttler, no run, 79.2kph. Spots Buttler on the move down and smartly slows it up. Nothing on offer for Buttler to put it away, settles to defend
Shakib to Buttler, no run, clears his front leg out, checking his drive to cover
Shakib to Rahane, 1 run, 85.3kph, off-lined. Rahane shuffles to go against the spin to mid-wicket
Y Pathan to Rahane, 1 run, too straight. Clipped away off the hips, round the corner
Y Pathan to Buttler, 1 run, tickled away off the inside half, short fine
Y Pathan to Rahane, 1 run, fuller, Rahane's back on the long-off drives
Y Pathan to Buttler, 1 run, back, slapping it down to long-on

Y Pathan to Stokes, out Bowled!! My word. He's brought on as a roller, to sneak an over under the radar, but such is the power that practically anybody in a Hyderabadi jersey can pick wickets. Pathan holds the ball back in his palm as he fires in a slider. Yes it was short, but certainly not for Stokes to rock back as deep as he did in trying to heave it away. Misses big time, sneaking under the bat. Well under. And yeah, off's uprooted. Stokes b Y Pathan 0(3)
Y Pathan to Rahane, 1 run, 92kph, inviting Rahane forward. Cleanly stroked out to long-off
S Kaul to Stokes, no run, inward zip again. Another block, this time to cover
S Kaul to Stokes, no run, shuffles, gets behind the length-off-stuff to keep it out

S Kaul to Samson, out Caught by Hales!! Times his way to Hales. He just can't look ugly, and the overdose of timing he's got in him isn't quite on par with the fields put out. Kaul brings out his knuckle ball, with a late tail inwards. Samson tries punching it through the on-side, gets it off the middle too, but can't keep it down. Right where short mid-wicket's waiting. Samson c Hales b S Kaul 40(30) [4s-3 6s-1]
S Kaul to Rahane, 1 run, 126.3kph, goes short, cross-seamed as he digs it into the wicket. Some sort of a front-hand tennis swat to long-on
S Kaul to Samson, 1 run, 133.4kph, tightens up on middle. Not quite the clean timing, but enough on Samson's punch to get it down the ground
S Kaul to Rahane, leg byes, 1 run, nipping back in off a shortened good length onto the hips. Turned away, one-handed glance. Nope, it's off the leg-ricochet
Shakib to Rahane, 1 run, drifting in on off. Knocked down, long-on's busy today
Shakib to Samson, 1 run, 85.1kph. A pressy poke, into the covers. And quick legs
Shakib to Rahane, 1 run, slower, not quite the timing, but wristy enough off the back foot into the vacant mid-wicket
Shakib to Rahane, FOUR, a defensive drag down. Rahane stays tall, picks his widely open cow corner. And whips. Splitting the men converging to perfection
Shakib to Samson, 1 run, in with the arm from wide of the crase. Samson waits longer, getting his steery-punch square
Shakib to Rahane, 1 run, rocks back, never mind getting cramped as he punches it to cover's left
Rashid Khan to Rahane, 1 run, to long-off, closed up a touch sooner than the ball comes onto him. Leading-edged back down the pitch
Rashid Khan to Rahane, FOUR, 94.8kph, back of the hand stuff, drifting down leg though and generously full. Rahane is quick to pounce on, sits, uses the angle and drills his sweep behind square
Rashid Khan to Samson, 1 run, some loop - if 88.9kph is what you call it. Stroked, long-off
Rashid Khan to Samson, 2 runs, low lean, opening up his bat face to carve it square
Rashid Khan to Rahane, 1 run, sliding in, fuller though. Wristed down, back to long-on
Rashid Khan to Samson, 1 run, too short a start. But with the pace Rashid's getting in on these skidders, Samson better be qucik on his back foot. Not quite, pulled off the inside half to long-on
Shakib to Samson, 1 run, fired down leg, a bit short and Samson whips it away towards deep mid-wicket for a single
Shakib to Samson, no run, slower and a touch short outside off, punched to backward point who makes a good stop
Shakib to Samson, 2 runs, premeditated paddle by Samson who was across the stumps very early. Connects well and deflects this down to fine leg. Easy two
Shakib to Rahane, 1 run, thrown up around off, Rahane gets across and flicks it away down to long-on
Shakib to Samson, 1 run, floated up around middle and leg, nudged to the leg-side with a shuffle across the sticks

Shakib to Samson, 2 runs, deft touch from Samson. Drifting in from a good length, he sits deep in the crease and dabs this very late past the keeper. Beats short third man who eventually tracks it down

S Kaul to Samson, 1 run, full and around middle, Samson continues to time his drives beautifully. Straight down the ground and they did think of the second but long-on is in business once more. Gets quickly across to his left to mop up
S Kaul to Samson, no run, back of a length outside off, steered with an open bat face towards backward point. Cannot find the gap

S Kaul to Samson, 2 runs, slower on a good length, a bit of width and Samson checks his back foot punch to beat the diving extra cover fielder. Mid-off gets across to his left to track it down as the batsmen take two

S Kaul to Samson, FOUR, such is the form Samson is in, he doesn't need bad balls to score boundaries. Here is another example. A knuckle ball outside off, he just stands tall and uses his supple wrists to drop kick this wide of the long-on fence. The fielder there tried hard but couldn't get to it
S Kaul to Rahane, 1 run, 'two' was the call from Rahane as soon as he hit this one but long-on was quick to get across to his right. On a good length just outside off, wristed away down the ground
S Kaul to Rahane, no run, stayed down a fraction from a good length, Rahane adjusts with a shuffle across and taps it towards mid-on
Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, 1 run, slowish and full around off, worked away down to long-on to keep the strike

Sandeep Sharma to Samson, 1 run, direct hit would have got Samson in trouble! Pandey from mid-on got across and tried to fire in a throw at the bowler's end but couldn't find the target. Rahane isn't amused with the call from his partner either, rightly so. Fuller ball that was nudged in front of mid-on
Sandeep Sharma to Samson, no run, yet another off-pace delivery, Samson was probably early into the flick. Checks his stroke to mid-wicket
Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, 1 run, another slower ball, on the pads and Rahane nudges it towards short fine leg. Quick single but they get it comfortably in the end
Sandeep Sharma to Samson, 1 run, slower ball on middle and leg, nudged through square leg for a single
Sandeep Sharma to Samson, no run, on middle and leg from a good length, Samson gets across and clips it towards mid-wicket who makes a tumbling stop
Basil Thampi to Samson, 1 run, slanting in around middle and leg, Samson checks his drive down to long-on to retain strike
Basil Thampi to Samson, 2 runs, tries the yorker but it's a full toss on middle and leg, casually wristed away wide of long-on who does well to get to it in the end with a slide to his right

Basil Thampi to Samson, FOUR, clobbered away! This time, Samson connected the pull perfectly and it raced away. Short of a length around middle, not high enough to threaten the batsman and an in-form batsman like Samson isn't going to miss out. Sends this to the deep square leg fence. Thampi needs to recover quickly

Basil Thampi to Samson, no run, slower ball and kept too low as well, Samson dabs it back past the bowler. He wanted the single but Rahane sends him back. Believe it or not, this clocked a mere 94.7kph

Basil Thampi to Samson, SIX, that's in the stands! Samson is showing no mercy on his State mate. Fractionally short from Thampi and that's all that was needed for the in-form Samson. Swivels to pull this away for a biggie. Didn't get a full chunk of it, didn't have to in the end as it cleared the deep mid-wicket fence with ease

Basil Thampi to Samson, FOUR, delicious shot! Oozing class! Not all that bad a ball, just a fab stroke. On a good length just outside off, Samson just stood tall and cracked the back foot punch on the up. Through the covers and it blazed away. What a shot!
Sandeep Sharma to Samson, 1 run, angling in on middle and off, Samson gets across and wrists this towards deep mid-wicket
Sandeep Sharma to Samson, no run, soft leading edge! Samson was standing tall to this good length ball around off, wanted to nudge it on the leg-side. Trickles towards short cover
Sandeep Sharma to Samson, no run, on a good length outside off, Samson stands tall and punches to cover
Sandeep Sharma to Samson, no run, starts with a full ball outside off, a bit of outward shape as Samson defends off the front foot

Sandeep Sharma to R Tripathi, out Bowled!! Bowled 'em! Horror stroke from Tripathi and his woes this season continue. On a good length around middle, kept low as well and Tripathi premeditated the charge down the pitch. In the end, he couldn't do much and had to adjust to keep it out. Couldn't and heard the rattle of timber behind him. Just the start SRH would have wanted. R Tripathi b Sandeep Sharma 4(5)
Sandeep Sharma to R Tripathi, no run, short of a length outside off, Tripathi cuts it hard but cannot find the gap at backward point

Shakib to Rahane, FOUR, beautifully timed! Placement was spot on too. Got this wide of mid-on and well to the left of the deep mid-wicket fielder as well. A touch short around middle, skids off the deck and Rahane whips it away with strong wristwork. Nicely done by the skipper
Shakib to R Tripathi, 1 run, walks down the track, does Tripathi but Shakib pulls the length back a bit. Slower as well and it's worked to deep mid-wicket
Shakib to Rahane, 1 run, floated up on a length on leg, a touch short and whipped to deep mid-wicket
Shakib to Rahane, no run, slower around off, worked down the track and Shakib gets across to stop it in his followthrough
Shakib to R Tripathi, 1 run, fired in just around off, Tripathi dabs it towards cover and they take a quick single
Shakib to R Tripathi, 2 runs, flatter on a good length, Tripathi makes room and punches this wide of long-off. Rashid races to his left and makes a sliding stop to save a brace

Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, no run, on a good length nipping in a fraction, Rahane defends this from the crease with soft hands towards cover. Fine first over from Sandeep, definitely getting some movement
Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, no run, more of the fullish length and Rahane times the straight drive well too. Mid-off is straighter though and this goes towards him
Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, no run, Sandeep continues to get that shape on the inswinger, full around off and it's defended off the front foot

Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, FOUR, nicely done by Rahane! This tailed in sharply from a fullish length but the line was a bit too straight. Clipped away sweetly past the diving mid-wicket fielder and it raced away to the fence. RR are away
Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, no run, a bit of extra bounce from a shortish length and Rahane stood tall to punch this. Straight to backward point
Sandeep Sharma to Rahane, no run, on a good length and a bit of inward shape, punched off the back foot towards cover
Jofra Archer to Saha, byes, 1 run, premeditated paddle attempt from Saha but doesn't get bat on ball. They sneak a bye. SRH limp their way to 151/7!

Jofra Archer to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Stokes!! Archer is having fun here at the death. Gets this third and this is another canny delivery. After a series of fullish balls, he drags back the length and takes all the pace off this one. Rashid was shuffling across for the slog but this got big on him. All he managed was to sky it towards deep mid-wicket. Stokes won't drop those. Rashid Khan c Stokes b Jofra Archer 1(3)
Jofra Archer to Saha, 1 run, almost chopped on! Archer is getting his yorkers bang on. Gets this in the blockhole once more and Saha squirts an inside edge that goes down to fine leg
Jofra Archer to Rashid Khan, 1 run, more of the fuller length, not allowing Rashid to get under it properly. Drilled down to long-on
Jofra Archer to Saha, 1 run, almost a yorker, ends up as a low full toss that's heaved towards deep mid-wicket

Jofra Archer to Saha, FOUR, lovely shot. Mid-off is up and Archer bowls a fuller length to compound things. Easy for Saha though, he holds his shape and drives beautifully. Splits mid-off and extra cover easily to find the fence. Valuable runs

Unadkat to Rashid Khan, no run, how did that miss? Just missed the stumps by a whisker. Slower ball on a good length, Rashid wanted to send this one out of Jaipur with that wild slog of his. If only he could connect. Gets lucky eventually

Unadkat to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Rahane!! SRH are coming apart here in the death overs. Must say that the RR bowlers have been smart as well in reading the surface and executing the plans. Unadkat does what he does best, a slower ball on a good length that Pandey wants to biff by making room. He has no other choice at this stage, does he? However, doesn't connect it well at all and slices it high towards backward point where the RR skipper does the rest. Manish Pandey c Rahane b Unadkat 16(15) [4s-1]
Unadkat to Saha, 1 run, Saha was moving around in the crease a lot and hencde, never was in control. Unadkat fires in a yorker that's stabbed to point. Just a single
Unadkat to Saha, 2 runs, Gowtham's turn to mess up, this time at long-off and Saha gets another bonus run. Fuller ball outside off, pushed down the ground. Another single results in a brace

Unadkat to Saha, 2 runs, sloppy from Archer. Wild throw at the bowler's end, Unadkat wasn't aware of it and they sneak an extra run. Another slower ball outside off, steered down towards third man. Should have been just a single
Unadkat to Manish Pandey, 1 run, sees Pandey giving the charge, does Unadkat and slows it down on a shorter length. No room to work with either and it's dragged down to long-on. Just a single

Jofra Archer to Y Pathan, out Caught by D Kulkarni!! Double strike from Archer! He turned it on at the death against the Mumbai Indians and is at it here as well. What a boost RR have got with his inclusion! Terrific death bowler and this over has been further proof of it. Pacy short ball and although it was a tad wide, Pathan was in no position to play it. Ends up trying to just guide it. Flies straight to the fielder stationed at third man. Y Pathan c D Kulkarni b Jofra Archer 2(3)
Jofra Archer to Manish Pandey, 1 run, another perfect yorker on off stump, nothing much Pandey can do except jam this towards cover
Jofra Archer to Y Pathan, 1 run, very full and a hint of tail into Pathan who wrists it away towards deep mid-wicket
Jofra Archer to Manish Pandey, 1 run, another slower ball on a shortish length, Pandey is cramped and he swivels to pull this to deep square leg
Jofra Archer to Y Pathan, 1 run, slower bal outside off, shortish and dabbed towards point for a quick single

Jofra Archer to Shakib, out Bowled!! Cleans him up! Excellent yorker from Archer and that's the end of Shakib. This was on the base of off stump and although the southpaw could see it coming, he was beaten for pace. Ended up just brushing the off bails. Fantastic comeback from RR, they are dragging things back in spectacular fashion here. Archer was unlucky not to get Williamson earlier with a yorker and was even unfortunate that a catch was put down as well of the Kiwi. Not this time. Shakib b Jofra Archer 6(6) [4s-1]

Stokes to Manish Pandey, no run, better from Stokes, more of the areas he needs to hit with this field set. Back of a length angling into Pandey who makes room but is still cramped for room. Tries to swing across the line but he ain't connecting that length. Despite the boundary, just 7 off the over. RR will take it
Stokes to Manish Pandey, no run, the change up, takes pace off and keeps it just outside off. Pandey backed away to slap this but straight to cover

Stokes to Manish Pandey, FOUR, up and over! With mid-off in the ring, perhaps not the ideal length from Stokes and he pays the price for it. Fuller ball and allows Pandey to get under it. Lifted cleanly over the fielder who did leap but was never going to get to it
Stokes to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, on a length outside off, a bit of width and Pandey was making room. Slapped through the covers and well to the right of sweeper cover. Two more

Stokes to Shakib, 1 run, this time they get the single. Another off-pace ball on a shorter length, dabbed to the right of cover and they steal a single. A direct hit might have been close perhaps but the throw doesn't hit. No real backing up but no overthrows taken
Stokes to Shakib, no run, on a good length outside off, Shakib tries to make room a bit and pats it towards cover

Gowtham to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, ahh, was winding up for the mighty heave but didn't get hold of it at all. Gowtham slowed this down considerably to tempt the big shot, Pandey dragged it off the inner half but got into the spaces at deep mid-wicket. End of Gowtham for this game, fab figures 4-0-18-2!
Gowtham to Manish Pandey, no run, drifting in around middle and leg, nudged with a slight shuffle towards mid-wicket
Gowtham to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, full and wide outside off, nice drive from Pandey. Beats extra cover and they get two by the time Samson tidies up at long-off
Gowtham to Shakib, 1 run, flowing straight drive with the use of the feet but Gowtham does brilliantly to get a hand on it. Cannot stop it cleanly and it goes past him. The batsmen cross
Gowtham to Shakib, no run, floated up outside off, a touch short and tapped towards cover. Pandey wanted the single but there wasn't any there
Gowtham to Manish Pandey, 1 run, hangs it on a good length on off, spins in a touch as Pandey punches it towards long-on

Ish Sodhi to Shakib, FOUR, nice way to start for Shakib! Premeditates the paddle sweep and makes a fair amount of connection on it as well. Deflected it really fine down the leg-side and it raced away to the fence

Ish Sodhi to Williamson, out Caught by Buttler!! Huge wicket! Maiden IPL wicket for Sodhi! And it's his NZ skipper that he has sent back. Vital breakthrough for RR because the SRH captain was batting like a dream. This one shot through low shockingly from a good length as Williamson tried to play the cut from the crease. It was a great take from Buttler and S.Ravi felt there was a bottom edge. KW didn't and went for the review. The replays didn't show anything to be honest but the snicko has a different story to tell. Tiniest of spikes or murmurs to be precise and Williamson had to go. Williamson c Buttler b Ish Sodhi 63(43) [4s-7 6s-2]
Ish Sodhi to Manish Pandey, 1 run, more of the shorter length and this skids through around middle, Pandey pulls it towards deep mid-wicket

Ish Sodhi to Williamson, 1 run, poor ball but Sodhi gets away with it. Half-tracker around leg, Williamson executes the half-pull but hasn't placed it well enough. Unadkat at fine leg gets across to make a sliding stop, keeps the batsmen to a single
Ish Sodhi to Manish Pandey, 1 run, a bit of turn on the leg break around off, Pandey nudges it with the spin towards point with soft hands
Ish Sodhi to Manish Pandey, no run, slow low full toss, took forever to reach Pandey who mistimed it back towards the bowler

Gowtham to Williamson, 2 runs, fantastic running, they have converted one into two here. Flatter and attacking the stumps, it was jabbed towards long-on but not with real timing. Williamson wanted two and his new partner Manish Pandey is more than ready to speed across

Gowtham to Williamson, 2 runs, slower and wider outside off, Gowtham has been keeping it out of the batsman's reach in this over. Williamson is clever though and chips it inside out over extra cover. A bit of work for Unadkat at sweeper cover and they get two
Gowtham to Williamson, no run, fires a low full toss outside off, bunted straight back to the bowler

Gowtham to Hales, out Caught by Samson!! Gowtham has another! He's bowled exceptionally well today and has started this spell with a bang as well. Hales was moving around the crease and Gowtham smartly dragged this wider outside off. Asked the Englishman to fetch it and he could only slice it high in the air. Easiest of catches for Samson at backward point. Decent start to the IPL for Hales but he would have wanted to kick on and make a really big one. Timely strike for RR because this partnership was starting to open up. Hales c Samson b Gowtham 45(39) [4s-4]
Gowtham to Williamson, 1 run, moves around in the crease, does Williamson but Gowtham is calmly not giving space, slapped down to long-off
Gowtham to Hales, 1 run, stifled LBW appeal but Hales got a bit of inside edge onto the pad on the sweep. Trickled to square leg and they stole a run
Jofra Archer to Williamson, no run, Archer digs in the bouncer, Williamson ducks under it
Jofra Archer to Williamson, no run, pacy delivery from Archer, outside off yorker. Williamson fails to squeeze it out
Jofra Archer to Williamson, SIX, decides to launch Archer over mid-off. Waited in his crease, picked this fuller length delivery early and muscled it over mid-off

Jofra Archer to Williamson, no run, Williamson is perplexed that it's not been called a wide. Full and homing down leg, Williamson moved across to scoop and missed. Guess, the movement must've put the umpire off-guard there
Jofra Archer to Hales, 1 run, Archer cramps Hales for room with this slanter on off. Chopped to cover
Jofra Archer to Williamson, 1 run, sliding on middle and leg, tucked to deep mid-wicket

Unadkat to Williamson, 1 run, fifty for Williamson. Flawless innings from the SRH skipper. Bided his time initially and just stepping the ante now. Nudges it towards mid-wicket, puts on the skates and comes back for the second fuss-free

Unadkat to Williamson, FOUR, oh, he's taking Unadkat to the cleaners. Streaky this time but Williamson won't mind. Throws his bat on this fuller length delivery outside off and gets a thick outside edge that flies away to the third man fence
Unadkat to Williamson, 2 runs, sensible. Works it into the gap at mid-wicket and gets a brace with ease
Unadkat to Williamson, FOUR, 14 off first three balls. Unadkat overcompensates and hurls it well outside off. Williamson leant across and spanked it with ferocity over extra cover

Unadkat to Williamson, SIX, Fab stuff. Goes downtown. Moved across a bit, with a clean swing of the bat lifted it nonchalantly over mid-off. Such is the timing that it went sailing all the way for a maximum
U Yadav to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that's it. 18-year old Shubman Gill slaps this short ball to the point boundary and swings his bat in celebration. Back-to-back defeats for RCB at the Chinnaswamy
Siraj to Shubman Gill, 1 run, yorker on middle and leg, squeezed away through mid-wicket

Siraj to Karthik, out Caught by Kohli!! Breathtaking catch from Kohli. Phew. It's a mistimed loft from Karthik down the ground and it would have landed short for most fielders at long-on. But Kohli races in and then comes up with some stunning acrobatics. Karthik c Kohli b Siraj 23(10) [4s-2 6s-1]
Siraj to Karthik, no run, tries to get fancy. He's aware that third man is inside the ring, so he tries for a reverse-hit over the fielder. But fails to make contact
Siraj to Karthik, 2 runs, short of length delivery, pulled away hard wide of deep mid-wicket
Siraj to Karthik, SIX, puts the seal on it. Crushing blow from Dinesh Karthik. He's offered a good length ball from Siraj, sets himself up and drills it over mid-off. Just over the ropes
Siraj to Karthik, 2 runs, flings his hands at a wide length ball and slices it over backward point. Came right off the toe-end, but clears the infield. Back for two
Southee to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, full toss outside off, Lynn walks across and hammers it to the right of long-off. Didn't get all of it. But the placement's enough to fetch him the second
Southee to Karthik, 1 run, coolly chips this length ball down towards long-on

Southee to Karthik, FOUR, flurry of runs in the last few balls and suddenly KKR are bossing this. Short of length delivery, Karthik beautifully swivels into the pull and helps it into the gap between deep square and fine leg. His timing's on fire
Southee to Karthik, 2 runs, slower length ball at the stumps, Karthik works it softly through mid-wicket and coasts back for two. He has started well here
Southee to Chris Lynn, 1 run, slices the yorker away to  deep point
Southee to Chris Lynn, FOUR, back-to-back fours. The power of Lynn coming to the fore. Low full toss, not an easy ball to hit but Lynn muscles it straight of long-on
Siraj to Karthik, FOUR, full in the slot for Karthik who smears it away through extra cover. Excellent finish to the over from the captain. Hammered this drive to the fence

Siraj to Karthik, 2 runs, chaos out there. Two run-out opportunities, both missed. Karthik cracked this length ball to backward point and immediately set off, Lynn wasn't even in the picture. Then they decide to take the overthrow and Lynn's struggling again at the non-striker's end. Bails light up before he gets in his crease, but that's because Siraj has knocked them off with his hand. Crazy
Siraj to Chris Lynn, 1 run, on the money. Brilliant yorker outside off, Lynn slices it to deep point
Siraj to Chris Lynn, wide, strays in line again in going for the wide yorker, Lynn collects another wide

Siraj to A Russell, out Caught by de Kock!! This is huuuuuuuuge. Golden duck for Russell on his birthday and the Chinnaswamy finds its voice. Siraj bends his back as he bangs it in, rushes Russell on the pull and balloons off a top-edge. Well taken by de Kock running back. Massive blow. A Russell c de Kock b Siraj 0(1)

Siraj to Nitish Rana, FOUR, Chahal fails to cut it off. He gave it his best, sprinting across and diving from deep backward point but couldn't get a strong enough hand. But how well has Rana timed this yorker. It's very close to the blockhole if not right in it, but Rana slices it superbly through the off-side
Siraj to Chris Lynn, 1 run, nice and full from Siraj, Lynn can't get under it as he brings the hammer down to drill the ball to long-off
Siraj to Chris Lynn, wide, aims for the wide yorker but misses his mark by a long way. Comfortably beyond the wide marker. Lynn lets it go
Murugan Ashwin to Nitish Rana, FOUR, oh poor finish to the spell from Ashwin. Lands the googly outside leg and is punished. Rana grounds his back knee to sweep it over short fine

Murugan Ashwin to Chris Lynn, byes, 1 run, floated up very wide outside off, Lynn walks across and stretches out to fetch the sweep but he's left high and dry by the turn. Wide probably? Maybe not as he walked so far across. Keeper fumbles, allows the bye
Murugan Ashwin to Nitish Rana, 1 run, looks to reverse sweep, mistimes it to short third man

Murugan Ashwin to Nitish Rana, 2 runs, Rana picks the googly and wants to belt it inside out over extra cover. But the prodigious turn does him in. It comes right off the bottom as he slices it up a long way. But the ball still evades a charging Umesh Yadav at sweeper cover. Didn't even get a finger despite the dive
Murugan Ashwin to Chris Lynn, 1 run, down to sweep the googly again, chips it up off a thick top-edge to the left of short fine
Murugan Ashwin to Chris Lynn, no run, no idea about which variation this is, just sweeps blindly. It's the googly from Ashwin which snakes in and slips under the bat. Wasn't far away from off stump
Southee to Nitish Rana, no run, back of a length delivery outside off, no pace on it from Southee, Rana finds backward point with his cut
Southee to Chris Lynn, 1 run, plants it in the blockhole, Lynn tries jamming it down the ground but sends a thick inside edge to deep backward square

Southee to Nitish Rana, 1 run, short ball, Rana swivels across and is through with the pull too early. It was a cutter from Southee which held on the batsman off the pitch. It bobbles off the cue end and drops behind the stumps
Southee to Chris Lynn, 1 run, he'd feel he missed out there. Full in the slot just outside off, clears the front leg for a biff down the ground but gets it off the inside half to long-on
Southee to Nitish Rana, 1 run, short of length ball angled away outside off, Rana cuts to sweeper cover
Southee to Nitish Rana, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, not enough room for Rana to cut. He checks the shot to short cover
Chahal to Nitish Rana, 1 run, short ball, turning in on middle and leg, Rana pulls to deep mid-wicket. Chahal goes wicketless
Chahal to Chris Lynn, 1 run, sweeps it away to long leg, brings up a fifty

Chahal to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, Chahal's down on his haunches. He fired it full at the stumps to get the LBW in play if Lynn misses. But Lynn isn't missing a lot. Gets the sweep to the right of long leg, comes back for two
Chahal to Chris Lynn, no run, the reverse-sweep this time, hits it straight to short third man
Chahal to Chris Lynn, no run, now Chahal smartens up and fires it pretty full outside off. Beats Lynn on the sweep
Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, crashes the sweep away behind square. He's doing nothing else, just sweeping. Gets the length he wants and muscles it
Murugan Ashwin to Chris Lynn, 1 run, tosses the leg-break up well wide of off, Lynn walks across and drags the sweep to deep mid-wicket
Murugan Ashwin to Chris Lynn, no run, now the googly, Lynn tries fetching the sweep from outside off and misses out. Snuck under him

Murugan Ashwin to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, sweeps off a thick top-edge, but clears square leg comfortable. The ball cordially spins towards the long leg fielder running to his right, helping him cut it off
Murugan Ashwin to Nitish Rana, 1 run, flat googly, turns away outside off. Rana leans back and pats it through the covers

Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, out Caught by Southee!! The dangerous Uthappa falls. He's lured into the big shot due to the flight, but gets it right off the toe-end. Had to reach out for the loft, as the line was wide from Ashwin. It's very smartly bowled actually. The ball grips away further to take the bottom of the bat. Southee hangs on at long-on. Uthappa c Southee b Murugan Ashwin 36(21) [4s-3 6s-3]
Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, wide, looped up wide of off, Uthappa lets it go and collects the wide
Murugan Ashwin to Chris Lynn, 1 run, flighted leg-break, pushed down to long-on
U Yadav to Uthappa, SIX, smashes this into the crowd. 143kph, short of length around the waist, Uthappa treats it with disdain. He belts it away from his presence. Gee that flew off the bat
U Yadav to Uthappa, no run, back of a length delivery on off, Uthappa turns it to short mid-wicket
U Yadav to Chris Lynn, 1 run, slower leg-cutter, drops it halfway down the pitch and gives Lynn enough room to slap it to deep point
U Yadav to Chris Lynn, no run, fiery from Yadav. A quick bumper following Lynn down leg, who decides to let it go
U Yadav to Uthappa, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, dabs it to third man
U Yadav to Uthappa, no run, length ball on off, punched straight back to find the bowler in the way
Chahal to Uthappa, 1 run, punched off the back foot to long-on

Chahal to Uthappa, no run, well bowled. There's plenty of turn out there, just that they've not given enough room for the ball to grip. This time Chahal lands it far enough from Uthappa, draws him forward and then rips it past the edge
Chahal to Chris Lynn, 1 run, another sweep from Lynn, connects it well to deep mid-wicket. Relying heavily on this shot against the wrist spinners
Chahal to Uthappa, 1 run, flat and short, turning away outside off, steered away through point
Chahal to Uthappa, SIX, Uthappa's looking ominous. He sizes up this overpitched delivery, gets his front leg out of the way and swings through the line. Clean six into the sightscreen

Chahal to Chris Lynn, 1 run, drifts in and pitches down leg, Lynn sweeps crisply to the right of long leg. Lynn dawdles the single. Could have been two had they pushed for it because there was a slight fumble there
Murugan Ashwin to Chris Lynn, 1 run, too short from Ashwin, pulled away without any timing towards deep mid-wicket

Murugan Ashwin to Chris Lynn, FOUR, third boundary of the over, slower and shorter of off, Lynn bends down low and places it into the vacant gap at deep mid-wicket, split the two men in the deep to perfection
Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, 1 run, tossed up just outside off, dropped wide of cover for a single
Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, FOUR, this is turning out to be an expensive over from Ashwin, dropped this one short and well outside off, Uthappa waits on it and then reverse laps it past the lone slip

Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, FOUR, beautifully played, overpitched and on Uthappa's pads, he leans forward, gets close to the ball and then plays the on-drive, beat the two fielders in the deep to a nicety
Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, no run, the reverse sweep from Uthappa, but he gets it off the bottom of the bat and straight to Kohli at slip
Siraj to Chris Lynn, no run, change of pace from Siraj, the slower ball which was well wide of off, Lynn let it go thinking it was a wide, but it was just inside the tramlines
Siraj to Uthappa, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, Uthappa plays with an open face and guides it to the left of backward point
Siraj to Uthappa, FOUR, that's poor from the fielder at short fine, too straight from Siraj, on Uthappa's pads and he flicked it fine. Beat Ashwin's awkward dive and rolled away to the fence
Siraj to Uthappa, no run, on a good length and in that channel just outside off, Uthappa gets half-a-stride forward as he pushes it towards cover
Siraj to Uthappa, no run, short of a length and angling back into the right-hander, Uthappa shuffles across and pushes it back at the bowler
Siraj to Chris Lynn, 1 run, back of a length and just outside off, hacked away without any timing towards long-on, just a single
Siraj to Chris Lynn, wide, the slower bouncer from Siraj, but it's too short and too high, called as a wide
Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, no run, that's a mighty fine riposte from Ashwin, the leg-break which was dropped short and turned square, was never going to catch Uthappa's edge through

Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, SIX, just over CDG, this was tossed up on off, Uthappa got a big stride forward and lifted it with the turn, high and towards long-on. CDG looked very interested for the catch, went with his outstretched right hand, but only tipped it over the ropes
Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, no run, that turned square, dropped short and well outside off, Uthappa was making room for the cut and had to abort his shot, not called as a wide
Murugan Ashwin to Chris Lynn, 1 run, flighted on off, Lynn gets down low and laps it behind square on the on-side
Murugan Ashwin to Uthappa, 1 run, fraction short and on Uthappa's pads, nudged away behind square on the on-side for a single

Murugan Ashwin to Narine, out Caught by de Grandhomme at long-off!!.. and Murugan Ashwin strikes with his first ball. This was tossed up nicely outside off, right in Narine's hitting zone, he took up the bait and was looking to cream it back over the bowler's head. The bat turned in his hands at the point of impact, he ended up slicing it high and towards long-off. de Grandhomme completes a fine catch. He had to make sure that he didn't step onto the ropes as he completed the catch - which he did. Relief for RCB and Chinnaswamy finds its voice back. Narine c de Grandhomme b Murugan Ashwin 27(19) [4s-3 6s-1]
Siraj to Chris Lynn, no run, on a good length and angling back into the right-hander, Lynn drives and gets a thick inside edge towards mid-wicket
Siraj to Chris Lynn, FOUR, cracking shot, short and wide of off, Lynn makes room, gets on top of the bounce and clatters it to the right of point, no stopping that
Siraj to Chris Lynn, no run, short of a good length and on the stumps, Lynn gets half-forward and defends it back at the bowler
Siraj to Narine, 1 run, fuller length delivery on off, Narine gets his left leg out and drives it to long-on for a single
Siraj to Chris Lynn, 1 run, short of a length and on Lynn's body, pulled away behind square on the on-side
Siraj to Narine, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, Narine doesn't get hold of the drive, just a single to long-off
Siraj to Narine, wide, banged in short and at the stumps, but it's too high and called as a wide

Chahal to Chris Lynn, no run, lovely from Chahal, but he still can't get rid of Lynn. This was beautifully bowled, slower through the air, dipping into the batsman as he backed away and then turned square, beat Lynn by a long way. de Kock was quick to whip the bails off, but Lynn - who overbalanced as he completed the shot somehow held his balance
Chahal to Chris Lynn, no run, Chahal shortens his length on off, Lynn makes room and finds cover-point with the cut
Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, cracking shot, tad too full and too wide from Chahal, Lynn backs away and drills it over cover, one bounce and into the fence
Chahal to Chris Lynn, no run, another leg-break from Chahal and Lynn isn't reading it, went down low on the sweep and missed, gets struck high on the back leg
Chahal to Chris Lynn, no run, flatter and quicker from Chahal, Lynn bent down low and finds short fine with the sweep
Chahal to Chris Lynn, no run, lovely leg-break from Chahal, pitched on middle, drew Lynn forward as he exposed all the three stumps and beat him on the outside edge
U Yadav to Narine, no run, banged in short and at the stumps, Narine hops across and defends it back at the bowler
U Yadav to Chris Lynn, 1 run, slower ball outside off, Lynn cracks it straight to cover-point, the fielder tumbles and misfields, allows a single
U Yadav to Chris Lynn, SIX, smashed, length ball on the stumps, that was right in the slot for Lynn, he cleared his left leg and hammered it back over the bowler's head, flat and over the ropes
U Yadav to Chris Lynn, no run, banged in short and at the stumps, Lynn swivels across and mistimes the pull towards mid-wicket
U Yadav to Chris Lynn, no run, much better from Umesh, yorker length delivery outside off, Lynn brings his bat down and digs it back at the bowler
U Yadav to Chris Lynn, FOUR, low full-toss and that has been drilled through cover, Lynn got his bat down like a sledge hammer and thread the ball through the infield
Chahal to Chris Lynn, 1 run, nicely tossed up on off, pushed to the left of the bowler and Lynn scampers across for a quick single
Chahal to Narine, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Narine swings and gets a big inside edge towards deep mid-wicket

Chahal to Chris Lynn, 1 run, chance and dropped, heads dropped in the RCB camp. It's Murugan Ashwin who has dropped the sitter. Lovely teasing bowling from Chahal, slowed down the pace, this was the leg-break which turned from leg-stump, Lynn was done in by the flight, gets a leading edge towards extra-cover. Ashwin had plenty of time as he ran back from cover, had the ball covered, juggled it twice and shells it

Chahal to Chris Lynn, no run, pleading appeal for LBW, but there was an inside edge on that, flatter and quicker from Chahal, Lynn was down on his knees as he swept, the inside edge saved him, else he was a goner
Chahal to Chris Lynn, no run, pushed through quicker and flatter, Lynn wasn't fully forward as he drove, gets an inside edge onto the pads
Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, lovely shot, tossed up well outside off, Lynn shuffles across, gets well outside off and sweeps it behind square on the on-side for a boundary
Southee to Narine, no run, change of pace from Southee, slower ball outside off, Narine went hard on the drive and got a big inside edge back at the bowler
Southee to Narine, 2 runs, on a good length and well outside off, Narine cleared his left leg and carves it over cover, dropped in no man's land - in between extra cover and long-off
Southee to Narine, no run, good change of pace from Southee, slips in the slower ball and gets it to angle across the left-hander, he swung and missed
Southee to Narine, wide, another bouncer from Southee, but it's way above Narine's head, called as a wide for height
Southee to Narine, no run, banged in short and at Narine's body, he hopped across and manages to keep it down. Was in the air for a while, but well out of reach of Southee - who rushed forward

Southee to Narine, FOUR, just over mid-on, not RCB's night? Short and at the stumps, Narine backed away on the pull, gets it right off the bottom of the bat, but has enough to clear mid-on for a boundary
Southee to Narine, FOUR, top-edge and four, another lucky boundary for Narine, banged in short and on the stumps, Narine swivelled across on the pull, gets a fat top-edge that lobs over short fine

U Yadav to Narine, 1 run, top-edge and safe, is it going to be Narine's night? Banged in short and at the stumps, he was in no position on the pull, got it high off the bat and lobbed towards short mid-wicket. Perhaps was Umesh's catch, but he was late to turn back and can't get across to the ball. I have seen a couple of replays and Umesh seemed to have slipped while turning back. That cost him the momentum and the chance to go for the catch
U Yadav to Narine, no run, low full-toss outside off, Narine backed away sliced it in the air towards backward point, bounced in front of Mandeep
U Yadav to Chris Lynn, 1 run, low full-toss from Umesh, he was looking for the yorker, driven towards mid-off and he calls his partner across for a quick single
U Yadav to Narine, 1 run, banged in short and at the stumps, Narine hops across and keeps it down towards cover, calls his partner across for a quick single
U Yadav to Narine, FOUR, Narine is hurting RCB once again, short of a length and just outside off, Narine rides the bounce and steers it over short third man, no one in the deep and it's a boundary

U Yadav to Narine, SIX, effortless from Narine, back of a length and just outside off, a gentle loosener from Umesh, Narine stands tall and punches it over mid-off, sailed all the way over the ropes for a maximum
Southee to Narine, 1 run, slower short ball from Southee, Narine doesn't get hold of the shot as he pulled, went high and towards long-off, bounced well in front of the fielder in the deep
Southee to Narine, wide, the slower bouncer from Southee, looks like that's RCB's plan against Narine, he ducks and it's called as a wide for height

Southee to Narine, no run, just short and wide of Kohli at slip, banged in short and it kept climbing on Narine, he was hopping across in defence, doesn't get on top of the bounce, the ball lobbed off the shoulder of the bat and looped in the air towards slip. Kohli rushed forward, dived but the ball bounced in front of him
Southee to Chris Lynn, 1 run, low full-toss from Southee, it was the attempted yorker and Lynn bashed it back over Southee's head, a long-off in place and he keeps it to single
Southee to Narine, 1 run, Narine is off and running as well, back of a length and just outside off, dabbed away to the right of backward point for a single
Southee to Chris Lynn, 1 run, Southee keeps it very full and on Lynn's pads, he gets his left leg out of the way and drives it towards mid-on, calls for a quick single and gets it with ease
Southee to Chris Lynn, no run, full and a hint of swing back into the right-hander, Lynn prods forward and drives it back at the bowler

Johnson to Kohli, SIX, six to end. Shuffles across and inside the line, too predictable, slower delivery again, Kohli swings it to the deep backward square leg fence. No-one there and anyway it has the legs to go over the fence. RCB end with 175
Johnson to Kohli, no run, good bowling. Making Kohli reach out wide and wider, slower delivery outside off, beats the lofted square-drive, no bye as well
Johnson to de Grandhomme, byes, 1 run, similar delivery to the last one, but de Grandhomme swings to leg and misses. Kohli wants the strike and beats DK's throw even as it missed

Johnson to de Grandhomme, SIX, missed the yorker and goes for six. Turns out to be a slower delivery, de Grandhomme sits down and slices it over the sweeper, gets enough on it to go all the way. Kohli likes it and roars 'come on'
Johnson to Kohli, 1 run, full and wide outside off, Kohli square-drives to deep backward point, there's a fielder placed for that exact shot
Johnson to Kohli, 2 runs, full on off, drilled straight down the ground, two they come back even as Russell is athletic with the throw back
Shivam Mavi to Kohli, 1 run, well bowled. Low full-toss, Kohli can only find a single to deep cover. Top over under the circumstances
Shivam Mavi to de Grandhomme, 2 wides, slower delivery outside off, de Grandhomme swings and misses. The umpire calls it as a wide, even as DK fumbles the ball on the bounce. They cross over
Shivam Mavi to de Grandhomme, 2 runs, short outside off, de Grandhomme pulls abnd gets it wide of deep mid. Two more
Shivam Mavi to de Grandhomme, 2 runs, low full-toss on off, de Grandhomme sliced that and mistimed it wide of Mitch J at long-off, comes back for two
Shivam Mavi to Kohli, 1 run, full on off, Kohli drills it to long-off, only a single
Shivam Mavi to de Grandhomme, 1 run, does so. Squeezes out a full and almost yorker length delivery to sweeper cover
Shivam Mavi to de Grandhomme, no run, low full-toss outside off, de Grandhomme drives and misses. Should put bat to ball here

A Russell to Kohli, SIX, now he raises the bat to celebrate. Back of the hand slower delivery from Russell, but too full and Kohli gets under this and directs the short-arm jab flat wide of long-on. Brilliant brilliant use of the wrists. That's all one can say

A Russell to Kohli, 2 runs, 50 for Kohli and his missus is up there clapping. As are the crowd. Kohli doesn't care to celebrate. He is busy getting his breath back. Slugged wide of deep mid to get to 50
A Russell to Kohli, 2 runs, right up there, Kohli digs it out and shouts for two, easily done in the end before long-on can get to the ball

A Russell to Mandeep, out Caught by Shivam Mavi!! Can Mandeep clear deep mid? No he can't. Caught right at the edge of the boundary. A slower delivery on off, Mandeep swings and doesn't get the elevation he needs. Bit more power and it would've been six. Mandeep c Shivam Mavi b A Russell 19(14) [6s-2]
A Russell to Kohli, 1 run, short of length outside off, slapped to extra-cover

A Russell to Kohli, SIX, Kohli is pointing his finger at someone. After hitting that for six over long-on. Full and in the slot, Kohli unleashes the short-arm jabbed flick that sends the ball over the crowd. We saw MSD do that against Negi in the last game, but this is trademark Kohli. How does he get under the ball with such a low backlift and generate so much power is incredibly unbelievable

Narine to Mandeep, SIX, fine blow. Two big hits from Mandeep in this over and both have come when it has been tossed up and in the teeing off range. This time Mandeep goes straight back over the bowler's head. Good over for RCB - 15 off it
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, the variation, a length delivery that turns away, Kohli is happy to pull to deep mid and rotate the strike
Narine to Mandeep, 1 run, dragged a bit short, Mandeep punches to long-on
Narine to Mandeep, SIX, brilliant slog-sweep. Over deep mid. Too full and tossed up outside off, Mandeep kneels down and finds the biggie that his side needs
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, short and Kohli has pulled it on the bounce to deep mid-wicket, again he is cursing and abusing, his frustration coming out at not putting the ball into the stands
Narine to Kohli, no run, slower and a tad short outside off, Kohli can't find the gap through a ring of fielders on the off-side
Shivam Mavi to Kohli, 1 run, pitched up outside off, Kohli drives and finds sweeper cover
Shivam Mavi to Kohli, no run, forces himself into the length delivery off the front foot, but can't beat Narine at extra-cover
Shivam Mavi to Kohli, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Kohli needs to miss backward point and the sweeper, does so easily, launches it in the air and well wide of both the men, races away

Shivam Mavi to Kohli, no run, short of length on off, pushed back down the pitch and Kohli is letting it all out. A few expletives - that can't be described for a worldwide family audience here - throw up out of his mouth, as he is absolutely livid for not getting something out of that delivery
Shivam Mavi to Kohli, no run, comes back well. Digs it in short outside off, moves away off the seam a tad, Kohli tries to ramp that wide of DK and doesn't connect

Shivam Mavi to Kohli, FOUR, beautiful touch. Slower ball outside off, Kohli uses the wide gap between backward point and short third to direct the ball there. Shivam Mavi perhaps gave Kohli too much room outside off to play that shot
Narine to Kohli, 1 run, keeps the strike with a nudged single to square leg
Narine to Kohli, no run, wooh! Look at that turn and it has cut Kohli in half. On the back foot. Spun appreciably and hit the leg, but it was sliding down. No appeal as well
Narine to Kohli, no run, this turns away from a short of length, Kohli carefully short-arm jabs to mid-wicket
Narine to Kohli, 2 runs, softly turns this offie to square leg, and runs hard to come back for two

Narine to Kohli, 2 runs, wristed powerfully straight down the ground, look at that piece of fielding from Russell. Runs full pelt with that huge frame of his and then tumbles to cut off the shot, manages to keep his body from not touching the cushions. Gets up and fires a rocket throw back. Kohli thought it was four, but Russell pulled off a magnificent piece of fielding

Narine to Kohli, FOUR, for a moment when he sliced that, looked like he had holed out, but perfectly placed between deep cover and long-off. Picked the one that goes away, sliced the loft and it is a one bounce over the ropes four
Johnson to Kohli, 1 run, slower delivery once more as he saw Kohli charge him, driven along the ground to long-off
Johnson to Mandeep, 1 run, full outside off, Mandeep reaches out and square-drives in the air, well wide of backward point, but just a single to the left of sweeper cover
Johnson to Kohli, 1 run, short and at the body of Kohli who swivels and rolls his wrists on the pull to find deep square leg
Johnson to Mandeep, 1 run, short of length and angling across Mandeep, who attempts to go across the line, a thick leading edge goes well wide of cover
Johnson to Kohli, 1 run, now runs this down to third man and takes a single
Johnson to Kohli, FOUR, no problems with the timing there. Picks the slower delivery outside off and then laces the cover-drive on the rise, sheer timing and leaves sweeper cover as a spectator
Kuldeep Yadav to Mandeep, no run, Mandeep is struggling against the wile and guile of Kuldeep Yadav, googly, leaves him off the pitch and beats his attempted dab
Kuldeep Yadav to Mandeep, no run, another wrong'un, fullish, steered to backward point, no chance of a quick single
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, Kohli goes for a full-blooded slog-sweep, but drags it to deep mid. He is struggling a bit tonight for timing
Kuldeep Yadav to Mandeep, 1 run, nicely tossed up now, Mandeep gets forward and drives to long-off
Kuldeep Yadav to Mandeep, no run, lovely googly, Mandeep was setting up for a big pull, but it turned the other way and left him helpless
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, leg byes, 1 run, turns in and beats Kohli on the back foot flick, runs off the pad for an extra
A Russell to Kohli, 1 run, length delivery outside off, glided down to third man

A Russell to Kohli, FOUR, my word. What a shot. Half-volley outside off, Kohli has dispatched that royally through the covers. No-one moved. But seems to have done some damage to his right-leg after over-stretching on the drive. A limp or two but looks like he will shrug it off

A Russell to Mandeep, 1 run, unbelievable shot from Mandeep under the circumstances. Dropped by Rana running back from short third. Was a short ball outside off, Mandeep left the bat llike a periscope and it looped off the toe, Rana was unsure which way to catch and what hand to use, eventually he circled around it and it went down
A Russell to Kohli, 1 run, slower delivery outside off, Kohli punches off the back foot to long-on
A Russell to Mandeep, 1 run, high full-toss, Mandeep nudges it away through mid-wicket
A Russell to Mandeep, no run, short of length and a hint of nip back in, Mandeep dabs in front of Karthik, wants a quick single, Kohli isn't interested
A Russell to Mandeep, wide, very wide and called rightly so as the ball passes the tramline outside off
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, no run, good length delivery on middle, pushed to short mid

Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, 2 runs, Kohli was aiming for a massive pull as the ball turned into him, short and very short too, but since he was aiming for power rather than placement, can only drag it off a thick inside edge to the right of fine leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, no run, slower and down leg, too early into the flick is Kohli, a thick leading edge rolls to the right of short cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Mandeep, 1 run, the googly, on a good length, Mandeep watchfully turns it behind square
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, too full, wristed to long-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, no run, watches the ball turn, turns it to short mid

A Russell to Vohra, out Bowled!! Bowled him. Russell strikes again. Does a little jig to celebrate his second wicket on his birthday. Tailed in late and took the inside edge before cannoning off the back boot onto the stumps. Vohra was giving the charge and was late on the shot, the incoming delivery sneaked through. A bit unlucky but that's how it can go in this format. Vohra b A Russell 0(1)
A Russell to Vohra, wide, dug in short, too high and it loops over Vohra who sits under that. Given as wide

A Russell to Brendon McCullum, out Caught by Karthik!! Quick short ball and he gets Brendon McCullum. McCullum actually was intending to send the ball to Banshankari, was through with the pull too early and it took the toe of the bat and looped to DK. No need for the umpire to make any decision on that. Off walks McCullum. Brendon McCullum c Karthik b A Russell 38(28) [4s-4 6s-2]
A Russell to Kohli, 1 run, slower delivery outside off, Kohli runs it down to third man
A Russell to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, full on the stumps, lofted on the bounce to Narine at long-off
A Russell to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Kohli pushes wide of backward point and takes the single
A Russell to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, Brendon McCullum charges Russell and has to reach out before squeezing the full ball through cover-point
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, no run, the orthodox chinaman now, wristed to short mid
Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, too full, full-toss it turns out to be, Brendon McCullum gets forward and strokes it to long-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, no run, a wrong'un, fuller, spins away and beats the sweep of Brendon McCullum
Kuldeep Yadav to Kohli, 1 run, tossed up on middle and leg, Kohli is early into the flick, a thick leading edge and it loops to long-off
Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, leg byes, 1 run, turns in and raps Brendon McCullum on the pad, who missed his forward block. Was it turning too much? May have been the case. KKR don't review

Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Gone first ball after the break. Slower and turns away from the advancing de Kock, who still goes through with the inside out hit, can only lift it up in the air for sweeper to run around to his left and take. A fist pump from Kuldeep Yadav to celebrate the wicket. de Kock c Shubman Gill b Kuldeep Yadav 29(27) [4s-3 6s-1]

Chawla to Brendon McCullum, SIX, muscled. Dragged down by Chawla and Brendon McCullum decides to go over long-on. Pure power from the Kiwi. Biffed that off the back foot and watched the ball go over long-on. 14 to him off Chawla in that over and he gets a move on
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, no run, similar shot, but finds backward point
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, short third didn't even move. Nor did backward point. Short and wide outside off, cut right into the gap between the two

Chawla to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, horrible umpiring. Really poor. How is that runs? Brendon McCullum is beaten all ends up by one that squares him up, pitched on middle, turned past the bat and hit the back leg, raced away past DK. Chawla went for a slight appeal and then kept quiet. Llong the ump who has given it as runs. Not even close to the bat. KKR should've reviewed that, but since it was given as runs, they didn't go for it
Chawla to de Kock, 1 run, uses his feet and hoicks, off the thick inside half, down to deep mid
Chawla to de Kock, no run, de Kock has reverse-swept that somewhere onto his helmet grille or the body. Pitched outside leg, pre-meditated by de Kock and he didn't get the ball away

Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, SIX, when it is tossed up, Brendon McCullum will look to play over mid-wicket. That's his signature shot. Sit down and then slog-sweep the spinner. Connects beautifully and loops over deep mid
Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, 1 run, comes down the track and has to adjust his cut as it is bowled short of what he expected, de Kock finds the gap at cover-point for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, awkward bounce for the man at deep backward square but it is just a single. A top edge on the sweep and Gill got away with it
Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, 1 run, shortish again, mistimed cut to sweeper cover
Kuldeep Yadav to de Kock, 2 runs, de Kock waits for the ball to turn away and then slashes it wide of backward point. Two more
Kuldeep Yadav to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, dragged down, very short, Brendon McCullum can only find deep mid with a not-so powerful pull
Shivam Mavi to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, low full-toss as Shivam Mavi went for the yorker, sweetly timed to the left of Russell at mid-off, he dives and gets something on the ball, only a single
Shivam Mavi to Brendon McCullum, no run, short and wide outside off, Brendon McCullum was miles away on the swipe, beaten and under his head as well
Shivam Mavi to de Kock, 1 run, low full-toss outside off, timed sweetly off the bat, sweeper moves to his right and fields well to keep it to a single
Shivam Mavi to de Kock, no run, yorker length outside off, de Kock reaches out to squeeze it out, gets a toe of the bat and it stays near the stumps. No chance of a quick single
Shivam Mavi to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, Brendon McCullum charges Shivam Mavi and while doing so, backs away to open up the off-side, carved to sweeper
Shivam Mavi to de Kock, leg byes, 1 run, pitches outside leg, rushes through off the pitch, de Kock heaves and misses. Off the pad and they take an extra
Narine to de Kock, 1 run, down leg, fuller, de Kock sweeps and misses. They steal a leg-bye. But the ump reckons there was an inside edge on that one, given as a run. Looped just over DK
Narine to de Kock, no run, DK fumbles. Not sure whether there was an edge on that. Replays show that it went over the top edge. Extra bounce from Narine, turns away past the cut
Narine to de Kock, FOUR, bit more air, and de Kock sweeps hard, beats mid-wicket on the dive to his left and deep square has no chance. Too full and de Kock found the middle of the bat
Narine to de Kock, no run, dragged down on a length, flat-batted back to the bowler

Narine to Brendon McCullum, leg byes, 1 run, beaten by the one that turns away, past Brendon McCullum's heave and it hits him on the body, impact outside the line and de Kock calls his partner through for a quick extra
Narine to de Kock, 1 run, de Kock had to put his skates on, as Rana dove to his left at point and stopped it. A weak throw helps de Kock to get there, also Narine fumbled the throw
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, no run, now reverse-sweeps but straight to the fielder at short third. Good end to the over

Chawla to Brendon McCullum, no run, well bowled. A ripping leggie which holds up on the pitch, actually Brendon McCullum expected the ball to turn a bit more, that's why the ball hit the outside half of the bat, rolls in front of Chawla
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, no run, that's some quicker ball. Just fires it in, Brendon McCullum defends in front of point and has to go back after de Kock didn't want the quick single
Chawla to de Kock, 1 run, poor from Kuldeep at backward point. Doesn't account for the spin away on the cut and fumbles, gives away the single
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, pushed through on middle, softly turned to the vacant short mid area
Chawla to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, a shimmy but stays in the crease and slog-sweeps, to the right of deep mid, in the gap and well placed to get a one bounce over the ropes four

Johnson to de Kock, SIX, Johnson has a wry smile at de Kock. Won't help though. Pace on the ball and off the bat as well. Full on middle, de Kock makes room and goes over cover, hit well and just about clears the ropes
Johnson to de Kock, no run, full on off, wristed powerfully, but hit too well and mid-on fields
Johnson to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, length delivery on middle, Brendon McCullum stays leg-side of the ball and pushes through the gap at cover
Johnson to Brendon McCullum, wide, again charges Johnson, but the Aussie slips the slower delivery down leg, called wide

Johnson to Brendon McCullum, FOUR, that's Brendon McCullum at his best. Brings the crowd to life. A shimmy down the wicket and then throws his fast hands on the short of length delivery, scythed over extra-cover. Brutal hit

Johnson to de Kock, 1 run, de Kock makes room and tries to go huge, but Johnson follows the batsman with a length delivery, inside edge onto the pad on the heave, allows a single to the short mid area
Johnson to Brendon McCullum, 1 run, slower delivery on the pads, turned through square leg, Brendon McCullum slipped as he looked to turn for the second, only a single
Narine to de Kock, no run, punched off the back foot to the right of cover, yes-no between de Kock and Brendon McCullum, but all is well eventually
Narine to de Kock, no run, goes for a hat-trick of fours and is lucky that the toe-end didn't carry back to Narine. Too early into the shot and Narine fields
Lungi Ngidi to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, yorker to finish the game and it's been flicked to deep mid-wicket. CSK back on top of the table after the loss against MI
Lungi Ngidi to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, wide yorker and Tewatia squeezes it out to cover

Lungi Ngidi to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, he's inside-edged this into the on-side and a massive roar from the crowd supporting CSK. Two legitimate balls will get them home now. Full delivery on the stumps, Shankar tried to go inside-out over cover on that occasion

Lungi Ngidi to Vijay Shankar, 2 runs, chipped in the air, not enough power but he races back for two. Short of a length delivery following the batsman as he backed away, Shankar wanted to hit the ball over the cover boundary, but mistimed it
Lungi Ngidi to Vijay Shankar, wide, pressure getting to the bowler? Sprayed down the leg-side, big test for Lungi Ngidi

Lungi Ngidi to Vijay Shankar, SIX, now then, now then! He isn't done yet! Raises the fifty and DD can mathematically still do this. 20 needed from 4 balls. Backs away to this shortish ball and pulls over mid-wicket
Lungi Ngidi to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, short of length delivery from Lungi Ngidi, Tewatia slaps it to mid-off
Lungi Ngidi to Rahul Tewatia, wide, oh that's well outside off stump, left alone, called a wide

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, SIX, and another one, clean hits, but the intent should have been there earlier for DD to have a real chance. Slower ball again, Shankar muscles this loft over long-on. This knock will do a world of good to Vijay Shankar's confidence. Meanwhile, MS was shaking his head
Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, no run, full toss and misses, Shankar tries to slog but gets hit on the pad

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, SIX, short ball and smashed. Back-to-back sixes. Why didn't you do this when Pant was going great guns? Would have been of great help. Anyway, this is a pull shot sweetly timed over mid-wicket. Now Rayudu is livid, he wants Dwayne Bravo to nail the yorker

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, SIX, mighty swing of the bat, timing very good, but all too late? Slower delivery on the stumps, Shankar gets down on  one knee and lofts it over long-on. Looks like Rayudu isn't happy with Dwayne Bravo for bowling a ball in the slot, earlier he was hinting to the bowling to bowl a bouncer
Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, wide, low full toss, down the leg-side, Dhoni tumbles and collects
Dwayne Bravo to Rahul Tewatia, 1 run, flat-batted in the air towards long-on, Faf runs forward but can't get there
Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, slapped straight down the ground for a single
Lungi Ngidi to Rahul Tewatia, no run, shortish and rising, Tewatia backs away and swings, makes no contact

Lungi Ngidi to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, oh that's up in the air and Dhoni can't get there, looks like he tweaked his back there as he tried to backpedal. Pacy short ball, Shankar goes for the pull, gets a top edge that clears the keeper

Lungi Ngidi to Pant, out Caught by Jadeja!! Maiden IPL wicket for Lungi Ngidi and he's been mighty impressive. Ends an excellent innings from Pant. Shortish slower delivery outside off stump, Pant slices it high in the air, Jadeja runs forward from sweeper cover and swallows it. Pant c Jadeja b Lungi Ngidi 79(45) [4s-7 6s-4]
Lungi Ngidi to Pant, no run, swing and a miss. Short of length delivery angled across, Pant lost his shape as he swung hard at it

Lungi Ngidi to Pant, FOUR, you are kidding me! What sort of a shot is this? He was almost beaten by the change of pace by this shortish slower ball, slapped it pretty straight towards long-on despite having to fetch this from outside off stump. Dhoni has been having long-on very wide fro Pant and he had no chance. In fact, Dhoni and Bravo were not happy with Faf. Looks like he was standing very wide without instructions and maybe he was just wandering
Lungi Ngidi to Vijay Shankar, leg byes, 1 run, darted in on a good length at 140.7kph, Shankar misses the flick and wears this on the thigh pad, a tickle fine could have been four
Dwayne Bravo to Pant, FOUR, low full toss and he's mishit this, yet it runs away for four. Long-on was very square and he had no chance of cutting this off

Dwayne Bravo to Pant, 2 runs, this is almost the Lagaan shot now. Pant was standing with a fully open stance facing the bowler before the ball arrived, spotted the slower delivery and scooper it over the keeper
Dwayne Bravo to Pant, no run, yorker from Dwayne Bravo, Pant squeezes it out into the off-side

Dwayne Bravo to Pant, FOUR, the line is wrong and Pant is single-handedly threatening CSK here. Slower delivery down the leg-side, can't bowl there with fine leg inside the ring and Pant helps it away on his way over the man at 45
Dwayne Bravo to Pant, no run, oh hit on the glove, pacy short ball, Pant falls over on the pull, lucky that he didn't get hurt
Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, sliced away over backward point, Shankar couldn't connect properly as Bravo took pace off the ball
KM Asif to Pant, SIX, fast hands from Pant come into play again. You cannot bowl length ball at this stage and KM Asif does that exactly, Pant picks it up over square leg for a maximum
KM Asif to Pant, FOUR, Pant goes slightly to the off-side and sweeps it fine of the stumps, ball goes fine of the short fine leg fielder for a four
KM Asif to Pant, 2 runs, drives it powerfully to long-off for a brace

KM Asif to Pant, FOUR, sloppy effort from Rayudu at long-off. Pant doesn't get it anywhere near the middle of the bat but he puts power in the shot as he generally does and ball goes for a four. Pant brings up his fifty with that four
KM Asif to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, short of length ball, Vijay Shankar's front leg was in the air as he plays that pull shot to deep mid-wicket for a single
KM Asif to Pant, 1 run, full toss at the stumps, Pant loses his balance as he carves that ball wide of long-on for a single. He is hitting the ball hard but timing is a serious issue for him
Dwayne Bravo to Pant, 1 run, uses his wrist to flick this ball to fine leg for a single
Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, back of a length delivery at the stumps, Vijay Shankar goes on the back foot and drives it to long-on for a single, ball hits him high on the bat
Dwayne Bravo to Pant, 1 run, slower ball at the stumps, Pant nudges to the leg-side for a single
Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, drives it to long-on for a single

Dwayne Bravo to Vijay Shankar, SIX, Vijay Shankar just puts enough power in the shot to send it over the ropes. It was in the fuller length zone, perfect length to hit. Vijay Shankar goes back in his crease and tonks it over long-on for a six
Dwayne Bravo to Pant, 1 run, starts in a typical Dwayne Bravo fashion with a slower ball, it was on the stumps, Pant waited for it and flicks it to long-on for a single
Harbhajan to Pant, 1 run, straight delivery at the stumps, Pant flicks it to the leg-side for a single

Harbhajan to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, gets it off the outside edge and ball scoops up in the air, luckily for Vijay Shankar ball falls just short of the short third man fielder. Karn Sharma rushed forward, but couldn't get there

Harbhajan to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, poor delivery down the leg-side, Vijay Shankar puts bat to it and guides it wide of the short fine leg fielder for a four. DD needs more of these shots from Vijay Shankar
Harbhajan to Pant, 1 run, steers it to point for a single

Harbhajan to Pant, SIX, Pant finally connects one and when he connects it, ball stays hit. A great hit though. Flat-batted slog over the fence. He goes on the knees and strikes it cleanly, ball sails over long-on for a maximum
Harbhajan to Pant, no run, quicker outside off, Pant hits it to cover
Jadeja to Pant, 1 run, drives it cover for a single
