Jadeja to Pant, no run, Pant loses his balance again trying to slog, someone needs to tell him about the timing aspect in the cricket while batting, fails to make contact and ball hits him on the pads, ball pitched outside leg though
Jadeja to Vijay Shankar, leg byes, 1 run, off the pads and goes behind for a single
Jadeja to Vijay Shankar, 2 runs, excellent running from the pair. Vijay Shankar drives it wide of long-on and complete a brace

Jadeja to Pant, 1 run, he loses his shape again, he is hitting the ball too hard here, hits it straight to long-on for a single, hit with power and Faf tumbled after collecting the ball because of the momentum
Jadeja to Pant, wide, quicker delivery outside off, Pant lets it go and umpire signals it wide
Jadeja to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, Vijay Shankar needs to show some more intent here. He guides it gently to the short third man for a single
Harbhajan to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, drives it to long-on and retains the strike
Harbhajan to Pant, 1 run, short ball outside off, Pant cuts it straight to the fielder at point but manages to take a single
Harbhajan to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, no timing on that shot from Vijay Shankar as he pulls it deep mid-wicket for a single
Harbhajan to Vijay Shankar, no run, quicker delivery at the stumps, Vijay Shankar hits it straight to the fielder
Harbhajan to Pant, 1 run, loses his balance and shape as he attempts that lofted shot, manages to hit it to long-off for a single
Harbhajan to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, nudges it to deep mid-wicket for a single
Jadeja to Pant, SIX, Gee! Quick hands from Pant, he picks up the length early, reaches the pitch of the ball and deposits in the stands at deep mid-wicket
Jadeja to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, steers it to short third man for a single
Jadeja to Pant, 1 run, Pant got an inside edge on it otherwise he was plumb in front, ball deflects to the leg-side for a single
Jadeja to Pant, FOUR, Pant falls as he attempts that pull on the short of length ball but he gets enough bat and finds the gap through deep mid-wicket for a boundary
Jadeja to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, fuller length delivery, Vijay Shankar drives it to long-off for a single
Jadeja to Pant, 1 run, Pant advances on that quicker delivery from Jadeja, he flicks it to deep mid-wicket for a single
Harbhajan to Pant, 1 run, arrowing in from round the wicket, tip-and-run single from Pant in front of cover
Harbhajan to Pant, wide, Harbhajan's misses his line. Lasers it down the leg-side, has to rebowl
Harbhajan to Pant, no run, flat and wide of off, Pant cuts and finds Raina at backward point
Harbhajan to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, shaved through square leg
Harbhajan to Vijay Shankar, no run, a full face of the bat push from Shankar from the crease down the ground
Harbhajan to Vijay Shankar, no run, this armer from Bhajji nearly went through the defences of Shankar. Stayed pretty low and Shankar somehow gets his bat down in time to negotiate the threat
Harbhajan to Pant, 1 run, flight from Bhajji, luring Pant into a leaning drive to long-off
Jadeja to Vijay Shankar, no run, 96.2kph, flatter around off. Shankar pokes it into the off-side

Jadeja to Maxwell, out Bowled!! Lock, stock and two smoking barrels. You-miss-I-Hit stuff from Jadeja. Maxwell's form seems to be like that mythical creature which just cannot be found. Rifled fast, coming in with the arm. Maxwell lined up for a heave across the line, fails to counter for the drift. The ball snakes in and clatters the stumps. DD in strife now. Maxwell b Jadeja 6(5) [4s-1]

Jadeja to Maxwell, FOUR, Jadeja errs in line and length, Maxwell makes him pay the penalty. Short, quick and outside off, Maxwell waited and flayed it through cover. Threads the gap and it races away to the fence
Jadeja to Pant, 1 run, Jadeja sprays another darter on middle and leg, whisked wide of long-on
Jadeja to Maxwell, 1 run, round-armish, drifts in. Maxwell clips it round his pad through square leg
Jadeja to Maxwell, no run, 97.5kph, fired on off. A straight batted push back to the bowler
Harbhajan to Maxwell, 1 run, Maxwell milks a single to long-off and gets off the mark
Harbhajan to Pant, 1 run, slashed from the crease to point
Harbhajan to Pant, 2 runs, darted outside off, Pant goes for the cut and gets an under-edge that nutmegs through MSD legs and runs away, two nabbed
Harbhajan to Pant, no run, quicker outside off, punched to extra cover
Harbhajan to Pant, no run, sliding on leg, dropped into the leg-side. A bit of yes-no again but no harm done in the end
Harbhajan to Pant, no run, slowish teaser outside off, Pant leant into the drive, the ball drifts in and takes the inside edge that rolls back onto his body

Jadeja to Shreyas Iyer, out Shreyas Iyer Run Out!! Kamikaze running and Iyer perishes. Tragedy for DD. Iyer was looking good but a miscommunication leads to his dismissal. Push-driven towards extra cover, there was never a single there. Iyer kept running, Pant took a couple of strides down the pitch before he stopped. The DD skipper was just a handshaking distance away from his partner and no way Iyer was returning. A clean pick and throw from Watto to MS, easy-peasy. Shreyas Iyer run out (Watson/Dhoni) 13(14) [4s-1]
Jadeja to Pant, 1 run, 100kph, a little shimmy from Pant to get to the pitch and knocks it down to long-on. The exchange of singles continue
Jadeja to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, round-armish darter outside off, driven along the ground to sweeper cover
Jadeja to Pant, 1 run, quick, wicket-to-wicket line. Flicked wide of long-on. No chance for the second
Jadeja to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, accurate on middle and leg, wristed away to long-on
Jadeja to Pant, 1 run, darting on leg, turned through square leg
Watson to Pant, 1 run, Pant abandons violence. Decides to press forward and bunts it to extra cover
Watson to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, guided straight to short third man, they'll nab a quick single
Watson to Shreyas Iyer, no run, beaten by the slower ball. The trademark cutter from Watson, grips and cuts away defeating Iyer on the tentative poke
Watson to Pant, 1 run, Pant hops across and pats it to point
Watson to Pant, FOUR, Watson is not learning. Shifts his line outside off, Pant knew the third man was inside the ring. Scythed it to his right and it zoomed away into the fence. Smartly done
Watson to Pant, SIX, woah. Pant wasting no time. Gets into the business straightaway. Full on the stumps, Pant gets under it and whiplashes it over cow corner. Into the stands

KM Asif to Munro, out Caught by Karn Sharma!! Munro combusts. Asif raises his hands aloft in joy. The bowler wins the battle and has the last laugh. Second wicket for Asif, nips out both openers. Looked like it was a certain trap, plotted by MSD and Asif. Much like the last ball, ushered it short and this was closer to the body. Munro swung across, only height as it went a long way into the night sky. There was a fielder waiting at deep mid-wicket and he set himself under it to gobble it up. Safe hands from Karn Sharma. Munro c Karn Sharma b KM Asif 26(16) [4s-3 6s-2]

KM Asif to Munro, SIX, Asif getting some pasting from Munro here. 14 runs off the last three balls. The intent was fine but the execution went haywire. Banged it short, no purpose on it and allowed Munro to free his arms. Arched his back slightly and ramped it over the cordon. More off the edge but it went flat and hit the ad cushions on the full. They checked with the third umpire and it was confirmed on the replays

KM Asif to Munro, FOUR, now the overcorrection from Asif, feeds a tasty half-volley. Munro stayed leg-side of the ball, puts his bottom hand to good effect once again to blast it straight down the ground
KM Asif to Munro, FOUR, sledge-hammered over point by the Kiwi marauder. Picked Asif's slower ball early, waited and stayed deep to slash it over point
KM Asif to Munro, no run, gets it to tail back into the left-hander, Munro moves inside the line and defends it to the left of the bowler
KM Asif to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, Asif spears in and spills it down leg. Worked neatly off the pads to fine leg

Watson to Munro, FOUR, expertly done by Munro. Watson was getting monotonously predictable with his lines. Full and outside off, Munro walked across his sticks and adjusted it beautifully to lift it over mid-on
Watson to Munro, no run, the cross-seamer, skidded off the pitch and slides under Munro's attempted cut

Watson to Munro, SIX, in the slot and out of the park. Watson getting a taste of his own medicine. Wafted it full just outside off, Munro with a solid base on leg-stump, gets under it and with strong wrists, whacks it into the deep mid stands. Into the crowd
Watson to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, 126kph, veering on leg. Tickled softly to fine leg
Watson to Shreyas Iyer, 2 runs, slower short ball from Watson, Iyer fetches it from outside off. Dragged it over mid-wicket and gets a brace
Watson to Munro, 1 run, slanted across outside off, Munro rides the bounce and steers it to point
Lungi Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, no run, better. Follows Iyer who was moving to the leg-side. Tucks him for space and Iyer can only block it after getting into a iffy position

Lungi Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, Ngidi sought to fox Iyer once again but Iyer outfoxes him. Slipped it wider of off on seeing the batsman back away. Iyer throws his bat, reaches out and slaps it with ferocity, beating the packed off-side field

Lungi Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, no run, this was gripped off the surface and dupes Iyer. The cutter from Ngidi, spits in and bites off, cramping Iyer for room. Tried to guide it to third man and was beaten by the extra bounce, also deceived by the change of pace
Lungi Ngidi to Munro, 1 run, flashed hard, a thick outside edge and flew to Bhajji at third man. Collected on the bounce
Lungi Ngidi to Munro, no run, a bit of yes-no but Munro is back safely. Went hard does Munro, but no timing and he chops it towards cover. Was looking for a single, his skipper wisely sends him back
Lungi Ngidi to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, darting down leg, tucked off the hips behind square on the leg-side
KM Asif to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, attacks the off-pole, Iyer gets his weight down and taps it to point for a quick single
KM Asif to Shreyas Iyer, no run, goes full to Iyer, met with a pristine drive to mid-on

KM Asif to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by Jadeja!! Adrenaline rush and Shaw falls. One shot too many for the youngster. Told you, Asif can hoodwink the batsmen with his skiddy short balls, here's the evidence. A short of length that kicks onto Shaw, he looked for a cross-batted smash across the line. Is hurried by the pace and ends up slicing it towards mid-on. Jaddu, the best fielder in the CSK set-up leaps across, times his jump to perfection and pouches the dolly at mid-off. Prithvi Shaw c Jadeja b KM Asif 9(5) [4s-2]

KM Asif to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, bosh. In the swinging arc for Shaw and he butchers it straight down the ground. Arrests his high backlift, again employs his bottom hand and bashes it straight down the ground. Watch out ump! Nearly knocked him out there
KM Asif to Prithvi Shaw, no run, slips in the bumper, good venom on this and Shaw lets it pass

KM Asif to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Shaw goes aerial and clears mid-off. Didn't time it as he would've liked but just enough to clear the fielder. On a back of a length on off, Shaw used his bottom hand to good effect to chip it over the ring. Couple of bounces and home
KM Asif to Prithvi Shaw, wide, a bit of lousy start for Asif. Can't control the swing, went for the inswinger. Splays it down the leg-side

Lungi Ngidi to Munro, no run, another dot. It's been only swing and misses for Munro this over. Another outswinger angled across the lefty, Munro rooted to the crease swipes and fails to connect. Excellent start for Ngidi
Lungi Ngidi to Munro, no run, short of length and rearing a touch, Munro jabs it down the pitch
Lungi Ngidi to Munro, no run, shortish with a hint of away movement, Munro pulls and misses once again
Lungi Ngidi to Munro, no run, big swoosh from Munro. Lopes out in a hurry aiming to biff Ngidi over mid-on. Zero connection and slices only thin Pune air
Lungi Ngidi to Munro, no run, similar line and the length to the left-hander, Munro waits on the back foot and inside the line to defend it into the off-side

Lungi Ngidi to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, decent beginning for Ngidi. Hits it on a back of a length and gets it to rise around off. Shaw gets on top of the bounce, opens the bat face and guides it away to third man. DD and Shaw are away!

Boult to Dhoni, 2 runs, very full and outside off, Dhoni gets under it and smacks it hard to the left of long-off. They race back for the second and it's Dhoni's third fifty of IPL 2018! What a gala time he is having! CSK finish on a massive 211/4

Boult to Dhoni, out Rayudu Run Out!! That's the end of Rayudu, wanted to get on strike as Dhoni had missed the pull but the CSK captain remained unmoved. Pant was quick to throw it towards Boult who fired a direct hit at the other end. Rayudu was way short and was never going to make it. Another valuable contribution from him nevertheless. Rayudu run out (Pant/Boult) 41(24) [4s-5 6s-1]

Boult to Dhoni, FOUR, blasted away! Doesn't matter where you bowl to him when he is in this mood. Banged in short by Boult and Dhoni was down the track in a flash, flat-batted it powerfully past the Kiwi who did well to get out of the way. Rockets past mid-off who was in the ring. Incredible, simply incredible

Boult to Dhoni, SIX, no he cannot! Because he is bowling to someone who is in insane hitting form this season. Misses the yorker and it's a low full toss, Dhoni just uses his quick hands and it's a short arm jab. Comfortably over deep square leg. No effort at all there
Boult to Rayudu, 1 run, good ball, wide low full toss and Rayudu can only slap it down to long-off. Good start to the over for Boult. Can he keep it going?

Boult to Rayudu, no run, marginal decision but the umpire doesn't wide it. Rayudu walked across the stumps for the sweep but missed it. It went down the leg-side but the bowler got the benefit of doubt there

Avesh Khan to Dhoni, SIX, that's deep into the crowd! After a series of good deliveries, Avesh loses his composure. Tries the yorker to be fair to him but it ends up as a juicy full toss. Clubbed away way over deep square leg. 108 meters it is! Second longest one of the tournament
Avesh Khan to Dhoni, no run, that's a misjudgement from Dhoni, probably thought this is too wide than he initially was and hence, offered no stroke
Avesh Khan to Rayudu, 1 run, excellent stuff this from young Avesh Khan, holding his nerve against two intimidating hitters. Another fairly accurate wide yorker, sliced to deep backward point
Avesh Khan to Dhoni, 1 run, once again Avesh gets his length right, this was wide and very full. Dhoni tried to get under it with that strong bottom hand but could only blast it straight to long-off
Avesh Khan to Rayudu, 1 run, good pacy delivery, not exactly a yorker but a dipping low full toss that Rayudu struggles to get under. Heaves it to deep mid-wicket. Nicely bowled
Avesh Khan to Rayudu, wide, tries the wide yorker but it's beyond the tramline, Rayudu is happy to leave it

Avesh Khan to Dhoni, 1 run, dropped! That's a dolly and Munro has spilled it. Short ball and Dhoni pulled it aerially to deep mid-wicket. Didn't connect that well but got lucky in the end. Munro probably didn't pace himself well there but no excuses really. How much will this cost DD?

Plunkett to Rayudu, FOUR, bleeding runs. They have no clue how to bowl to these two at the moment. Plunkett pulls his length back but the width is there outside off, Rayudu just slashes hard at it and gets a slice that beats short third man comfortably to his left. Not exactly where he intended but he won't mind

Plunkett to Rayudu, SIX, that's glorious from Rayudu! Talk about being in ripe form, this is another example of it. Premeditates the charge down the pitch and lofts it straight over the bowler's head. Dead straight and comfortably over the ropes

Plunkett to Dhoni, 1 run, missed out there, Dhoni. Short of a length and he rode the bounce well to control the pull. Straight to Mishra at short fine leg who has a shy at the bowler's end but misses. Dhoni was in anyway
Plunkett to Rayudu, 1 run, how did that go there? Slower ball and Rayudu wanted to launch it over long-on, instead slices it off the bottom of the blade to long-off

Plunkett to Rayudu, FOUR, gets it away very fine. Smart batting from Rayudu but this is equally poor from Plunkett who is having a horror night. Too straight in line on this short ball, Rayudu swivels across to get inside the line and pulls it away. Fine leg was too square
Plunkett to Dhoni, 1 run, slower back of a length ball, dabbed gently towards short third man for a single
Boult to Rayudu, no run, tries to be too cheeky, the reverse paddle but misses out on the full ball. Just inside the tramline perhaps. 21 off the over!

Boult to Rayudu, FOUR, Rayudu joins in the fun now and Boult is getting a severe beating here. Misses the yorker anmd gives a low full toss, Rayudu is already across the stumps and wrists it away powerfully wide of the long-on fielder. Nicely done

Boult to Dhoni, 1 run, premeditated shuffle across the stumps but Boult takes pace off it and spears it around middle, nudged towards short fine leg. The backward square leg fielder dives to his right to stop it

Boult to Dhoni, FOUR, he is playing around with the field here. Dhoni is on a roll. He is expecting the short ball and swivels to pull this wide of the man at short fine leg. Dhoni is motoring along here. DD need to somehow stop him

Boult to Dhoni, SIX, kaboooooom! Another one! Dhoni is on the rampage now. Fuller in length around off, he just stands deep in the crease and belts this over long-on. Comfortably clears the fielder over there. The skipper is infusing momentum back into the innings

Boult to Dhoni, SIX, that's gone all the way! How flat he is sending this into the stands?? Wow! Fractionally short and slower in pace, Dhoni just swivels and absolutely cracks this pull over deep mid-wicket. He is looking ominous straightaway
Mishra to Dhoni, 1 run, flatter low full toss on the pads, wristed away between deep mid-wicket and long-on. The former is quick to get to the ball and prevents the second

Mishra to Dhoni, SIX, thumped away! Floated googly and fuller outside off, Dhoni was on the charge and although this was wider in line, he trusted his strong bottom hand to launch. And launch he did, flat over long-off
Mishra to Rayudu, 1 run, another mishit that lands short. A touch short and Rayudu wanted to maul the pull over deep mid-wicket. Ends up mistiming it towards Boult at long-on
Mishra to Dhoni, 1 run, low full toss around middle and leg, wristed away down to long-on for a single

Southee to Cutting, SIX, RCB win by 14 runs! All Southee had to do was bowl a legitimate delivery. He does that. Overpitched delivery, Cutting gets underneath the ball by crouching and lofts it handsomely over long-off
Southee to Cutting, no run, right in the blockhole, Cutting can't do much. Looks to flick and inside-edges it onto his pad. Dies down adjacent to the pitch
Southee to Cutting, no run, another dot - as Cutting declined the run. Shortish ball, pulled to deep mid-wicket
Southee to Cutting, no run, tries to punch and inside-edges to short fine leg. They don't run
Southee to Cutting, FOUR, short ball, Cutting stands tall and heaves it over mid-wicket. A boundary

Southee to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Kohli!! A wicket. That's gold at this stage. A distraught Hardik walks off. It was the slower delivery and Hardik decided to clear long-on. Doesn't time it as he got it off the toe-end. Kohli runs in from long-on, puts in the dive to snaffle it. That's a screamer from the skipper. Hardik Pandya c Kohli b Southee 50(42) [4s-5 6s-1]

Siraj to Cutting, 2 runs, Colin de Grandhomme has been excellent in the field today. Saves another two for his side. Full toss outside off, hacked away through mid-wicket and the Kiwi made a tumbling stop in the deep
Siraj to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, another one - yorker length, Hardik can't get underneath that ball. Drilled to long-off. The single brings up his fifty as well
Siraj to Hardik Pandya, no run, this is top-notch bowling from Siraj. Wide yorker and Hardik misses it. Stays leg-side of the ball and looks to thump it downtown. Connects with thin air

Siraj to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Mandeep!! That's a strange dismissal. Krunal tries to scoop and he's caught at backward point. You read that right. Cross-seamed fullish ball on the stumps, Pandya went towards off and crouched low to go over short fine. The leading edge balloons to Mandeep at backward point. Krunal Pandya c Mandeep b Siraj 23(19) [4s-1 6s-1]

Siraj to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, Hardik loses his bat as he goes too hard. In the blockhole and he can only toe-end it to long-on. The bat slips out of his hand and falls somewhere near the square leg region

Siraj to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, Siraj gets away with a full toss. Krunal looks to hack across the line and misses. They nab a run and that's been given as runs. Oh, wait.. RCB review. Massive inside edge Erasmus was right. RCB lose their review

Southee to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, excellent over. Just 5 off it! Good field placement as well. After bowling two yorkers, Southee shortens his length, carved over extra cover, Baz runs across to his left from deep extra to mop that up
Southee to Krunal Pandya, no run, another yorker! Krunal can't do much. Dug out, back at the bowler
Southee to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, just four off the first four balls. In the blockhole, squeezed drive to long-on
Southee to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, hat-trick of slower deliveries, once again Krunal is early into his shot and loses his shape as well trying to pummel it. Just a single down to long-on
Southee to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, CdG has saved three runs there. Slower delivery, thumped down the ground. The Kiwi runs to his right from long-off and throws himself to his right. Top effort!
Southee to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, crouches low for a wild swing. Was the slower delivery and ended up getting into the shot way to early. Just a single... to long-off

Siraj to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, doesn't quite get it off the middle, but Hardik has got enough wood there. Fullish ball outside off, enough room to free the arms. Goes hard and lofts over extra cover. A boundary to end the over - 10 off it
Siraj to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, full toss and Krunal fails to put it away. Tried the flick and inside-edged it onto his pad. A single to cover point
Siraj to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, yorker length, Hardik goes hard on his drive. Can only get it off the toe-end. Siraj dives to his right and can only get a hand on it. Parried to long-on
Siraj to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, slower ball, Krunal moves off-side and nudges it to short fine leg
Siraj to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, full and on the stumps, driven off the inside half to long-on
Siraj to Hardik Pandya, wide, on a length and errs in line. Just outside the tramline wide of off
Siraj to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, hurried by the shortish pacy ball, mistimed flat-batted hit to long-off

de Grandhomme to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, 17 off the over! There's the big over for Mumbai. Poor ball from de Grandhomme. The batsman backed away and the bowler followed him, by dishing one on the pads. Easy pickings for Hardik, who tickles it very fine
de Grandhomme to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, closes the bat-face to turn it towards mid-wicket. Hustle back for the second

de Grandhomme to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, edged and four! Mumbai won't mind. Length ball, Hardik gets a healthy inside edge looking to punch through the off-side. The keeper is up and there is no one to stop that
de Grandhomme to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, slower ball, driven towards extra cover for a single
de Grandhomme to Krunal Pandya, no run, shortish ball just outside off, Krunal tries the late-dab, misses. He is miffed with himself

de Grandhomme to Krunal Pandya, SIX, that's a massive hit. Should calm the nerves in the Mumbai dug-out. The cutter, picked by Krunal, stays deep in his crease to swing it high and over deep mid-wicket

U Yadav to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, that's a weird way to tackle shortish balls. Hit-the-deck-hard ball on the ribs, following a backing away Krunal. The batter somehow managed to tuck it to deep mid-wicket

U Yadav to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, length ball wide of off, Krunal stays deep and swings his bat hard. The bat turns at the point of impact and all the lefty could do was slice it over covers off the toe end. Vohra, in the deep, over-runs, but no damage done. Just two

U Yadav to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, decks in from a length and Hardik is cramped for room. Cross-batted to extra cover and Chahal has a shy at the keeper's end. Kohli is not happy with that throw. Not costly
U Yadav to Hardik Pandya, no run, slashes and misses. Back of a length that bounces more than Hardik expects it to. Tried the cut, failed to make contact
U Yadav to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, back of a length delivery, Krunal moves slightly towards off and offers a straight bat to bunt it down to long-on
U Yadav to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, full on leg, flicked away to deep backward square leg. Tailed in a tad, did that ball from Umesh
de Grandhomme to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, stands tall to force the length ball to sweeper cover. de Grandhomme is doing a good job here. Keeping things tight
de Grandhomme to Krunal Pandya, byes, 1 run, a heave attempted and he has completely missed that. Gripped off the surface and de Kock fails to gather it cleanly. Nab a bye
de Grandhomme to Krunal Pandya, no run, driven sweetly, but can't find the gap. Extra cover is quick to stop that
de Grandhomme to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, bit of width outside off, guided behind square on the off-side
de Grandhomme to Hardik Pandya, no run, inside edge saves Hardik. Looked to punch and got an inside edge onto his pad. The length ball came in with the angle

de Grandhomme to Hardik Pandya, 5 wides, there's the pressure-releaser. Horrible ball from Colin de Grandhomme. Probably, the cutter, errs in line, the keeper has no chance and the ball runs away to the fine leg fence. Bonus runs
de Grandhomme to Hardik Pandya, no run, short ball and Hardik is surprised by the pace. He is late on his pull and cops a blow on the back shoulder. A slight delay. He is fine to resume
Chahal to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, horror ball to finish his spell. Short and down the leg-side, Krunal waits for it and swivel-pulls it over the leg-slip fielder. 4-0-23-0!

Chahal to Hardik Pandya, leg byes, 1 run, an appeal for lbw and there's a long chat between the bowler and the keeper. Sanity prevails - no review. Hardik missed the sweep against this away-turner. That's definitely missing off. Plenty of turn on this wicket
Chahal to Hardik Pandya, no run, that's a peach! Quicker leg-break that pitched around leg and turned past the outside edge of Hardik, who was looking to block
Chahal to Hardik Pandya, wide, tossed up wide of off, spins wide of the tramline and Hardik shoulders arms. Called as a wide
Chahal to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, turning in from a length, Krunal Pandya allows the ball to turn and helps it along its way to backward square leg
Chahal to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, shorter ball, cut away to in front of square on the off-side
Chahal to Hardik Pandya, no run, darted, kept out

de Grandhomme to Duminy, out Duminy Run Out!! 1 run completed. That was a rocket throw from Umesh Yadav. And, Duminy was probably lethargic. Doesn't put the dive and pays the price for it. Was a short of length delivery just outside off and that was forced through point off the back foot. Umesh runs across from sweeper cover, fires a bullet and QDK makes no mistake. Umesh has one of the best arms. Duminy run out (U Yadav/de Kock) 23(29) [4s-3]
de Grandhomme to Duminy, no run, pitched up delivery, pushed back to the bowler
de Grandhomme to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, shortened length and on the stumps, pulled away. Goes to deep mid-wicket, who takes it on the bounce
de Grandhomme to Hardik Pandya, no run, there's the width and the length was short as well, Pandya misses out. Cuts and finds the man at backward point
de Grandhomme to Duminy, 1 run, loopy full ball just outside off, off-driven all along the carpet to long-off
de Grandhomme to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, starts with a short of a length delivery on the stumps, chipped over non-existent mid-on. A single to long-on
Chahal to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, moves leg-side even before the ball is delivered does Pandya, was quicker and on the shorter side. Stabbed to sweeper cover. Just 3 off it
Chahal to Hardik Pandya, no run, that spun a mile! 82.9kph, that pitches on middle and turns a long way, Pandya was looking to push it through the off-side. Beaten by a long way
Chahal to Duminy, 1 run, too full, Duminy fetches it from outside off and sweeps through square leg. A premeditated shot
Chahal to Duminy, no run, comes down the track, isn't to the pitch, uses his wrists to play with spin, finds a diving mid-wicket fielder
Chahal to Duminy, no run, quick leggie just outside off, defended off the front foot
Chahal to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, wristed through mid-wicket. CdG mops up
Washington Sundar to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, quicker and flatter, that is Sundar's stock delivery and Pandya nudges it into the on-side

Washington Sundar to Hardik Pandya, SIX, big over this. Always a gamble to bowl off-spin to Pandya. Flighted outside off, Pandya kneels down and powers the slog sweep over deep mid-wicket. Already 14 off the over
Washington Sundar to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, very full and outside off, Pandya drives it through cover and the fielder in the deep is very square. Long chase for CdG and he gets there to save two

Washington Sundar to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, Pandya will take his chances against the spinners. Not the sweetest of connection but he clears mid-wicket comfortably. Pitched up and Pandya swings with the spin and collects the boundary for the over
Washington Sundar to Duminy, 1 run, bit of turn and Duminy plays it late, dabs it in front of backward point and sets off. Good call from Pandya as he was the one running to the danger end

Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, FOUR, Karthik hits the winning runs. Slower ball wide of off, Karthik throws his bat at it and slices it wide of backward point, who put in the dive. Runs away to the fence and that's it. KKR win by 6 wickets!

Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, FOUR, Karthik is just toying with the bowler. Well, Bravo hasn't been on target as well. Full toss on the pads, Karthik walks forward and flicks it over the square leg umpire's head
Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, wide, full and down the leg-side. Karthik misses his flick. Wided. KKR are a hit away
Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, 2 runs, length ball wide of off, Karthik opens his bat-face and forces it to deep point

Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, FOUR, bowls a low full toss on the pads from round the wicket. A hit-me delivery. Flicked away very fine. Watson doesn't bother to put a dive. Why would you do that, when you already know the result
Lungi Ngidi to Karthik, 1 run, very full on the pads at 135.3kph, flicked to long leg
Lungi Ngidi to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 117.5kph, off-cutter on off and middle, tapped in front of cover for a sharp single
Lungi Ngidi to Shubman Gill, wide, short, down the leg-side and Gill will just ignore that
Lungi Ngidi to Karthik, 1 run, another off-pace delivery, 109.1kph, steered to third man
Lungi Ngidi to Shubman Gill, 1 run, slower ball at 118.2, short as well. Gill picks it and dabs it behind square on the off-side
Lungi Ngidi to Karthik, 1 run, shortish ball on off, Karthik hops and drops it towards point with soft hands
Lungi Ngidi to Karthik, FOUR, all too easy. Ngidi doles out a short ball down leg and Karthik just helps it on its way. Pulled away to fine leg for another boundary
Jadeja to Karthik, 1 run, fired on leg, nudged into the leg-side for a single

Jadeja to Karthik, FOUR, now DK tries the reverse sweep and manages to get some bat on it. Off the inside part, misses the batsman's pad and beats the short third man fielder too. The asking rate is below 6
Jadeja to Karthik, 2 runs, fired on middle and leg, swept fine. The fine leg fielder dives to his right and saves a couple
Jadeja to Shubman Gill, 1 run, quick ball from a shortened length, Gill is squared up by the turn. Takes the outside edge and dies down on the off-side. A single nabbed

Jadeja to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that's delicious. More air on this ball from Jadeja, Gill reaches out with a stride and gets to the pitch of the ball. Follows it up with a superb drive through extra cover

Jadeja to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, maiden IPL fifty for Shubman Gill! His team-mates give him a standing ovation. He's played a beautiful innings. Gets to the milestone by driving a fullish ball wide of long-off

KM Asif to Karthik, SIX, 21 off the over and the asking rate has come down to 7.4. KKR are surely the favourites now. The inexperienced Asif bangs one short, but slightly errs in line. Leg-stumpish and Karthik takes heavy toll of it. Walks across and helps it along its way with a hook over fine leg
KM Asif to Shubman Gill, 1 run, now the sensible thing. Sees the ball on a good length and opens the bat-face to run it down to third man

KM Asif to Shubman Gill, SIX, excellent effort from Rayudu, gets a hand on it, but can only parry it over the cushions. Short ball on off, quick hands from Gill who upper-cuts it behind square. Rayudu sprints across to his right from third man and flew with his right hand out to pluck, in vain
KM Asif to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, now goes back in his crease and width has been served outside off. Cut hard to the right of third man
KM Asif to Shubman Gill, no run, cut hard, but straight to backward point

KM Asif to Shubman Gill, SIX, that's a stunning shot! That's gone a long way back. His highest score in IPL. Picked the length (short) early, got into a good position on the back foot and muscled the pull over deep square leg. Right off the meat of the bat. Picked it up beautifully
Karn Sharma to Shubman Gill, 1 run, shorter in length, whipped to deep square leg. Eleven off the over
Karn Sharma to Karthik, 1 run, flat and quick, another sweep from DK, finds the man at long leg

Karn Sharma to Karthik, FOUR, moves leg-side evn before the ball is delivered does Karthik and that would have distracted the bowler. Karn Sharma fires one well down the leg-side and that's easy pickings for the skipper. Stays low and sweeps wide of the man at 45
Karn Sharma to Karthik, 2 runs, good cricket. Leg-break on leg, Karthik knocks it towards mid-wicket with soft hands and hustles back for the second
Karn Sharma to Shubman Gill, 1 run, Gill backs away and Sharma follows him. Gets a tickle on his glance and the ball rolls towards backward square leg. Just a single

Karn Sharma to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, in-drifting full ball on middle and leg, driven off the inside part of the bat to mid-wicket. Between long-on and deep mid-wicket, so they come back for the second
Dwayne Bravo to Shubman Gill, 1 run, decks in from a short of length, Gill stays leg-side and taps it towards backward point for a single. Harbhajan, the fielder, doesn't throw the ball

Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, leg byes, 1 run, back of a length delivery on middle, Karthik walks across and looks to tuck it away. Gets an inside edge onto his thigh and the ball rolls to the keeper's left

Dwayne Bravo to Karthik, wide, quick bouncer just down the leg-side, Karthik misses the pull the keeper-bowler went up straightaway for an appeal. Probably to distract the umpire. Doesn't work. Called as a wide
Dwayne Bravo to Shubman Gill, 1 run, full again, uppish drive from Gill. A single to long-off
Dwayne Bravo to Shubman Gill, FOUR, top shot! Bravo overpitches with mid-off inside the circle. Gill stays leg-side of the ball and thumps it over wide mid-off. One bounce and into the fence
Dwayne Bravo to Shubman Gill, no run, skiddy length ball on middle, bunted to mid-wicket

Dwayne Bravo to Shubman Gill, no run, just out of Dwayne Bravo's reach. Fuller ball on off and Gill is early into his drive. Got it off the toe-end and the ball went to the bowler's left. He might have got his finger tip to it

Harbhajan to Karthik, FOUR, good shot to get off the mark. Hint of width on this short of length and that's enough for Karthik. He is quick to trek back and employ the cut shot behind square. Finds the gap and fetches his first boundary
Harbhajan to Karthik, no run, off-spin on off, Karthik is half-forward to block

Harbhajan to Rinku Singh, out Bowled!! Gone! Harbhajan Singh likes it. The quick delivery does the trick. Fired full and on the stumps. Rinku moves leg-side and swings his bat hard; misses completely. He attempted the big heave. Crashes into middle and leg. Rinku Singh b Harbhajan 16(18) [4s-2]
Harbhajan to Shubman Gill, 1 run, fired on off-stump, squeezed to sweeper cover
Harbhajan to Shubman Gill, no run, pushed quicker and Gill stands tall to push it back towards Harbhajan
Harbhajan to Shubman Gill, no run, 94.5kph, turns in from a short of length, Gill walks down and misses the punch (through the on-side), gets hit on the front leg. Half an appeal
Jadeja to Rinku Singh, no run, quick in-turner and Rinku is back and across to punch. He doesn't have enough room to free his arms and ends up patting it towards cover. Just 6 off it
Jadeja to Shubman Gill, 1 run, too full, push-driven to deep extra cover
Jadeja to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, closes the bat-face to work this 97kph flat ball to deep mid-wicket. Good running between the wickets
Jadeja to Rinku Singh, 1 run, leg-stump line, shorter in length as well, worked off his hips to deep square leg
Jadeja to Rinku Singh, wide, spills one down the leg-side and that's been wided
Jadeja to Rinku Singh, no run, turns in from a short of length and Rinku is cramped for room. Blocks
Jadeja to Shubman Gill, 1 run, off-driven all along the ground to long-off
Harbhajan to Shubman Gill, 1 run, slower and shorter, nudged to square leg

Harbhajan to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that's an incredible shot. Was a full ball and Gill doesn't get down to sweep. Can't call it as sweep. A half-sweep, half-whip. Powerfully hit through square leg. Raced away
Harbhajan to Shubman Gill, no run, comes down the track, isn't to the pitch and can only push it towards extra cover, who makes a tumbling stop
Harbhajan to Shubman Gill, no run, lbw appeal, turned down. Gill presses forward and is beaten by the in-spin. Gets struck on the front leg. Spinning down
Harbhajan to Rinku Singh, 1 run, shorter and flatter, turned into the on-side

Harbhajan to Rinku Singh, FOUR, nicely done! Risky, but executed it so well. With a slip in place, Rinku employs the late-dab. Played very late and got it wide of the slip fielder. No third man to stop that
Jadeja to Shubman Gill, no run, fired full on the stumps, blocked back
Jadeja to Rinku Singh, 1 run, mistimed push towards sweeper cover
Jadeja to Rinku Singh, no run, looks to cut this not-so-short ball and misses
Jadeja to Rinku Singh, 5 wides, horror ball, well down the leg-side and Dhoni is blinded by the batsman who was shuffling across. The keeper has no chance and that's five bonus runs

Jadeja to Rinku Singh, no run, the bails are down and Dhoni goes up for an appeal. A stumping appeal. The third umpire is called. Looked to guide the length ball behind square leg did Rinku Singh and got a bottom edge that hit the ground and deflected onto the stumps off the keeper's pad. The back leg was in and grounded. NOT OUT
Jadeja to Shubman Gill, 1 run, fired in from round the wicket, Gill brings his bat down and taps it to cover
Jadeja to Rinku Singh, 1 run, shortish and wide outside off, cut square of the wicket
Harbhajan to Rinku Singh, 1 run, too straight and that's been worked around the corner
Harbhajan to Rinku Singh, no run, slower through the air and Rinku isn't to the pitch, despite coming forward. Poked into the off-side

Harbhajan to Rinku Singh, no run, dropped? No. Short of a length ball just outside off, not enough width to play the cut. Gets an under-edge that hits the ground and goes to the keeper, where MS doesn't gather it cleanly
Harbhajan to Rinku Singh, no run, turning away outside off, Rinku shoulders arms
Harbhajan to Rinku Singh, no run, slower and shorter, Rinku plays the late-cut, can't beat a diving backward point fielder
Harbhajan to Rinku Singh, FOUR, what a way to greet a new bowler. Looped up delivery, but in the process overpitched, Rinku presses forward and chipped it inside-out over extra cover. Top shot
Jadeja to Rinku Singh, 1 run, 99.6kph, short of length, scythed to deep point. A wicket and 11 runs off that over
Jadeja to Rinku Singh, 2 runs, width outside off, cut away behind square on the off-side

Jadeja to Narine, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Dropped him twice, conceded a six and finally Jadeja removes Narine. Much-needed breakthrough. The West Indian perishes trying to deposit another one into the stands. The length was on the shorter side and Narine was a touch early to swing his bat. He wanted to go over deep mid-wicket, ended up lofting it to long-on. Bravo won't drop those. Yet another important knock from Narine. He's done his job. Narine c Dwayne Bravo b Jadeja 32(20) [4s-4 6s-2]
Jadeja to Narine, 2 runs, tucked to deep mid-wicket for a couple, good running
Jadeja to Narine, SIX, Narine won't hang around blocking. Definitely not against a left-arm spinner. Was bulleted on off, Narine stood tall and smoked it over cow corner. Swung hard
Jadeja to Narine, no run, darted at 92.7kph just outside off, guided to short third man

Watson to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that was in the air, but in the gap too. Ends the powerplay with a boundary, does Gill. Was short and wide outside off and Gill placed his square cut right into the gap between point and cover-point. End of a fruitful powerplay for KKR
Watson to Shubman Gill, no run, fullish around off, Gill has played this off his front foot to cover

Watson to Shubman Gill, FOUR, that's called improvisation. Picks the length early again, goes back in his crease and guides this towards the third man fence. Opened the face of the bat real late and got a cheeky boundary
Watson to Shubman Gill, no run, pitched up around the off-stump channel, Gill reaches for it with an off-drive to the man at mid-off

Watson to Shubman Gill, FOUR, how well has Gill played that? This was a short delivery and dipping into him. Gill adjusts well and pulls it nicely, beats deep square leg by some distance and gets off the mark
Watson to Shubman Gill, no run, short of a length around off, Gill moves inside the line and blocks it off his back foot. Solid in defence
KM Asif to Narine, no run, too close to cut that, Narine gets cramped for room with this short and pacy delivery aimed at him
KM Asif to Narine, no run, on the pads and Narine has flicked it straight to the man at short fine leg
KM Asif to Narine, no run, slower delivery, Narine gets deceived by the pace on that and fails to connect

KM Asif to Narine, FOUR, Harbhajan Singh misfields! This is contagious. First Jadeja, now Bhajji. MS Dhoni would be livid with this. Was a full length delivery outside off, Narine went for a drive and got an outside edge towards third man where a misfield helped him with a boundary. Narine will be thanking CSK fielders for their generosity tonight

KM Asif to Uthappa, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! The skiddy pace of Asif gets Uthappa. Was a short and quick delivery around off, Uthappa went ahead with his pull and got a top edge to mid-on. DJ Bravo won't miss those as he settles underneath and reverse cups it. Two of KKR's finest batsmen are back to the hut. Uthappa c Dwayne Bravo b KM Asif 6(8) [4s-1]
KM Asif to Uthappa, no run, 'wait on' is the shout from Uthappa as he drives the full length ball to the man at cover
KM Asif to Uthappa, wide, length delivery angled down the leg side, Uthappa shuffles in his crease, moves inside the line and tries to flick that away but it's well down the leg side

Watson to Narine, FOUR, another edge, another boundary! Was a full length delivery angled away from the batsman, Narine went hard at it, swung at it and got a thick outside edge that flew over gully this time. Hit out or get out, this is the only one way Narine knows
Watson to Uthappa, 1 run, waits for the slower delivery before he decides to run it down to third man

Watson to Uthappa, no run, struggling with his timing in this over against Watson, is Uthappa. This was a shortish delivery around off as the batsman mistimed his pull to short mid-wicket. Was a bit late in his shot on this occasion
Watson to Uthappa, no run, stays put and stylishly knocks the length ball to cover, does Uthappa
Watson to Uthappa, no run, on a length on middle and leg, nudged to the right side of the bowler by Uthappa
Watson to Narine, 1 run, backs away and slaps the length delivery to the diving fielder at mid-off
Watson to Narine, wide, full length delivery angled away well outside off, Narine leaves it alone and the umpire does the rest, exercises his arms

Lungi Ngidi to Uthappa, FOUR, how quick is this outfield! Or is the timing by Uthappa? Fullish on the pads and Uthappa nicely flicks it through mid-wicket. Beats short mid-wicket and deep mid-wicket with his perfect timing on this flick
Lungi Ngidi to Narine, 1 run, drags the length delivery to deep mid-wicket and takes a single
Lungi Ngidi to Narine, no run, a low full toss outside off, Narine is way down to leg side as he gets beaten on his drive

Lungi Ngidi to Narine, FOUR, pulled away! He'll continue playing the same way, doesn't matter. Short length around around off, Narine clears his front leg again and pulls it over mid-wicket, beats the man in the deep with ease

Lungi Ngidi to Narine, FOUR, edged away! Full length delivery around middle and leg, Narine takes on the bowler, swings hard and gets an outside edge that flies over the slip cordon to find the fence. Every boundary Narine hits from here on will hurt Jadeja
Lungi Ngidi to Uthappa, 1 run, length delivery outside off, Uthappa plays it late and steers it down to third man

KM Asif to Narine, no run, second dropped catch! This is unbelievable really. Is this Narine's night? Went hard at a shortish delivery and miscued it to Jadeja at mid-off. He jumped in order to take it but failed yet again. But you know Narine, he'll give you more chances

KM Asif to Narine, no run, dropped! Can you believe it? CSK's best fielder has put one down. Narine slapped the shortish delivery to mid-off where Jadeja spills it out. He tried to take it on the second attempt too, but failed even then
KM Asif to Narine, SIX, that's the first one by Narine tonight. Was a shortish delivery around off and Narine cleared his front leg to club it nonchalantly over long-on
KM Asif to Narine, no run, swing and a miss! That's the third consecutive dot of the over. Was a back of a length delivery angled away from the batsman and Narine swung at it, missed by a huge margin
KM Asif to Narine, no run, short and quick again around off, Narine goes for it and mistimes it towards mid-off. On a bounce to the man there
KM Asif to Narine, no run, quick and short delivery aimed at the helmet, Narine does well to take evasive action

Lungi Ngidi to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Watson!! Was a short of a length delivery on middle and leg, Lynn went for a pull and got an inside edge before the ball clipped his pads and carried to Watson in the slip. The on field umpire couldn't pick that up in the background noise but UltraEdge comes to Ngidi's rescue. Lynn is back to the hut and all of a sudden there are CSK, CSK chants at the ground. Chris Lynn c Watson b Lungi Ngidi 12(6) [6s-2]
Lungi Ngidi to Chris Lynn, no run, short of a length and nipping into the batsman, Lynn moves away and taps it to the right of the pitch

Lungi Ngidi to Chris Lynn, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Lynn. This was a full length delivery on middle, Lynn stayed rooted and timed his loft right over the bowler. Straight as an arrow and over the boundary ropes

Lungi Ngidi to Chris Lynn, SIX, into the stands and the crowd are on their feet. Picks the length early on this short one and swivels quickly to pull that over square leg. Was on to his pull in a flash on that occasion
Lungi Ngidi to Chris Lynn, no run, fast and a length delivery outside off, Lynn looks to go big with a wild swing but the bat is nowhere close to making contact
Lungi Ngidi to Chris Lynn, no run, starts off with a quick bouncer on off, Lynn gets surprised on the pull and gets struck on his glove

Chawla to Dhoni, FOUR, Dhoni finishes off in style, with a boundary. Picks the length early on the short one, rocks back and pulls it right into the gap at deep mid-wicket. No fielder there as CSK end on a competetive score

Chawla to Jadeja, out Caught by Karthik!! Top-edge and DK takes it. Was short and quick around off, Jadeja tried to pull it but all he could manage is a top edge. DK sprinted back, called for it and took it. Jadeja c Karthik b Chawla 13(12) [4s-1]

Chawla to Jadeja, byes, FOUR, CSK will take that! Doesn't matter how they come. Was a quicker delivery around off, Jadeja tried to slog it away but couldn't connect and Karthik failed to grab it too. That raced away to the fence in no time, so quick that was
Chawla to Jadeja, FOUR, 50-run stand up with that blow. Was the googly around off, Jadeja walked down the wicket and slammed it right past the bowler and the umpire who had to take evasive action
Chawla to Jadeja, 2 runs, darted outside off, Jadeja reaches for it with an expansive drive and gets a couple of runs. Good running between the wickets there but they were probably short by one.
Chawla to Dhoni, 1 run, darted on off, Dhoni puts in a lot of effort but can only get a single at deep mid-wicket with this swipe

Narine to Dhoni, 1 run, 4-0-20-2 are Narine's figures. Could probably be the match defining spell. Was a shortish delivery around off and Dhoni steered it away to short third man. Still no boundary for Dhoni against Narine in the history of IPL.
Narine to Jadeja, 1 run, quicker delivery well outside off, Jadeja reaches for it with a slap to sweeper cover
Narine to Jadeja, 1 runs, quicker delivery on middle and leg, Jadeja drags it down to wide long-on and calls for two. Dhoni obliges, gets it with ease
Narine to Jadeja, no run, another dot ball. This was quick and full outside off, Jadeja went for an expansive drive but couldn't find the gap at cover
Narine to Jadeja, no run, shortish outside off, Jadeja chops it to point and that's a dot ball
Narine to Dhoni, 1 run, full and quick on middle and leg, Dhoni gets down on his knee and sweeps it hard to deep square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, 1 run, sweeps the tossed up delivery to the same fielder in the deep and takes a single to end the over. Was the wrong 'un perhaps

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, SIX, dropped! How costly will that dropped catch prove to be? Was a shortish delivery around off, Dhoni pulled it hard to deep square leg where Gill lets it through his palms. Tried to reverse cup it and made a mess of it
Kuldeep Yadav to Jadeja, 1 run, short and wide outside off, slapped past the diving fielder at cover. Sweeper cover keeps them down to single
Kuldeep Yadav to Jadeja, wide, spinning away from the batsman but well outside off, Jadeja doesn't fiddle with it. Easy call for the umpire there
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, 1 run, another tossed up delivery outside off, going away from the batsman and Dhoni calmly punches it to the left of sweeper
Kuldeep Yadav to Jadeja, 1 run, the slider outside off, Jadeja rocks back and mistimes his punch to cover, came off the inside half of his willow
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, 1 run, tossed up delivery going away from the batsman, Dhoni reaches for it with a slap to long-off

Johnson to Dhoni, 1 run, 15 runs of the over! Not a night for Johnson to remember. 51 runs off his 4 overs! This was a length delivery on middle and leg as Dhoni worked it away to wide long-on and settled for a run

Johnson to Dhoni, SIX, that's high. That's handsome. On a length on middle and leg, Dhoni stays put and towers this over long-on for six more. Rinku Singh at the fence was just a mere spectator. The crowd is loving this, when MS is in such form everybody does!
Johnson to Dhoni, no run, good change in pace there. Full length delivery on middle and leg, Dhoni pushes this back to the bowler
Johnson to Dhoni, 2 runs, back of a length outside off, Dhoni punches it towards sweeper cover and calls for two. Jadeja obliges and the batsmen manage to take two more

Johnson to Dhoni, SIX, that's a flat six again. Short of a length on leg, Dhoni swivels quickly and pulls it to perfection over the square leg boundary. That went to the fence at the speed of light, none of the fielders had any time to even react
Johnson to Dhoni, no run, on a length outside off, Dhoni stands tall and punches it firmly to the man at cover

Shivam Mavi to Dhoni, 1 run, retains strike with a gentle nudge to long-on. Was a back of a length delivery around off as Dhoni knocked it down, gives the youngster some respect after a meaty blow on the previous delivery

Shivam Mavi to Dhoni, SIX, too many short deliveries and MS puts one into the stands. Was getting too predictable there. Shortish in length around off, Dhoni picks it up early and deposits a flat six over the mid-wicket fence. Sweet sound on that blow

Shivam Mavi to Dhoni, no run, this is impressive bowling by the youngster. Isn't giving the length to the batsman to get underneath. This was short and quick around off, Dhoni looks to work this away to the leg side, gets beaten though
Shivam Mavi to Jadeja, 1 run, banged short outside off, Jadeja hops a bit in order to chop this down to third man
Shivam Mavi to Jadeja, wide, shortish in length but a tad too wide outside off, marginally outside that guide line, beats Jadeja's tentative poke

Shivam Mavi to Dhoni, 1 run, good fielding in the deep by Rinku Singh, saves a run for his team. This was a length delivery that was tucked to deep square leg by Dhoni and Rinku sprinted to his right and kept the batsmen down to a single with his brisk work and quick release of the ball
Shivam Mavi to Dhoni, no run, skiddy short of a length delivery around off, MS shuffles in the crease, reaches the line of the delivery and nudges it in front of short mid-wicket
Narine to Dhoni, 1 run, bowls the off-spinner this time, gives it a bit of flight too. Dhoni takes a huge forward stride and flicks it away to square leg and retains strike
Narine to Jadeja, 1 run, flatter delivery on the pads, tucked to the leg side by Jadeja for a run

Narine to Rayudu, out Bowled!! Narine is bowling a fine spell today. Gets the dangerous batsman, the highest run getter of CSK with this peach of a delivery. It's the offie that does the trick. Rayudu waited for it and tried to run it down but the ball spins in sharply, flicks his pads and takes down the sticks. Second scalp of the match for Sunil Narine and the crowd at Eden erupts in joy. Rayudu b Narine 21(17) [4s-3]
Narine to Dhoni, 1 run, short one outside off, Dhoni has plenty of time to camp back and knock that away to sweeper cover
Narine to Dhoni, no run, the quicker delivery on middle and leg, Dhoni is too late in bringing his bat down and gets struck on the pads due to the pace

Narine to Rayudu, 1 run, in the air.. but safe! Wasn't timed, nor middled by Rayudu. Was a shortish delivery around off as the batsman dragged it towards wide long-on. Rinku Singh came charging in but couldn't reach well in time
Chawla to Dhoni, no run, shortish in length outside off and Dhoni has chopped it to the man at point
Chawla to Rayudu, 1 run, a bit of flight on that one as Rayudu chips it down to long-on for an easy single
Chawla to Rayudu, no run, quicker googly on middle, Rayudu looks to play the on-drive and ends up getting an inside edge towards short fine leg
Chawla to Rayudu, no run, quick one on middle and leg, Rayudu knocks it back to the bowler, wasn't middled

Chawla to Rayudu, FOUR, poor line by Chawla. Can't bowl such freebies to a batsman in such fine form. Down the leg side and Rayudu sweeps it away to the fine leg fence. Fielder is nowhere close to cut this down
Chawla to Rayudu, 2 runs, floated on leg, Rayudu flicks it away to deep square leg into the gap and manages to get two runs, Narine was a bit squarer on that occasion, hence couldn't stop the second
Johnson to Rayudu, 1 run, fuller length delivery outside off, Rayudu chases and thrashes it away to sweeper cover
Johnson to Rayudu, no run, moving on a length around off, Rayudu waits deep and opens his bat face to glide it straight to point
Johnson to Dhoni, 1 run, Johnson greets him with a head-high short ball. Seemed like he was into the pull shot early. It was a cross-seamer as well, yes, drags it away to deep mid-wicket
Johnson to Rayudu, 1 run, a straight-batted punch down the ground

Johnson to Rayudu, FOUR, edged and profitable result for Rayudu. Johnson wears a wry smile on his face. Slanted across outside off, lured Rayudu into playing a false shot. Gets the outside edge and unfortunately for Johnson, it flew past a diving DK to his right
Johnson to Rayudu, no run, on a length closer to off, Rayudu stays in his crease and pats it defensively into the off-side
Kuldeep Yadav to Rayudu, 1 run, googly again, Rayudu gets a leading edge as he closes his bat face early. Loops up towards cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhoni, 1 run, thumped down to long-on

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, out Caught by Johnson!! In the air and taken at long-on. Two wickets in two overs for KKR, they are plotting a turnaround here. Both set batsmen dismissed. Well-flighted delivery outside off, Raina grounds his knee and smacked it - skews it off the toe-end - finds long-on. It was in the slot but Raina couldn't connect it well. Raina c Johnson b Kuldeep Yadav 31(26) [4s-4]
Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, 2 runs, teaser outside off, Raina shifts his weight forward and flails his hands to crash it wide of long-off. Two taken
Kuldeep Yadav to Rayudu, 1 run, googly from Kuldeep, dropped on a shorter side. Rayudu has enough time to read it and wrist it to mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, 1 run, flatter outside off, Raina backs away and punches it through cover
Narine to Rayudu, no run, slowish outside off, Rayudu waits for the ball to arrive and steers it to short third man

Narine to Rayudu, FOUR, brilliant placement from Rayudu. Safe bet against Narine. Tossed up on middle and leg, Rayudu sank low and gets under it to sweep it in the gap between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket
Narine to Raina, 1 run, 97kph, fired on leg. Raina gets low and sweeps it away to deep backward square leg
Narine to Rayudu, 1 run, touch quicker, placed into the vacant mid-wicket region

Narine to Watson, out Caught by Shivam Mavi!! Watson couldn't have picked the fielder out any better. He knows, can't believe his luck. Punches his bat in anger. Narine provides the breakthrough for KKR. Landed short and asked Watson to go for it. Watto rocked back and smoked it flat, forgets there is a fielder set for the trap. Hits it straight to Mavi, who takes it at the edge of the bounce. Didn't have to move an inch. Like Faf, Watto also fails to convert his start into a big-score. Watson c Shivam Mavi b Narine 36(25) [4s-4 6s-2]
Narine to Raina, 1 run, Raina makes some adjustment to this carrom ball from Narine that fizzes off the surface. Whips it through mid-wicket

Kuldeep Yadav to Watson, SIX, Watson flexes his muscles and tonks one straight over Kuldeep's head for a maximum. Thrown well outside off, Watson fetches it from there after bending low and slammed it beautifully straight down the ground. Ruins a good over from Kuldeep
Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, 1 run, overpitched at the stumps, whipped away to long-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, no run, plenty of air, Raina prods forward and defends it slightly off the inner half
Kuldeep Yadav to Watson, 1 run, googly, spinning away outside off. Watson makes room and thrashes it to sweeper cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, 1 run, spearing on leg, Raina tickles it away to fine leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, no run, tossed up, a little overpitched. Raina drives it straight to extra cover
Shivam Mavi to Raina, 1 run, attacks the stumps, Raina hops across and clips it to mid-wicket
Shivam Mavi to Watson, 1 run, this back of a length delivery holds up a touch on the pitch, Watson was early into the shot. Gets it high on the bat towards mid-wicket
Shivam Mavi to Raina, 1 run, pitched up in the driving length. Spanked through cover
Shivam Mavi to Watson, 1 run, curving in, a low full toss. Watson picks it away to deep mid-wicket. This was clocked at 144kph
Shivam Mavi to Watson, no run, mild appeal for LBW, quickly withdrawn. Full and tailing back in, Watson misses the flick and wears it on the pad. Clearly going down leg
Shivam Mavi to Raina, 1 run, 140kph, sucker ball from Mavi. Raina with no feet feels for it, outside-edges it away to third man

Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, 1 run, oh. The slider from Yadav, nearly went through Raina's defences. Skidded off the deck, Raina was hanging back and misjudges it. Brings his bat down hurriedly and jabs it off the inner half to square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Watson, 1 run, tossed up temptingly on the stumps, whisked away to long-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Watson, FOUR, very smart from Watson. Knew there was no fine leg; plants his front leg across and rolls his wrists on the sweep. Sends it very fine and earns himself a boundary
Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, 1 run, touch too full, Raina lunges forward with a solid push to long-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, no run, the wrong 'un from Kuldeep, Raina didn't pick it at all. Went low for a swat across the line and is beaten completely
Kuldeep Yadav to Raina, no run, 96kph, flat and quick outside off. Raina reaches out and aims to cut, messes up with his timing and chops it to point
A Russell to Raina, 1 run, hits the deck hard outside off, Raina rides the bounce and dabs it to third man
A Russell to Watson, 1 run, full on the pads, clipped away to deep square leg
A Russell to Raina, 1 run, tucked to mid-wicket and they set off for a single. A direct-hit at the striker's end could've had Watto in trouble
A Russell to Raina, FOUR, woah. How cleverly did Raina place that? Deft hands. Played it so late, just used Russell's pace, waited deep and glided it to the third man fence. Wonderful from Raina!
A Russell to Raina, wide, another blip for Russell. Not learning. Splays it down leg and called a wide. DK walks up to him and has a few words of advice
A Russell to Raina, FOUR, Russell loses radar and spills it down leg. Easy-peasy for Raina, just needed to get some bat on it. Does so and hacks it very fine
A Russell to Raina, no run, beaten. Pitched up and swerving away outside off, Raina goes after it and the ball swings just past his driving blade
Chawla to Raina, 1 run, straighter on the stumps, worked through mid-wicket

Chawla to Raina, no run, was there a nick? There was a certain deviation and also, a faint noise. I guess, the reaction of Chawla suggests that there was an edge. So, will go down as a drop. Guess, who's the culprit? It's the skipper, DK. Googly, turning away from Raina, who went for the drive. Scraps the outside edge, straight in and out of DK's gloves. Costly drop? Surely

Chawla to Raina, FOUR, Chawla errs in line and Raina makes him pay. Half-tracker down leg, Raina will keep putting this away to the fence, seven days a week and twenty four hours a day. Half-swivels and helps it away past short fine leg
Chawla to Raina, no run, now goes forward and stabs a leggie straight down the pitch
Chawla to Raina, FOUR, Raina takes on his former statemate. Stretches across outside off, gets under this flighted delivery and lofts it over cover. Excellent execution!

Chawla to du Plessis, out Bowled!! Cleaned up. du Plessis is hoodwinked by Chawla's googly. He was strugging to pick earlier as well. Credit to DK for bringing back the leggie. KKR draw first blood. It was dropped a tad shorter - the googly - du Plessis stayed back, waiting for the leggie perhaps. The ball spun back in, goes through the bat-pad gate and crashes the stumps. The South African skipper is absolutely clueless. Eden Gardens roars. du Plessis b Chawla 27(15) [4s-4 6s-1]

Johnson to Watson, SIX, proper pasting for Johnson in this over. 19 runs off it and just the momentum CSK were looking for. Went short, no real threat behind it. Watson swivels across, taking his eyes off the ball and pulls it over short fine leg. Sweet timing and it flies all the way for a maximum
Johnson to du Plessis, 1 run, Johnson follows the batsman, who took a couple of strides down the pitch. Fended away in front of square on the leg-side
Johnson to du Plessis, SIX, du Plessis is looking in fine touch. Sees a short ball, backs away and gets under it to smoke it over deep backward square leg stands. Into the crowd
Johnson to Watson, 1 run, fullish outside off, Watson drills it along the ground, this time there is protection. Straight to long-off

Johnson to Watson, FOUR, oh goodness! What a strike from Watson. Johnson and the umpire had to take evasive action as it was struck so hard. Can you believe it? Still runs away to the fence. Full and on off, Watson stomps forward and hammers it back at Johnson, who puts up his left hand to take cover. The ball hits him and flies away past a ducking umpire Abhijit Deshmukh to the boundary. That must've hurt and it's his bowling arm
Johnson to du Plessis, 1 run, Johnson feeds a half-volley just outside off, du Plessis languidly drives, wide of mid-off. Chawla dives and makes a superb stop
Narine to Watson, no run, 91kph, drifter on leg. Watson adjusts his backlift and flicks it to square leg
Narine to Watson, FOUR, no half measures from Watson on this occasion. Spots the half-tracker early, chooses his spot and muscles it to the right of deep mid-wicket fielder. One-bounce four
Narine to Watson, no run, three dots in a row. Flat and width on offer, Watson goes deep and flashes it straight to point
Narine to Watson, no run, 94kph, pushed through quicker just outside off. Watson was closing the bat face a little early, tamely pushes it back to the bowler
Narine to Watson, no run, gives more air, straightens a bit and Watson quells it after getting forward
Narine to du Plessis, 1 run, flighted on middle and leg, du Plessis waits and waits before turning it gently through square leg
Shivam Mavi to Watson, no run, good change up from Mavi. Bangs it short, good wheels on it as it loops over Watson's head. He went for the pull and missed
Shivam Mavi to du Plessis, 1 run, wafted in closer to off, du Plessis chops it towards DK and they nab a quick single

Shivam Mavi to du Plessis, FOUR, ah, time for French cricket from du Plessis. Late swing for Mavi again, du Plessis squirts an inside edge that almost shaved the leg-stump. Fine leg was inside the circle and it escapes away to the fence

Shivam Mavi to Watson, 1 run, cuts back in from a length, swung back in prodigiously. Watson gets an inside edge onto his pad and the ball drops dead in front of the stumps. They scamper for a single, Mavi rushes forward and breaks the stumps. Faf was in anyway. Mavi seems to have hurt his finger in the process, DK checks on him but he looks okay to continue
Shivam Mavi to Watson, no run, rifles it on middle and leg-stump line, Watson is behind the line to block it with a straight bat
Shivam Mavi to Watson, no run, full and arrowing at the stumps, Watson presses forward and defends down the pitch
Chawla to du Plessis, no run, Chawla slips in another googly and cramps up du Plessis. Didn't read at all, manages to get his bat in time to keep it out
Chawla to du Plessis, FOUR, tossed up teasingly outside off and du Plessis says thank you very much. Leans across, picks it up and lifts it disdainfully over mid-off. Clean swing of the bat!
Chawla to du Plessis, no run, googly, snaking in. du Plessis keeps it out

Chawla to du Plessis, FOUR, poor poor effort from Uthappa. What an error from the vice captain of KKR. Flat and quick outside off, du Plessis punches it from the crease towards Uthappa at cover-point, who clumsily lets it through. Chawla is not happy with the effort

Chawla to du Plessis, no run, wow! How close was that to off-pole? Not much, not much. Flighted just outside off, du Plessis bent low for a slog across the line, misses and DK fails to collect it cleanly as well. However, they don't take the bye
Chawla to du Plessis, no run, offers a juicy floater outside off, du Plessis crisply drives, finds extra cover
Johnson to du Plessis, 1 run, sharp inward shape for Johnson, tucks du Plessis for space. Somehow hops back and defends it awkwardly into the off-side, calls through for a single and Watto responds

Johnson to du Plessis, FOUR, edged and past the lone slip. Goodish length, moving away outside off. du Plessis threw his bat hard at it, ends up feathering a thick outside edge which flew past Uthappa at widish first slip. The third man had no chance as it sped away to the fence in a hurry
Johnson to Watson, 1 run, goes full, wide of off. Watson guides it neatly to third man after opening the bat face

Johnson to Watson, FOUR, oh, gosh. How did Watson manage to get this wide of mid-off. Lost timing totally as he went chasing for a drive to an outswinger slanted outside off. Way too early into the shot and canned it off the inner half, evades mid-off who refuses it put in a dive. All the way and Watson is off the mark with a boundary
Johnson to Watson, no run, similar delivery, at 133kph. Climbs from a back of a length and Watson taps it softly towards cover, was keen for a single but Faf isn't interested
Johnson to Watson, no run, starts with a short of length delivery angling into Watson, who gets on top of the bounce. Watches it carefully before dropping it dead into the off-side

Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, leg byes, FOUR, Mumbai are alive! They live on to fight another day this season. An anti-climax of a finish, slow yorker and Krunal missed the slog to be hit on the back leg. KXIP were busy appealing for LBW and the ball raced away to the fence. They didn't have any review to challenge the call anyway and so it meant that the game was settled
Andrew Tye to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length around off, walks across a bit and nudges it towards mid-wicket. Hands it to Krunal Pandya to finish it off
Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, shorter length this time and no pace on it, muscled away to deep mid-wicket

Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, SIX, he has absolutely blasted this away! Krunal is hitting them with such ferocity and also clearing the fence by some margin as well. Fuller ball on middle and leg, he was backing away and slogs it merrily over the ropes. Such a huge hit and with such power. Wow!

Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, not where he wanted to hit this but who cares? MI are cantering now. Slower and shortish, foxed Krunal for a moment but the length allowed him to adjust. Lobbed wide of backward point and it races away. Just 11 off 10 needed now!
Andrew Tye to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length and Rohit was on the charge already, adjusts to flat bat it towards long-on

Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, SIX, M-A-S-S-I-V-E! What a blow by Krunal! This over has most certainly sealed the game for Mumbai. Excellent hitting under pressure from these two. Stoinis errs on the fuller side once more and feeds it right where Krunal was wanting it. He backed away, cleared his front leg and deposited it over long-on for a mammoth six

Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, raining boundaries now! This is the over MI needed to turn this game around and Stoinis is bearing the brunt of it. Misses the yorker for the second time in as many deliveries and it's a full toss on the pads, easily chipped away aerially but well wide of short fine leg

Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, an exact replica from Krunal and the runs are coming now. Full and wide outside off, slower ball but the width allows the southpaw to free his arms. Crashes it through extra cover and the man at sweeper is very wide
Stoinis to Rohit, 1 run, slower and just outside off, soft hands on the dab towards backward point and takes the single

Stoinis to Rohit, FOUR, sublime stroke! Most people would have tried slogging this but not Rohit. Uses his timing and placement to find the fence. Full and wide outside off, unfurls the drive with finesse past a diving extra cover fielder. There wasn't any protection in the deep
Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, slower and short around middle, flat-batted over Stoinis' head. Long-on is straight and so, just a single

Mujeeb to Rohit, SIX, what a gigantic strike! Rohit is in the mood tonight, that's for sure. Shuffles a tad across the stumps and gets a fuller ball closer his arc. Goes through with that classy bat swing of his to send this way into the crowd at deep mid-wicket. 14 off the over! MI are hanging on here
Mujeeb to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, fired in the blockhole at 106.7kph and Krunal had to get his bat down in time. Does so and squeezes it towards long-on
Mujeeb to Rohit, 1 run, flattish and skids off the deck, Rohit wanted to launch the pull but mistimes it to deep mid-wicket
Mujeeb to Rohit, no run, stifled LBW appeal but probably going down leg. Loopy wrong 'un and Rohit was early into the slog sweep. Misses and gets hit on the knee

Mujeeb to Rohit, no run, run out chance missed! A direct hit at the keeper's end would have got Rohit but Yuvraj misses. Slower and outside off, slightly short and Rohit cut it but cannot beat backward point. Hesitation in the running but eventually, the skipper survives

Mujeeb to Rohit, SIX, this will help MI! The skipper tees off and clears the fence with ease. Fullish and in the slot, flatter trajectory helped Rohit as he clubbed it dead straight over the bowler's head. Lovely placement too as you cannot have a fielder there. Not that it would have mattered
Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, no run, fantastic bowling from Tye, another dot and the pressure is mounting. Back of a length around middle, Krunal can only whip it back towards the bowler
Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, no run, nearly chops it on! Knuckle ball on off and Krunal wanted to dab this towards short third man. Gets a bottom edge and it just goes past the stumps

Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, good placement and timing to get Krunal off the mark. Finds the fence. Fuller ball on the pads, he shuffled across and flicked this well wide of the deep mid-wicket fielder who had lot of ground to cover
Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, wide, more of the off-pace deliveries from Tye but he slips this down the leg-side. Krunal tries to flick, doesn't connect

Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, out Bowled!! The stumps are in a mess! This is excellent stuff from Tye and this is why he is sought after in the T20 format. Loves bowling at the back end of the innings. This is a big strike for KXIP as the dangerous Hardik Pandya has to depart. He did get going tonight from the word go but his cameo has been nipped in the bud. The cutter from Tye and he did smartly to attack the stumps, a wild slog attempted and once Hardik missed it, he knew the result. Woodwork destroyed! Hardik Pandya b Andrew Tye 23(13) [4s-2 6s-1]
Andrew Tye to Rohit, 1 run, just short of long-on! Slower ball on middle and leg, Rohit checks his whip stroke at the last moment. Luckily for him, doesn't carry to the man in the deep

Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, Hardik was in two minds as he initially wanted to play the paddle scoop by moving across the stumps. Tye shortened the length and took pace off it, eventually dabbed to short third man
Mujeeb to Rohit, no run, fuller and just around off, flatter trajectory and Rohit defends well off the front foot. Despite that six, just 8 off the over!
Mujeeb to Rohit, no run, the googly and hurries Rohit who gets stuck on the back foot. Gets bat down in time and dabs it towards cover

Mujeeb to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, Hardik wanted to send this into the parking lot of the stadium. Such was the bat swing on seeing the loop from Mujeeb but gets it off the inner half. Towards deep mid-wicket
Mujeeb to Hardik Pandya, no run, shortish and outside off, cut hard but cannot finds the gap at cover-point

Mujeeb to Hardik Pandya, SIX, dumped into the stands! Hardik Pandya has been promoted to up the ante and he is at it. Makes a hint of room and gets a fuller ball in his arc, smokes it into orbit at long-on. Powerful hit!

Mujeeb to Rohit, 1 run, tight single but HP is in once again. Really quick with his running. Floated up around off by Mujeeb, nudged towards backward point and they raced across for the single. Rahul didn't gather it cleanly anyway

Andrew Tye to Rohit, 1 run, had to hurry but Hardik Pandya was quick and made it with ease. Slower ball outside off, Rohit dabs it towards short third man and HP was always intending to sneak a single there
Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, stump to stump line from a good length, whipped away towards long-on for a single

Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, and again! Stoinis fumbles but no harm done this time. Back of a length outside off, crashed through point and sweeper cover gets across to get to it. Didn't gather cleanly but no extra run taken

Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, Stoinis lets it through! Poor fielding and his Aussie teammate who is bowling won't be amused at all. Slower and fuller outside off, Hardik absolutely belted the drive but it shopuld have been cut off at sweeper cover. Instead it sneaks through Stoinis and crashes into the fence
Andrew Tye to Rohit, 1 run, slower ball around middle and leg, nudged gently towards square leg and Rohit set off quickly for the run in the hope of sneaking a second. Not on
Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, very full and outside off, squeezed away down towards long-off

Mujeeb to Ishan Kishan, out Bowled!! Excellent comeback from Mujeeb! Got carted for two biggies but the Afghan lad has held his nerve brilliantly. Saw Kishan give the charge and hung it back a bit in the air. Pulled the length back just a touch and that meant that the wild slog was never really on. Kishan misses and finds the stumps in a mess. Back to back overs where the runs have come but so have the wickets and that's what KXIP will be concerned with as MI bat deep. Ishan Kishan b Mujeeb 25(19) [6s-3]

Mujeeb to Ishan Kishan, SIX, that's gone deep into the crowd! Best over of the chase thus far and MI needed this to be fair. Mujeeb is under pressure now. Full and flat just outside off, Kishan fetches it with a slog sweep over deep mid-wicket. Meaty blow!
Mujeeb to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, flatter and outside off, chops the cut towards cover and takes Yuvraj on for the single. The shy at the bowler's end misses but I reckon Hardik may have made it
Mujeeb to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, clubbed wide of long-on. It was in the air but Hardik got his placement right. On a good length from a flat trajectory, he gets under it and flays it away
Mujeeb to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, tries to flat-bat it away hard past the bowler but it's straight towards long-off
Mujeeb to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, flatter and a bit short outside off, crashed off the back foot towards deep cover

Stoinis to Ishan Kishan, SIX, helps it away for a biggie! Stoinis spoils the over with a short ball around leg stump, doesn't rise enough to threaten Kishan who swivels to just control the pull. The emphasis was to just use the pace and get it over short fine leg. In the end, it went all the way
