Plunkett to Williamson, 1 run, top ball! Saw the batsman back away and followed him with a yorker. Jammed out into the leg-side and can only sneak a single

Plunkett to Y Pathan, 1 run, dropped! Vijay Shankar at deep backward square leg has put down. Probably lost it a bit and was late to go for the catch. Was a shortish ball on leg and Pathan heaved it flat behind square leg. How costly will that be?
Plunkett to Y Pathan, no run, 31 off 15 now! Good ball, first up to Yusuf Pathan. Banged in short and got good height. Above the shoulder and Pathan misses the pull
Plunkett to Williamson, 1 run, short ball on leg, pulled to deep square leg

Plunkett to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! The teenager takes a high-pressure catch. The cross-seamed fuller length ball, Pandey went too hard on his lofted shot and lost all his shape in the process. Wanted to go downtown and the bat face turned at the point of impact. Went miles up in the air and Shaw settled under it after running back from extra cover. Reverse-cupped. Manish Pandey c Prithvi Shaw b Plunkett 21(17) [4s-2]

Boult to Williamson, 2 runs, the cutter to finish the over, Williamson moves towards off and then back towards his original position to push-drive it to the left of long-off. Hustles back for the second run. The throw was to the bowler's end, Pandey was in

Boult to Williamson, no run, tries to be cheeky;  end result is a dot. It was a low full toss outside off and Williamson shuffled across to paddle it away. Got it off the toe-end and the ball died down in the pitch itself
Boult to Manish Pandey, 1 run, another one in that yorker length, Pandey goes too hard and squeezes it to long-on

Boult to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, yorker length outside off, Pandey throws his bat at it and the bottom hand comes off the handle as well. Off the inside edge and the ball rolls towards mid-wicket. Two more
Boult to Williamson, 1 run, full again and KW drives uppishly. More of a chip. On the bounce to long-off
Boult to Manish Pandey, 1 run, takes the pace off the ball and bowls a full ball on the stumps, Pandey clears the front leg and drives it firmly to long-off
Avesh Khan to Williamson, 2 runs, back of a length delivery and the batsman gets on top of the bounce to punch it square of the wicket. A couple to deep point

Avesh Khan to Williamson, SIX, superb shot! Bouncer well outside off, a slight move across from Williamson, followed by an upper cut over third man. Both his feet off-ground when he made contact with the ball. Classy shot. Timing and placement was spot on
Avesh Khan to Manish Pandey, 1 run, wow! Gets away with a full toss now. 144kph, and just below the waist. Pandey goes hard and heaves off the inside part. A single to long leg
Avesh Khan to Manish Pandey, no run, swing and a miss. Normal-paced short of length delivery wide of off, it was there to be hit. Tries the cut and fails to connect. Beaten for pace - 143kph
Avesh Khan to Williamson, 1 run, short ball without any venom, wide of off, Williamson pulls well, but straight to the man at deep mid-wicket
Avesh Khan to Williamson, no run, back of a length, Williamson punches off the inside part. Back at the bowler

Christian to Manish Pandey, FOUR, now these two boundaries have made a mess of Christian's figures. The length was shortened by Christian, Pandey danced out of his crease and slapped it through covers. In the gap and 13 came off that over

Christian to Manish Pandey, FOUR, two fielders run across, see each other and neither go for the ball. Comical. Two overseas fielders - Roy and Boult. Was a low full toss and Pandey got underneath it to bunt it over the bowler's head. Long-on should have cut that off. Ordinary stuff!
Christian to Williamson, 1 run, shortish ball on the stumps, the leg-break, Williamson moves across to pull and gets an inside edge onto his pad that rolls to Pant's left
Christian to Manish Pandey, 1 run, shortish ball, Pandey shimmies down and pulls hard, finds long-on. Singles won't hurt DD
Christian to Williamson, 1 run, Christian nails the yorker and Williamson can only turn it towards square leg. Was another slower ball, but the length was spot on
Christian to Williamson, 2 runs, off-paced full ball on off, Williamson shuffles across and flicks it through mid-wicket for a couple

Plunkett to Manish Pandey, no run, slower ball to cap off the over. Loopy length ball at 117kph around off, Pandey spots it late and can only push it back to the bowler. Another tight over - just 6 off it
Plunkett to Williamson, 1 run, dragged short, controlled pull to deep backward square leg

Plunkett to Williamson, 2 runs, shimmies down the track does Williamson and taps a length ball to backward point. Boult has a shy at the bowler's end and misses the target, resulting in an overthrow. The throw from long-on is again off-target. They can't steal the third run
Plunkett to Manish Pandey, 1 run, bowled fuller and Pandey looked to drive through covers. Inside-edges to short fine leg. Was another off-pace delivery from Plunkett
Plunkett to Williamson, 1 run, head-high bumper at 116.6kph, pulled to deep square leg
Plunkett to Manish Pandey, 1 run, back of a length delivery around off, Pandey stands tall and punches it on the rise. Beats a diving extra cover fielder for a single to long-off

Mishra to Manish Pandey, 1 run, once again the length is slightly too short, this was the leg-break, turned to deep mid-wicket. Just 4 off the over and Mishra finishes with impressive figures - 4-0-19-2
Mishra to Williamson, 1 run, the wrong 'un, slightly on the shorter side, Williamson has enough time to rock back and knock it to deep mid-wicket
Mishra to Manish Pandey, 1 run, flighted delivery way outside off, Pandey reaches out and cleanly drives it all along the carpet to sweeper cover
Mishra to Williamson, 1 run, leg-stump line, tickled behind square on the leg-side

Mishra to Williamson, no run, quicker ball and Williamson pushes firmly, back towards the bowler. Didn't time it well. Mishra dives to his right, but can't hold on. Those need to stick. Too harsh to call it a drop
Mishra to Williamson, no run, leg-break on middle, tucked to mid-wicket. A dot
Plunkett to Williamson, 1 run, Williamson will keep doing that all day. Give him a bit of width, he'll open the bat-face and run it down to third man
Plunkett to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short of length around the fifth stump line, patted to the right of the point fielder, who dives and stops
Plunkett to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, short of length, a walk across to wrist it towards mid-wicket. Played with soft hands and collects an easy couple

Plunkett to Manish Pandey, no run, in the air for a while, but safe. Back of a length that held onto the surface a bit, Pandey is early to have a push at it, off the splice and dies well short of the bowler
Plunkett to Manish Pandey, wide, bends his back and bowls a bouncer does Plunkett. On the stumps, but slightly too high. Pandey sways away from it and that's been wided for height
Plunkett to Williamson, 1 run, hint of width outside off and Williamson steers it down to third man
Plunkett to Williamson, no run, decks in from a length, cut to backward point

Mishra to Dhawan, out Bowled!! A long stare to the batsman, followed by a loud roar - that's Mishra's reaction. He has removed both the openers. Beautiful bowling. Tosses this well above the batsman's eyeline and that entices Dhawan into a false stroke. He cleared his front leg to hack it over the leg-side and missed it completely. Was bowled full and Dhawan was beaten in the flight. Middle stump takes the brunt. Replay shows that it was a wrong 'un. Dhawan b Mishra 33(30) [4s-2 6s-1]
Mishra to Dhawan, wide, darted down leg at 94.4kph, Dhawan misses the fine sweep. Wided
Mishra to Williamson, 1 run, drifting in on leg, Williamson stays low and works it with soft hands towards mid-wicket. Has to settle with a single
Mishra to Williamson, no run, Williamson is half-forward to push this quick leg-break to cover. No feet movement there from the SRH captain
Mishra to Dhawan, 1 run, 91.8kph, leg-break that turns in a tad towards off, Dhawan stays back to cut to sweeper cover
Mishra to Williamson, 1 run, punched to Mishra's right. A single to long-on. This was bowled quickly by Mishra
Mishra to Williamson, no run, bit of extra bounce on this leg-break, Williamson stands to knock it towards mid-wicket
Christian to Williamson, 1 run, pulls the length further back, Williamson moves off-side, gets into a good position and pulls it to deep square leg
Christian to Dhawan, 1 run, the length has been shortened and Dhawan stands tall to force it through backward point
Christian to Dhawan, no run, pitched up outside off at 116kph, driven straight to cover
Christian to Williamson, 1 run, good length ball on middle, Williamson moves across and glances it to fine leg. Off the mark straightaway
Christian to Dhawan, 1 run, over-corrects, short-and-wide outside off, cut to deep point
Christian to Dhawan, 2 runs, on the pads, tickled down to fine leg for an easy couple

Mishra to Hales, out Bowled!! That's an absolute peach. Hales had no clue, still doesn't. Stands in his crease and stares at his stumps in total disbelief. That ball reminded me of the famous ball bowled by Warne to Gatting. Mishra gives air on this occasion, gets it to drift in and beats him with the away-turn. Pitched around middle and leg, beat the outside edge and crashed into the off-stump. There's the breakthrough DD were looking for. Hales not happy with Mishy's celebration in his face. Maybe something was said. Kept looking back while walking. Hales b Mishra 45(31) [4s-3 6s-3]
Mishra to Dhawan, 1 run, shortish ball, punched to long-off

Mishra to Dhawan, FOUR, that's a gift and Dhawan takes full toll of it. What was that from Mishra? Darts a full toss on the pads and Dhawan won't miss out on those. Bends his back leg and clouts it behind square leg. There's none to stop that
Mishra to Hales, 1 run, quicker delivery, driven past the bowler to long-off
Mishra to Dhawan, 1 run, the short ball, Dhawan has ample time to trek back and muscle the pull. Maxwell, at deep mid-wicket, mops up
Mishra to Hales, 1 run, flat ball just outside off, Hales gets low and laps it to the right of long leg

Christian to Dhawan, no run, pacy length ball on off and middle, Dhawan walks across towards off and taps it towards cover. Looks for a non-existent single, rightly sent back by Hales. Just 4 off Christian's opening over
Christian to Hales, 1 run, the off-cutter at 115.7kph, dinked to long-on
Christian to Hales, no run, length ball, skids on, Hales stays leg-side of the ball to push it through covers. Off the inside half and Christian is quick to cut it off in his followthrough
Christian to Dhawan, 1 run, straighter lines, short of length on middle and leg, worked around the corner
Christian to Hales, 1 run, slower ball, short again, Hales stands, waits and heaves it to deep mid-wicket
Christian to Dhawan, 1 run, starts from round the wicket and bowls a shortish ball, Dhawan waits for it and muscles the pull to deep mid-wicket
Mishra to Hales, no run, googly, skidding on with the angle. Hales waits back to work it through square leg. Is beaten by the extra zip off the deck and wears it on the thigh pad
Mishra to Hales, no run, wicket-to-wicket line from Mishra, Hales watchfully blocks it off the front foot
Mishra to Hales, no run, spinning on middle, turned softly to mid-wicket

Mishra to Dhawan, 1 run, rank long hop from Mishy, at the stumps. Dhawan spots it early and muscles it into the gap on the leg-side. Maxi from deep mid-wicket sprints to his left and keeps it down to a single
Mishra to Hales, 1 run, drags it short, Hales tucks it to mid-wicket
Mishra to Dhawan, 1 run, flipper from Mishra, Dhawan goes back and shovels it away to long-on

Avesh Khan to Hales, SIX, 27 runs off the over. Avesh has been taken to the cleaners. Drops it short on seeing Hales move to leg. Hales throws it bat and smashes it over the in-field on the off-side. Sails over the ropes by a few inches. Just the momentum SRH needed at the end of Powerplay
Avesh Khan to Hales, no run, full and tailing in, Hales drills it to mid-on

Avesh Khan to Hales, SIX, this is turning out to be an expensive over for DD. Went full outside off, Hales jumped across and lifted it over mid-off. Not off the sweet spot but enough to take it all the way for a maximum
Avesh Khan to Hales, SIX, no respite for Avesh whatsoever. Tests Alex with a short ball, much like Hales he gets under it and blasts the pull over the mid-wicket fence
Avesh Khan to Dhawan, 1 run, short and this one hurries onto Dhawan. Gets it high on the bat as he pulls it wide of short fine leg

Avesh Khan to Dhawan, SIX, bang! "Don't ball short to me," seemed like the body language of Dhawan. Knew what was coming, was ready on the back foot as he muscled it way back into the deep square leg stands

Avesh Khan to Hales, no ball, 1 run, full and curves in late, Hales digs it into the pitch and it bounces over Avesh's stretched hands. The highlight of the delivery is - Avesh has overstepped. Free-hit for Dhawan next ball

Plunkett to Dhawan, FOUR, Plunkett is spraying it all over the place. Misses the line and ends up offering a buffet ball for Dhawan down leg. Just needed to get some bat on that. Does so after a half-swivel and runs it down to the fine leg fence
Plunkett to Hales, 1 run, again that mini-shuffle from Hales, short on leg-stump line. Hales rolls his wrists and controls the pull along the ground to deep square leg
Plunkett to Dhawan, 1 run, 134kph, slanting in from round the wicket. Dhawan mistimes the heave - gets it off the inner half to deep square leg
Plunkett to Hales, 1 run, better. Tucks Hales for room by following him. Nudged to the vacant mid-wicket region

Plunkett to Hales, FOUR, overcorrects and lands a fuller length delivery on the pads. Hales shuffled a bit and that must've put Plunkett off-guard. Moves inside the line and glances it very fine. The fielder was inside the ring and didn't have any chance
Plunkett to Hales, no run, short, slower ball that went awry for Plunkett. Hales chased and thrashed, fails to thread the gap on the off-side
Maxwell to Hales, 1 run, flat and quick on leg, turned through square leg
Maxwell to Dhawan, 1 run, straighter at the stumps, Dhawan gets low and plays a cute-little lap-sweep to short fine leg
Maxwell to Hales, 1 run, spearing on middle and leg, knocked away to long-on
Maxwell to Hales, no run, half-tracker and Maxi is lucky to get away with this. Hales bashed it straight to cover
Maxwell to Dhawan, 1 run, drifter on leg, Dhawan hangs back and hacks it to deep backward square leg, on the bounce to the fielder
Maxwell to Dhawan, no run, snaking in from round the wicket, Dhawan punches it to extra cover
Boult to Dhawan, 1 run, full and zeroing at the stumps, Dhawan with a shuffle to get inside the line, pushes it to mid-on
Boult to Hales, 2 wides, Boult loses his radar, slips it down leg. Pant dives across and makes a half-stop
Boult to Hales, 2 runs, Boult rifles a yorker outside off, Hales slices it square on the off-side. Maxi from the deep cuts it off moving to his right
Boult to Dhawan, 1 run, scrambled seam delivery from Boult, on a fuller length. Dhawan checks his drive to mid-off
Boult to Dhawan, no run, fizzes off the deck, startles Dhawan. He was late to bring his bat down and wears it on the thigh pad as it rolls towards the lone slip
Boult to Hales, 1 run, slower ball, fired it very full outside off. Hales squeezes the drive to mid-off
Boult to Dhawan, 1 run, sliding on leg, Dhawan turns it softly to square leg
Avesh Khan to Dhawan, 1 run, angled across outside off, Dhawan waits and flashes it to third man
Avesh Khan to Dhawan, no run, pokes and misses. This short of length delivery rises off after hitting the deck, Dhawan tamely jabs and makes no connection

Avesh Khan to Hales, 1 run, Maxi drops a skier. He's having a horrible tournament, not amongst the runs and now puts down a sitter. Hales miscues the pull, gets it high on the bat and sends it high into the night sky. Maxi from deep square leg, runs in and slides with both hands cupped. Straight in and out, embarrasses himself and DD
Avesh Khan to Hales, FOUR, Hales is aware of the field. Perhaps realised another short ball was coming. Moved away to the leg-side, opened himself up and ramps it over short third man
Avesh Khan to Hales, no run, pulls and misses this time. More venom and hike in pace from Avesh on this bumper. Goes sniffing past Hales's helmet

Avesh Khan to Hales, FOUR, lousy beginning from Avesh. Whangs in a short ball on leg-stump line, forgets the fine leg is inside the circle. Easy picking for Hales, swivels across and helps it over the man at 45. Didn't get it off the middle but enough to clear the fielder
Boult to Dhawan, no run, goes short outside off, Dhawan standing tall forces it to point. Just a solitary run from the over. Tidy start from Boult

Boult to Dhawan, no run, bends his back and digs it short, look at that carry. Whew! Dhawan thought about ramping it over the keeper but it kicked off rapidly and he withdrew from the shot at the last moment
Boult to Dhawan, no run, 141kph, pitched up and wooes Dhawan into the mandatory drive. He prodded forward and drove, straight to extra cover
Boult to Hales, 1 run, Hales is off the mark. Languidly wades forward and drives an overpitched delivery just outside off to mid-off

Boult to Hales, no run, oops. Boult tumbles in his followthrough as he hurls this full ball that swung into the right-hander. Hales was neither forward nor back - defends it onto his pad and dribbles away to the off-side
Boult to Hales, no run, hint of shape back from this back of a length delivery on off, Hales stayed back and punched it with an open bat face to point
Bhuvneshwar to Vijay Shankar, 3 runs, fab running by the duo. Nurdled off the hips behind square, the duo put their jetpack on and scamper back for the third

Bhuvneshwar to Vijay Shankar, FOUR, Shankar picks the leg-cutter on this occasion. Took a stride forward, opened his bat face and flayed it past point. Sweeper cover fielder couldn't get across and it runs away to the boundary
Bhuvneshwar to Christian, 1 run, in the air and short of long-on. Christian's unintended slog nearly went straight to long-on. Dragged it off the inner half as the slower ball ruins his timing
Bhuvneshwar to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, now responds with a yorker just outside off, Shankar squeezes it with an open bat face to point. Nothing else he could've done about it
Bhuvneshwar to Vijay Shankar, SIX, this should ease Shankar's nerves. Much-needed hit for DD. Bhuvneshwar overdoes it; full and outside off, Shankar lines up and smacks it with ferocity over long-on
Bhuvneshwar to Vijay Shankar, 2 runs, 128kph, slower ball on middle. Shankar places it towards mid-wicket, runs hard and gets the brace
S Kaul to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, SRH have been agile in the field today. Punched crisply to cover-point, the fielder flings across and makes a superb stop
S Kaul to Christian, 1 run, bashes a drive to long-off

S Kaul to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, run-out chance at the non-striker's end missed! Why didn't Kaul collect the ball and break the stumps? Had ample time there as Christian had given up. Poked airly to extra cover, KW fires a throw and misses the target. No backing up and they take the single eventually. Skipper gestures to Kaul that he should've collected the ball
S Kaul to Vijay Shankar, 2 runs, knuckle ball from Kaul, on a short of length. Shankar shaves it through mid-wicket. Rashid Khan with a slide intercepts and keeps the pair down to a brace
S Kaul to Christian, 1 run, smidgen full, the slower ball. Christian drives it to KW who cuts it by moving across to his right at extra cover
S Kaul to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, late curl for Kaul, dipping on middle and leg. Glanced to deep square leg
Shakib to Christian, 2 runs, tossed straighter on middle, Christian puts it into the gap at deep mid-wicket and adds a couple to the tally
Shakib to Christian, no run, this flatter ball from Shakib has Christian in a strife. Rushes out of his crease looking to nudge it to the leg-side, misses and is struck on the back pad
Shakib to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, leading edge and safe. Shankar closes the bat face early, pops a leading edge that balloons away to long-off
Shakib to Christian, 1 run, wristed in front of square on the leg-side
Shakib to Christian, no run, hammered straight down the ground, Shakib fails to get a hand on it as the ball knocks the stumps at the other end. Shankar was backing up, was really struggling
Shakib to Christian, no run, leans across and push-drives it to extra cover
Rashid Khan to Christian, 1 run, floated on the stumps, clipped through mid-wicket

Rashid Khan to Pant, out Lbw!! Pant has been given out LBW, he reviews. No issues with the front foot. Clearly no bat there. Only factor that could favour Pant is the height. Hit in-line as well. Ball-tracker is out: 2 reds. Pitched - in-line. Impact - in-line. Wickets - umpire's call. Clipping the top of middle. What a fightback from SRH this has been. Skiddy leg-break from Rashid on a short of length, Pant went back for the pull and it didn't rise much as he expected. Misses and is rapped on the back thigh. Was given out on-field, he reviewed in hope but in vain. Pant lbw b Rashid Khan 18(19) [4s-1]
Rashid Khan to Vijay Shankar, 1 run, worked off the pads through mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Vijay Shankar, no run, again on the back foot, to quell this flattish ball just outside off
Rashid Khan to Vijay Shankar, no run, spinning just outside off, Shankar hangs back and pokes it into the off-side

Rashid Khan to Naman Ojha, out Naman Ojha Run Out!! Suicidal running and DD lose another wicket. Remember, Pant was involved in a run-out against CSK as well where he ran his skipper out. Today, it's the turn of Ojha, who has to depart early. Defended to the right of the bowler and Ojha took off, Pant responded and stopped, throwing his partner under the bus. Rashid Khan moves across quickly and lasers a throw to the keeper, who does the rest. Naman Ojha run out (Rashid Khan/Saha) 1(4)

S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, a welcome boundary for Pant, this should get him going. Kaul wafts it full outside off, Pant plonks his front foot forward and blasts it straight back at Kaul, who sticks his hand out but can't cling onto it. Brushes his fingertips and trickles away to the straight boundary. Umpire Bruce Oxenford had to take cover as it was coming at him

S Kaul to Naman Ojha, leg byes, 1 run, reverse-swinging yorker that tails in and pings Ojha on the boot. Falls over as he misses the flick. Kaul goes up for a half-hearted appeal for LBW but it was sliding down leg
S Kaul to Pant, 1 run, 120kph, on a length just outside off. Pant chops it down towards long-off

S Kaul to Pant, wide, umpire Bruce Oxenford took a while to signal that a wide. A marginal call, angled wide of off and stalking the tramlines. Pant slashes and misses, loses his balance as well. He's really struggling today
S Kaul to Naman Ojha, 1 run, backs away to leg-side to free his arms. Glided away to third man
S Kaul to Naman Ojha, no run, 134kph, nipping back in from a length. Cramps Ojha for room and he defends it into the pitch

S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, out Caught by Dhawan!! Told ya! Shikhar is a good fielder, compensates for the early fault of his in the previous over as he holds onto a catch and does the 'Thigh five' to get the Hyderabad crowd into a frenzy. Full and on leg, Iyer had the license to go for it. Picked it off his pads and whacked hard, no real timing behind it and hits it straight to Dhawan at deep mid-wicket. Shreyas Iyer c Dhawan b S Kaul 44(36) [4s-3 6s-2]
Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, banged in short, swatted away through mid-wicket

Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, a rare blip from Shikhar Dhawan in the field, you won't see this often because he's usually a good fielder. A dipping low full toss on off, Iyer smashes it down to long-off, Dhawan was pretty squarer and had to run across to his right. Did so and in the process, sort of took his eyes off the ball. Or got an awkward bounce too, failed to get his body behind the line of the ball and lets it through to the fence
Sandeep Sharma to Pant, 1 run, cross-seamer from Sandeep, Pant after crouching a bit, heaves it along the ground to deep square leg
Sandeep Sharma to Pant, no run, was this the knuckle ball? Seemed like so which defeated Pant completely. Didn't read it and swung blindly, fails to make any connection

Sandeep Sharma to Pant, no run, another instance of pitch holding up. This was slanted wide of off, Pant goes hard at that without using his feet. Ends up squirting it off the inner half to the leg-side
Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, Sandeep serves a low full toss on middle and leg, Iyer picks it away to long-on
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, 2 runs, this time they collect the second without any fuss. Drilled wide of long-off
Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, punched, standing tall through extra cover. Iyer was pushing himself hard, but couldn't steal the second there. Is disappointed with himself and grunts loudly..

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, 1 run, Bhuvneshwar knows the pitch is a bit sticky and slower balls are holding up, so he decides to unleash his knuckle balls. Dupes Pant, who checks his shot and skews it away to long-on
Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, Iyer backs away aiming to manufacture room. Bhuvneshwar shortens his length outside off and Iyer could only chop it away to third man
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, 1 run, angling at the hips, Pant hops back, softens his grip and tucks it into the leg-side. Acres of gap in front of square, easy single nabbed

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, 2 runs, Bhuvi comes back and feeds a knuckle ball which ends up as a fuller length delivery outside off, Pant spanks it wide of long-off. Pandey with a sliding stop and they get a brace
Rashid Khan to Pant, 1 run, works that away to deep square leg and takes a single to end the over
Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, quicker delivery around off, Iyer goes back in the crease and plays it with soft hands in front of point

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, rubbing salt on the wounds. Flighted ball outside off, Iyer goes inside out and chips it to perfection over wide long-off. The fielder tried hard, but the ball just cleared the fence

Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, no run, Saha has dropped it! Could have been the second wicket for Rashid. Iyer tried to work that short delivery away to the on side but got a thick inside edge. Saha behind the wickets makes a mess of it as the Delhi skipper gets a life
Rashid Khan to Pant, 1 run, shortish delivery outside off, slapped through cover point for a single

Rashid Khan to Pant, no run, how did he stop that? Was extremely drilled down by Pant. Was a full length delivery on middle and leg, Pany slammed it back to the bowler who stopped it with his left foot

S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, no run, excellent comeback over by Kaul. Went for 20 runs in his first over, concedes only three in this one. This was fine yorker around off and all Iyer could do is squeeze it out to point
S Kaul to Pant, 1 run, played with soft hands. Short of a length outside off, Pant steers it down to short third man and gets to the other end quickly
S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, shortish delivery aimed at the ribs, Iyer tucks it away to deep square leg for a single
S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, no run, short and quick outside off, Iyer tries to upper cut that but the extra bounce on it beats him

S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, no run, appeal for a caught behind? No that probably brushed his jersey. Was a short one on leg, Iyer tried to hook it but the ball kissed his jersey and went to the keeper. Appeal turned down by the umpire
S Kaul to Pant, 1 run, shortish in length and outside off, Pant has punched that firmly to sweeper cover off his back foot

Rashid Khan to Pant, 1 run, that was in the air for a while, in no man's though. Flatter on middle and leg, Pant went for the flick and as he was early in to his shot, ended up chipping it towards mid-wicket. Luckily for Pant there was no fielder there, else this was a straight forward catch
Rashid Khan to Pant, no run, another quicker delivery, full in length on middle, Pant blocks that off his back foot
Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, quick and full on middle, Iyer tries to flick that to the on side but gets a leading edge towards point
Rashid Khan to Pant, 1 run, shortish delivery outside off, Pant cuts it away to deep point and gets off the mark

Rashid Khan to Pant, no run, a quicker delivery outside off, Pant goes down on his knee to slog it but gets beaten due to the pace on it. Saha is quick to take down the bails but Pant's back foot was rooted in the crease

Rashid Khan to Prithvi Shaw, out Caught by S Kaul!! Sunrisers' best bowler strikes, gets the young opener. Tossed up delivery around off, Shaw goes after it with a slog and gets a top edge to short third man. Kaul stationed in the position goes down on his knee and reverse cups it. Fine knock by Shaw, nevertheless. He has laid the foundation for the likes of Pant and other Delhi batsmen. Prithvi Shaw c S Kaul b Rashid Khan 65(36) [4s-6 6s-3]

Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, that was pulled hard. Short of the man in the deep though. Short of a length around off, Shaw drags it away to deep mid-wicket, on a bounce and just for a single

Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, 2 runs, that's a poor delivery by Sandeep. Hasn't been at his best tonight. Bowls a full toss on middle and Shaw simply whips it away to wide long-on where a tag-team effort by the fielders keeps the batsmen down to two
Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, moves inside the line, shuffles a bit and wristily flicks the length delivery away to deep mid-wicket
Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, another slower delivery on shortish length on middle and leg, Shaw has nudged that away to the leg side for a single
Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, fine running between the wickets. Slower delivery around off, Iyer plays it with soft hands towards the left of the bowler and manages to take a quick single
Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, no run, what was that? So low, so slow. Was the knuckle delivery outside off, Iyer tried to punch that but got beaten due to the lack of bounce on that occasion

Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, 2 runs, flighted delivery on a full length on middle, Shaw goes down and sweeps it away to deep square leg for a couple of runs to end the over. 14 runs off that over, this is fine batting by Iyer and Shaw. They're keeping the scoreboard ticking
Shakib to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, eases the tossed up delivery down to long-on for a single

Shakib to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, that's a perfect example of a square cut. Was another short delivery outside off and Iyer was on to it in a flash. Rocks back and chops it right into the gap between point and cover-point
Shakib to Shreyas Iyer, no run, flat and quick on middle and leg, Iyer tries to flick that away, ends up getting a leading edge back to the bowler

Shakib to Shreyas Iyer, SIX, that's into the stands! Iyer joins the party, scores his first maximum of the night. Gets to the pitch of the ball and sends it sailing over the man at long-on for a perfectly timed six
Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, flatter in trajectory around off, Shaw punches down to long-on for a run
Rashid Khan to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, quicker delivery, short in length on middle and leg, Shaw knocks that down to long-on with a firm back foot punch
Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, short one outside off, Iyer punches it away to sweeper cover
Rashid Khan to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, sensible batting. Floated delivery on middle and leg, Shaw tickles it to mid-wicket and takes a single
Rashid Khan to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, doesn't even spare Rashid Khan. Short one, probably the googly, Shaw camps back and pulls it well past the fielder at deep square leg
Rashid Khan to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, shortish on the pads, nudged to square leg for a single
Rashid Khan to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, starts off with a shortish delivery on leg, Shaw pulls it down to short fine leg before he gets to the other end
Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, that will be the strategic time-out! Floated on middle and leg, Shaw gets down on his knee and sweeps it away to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Shakib to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, shortish delivery outside off, Iyer knocks it in front of cover-point and gets a single more

Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, another fine fifty for Shaw! Has been consistent right throughout. This was a short and low delivery on middle, he flicked that away to deep mid-wicket for a single to reach the milestone
Shakib to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, flat and full on the pads, flicked away to wide long-on by Iyer for a run again
Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, too full on leg, Shaw drills it down to long-on and gets to the other end
Shakib to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, loopy delivery around off, Iyer chips it towards sweeper cover and takes a single

S Kaul to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, 20 runs off that Kaul over! Think this is Kaul's most expensive over of IPL 2018. Coming back to the ball it was a shortish one outside off, Shaw transfered his weight on to the back foot and crunched it through the gap at cover, two fielders went for the chase but none could stop that

S Kaul to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, Kaul is feeling the pressure. Struggling with his lines and lengths. Has tried the knuckle ball, the short one but nothing's going his way. This was on the pads and Shaw dragged it down to fine leg with ease
S Kaul to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, pulled away! He's looking to make the most of the powerplay. This was a short delivery around off, Shaw picked the length early and pulled it nicely over mid-wicket

S Kaul to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, he's picking those slower deliveries, those knuckle balls to perfection. This was a full one outside off and Shaw simply smoked it over long-off. Third one of the night for him, he's approaching another fifty
S Kaul to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, another short delivery aimed on the thigh, Shreyas tucks that off his hips and gets a single at deep square leg
S Kaul to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, Kaul starts off with a shortish delivery, the line is on middle and leg, Shaw pulls it away to deep square leg
Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, no run, slower delivery to end the over, was pitched on off and Iyer managed to block it down

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, FOUR, straight down the ground! Another slower delivery on a full length on middle, Iyer stays put and drives it straight back, almost takes down Shaw at the other end who takes evasive action and loses balance. Can't keep a fielder there as Iyer scores his first boundary
Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, no run, fullish on middle and leg, flicked away to short mid-wicket

Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, no run, yes-no-yes-no! No harm done though. This was a length ball that was played to point by Iyer and he called for the run. Shaw sent him back and avoided another run out
Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, good stop by Shakib there. Was a full length delivery that was flicked to short mid-wicket and the save kept the batsmen down to a single
Bhuvneshwar to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, back of a length delivery on middle and leg, Iyer nudges it away to deep square leg

Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, boundary to end the over. Short one on the pads and all Shaw has to do is help it on its way. Does so and drags it past the fielder at short fine leg, finds the fence and moves on to 28* with that, was the knuckle ball and Shaw picked it up nicely

Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, 2 runs, wasn't middled, but well over the infield. Full length delivery snaking away from the batsman, Shaw goes hard at it and chips it over the infield on the off-side. Williamson sprints to his left but can't stop the batsmen from taking the second run
Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, plays that late and runs it down to third man for a single again, was a length delivery outside off
Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, back of a length on middle and leg, Prithvi Shaw tucks it away to backward square leg

Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, in the air... but safe! Fullish in length outside off, Iyer chips it in front of covers and takes a single. The fielder there dived ahead but this fell well short of him
Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, no run, length delivery angled away from the batsman outside off, Iyer knocks it in front of cover
Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, 2 runs, comes down the track to convert the length into a full one and flicks it away to wide long-on for a brace

Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, no run, this was short and kept a bit low around off, Shaw camps back and cuts it straight to the man at point. For a moment it looked as if this would knock down the off-stump
Shakib to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, flighted delivery outside off, Shreyas Iyer drives it down to long-off and gets off the mark
Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, flatter on middle and leg, Shaw tucks it to the right of long-on and gets off the strike
Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, no run, shortish outside off, punched to the man at cover by Shaw
Shakib to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, greets Shakib with a glorious shot. Tossed up delivery outside off, Shaw leans forward and times his chip over covers for six more, that's his second one of the night
Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, picks the slower one and nudges it to square leg for a run

Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, FOUR, crunched away! Short and wide outside off, Shaw throws his hands at it and crunches it through the gap at cover-point, races away to the fence in a jiffy. How good has he looked in his maiden IPL season!
Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, wide, attempts a slower delivery but it's well down the leg side, flick and a miss

Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, out Maxwell Run Out!! Can you believe it? Maxwell has been run out, what an unfortunate way to get out. Nothing's going right for Maxwell this year. Was a full length delivery around off and Shaw drove it straight back to the bowler. Sandeep in his followthrough got his hand to it and parried it on to the stumps at the bowler's end. Maxwell is well short of the crease and he has to walk back. Got to feel for the Aussie batsman! Maxwell run out (Sandeep Sharma) 2(3)

Sandeep Sharma to Prithvi Shaw, SIX, that's a beautiful shot. On a length outside off, Shaw stands tall, reaches for the widish delivery and towers it over long-on for half a dozen. No one has treated Sandeep in such a way so far in the tournament
Sandeep Sharma to Maxwell, 1 run, that was in the air for a while but in the gap too. Was a length ball and wide outside off, Maxwell goes for a drive and gets an edge towards third man for a single
Sandeep Sharma to Maxwell, no run, starts off with a shortish delivery, bangs it hard outside off and Maxwell rises in his crease to punch it to cover-point

Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, no run, brilliant opening over by Bhuvi. Only two singles off it. This was a back of a length delivery outside off as Shaw punched it straight to cover-point. This is not going to be easy for the Delhi top-order. Two quality bowlers who swing both ways, they're up against some challenge are the Daredevils
Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, no run, pitched outside off on a full length again, Shaw calmly pushes it to the man at mid-off
Bhuvneshwar to Maxwell, 1 run, Maxwell's off the mark too. It's a length delivery around off, Maxwell knocks it in front of mid-off and calls for a quick single, gets to the other end and slips a bit
Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, 1 run, another swinging delivery, late swing on that full length ball on middle and leg, Shaw flicks it to wide mid-on and scampers across

Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, no run, that was bowled on tempting length by Bhuvi. Was full and outside off, Shaw resists the temptation and leaves it alone. For a moment he thought of going for an expansive drive, I guess
Bhuvneshwar to Prithvi Shaw, no run, an inswinging delivery on a full length around off, Shaw strides forward and offers a solid defence
Krunal Pandya to Karthik, 1 run, flat-batted to long-on and they jog just because they had to. Or maybe not. MI win by 13 runs
Krunal Pandya to Karthik, no run, oh dear, that's it for KKR. Angled in on the stumps and DK has dragged it round the corner.. for a dot
Krunal Pandya to Karthik, FOUR, wide full toss and Karthik's carved it over the infield square on the off-side

Krunal Pandya to Karthik, no run, nicely bowled by Krunal Pandya. Not a six and that'll do. Karthik missed his sweep -- 93ks delivery that -- and MI have taken it upstairs.  Hit on the belly as he shaped for the big wind-up, but that looked high, and down the leg-side. Ball-tracking: suggests that the impact is down leg, so there's nothing more to it

Krunal Pandya to Narine, out Caught by Rohit!! Oh, that's it for Narine. Three consecutive boundaries from KKR and here's the wicket. KP angles this across Narine, who was always going for it. Gets a toe-end and Rohit nicely traces a few yards back at extra cover to take this. Narine c Rohit b Krunal Pandya 5(4) [4s-1]
Krunal Pandya to Narine, FOUR, gee this is going south. Krunal has done nothing to allay fears. Bowls a full toss and is hammered down the ground. 19 off 5 needed

Bumrah to Karthik, FOUR, Duminy drops it at deep square and then also lets it go for a boundary. Low full toss, Karthik got into a position early and swiveled the hack round the corner. It was right upto Duminy, who went for the reverse cup but lets it through. What's worse: it bounces once before the boundary ropes. Bad. Very bad
Bumrah to Karthik, FOUR, misses the yorker by inches and that's good enough for DK. Went back and got under it, drilling it uppishly through a very straight long-on

Bumrah to Karthik, no run, wow Bumrah, wow. Beats Karthik's pull shot with a well-directed short ball at 138ks. And he's asking back for the ball. He wants to run through this over. He's in the rhythm
Bumrah to Karthik, no run, almost 147ks and they don't go for the single. Took a thick inside edge and rushed to fine leg, the ball, but all that for nothing. DK wants the strike

Bumrah to Karthik, SIX, what about the height on this full toss? Looked like it was below the waist. This time Karthik makes hay. Slogs it over deep mid-wicket, where Milne is trying to catch that one-handed and leaping. Well over him

Bumrah to Karthik, no run, pacy low full toss at 143ks on leg-stump, and Karthik's been beaten by the sheer pace on it. Rapped on the pad, and then grimaces more in disappointment than pain. Angle was always taking it down, so no appeal from Mumbai there
Hardik Pandya to Karthik, 1 run, bowls the cutter on a back of a length, and wide, but there's a fielder much squarer this time. Fields it at deep cover-point, say

Hardik Pandya to Karthik, no run, now he's been undone by a slower delivery. About 115ks, Karthik walks across his stumps and gives it a mighty waft. And all he gets is a big toe-end rolling back to the keeper
Hardik Pandya to Karthik, FOUR, good follow-up with the slower delivery but got the length wrong. And the line. Shortish outside off, allowing Karthik to stay back and flash it square on the off-side
Hardik Pandya to Karthik, no run, full and pacy around off-stump, Karthik shuffles across a touch and all he could do was block it into the leg-side
Hardik Pandya to Narine, 1 run, gets his front leg outta way and wrists this seam-up full ball to long-on. 42 off 16
Hardik Pandya to Narine, no run, hoodwinked by the cutter. It's outside off and Narine goes for the big slog. Off the bottom-end, and it rolls behind the wicket
Bumrah to Karthik, leg byes, FOUR, given as leg byes. Goes for the slower delivery but gets the radar wrong. Slipping down leg; beats the batsman and then the keeper too. 43 needed off 3 overs!
Bumrah to Karthik, FOUR, short and wide, and pumped away with an uppish cut shot behind square on the off-side

Bumrah to A Russell, out Caught by Krunal Pandya!! That's a terrific catch from Krunal and Russell falls to a top-edged pull. Hurried by the pace, so looked in no position to play the shot. Backed away, and met the ball with weight on his front foot. Krunal swerved in the deep, anticipating the trajectory and then dived in front at deep backward square to take the catch. Good effort, running back from short fine leg. A Russell c Krunal Pandya b Bumrah 9(10) [4s-1]
Bumrah to Karthik, 1 run, fuller at nearly 143ks this time, Karthik flat-bats him to long-on for a single. 51 off 21 needed

Bumrah to A Russell, 1 run, hurried by the 142ks delivery. Angles this in on a back of a length, Russell was looking to slap it around but ends up crouching and swatting his bat across -- more in hope of not getting hit
Bumrah to Karthik, 1 run, length ball outside outside off and Karthik's hammered him.. for a single through cover-point say. Rocked back and sideways and freed his arms. Over to you, Russell
Markande to A Russell, no run, darted full and quick, Russell blocks it back

Markande to A Russell, FOUR, that wasn't too short but look at Russell pin all his weight on the back foot, and deep in the crease, and swat it disparagingly wide of long-on. That fact that he had to summon the ball from outside off tells how powerful Russ is
Markande to Karthik, 1 run, triggers leg-side and slaps this leg break through to deep extra cover

Markande to Karthik, no run, nicely done. Karthik's early trigger suggested that he was intending to make room, so Markande bowls the quicker googly that cramps him up for room, and hits him on the front thigh
Markande to A Russell, 1 run, flatter delivery worked to backward square leg
Markande to A Russell, no run, drifts in flat on leg-stump and skids on straight. Deflected off Russell's pad

McClenaghan to A Russell, 1 run, made some late room and is followed by a cramping delivery on the top of stumps. Not enough room, so Russell chops the cut to short third man and keeps strike. 60 from 30 balls
McClenaghan to A Russell, no run, slower delivery and he's totally early in this tuck round the corner. Ball rolls up his thigh and then surrenders to gravity. Drops at Russell's feet
McClenaghan to Karthik, 1 run, pushes it to cover

McClenaghan to Karthik, no run, short and down leg to the right-hander, Karthik swivels into a might heave-ho but doesn't connect. Karthik is shocked that it's not a wide. Close call there. Might just have been hovering around and over leg-stump there
McClenaghan to A Russell, 1 run, 135ks and on a back of a length, pushed to sweeper cover off the back foot
McClenaghan to Karthik, 1 run, angled across, Karthik chops the cut to backward point
Hardik Pandya to Karthik, 1 run, shunted to third man this time. Keeps strike. 64 needed off 36 balls
Hardik Pandya to A Russell, 1 run, back of a length at 137ks, Russell takes his bottom hand off and blocks to point
Hardik Pandya to Karthik, 1 run, on the front foot to drive this through covers

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Bumrah!! Mumbai have found a way past their ex. Nitish Rana, as strong as he's through square on the off-side, has a few issues against the short ball. So Hardik Pandya does exactly that. Angles this seam-up short ball across from over the wicket, has Nitish Rana fetching the pull from outside off, and has him top-edging. Taken at deep square leg by Bumrah, who drops down to take it one-handed amidst fears of a spill. Nitish Rana c Bumrah b Hardik Pandya 31(27) [4s-3 6s-1]
Hardik Pandya to Karthik, 1 run, jabby sorta drop to backward point. Beats the fielder and fetches Karthik his first run of the day, this slower delivery
Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slower ball on a back of a length. Bounces extra, and Nitish Rana rides it by making a touch of room and opening the blade to third man for a single
Markande to Nitish Rana, 1 run, bowls the leg break after two googlies. Punched to long-off off the front foot. Keeps the strike. He knows he'll need to take centerstage
Markande to Nitish Rana, no run, another googly, Nitish Rana goes back and across and punches to cover
Markande to Nitish Rana, no run, stays in the crease to this googly and prods it back

Markande to Uthappa, out Caught by Cutting!! The cameras rightly pan to Hardik Pandya, who was furious when Markande had dropped Uthappa on four. Redemption for the young leggie here. First ball to Uthappa in this new spell and he's taken him out with a leg break. Got it to spin, which meant that Uthappa, on his front foot and going for the big hit, had to slice it. Carries nice and high to long-off. Uthappa c Cutting b Markande 54(35) [4s-6 6s-3]
Markande to Nitish Rana, 1 run, flighted on leg-stump and this wrong 'un's been swept airily to deep square leg. On the bounce to the fielder in the deep
Markande to Nitish Rana, no run, gets on the front foot and opens the face of the bat to this googly. Blocked to poitn basically
Cutting to Uthappa, no run, waits on his front foot for this slower ball -- zillionth of the over -- and prods it to covers. 16 runs off the over
Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, short and into his right shoulder, and here's what Uthappa does: Swivels and pulls it through fine leg. Life's ridiculously easy at times

Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, first fifty of the season for Uthappa. He's making a day out of Markande's drop. Another short ball, Uthappa stays front-footed and heaves that over mid-wicket. Gloriously weird shot
Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, another slower delivery. Not much to guess out there for Uthappa at the moment. Stays put and flashes the late cut in front of the backward point fielder. 79 off 51 needed
Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, that's good anticipation. Knew Cutting will be slow and around off, so shuffles across on his knees and swept this through fine leg. Nicely done
Cutting to Uthappa, no run, slow on stumps and Uthappa finds backward point with this late glide. Had made room, sliced it well too, but finds the fielder
Bumrah to Uthappa, 1 run, had made early room and is greeted with a wide slower ball on a length. Checks his shot, does Uthappa, and plonks a single to long-on
Bumrah to Nitish Rana, 1 run, another slower ball that skews away off Nitish Rana's outside edge. Well controlled with soft hands and a dead bat
Bumrah to Nitish Rana, no run, slower delivery that's been angled across Nitish Rana. Dabbles and is beaten on the over the wicket. Oh these two know each other well
Bumrah to Uthappa, 1 run, no back foot in this pull, so swerves uncontrolled to long-on

Bumrah to Nitish Rana, 1 run, punched to deep cover and the throw is flat and quick. Ricochets off Nitish Rana's bat at the non-striker's and flies away.. only for Lewis to offset it with some flying of his own. Rallies across from mid-wicket and dives to collect the overthrow. Good work
Bumrah to Nitish Rana, no run, appeal for a strangle down leg. Bumrah is from over the wicket to the left-hander, beats him for pace and flicks the thigh pad -- which is also why it's not a wide
Cutting to Uthappa, no run, back of a length and just outside off, Uthappa dabs it late and straight to backward point

Cutting to Uthappa, FOUR, a gift and Uthappa will not miss out. Cutting lost his line as he attempted another slower ball, ends up drifting down the leg-side and all Uthappa had to do was to whip it into the gap - he does so, behind square on the on-side and MI continue to bleed boundaries
Cutting to Nitish Rana, 1 run, another slower off-cutter from Cutting, chopped away square on the off-side for a single

Cutting to Nitish Rana, no run, another slower ball from Cutting, this was a back of a length delivery outside off and he got some extra bounce as well. Rana went hard on the cut and mistimed it towards cover-point
Cutting to Uthappa, 1 run, short of a length and on the stumps, a short-arm jab towards deep mid-wicket for a single
Cutting to Nitish Rana, 1 run, Cutting starts with a slower short ball outside off, Rana runs it down towards third man for a single

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, FOUR, a gift and Uthappa accepts it with glee, full-toss outside off, all Uthappa had to do was to find the gap, he gets forward and drills it to the right of extra-cover, no chance for the fielder getting across from long-off
Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, no run, slower and on the stumnps, Uthappa goes back and pushes it to the right of the bowler. Nitish Rana got in his way, but Krunal tumbles and saves a run for his team

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, no run, appeal for a run-out, but I reckon Uthappa is well in. He's in by a yard, NOT OUT is the call. This was flighted slower and just outside off, Uthappa played with an open face and in front of point, took a few steps down the track as he looked for a single, sent back in time by his partner
Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, no run, pushed through flatter and wider of off, Uthappa chops it straight to the fielder at backward point
Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, 2 runs, tad shorter and on Uthappa's pads, he goes back and whips it wide of mid-wicket, back for the second run
Krunal Pandya to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slower and on off, eased down towards long-on for a single

Markande to Uthappa, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Uthappa, Markande drifts this one wider of off, Uthappa gets forward and thumps it back over the bowler's head, all the way for another maximum, 17 from the over

Markande to Uthappa, SIX, 4000 IPL runs for Uthappa, this is excellent cricket, tossed up nicely outside off, it was the wrong 'un and Uthappa spotted it early, got a big stride forward, hit it with the spin and into the crowd at wide long-on
Markande to Uthappa, no run, flatter and just outside off, Uthappa backs away and dabs it straight to short third man
Markande to Uthappa, no run, pushed through quicker, the wrong 'un from Markande, hurried onto Uthappa as he looked to nudge, gets hit high on the pads

Jofra Archer to Rahul, FOUR, fittingly a Rahul signature cover drive to finish the game. He's been fantastic tonight and has calmly ensured an easy win for KXIP. Overcooked from Archer and it's been creamed away off the front foot. Long-off had no chance of cutting it off. KXIP return to winning ways
Jofra Archer to Rahul, 2 runs, backed away early and Archer followed him with a slower ball. Worked softly through square leg and Rahul wanted two straightaway. Gets it comfortably

Jofra Archer to Rahul, SIX, stand and deliver stuff! Poetry in motion, this shot. Length ball alright but look at the way it's been put away by Rahul. Holds his shape and lifts it straight over Archer's head. Straight as an arrow and clears the ropes with ease. Just a hit away now, KXIP

Jofra Archer to Rahul, 2 runs, extra cover did well to get a hand on this with the dive but can only parry it towards long-off. A brace to start the over. Fuller ball that Rahul creamed off the front foot
Unadkat to Stoinis, no run, another slower ball around middle, nudged with soft hands onto the pitch. Another expensive over for RR. The game is all but done now
Unadkat to Rahul, 1 run, fast off cutter and induces a soft leading edge that dribbles away through cover

Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, more runs! Unadkat is being taken to the cleaners here. Came round the wicket and actually got his line right but Rahul is in such a mood that he will put even the good ones away. Makes room by backing away and steers it to find the gap. Bisects short third man and backward point with ease

Unadkat to Rahul, SIX, he is in a hurry to finish this off now, is Rahul. Probably not interested in taking this deep. Gets a freebie, slower short ball around leg, doesn't came easier than these with short fine leg in place. He swivels to get inside the line and helps it away down the leg-side with a well-timed pull

Unadkat to Rahul, 2 runs, another easy brace. These two are doing it comfortably now. Fuller ball that's driven to the right of sweeper cover this time. The throw was good at the bowler's end, Unadkat whipped off the bails quickly too but Stoinis was equally quick. Always looked not out and replays confirm it
Unadkat to Rahul, 2 runs, slower ball on a good length, Rahul waits for it and slaps it to the left of Samson at sweeper cover. Another brace

Jofra Archer to Stoinis, 2 runs, very full and attacking the stumps, whipped away into the gap at deep mid-wicket. They hare back for the second, 16 off the over! KXIP have wrested some sort of control back now in this run chase
Jofra Archer to Rahul, 1 run, quite full and outside off, jammed out towards the cover region for a single

Jofra Archer to Rahul, SIX, that's gone all the way! What a shot! That too under pressure! Mind you this shortish length ball clocked 145kph but that's also what aided Rahul here. He stays back and upper cuts it over short third man. Deep into the crowd. Just the over KXIP wanted to ease a few nerves in the dug out. What a way to get to fifty! Top knock but he knows that the job isn't done yet
Jofra Archer to Stoinis, 1 run, almost a yorker this time, doesn't get Stoinis get under it properly and it's drilled to long-off

Jofra Archer to Stoinis, FOUR, slammed away! Archer just misses his yorker and ends up dishing out a low full toss. Width on offer too and this is crashed past a diving extra cover. Sweeper cover ain't stopping this
Jofra Archer to Stoinis, 2 runs, on a good length around middle and leg, wristed away off the back foot to the right of deep square leg. They get an easy two
Stokes to Stoinis, 1 run, deceives Stoinis with a slower one, he wanted to slog this over mid-wicket but ekes out an inside edge to short fine leg
Stokes to Rahul, 1 run, slips this down leg, flicked away down the leg-side  for a single
Stokes to Rahul, 2 runs, 'two' was the call from Rahul as soon as he hit this and gets it with ease. Fullish ball around middle and leg, wristed away wide of Archer at long-on
Stokes to Rahul, 2 runs, fullish this time and outside off, Rahul opens the face on the drive to get it through backward point. Tripathi from sweeper cover gets around to mop up
Stokes to Stoinis, 1 run, back of a length around middle and leg, pulled away through backward square leg
Stokes to Rahul, 1 run, slower on a shortish length, Rahul pulls hard but straight to the man at deep square leg
Unadkat to Rahul, 1 run, full and outside off, driven off the front foot towards deep cover

Unadkat to Rahul, no run, nearly another blinder from Samson at point but he couldn't quite take it cleanly in the end. Slower ball wider outside off, Rahul sliced this hard towards the off-side and couldn't keep it down. Samson did brilliantly to dive forward and take it one-handed but replays showed that it just about bounced in front of him. Not exactly conclusive when referred upstairs but the soft signal was NOT OUT and there wasn't anything clear to overturn that one either

Unadkat to Stoinis, 1 run, direct hit would have got Stoinis! Rahane was the man at extra cover and his reaction says how much RR wanted this. Slower ball that was tapped gently into the off-side, was always a risky run and Stoinis escapes
Unadkat to Stoinis, no run, around the wicket now and angles this into Stoinis, blocked back down the pitch

Unadkat to Stoinis, FOUR, just past a flying Buttler to his right! Excellent bowling from Unadkat, totally bamboozled Stoinis with this off cutter and induced a thick edge on the drive. Buttler did all he could with a dive to his right but couldn't reach it. Raced away fine to the third man fence
Unadkat to Stoinis, no run, fast off cutter on a good length, fizzes away off the pitch and Stoinis dabs it towards point
Unadkat to Stoinis, wide, sprays this down the leg-side, a bit short as well and Stoinis tried to get a tickle on it. Doesn't succeed
Shreyas Gopal to Stoinis, 1 run, the expected flat trajectory and a bit short around middle, worked gently towards mid-wicket

Shreyas Gopal to Stoinis, SIX, connects well this time! Stoinis was getting foxed a bit and decides to transfer the pressure right back on the bowler. Tossed up once more but this was in his arc, he lofted straight through the line over the bowler's head. Into the sightscreen. Relieves the pressure a touch for KXIP
Shreyas Gopal to Stoinis, no run, beaten again! Stoinis is all at sea to the leggie here. Another slowish leg break and this time tries to flash the cut, doesn't connect
Shreyas Gopal to Stoinis, no run, beautifully bowled! Slows the leg break down considerably and Stoinis errs by playing this off the back foot. Should have been forward. Gets squared up eventually
Shreyas Gopal to Rahul, 1 run, smart from Gopal, not getting it anywhere near Rahul's arc. Drifts this well wide outside off once more, squeezed towards point
Shreyas Gopal to Rahul, no run, floats this leg break wider outside off, Rahul reaches it and checks the drive to extra cover
Gowtham to Stoinis, no run, floated up outside off, a trifle short and Stoinis defends well off the back foot

Gowtham to Axar, out Caught by D Arcy Short!! Excellent catch! We've seen a few crackers already in this match and here is another one. The pressure was telling on the aggressive Axar and with a spinner on, he decides to take a chance. Slogs this over mid-wicket but only gets height on it and not the distance. Well, actually almost cleared Short who took the catch calmly and ensured that his foot didn't touch the ropes. Smart work. RR are clawing their way back here. Axar c D Arcy Short b Gowtham 4(5)
Gowtham to Rahul, 1 run, drifting in around middle and leg, worked away down the ground towards long-on
Gowtham to Rahul, no run, full and outside off, reaches out and drives it towards the covers

Gowtham to Rahul, 2 runs, good work by Anureet, covered a lot of ground from deep backward square leg and managed to pull it back just in the nick of time. Unadkat from short fine leg was also chasing it and he recovered it. Fuller ball down leg and it was glanced nicely down the leg-side by Rahul
Gowtham to Axar, 1 run, fired full around middle and leg, drilled down the ground to long-on
Unadkat to Rahul, no run, good ball to end a top over. Off cutter that grips off the surface a bit, Rahul tries to work across the line and gets a soft leading edge onto the pitch
Unadkat to Axar, 1 run, banged in short and tucks up Axar on the pull. Drags it to deep square leg
Unadkat to Rahul, 1 run, slow cutter on a good length outside off, punched off the back foot towards long-on
Unadkat to Rahul, no run, edged and it doesn't carry to the keeper. Slower delivery at 119ks, Rahul looked to play it straight and got a thin outside edge
Unadkat to Rahul, no run, angles this across, Rahul opens side-on but finds backward point with the slice
Unadkat to Axar, 1 run, full on off-stump, pushed to mid-on for a sharp single
Anureet Singh to Axar, 1 run, gets some seam into Axar from over the wicket. Worked to backward square leg

Anureet Singh to Nair, out Bowled!! Looked like the knuckle ball. Banged in on a back of a length outside off, Nair looked to pull and chops an inside edge onto his stumps. Another pretty Karun Nair innings that cries for more deliveries at the crease. Nair b Anureet Singh 31(23) [4s-2 6s-2]
Anureet Singh to Nair, 2 runs, nurdles the ball round the corner and hurries back for second run. Stokes with the running one-handed throw but Nair makes it back in
Anureet Singh to Nair, SIX, drifts it on leg-stump and that's been handsomely picked up over long leg. Cross-seamed and skidding on, so Nair had the pace to work with
Anureet Singh to Nair, 2 runs, even slower on a lenght, chipped uppishly to long-off
Anureet Singh to Rahul, 1 run, slower delivery on off-stump, worked through mid-wicket
Shreyas Gopal to Nair, no run, flatter delivery at the stumps, Nair goes on the back foot and blocks it to the off-side

Shreyas Gopal to Nair, SIX, Nair doesn't reach the pitch of the ball but he still goes through with the shot and connects well. It was a flighted delivery at the stumps, Nair comes down the track and lofts it over cover with the turn for a six. He hit it inside-out, one of the hardest shots to execute. Ball hit the ropes on the full and umpires are confirming it
Shreyas Gopal to Rahul, 1 run, nudges it to the leg-side gently and takes a single
Shreyas Gopal to Nair, 1 run, goes on the back foot and pulls it to deep mid-wicket for a single
Shreyas Gopal to Rahul, 1 run, wanted to create room but Shreyas Gopal bowls straight and Rahul was cramped for room, he ends pushing it to the off-side
Shreyas Gopal to Nair, 1 run, turns it to mid-wicket for a single

Anureet Singh to Rahul, FOUR, that shot had class written all over it. He waited and waited for the ball to come and just opens the bat face at the last moment, timing was perfect and so was placement. Ball beats the short third man fielder for a four

Anureet Singh to Rahul, 2 runs, slower delivery at the stumps, Rahul picks it up early, gets in a good position and pulls it to deep square leg where Rahul Tripathi fumbles but he dives and makes up for it and stops the four
Anureet Singh to Rahul, no run, backfoot punch straight to cover
Anureet Singh to Nair, 1 run, pushes it to the off-side for a single
Anureet Singh to Rahul, 1 run, taps it to cover gently and takes a quick run. Rahul had to dive in the end to reach his crease
Anureet Singh to Rahul, no run, goes on the back foot and cuts it to cover
Shreyas Gopal to Rahul, 1 run, it wasn't a short delivery but Rahul belives in old school of playing everything on the back foot. He goes deep in the crease and punches it to long-off for a single
Shreyas Gopal to Nair, 1 run, comes on the front foot and drives it to long-off for a single
Shreyas Gopal to Nair, no run, much fuller and on the stumps, Nair drives it to cover
Shreyas Gopal to Rahul, 1 run, again goes back and pulls it to deep mid-wicket for a single

Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, out Bowled!! Sensational bowling from Bhuvneshwar Kumar. Just brilliant. No way anyone's hitting this ball for six. De Grandhomme anticipates the yorker, walks across premeditatedly but he still can do nothing about it. Drags it off the inside edge and leaves his stumps in a mess. Leaves RCB's season in a mess. de Grandhomme b Bhuvneshwar 33(29) [4s-1 6s-2]

Bhuvneshwar to Mandeep, leg byes, 1 run, quick, full and smashing into Mandeep's pad as he swings and misses after charging down the track. De Grandhomme has to send this final ball out of the park now

Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, 1 run, huge roar from the crowd. This is champion stuff from Bhuvneshwar. What nerves under pressure. What execution. Another brilliant yorker, de Grandhomme jams it to long-on
Bhuvneshwar to Mandeep, 1 run, walks across to try something different. Paddles the ball straight to short fine leg. They're not getting the boundary
Bhuvneshwar to Mandeep, 2 runs, doesn't quite get it on the money, but it's still a very hard to hit low full toss. Mandeep drives hard to the right of long-on, runs for his life to get two
Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, 1 run, what a ball from Bhuvneshwar. Inswinging yorker on middle and leg, de Grandhomme can only jam a single to long-on even after clearing his front leg
S Kaul to de Grandhomme, 1 run, yorker outside off, squeezed to backward point

S Kaul to Mandeep, 1 run, the inside edge saves him. An inswinging full ball on middle and leg, crashes into Mandeep's back pad as he sets up to slog. They'll take the single towards backward point. What an over from Kaul. Brilliant death bowling
S Kaul to de Grandhomme, 1 run, good from Kaul. Another delivery that's pretty full. De Grandhomme clears his front leg to carve it inside-out, but only goes as far as Williamson at extra cover

S Kaul to Mandeep, 1 run, chopped off a thick under-edge towards the keeper. They hare across for the single. Despite Saha's under-arm throw being on target, de Grandhomme is too quick. He was off the blocks early
S Kaul to Mandeep, 2 runs, short and wide, slapped hard by Mandeep. The spin on the ball almost wrong-foots Rashid who ran past the ball and then stretched his left hand out to stop it
S Kaul to de Grandhomme, 1 run, very full, tailing in towards off. De Grandhomme swipes it off the inside half to deep mid-wicket. The length prevented him from getting under it

Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, 1 run, misses the blockhole by quite a bit, offering a shin-high full toss. But de Grandhomme hammers this straight down along the ground to long-on. Just six off the over
Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, no run, back of a length delivery outside off, slices it straight to backward point. Came down looking for a single but was sent back
Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, no run, goes very very hard in trying to cut the ball again, loses his shape and is beaten
Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, FOUR, good yorker from Bhuvneshwar, but he has to watch in agony as de Grandhomme's toe-edge runs away past short third man
Bhuvneshwar to de Grandhomme, no run, back of a length delivery outside off, de Grandhomme flings his hands for a cut but misses. Sneaked under him
Bhuvneshwar to Mandeep, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, dabbed to short third man. They get across for the single

Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, no run, soft leading edge as he tries working this leg-break through the on-side, rolls back to Rashid, who takes his hat and swings it hard in frustration. Were those the gamechanging sixes?
Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, wide, googly turning down leg, wided. Now Rashid feeling it

Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, no run, has de Grandhomme been stumped? Saha looks confident. Smartly bowled wide of off again, makes him reach out for the loft and then turns it past him. But de Grandhomme manages to ground his back foot. The foot did go up for a bit, but then it came down quickly before the bails came off
Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, no run, beaten! Rashid bowls this leg-break much wider of off, forces de Grandhomme to target the off-side and then beats the edge
Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, SIX, COLIN DE GRANDHOMME! Back-to-back sixes off Rashid Khan for the New Zealand batsman. Sits on his back knee and wallops the slog-sweep over deep mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to de Grandhomme, SIX, what a blow! He takes this leg-break on and hacks it across the line over mid-wicket. Brute power from Colin de Grandhomme. Hits the cushions on the flush
Rashid Khan to Mandeep, 1 run, he tries reading the ball off the back foot, but Rashid just gives you so little time. This googly slides in rapidly and takes a thick inside edge behind square

S Kaul to Mandeep, leg byes, 1 run, he's swivelled right through with the pull before the ball even arriving. Excellent change-up again. Short of length, sticks in the pitch and deflects of Mandeep's chest towards point
S Kaul to de Grandhomme, 1 run, pretty full outside off, drilled to Williamson at extra cover. Probably will think that he missed out there
S Kaul to Mandeep, 1 run, back of a length on middle and leg, Mandeep nurdles it round the corner
S Kaul to de Grandhomme, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, no pace on it, de Grandhomme chops it off the under-edge through point
S Kaul to Mandeep, 1 run, nudges this length ball down to long-on

S Kaul to de Grandhomme, 1 run, full at the stumps, hit flat and hard towards long-on where Pandey comes forward for the catch but then takes a backward step to stop it on the bounce. Slight misjudgement? Maybe. But he did well to stop the boundary

Sandeep Sharma to Mandeep, FOUR, oh this is not good from Siddarth Kaul. A good over is spoiled as he lets the ball slip through his hands at the boundary. Back of length, Mandeep drags his pull through mid-wicket wide of the deep fielder. Should still have only been two at most. But Kaul couldn't get a hand on it while tumbling to his left
Sandeep Sharma to Mandeep, no run, the cutter stops on Mandeep, who closes his bat-face early and almost chips the leading edge back. Didn't stay in the air for long though

Sandeep Sharma to de Grandhomme, 1 run, just about gets the toe-edge to stop himself from being plumb. It was a slower ball on middle and de Grandhomme was deceived by it, went through with the flick very early
Sandeep Sharma to Mandeep, 1 run, another cutter from Sandeep, nudged down to long-on
Sandeep Sharma to de Grandhomme, 1 run, slower leg-cutter outside off, pushed through the line to long-off

Sandeep Sharma to de Grandhomme, 2 runs, back of a length delivery outside off, it's a slower ball so there's not much pace on it. But de Grandhomme has still glided it with crisp timing through backward point. Back for two
Shakib to de Grandhomme, 1 run, skidding on with the angle, de Grandhomme clips it through mid-wicket. Shakib bowls out
Shakib to de Grandhomme, no run, back of a length, slides on towards the stumps, de Grandhomme checks his drive back to Shakib
Shakib to Mandeep, 1 run, not as short as Mandeep wants it to be, results in a mistimed pull through the on-side
Shakib to de Grandhomme, 1 run, length ball outside off, reasonably flat from Shakib, de Grandhomme mistimes his drive through cover
Shakib to Mandeep, 1 run, goes back to the slider and works it to mid-on
Shakib to Mandeep, 2 runs, flighted full outside off, Mandeep steers it nicely through backward point to enable the second run. Placed it really well with an open face
Sandeep Sharma to Mandeep, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, another slower ball, Mandeep waits on it nicely before clipping it through mid-wicket
Sandeep Sharma to Mandeep, no run, slower ball on a good length, Mandeep cautiously defends to short cover
Sandeep Sharma to Mandeep, no run, short of length outside off, Mandeep drags his pull off the toe-end to the right of short mid-wicket where Pathan throws himself across to stop
Sandeep Sharma to Mandeep, no run, hangs back to a length ball and defends
Sandeep Sharma to de Grandhomme, 1 run, slower length ball, de Grandhomme flicks uppishly through square leg. Dhawan runs around and nonchalantly picks it up with one hand after on the bounce
Sandeep Sharma to de Grandhomme, no run, back of a length delivery, cuts away from off, de Grandhomme blocks from the crease
S Kaul to de Grandhomme, 1 run, clipped away through backward square

S Kaul to de Grandhomme, no run, Siddarth Kaul is appealing on a trampoline! He hops once, then again, then again, then again... But he's flattened by the umpire's lack of enthusiasm. An absolute corker of a delivery to welcome the new man, gets it tailing in and smashes him on the toes. De Grandhomme falls over. But it might have been missing leg. Wow. All happening

S Kaul to Moeen Ali, out Caught by Saha!! Given. Sunrisers bowlers roaring back into this. They could be ahead in the game now actually. Back of length delivery angled away from off, Moeen fancies a front-foot pull but all he does is get a faint under-edge through to Saha. Didn't look comfortable during his stay at all. Moeen Ali c Saha b S Kaul 10(7) [4s-2]
S Kaul to Moeen Ali, no run, brisk bumper shooting past Moeen's right ear. He did well to get inside the ball on leg-stump, but was beaten for pace while looking to pull
S Kaul to Moeen Ali, no run, back of a length on middle, blocked into the on-side

S Kaul to Moeen Ali, FOUR, two boundaries for Moeen so far, one off the outside edge and this one off the inside. Almost chopped it back onto off-stump. Back of length outside off, loosely wafts at it with cemented feet and gets lucky
Rashid Khan to Mandeep, no run, slightly slower outside off, Mandeep defends the googly into the off-side

Rashid Khan to Mandeep, no run, excellent delivery, with the ball fizzing past the outside edge. Mandeep has no clue while coming forward to defend this length ball. He plays for the googly, but it's the normal leg-break which beats him comprehensively

Rashid Khan to de Villiers, out Bowled!! He's got him this time and off goes Rashid. Oh what celebrations. It's the big wicket of AB de Villiers, who goes for the cut shot again off the googly and perishes. Tried backing away to it, but the ball kept creeping in to deny the room. Eventually, crashes into the stumps off the under-edge. This game has come alive. de Villiers b Rashid Khan 5(8)

Rashid Khan to de Villiers, no run, ahhhhh! Did that clip pad first? No, didn't hit the pad at all. But it wasn't far. This googly snaked in as de Villiers was shaping to cut. Picked it up late and then checked his shot
Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali, 1 run, flat on off, the conventional leg-break, Ali chops it through point
Rashid Khan to Moeen Ali, FOUR, flashes at this googly turning away from him and the edge zooms over slip. Dhawan barely had any time to get his hands up
Shakib to Moeen Ali, 1 run, steps out on seeing the flight and whips this away towards deep mid-wicket

Shakib to Kohli, out Caught by Y Pathan!! One-handed ripper from Yusuf! What's with IPL these days? Gayle picked up one yesterday and another big man does today. Huge wicket for SRH and Shakib has picked this up with a nothing ball to be honest. Skidded through off a good length and Kohli wanted to go across the line. Got hurried into it and ended up spooning it towards short third man where the big Pathan leapt, stretching his right hand. And it stuck folks, it stuck. Look at the joy on the SRH fielders' faces. Game on, then. Kohli c Y Pathan b Shakib 39(30) [4s-5 6s-1]
Shakib to Kohli, no run, Kohli wanted the single but backward point was quick to get to the ball. Floated up around off, nudged with soft haneds
Shakib to de Villiers, 1 run, nicely tossed up around off, driven nicely through the covers for a single
Shakib to Kohli, 1 run, flatter and around middle, nudged away through mid-wicket for a single
Shakib to de Villiers, 1 run, fractionally short and AB carves it away towards deep point for a single
Rashid Khan to Kohli, no run, full and outside off, Kohli looks to drive but picks out extra cover
Rashid Khan to de Villiers, 1 run, flatter and outside off, pushed off the back foot towards backward point for a single

Rashid Khan to de Villiers, wide, all the enthusiasm for nothing in the end and the review has been lost for SRH. This slipped down leg and AB opted for the sweep. Saha took off as soon as he collected this and that spurred Williamson to take it upstairs. Unfortunately, nothing on the UltraEdge
Rashid Khan to Kohli, 1 run, slower and on a length just outside off, patted towards the off-side for a single
Rashid Khan to Kohli, no run, fuller and around middle, worked gently back towards the bowler down the track

Rashid Khan to Kohli, FOUR, goes through KW's hands at first slip! Is this the game for SRH? Massive moment in the game. Kohli plays this leg break off the back foot and ends up edging it straight to his opposition counterpart. Williamson didn't expect it to come so quickly perhaps and it went through him to the fence
Rashid Khan to Kohli, no run, slightly shorter outside off, Kohli hangs on the back foot and punches it to cover

Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, no run, did that carry? No, just short of a diving Sandeep in his followthrough. This stopped a touch off the surface and de Villiers spooned it straight back down the pitch. Sandeep made a fine effort diving forward but couldn't reach it
Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, 1 run, slower ball onto the pads, Kohli gets across and glances it away down to fine leg
Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, 1 run, fractionally shorter in length and AB punches it through the covers for a single
Sandeep Sharma to Kohli, 1 run, walks down the pitch and works this away towards long-on for an easy single
