Sandeep Sharma to de Villiers, 1 run, angling in from a good length, nudged towards square leg and ABD is away

Sandeep Sharma to Vohra, out Bowled!! The drop doesn't cost SRH at all in the end. Atrocious stroke from Vohra though and is undone by some wily bowling from Sandeep. Slower ball and Vohra was early into the sweep by moving across the stumps. Took a piece of the bat, the pad and then disturbed the stumps. Vohra stood there in disbelief, probably wondering how he got out. I reckon he should wonder why he tried this shot. Vohra b Sandeep Sharma 8(10)
Rashid Khan to Kohli, no run, slightly shorter and spinning away from outside off, punched off the back foot towards cover
Rashid Khan to Kohli, 2 runs, drifting in around middle and leg, worked away through the gap at mid-wicket and they hare back for the second
Rashid Khan to Kohli, no run, floated up around middle and leg, Kohli made room for the slog sweep but is struck on the pads

Rashid Khan to Vohra, 1 run, Kaul spills a dolly! He had enough time to judge this but rushed into the catch and eventually, it slipped and crashed into his neck before falling to the ground. Was a quickish delivery and Vohra mistimed the pull due to the bounce. Kaul from deep backward square leg anticipated it well and got to it nicely as well, just couldn't complete the job. Vohra lucky in the end. How much will this cost SRH?
Rashid Khan to Kohli, 1 run, tossed up leg break this time, Kohli uses his quick hands to drive this down to long-off
Rashid Khan to Vohra, 1 run, floated up around middle and leg, worked away behind square on the leg-side for a run

S Kaul to Vohra, 1 run, quick single. Vohra could have been in trouble if it was a direct hit at the bowler's end. But it isn't and he survives. Fullish ball that's driven towards mid-on and he wanted the single straightaway. His skipper obliges as well
S Kaul to Kohli, 1 run, banged in short outside off, Kohli stands tall and guides it down to third man by using the pace
S Kaul to Kohli, no run, full and just around off, Kohli wanted to drive this straighter but gets it off the cue end towards mid-on
S Kaul to Vohra, 1 run, too straight in line from a good length, worked away on the leg-side for a single

S Kaul to Kohli, 1 run, on a good length just outside off, chopped towards backward point and they sneak a quick single. Direct hit but Vohra was in. Kohli is back to being the leading run scorer in IPL history, his cat-and-mouse game with Raina continues in this regard

S Kaul to Kohli, FOUR, new bowler but the strategy from Kohli continues to be the same - attack! Charges down the track early and plays his favorite pick-up stroke over mid-wicket. Rashid in the deep had a bit of ground to cover and tried hard but in vain. The RCB skipper is pumped up, that's for sure

Shakib to Kohli, 1 run, fuller this time around off, worked away towards mid-on and he'll keep strike. Expensive over for SRH, they would have wanted to keep a lid on the scoring rate in the Powerplay but RCB have come out with a clear plan to attack the new ball

Shakib to Kohli, FOUR, got it finer than he intended to but he won't mind. Flatter and closer to off, executes the late cut and it dribbles away off the outer half. Beats short third man easily and speeds to the fence

Shakib to Kohli, SIX, glorious stuff from the RCB captain! He has come out with clear intent and has decided to unsettle Shakib. Expects the floater and is down the pitch in a flash. Lofts it dead straight over the bowler and into the sightscreen
Shakib to Kohli, FOUR, mowed away over mid-wicket. Kohli has had enough of plodding around. Sees this arm ball on a good length and clobbers it over mid-wicket. Easily over the infield
Shakib to Kohli, no run, and again. Almost a replica of the previous ball. Looped up nicely and he push-drives it towards short extra cover who does enough to stop this despite not gathering cleanly
Shakib to Kohli, no run, flighted generously outside off, Kohli checks the drive towards short cover
Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, another similar open-chested reverse-hack over short third man but unfortunately, it's not enough for KXIP. Rajasthan Royals win by 15 runs
Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, now he's opened his stance completely here. Chest facing the bowler as he reverses this over short third man

Unadkat to Rahul, no run, it's a disservice if you call it a drop. That was flat-batted back hard. Very hard. Unadkat got into a position to take the catch actually (or save his face) and took a blow on his wrists, as the ball dipped last minute to disrupt plans. Looks in pain, wincing in pain. But he's back up quickly. Good to see
Unadkat to Rahul, SIX, he's ready for the cutter. Stays leg-side of the ball and pumps the free-hit delivery over covers. Highest score for him in IPL
Unadkat to Rahul, no ball, no-balled for height. Rahul shuffled across on his knee to scoop, got a ball much higher than he anticipated and somehow deflected it off the splice/handle behind square
Unadkat to Andrew Tye, 1 run, slow and low full toss, Andrew Tye wrists it to long-on

Unadkat to Stoinis, out Caught by Gowtham!! Sehwag's smiling in the dug out, perhaps because he's seen Gowtham take the catch and put the ball in his pocket. Very cool. A full toss outside off that Stoinis timed well but this is a big ground, we must remember. So there's Gowtham waiting at a square deep cover, timing his leap just perfect to reverse-cup the ball above his head. Stoinis c Gowtham b Unadkat 11(16)
Jofra Archer to Rahul, FOUR, this boundary means that 32 is required off the last over. Rahul gets into the scoop position again, and ramps this up over short fine leg

Jofra Archer to Rahul, FOUR, oh that's another stunner from Rahul. Shuffled across and timed his pick-up scoop just right. Not easy if that's almost a yorker from Jofra Archer. Perhaps an inch short but how good was Rahul, laying into it like it's a right he's earned

Jofra Archer to Rahul, FOUR, not great cricket overall, except from Jofra Archer. Bowled the slower one that spins away, Rahul looked ungainly while chipping this, because he was aiming cow corner. Just manages to clear mid-off, and there's Unadkat in the deep, sliding with the ball into the ropes..

Jofra Archer to Rahul, 2 runs, the mid-wicket/mid-on region is vacant, so Rahul digs this yorker out and collects a well-run second to that region. Jofra Archer was the one who ran across and fielded that
Jofra Archer to Stoinis, 1 run, now Jofra Archer nails the yorker right again outside off. Squeezed out to cover for JUST A SINGLE
Jofra Archer to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length cutter, Rahul gets into a position to scoop and picks up the half-sweep squarer of short fine leg

Unadkat to Stoinis, no run, what a stunning over from Unadkat. He's gone wide of the crease and angled the yorker in on sixth-seventh stump. Stoinis doesn't connect, even as he leans across and tries to

Unadkat to Rahul, 1 run, would have been a wide outside off had Rahul not played at it. But he does, with a reverse-sweep. Too wide, almost out of his reach and the toe-end only fetches him a single. KXIP need more
Unadkat to Stoinis, 1 run, another slower delivery, and Stoinis's attempt to make room comes a cropper. Flat-bats it to mid-off, where Anureet pulls off some sharp piece of fielding to stop it

Unadkat to Stoinis, 2 runs, this isn't going anywhere for Punjab. Stoinis backs away, and finds long-off with this flat-batted forehand. Was a slower delivery, so credit to Stoinis for controlling it well
Unadkat to Rahul, 1 run, was backing away, so Unadkat nicely bowls a wide full toss. Finds Rahul reaching out and toe-ending it to short third man. Lovely piece of bowling
Unadkat to Rahul, FOUR, fetches it from outside off and heaves it between mid-wicket and long-on. Shuffled just a bit from leg to off, got behind the line and let his bottom hand take over
Jofra Archer to Stoinis, no run, another yorker length delivery, another squeeze. Gee, Rajasthan have come out in skin borrowed from SRH. 57 from last 3 overs

Jofra Archer to Stoinis, no run, makes a fool out of Stoinis with this slower delivery. And smiles. Slow, very slow, and Stoinis waits and waits. And ends up waiting more than he should. He's late on a slower bouncer, which was dicely a touch higher than it'd have been
Jofra Archer to Rahul, 1 run, yorker on the stumps this time, Rahul opens the face of the bat to point. Quick single but Stoinis makes it in
Jofra Archer to Stoinis, 1 run, another. Quicker single this time but it all all similar. Stoinis's making room and interrupted by a speary yorker beaming in from over the wicket
Jofra Archer to Rahul, 1 run, 100 comes up, finally. Early room made down leg, so Jofra Archer nails the yorker and only concedes a squeezed-out single to deep mid-wicket
Jofra Archer to Stoinis, 1 run, followed down leg with a angled-in slower delivery, and Stoinis uses his hands to hack it to deep mid-wicket
Unadkat to Stoinis, 1 run, yeah he can. Slower ball on the pads and it only yields a single. Nudged to backward square leg. There's nothing more you could do with that to be honest. 61 off 4 overs
Unadkat to Stoinis, no run, waits for the slower delivery outside off and finds backward point with his delayed back-but
Unadkat to Rahul, 1 run, transfers his weight into this cut shot through backward point
Unadkat to Stoinis, 1 run, charges down .. and nothing. He's run down the track to a cutter, so has his bat's toe-end to offer. Single to short third man
Unadkat to Rahul, 1 run, cutter that's been plonked to extra cover for a single

Unadkat to Rahul, 2 runs, angled in from round the wicket, Rahul nudged it around. And you've to see Samson rushing it from deep square leg, throwing himself at the ball and getting rid of the ball with a head-first dive. Good to see
Ish Sodhi to Rahul, 1 run, drifting in slow on middle and spinning just enough. Manoeuvred to long-on off the back foot
Ish Sodhi to Stoinis, 1 run, another leg break, against which Stoinis has rocked back-and-across and punched it to long-off
Ish Sodhi to Rahul, 1 run, bowled a touch slower at 82 ks, and Rahul plays him late again. This time much finer, through cover-point say

Ish Sodhi to Rahul, 2 runs, much turn on this leg break but Rahul's nicely stayed in the crease and played a little late. Finds the gap through backward point for a couple, making some room just at the last minute. And they come back for the second!
Ish Sodhi to Rahul, no run, flatter leg break, Rahul taps it back from in front of off-stump
Ish Sodhi to Stoinis, 1 run, shortish leg break with some turn, and Stoinis adjusts with a crouched swat to backward square leg

Anureet Singh to Rahul, FOUR, leg cutter and Rahul's smashed him off the front foot. Shortish, decking away, and hammered through mid-wicket with utter disadain. Another day at work, another fifty for Rahul
Anureet Singh to Stoinis, 1 run, can't bowl so slow at such a short length. Stoinis waits and ramps it to third man with an arched back. Could have done so much more with that
Anureet Singh to Stoinis, no run, length ball at 130ks, Stoinis bocks from the crease

Anureet Singh to Axar, out Axar Run Out!! 1 run completed. Run out appeal here. Slower and wider, Axar dragged it to long-on, where the fielder ran across and fired a throw to Buttler, with the batsmen trying to go for the second. Axar wasn't sure about the second, even put his hand up but Rahul was through, and he had to oblige. That's touch and go actually, the run out. Diving Axar's bat is just about at the line when Buttler takes the bails off. Oh dear, that's a tough one for the third umpire. And it's been given out.. Small margins and it goes against the batsman this time. Axar run out (Binny/Buttler) 9(5) [4s-1]

Anureet Singh to Axar, FOUR, heaved away. That kinda slower delivery that gives away its cards early because it's been pitched on a length. Axar delays his cross-batted mow and picks a boundary through wide long-on. Uppish and safe
Anureet Singh to Axar, 2 runs, off-pace bouncer from over the wicket to the left-hander, who swivels on his front foot and pulls it down to fine leg
Gowtham to Axar, 1 run, slower and angled into Axar, who gets his front leg outta way and flicks it through mid-wicket. Kings XI Punjab need 85 runs in 42 balls
Gowtham to Rahul, 1 run, flatter on off-stump, worked off the front foot to mid-wicket
Gowtham to Rahul, no run, turning into Rahul again but the length's dragged back, so the batsman can rock back and adjust
Gowtham to Axar, 1 run, fires it from round the corner - going wide of the crease, with a slip in place - and concedes a single to long-on
Gowtham to Rahul, 1 run, darted fuller, nudged round the corner

Gowtham to Rahul, byes, FOUR, it's a Test pitch now. Or seems like it. Spins in from outside off, sneaks through Rahul's drive away from the body and misses off-stump by a whisker - in the way also beating Buttler to his left

Stokes to Manoj Tiwary, out Caught by Rahane!! Half the side back in the hut. RR are back in this!! A nothing shot from Manoj Tiwary, sits back and looks to loft-drive Stokes over cover, but he hadn't quite read the pace on this. It did stop a tad and he ended up spooning it towards cover where Jinks dives full length to grab it cleanly. Manoj Tiwary c Rahane b Stokes 7(8)
Stokes to Rahul, 1 run, short and sits up wide of Rahul's off-stump, he flashes it down to sweeper cover. Too easy
Stokes to Rahul, 2 runs, shuffles forward and flicks the full ball to the right of deep mid-wicket, lots of ground to cover for the fieldsman and they sneak the second sans any discomfort
Stokes to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, errs in line now, gets too straight and gets picked away down to fine leg for a yawning single
Stokes to Manoj Tiwary, no run, angled in from back of a length, nice extra lift off the pitch too, Tiwary punches from the crease and picks out cover
Stokes to Rahul, 1 run, cuts back in from a length and there's no room for Rahul to free his arms, hops back and tucks the ball into mid-wicket pocket
Ish Sodhi to Rahul, 1 run, keeps his head still this time around, allows the ball to do its bit and pushes it in the gap at cover
Ish Sodhi to Rahul, no run, stays back in the crease and looks to clip square, the ball fizzes in quickly and hits him on the thigh pad. Going down
Ish Sodhi to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, advances and works the ball off his pads into the leg-side

Ish Sodhi to Rahul, leg byes, 1 run, dangerous shot and he gets away with it. Looks to reverse paddle Sodhi, played that a tad too early and was done by the lack of spin. The ball brushes his forearm and lobs over Rahane at slip
Ish Sodhi to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, such a good player of spin is Manoj Tiwary. Lunges forward, reads the line and drives sweetly through extra cover
Ish Sodhi to Manoj Tiwary, 2 runs, lobs it up nicely outside off stump, Tiwary gets down on one knee and brooms it away square on the leg-side
Lomror to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, goes on the back foot, waits for the ball to turn and uses his wrist to turn the ball to deep mid-wicket for a single
Lomror to Rahul, 1 run, pushes it to point and takes an easy single
Lomror to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, flatter delivery at the stumps, Manoj Tiwary drives it to deep cover for a single
Lomror to Rahul, 1 run, straight delivery and Rahul pushes it to long-on for a single
Lomror to Rahul, 2 runs, comes on the front foot and pushes it wide of the long-off for a brace
Lomror to Rahul, FOUR, touch short, Rahul picks up the length quickly, goes deep in the crease and pulls it through deep mid-wicket for a four

Ish Sodhi to Akshdeep Nath, out Caught by Gowtham!! Ish Sodhi was bowling beautifully and this was always on the cards. It was a flighted delivery at the stumps, Akshdeep Nath went for a wild swing against the turn, he ends up mistiming it high in the air, long-off comes under it and takes it easily. Punjab are in real trouble now. Akshdeep Nath c Gowtham b Ish Sodhi 9(13) [4s-1]
Ish Sodhi to Akshdeep Nath, no run, slower and lots of spin for Sodhi. Akshdeep Nath was on the back foot and he manages to adjust well to guide it down to short third man
Ish Sodhi to Rahul, 1 run, goes back and cuts it to deep point for a single
Ish Sodhi to Rahul, no run, Rahul goes on the back foot and guides it straight to short third man. Rahul needs to show more intent here
Ish Sodhi to Rahul, no run, comes on the front foot and blocks to cover
Ish Sodhi to Rahul, no run, it was a wrong 'un and Rahul was cramped for room, almost chopped it back onto the stumps. Manages to steer it to short third man in the end
Lomror to Rahul, 1 run, flatter delivery aiming at the stumps, Rahul goes on the back foot and drives it to long-on for a single
Lomror to Akshdeep Nath, 1 run, goes outside the line and sweeps it to deep square leg for a single

Lomror to Akshdeep Nath, FOUR, excellent shot from Akshdeep Nath. This will give him some confidence. He comes down the track and at the same time makes room for himself to loft it over deep cover for a handsome boundary
Lomror to Akshdeep Nath, no run, flatter delivery at the stumps, Akshdeep Nath brings his bat down straight and blocks it back
Lomror to Akshdeep Nath, 2 runs, goes on the back foot and nudges it wide of long-on for a brace
Lomror to Rahul, 1 run, fuller length at the stumps, Rahul makes room and drives it to deep cover for a single
Ish Sodhi to Akshdeep Nath, no run, attempts a reverse sweep and misses it completely, trying his best to find runs against spin is Akshdeep Nath
Ish Sodhi to Rahul, 1 run, drives it to deep cover for a single

Ish Sodhi to Rahul, no run, absolute jaffa from Ish Sodhi. Dream ball for a leggie, it pitched on off and went past the off-stump, Rahul in such good form could do nothing with it. It was too good a delivery to find the edge
Ish Sodhi to Akshdeep Nath, 1 run, short delivery, Akshdeep Nath goes on the back foot and pulls it to deep mid-wicket for a single

Ish Sodhi to Akshdeep Nath, no run, dances down the track and fails to lay bat on the wild heave-ho. Was aiming over mid-wicket, but was defeated by the skid and spin off the pitch. He clearly isn't picking Sodhi here

Ish Sodhi to Akshdeep Nath, no run, RR have gone up for a lbw review against Nath. The pertinent point is whether it has hit the bat first or pad? No bat involved. It hit the pad first, but the ball straightened enough to miss the off pole. It was a flighted delivery, Nath was prodding forward to tap, but the ball gripped off the pitch to clip him high on the front pad

Stokes to Rahul, no run, fuller length delivery and Rahul hits it straight to cover, he wanted a single but Akshdeep Nath wasn't interested at all. And when the fielder picked up the ball Rahul was almost in the mid crease, he had given up but throw was wayward and Rahul gets away with it
Stokes to Rahul, FOUR, treat to watch! Good length delivery outside off, Rahul gets into good position and drives it sumptuously through cover, raced away all along the carpet
Stokes to Rahul, no run, slower delivery at the stumps, Rahul waits for it and pushes it to cover
Stokes to Rahul, no run, opens the face of the bat early and looks to force the drive, it smacks the outside half and rolls to mid-off
Stokes to Rahul, no run, good length delivery at the stumps, driven to mid-off
Stokes to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul latches on anything loose, he absolutely does. It was a fuller length delivery outside off, Rahul reaches for it and slams the drive over point
Unadkat to Akshdeep Nath, no run, good length delivery outside off, Akshdeep Nath stays in the crease and blocks it to point. This has been a horrific start from Punjab so far
Unadkat to Rahul, 1 run, soft hands from Rahul as he steers it to the off-side for a single
Unadkat to Rahul, no run, straight delivery at the stumps and Rahul blocks it to cover
Unadkat to Rahul, 2 runs, good length delivery at the stumps, Rahul clips it to deep square leg and takes a brace

Unadkat to Akshdeep Nath, 1 run, extra bounce for Unadkat and he finds the leading edge, Akshdeep was looking to work into the leg-side and was a tad early on the shot, the edge drops in no-man's land around the backward point region. Lucky escape for the UP lad

Unadkat to Rahul, 1 run, Unadkat finds the outside edge of Rahul but there was no slip to gallop it. It was angled across Rahul who played slightly inside the line of the ball before running the edge down to third man
Jofra Archer to Akshdeep Nath, no run, good length delivery outside off, Akshdeep Nath steers it straight to point
Jofra Archer to Rahul, 1 run, fuller length delivery, Rahul drives it to cover and takes a single

Jofra Archer to Nair, out Caught by Unadkat!! Oh dear! What are Punjab doing here, self-destruction of the highest order. It was a short ball  at the body, Nair was hurried by the extra pace as he wanted to pull it, but the ball got big on him and he ends up slicing it. Unadakat from mid-wicket goes back and takes a brilliant catch, it is never easy taking such catches, but Unadkat made it look easy. Nair c Unadkat b Jofra Archer 3(5)
Jofra Archer to Nair, no run, Nair was a touch late on the ball and ends up inside-edging it onto his thigh pad
Jofra Archer to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length delivery aiming at the body, Rahul stays in the crease and tucks it to the leg-side for a single
Jofra Archer to Nair, 1 run, opens the face of the bat and guides it to the third man for a single
Gowtham to Rahul, no run, Rahul plants his front foot forward and drives it to cover, straight to the fielder, he is finding fielders at the moment
Gowtham to Nair, 1 run, fuller length delivery and Nair pushes it to mid-off and takes a single
Gowtham to Rahul, 1 run, comes on the front foot and drives it to long-on for a single
Gowtham to Nair, 1 run, nudges it to deep square leg and takes a single

Gowtham to Ashwin, out Bowled!! Ashwin had taken a couple of brilliant decisions this season, but this was an absolute disaster. Dream of a delivery from Gowtham, his confidence was high after taking Gayle and he gives this ball ample air; the ball turned, gripped and went through the bat-pad gap of Ashwin. Ash was trying to mow across the line and it ended up looking silly. Ashwin b Gowtham 0(2)
Gowtham to Ashwin, no run, flatter delivery outside off, driven to cover

Gowtham to Gayle, wide, out Stumped!! Astute Gowtham gets the better of Gayle. Terrific plan this and equally good execution. It was fired down the leg-side, Gayle came down the track and was strangled outside the crease; Buttler behind the stumps takes off the bails quickly. Back to back failures for the universe boss against RR. Gayle st Buttler b Gowtham 1(1)
Jofra Archer to Rahul, SIX, this is a much better shot from Rahul. He backs away, makes room for himself and cuts it over point, connection was so good that it sails over the ropes

Jofra Archer to Rahul, 2 runs, this is unlike Rahul, he loses his shape on that lofted shot and ends up slicing it over cover, three fielders runs back and one of them just manages to haul the ball back in
Jofra Archer to Rahul, no run, wanted to steer it to the third man but ends up finding the point fielder. Three dot balls in a row, big shot coming up folks
Jofra Archer to Rahul, no run, another defensive shot to point, this was almost an action replay of the previous ball
Jofra Archer to Rahul, no run, good length delivery moving in to Rahul who stays in the crease and blocks it solidly to the off-side
Jofra Archer to Gayle, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, Gayle reluctantly taps it to the off-side for a single. This shot was almost an after thought from him
Gowtham to Rahul, no run, gave some flight and bowls it outside off, Rahul waited for the ball and guides it straight to short third man
Gowtham to Rahul, no run, another fuller delivery outside off and Rahul finds the cover fielder again
Gowtham to Rahul, no run, fuller length delivery outside off, Rahul drives it to cover
Gowtham to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul responds by coming down the track, he reaches the line of ball and lofts it over cover for a four

Gowtham to Rahul, no run, Rahul shuffles to the off-side and wanted to sweep, but misses and gets hit on the pads and a huge appeal from Gowtham. Umpire says no and they were thinking of taking a review but decide against it in the end. Rahul might have been outside the line. Replays in: Impact outside off stump
Gowtham to Rahul, no run, flatter delivery on off, Rahul blocks to the off-side

Andrew Tye to Unadkat, out Caught by Nair!! A wicket to cap off the innings. Fourth scalp for Tye - who's had a field day with the ball. Lands the knuckle ball on a fuller length at the stumps. Unadkat had to go for it and lifted it high. Straight into the gullet of Nair at long-on. Catching has been really good from Punjab today. Unadkat c Nair b Andrew Tye 0(1)
Andrew Tye to Lomror, 1 run, shortish outside off, muscled away to deep mid-wicket
Andrew Tye to Lomror, FOUR, oh, this will do for the Royals. Finally, Lomror gets some bat. Goes low and scoops this full ball at the stumps over short fine leg

Andrew Tye to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! RR continue to lose wickets in clusters. Two wickets in three balls now. Superb bowling from Tye. Unleashes the knuckle ball and dupes Archer, who swung high in the air. Only height. Skies it into the dark sky towards long-off. Tiwary is safe as houses. Jofra Archer c Manoj Tiwary b Andrew Tye 0(1)
Andrew Tye to Lomror, 1 run, bashed ferociously to long-on

Andrew Tye to Stokes, out Caught by Ashwin!! A wicket against run of play and Tye nets the big fish. Stokes gone. The wheels are coming off for Rajasthan Royals. Tye hurls a low full toss outside off, Stokes goes for the across-the-line swipe and loses his shape completely. Skews it off the bottom to extra cover. Skipper Ash swallows it up. Tye is chuffed to bits. Stokes c Ashwin b Andrew Tye 14(11) [4s-1]
Mohit Sharma to Lomror, no run, another play and miss. Lomror just can't seem to lay bat. Full ball angled outside off, Lomror swings and misses

Mohit Sharma to Lomror, 2 runs, Run-out check sent upstairs now. Lomror dives to make his ground but the bat is in the air. Third umpire taking his time and scrutinizing different angles. And he gives the benefit of doubt to the batsman. Heaved away to deep mid-wicket, they decide to take the second. But both batsmen nearly bumped into each other. A good throw by the fielder to the kepeer's end but Lomror makes it in with a dive
Mohit Sharma to Lomror, no run, doesn't take toll of the free-hit. He's really struggling. Full and just outside off, Lomror tries to jam it and fails

Mohit Sharma to Stokes, no ball, 1 run, oh, what happened there? Sweaty hands from Sharma and he bowls a waist-high full toss at Stokes. The batsman was charging and it took him by surprise. Stokes somehow gets bat and caresses it to long-off. No-ball called and it will be a free-hit for Lomror next ball
Mohit Sharma to Lomror, 1 run, hacked across the line, through mid-wicket
Mohit Sharma to Lomror, no run, and again. Sharma shifts his line outside off, Lomror doesn't pick the slower ball. Pokes half-heartedly and misses

Mohit Sharma to Lomror, no run, slower short ball from Sharma, on leg-stump line. Loops over Lomror's head as he fails to help it away to the leg-side afet getting inside the line. Was defeated by the extra bounce

Andrew Tye to Stokes, out Binny Run Out!! 1 run completed. Another one falls. Royals in a bit of strife here. A fuller length delivery outside off, Stokes blasted it to long-off. Karun Nair, the fielder was a little squarer and the second run was on. But after collecting it with a sliding stop, Nair released the throw in a flash accurately to the bowler. Binny was too casual and didn't bother to dive, which would've saved him. Not to be today. Binny run out (Nair/Andrew Tye) 11(7) [6s-1]
Andrew Tye to Binny, 1 run, slower short ball outside off, Binny rises on his toes and flays it with a horizontal blade to cover
Andrew Tye to Binny, 2 runs, nurdled this back of a length delivery to mid-wicket, called "Two" straightaway and gets there in the end

Andrew Tye to Binny, SIX, whoa! Binny gets into the act. Read the knuckle ball from Tye, it was full in the arc for Binny. He just extended his arms and lofted with a clean swing of the bat over long-on
Andrew Tye to Stokes, 3 runs, flashed hard from Stokes, not where he intended. Manages to clear cover-point. Three taken
Andrew Tye to Binny, 1 run, length delivery outside off, Binny opens his bat face, uses the pace of Tye and guides it to third man

Mujeeb to Stokes, no run, shout for LBW, looks close. They are contemplating about taking a review. Nah! Not interested. They aren't taking the gamble. Rifled quick and it slanted in from round the wicket, Stokes was caught playing down the wrong line. Misses it and is pinged low on the front pad. Seemed like the angle was taking it down the leg-side. Or was there some bat on it? Yes, Ultra-Edge spots a spike. Good call from Ash not to challenge the on-field call
Mujeeb to Binny, 1 run, milks a single to long-on and hands the strike to Stokes
Mujeeb to Binny, no run, short outside off, Binny steers it to point
Mujeeb to Binny, no run, flattish outside off, Binny goes back and cuts it to backward point

Mujeeb to Buttler, out Stumped!! And Buttler doesn't make use of the reprieve. His watch is ended, however has done his job. The wily mystery spinner from Afghanistan picks up his second wicket. Saw the batsman advancing, pushed it through quicker and held it short too. Buttler didn't get to the pitch and misses his attempted slog. Easy stumping for Rahul. Two set batsmen back in the hut for the Royals. Rahman tops the wicket-takers chart with this scalp. Buttler st Rahul b Mujeeb 82(58) [4s-9 6s-1]
Mujeeb to Stokes, 1 run, plants his front foot across and sweeps it along the carpet to deep backward square leg
Ashwin to Stokes, 1 run, crashed towards long-off

Ashwin to Buttler, 3 runs, in the air and Buttler gets away. Akshdeep Nath puts down a toughie. Buttler loses his shape and sends a leading edge into the night sky towards long-off. Nath sprinted forward, guess he picked it late as he saw Tiwary approaching from extra cover. Decided to go for it in the end, got both hands but shells it. Ashwin won't be happy
Ashwin to Buttler, no run, touch quicker outside off - the carrom ball. Buttler was backing away and chops it to the off-side
Ashwin to Buttler, 2 runs, drifter on leg, wristed to mid-wicket for a brace
Ashwin to Stokes, 1 run, creamed away to sweeper cover

Ashwin to Stokes, FOUR, biceps and triceps. Wrists and fists from Stokes. Gets into business by backing away to leg and hammers it over the bowler's head. So powerful! Picked the safest spot in the ground as well
Mujeeb to Stokes, 1 run, Rahman pulls his length back slightly, Stokes hangs back and swats it away to long-on
Mujeeb to Buttler, 1 run, eases a single to long-on

Mujeeb to Stokes, 1 run, nervy from Stokes. Very lucky as this darter from round the wicket, sneaked in and Stokes went for a booming drive. Inside-edges it which rolled away agonisingly past the off-stump

Mujeeb to Samson, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! Mujeeb strikes. Suckered Samson by tossing it up and the Kerala lad fell into the trap. It was in the slot for Samson, he cleared his front leg and whacked hard - the bat face turns on impact and he ends up slicing it straight to long-on. Dolly for Tiwary and Punjab break the stand. Rahman, with the golden arm. Samson c Manoj Tiwary b Mujeeb 22(18) [4s-1 6s-1]
Mujeeb to Buttler, 1 run, tempts Buttler by giving more air, he goes hard and mistimes it along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Mujeeb to Samson, 1 run, Rahman fires it full, Samson lunges into a forward push - straight down the ground
Ashwin to Samson, 1 run, leg-break now, turns slightly off the deck and Samson spots it to dead-bat it into the pitch

Ashwin to Samson, FOUR, 50-stand comes up between the duo. Overdoes the carrom ball. Short, wide and width for the taking, Samson accepts it with glee and slaps it past cover-point. No sweeper cover and it'll be a boundary
Ashwin to Buttler, 1 run, snaking in, Buttler flicks it away to deep mid-wicket
Ashwin to Samson, 1 run, keeps it on the stumps, clipped in front of square on the leg-side
Ashwin to Samson, no run, good comeback by Ashwin. This was spins away quickly outside off, Samson feels for it and is beaten by the excess turn

Ashwin to Samson, SIX, this was the shot he was looking off the last ball, gets it right on this occasion. Ashwin drops it short just outside off, Samson goes back and flat-bats it with brute power to smash it over long-on
Mujeeb to Samson, byes, 1 run, a blind heave from Samson. Doesn't spot the flighted delivery and doesn't make any contact either. Rahul messes up as he lets it through. A bye stolen
Mujeeb to Buttler, 1 run, "Finish well," said KL Rahul from Behind before this ball and Rahman keeps it tidy on the stumps. Nudged to mid-wicket
Mujeeb to Buttler, no run, now the googly. Sharp turn from outside off and cramps Buttler for room, who quells it to extra cover
Mujeeb to Buttler, 2 runs, dainty floater on leg, Buttler picks it away through mid-wicket. Plenty of gap and he comes back for the second
Mujeeb to Samson, 1 run, pushed through quicker outside off, Samson goes deep and laces it with an open bat face to backward point
Mujeeb to Buttler, 1 run, sliding in at middle and leg, Buttler eases it gently to long-on
Ashwin to Buttler, 1 run, flat and very wide of off, Buttler reaches out and carves it to point
Ashwin to Samson, 1 run, forced away to sweeper cover
Ashwin to Samson, no run, 91kph, touch quicker and Samson premeditates a lap-scoop, messes up with the execution. Moves tad too early across his stumps and wears it on the thigh pad
Ashwin to Buttler, 1 run, carrom ball again, Buttler leans into a push towards cover
Ashwin to Samson, 1 run, 85kph, similar delivery breaking away just a tad just outside off. Samson wrists it away to long-on
Ashwin to Buttler, 1 run, slips in a carrom-ball, Buttler checks his defence to long-off

Axar to Samson, 2 runs, another error in the field. This time it's Mujeeb -- who's had a fair share of fielding problems this season. Guided late from the crease to short third man, Mujeeb takes his eyes off the ball and fails to get his body behind the line. Costs his team an extra run
Axar to Buttler, 1 run, a soft poke to cover

Axar to Buttler, FOUR, very, very poor effort from Tye. Too lazy to bend down and Axar is not happy at all. Slashed wide of long-off, Tye moves across to his left, went with one-hand pretty late and ends up letting it roll away to the fence
Axar to Buttler, 2 runs, finds some gap on the leg-side, places it into the vacant mid-wicket region and gets two
Axar to Buttler, no run, another straight-to-extra cover punch from Buttler
Axar to Buttler, no run, a high-batted punch from Buttler, extra cover fielder dives and takes all the sheen off it
Mujeeb to Buttler, 1 run, short again. Buttler gets back deep, stabbing it square
Mujeeb to Buttler, no run, cutting back in with the angle, loses timing as he inside-chops it to cover
Mujeeb to Buttler, FOUR, sprays it down leg. Buttler's quick to latch on, swivelling, swiping flat and hammering it fine
Mujeeb to Buttler, 2 runs, deep back again, with a violent slice away through sweeper, making Mohit dive at the boundary
Mujeeb to Samson, 1 run, stays back late, guiding it out to short third
Mujeeb to Buttler, 1 run, deep in the crease, lets the ball do its bit and punches it to keep long-off busy
Axar to Buttler, 1 run, darted into the body, slapped down the ground
Axar to Buttler, no run, another attempted reverse. Misses, but does well to get his front pad outside the line of off in all his extravaganza. Gentle appeal, gently turned down
Axar to Buttler, no run, reverses. Well this was coming. Not quite off the middle as he finds point
Axar to Buttler, no run, grips again, and this time bites to turn away. This time Buttler tries playing for the angle, down the wrong line again. Only to get beaten
Axar to Buttler, no run, oh there's grip. Pitches outside off, straightens and Buttler ends up foxed, driving down the wrong line. Well wrong
Axar to Buttler, no run, a hint of width, Buttler uses the spin to check a defence to cover
Ashwin to Buttler, 1 run, shows the straight bat, knocking it down the ground
Ashwin to Samson, 1 run, squeezy-drive through the covers
Ashwin to Samson, no run, carrom ball. Too close to be chopping, and the lack of turn doesn't simplify things either. Missed cut, playing all around it
Ashwin to Buttler, 1 run, shuffles to take it on the pads, and tickles it to short fine. What's more - it's a fifty, stealing the opening spot
Ashwin to Samson, 1 run, leggie, Samson stays late, dabbing it square of cover
Ashwin to Buttler, 1 run, 91.1kph. Off-spin. A touch short though, allowing Buttler to go back in the crease to punch it to long-off
Stoinis to Buttler, 1 run, full, drifting into leg, stroked down the pitch
Stoinis to Samson, 1 run, too straight. Turned away through square leg. First runs
Stoinis to Buttler, 1 run, carves it away angle-batted to sweeper

Stoinis to Gowtham, out Caught by Manoj Tiwary!! The promotion experiment to force things along doesn't pay off. Gowtham has a role to slog, he clears his front leg and tries hoicking the fuller length into long-on. But the pace is just not there, sticks into the surface, spits up, miscues and finds long-on to perfection. Gowtham c Manoj Tiwary b Stoinis 8(6) [6s-1]
Stoinis to Gowtham, no run, 130kph, split-fingered length ball. Gowtham doesn't have the pace to dab it. He tries nevertheless, and has to settle for the inside-edge chopping past his stumps
Stoinis to Buttler, 1 run, 126.2kph, length, leg-lined, nudged, mid-wicket
Andrew Tye to Buttler, 1 run, shorter, nipping back into the body to deny him the room. Tapped back, down the pitch
Andrew Tye to Gowtham, 1 run, 117.9kph, gets to his trusted knuckle ball. Knocked out to mid-wicket
Andrew Tye to Buttler, 1 run, goes yorker. Dug out, down the ground

Andrew Tye to Buttler, FOUR, further dismissive. Tye overcorrects his line, goes outside off, but the length remains just as friendly. Matters taken over the covers now, leg-bent, hands flowing and creaming it one-bounced
Andrew Tye to Buttler, FOUR, overcooked on the legs. And Buttler owns him, all bottom-hand in this whippy on-drive. He knows there's no long-on, and he bisects the ones inside the ring to perfection
Andrew Tye to Buttler, no run, slower back of a length stuff. A waited punch to cover
Mohit Sharma to Gowtham, SIX, the punch. The pose. Gets the length right in his slot, loads, shows up the full face and tonks it straight down. Talk about the lack of respect
Mohit Sharma to Buttler, 1 run, another spongy bouncer. 120.9kph. Buttler hops, tennis-forehand-like. Cow corner
Mohit Sharma to Gowtham, 1 run, banged in, and as the pitch has been all day, comes up very slowly. Softly ramped away, one-bounced to third man
Mohit Sharma to Buttler, 1 run, in the blockhole. Drilled away, never mind the toe end to mid-on
Mohit Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, 134.1kph. So damn deft. A seam up outside off, and Buttler, lines himself up, opening his bat face very late, just to guide it through the cordon. The empty cordon
Mohit Sharma to Buttler, wide, way outside off. Nothing Buttler's desperate attempt to reach out and throw his bat at it can do
Mohit Sharma to Buttler, no run, tries arching back to force the cut past cover. Nah
Andrew Tye to Gowtham, no run, bumps it in again, carrying up decently as Gowtham starts with a sway away
Andrew Tye to Buttler, 1 run, on the shorter side, poked out to point

Andrew Tye to Rahane, out Caught by Akshdeep Nath!! His lack of runs continue. And the first change up of the day - the knuckle ball has an instant reward. Rahane doesn't spot, tries going airy over mid-wicket with his flick. Runs down as well as he does so, closes early, spooning up the leading edge. Only as far as extra cover. And Akshdeep has a calm auspicious start. Rahane c Akshdeep Nath b Andrew Tye 9(10) [4s-1]
Andrew Tye to Buttler, 1 run, pitched up. A checked drive to mid-off, who is right at the edge of the circle
Andrew Tye to Rahane, 1 run, 132.7kph, on a back of a length, clipped away off the hips, swiping it rather to deep mid-wicket
Andrew Tye to Rahane, no run, 136.8kph, full-paced to start. On off, on the fuller side and Rahane is a touch early into his flick, leading-edging it back
Mohit Sharma to Rahane, 1 run, gets on his toes, using the angle sliding in onto his pads to turn it round the corner
Mohit Sharma to Rahane, FOUR, third man isn't there. Rahane has a measure of it, and holds his cut back. Waits, lets it get close and chops it to pierce slip and short third, to perfection
Mohit Sharma to Rahane, no run, walks down, tries getting pace on the ball in an open-faced steer. Point's diving though, cutting it off
Mohit Sharma to Rahane, no run, 137kph, tightens up on off, pulls his length back too to tie Rahane up for room. Tucked away eventually off the inside half of his bat
Mohit Sharma to Buttler, 1 run, length, around off. Stabbed away square

Mohit Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, 134.6kph. Warms up with a rather innocuous back of a length sitter. Buttler doesn't need any further warming up though. He stays up tall, rocking back and flat-bats. Hard. Crunched through mid-wicket
Axar to Buttler, 1 run, drags his length back, angling sharply into leg. Tapped away off the back foot, long-off
Axar to Buttler, SIX, fuller, wider, worse. Buttler doesn't need to make room, there's plenty already. Crouches low and lofts an uppish slap. Over covers, again
Axar to Buttler, FOUR, gets the width, makes it look worse moving away and inside-outs it over extra cover. Ah, the delight of watching him open
Axar to Rahane, 1 run, flat-footed, but cramps out his cut behind a backward point
Axar to Buttler, 1 run, quicker on middle. Keeps his front leg outside the line to stroke it through to mid-off
Axar to Rahane, 1 run, 96kph. Doesn't bother with the flight, Rahane too doesn't bother waiting for the turn. Uses the angle to wrist it down to long-on
Stoinis to Buttler, no run, fifth-stumpish. Buttler drives through the line, but extra cover's quick to dive
Stoinis to Buttler, no run, another shuffling across walk. Behind the off-top-length to knock a defence to leg
Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR, oh the punch. Walks down, gets behind the line, on top of the good length, and straight bats, down the ground

Stoinis to Buttler, FOUR, 135.7kph. Strays. Feeds the pads, trying out the surprise inswinger after the set up with a couple of away ones, gets it wrong and Buttler is quick to whip, neatly behind square
Stoinis to Buttler, 2 runs, a walk down. Drives, and once again a fat outside edge is dug out behind point
Stoinis to Rahane, 1 run, a hint of swing. Gentle. Draws Rahane forward, draws his outside edge with the ball going away, but wide of slip to third man

Krunal Pandya to Kuldeep Yadav, out Lbw!! Kuldeep reviews a leg-before call, inadvertently extending KKR's misery by a couple of minutes. Went for a reverse-sweep and missed it by quite a bit. The ball pitched around middle and leg, straightened and would have knocked the stumps over comfortably. KKR go down to their eighth consecutive loss against MI. Kuldeep Yadav lbw b Krunal Pandya 5(15)
Markande to Prasidh, no run, flat length ball, darted wide of off, left alone
Markande to Prasidh, no run, reasonably well played. Went back to this googly, offered himself enough time off the pitch and blocked
Markande to Prasidh, no run, sharp turn on this leg-break from outside off, Prasidh tried chasing it with his hands but he was a long way off
Markande to Prasidh, no run, tosses the leg-break up, Prasidh offers the full face in defence
Markande to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run, swept down to long leg
Markande to Prasidh, 1 run, hangs back to a googly, got caught in the crease there. It snakes in and takes a thick inside edge behind square
Krunal Pandya to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, presses forward to defend, gets an inside edge onto pad

Krunal Pandya to Tom Curran, out Caught by Duminy!! Not quite to the pitch of the ball as he dances down, goes through with the loft nonetheless and lobs it off the inside half to long-on. Krunal gets on the wickets column as KKR lose their ninth. Tom Curran c Duminy b Krunal Pandya 18(17) [4s-3]

Krunal Pandya to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run, flighted ball drifted across off from round the wicket, Kuldeep aims for the covers as he flashes a drive but there's enough purchase there to foil his efforts. Skews it off a thick inside edge past leg stump
Krunal Pandya to Tom Curran, 1 run, flat on middle and leg, clipped away through square leg
Krunal Pandya to Kuldeep Yadav, 1 run, picks up the length ball and sweeps it to deep square
Krunal Pandya to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, sliding on with the arm outside off, Kuldeep wants to dab it fine but fails to connect
Markande to Tom Curran, FOUR, he's done well to make the contact he's made. Floated up very wide, Curran reaches out and belts the flat-batted drive wide of long-off
Markande to Kuldeep Yadav, leg byes, 1 run, flighted googly on leg, beats Kuldeep's swish and deflects off his pad
Markande to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, flicked to mid-wicket

Markande to Kuldeep Yadav, 2 runs, healthy deflection off the edge, can't attach much blame to Ishan Kishan. Another googly from Markande, drew Kuldeep forward and took the edge. It hits Kishan on the thigh before deflecting past slip
Markande to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, picks the googly and steers to backward point
Markande to Tom Curran, 1 run, flighted leg-break, Curran uses his feet well and flicks through mid-wicket
McClenaghan to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, another play and miss! Short of length, Kuldeep not comfortable with it at all. Moves away from the line of the ball, and then pokes in vain
McClenaghan to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, backs away to run it down to third man, but beaten on the edge again
McClenaghan to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, good length ball holding its line outside off, Kuldeep wafts and misses
McClenaghan to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, back of a length delivery outside off, stabbed to backward point
McClenaghan to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, short of length on middle, fended down
McClenaghan to Tom Curran, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, steered to third man

Cutting to Tom Curran, 1 run, pats the leg-cutter to backward point and wanders out for the single, but Kuldeep isn't interested in the slightest. Curran wasn't even in the picture had Duminy's shy been on target. He gets the single eventually

Cutting to Chawla, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Holes out in the deep. Swiped across the line of this slower ball, but got it right off the toe-end. The line was a touch wide of off, which didn't work in his favour either as he had to fetch it. Right down the throat of Suryakumar at deep mid-wicket. Chawla c Suryakumar Yadav b Cutting 11(13) [4s-1]
Cutting to Chawla, FOUR, awful delivery. Short of length ball down leg, Chawla helps it away past the keeper
Cutting to Tom Curran, 1 run, short of length delivery, pulled away off the front foot to deep mid-wicket
Cutting to Tom Curran, no run, loopy leg-cutter which dips into the blockhole and sneaks through Curran. Not far away from off-stump that
Cutting to Chawla, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off, off-pace from Cutting, chopped away through cover-point
Bumrah to Chawla, 1 run, nudged into the on-side
Bumrah to Tom Curran, 1 run, tries slotting the full ball through extra cover but Suryakumar slides and intercepts from mid-off
Bumrah to Tom Curran, no run, backed away a touch and took himself too far away from this full ball outside off. Couldn't get to it in the end
Bumrah to Chawla, 1 run, short of length at the body, Chawla swivels across to pull it down to fine leg
Bumrah to Chawla, no run, back of a length on off, defended to short cover
Bumrah to Chawla, 2 runs, length ball around off, Chawla gets his front leg out of the way as he slices it through extra-cover. Good chase from Cutting
Cutting to Tom Curran, no run, walks down the pitch way too early, Cutting cuts his fingers across the ball while digging it short. Gets it to dip under Curran's cross-batted swipe
Cutting to Tom Curran, FOUR, short of length, sits up for Curran who whacks it away through mid-wicket. Dismissive pull shot
Cutting to Tom Curran, no run, full length just outside off, Curran tries swinging through the line of it but is beaten on the outside edge
Cutting to Chawla, 1 run, short ball on off, Chawla ramps it on the bounce to Bumrah at third man
Cutting to Chawla, no run, short of length delivery in line with the stumps, fended off
Cutting to Chawla, no run, full toss outside off, mistimed to short cover
Bumrah to Tom Curran, no run, back of a length delivery at the stumps, blocked to short cover
Bumrah to Chawla, 1 run, length ball on leg, clipped away through square leg
Bumrah to Chawla, no run, short of length delivery on off, Chawla stays leg-side of it as he steers the ball to point
Bumrah to Chawla, no run, back of a length delivery on leg, blocked

Bumrah to Rinku Singh, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Very loose shot, especially with a slip in place. He's trying to steer this back of length delivery with an open face down to third man. All he does is poke it off the outside edge to Ishan Kishan. KKR going down in a heap. Rinku Singh c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 5(3) [4s-1]
Bumrah to Rinku Singh, FOUR, short of length delivery angled away outside off, Rinku Singh delightfully ramps it over slip. Lovely touch

Hardik Pandya to Tom Curran, FOUR, streaky! Once again Curran plays down the wrong line. He wanted to punch the back of a length delivery and got an inside edge, the ball flies over the stumps and goes away to the fine leg fence
Hardik Pandya to Tom Curran, no run, back of a length on off, defended
Hardik Pandya to Tom Curran, no run, back of a length around off, Curran plays and misses. Nothing but a straight delivery and Curran played down the wrong line. Everything going Hardik's way
Hardik Pandya to Rinku Singh, 1 run, slanted across the left-hander and Rinku Singh plays a dangerous steer to third man. There was a slip in place and Duminy at backward point was really close

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Cutting!! That surely should be the game. Two in two for MI. Fantastic catch from Cutting. Short delivery angled across the left-hander, Rana had to fetch the pull and all he could manage was a toe-end towards deep square leg, Cutting had to cover a lot of ground, he got there and slid across to complete the catch. He was out in similar fashion in the previous game as well. Problem area for Rana? Nitish Rana c Cutting b Hardik Pandya 21(19) [4s-2 6s-1]

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, out Karthik Run Out!! Huge moment. The ball kissed the stumps but the LEDs didn't light up then, but it did when Hardik got his fingers to it with the ball still in contact with his forefinger. So the third umpire had a few replays and gave it in favour of Hardik. Very poor running this from KKR. Second run-out of the innings. Rana tapped the slower delivery towards backward point and took a few steps out, the ever eager Karthik was more than halfway down before being sent back, Duminy was the one who threw the ball and the rest as mentioned above. Karthik put in the dive but still was well short of the crease. Karthik run out (Duminy/Hardik Pandya) 5(3) [4s-1]

Markande to Karthik, FOUR, smacked! Karthik needs to get on with the game. Tossed up on off and middle, Karthik bents his back knee and powers the sweep in front of square, splitting deep backward square and deep mid-wicket
Markande to Nitish Rana, 1 run, now goes for the fancy reverse sweep, off the glove and drops safely wide of short third man

Markande to Nitish Rana, SIX, much needed maximum for KKR. They have lost the momentum completely. Flatter delivery and Rana is quick to kneel down and deposit it over deep mid-wicket. Not off the middle but enough to clear the fielder
Markande to Karthik, 1 run, tad too full and Karthik whips it on the bounce to long-on

Markande to Karthik, no run, in the air and just short of Markande. Flighted delivery and Karthik is drawn into the drive, the ball dips in front of him and he scoops it uppishly back to the bowler. Lands just in front of Markande
Markande to Nitish Rana, 1 run, googly on the stumps, Rana sits down and sweeps to deep square leg

Hardik Pandya to A Russell, out Caught by Markande!! Is that the game? Small moments make such a big difference. Rana wanted the single off the previous ball, but Russell was not interested. Had he crossed over, then he would not have been on strike. Off-cutter outside off, Russell was backing away and expecting another short delivery, then has to reach out to play the lofted drive, doesn't get the elevation and offers a simple catch to Markande at extra cover. A Russell c Markande b Hardik Pandya 2(4)

Hardik Pandya to A Russell, no run, struck on the body! Banged in and Russell was ducking to evade, but the ball does not rise as much as he anticipated and is hit on the left shoulder, the ball dribbles away to backward square and Russell is not interested in the single
Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Rana punches it on the up wide of mid-off. The elder brother tidies up
Hardik Pandya to A Russell, 1 run, 114.6kph short of length delivery and Russell goes hard on the pull, mistimed through mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, 1 run, off-cutter with width outside off, Rana cuts it square on the off-side and Lewis does well to keep it to one
Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, no run, fuller and around off, Rana pushes it to mid-off
Markande to Nitish Rana, 1 run, fraction short and Rana is quick to rock back and pull it to deep mid-wicket
Markande to A Russell, 1 run, quicker and around off, Russell knocks it into the off-side and gets off the mark with a single

Markande to Uthappa, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Markande strikes in his first over. Uthappa scored a fifty in the reverse fixture but not today. And like the previous game, he falls to the leg-spinner. Backs away slightly to the leg-side, Markande pushed it through a bit and hence the slog sweep is not connected properly, hit it flat and straight to deep mid-wicket. Yadav did not have to move much to take that. Uthappa c Suryakumar Yadav b Markande 14(13) [6s-2]
Markande to Nitish Rana, 1 run, googly on the pads, nudged away square on the leg-side, for a single
Markande to Uthappa, 1 run, flatter and on the stumps, clipped away towards deep mid-wicket
Markande to Uthappa, no run, tossed up just outside off, Uthappa hangs back and knocks it to cover
Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, no run, off-cutter and Rana made room to carve it through the off-side, the ball does not arrive and the shot is mistimed towards cover-point
Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, no run, once more finds the same fielder. Back of a length and no room for Rana to work with, tapped to gully
Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, no run, on a length around off, Rana defends it to the man stationed at gully

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, FOUR, bisected Ishan Kishan and wide slip to perfection. The off-cutter from Pandya and Rana read it early, waited back in his crease, opened the bat face and glided it right between the two fielders
Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, no run, back of a length close to off, Rana directs it to backward point with an open bat face

Hardik Pandya to Nitish Rana, FOUR, nice way to start the over. Rana gets a leg-stump half volley and he puts it away nonchalantly, leans forward and flicks it backward of square leg, fine leg was inside the ring and the man in the deep was square

Bumrah to Uthappa, no run, now almost beats him on the inside edge. Nips back in from short of length and cramps Uthappa for room, he went for the steer to third man and got an inside edge that went past the stumps. So easily could have crashed into the stumps

Bumrah to Uthappa, no run, much better from Bumrah. That's where he needs to be. The three quarter length from the fast bowler and just outside off, Uthappa goes for a forward push and the ball holds its line to beat the outside edge. Bumrah had his hand up in excitement. He thought he had his man

Bumrah to Uthappa, SIX, wow! Uthappa has had his problems against the short ball this season, not this time though. Picked the short of length delivery early, transfers his weight onto the back foot and nails the pull over deep square leg. Went a long way back into the stands
Bumrah to Nitish Rana, 1 run, back of a length on off, Rana drops it with soft hands into the off-side, quick single taken
Bumrah to Nitish Rana, no run, good length ball on off, Rana defends with the bat and pad close together

Bumrah to Nitish Rana, no run, beats the bat first ball. The natural angle that Bumrah generates takes the ball away from Rana, who has a tentative poke at that. Beaten by a long distance on the outside edge

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, out Chris Lynn Run Out!! Yes-no and Lynn is gone. Massive wicket for Mumbai. Lynn was looking in good form and Uthappa has sold him down the river. Made room to punch the flatter delivery to cover-point, called for a single and took a couple of steps out, then said no and by that time Lynn was more than halfway down the wicket. All Suryakumar had to do was throw the ball to Krunal and he did the rest. Lynn is fuming as he walks back. Chris Lynn run out (Suryakumar Yadav/Krunal Pandya) 21(15) [4s-3 6s-1]

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, SIX, not middled but Uthappa will take it. He loves facing the spinners. Bit of air given by Krunal and that is enough for Uthappa to get underneath it, sliced the on-drive over the wide long-on fence
Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, no run, quicker and sliding on, Uthappa wrists it to mid-on, middled it and hence could not cross over for the single
Krunal Pandya to Chris Lynn, 1 run, shimmies down and Krunal smartly slows the pace, eased down to long-off
Krunal Pandya to Chris Lynn, no run, makes room and connects with the flatter delivery, can't get the punch past extra cover
Krunal Pandya to Chris Lynn, no run, drifts in and Lynn mistimes the drive back to Krunal
McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, once more offers no pace on the ball and Lynn chops the cut to the man sweeping on the off-side
McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, no run, change of pace and Lynn bunts it into the off-side with a closed bat face

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, McClenaghan has lost the plot a bit against Lynn. Goes short and at the body, no pace this time and Lynn is able to pick his spot, swivels around and places the pull backward of square. All along the ground

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, SIX, smashed! That has gone around 30 rows back. Back of a length and McClenaghan had become predictable there, Lynn lined up for that length and muscled the pull over deep square leg. That came right off the screws

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, no run, in the air and safe. Ishan Kishan slips while going for the catch. McClenaghan rushes Lynn with a short delivery, the top-edge deflects off the helmet and went straight up. Kishan started running forward, but slipped while doing so and the ball dropped in front of him. How costly will that be? Rohit is not happy with his keeper

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, no run, short of length angled across off, Lynn stands tall to slap it through the off-side, the ball climbs bit more than he anticipated and hence he checked it to cover. Landed in front of Lewis at cover
Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, no run, turning away from the batsman and Uthappa plays it late with an open bat face, directs it to short third man. Tidy start from the elder Pandya, only 2 runs off it

Krunal Pandya to Chris Lynn, 1 run, short and hint of space around off, Lynn punches it towards extra cover. Rohit runs to his left, tumbles over and makes a half stop, enough for the duo to cross over for the single
Krunal Pandya to Chris Lynn, no run, slower and on the stumps, Lynn blocks it back to Krunal
Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, 1 run, the dragged back length and Uthappa works it through mid-wicket, just a single

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, no run, turn for Krunal. And plenty of it. Shortens the length and gets it to spin across the right-hander, Uthappa camping back was looking to nudge it into the leg-side, aborts at the last second

Krunal Pandya to Uthappa, no run, stifled appeal for LBW. No discussion regarding the review. The drifter which slides on, Uthappa went down to play the sweep, misses and is rapped on the pads. The ball might have been sliding down leg?
McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, no run, back of a length around off, Lynn hangs back and defends to cover. 12 runs and a wicket. MI would take that

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, now on the other side of the ground. McClenaghan needs to stick to one plan. Short and on leg-stump, Lynn didn't go hard on the pull, just relied on placing it fine and pocketing a boundary

McClenaghan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, streaky! But Lynn won't mind it. He's off the mark with a boundary. The idea from McClenaghan is to push it across the right-hander, Lynn throws everything at the drive and the outside edge runs away fine

Boult to Williamson, FOUR, game, set and match - SRH. Williamson finishes things off in style. Slanting on middle and leg, KW gets across and whips it over square leg to take SRH into the Playoffs. No-one in the deep and it'll be a boundary
Boult to Dhawan, 1 run, hacks it away to deep square leg and the scores are level now

Boult to Dhawan, FOUR, Dhawan moves into the nineties. Short, aiming at the body. No problems for Dhawan, who gets into a strong position and pulls it witheringly through mid-wicket. No chance for the fielder in the deep
Boult to Williamson, 1 run, very full outside off, Williamson arrests his high backlift and jams it to third man
Boult to Dhawan, 1 run, full and zooming at the stumps, crashed down to long-on
Plunkett to Williamson, FOUR, Plunkett ends his spell with a four. He has taken quite a beating today. Overpitches this time, Williamson accepts the gift with glee and drills it through extra cover
Plunkett to Dhawan, 1 run, driven with authority to long-off

Plunkett to Williamson, 1 run, how isn't this called a no-ball? Clearly looked like it was above the waist. Williamson enquires the square leg umpire and is amused. Anyway, Plunkett slips in a full toss that is just about waist-high, swatted to deep mid-wicket
Plunkett to Dhawan, 1 run, full outside off, a leaning drive to long-off

Plunkett to Dhawan, 2 runs, not sure if this is the plan from Plunkett or he is not getting his rhythm right. Lasers it down leg, Dhawan spindles across and pulls it behind square on the on-side. Shaw from the deep runs across and keeps the pair down to a brace
Plunkett to Williamson, 1 run, angling on middle and leg, nurdled in front of square on the leg-side
Harshal Patel to Williamson, 1 run, heaves across the line, rolls away to deep square leg
Harshal Patel to Williamson, no run, played meekly to cover

Harshal Patel to Dhawan, 1 run, oh, Harshal fools Dhawan with this cutter that holds up on the pitch slightly. Dhawan is early into the hoick and squirts it off the cue-end down the pitch. Patel bends low and can't stop that
Harshal Patel to Dhawan, FOUR, this boundary brings the 150-run stand between the duo. Harmless length delivery outside off, no mercy whatsoever. Dhawan leans across and bashes it over extra cover
Harshal Patel to Dhawan, no run, seemed like the off-paced delivery, Dhawan again can't get his timing on the pull. Drags it off the inner half and Pant makes a good stop prancing to his right
Harshal Patel to Dhawan, no run, goes wide of the crease and hurls it full outside off, Dhawan goes with hard hands and mistimes it back to the bowler - who gets a fingertip and parries it to mid-on
Plunkett to Dhawan, 1 run, shortish outside off, poked into the off-side
Plunkett to Williamson, 1 run, nudged gently to deep mid-wicket

Plunkett to Williamson, SIX, another tripe ball on leg-stump line, it's half a dozen. Banged in short, on leg-stump. Williamson swivels and helps it over disdainfully to fine leg. The ball lands on the ad cushions, the umpires took the confirmation of the third umpire before signalling it a six

Plunkett to Williamson, 2 runs, this is the epitome of unimaginative bowling by DD. Keeps drifting it down leg, Williamson is happy to shuffle inside the line and tickle it very fine. Harshal Patel with a sliding stop but can't prevent the duo from stealing the second
Plunkett to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan triggers for a second before opening his bat face to guide this fuller length delivery outside off towards point
Plunkett to Williamson, 1 run, very full outside off, Williamson waits in his crease and quells it to point for a single
Boult to Williamson, 1 run, lowers his pace does Boult, 119kph length ball on the pads. Worked neatly to deep square leg
Boult to Dhawan, 1 run, punched on the up to sweeper cover

Boult to Williamson, 1 run, run-out chance missed. KW had almost given up. Nothing going DD's way at the moment. Squeezed to point and they take on Iyer's throw, who misses the target at the non-striker's end
Boult to Williamson, FOUR, Boult is not learning. Sprays another full ball and it ends up as a half-volley again. Drilled fluently square on the off-side
Boult to Williamson, 2 runs, lifts this half-volley over extra cover. Two taken

Boult to Williamson, FOUR, is welcomed to the crease with a boundary. Kiwi to Kiwi and Williamson greets him with a flick of his wrists to the fence and brings up his fifty as well. Superbly constructed knock from the SRH skipper, waves his bat to the dug-out. His 6th half-century of the season. It was too leg-sidish from Boult, Williamson moved across and wristed it nonchalantly through square leg. In the gap!
Maxwell to Williamson, 1 run, keeps strike with a leg-side nudge. 49 off 36 needed
Maxwell to Williamson, no run, aiyoh, that's not a wide? Certainly looked like one to my poor eyes. Outside off, and Maxwell has some beginner's luck on the night
Maxwell to Dhawan, 1 run, gets to the pitch of the ball -- too close in fact -- and lofts it on the bounce to wide long-off
Maxwell to Dhawan, 2 runs, wafted behind point, as Dhawan spots a bit of compensatory width
Maxwell to Dhawan, FOUR, there's no mercy in the world for things that're short. In cricket too. Dhawan rocks back and smashes the pull through square leg
Maxwell to Williamson, 1 run, darted on the pad and is nurdles into the leg-side. How easy are SRH making this look?

Nadeem to Dhawan, SIX, strewn full and into the pads, and Dhawan's picked his area on this. Dispatches this over mid-wicket with a bat swing that suggests many more similar hits. He's hit the purple patch again, if this innings is any omen. 58 needed off last 7
Nadeem to Williamson, 1 run, low full toss, Williamson protracts his hands and slaps that through to deep extra cover
Nadeem to Williamson, 2 runs, shortish this time, and KW is on the back foot in no time. Pulls flat through mid-wicket. Shankar fumbles in the deep and allows a comfortable second in the end
Nadeem to Williamson, 2 runs, very round-armish ball from round the wicket that's worked into the leg-side. Good two runs on the board
Nadeem to Dhawan, 1 run, worked to long-on

Nadeem to Dhawan, SIX,  hundred run stand. You have to ask Dhawan how he got under this full ball. Drifted in by Nadeem, and Dhawan's waited that extra second to nail that loft over long-on. A wristspinner from Nadeem that!

Harshal Patel to Williamson, 2 runs, some good cricket all around on this delivery. Firstly it's from Williamson, who's run down the track and then adjusted his loft to clear the umpire straight on. And then it's from Maxwell, who throws himself into a dive at long-on and stops a certain boundary. Sunrisers Hyderabad need 76 runs in 48 balls
Harshal Patel to Williamson, no run, umpire signals one for the over. Harshal Patel angles in the slow bouncer from wide of the crease, and has Williamson ducking
Harshal Patel to Dhawan, 1 run, short outside off and he's thrown his hands on the upper cut. Over point but there's protection in the deep

Harshal Patel to Dhawan, FOUR, he's read this slower ball! gosh he has. Slow and short, Dhawan stays on the front foot as he mauls this over deep mid-wicket. Raises his bat to a fifty but we are left wanting for the pat-thigh-Mo'-twirl celebration
Harshal Patel to Dhawan, no run, slow and short outside off this time, and Dhawan hasn't read him. Again. Tries to fetch the pull and swipes Delhi's air
Harshal Patel to Dhawan, no run, slow ball, Dhawan is early into his pull and doesn't connect. Body blow
Mishra to Dhawan, 1 run, uses his feet and plonks it straight down the ground for a single

Mishra to Dhawan, FOUR, now Dhawan was almost hoodwinked in the air. Mishra saw him charging down and bowled it slow down leg. But Dhawan was upto it. Would have been stumped otherwise. Gets some bat and deflects it wide of the keeper
Mishra to Williamson, 1 run, stays leg-side and drives this fullish delivery wide of long-off
Mishra to Williamson, SIX, that slow-and-wide plan to KW from Mishra was better. Drifts this in and is slog-swept by KW over mid-wicket
Mishra to Dhawan, 1 run, prods his bat to the googly and gets a low outside edge to point
Mishra to Williamson, 1 run, ugly slog from KW here. Very slow from Mishra, Williamson crouches and slogs it across over square leg

Plunkett to Williamson, 1 run, KW had to wait on it. Plunkett bowls this slow again -- yawn -- but it's on a length, so Williamson jumps around and works that to deep mid-wicket. 91/1 at the halfway mark, 97 more needed
Plunkett to Dhawan, 1 run, pitches outside off and comes slow onto Dhawan, this slower delivery. Worked to short fine leg

Plunkett to Williamson, 1 run, slow and short, and Williamson pulls that through the leg-side. He's read every slower ball this over. And didn't read the only 135ks that Plunkett's bowled this over. That's how it goes sometimes

Plunkett to Williamson, no run, a leading edge but Williamson's safe. Is wound up in trying to play this on leg-stump, gets the edge and gets away. Falls well in front of the mid-off fielder, who's a bit deep

Plunkett to Williamson, FOUR, "that's terrible, I am sorry," says Bishop on air. Another full slower delivery from Plunkett. He's not giving up on the plan. And Williamson, not for the first time this over, creams the drive past the diving mid-off fielder
Plunkett to Williamson, FOUR, he's gawked at Plunkett's release and read the slower delivery. Full too, so he's knelt and drilled that drive through extra cover
Mishra to Dhawan, FOUR, ala laser beam. Ues his feet and drills that straight down the ground

Mishra to Williamson, 1 run, Mishra is bowling well to Williamson here. Sees that the feet aren't moving much, so he's bowling the leg breaks slow and wide. Another one that has caught behind at reaching out - so off the toe-end over wide mid-off. Lands in the safe region
Mishra to Dhawan, 1 run, slow and dipping, and almost triggering Dhawan into an embarrassing loss of balance. Nudged in the end to short fine leg
Mishra to Williamson, 1 run, sits low and drags the sweep to backward square leg

Mishra to Williamson, no run, he's standing on leg-stump and trying to loft it over covers. Only fair Mishra's leg break beats him with some sharp spin. Keeper takes the bails off but Williamson's back foot didn't move at all
Mishra to Dhawan, 1 run, into the position to sweep early and hedge-hops this sweep over square leg. There's a fielder in the deep, so just a single
Vijay Shankar to Dhawan, 1 run, length ball dropped outside off -- might have been slow too -- and Dhawan times that with a waft through covers
Vijay Shankar to Williamson, 1 run, slower delivery nudged to mid-wicket for a sharp single

Vijay Shankar to Dhawan, 1 run, this was nicely bowled actually. Saw Dhawan stepping outta his crease and bowled it slow at 120ks outside off. Inside-edged wide of off-stump, as Dhawan tries to reach out
Vijay Shankar to Dhawan, wide, umm, that's a desperate try to evade the run punishment. Attempted slower delivery wide of off-stump and he's overcooked it. By some distance
Vijay Shankar to Dhawan, SIX, and this one's across the line. Shankar's angling it in, and that helps Dhawan's shot there. Swivels with the angle and plonks it all the way over deep square leg
Vijay Shankar to Dhawan, FOUR, over mid-off. And by a long way. Goes through the line and lofts it disdainfully there
Vijay Shankar to Dhawan, no run, angles in the back of a length from wide of the crease. Cracked to point
Mishra to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan keeps strike to wide long-on here
Mishra to Dhawan, no run, sharp from Mishra. Collects this drill-down from Dhawan, who had used his feet, and swivels around to threaten the stumps at the bowler's end. Doesn't throw; just scares
Mishra to Williamson, 1 run, lunges in front and works it to long-on

Mishra to Williamson, FOUR, slowish leg break and that's a feeder to Williamson's glory. Opens the punch and splits it between backward point and short third man. Mishra isn't happy but pretty sure he wouldn't have been able to field it either. Pretty sure.
Mishra to Williamson, no run, too full to sweep and Mishra thinks he has Williamson plumb. Think it was clearly going down leg there

Mishra to Dhawan, 1 run, from over the wicket is Mishra. Bowls it full and is nudged to mid-wicket. Someone's singing there, trying to gather attention and thus the throw. Has to be Pant.. for more reasons than one
Boult to Williamson, no run, slow full toss which is an attempted cutter. Patted to cover and it's straight to a fielder, so no run off it. 51/1 after the powerplay
Boult to Dhawan, 1 run, slow and outside off, and they pick a stuttered single off Dhawan's open bat face
Boult to Williamson, 1 run, stays leg-side of the ball and packs a punch through the point region. A run rate of 8.82 as SRH get a fifty on the board
Boult to Dhawan, 1 run, sneaks a single to mid-wicket

Boult to Dhawan, SIX, gee, this cutter gets a treatment even worse. Drags it from outside off too -- meaning imagine the biceps he's built -- and then carts it over cow corner with a little bit of a crouch. Ungainly looking but effective
Boult to Dhawan, FOUR, length ball and a front-footed Dhawan mows it over mid-on. No shame in conceding a boundary to that

Plunkett to Williamson, FOUR, Harshal at square third man can't get to it. Played much finer by Williamson this time, opening the bat face and slicing it just wide of the keeper. No pace lost here. Plunkett bowling them at over 140 clicks and Williamson ensuring that they run to the fence as quick. Conservation of pace
Plunkett to Dhawan, 1 run, into the pads, and Dhawan's nicely nudged it round the corner

Plunkett to Williamson, 1 run, bit late on this short ball - another delivery over 140ks. Drags it to Shankar at mid-wicket, who's quick at the ball. Hurries Williamson as he charges into the bowling crease. All safe

Plunkett to Williamson, 2 runs, Harshal runs across and dives neat third man to stop this. Nicely played by KW actually. Quick at 140ks from Plunkett, and Williamson uses the pace, opening the bat face and gliding it away very late
Plunkett to Williamson, no run, full at 134ks outside off, Williamson blocks it to cover
Plunkett to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, wanted to step out and mow this over cow corner but it's a slower delivery first ball from Plunkett. Off the pad to fine leg

Harshal Patel to Williamson, 2 runs, beaten in the air, was Williamson. Stepped out of his crease and realized that he's been hoaxed y the change of pace. Around 120ks, that ball, that takes Williamson's inside edge and flies round the corner
Harshal Patel to Williamson, no run, goes with pace against KW and angles it in fuller too. Played straight to mid-wicket
Harshal Patel to Dhawan, 1 run, another waft but only for a single to deep backward point. Fuller from Harshal Patel

Harshal Patel to Dhawan, FOUR, Harshal Patel has bowled exactly like he didn't need to. Got it right first ball but not this time. Pacy ball wide of off, and Dhawan's scorched it away through point. Free swing of the arms and poof, the ball disappears
Harshal Patel to Williamson, 1 run, now a cutter on a length to KW, who delayed his tuck round the corner and kept control of his shot

Harshal Patel to Dhawan, 1 run, 142ks from Patel. Nicely bowled too, going wide of the crease and taking away all of Dhawan's room outside off. Nudged away for a single, and honestly that was the most Dhawan could do with it
Nadeem to Dhawan, 1 run, low full toss patted to long-on
Nadeem to Williamson, 1 run, waits a touch longer and opens the bat face to beat the man at backward point. Single on offer, hence
Nadeem to Williamson, no run, opens the drive and finds point off this full-wide ball

Nadeem to Dhawan, 1 run, we don't need more run outs. But Pant was vocal. He needs the thunder away from him. Dhawan uses his feet, gets too close to the ball and squeezes it out to mid-off. A bit hurried but makes it to the danger end
Nadeem to Williamson, 1 run, lunges forward and workes this through to deep mid-wicket
Nadeem to Williamson, no run, yeah, that's what he'll do. No spin on this one, and a cramped KW keeps it off with the inside half of his bat

Harshal Patel to Williamson, 1 run, Williamson will keep dabbing these slower deliveries to short third man and keep rotating strike until the earth stops rotating. We do need a cosmic persepective at times when our consciousness has surrendered to Pant's brilliance. Okay, enough

Harshal Patel to Hales, out Lbw!! You can see why Harshal Patel is pumped here. Was taken to the cleaners with two back-to-back fours and now comes up with a very full cutter, that skids on and raps Hales low on the pad. That was as out as the appeal suggested. Hales was as much beaten by the fullish length as he was by the slowness of the delivery. P-L-U-M-B. Hales lbw b Harshal Patel 14(10) [4s-3]

Harshal Patel to Hales, FOUR, that's no way soft. No way near to soft. Back of a length again and this time Harshal Patel angles it in. Umm, only for Hales to swivel and pull that round the corner. Used that incoming angle to his advantage, does Hales
Harshal Patel to Hales, FOUR, back of a length but there's enough room outside off. Hales makes some of his own and punches it behind point. Softly done
Harshal Patel to Hales, no run, angled this at 124ks from wide of the crease. Hales offers a dead bat
Harshal Patel to Dhawan, 1 run, starts with a slow length ball that's been nicely run down to point by Dhawan. Knows Hales is in greater form with the bat, and wants him to have more strike

Boult to Hales, no run, full searching for the swing.. and there's none. Driven, and driven straight to mid-off in place. Just 6 runs coming off the opening over that could have been so much more - for the batsman and for the bowler
Boult to Hales, FOUR, back of a length ball and that's been swatted away. Rocks back, opens his stance and swivels a boundary through mid-wicket
Boult to Hales, 2 runs, inswinger but the slow Kotla deck allows Hales to work it off the bat's inside-half through mid-wicket
Boult to Hales, no run, finally gets it as full as he'd have liked. No swing yet again. Cruchy drive straight to the fielder at cover
