Boult to Hales, no run, gets the ball decking back from a back of a length, and skids it off the deck to hit Hales's thigh. He was trying to muscle it round the corner. Doesn't connect, obviously
Boult to Hales, no run, angled across on a length by Boult, and Hales slaps it to cover-point in place. Not much swing
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, SIX, 26 runs off the final over as Pant ends on a scintillating 128*! Walks back to a standing ovation as he muscles the full toss over mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, SIX, that's a one-handed six! Short of a length around off, Pant goes hard at it, in the process one hand comes off but he somehow manages to clear the long-on fence

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, SIX, don't think Bhuvi has been treated in such a way this season by anyone. He's under the pump! Bowls a short one around off, Pant transfers his weight on to the back foot and pulls it for a clean six over fine leg
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, FOUR, how easy? Similar to the previous shot. An exact replica. A fullish one around off, Pant is quick to get into position and scoop it over short third man once again

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, FOUR, have run out of adjectives to describe this masterclass by Pant. Was a full length delivery around off, Pant gets into position early and scoops it over short third man with an angled bat

Bhuvneshwar to Maxwell, out Caught by Hales!! Maxwell looks to go big but misses. Was a back of a length delivery around off, Maxwell went at it with hard hands, swung at it only to get a top edge to wide long-off. Hales is the man who settles underneath and takes it. More importantly Pant is back on strike. Maxwell c Hales b Bhuvneshwar 9(8) [4s-1]
S Kaul to Maxwell, 1 run, a full toss to end the over. This was well outside off and Maxwell drove it away to sweeper cover
S Kaul to Maxwell, FOUR, first one of the night for Maxwell. Another full toss around off, Maxwell stays put and smacks it right past the bowler, intercepts long-off and long-on to perfection
S Kaul to Pant, 1 run, moves over to the other end with a single, down to long-off
S Kaul to Pant, no run, full and quick outside off, Pant moves across and tries to squeeze it but fails to connect

S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, that's Pant's maiden century in the IPL. Has missed out on a few occasions previously but doesn't miss out tonight. Gets a full toss around off and makes sure to muscle it over mid-wicket with all his might. Gets to the milestone and celebrates in style. Maxwell gives him a tight hug!
S Kaul to Pant, no run, full and wide outside off, Pant creams his expansive drive, can't beat extra-cover though
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, 1 run, retains strike with a pull to deep square against a short one. Reckon this is the most expensive over by Bhuvi this season, 18 runs off it

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, FOUR, amazing shot that. Was a length ball outside off, Pant does well to ramp this over short third man. The ball is just flying all over the place, to all the corners. Awestruck by this display of batsmanship!
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, no run, gets it right finally. Goes for the wide yorker and manages to beat the set batsman this time around

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, 2 runs, Bhuvi feeling the heat tonight. Not quite at his best. Misses out on the length again and bowls a wide full toss, driven to sweeper cover where a good effort keeps the batsmen down to two
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, FOUR, on to 90* is Pant. On a length outside off, Pant throws his hands at it and smacks it over the cover fence, on a few bounces and into the fence
Bhuvneshwar to Pant, wide, fired in but well outside off, Pant tries to reach it with a squeeze but it's too far

Bhuvneshwar to Pant, SIX, even he gets punished. Tries to bowl a yorker but ends up bowling a half-volley. Pant doesn't miss out and deposits it over mid-wicket. Way into the stands as Pant moves on to 86*

Rashid Khan to Maxwell, no run, the wrong' un to end the over. Maxwell was real to pick the googly there. Tries to flick that away but gets rapped on the pads. Was ther quicker one too. End of the spell for Rashid who has conceded 35 runs tonight.
Rashid Khan to Maxwell, no run, full and spinning away sharply around the middle-stump channel, Maxwell gets a leading edge on his flick
Rashid Khan to Maxwell, 2 runs, Maxwell doing it in single and doubles. Eases the full delivery to wide long-on and calls for two, gets it too
Rashid Khan to Pant, 1 run, full and quick on middle and leg, flicked to deep square leg
Rashid Khan to Pant, SIX, Rashid Khan taken to cleaners. He has the Orange Cap now. A floated delivery around off, Pant goes after it with all might and clears the long-off fence
Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, he has all range of strokes in his kitty. Brings in the reverse sweep into play and gets it over the point fence on a couple of bounces

S Kaul to Pant, 1 run, pretty decent comeback by the bowler. Two dots and a single to end the over after that nasty six by Pant on the first ball. This was full, quick around off, Pant went after it with a mighty heave only to get an inside edge to square leg
S Kaul to Pant, no run, similar to the previous one, a wide yorker outside off, Pant is late in getting his bat down in time, gets beaten yet again
S Kaul to Pant, no run, a yorker delivery outside off, Pant tries to squeeze it but gets undone due to the pace on that
S Kaul to Maxwell, 1 run, length delivery on middle, Maxwell tamely nudges it down to long-on
S Kaul to Pant, 1 run, stands tall and flat bats the short one down to long-off, on a bounce to Sandeep guarding the boundary

S Kaul to Pant, SIX, Kaul keeps on getting thrashed, like he has throughout this innings. Dishes in a full length delivery on middle, Pant waits for it and pummels it over for long-on, high and handsome. The crowd absolutely loved it, they are up on their feet
Shakib to Pant, 1 run, a full toss, a quicker one too, drilled down to long-on by Pant for a run
Shakib to Pant, no run, a straighter delivery on leg, beats Pant's sweep and strikes him on the pads. Shakib went for an lbw appeal but this was clearly going down leg
Shakib to Pant, FOUR, another impressive hit by Pant. Comes down the wicket, converts the length into a full one and hammers it past Shakib. That raced away to the fence in no time
Shakib to Maxwell, 1 run, Maxwell is off the mark with a single to extra cover
Shakib to Pant, 1 run, worked away to backward square leg for a run
Shakib to Pant, SIX, smoked it! Tossed up delivery around off, Pant has smacked this one over the mid-wicket fence for half a dozen to reach his fifty.

Rashid Khan to Pant, out Harshal Patel Run Out!! 1 run completed. What is Pant doing? That's the second run-out he's involved in tonight. Flicks the flatter delivery to short mid-wicket and gets the single. Calls for the second too but as the throw comes in at the striker's end he sends Harshal back. Goswami fumbles on the first attempt - doesn't gather the ball cleanly - but reacts quickly and gets the direct hit right on the second one with an underhanded flick onto the stumps. Harshal Patel run out (Shikhar Dhawan/Goswami) 24(17) [6s-2]
Rashid Khan to Pant, no run, the googly, turns away sharply to beat Pant's tentative poke
Rashid Khan to Harshal Patel, 1 run, decides to take a single with a gentle knock down to long-on

Rashid Khan to Harshal Patel, no run, another quicker delivery, a straight one outside off that leaves Harshal clueless. Plays inside the line and gets beaten all ends up. Might have easily edged that
Rashid Khan to Pant, leg byes, 1 run, quicker delivery around off, Pant gets down to sweep but the ball flicks his thigh pad and rolls to short third man
Rashid Khan to Harshal Patel, 1 run, full and quick around off, Harshal chips it down to wide long-off for a run. Was in the air for a while but fell short of the man in the deep
Sandeep Sharma to Harshal Patel, 1 run, dropped short around off, Patel whips it down to long-on, takes a single and retains strike

Sandeep Sharma to Pant, 1 run, 50-run stand up for the fourth wicket. How pivotal has this knock by the youngster been. Short of a length outside off and Pant does well to slap it to cover, a slight misfield too but the batsmen are satisfied with the single
Sandeep Sharma to Pant, FOUR, easy pickings for the batsman. On the pads and can't get any easier for Pant who glances it past short fine. Needs one boundary more to reach his fifty
Sandeep Sharma to Harshal Patel, 1 run, length delivery outside off, cut towards cover-point this time

Sandeep Sharma to Harshal Patel, SIX, now you know why he has been promoted up the order. Picks the length early on this short one and slaughters it over the long-on for an impressive six. Was middled to perfection as it went deep into the stands. Held the pose for the cameras too
Sandeep Sharma to Harshal Patel, no run, short of a length around off, nipping into the batsman, Harshal tries to punch, but fails to middle that and gets it off his inside edge

Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, that's the third boundary of the over. Pant is showing no mercy against Rashid. Another short delivery down the leg side, Pant does well to drag it down to the long-leg fence. 15 runs of that over and Pant moves into the 40s
Rashid Khan to Harshal Patel, 1 run, whipped to mid-wicket by Harshal for a single again, was darted around middle and leg
Rashid Khan to Pant, 1 run, eases the floater to sweeper cover and changes strike

Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, successive boundaries for Pant. This was full on middle and leg, Pant gets down and goes for a sweep, gets a glove to it and manages to evade short fine leg this time around

Rashid Khan to Pant, FOUR, Pant is playing a gem here. Delhi need him to play a few of these. Flat and quick around off, Pant premeditates and reverse sweeps it through short third man. Was a well played shot by the southpaw
Rashid Khan to Harshal Patel, 1 run, full and quick around off, Harshal pushes it to the off-side with soft hands and gets a run

S Kaul to Harshal Patel, 1 run, a yorker to end the over. This was speared in around leg, a bit of reverse swing too. Harshal does well to flick it away to mid-wicket with a squeeze and complete a single. Wanted the second two but was sent back by Pant. Don't need another run-out, do they?
S Kaul to Pant, 1 run, seaming into the batsman, back of a length around off, Pant knocks it in front of cover-point and gets across

S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, another poor delivery. He's struggling with his lines and lengths tonight. Bowls a short one again but on the pads, easy for the batsman to help it on its way to the square leg fence with an easy whip. No fielder anywhere close to cut this down
S Kaul to Harshal Patel, 1 run, pitched up on middle and leg, Harshal bunts it down to long-on for a single

S Kaul to Harshal Patel, SIX, not quite his day, it seems. Conceded 15 runs in the first over, concedes a big one early in this one. Was a shortish delivery around off, Harshal was quick to camp back and deposit it over mid-wicket for a flat six
S Kaul to Pant, 1 run, change of pace on that delivery, bowls a slower full one outside off, Pant plays it with soft hands and bunts it in front of point, scurries across to the other end
Rashid Khan to Harshal Patel, no run, lovely leg break! Flighted up well and spins away sharply to beat Harshal's drive. Goswami cannot gather it cleanly and it bobbles to short third man
Rashid Khan to Pant, 1 run, floaty leg break and it's a trifle too full, swept away through backward square leg for a single
Rashid Khan to Harshal Patel, 1 run, googlies on the menu from Rashid to start with, worked off the back foot down to long-on
Rashid Khan to Pant, 1 run, tries the half-sweep does Pant and nearly loses balance in the process. Connected well though and gets it to deep backward square leg
Rashid Khan to Pant, no run, beaten! The famous Rashid Khan googly and Pant hasn't read it at all. Pushes at it tentatively and is beaten comprehensively
Rashid Khan to Harshal Patel, 1 run, tossed up fuller around middle and leg, wristed away towards long-on for a single
Shakib to Pant, no run, full and outside off, gets on the front foot does Rishabh and tas it to the leg-side

Shakib to Harshal Patel, 1 run, gets a big inside edge on this attempted heave. Harshal was down the track for the big shot but this isn't the pitch to be a hero straightaway, not for a lower order batsman anyway
Shakib to Pant, 1 run, pushed through quicker outside off, whipped away through mid-wicket for a single
Shakib to Pant, no run, flatter and around off, defended well from the crease with a straight bat

Shakib to Harshal Patel, 1 run, nearly another disaster! Pant was ball watching, just like in the Iyer run out and is lucky here. Fuller and outside off, driven through the covers and there was a lot confusion in the running as Patel wanted the single but found no response. Eventually, it sneaked through the infield and that saved DD
Shakib to Pant, 1 run, flatter and around middle, spinning in and Pant works with the turn through mid-wicket
Sandeep Sharma to Pant, 1 run, the slower balls continue to deceive Pant, dragged off the inner half through mid-wicket
Sandeep Sharma to Pant, no run, back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot towards cover

Sandeep Sharma to Pant, out Shreyas Iyer Run Out!! Disaster for DD! For the second time in the tournament, Pant has ran Shreyas Iyer out due to some terrible running between the wickets. Waste of a wicket really and now, the Daredevils are in serious trouble. Another cutter and Pant got a thick inside edge onto the pad as the ball rolled to the left of an alert Goswami. Shreyas Iyer wanted the run and by the time it was denied, he was almost near a shakehand distance from Pant. Too late to go back and Goswami's throw is on the money to Sandeep who does the rest. Out by a countrymile. Shreyas Iyer run out (Goswami/Sandeep Sharma) 3(8)
Sandeep Sharma to Pant, no run, another slow cutter and Pant isn't comfortable at the moment due to the lack of pace. Waits to adjust but still ends up getting an inside edge onto the pads
Sandeep Sharma to Pant, no run, beautiful bowling! The change of pace does Pant in completely as he is early into the dab and gets a nick as well but dies down before Goswami
Sandeep Sharma to Pant, no run, tries to force this away but finds mid-wicket. Was a bit aerial as well. On a good length and sticks onto the surface as Pant attempted the cross-batted heave
Shakib to Pant, 1 run, slower and spinning into the left-hander, Pant is happy to milk them around for now. Nudges this through backward square leg
Shakib to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, speared in around middle and leg, flicked away through square leg for a single
Shakib to Shreyas Iyer, no run, another LBW shout from Shakib but Iyer was well down the track. Tried to work it away, instead got pinged on the pads
Shakib to Pant, 1 run, flatter and turning in from a shorter length, Pant goes squarer with his flick stroke and they get a single
Shakib to Shreyas Iyer, 1 run, the slider this time around off, Iyer nudges it with soft hands towards mid-wicket and they eke out a quick run
Shakib to Pant, 1 run, the hat-trick ball is kept out with ease. Spins in a bit from a good length, Pant camps back and whips it to deep mid-wicket
S Kaul to Pant, 1 run, on a length outside off stump, Pant stands tall and dabs this towards point for a single. Expensive first over for Kaul to end the Powerplay

S Kaul to Pant, 2 runs, just over the infield! Pant is taking his chances and for now, is getting lucky. Slower and wider outside off, he wanted to biff this away but only managed a slice that flew over extra cover. Mid-off trekked back in an attempt to catch the skier but wasn't going to reach there
S Kaul to Pant, no run, pacy good length ball outside off, hits the bat hard as Pant defends towards cover-point

S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, flashy runs this time but another boundary! Three in a row for Pant who isn't going to die wondering. Round the wicket from Kaul and angles this into the left-hander, it's a drive with hard hands and the edge flies past the diving Goswami to the fence

S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, does it again!' Squarer this time, result is the same. Short again from Kaul and more width on offer, he stands tall to force it away through backward point. Finds the gap once more. Pant is intent on taking it on
S Kaul to Pant, FOUR, that's a typical Pant stroke! Back of a length and a bit of width on offer. He throws his hands to slam it on the up and finds the gap at cover as well. Raced away in a flash
Sandeep Sharma to Shreyas Iyer, no run, accurate stuff from Sandeep, good length around off stump and Iyer gets behind the line nicely to defend

Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, 2 runs, off the toe-end towards extra cover. Oh horrible from Watson. He's had a needless shy and given away the overthrow as Buttler raises his bat and does a victory lap in the second run. The Royals charge out to the centre in delight. Buttler's kept them afloat in the tournament

Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, SIX, the Rajasthan dugout erupts. Back of length slower ball, not easy to hit, but Buttler hacks it with stunning power over mid-wicket. Wow what a shot. This should be the blow which seals it

Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, 2 runs, skied up off the toe-end, but what's happened here? Bravo is on his knees. Mid-wicket was vacant, so the only one who could've taken it was the bowler. But Bravo slipped as he veered from his followthrough
Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, 2 runs, this is closer to the stumps but it skids on and foils Buttler's timing as he swings through mid-wicket. Skewed off the inside half wide of the fielder in the deep

Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, no run, deceives him with a wide slower ball. Some seriously good execution under pressure. Knows Buttler will be swinging to leg, so he takes it away from his arc while taking the pace off and beats him

Willey to Gowtham, out Caught by Dhoni!! Back of length outside off, width on offer, Gowtham slashes at it but only gets an edge through to Dhoni. Precious little cameo though. It's got the equation down to 12 off the final over. Gowtham c Dhoni b Willey 13(4) [6s-2]

Willey to Gowtham, SIX, this is remarkable from Gowtham. He's come out and nailed two balls out of the three he's faced. Willey misses his mark with the yorker, offers it in the slot and Gowtham tonks it over long-off's head
Willey to Buttler, 1 run, Buttler's tiring. Length ball angled in on leg, an off-cutter, he loses his shape as he swings across the line. It takes an inside edge onto pad
Willey to Gowtham, 1 run, back of a length delivery just outside off, dabbed wide of short third man where Bhajji slides in a way so as to put his who body behind it. Not letting that through
Willey to Gowtham, wide, pressure on Willey now. He sprays this one down the leg-side

Willey to Gowtham, SIX, stunning strike from Krishnappa Gowtham, that too off his very first ball. The crowds jump out of their seats as he muscles his flat-batted heave over long-off. It's gone soaring into the stands
Willey to Buttler, 1 run, can't get any timing on it. Length ball, he goes hard but hits it limply down the ground to long-on. Not easy against this older ball

Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, 1 run, dropped by Dhoni. Could have been the match right there. Fine leg is inside the ring, which tempts Buttler into looking for the scoop. But this is a slower ball, making it really difficult to get any leverage on it. He deflects it to Dhoni's left, who dives with one hand but can't cling on
Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, 2 runs, back of a length delivery on middle and leg, clipped through square leg

Dwayne Bravo to Binny, out Caught by Watson!! Full toss at the stumps, should have disappeared too. Instead, Bravo's got very lucky. Binny swung across it too early, and lobbed it up off a leading edge. No mistake from Watson at extra cover, with his hands like buckets. Binny c Watson b Dwayne Bravo 22(17) [4s-1 6s-1]
Dwayne Bravo to Binny, SIX, length ball from Bravo, disappears. What a blow from Binny. His base was steady as he launched it brutally over long-on

Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, 1 run, makes some room and again, Bravo one-ups him by bowling this slower ball very wide. Buttler reached out and flat-batted it towards Bravo, who fails to hold onto the overhead chance
Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, no run, advances down but Bravo cramps him up with a back of length delivery which skids on and hits the thigh. Really good
Willey to Buttler, 1 run, he's pulled off his signature scoop after walking across the stumps, but fine leg is back. It gives him just a single. Just eight off the over, despite the boundary
Willey to Buttler, no run, well bowled. Back of length, very tight on off-stump, Buttler blocks

Willey to Buttler, no run, direct-hit could have been very tight. Back of length ball close to off, Buttler slices it straight to backward point and comes out looking for the single, only to be sent back. Made a desperate attempt to get in

Willey to Buttler, FOUR, oh well well. Where is sweeper cover? The fielder was very square in his position, and Buttler made some room to slap the ball away from off-stump. Brilliant batting. But was that the plan or did the fielder stand out of place. Willey shakes his head as he walks back
Willey to Binny, 1 run, back of a length delivery slanted in towards Binny, heaved away to deep mid-wicket
Willey to Binny, 2 runs, back of length delivery outside off, Binny makes room and flat-bats it wide of sweeper cover

Watson to Buttler, FOUR, audacious from Buttler, but then that's what he is about. Slower length ball, he gets into position early and slaps the reverse-hit through backward point. Much needed boundary off the over
Watson to Binny, 1 run, works it through mid-wicket

Watson to Buttler, 1 run, clears his front leg and smacks this slower ball straight at Watson, who tried putting his hands together in front of his face but it burst through them. Half a chance, if you want to be harsh
Watson to Binny, 1 run, back of a length at the hips, glanced fine by Binny. Bhajji does well to slide around from short fine leg and save the boundary, gets an applause from his captain
Watson to Buttler, 1 run, looks to carve this slower ball through the off-side, but it doesn't come on well enough. Eked off a thick inside edge through square leg

Watson to Binny, 1 run, slower length ball at the stumps, clipped away towards deep mid-wicket. Binny may have wanted the second, but you don't want to take on Jadeja's arm. They wisely settle with one

SN Thakur to Binny, 1 run, short of length, blocked back past the bowler towards mid-off. There was some hesitation between the two, as Buttler was waiting for the ball to go past Thakur, which caused Binny to stutter. A direct-hit at the non-striker's end would have been touch and go
SN Thakur to Binny, no run, length ball just outside off, stays a touch low and cuts through Binny's ungainly hack
SN Thakur to Binny, no run, better. Much tighter to off-stump with this length ball, Binny prods forward and defends
SN Thakur to Binny, FOUR, throws his hands at the width on offer and lashes it through backward point. Two ordinary deliveries from Thakur back-to-back. Not good

SN Thakur to Binny, 2 runs, excellent effort from Karn Sharma, running around from fine leg. He's saved the boundary for Thakur, off a delivery which very much deserved one. Length ball down leg, Binny glances it away nicely but couldn't get it fine enough
SN Thakur to Buttler, 1 run, back of a length delivery just outside off, punched to extra cover
Jadeja to Binny, no run, wafts at this length ball which grips and turns away to beat the outside edge. Dhoni took the bails off in a flash but Binny's back foot was firmly planted
Jadeja to Binny, 2 runs, long boundaries here, Binny works this wide of long-on and picks the holes in the field nicely. Easily back for two
Jadeja to Buttler, 1 run, steers it with the turn through backward point
Jadeja to Binny, 1 run, comes on the front foot and eases this down to long-off
Jadeja to Buttler, 1 run, sliding in on middle, nudges it round the corner
Jadeja to Buttler, no run, flat on off, turning away from a length. Buttler punches to extra cover
SN Thakur to Binny, no run, slightly behind that good length, Binny pats it to backward point
SN Thakur to Binny, no run, length ball, blocked

SN Thakur to Chopra, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! The big back-lift probably works to his detriment here. Full at the pads again, the ball slightly stops on him, but due to the velocity at which the bat comes down, he's unable to check the flick shot enough. Chips it off a soft leading edge straight to short mid-wicket. Chopra c Dwayne Bravo b SN Thakur 8(6) [4s-2]
SN Thakur to Chopra, FOUR, full at the pads, Chopra gets his bat down from the big back-lift and flicks it stylishly behind square. Beats the fielder's dive in the deep
SN Thakur to Chopra, no run, back of a length delivery at the stumps, blocked back
SN Thakur to Buttler, 1 run, good length ball, pushes it down to long-off
Dwayne Bravo to Chopra, no run, bangs this in short outside off, slower ball, loops over Chopra's attempted dab

Dwayne Bravo to Chopra, FOUR, beautiful timing. That sped off his bat through backward point. Back of length just outside off, not that bad a delivery, but Chopra leans back and spears a cut through to the fence
Dwayne Bravo to Chopra, no run, short of length delivery, fended off
Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, 1 run, short of length delivery, thwacked to deep mid-wicket

Dwayne Bravo to Samson, out Samson Run Out!! Oh dear, total breakdown between the two batsmen, so much so that they were almost caught together at one end at one point. Back of length delivery, Samson pats it towards backward point and takes a couple of steps down the pitch, which lured Buttler for the single. However, Samson was guilty of ball-watching and quickly turned his back to him, while Buttler ran through to the striker's end. Eventually, Samson may have sacrificed himself. Raina passes the ball onto Bravo who under-arms it back onto the stumps to catch the struggling Samson short. Samson run out (Raina/Dwayne Bravo) 21(22) [4s-2]
Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, 1 run, dipping slower ball, Buttler goes hard on the drive but it's bereft of any timing. Cut off at extra cover

Willey to Samson, 2 runs, full ball, Samson punches it powerfully down the ground. It swirled away from Raina at long-off, who covered good ground and parried it to the converging long-on fielder with a dive

Willey to Samson, FOUR, really lucky for Samson. Pressure was building on him, he makes some room and slices this up off a thick edge over short third man. The idea was to go over backward point, but it spooned up over Bhajji off the edge
Willey to Buttler, 1 run, makes quite a bit of room but Willey follows him with a slower ball, can only knock a single through the covers
Willey to Samson, 1 run, 137.5kph, fuller length ball outside off, carves it on the bounce to sweeper cover
Willey to Buttler, 1 run, not a lot of pace on offer from Willey. Back of length delivery outside off, Buttler punches through the covers
Willey to Samson, 1 run, length ball just outside off, 121kph, bunted down to long-off

Dwayne Bravo to Buttler, 2 runs, Buttler was prepared to face the slower ball; keeps his head still and drills the ball to deep mid-on. He wasn't keen on the second, but Samson sensed an opportunity there, Buttler responds in kind
Dwayne Bravo to Samson, 1 run, disguising slower ball, dips at the pads, Samson gets across and twirls his wrists to milk it in the gap through mid-wicket. Manages to get off strike, finally...
Dwayne Bravo to Samson, no run, brilliant from Bravo, stretches his left hand in his followthrough and fields nonchalantly. Samson is beffuddled after playing a punch, what does he do next?
Dwayne Bravo to Samson, no run, cross-seamer at 130ks, Samson was late in reading that, throws everything at it but fails to make contact
Dwayne Bravo to Samson, no run, Samson is struggling here, isn't quite finding the middle, looks to pierce the off-side ring with a punch but miscues it towards cover

Dwayne Bravo to Samson, no run, starts with a slower short ball outside off stump, Samson gets deep inside the crease and slashes late, a diving effort from backward point (to his left) prevents the single
SN Thakur to Buttler, no run, punched to covers and that will be the timeout!
SN Thakur to Buttler, 2 runs, drifts leg-side now, Buttler slams the flick to the left of long leg, Bhajji seemed to have reacted late but he manages to haul the ball back in
SN Thakur to Buttler, no run, around the fifth stump channel, Buttler bunts it with soft hands into the off-side
SN Thakur to Samson, 1 run, fullish outside off stump, Samson drives uppisly over cover
SN Thakur to Samson, no run, better from Thakur, adjusts his length and line, keeps Samson in check with a defensive poke into the off-side
SN Thakur to Samson, FOUR, that's a gift. Full and down leg, Samson glances it off his pads and off she goes...
Karn Sharma to Buttler, no run, sliding in towards middle and leg, turned to the on-side off the back foot. A loud call of no at his partner
Karn Sharma to Buttler, FOUR, spins away from a shorter length, Buttler goes hard and sends a thick edge fine of third man. Streaky, but Buttler won't mind

Karn Sharma to Samson, 3 runs, brilliant effort from Billings in the deep. Flung himself to his right and flicked the ball back air-borne, the ball was rolling back to the cushions and Billings once again flings across to keep it in play. Samson swept this powerfully and it seemed to be heading straight to the boundary, but Billings proves why he's so highly rated as a fielder. Simply superb
Karn Sharma to Buttler, leg byes, 1 run, shuffles across before sinking to one knee, might have dragged the sweep off the bottom edge or did he? Nah, makes no contact. It drifts past him
Karn Sharma to Buttler, 2 runs, straighter one, Buttler paddles it fine to bring up his fourth successive fifty to match Virat Kohli's feat. Only Viru has five in a row
Karn Sharma to Samson, 1 run, gets as low as he can and swipes the ball from middle stump to deep backward square
Jadeja to Samson, 1 run, shorter and quicker on middle, Samson clips it off his pads into the leg-side

Jadeja to Buttler, 3 runs, punches uppishly, sends it in the same region, Rayudu had a lot of ground to cover to his left (from sweeper cover), but he does well to put in the dive and keep it down to three

Prasidh to Mohit Sharma, no run, KKR win by 31 runs. Handshakes all round and the campaign is back on track for Karthik and his boys. Krishna dug in another bumper and Mohit attempted the ramp, climbed over the hanging willow
Prasidh to Mohit Sharma, no run, bouncer following the batsman and Mohit tried his best to connect with the ramp, but just couldn't. Too quick for him

Prasidh to Mohit Sharma, FOUR, fuller and outside off, a handsome square drive to get off the mark from Mohit, he presses forward and creams it with an open bat face square of the wicket, giving sweeper no chance

Prasidh to Ashwin, out Lbw!! Ouch! Ashwin is limping off the field. DK helped his state mate compose himself. He was struck on the right knee. Length delivery right on the stumps, Ashwin with a cleared front leg missed the slog to the on-side, hit flush on the back knee in front of middle. The umpire took a while before raising his finger, but he made the right decision. Ashwin grunted in pain after the blow and was on his haunches for a bit. Ashwin lbw b Prasidh 45(22) [4s-4 6s-3]
Prasidh to Barinder, 1 run, round the wicket and banged in short, Sran pulls and the splice lobs over Ashwin, who is happy with the single

Prasidh to Andrew Tye, out Caught by Karthik!! Excellent take! Sharp short delivery on middle and leg, Tye moved across, got inside the line and attempted the pull, the pace was just too quick for him, kissed the glove and flew to the left of DK, who flings full length to glove that. Andrew Tye c Karthik b Prasidh 14(10) [4s-1 6s-1]
Prasidh to Andrew Tye, wide, starts the final over with a wayward delivery outside off, signalled a wide
A Russell to Ashwin, no run, yorker to finish off, Ashwin ekes out an inside edge onto the pad. Dre Russ finishes with 4-0-41-3

A Russell to Ashwin, FOUR, KXIP are in this mathematically. 38 off 7. Ashwin is playing a gem here. Short delivery and Ashwin cheekily periscopes his bat up and ramps it over DK. It almost went the distance

A Russell to Ashwin, SIX, Ashwin is helping his team's NRR with these strikes. Back of a length and at the stumps, Ashwin cleared his front leg and hammered it over cow corner. Got the elevation and the distance

A Russell to Andrew Tye, leg byes, 1 run, Russell is down. Every time that happens the whole KKR team runs up to check on him. Full and angled in, Tye misses the flick and is struck on the pad. Ashwin was looking to steal a leg bye and was more than halfway down, Russell has a shy and misses and the duo eventually get the run. Russell went down after throwing the ball. He takes a while to get on his feet and is helped by DK. Looks fine to complete the over
A Russell to Ashwin, 1 run, resorts to the yorker, Ashwin jams it into the off-side and switches ends

A Russell to Ashwin, SIX, wow! That is a massive hit from Ash. Picked the back of the hand slower ball, lined himself up for the big heave-ho and gave it the full monty, cleared long-on quite comfortably
Prasidh to Andrew Tye, FOUR, length delivery and Tye gives it his all, shuffled across to get inside the line and powered it away along the ground to deep mid-wicket, no chance for Gill to get around
Prasidh to Andrew Tye, no run, sent back by Ashwin. Yorker aimed for the base of off, Tye digs it to the left of Krishna and he wanted the run, but Ashwin sends him back after taking a few steps out
Prasidh to Ashwin, 1 run, slower delivery and Ashwin does not generate enough power to clear long-on, on the bounce
Prasidh to Ashwin, 2 runs, short of length at the body, a cramped Ashwin gets the pull away to deep mid-wicket, Tye pushes for the second and steals it comfortably in the end
Prasidh to Ashwin, wide, short and outside off, Ashwin lets go and pockets a wide
Prasidh to Andrew Tye, 1 run, very full and outside off, Tye jams out the drive to long-on
Prasidh to Andrew Tye, no run, full and fast outside off, Tye swings and misses. Touch too quick for him
Narine to Ashwin, FOUR, now shows his power. Narine offers him the space to free his arms and Ashwin thumps it straight back over Tye, no chance for long-on to get across and stop that
Narine to Ashwin, FOUR, delicate. The quicker offie and Ashwin picked it alright, camped back in the crease and used the pace on the ball to direct it fine past short third man
Narine to Ashwin, no run, short and outside off, Ashwin cracks the punch to extra cover
Narine to Andrew Tye, 1 run, off-break and Tye is through the shot, thick inside edge to short fine leg
Narine to Ashwin, 1 run, carrom ball outside off, Ashwin chops the cut to deep extra cover

Narine to Andrew Tye, 1 run, another skier that drops safely. We have seen quite a few in this innings. The carrom ball and Tye just wants to slog, miscues it over Narine and the ball drops well in front of long-on and long-off

Searles to Ashwin, SIX, third six of the over. This time off Ashwin's willow. Searles hurls it full and in the swinging arc, Ashwin presses forward and sends it sailing over long-off. Searles ends with 4-0-52-1 on IPL debut
Searles to Ashwin, wide, goes wide of the crease and sprays it down leg, Ashwin misses the tickle
Searles to Ashwin, no run, fired into the dugout, jammed out to the left of Searles
Searles to Andrew Tye, 1 run, slower short of length delivery and Tye drags the pull to long-on

Searles to Andrew Tye, SIX, off the mark in style. Tye does not want to hang around. Back of a length and not much wrong with the delivery, Tye just goes through the line and smashes it over the leaping long-on fielder

Searles to Finch, out Caught by Kuldeep Yadav!! And he's gone.. Finch is livid. Lets out a grunt before storming off. Searles went round the wicket and hurled it across the right-hander, Finch shuffled across and did well to get under the ball to play the scoop, couldn't find the elevation and Kuldeep takes a good catch at short fine. Either side and that would have been a boundary. FYI, maiden IPL wicket for Searles. Finch c Kuldeep Yadav b Searles 34(20) [6s-3]
Searles to Finch, SIX, Finch is not given up yet. Length delivery right in the slot, Finch winds up with the front leg cleared and gives it his all, heaved away into the deep mid-wicket stand
Chawla to Finch, 1 run, closes the bat face and the leading edge rolls away towards extra cover
Chawla to Ashwin, 1 run, dabbed to short third man

Chawla to Ashwin, 2 runs, mistimed loft and it lands safely. Ashwin goes for the loft over long-off and instead sliced it over extra cover, Kuldeep tracks back but the ball drops well in front of him. Searles tidies up from long-off
Chawla to Ashwin, FOUR, similar to the previous delivery and this time Ashwin uses the pace on the ball smartly, waits and back cuts it behind point, bisected the two fielders there to perfection
Chawla to Ashwin, no run, faster and outside off, Ashwin cuts and misses. Beaten by the pace on the delivery

Chawla to Finch, 1 run, what happened there? A skier and it lands right between the two West Indians. DK is not a happy man. Has his hands up as to asking what's going on. Finch miscued the loft and it stayed up for a long time, neither Searles nor Russell called for the catch and it landed it right in front of the duo. Poor!
Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, 1 run, quicker one at 106ks and Finch chops it to cover-point, retains strike
Kuldeep Yadav to Ashwin, 1 run, very full and Ashwin squirts an inside edge backward of square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Ashwin, no run, tossed up on off, Ashwin defends it back to Kuldeep
Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, 1 run, flatter and quicker, Finch knocks it to long-off

Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, SIX, consecutive sixes for Finch. He needs to kick-on, at least to get his form back. Wrong 'un and Finch had to fetch it from outside off, cue-ends the slog sweep just over a leaping Searles at long-on

Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, SIX, half tracker and Finch dismisses it from his presence. Real poor bowling from Kuldeep. Gave Finch all the time to pick his spot and muscle the pull over the cow corner fence
Chawla to Finch, 1 run, shortens the length on the googly and Finch chops the cut to sweeper cover
Chawla to Ashwin, 1 run, bit more air and Ashwin eases the push past Chawla and down to long-off
Chawla to Finch, 1 run, backs away and plays the punch off the stumps, single to deep extra cover
Chawla to Ashwin, 1 run, the wrong 'un and is milked away with the spin to deep mid-wicket
Chawla to Finch, 1 run, quicker and on the stumps, Finch works it to deep mid-wicket
Chawla to Finch, 2 runs, starts with a googly and Finch nudges it with the spin into the on-side, in the gap and the pair scamper back

Kuldeep Yadav to Axar, out Caught by Searles!! Wicket for Kuldeep. That should get back his confidence, especially after what Ishan Kishan did in the previous game. Switched to round the wicket and fired the full delivery outside off, Axar moved a bit and lofted it to long-off. The length was tad too full and hence Axar could not get underneath it. A well-judged catch by Searles, who timed his jump to perfection. Axar c Searles b Kuldeep Yadav 19(11) [4s-2 6s-1]
Kuldeep Yadav to Axar, wide, saw the batsman move around and fired it outside off, well wide of the tramline

Kuldeep Yadav to Axar, SIX, now sends it over Russell. Not connected properly, but the small boundaries aid him in. Shuffled across to the conventional chinaman and heaved it with a bent back knee over long-on, just over

Kuldeep Yadav to Axar, FOUR, good use of the feet. Axar puts on the dancing shoes and gets close to the flighted delivery, then muscles the drive straight of long-on, where Russell's dive is an after thought
Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, 1 run, once again Kuldeep is short in his length, pulled along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Axar, 1 run, fraction short and the ball keeps low, Axar adjusts and pulls to deep mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Finch, 1 run, floated up very full and Finch squeezes the drive to long-off
Narine to Finch, 1 run, once more reads it off the surface, Finch makes room and chops it into the off-side
Narine to Axar, 1 run, this time manages to beat the chinaman to his right and pick up a single to deep cover
Narine to Axar, no run, turning away and Axar punches it straight to Kuldeep at cover
Narine to Finch, 1 run, dragged back length and Finch has the space to carve it to sweeper cover

Narine to Finch, no run, off-break and Finch has no clue. Hangs back in hope to read it off the surface, is late and is struck on the pad after being beaten on the inside edge. The ball was turning down leg and hence a stifled appeal from DK
Narine to Axar, 1 run, fraction short and Axar pulls it to deep mid-wicket
Searles to Axar, 1 run, slower delivery outside off, punched away to sweeper cover

Searles to Axar, FOUR, crunched! 100 comes up within 10 overs and KXIP still need to strike over 14 per over. On a length and outside off, Axar stands and thumps it on the up past Russell at extra cover. Raced away!
Searles to Finch, 1 run, off-cutter on the pads, clipped away backward of square leg
Searles to Axar, 1 run, slanted across the left-hander, Axar punches it to sweeper cover
Searles to Axar, no run, back of a length and Axar pushes it back to Searles
Searles to Finch, 1 run, wide of the crease and angled in, nurdled with a closed bat face to deep backward square

Narine to Rahul, out Bowled!! Narine has his man. Big moment in the game. That might be the match. Even Narine enjoyed out. He lets out a roar. Never seen him express his delight after picking a wicket. The round the wicket ploy has worked, carrom ball on the stumps, Rahul kneels to play the slog sweep, gets an inside edge onto the front thigh, the backspin on the ball takes it onto the stumps. Unfortunate way to get out. Rahul b Narine 66(29) [4s-2 6s-7]
Narine to Finch, 1 run, off-break and Finch decides to sweep him first ball, gloves it to short fine leg

Boult to de Villiers, SIX, fitting finish from AB de Villiers. RCB are still alive and DD have officially been knocked out. Slower delivery outside off stump, AB waits for the ball and lifts this over long-off
Boult to de Grandhomme, 1 run, driven to deep extra-cover. Scores level
Boult to de Grandhomme, no run, slower ball and de Grandhomme fails to connect
Boult to de Villiers, 1 run, full and on the stumps, de Villiers drives to long-on

Boult to de Villiers, SIX, Boult has actually bowled a full toss way outside off stump, but that big back and across movement of de Villiers helps him easily time this kind of sweep shot over backward square leg. He's just awesome to watch
Boult to de Grandhomme, 1 run, full ball outside off stump, de Grandhomme hits this on the bounce to long-off
Harshal Patel to de Grandhomme, 1 run, very full, de Grandhomme drills it to the left of the bowler, who deflects it to long-off
Harshal Patel to de Grandhomme, 3 wides, full and down the leg-side, the keeper can't collect cleanly and they sneak a couple of runs

Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Prithvi Shaw!! You got to be kidding me. Take a bow Shreyas Iyer. He's placed a man very straight behind the keeper and this ball goes to him. For a moment it looked a brilliant, cheeky scoop shot from Sarfaraz Khan to this low full around off stump, until the little fella - Prithvi Shaw - sneaked across to his right into the frame. He almost made a mess of it, juggled and took it on the second attempt. Don't be harsh on Sarfaraz Khan people, he actually played a good shot, but fell in the trap set by Iyer. Sarfaraz Khan c Prithvi Shaw b Harshal Patel 11(8) [4s-2]
Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, no run, slower ball on the shorter side, Sarfaraz tries to cut and misses

Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, oh superbly guided away past point and he thanks the heavens again. Short of a length delivery outside off stump, Sarfaraz uses the pace on the ball and beats third man
Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, wide, now he tries to unsettle the bowler by moving around in the crease, succeeds as Harshal Patel bowls down the leg-side

Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, lovely lofted drive and this should lift Sarfaraz Khan's confidence. Straightaway looks to the heavens after connecting well. Full ball outside off stump, Sarfaraz hits this over cover
Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, wide, slower ball and it slips down the leg-side

Harshal Patel to Sarfaraz Khan, no run, low full toss thuds into the pad, Sarfaraz misses a flick, easy ball that was, impact was marginally on leg stump, just umpire's call and it was evident to the naked eye that the ball will miss the leg stump. DD took the chance and went for the review, only to lose it
Boult to Sarfaraz Khan, 1 run, great yorker, Sarfaraz gets his bat down to keep it out, the ball takes the stumps as it rolls back
Boult to de Villiers, 1 run, very full and outside off stump, de Villiers drives it to sweeper cover
Boult to Sarfaraz Khan, 1 run, the yorker again, sqeezed out to long leg
Boult to de Villiers, 1 run, wide yorker dug out to deep point
Boult to Sarfaraz Khan, 1 run, opens the face of the bat and guides this short of length delivery to third man

Boult to Mandeep, out Bowled!! Oopsy! Why would you swipe across the line from a good length on this pitch. Made it look as if it stayed low. The scrambled seam delivery and the ball ignited the stumps after beating the ugly swipe from the batsman. Dan Vettori gestures to someone to go out now from the dugout. Okay, it's Sarfaraz! Mandeep b Boult 13(14) [6s-1]
Mishra to de Villiers, 2 runs, short and nudged to deep mid-wicket, Mandeep quickly races back for the second. So Mishra is done
Mishra to Mandeep, 1 run, advances and drives it to long-on, mistimed hit though
Mishra to Mandeep, no run, oh that's dangerously played off the back foot. The quicker delivery, Mandeep manages to get a leading edge that rolls towards short third man
Mishra to Mandeep, no run, driven softly to cover
Mishra to Mandeep, 2 runs, he's top-edged this sweep and expertly landed this ball in the open space between deep square and deep mid-wicket. A bit more bat on that could have been a catch
Mishra to de Villiers, 1 run, freebie full toss, drilled to long-on
Junior Dala to Mandeep, no run, that was an attempted drive through cover, but he got an inside edge that rolled towards mid-wicket
Junior Dala to Mandeep, 2 runs, steps out and slices the ball over backward point as Junior Dala bowls wide outside off stump, third man tidies up
Junior Dala to Mandeep, no run, good length delivery on the stumps, Mandeep turns it to mid-wicket
Junior Dala to Mandeep, no run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Mandeep guides it to backward point

Junior Dala to Mandeep, SIX, how easy was that? Mandeep has been in good touch, getting starts this season. This was a short delivery down the leg-side, Mandeep easily pulls it over long leg as he got inside the line
Junior Dala to Mandeep, no run, watchfully defended to the left of the bowler
Mishra to Mandeep, 1 run, this is drilled along the ground to long-on
Mishra to de Villiers, 1 run, shortish and outside off stump, cut to deep extra cover
Mishra to Mandeep, 1 run, spinning away outside off stump, Mandeep reaches out and slaps it to long-off
Mishra to Mandeep, no run, googly and beaten, hit the pad, but the ball was spinning too much and snaking down the leg-side

Mishra to Kohli, out Caught by Pant!! Now then, now then. Is this a bit of a turning point? Look at the turn for Mishra. Pitched just outside off stump and spun big, sucked Kohli into the drive and he went for a big drive targetting cover. He couldn't counter for the spin and got an edge, Pant somehow managed to cling on. Kohli walks without waiting for the umpire. He's done his part, but he's livid with himself because he normally loves finishing games when set. Kohli c Pant b Mishra 70(40) [4s-7 6s-3]

Mishra to Kohli, FOUR, oh you are unreal man! This fella has bowled a pretty decent leggie and you've whipped it with your rubber wrists from the within the stumps, finding the cow corner fence. Not many would have split deep mid-wicket and long-on because it's hard to time that ball so well with such a shot
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, 2 runs, slower delivery dropped short, de Villiers slaps it wide of long-off

Harshal Patel to de Villiers, SIX, that's masterful! Masterful because he's picked this slower ball, waited and muscled the loft over long-on. Fifty for AB de Villiers as well. RCB fans would be delighted to see both AB and Kohli score fifties in the same innings. Part of the reason why they weren't clicking as a batting unit this season. Kohli is so happy for AB

Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, oh lovely. Third man is inside the ring and that is exactly why de Villiers wants to give himself a bit of room. Short of a length delivery outside off stump, de Villiers cracks the cut past backward point
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, no run, oh the under edge is found as de Villiers backs away and tries to guide this ball through the off-side, the ball misses the sticks and rolls back to the sticks
Harshal Patel to Kohli, 1 run, nudged to mid-wicket

Harshal Patel to Kohli, SIX, finally, a 100-run partnership between Kohli and AB this season. Harshal Patel bowls a good length delivery down the leg-side in trying to follow Kohli, but the Indian captain is so good with his wrists and whips it away over mid-wicket

Lamichhane to de Villiers, no run, oh squared up completely was de Villiers. This is the length he should have been hitting, the good length, pitching within the stumps and turning square, de Villiers was looking to flick, lucky that the leading edge didn't carry to the bowler

Lamichhane to de Villiers, SIX, he's hit that in the airrr, not timed that well, there is a man at deep backward square leg, he jumps and it's evaded him. The length was just a bit too full, de Villiers got inside the line of this flighted delivery and slog-swept it over backward square leg
Lamichhane to Kohli, 1 run, shortish googly, Kohli pulls to deep square leg
Lamichhane to de Villiers, 1 run, sweeps through backward square leg

Lamichhane to Kohli, 1 run, again short and allows Kohli to play off the back foot to mid-wicket, is getting turn so anything around the good length zone would be tough to hit. Kohli wanted two on that occasion, but the fielders were smart enough
Lamichhane to de Villiers, 1 run, shortish and on the stumps, de Villiers works it to deep mid-wicket
Harshal Patel to Kohli, 2 runs, slower delivery outside off stump, Kohli cuts square of the wicket on the off-side
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, 1 run, shortish, de Villiers flat-bats it to long-on
Harshal Patel to de Villiers, FOUR, cheeky! This guy is not all about power! Full ball and he's smartly moved across to scoop this over the infield with fine leg inside the ring

Harshal Patel to Kohli, 1 run, and now Harshal Patel hits Kohli with a throw. Kohli takes it with a smile. He tapped this to the left of the bowler and set off, Harshal Patel attacked the ball, turned around and had a go at the bowler's end

Harshal Patel to Kohli, no run, oh put down, but got to be cruel to call that a dropped catch. Harshal Patel hardly had any time to react. Kohli stepped out and muscled this length ball, Harshal Patel just got his hands to it, wasn't in any position to catch, lucky that he didn't hurt his hand like Mujeeb earlier in the day
Harshal Patel to Kohli, no run, short of length delivery on the stumps, Kohli defends

Mishra to de Villiers, no run, and again, full and very wide, very lucky that de Villiers crashed that straight to cover. A loud grunt from Mishra as he collects the cap from the umpire. Knows he's spoiled a good over. He is one of the keys to DD's success mind you. Two more overs up his sleeve to make some inroads

Mishra to de Villiers, SIX, that's the bowler getting greedy with the turn on offer and offering a freebie. Way too full, the length is still acceptable, but the line is way outside off stump, got to be closer to the sticks. AB just waited for it and smashed that lofted drive over extra-cover
Mishra to de Villiers, no run, slower and spinning away, de Villiers carefully works this to the right of the bowler, who stops the ball with a dive
Mishra to Kohli, 1 run, there's that Mishra quicker ball, landed very short, mistimed pull to long-on. Kohli reckons he should have smashed that over mid-wicket
Mishra to Kohli, wide, oh that spun big and Pant just about managed to get his fingertips to it diving to his right
Mishra to de Villiers, 1 run, very full and on the stumps, dug out towards short mid-wicket
Mishra to Kohli, 1 run, driven off the front foot past the diving fielder at cover as Mishra spins this away from the right-hander
Junior Dala to Kohli, 1 run, short slower ball, no one at mid-wicket and Kohli works it in the gap, can't get the second as the fielder attacked the ball quickly
Junior Dala to de Villiers, 1 run, slower delivery, de Villiers delays the swipe to long-on
Junior Dala to Kohli, 1 run, drilled to long-on

Junior Dala to Kohli, FOUR, tickled and fifty for captain Kohli. Immediately raises the bat to the dug-out and the crowd. Looks determined as always. Really terrible short of length delivery down the leg-side, just helped on its way with fine leg inside the ring

Junior Dala to Kohli, 2 runs, oops! Junior Dala is down on the ground trying this slower ball, goes as a full toss, lucky that Kohli couldn't get enough power behind the flick as he tried to split deep mid-wicket and long-on
Junior Dala to Kohli, no run, Kohli takes a step down the pitch and yorks himself, drilled off the toe end of the bat to cover
Mishra to de Villiers, no run, better from Mishra, spots de Villiers running down the pitch and shortens the length, a forced defence from de Villiers

Mishra to de Villiers, SIX, okay, you have to learn! Got away with one previous ball bowling full, this time the line is outside off and allows de Villiers to swing his arms. Easily lofted over long-off and AB is pretty good with his timing, isn't he?
Mishra to Kohli, 1 run, that's way too full to trouble the batsman, worked away to long-on
Mishra to de Villiers, 1 run, de Villiers gets down on one knee and sweeps, protection at deep backward square leg
Mishra to Kohli, 1 run, flat and short enough for Kohli to go back and tuck into the on-side towards long-on
Mishra to de Villiers, 1 run, sensibly allows the full ball to come and nudges it to mid-wicket, couldn't steal the second as the ball was timed a little too well
Lamichhane to de Villiers, 1 run, sliding on the shorter side. A tappy drive, long-off
Lamichhane to Kohli, 1 run, deeper in the crease, one-bounced to long-on with his high elbowed punches
Lamichhane to de Villiers, 1 run, back, punchy, mid-on
Lamichhane to Kohli, 1 run, quite off the inside half as he wrists it in front of square
Lamichhane to Kohli, no run, straight on middle. Behind, blocked

Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, 1 run, the inside edge rolls to backward square leg and CSK have bagged two vital points. Manish Pandey congratulates Rayudu. Kane, Rashid, Hooda and a few others too join. A fantastic win for CSK

Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, 1 run, that's it! Maiden IPL hundred. The crowd roars. What a knock from Ambati Rayudu. He takes the helmet off, raises the bat and enjoys the moment with a big smile. He has been exceptional this season. The teams applauds and Dhoni congratulates him too. Short of a length delivery on the leg stump, Rayudu moves across and works it towards square leg
Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, 1 run, opens the face of the bat and guides it to third man to get Rayudu back on strike
Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, FOUR, oh he's hit this for four. CSK need 3 more to win and Rayudu needs one for a hundred. Length delivery down the leg-side, Dhoni swings it away behind square on the on-side
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, 1 run, in the airrr and it lands safely. Lucky that! On 99 now. Rayudu wanted to slog over mid-wicket, got a top edge that landed in front of third man
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, no run, short ball and Rayudu tries to guide it past the keeper, misses. He's just a hit away from a hundred
S Kaul to Dhoni, SIX, he got away with a couple of full tosses earlier in the over, but Dhoni has had enough. Absolutely tonks it flat over the square leg boundary. Just 8 needed now.
S Kaul to Rayudu, 1 run, backs away to go big, but slices this low full toss straight to sweeper cover
S Kaul to Dhoni, 1 run, low full toss, gently driven to long-off
S Kaul to Rayudu, 1 run, full toss, driven to long-off and he asks square leg umpire for a no-ball, that was well under the waist
S Kaul to Dhoni, 1 run, lovely yorker, a very good ball if you have forced Dhoni to jam his bat down to save his wicket, hit to long-off
S Kaul to Rayudu, 1 run, full toss, Rayudu mistimes the slog to deep mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Dhoni, no run, very full, driven to extra-cover and that's Rashid Khan kept out with no wickets - 4-0-25-0
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, 1 run, shortish delivery from Rashid Khan, Rayudu pulls it to long-on
Rashid Khan to Dhoni, 1 run, gently driven to long-off
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, 1 run, flighted delivery outside off stump, Rayudu drives it to long-off
Rashid Khan to Dhoni, 1 run, opens the face of the bat and runs it to backward point, they sneak a quick single
Rashid Khan to Dhoni, no run, guided to backward point
Shakib to Rayudu, FOUR, use of the feet again, Rayudu is just rubbing it into Shakib, who has had a catch being put down. Goes straight down the ground and over the umpire's head. Into the 90s now
Shakib to Rayudu, SIX, he's back to taking the aggressive route again. Advances, takes it on the full and muscles it over the man at long-off
Shakib to Dhoni, 1 run, driven to long-off

Shakib to Rayudu, 1 run, that's well bowled and equally well played by Rayudu. Shakib fired this way outside off stump on seeing Rayudu advance, the batsman had to really reach out to meet the ball and tapped it to extra-cover

Shakib to Dhoni, 1 run, I can't believe my eyes. Manish Pandey has dropped a sitter by his standards. It's MS Dhoni too! Pandey is one of SRH's finest fielders. Flighted delivery on the stumps, Dhoni steps out and mistimes the loft, hit flat to long-on, Pandey was close to the rope, took it too casually and it popped out
Shakib to Rayudu, 1 run, flatter and on the leg stump, Rayudu flicks it to long-on
Sandeep Sharma to Rayudu, 1 run, bunted down to long-on
Sandeep Sharma to Dhoni, 1 run, slower ball on the leg stump, Dhoni glances it to fine leg
Sandeep Sharma to Dhoni, wide, that's the bouncer too high, Dhoni lets it pass
Sandeep Sharma to Rayudu, 1 run, very full and on the stumps, driven to long-on
Sandeep Sharma to Dhoni, 1 run, fullish delivery outside off stump, Dhoni guides it to deep point
Sandeep Sharma to Rayudu, 1 run, short of length delivery on the stumps, Rayudu drives it to long-on

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, out Caught by Williamson!! Now then, is there a change in the tale? SRH are masters at staging comebacks from nowhere. Don't write them off yet. Short of a length delivery it was from Sandeep Sharma, Raina wanted to play across the line, but he ended up slicing it towards mid-off, hit high on the bat, Kane ran to his left from extra-cover and put in the dive to complete the catch. Raina c Williamson b Sandeep Sharma 2(3)
Shakib to Raina, 1 run, driven down to long-on
Shakib to Rayudu, 1 run, stays leg-side of the ball and punches it to deep point
Shakib to Raina, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Raina drives it to long-on

Shakib to Rayudu, out Watson Run Out!! Shane Watson was moving slowly as he went for that run, wonder if he was carrying a niggle there. Rayudu pushed this flatter delivery towards extra-cover and set off, Watson was slow to take off, captain Kane threw it to the keeper, who did the rest. Finally a breakthrough for SRH, but Watson has done his job. Watson run out (Williamson/Goswami) 57(35) [4s-5 6s-3]
Shakib to Rayudu, no run, flatter, defended

Shakib to Rayudu, SIX, oh my god! This guy is playing some outrageous shots. Flighted delivery from Shakib, Rayudu steps out, gets closer to the pitch of the ball and slogs it hard over deep mid-wicket

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, FOUR, the runs are leaking. Short of a length on the leg stump, poor line with not much of protection behind square on the on-side, Watson pulls and sends it to the long leg boundary
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, 1 run, drilled to long-on

Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, SIX, this is precisely why SRH need Rayudu ASAP! Just look at him run down at SRH's key bowler. Got beaten previous ball, but no respect whatsoever and he forces Bhuvi to shorten the length, with it swings across the line with a pull and powers it over the mid-wicket boundary. He's just toying with them
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, no run, ohh! That's gonna hurt. Interestingly this short of length delivery swung back in and beat Rayudu on the pull shot, hit on the thigh, hope it's not too bad
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, 2 runs, slower ball, swiped across the line and deep square leg is very open, another lovely slide from Rashid to stop the boundary
Bhuvneshwar to Watson, 1 run, short of length delivery on the off stump, Watson flicks it to mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run, calmly defends off the back foot
Rashid Khan to Watson, 1 run, short enough for Watson to go back tuck to mid-wicket, they think about two, but the fielder attacked the ball quickly
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, 1 run, nudged to square leg
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run, a forward stride and then a confident defence to respect this flighted delivery

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, SIX, has he sliced this? Yes he has, but that bat in his hands is very good and it takes the ball all the way. The leggie outside off stump, Rayudu gets down on one knee and goes hard at it, looked like it was going to long-off for a moment, but this isn't Uppal. The boundaries are smaller
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run, flatter delivery outside off stump, Rayudu defends off the back foot
S Kaul to Rayudu, 1 run, and another yorker, this time he gets it right, Rayudu flicks it to mid-wicket

S Kaul to Rayudu, FOUR, wow! Just wow! The yorker goes as a juicy full ball and Rayudu thrashes the drive wide of extra-cover. Interesting to see Kaul try three bouncers and then only try the yorker. What's the thought process there?
S Kaul to Rayudu, no run, lovely yorker on the stumps, Rayudu digs it out

S Kaul to Rayudu, SIX, gee there's a lot of audaciousness with the way he bats. He knows Kaul way too well. Two short balls first up in the over, but expects Kaul to try another one, the bowler dished out exactly what the batsman wanted and that back and across movement from Rayudu makes a strong statement that he is bossing the show, out comes the pull shot and clears deep mid-wicket. Brilliant fifty
S Kaul to Watson, 1 run, Kaul's banging them into the surface and getting it up around neck height, this time Watson top-edges a pull shot that lands in front of the deep backward square leg fielder
S Kaul to Rayudu, 1 run, pulled in the air after getting inside the line, mistimed to an extent and lands safely at deep square leg

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, just bowled a slower ball, tries to repeat, but this is well outside off stump and the batsman read this from the hand. No third man, so Watson camps back and cuts past backward point. A 31-ball fifty for Watto, another very handy innings at the top

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, no run, oh that ball deserved a wicket. Watson completely foxed by it and was through with the pull shot before the ball came, luckily for him the bounce was good enough to escape the sticks

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, 2 runs, low full toss, driven nicely past cover, Rashid does really well to run to his right and slide to save two runs. He's a pretty good fielder having worked a lot on his fitness in the last one year
Sandeep Sharma to Rayudu, 1 run, back and across movement and then a pause from Rayudu as he spots the slower ball and thumps it to long-off
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, 1 run, short slower ball and he gets away with it as Watson pulls and finds deep backward square leg
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, 2 runs, in the air but wide of the man at cover. For a moment it looked as if Watson drove this full ball to hand, long-off cuts it off running to his left
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run, flighted just outside off, Rayudu waits back and defends it
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, half-tracker and punished. Rayudu camped back, twirls his wrists and hammers it to the cow corner fence. Shikhar had no chance cutting that off
Rashid Khan to Watson, 1 run, googly again, Watson drags it to short fine leg
Rashid Khan to Watson, no run, wrong 'un and Watson doesn't pick it. Went for a cross-batted swipe and is beaten by the googly which slides under his bat
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, 1 run, wicket-to-wicket line, Rayudu drops it into the off-side and hares across to the other end
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run, leg-break that fizzed off the deck outside off, Rayudu tries to cut - gets a thick outside edge to short third man
Shakib to Rayudu, 1 run, lopes out of his crease and creams it along the ground to long-off
Shakib to Watson, 1 run, punched away to sweeper cover
Shakib to Watson, FOUR, splits the gap perfectly. Shakib goes short once again, Watson stays low and pulls it through mid-wicket. Beats long-on and deep mid-wicket
Shakib to Watson, no run, arm-ball that stays low. Watson went for the sweep and gets it off the bottom onto his thigh pad
Shakib to Rayudu, 1 run, flatter again, Rayudu with his high backlift, thrashes it down to long-on
Shakib to Watson, 1 run, skidding off the deck, Watson was on the back foot and shaves it slightly off the inner half through mid-wicket
S Kaul to Rayudu, no run, shortish outside off, Rayudu holds his bat inside the line and lets it pass

S Kaul to Rayudu, FOUR, magnificent. No half-measures whatsoever. Saw a pitched up delivery outside off, props forward and presents a straight bat to drill it past mid-off. Third boundary of the over so far
S Kaul to Rayudu, no run, this back of a length delivery rears up at Rayudu, who yanks his bottom hand off the handle and blocks it
S Kaul to Rayudu, 2 runs, Kaul goes wide of off, Rayudu steers it towards third man gets a couple

S Kaul to Rayudu, SIX, in the air and clears Hales at long-on. He seemed to have misjudged it there, runs forward and later realises that the ball is sailing over his head. Short again, Rayudu stayed back and smacked it flat and hard - enough wood to take it all the way

S Kaul to Rayudu, FOUR, short, no real purpose and Rayudu pulls it away to the mid-wicket boundary. Didn't time it alright, but placed it in the gap. The ball hurried onto him a bit and that foiled his timing
Shakib to Rayudu, 1 run, Rayudu gambols out and wrists it to the left of mid-wicket
Shakib to Rayudu, no run, drifter on leg, flicked to mid-wicket
Shakib to Rayudu, FOUR, 50-up for CSK with this boundary. Rayudu takes on Shakib, uses his feet and reaches the pitch. Lets his bottom hand do the talking. Lofting him over Shakib's head
Shakib to Watson, 1 run, sits on back knee and brooms it to backward square leg
Shakib to Watson, no run, armer, sliding in off the deck. Watson goes back and forces it to extra cover
Shakib to Watson, FOUR, begins with a tripe on leg-stump. Watson accepts it with glee and glances it off his pads, beats short fine leg and races away to the fence
Rashid Khan to Watson, 1 run, overpitches outside off, Watson lunges across and works it away to long-on
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, 1 run, now the googly, Rayudu reads it well and nurdles it through mid-wicket

Rashid Khan to Rayudu, FOUR, Rayudu brings out the sweep. Safe bet against the spin. Went low, rolled his wrists and placed it in the gap in front of square on the leg-side. Hooda from the deep ran across and dived near the ropes, but in vain
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run, spinning around off, Rayudu stays back and dinks it with an open bat to short third man
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, no run, the quick leggie, outside off. Rayudu waits deep and smears it to point
Rashid Khan to Watson, 1 run, slips in a full toss, Watson crouches low and swats it away to deep mid-wicket
Bhuvneshwar to Watson, 1 run, Bhuvneshwar extracts some inward shape and cramps Watson for room. A faint inside edge onto his pad and it dribbles to point. They nab a tight single
Bhuvneshwar to Watson, no run, short of length and attacking Watson's chest, dead-batted down the pitch
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, 1 run, advances down the track and slogs hard - mistimes it wide of mid-on
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, no run, beaten by a jaffa! Goodish length and holding its line just outside off, Rayudu was caught in no-man's land. Tentatively swishes and is beaten on the outside edge
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, SIX, Rayudu gets into the act. Reaches out for a fuller length delivery outside off and effortlessly lifts it over extra cover
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, no run, rising from a length, Rayudu taps it to cover

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, 'don't bowl short to me' - Watson's body language suggested as Sandeep overbakes and goes short. Watson stays in his crease, allows for the ball to come and pulls it with brute force over mid-wicket
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, SIX, Sandeep's slower ball goes awry. It was the knuckle ball and Watson spotted it early. Squated low and helped it over short fine leg. Clears the rope for a maximum
Sandeep Sharma to Rayudu, 1 run, drifting on leg, dropped towards mid-on
Sandeep Sharma to Rayudu, no run, "Wait, wait" shouted Rayudu as he spanks it straight to cover
Sandeep Sharma to Rayudu, no run, pitched up and just outside off, Rayudu stomps forward and defends it slightly outside the line - rolls away to mid-wicket
Sandeep Sharma to Rayudu, no run, Sandeep is getting some shape but keeps it on middle and leg-stump line. Rayudu casually gets forward and defends it to mid-on
Bhuvneshwar to Rayudu, 1 run, this back of a length delivery straightened after pitching and squares up Rayudu a bit. Uses soft hands and steers it off the outer half to third man
Bhuvneshwar to Watson, 1 run, homing in from a back of a length, Watson with an open bat face guides it to backward point
Bhuvneshwar to Watson, no run, touch shorter outside off, punched into the off-side
Bhuvneshwar to Watson, no run, Bhuvneshwar shifts his line to just outside off, Watson chops it off the bottom towards the keeper - who makes an acrobatic stop
Bhuvneshwar to Watson, SIX, Bhuvneshwar goes short and Watson dispatches it over long-on. Went back and flat-batted it disdainfully. The key was - he picked the length early
Bhuvneshwar to Watson, no run, Bhuvneshwar starts with a back of a length delivery just outside off, Watson stands tall in his crease and defends
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, 1 run, splaying on leg, picked away through mid-wicket to keep the strike
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, no run, full and on middle, Watson with a full face of the bat pats it softly to mid-on
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, no run, better from Sandeep. Gets this short of length delivery to nip back in. Watson meekly taps it to cover

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, FOUR, Sandeep offers width and Watson doesn't let it go scot-free. Flails his hands and creams it with super timing past a diving Manish Pandey at cover-point. First boundary of the innings
Sandeep Sharma to Watson, no run, gets a hint of shape after pitching. Watson strokes it straight to the fielder at extra cover on this occasion

Sandeep Sharma to Watson, 2 runs, runs straightaway. Sandeep gets this length ball to seam back in, Watson was on the back foot and he languidly punches it through cover. Beats the in-field and gets a brace
Dwayne Bravo to Shakib, 2 runs, muscled down to long-on, they run hard and gets the second
Dwayne Bravo to Shakib, no run, two dots in row. Gold at the moment. Slower ball lasered outside off, Shakib slashes and misses

Dwayne Bravo to Shakib, no run, Bravo resorts to full and pacy delivery, Shakib takes a stride and misses the whip. Is struck on the pads and the ball trickles to the right of Bravo, who gets across and fires a throw at the stumps. Shakib was looking for a single and had given up. A direct-hit would've been curtains for him

Dwayne Bravo to Shakib, FOUR, just eludes Rayudu's outstretched right hand. Bravo lands the slower ball on the middle stump, Shakib gets low and slogs it across the line. Rayudu tried his best at square leg, but it evaded him
Dwayne Bravo to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, full again, follows Hooda, who was charging down the track. Can only hack it down to long-on
Dwayne Bravo to Shakib, 1 run, fuller length delivery slanted outside off, Shakib meets it with a straight-batted drive to long-off
SN Thakur to Shakib, 1 run, tucks Shakib for room with a length ball on off. Cut away to point
SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, attacks the stumps, Hooda flaps it away to long-on

SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, wide, there was a definite sound as the ball past Hooda's horizontal bat. MS and Thakur went up in unison, but the umpire calls it a wide. Full and moving well wide of off, Hooda threw his bat and the noise could've been of the bat hitting the ground there
SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, SIX, in the slot and out of the park. Thakur gets his line closer to off, Hooda stays still and biffs it powerfully over long-off
SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, wide, and again. Action reply of previous ball, just that Hooda didn't swish his blade. Thrown outside the tramline and Thakur has to rebowl
SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, wide, hurls it very full outside off, flirts with the tramlines and it's been called a wide. Hooda went after it and couldn't reach

SN Thakur to Manish Pandey, out Caught by Willey!! Pandey perishes. SRH lose their fourth wicket. Cross-seam full ball from Thakur, Pandey went hard at it and the bat turned on impact in his hands. Hence, skies it towards long-off. Willey steps forward and grabs it with ease. The visitors are losing steam here. Manish Pandey c Willey b SN Thakur 5(6)
SN Thakur to Manish Pandey, no run, smartly done by Thakur. Bangs the turf hard, gets it to rise at Pandey, who went for the pull and missed
SN Thakur to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, the ball is following Jaddu wherever he goes today. Short outside off, Pandey smacks it to the right of sweeper cover, two stolen
Dwayne Bravo to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slower ball, full on middle. Shaved off the pads to deep mid-wicket
Dwayne Bravo to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, this time they will settle for a single. Nudged softly to mid-wicket
Dwayne Bravo to Deepak Hooda, 2 runs, this is clever batting from Hooda. Just places this full ball into the gap in the leg-side and gets a brace again
Dwayne Bravo to Deepak Hooda, 2 runs, clipped away through mid-wicket and they race back for the second

Dwayne Bravo to Deepak Hooda, no run, Hooda has been given out LBW, he has a word with his partner and decides to review. Bravo's foot is way behind the line, so no problems with the no-ball. Moving on, looks like no bat as well. Ultra-Edge confirms it. HawkEye in - Pitching - In-line. Impact - In-line. Wickets - missing. Superb review from Hooda. It was full and spearing in, Hooda was shuffling across and misses the clip. Is thudded low on the pad, the on-field call was OUT and Hooda challenged it. Gets the decision in his favour in the end with the ball missing the leg-stump
Dwayne Bravo to Deepak Hooda, wide, Bravo loses his line and sprays it down leg

Dwayne Bravo to Deepak Hooda, 2 runs, slower delivery bowled fuller on off, Hooda gently taps it towards long-off. They run hard, take on Billing's arm and makes it in the end. A direct-hit at the bowler's end would've been interesting
SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, sliding on middle and leg, picked away in front of square on the leg-side
SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, FOUR, mid-off in the circle and Hooda goes over his head. Scrambled seam lengh delivery around off, Hooda backs away and gives charge to lift it over mid-off
SN Thakur to Manish Pandey, 1 run, touch fuller and Pandey drills it away to sweeper cover
SN Thakur to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, wristed away to long-on
SN Thakur to Manish Pandey, 1 run, poked softly to cover

SN Thakur to Williamson, out Caught by Dwayne Bravo!! Woah. Screamer from DJ Bravo. This wicket purely belongs to him. Two wickets in two balls for CSK and they are fighting back here. Both set-batsmen back in the hut. Thakur went wider of off, Williamson sliced it airly, there was a fielder at deep point. Bravo had to run across to his left, does so and brilliantly gobbles it up. He's a mighty fine fielder, breaks into a jig as well. Williamson c Dwayne Bravo b SN Thakur 51(39) [4s-5 6s-2]

Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, out Caught by Harbhajan!! The breakthrough has been achieved. End of the 123-run stand between Dhawan and Williamson. Bravo, the man, with the much-needed wicket for CSK. Change of pace deceives Dhawan, who was into his cheeky lap way too early. Had to generate some power to get it over short fine leg, couldn't and ended up hitting it straight to Harbhajan, who pouches it at the edge of the ring. Dhawan c Harbhajan b Dwayne Bravo 79(49) [4s-10 6s-3]
Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, 1 run, Bravo slips in a cutter on seeing Williamson advance. He make-shifts his back lift and pushes it away to long-off
Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, 1 run, push-drives it to cover

Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, FOUR, expertly done. Uses his quick-silver hands to direct this wide yorker into the third man fence. Gets his bat down in time and threaded the gap between short third man and backward point with perfection

Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, 1 run, and that's fifty for SRH's skipper Williamson. His 10th IPL fifty. Continuing from where he left off from the last game. Eases a single to long-off and reaches the milestone, raises his bat to soak in the applause from the dug-out
Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, FOUR, Bravo is welcomed to the crease with a boundary. Feeds it full, overpitches it a tad and Williamson makes him pay by cracking it through extra cover

Willey to Dhawan, no run, ends well does Willey. Wafts it too full outside off, Dhawan jams it out and in the process, the bottom part of his willow flies away into the off-side. Change of bat, please

Willey to Dhawan, FOUR, stand and dismiss stuff from Dhawan. Just admires the shot, knew the moment he connected it was a boundary. Willey serves it full, in the slot and Dhawan blasts it with ease to the long-off fence. The fielder was squarer and had no chance

Willey to Dhawan, FOUR, swings south does Dhawan. But the ball goes in the direction of north. He won't mind though as long as boundaries are coming. Shortish outside off, Dhawan goes hard and gets a thickish outside edge that flies away to the third man fence
Willey to Williamson, 1 run, corrects his length and keeps it short outside off. Williamson hops across and lifts it over point. Jaddu from sweeper cover cuts it off, keeping them down to a single
