Willey to Williamson, FOUR, 100-run stand comes up between the duo. Cross-seamer from Willey, but it's too full outside off. Can't bowl there with mid-off in the circle. Williamson leans forward and drills it over the fielder's head beautifully
Willey to Dhawan, 1 run, 133kph, Willey angles a length ball outside off, Dhawan deft-touches it to point for a quick single
Harbhajan to Dhawan, 1 run, now milks a single to long-off and keeps the strike. 16 came off it
Harbhajan to Dhawan, SIX, bread and butter for Dhawan. It looked as though he was waiting for it. Harbhajan drops a rank long hop, Dhawan sits back and smokes it over cow corner. Into the crowd

Harbhajan to Williamson, 1 run, "Catch it" was the shout from MS and Harbhajan, it drops short of the fielder at short third man. Williamson goes for the reverse and gets it off the glove. Luckily escapes
Harbhajan to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan treks back and nudges it into the vacant area at mid-wicket
Harbhajan to Williamson, 1 run, flatter outside off, Williamson reaches out and flays it to point

Harbhajan to Williamson, SIX, if Dhawan from other end is changing gears, Williamson decides to up the ante as well. Skips out, Harbhajan gives more flight. KW isn't to the pitch, but still goes through by getting his weight forward. Sends it soaring over long-off. All the way!
Jadeja to Dhawan, 2 runs, widish one and short in length, slapped to sweeper cover hard. Only for a couple of runs though as Billings cuts it down
Jadeja to Dhawan, SIX, what a shot to reach his fifty! Shortish delivery around off, Dhawan doesn't miss out on the opportunity and swings it over mid-wicket. Flat and over the ropes, she goes!
Jadeja to Williamson, 1 run, mistimes his punch to a shortish delivery,gets a single as it rolls to short mid
Jadeja to Dhawan, 1 run, flatter delivery around off, Dhawan plays the reverse paddle to find the man at short third man
Jadeja to Dhawan, no run, on a length outside off, Dhawan cuts it to the man at point
Jadeja to Williamson, 1 run, flatter one around off, driven down to long-off by Williamson
Watson to Williamson, 1 run, fullish delivery around off, Williamson stands tall and drills it down to long-on. Went to the man in the deep at the rate of knots
Watson to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, short one on leg, skids on after pitching, Dhawan tries for a tuck but the ball hits him on the thigh pad
Watson to Dhawan, wide, sprays it down the leg side, Dhawan fails to connect his flick, an easy decision for the umpire
Watson to Dhawan, no run, wasn't that a no-ball? It was well above his waist. Short and wide around off, Dhawan slaps it to the man at point
Watson to Williamson, 1 run, shortish delivery around off, Williamson goes back and guides it down to third man
Watson to Williamson, SIX, impressive! How well was this timed! Length ball on middle and leg, Williamson pulls it over square leg for a well timed six. Came right from the meat of his willow

Watson to Williamson, FOUR, the boundaries have started to flow. A good length delivery outside off, Williamson moves away and carves it over point. No chance for the fielder at third man to cut this down
Jadeja to Dhawan, no run, short and quick outside off, Dhawan looks to cut that away, gets beaten as the ball slids on
Jadeja to Dhawan, SIX, only a hit away from his fifty now. This was a full delivery outside off and Dhawan smoked it over long-on for half a dozen. Great shot by the southpaw
Jadeja to Williamson, 1 run, walks down the wicket and knocks the flatter delivery to long-off
Jadeja to Dhawan, 1 run, another 50-run stand up between these two. This was a short delivery and Dhawan pulled it down to long-on

Jadeja to Dhawan, FOUR, that was four the moment it was hit. A good length delivery around off, Dhawan is quick to camp back and punch it away. Beats the fielder at extra cover and the man at sweeper cover too
Jadeja to Williamson, 1 run, short and wide outside off, slapped to sweeper cover by Williamson off his back foot
Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, no run, full length delivery angled across the batsman, Dhawan shoulders arms to let it through to the keeper

Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, FOUR, poor effort by Bhajji near short fine leg. Perhaps he slipped there, hence couldn't stop the ball. This was a short one down the leg-side and Dhawan pulled it away, beating Harbhajan at short fine
Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, no run, on a length outside off, shaped away from the batsman, Dhawan leaves it alone
Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, 1 run, length delivery outside off, chipped over point for a single
Dwayne Bravo to Williamson, FOUR, finally a boundary of Williamson! That'll give him some relief. This was short one on leg, Williamson does well to drag it down to the fine leg fence
Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, 1 run, short of a length and well outside off, Dhawan slaps it away to sweeper cover
Dwayne Bravo to Dhawan, wide, full and wide outside off, Dhawan decides to leave it as it was outside that guide line

Watson to Williamson, no run, another dot ball. Only two runs of Watto's first over. This was a good length delivery around off, Williamson tried for a punch and got an inside edge, back to the bowler it rolls
Watson to Williamson, no run, Williamson is struggling today. Short of a length outside off, the batsman tries to hack it away but gets beaten due to the lack of bounce
Watson to Dhawan, 1 run, whips the length delivery down to long-on, only for a single

Watson to Williamson, 1 run, CSK fielders have been on their feet today. Have saved close to 10 runs already in this innings. This was short and wide outside off, Williamson slapped it hard but Jaddu's sprint and slide at sweeper cover was better than the shot
Watson to Williamson, no run, nudges the length delivery to the man at short mid. Two dots to start his spell
Watson to Williamson, no run, full length delivery outside off, shaping away from the batsman, Williamson goes for a cover drive but misses. Was very close to that outside edge

Chahar to Williamson, 1 run, Chahar ends with figures of 4-0-16-1. Not a bad spell, isn't it? This was a short delivery well outside off, Williamson connects his back foot punch but Billings does the rest near the fence. Saves a run for his team with his quick work at sweeper
Chahar to Dhawan, 1 run, steps down the track and bunts the short delivery in front of cover
Chahar to Dhawan, wide, another one down the leg side, full and swinging down, again Dhawan tries to flick that but as it was moving down, he failed to connect it
Chahar to Dhawan, wide, short and wayward down the leg side, Dhawan fails to connect his tuck

Chahar to Dhawan, FOUR, here it is! Finally a boundary against Chahar. This was a half-volley outside off, Dhawan is quick to lean ahead and cream his drive through cover. Beats the two fielders chasing to stop this from reaching the fence
Chahar to Williamson, 1 run, fullish delivery outside off, Williamson drives it away to sweeper cover and takes a single. Hasn't conceded a single boundary in this innings!
Chahar to Dhawan, 1 run, plays this with soft hands, it's a short delivery and Dhawan drops it to the left side of the pitch. Another quick run by the batsmen there
Chahar to Dhawan, no run, back of a length around middle and Dhawan knocks it back to the bowler

Harbhajan to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan plays the last ball of the over with soft hands. Nudges it in front of short mid-wicket and takes a run. Jaddu came running in from deep mid-wicket but Dhoni was quicker than him to reach there

Harbhajan to Williamson, 1 run, loopy delivery on middle and turning down leg, Williamson nurdles it to deep mid-wicket and calls for two. Billings is quick to sprint across, gather the ball and deny them the second
Harbhajan to Dhawan, 1 run, rocks back and pulls the short one down to long-on. Lot of bottom hand on that shot by Shikhar
Harbhajan to Dhawan, wide, pressure put on Bhajji. Spinning away but well outside off, Dhawan has nothing to do with it

Harbhajan to Dhawan, FOUR, well played! This was a tossed up delivery, Dhawan comes down the wicket and smokes it right over the bowler's head. Straight as an arrow, on a bounce and over the fence. Hit the cushions in fact
Harbhajan to Williamson, 1 run, 500 runs for Williamson in IPL 2018. Camp backs and slaps the shortish delivery to sweeper cover
Harbhajan to Dhawan, 1 run, starts off with a shorter one on leg, nudged into the on side by Dhawan for a single
Chahar to Dhawan, 1 run, comes down the wicket but as the ball moves away, Dhawan decides to squeeze it in front of point.

Chahar to Williamson, 1 run, short and wide outside off, Williamson throws his bat at it and gets an outside edge that flies down to third man. That was travelling and went on a bounce to the fielder in the deep
Chahar to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, length delivery with a bit of movement on leg, Dhawan goes for an on-side flick as the ball strikes him on the pads
Chahar to Dhawan, wide, shuffles a bit in the crease and distracts the bowler. Chahar bowls it on leg but it was swinging down the leg side and Dhawan failed to connect his glance
Chahar to Dhawan, no run, again sharp away movement on this length ball. Outside the off stump and Dhawan thinks it's better to leave it alone
Chahar to Williamson, leg byes, 1 run, short of a length on leg, Williamson fails to connect his tuck but the ball clips his pads and rolls to the keeper

Chahar to Williamson, no run, unplayable that ball was. Pitched outside the off-stump channel and swings away sharply. Williamson is in two minds there, but decides to withdraw from the shot on the last moment
SN Thakur to Williamson, 1 run, single to end the over. Back of a length around off, Williamson chops it down to third man and retains strike
SN Thakur to Williamson, no run, shaping away from the batsman well outside off, Williamson stays put and watches it sail through to the keeper
SN Thakur to Williamson, no run, short and wide outside off, cut to the man at point where a valiant effort saves a certain boundary
SN Thakur to Williamson, no run, hits the deck outside off, on a short length, Williamson looks to cut, gets an inside edge

SN Thakur to Williamson, FOUR, that's the form he is in. Picks the length early on the shortish delivery. He's quick to transfer his weight on to the back foot and pull it to perfection through mid-wicket. Made sweet sound of the willow as the ball met it
SN Thakur to Dhawan, 1 run, short of a length on middle and leg, Dhawan nudges it to short mid and calls for a quick single. Williamson obliges and gets to the striker's end in a jiffy
Chahar to Williamson, no run, exhibition of swing bowling by Chahar. Ends the over with an away swinger now as Williamson decides to leave it. Was a wise decision to let it through to the keeper
Chahar to Williamson, no run, shorish in length and snaking into the batsman, very late. Williamson is slow to connect his on-side flick and gets rapped on the thigh
Chahar to Williamson, no run, beats the SRH skipper with this away swinging delivery. That was wide outside off, Williamson tried to feel for it, got beaten all ends up

Chahar to Hales, out Caught by Raina!! First blow of the match for Sunrisers. His struggle finally comes to an end. Never looked comfortable at the crease. Throws his hands at an away swinging length ball and ends up chipping it straight to Raina at cover-point. He wont miss those and reverse cups it in that region. Another fine start for the pacer. How often have we seen him doing this? Hales c Raina b Chahar 2(9)
Chahar to Dhawan, 1 run, length delivery shaped away from the batsman, Dhawan steers it down to third man and hands over the strike to Hales

Chahar to Hales, 1 run, quick single there. This was a full length ball around off and Hales drove it to mid-off to scamper across. However, the throw came in at the striker's end and Dhawan was well in
Willey to Dhawan, no run, short one to end the over. Banged hard around his thigh, Dhawan tries a tuck but gets it off the leading edge to the left of Willey

Willey to Dhawan, FOUR, this one is even better. Full length ball outside off, Dhawan reaches for it and slaps it through the gap at extra-cover. The fielders on the off side had hardly any time to react
Willey to Dhawan, FOUR, that'll give him some confidence. Length delivery on middle, Dhawan stands tall and pummels this one over mid-wicket, that's a fine shot by the southpaw

Willey to Hales, 1 run, Hales gets off the mark finally. Not a convincing shot though. Went for a wild heave against a length delivery and got an inside edge on to the pads. As the ball rolled into the off side, the batsmen crossed over
Willey to Dhawan, 1 run, flicks the full length ball to short mid-wicket and takes a quick single
Willey to Dhawan, no run, short of a length outside off, punched to the man at cover by Dhawan
SN Thakur to Hales, no run, short one to end the over, Hales rocks back and blocks it. Again there was a bit of inward movement on that

SN Thakur to Dhawan, 1 run, back of a length on middle and leg, Dhawan comes down the wicket and tucks it to short mid-wicket for a quick single. There was a shy at the striker's end by Billings but failed to connect.
SN Thakur to Dhawan, no run, that's a sharp bouncer. Hits the deck hard and makes it bounce sharp. Dhawan sways away from the line of the delivery

SN Thakur to Dhawan, no run, two noises there, hence the lbw appeal turned down. Was bowled on a length around off and swung back in, Dhawan tried to flick that away, ended up getting an inside edge on to the pads. Hold on, the replays showed that this was hitting the leg stump. The two noises were of the ball clipping the back and front pad in succession. Lucky to get away with that, is Shikhar Dhawan
SN Thakur to Dhawan, no run, comes down the wicket and knocks the length delivery back to the bowler. That came in late

SN Thakur to Dhawan, FOUR, a french cut to get his first boundary. On a good length around off, shaping into the batsman. Dhawan tries to fend it late and ends up getting an inside edge. Past the leg stump and all the way to the fence she goes, in a jiffy.

Chahar to Hales, no run, an inswinger to end the over. Late swing on that. A perfect yorker on off as Hales brings his bat down in time and squeezes it out. Excellent opening over by Chahar. Has done it right throughout the tournament.
Chahar to Hales, no run, how easily he could have edged that. In that teasing channel outside off, moving away from the batsman, Hales looks to poke at it but misses
Chahar to Hales, no run, this came back in sharply. Hits the deck hard and it seams in. Hales does well to rock back and block it solidly
Chahar to Hales, no run, this was full again outside off, Hales reaches for it with a square drive but can't beat the man at point
Chahar to Hales, no run, pitches this one up outside the off-stump channel, a hint of away movement as Hales prods forward and pushes it to mid-off
Chahar to Dhawan, 1 run, gets off the mark immediately. Tucks the shortish delivery to the on side and sets off. Completes the single quite comfortably
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, SIX, Mumbai Buttler'ed at home. Slow ball sitting up and martyed over cow corner

Hardik Pandya to Samson, out Caught by (sub)Rahul Chahar!! With 4 needed, he goes for the glory hit and falls. Slow cutter, Samson went for the all-hands loft over cover and found Chahar in the deep. Samson c (sub)Rahul Chahar b Hardik Pandya 26(14) [4s-2 6s-2]
Hardik Pandya to Samson, no run, goes back to the off-pace delivery that dips right in front of Samson and deceives him

Hardik Pandya to Samson, SIX, this is a glorious glorious pull. Pandya just stares and walks back to the top of his mark. You do that when you've been pulled off the front foot, and the ball flies over deep mid-wicket

Hardik Pandya to Samson, SIX, that's flown off Samson's bat. He walks stone-faced to the middle of the pitch and punches gloves with Buttler. Slow ball sitting up and Samson mowing it over cow corner has to be a sight to behold
Hardik Pandya to Samson, no run, slices this low-wide ball outside off to point
McClenaghan to Buttler, FOUR, that's been muscled through long-on. Going against McClenaghan's angle from over the wicket and going through the line. One bounce and into the ropes. Just the 16 needed
McClenaghan to Buttler, no run, it was outside the tramline, this full ball, but Buttler shuffled across in his crease, so fair enough

McClenaghan to Samson, 2 wides, banged in too short, Samson doesn't even go for the pull. Stands, and Kishan behind the stumps jumps, gets the tip of his gloves and keeps it to just the single (plus the wide extra)
McClenaghan to Buttler, 1 run, back to over the wicket to Buttler. Bowls it slow and on a length, Buttler slaps it to long-off
McClenaghan to Samson, 1 run, he's standing outside off-stump here and gets a slow back of a length delivery from McClenaghan, that Samson inside-edges onto his body. Runs the single on offer
McClenaghan to Samson, no run, goes round the wicket to Samson and elicits an outside edge on the front foot drive. Scoots to backward point. It's a dot ball more importantly. 24 off 22
McClenaghan to Buttler, 1 run, bowls full and wide from over the wicket, and Buttler checks the push to long-off. Must have stopped on him
Markande to Buttler, 1 run, drags the length back and forces a shimmying Buttler into an unabitious nudge to long-on
Markande to Samson, 1 run, drawn on the front foot for a drive through to wide long-off

Markande to Samson, FOUR, he's joining the party. Very slow from Markande, trying to get Samson to miscue one, but doesn't on this occasion. Makes room, waits for the dip and lofts it over straight mid-on
Markande to Buttler, 1 run, was actually a delivery down leg but Buttler's managed to reverse-sweep it through covers. This man!
Markande to Samson, 1 run, nurdles it to backward square leg
Markande to Samson, FOUR, drifting on leg-stump and it's been cutely paddled away. Runs very fine, through keeper's left and runs for a boundary. Not a great start that by Markande
Bumrah to Samson, 1 run, back of a length and into the batsman, and Samson's happy to nudge it around for a single through mid-wicket. 37 off 30 now

Bumrah to Buttler, 1 run, 141ks this time and it bounces over the stumps.. off Buttler's inside edge. Angled it in nicely and then beat him with extra pace. Buttler in no position to even defend. Lays his dead bat out there, and survives
Bumrah to Buttler, SIX, and now one better. Swivels this time, and deposits the short ball over long leg this time. Game slipping, or has it already?

Bumrah to Buttler, FOUR, he's making a living out of his hands. Nicely keeps his weight distributed between front and back, so he can go either way. Opens the stance and swats this back of a length delivery over mid-wicket
Bumrah to Samson, 1 run, back of a length outside off at 140ks, Samson uses the pace and sends a single down to third man
Bumrah to Buttler, 1 run, stays put and punches this 142ks delivery through covers
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, cuts this slower delivery through cover-point. Nicely on his back foot to get on top of the bounce
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, 2 runs, backs away and lifts the slower delivery straight down the ground

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, FOUR, front leg is already out of the way, and this fuller delivery goes for a four. Just moved a little to the off-stump and opened his torso side-on, and goes through with the flat mow through long-on

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, SIX, not quite as pretty as those Dhoni's bottom-handed whips over long-on but this is good enough. Carries all the way. Takes on the seam-up length ball and muscles it across the line
Hardik Pandya to Samson, 1 run, short ball, pulled to fine leg

Hardik Pandya to Rahane, out Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! That's a crucial wicket. Rahane's found long-off, where SKY takes the catch and has a pratfall. Just lost his balance a bit and slipped backwards. Was a front footed power-punch but there's not enough wattage in the shot. So much for being a touch player. And here's Pandya picking a wicket just when you least expect him to. Rahane c Suryakumar Yadav b Hardik Pandya 37(36) [4s-4]

McClenaghan to Buttler, no run, that's a pretty slow ball but since it's been banged so short, it carries to Ishan Kishan at a good height. Buttler didn't play a great shot here. He's trying to fetch that swat-pull against McClenaghan's angle, and that after giving himself some room. Doesn't connect

McClenaghan to Buttler, no run, shuffles across and tries to pick that shortish delivery on leg-stump. But it's quick, and Buttler's taken a little bit too much time to wind-up on that shot. Dangerously past the glove but he'll live on for now

McClenaghan to Buttler, FOUR, some width on the cutter, and that cut shot creams past Lewis's dive at deep cover. Just slid through the ball there, cutting the trajectory at 90 degrees. Must be a good outfield

McClenaghan to Rahane, 1 run, that was quick. 141ks from McClenaghan and he finds Rahane on the front foot, trying to awkwardly pull this. Gets some thrust from the swivel and picks out a single to deep mid-wicket
McClenaghan to Rahane, no run, now the slower delivery. Swing into a pull but he's no way near connecting that. Past his left shoulder
McClenaghan to Rahane, no run, simply keeps it outside off and Rahane makes life tougher for himself. Backs away and then finds himself embarrasingly reaching for the ball. Couldn't

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, FOUR, five fifties in a row for Buttler in IPL 2018. He's equaled the record of Sehwag, who was harvesting runs for a living back in 2012. And what a way to get there. Backs away, exposes the stumps and slaps the ball from in front of them audaciously. Connects. Anyone who's near as good as Sehwag -- statiscally! -- will connect

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, 2 runs, they've taken two here. An ungainly slog across the line that takes Buttler's under-edge because it was off a slower delivery. Long-on runs across and cuts it off, but he's not quick enough. Rahane and Buttler are
Hardik Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, backward point opened through point

Hardik Pandya to Rahane, FOUR, a helluva lot happened off this one ball. Now Rahane was shaping to scoop, and Hardik Pandya nicely bowls the cutter wider of off-stump. Rahane adjusts though. Slices it, making the most of the room he had, but wasn't in control. Just cleared short third man's right-handed leap
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, that was a slower ball but corrupted by some width. Slashes through point

Hardik Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, they're all batting one way. Making room down leg, and Mumbai's bowlers are cramping them up with the angle. Another one here, this time executed by Hardik Pandya. It's a good ol' boring single to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Buttler, no run, he's using his arm-balls well. Hurries Buttler with the pace and stalls his room-making down leg. Hit on the thigh. More importantly, it's a dot. 83 off 9 overs
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, keeps strike to long-on

Krunal Pandya to Rahane, no run, Krunal has won here. Not with a wicket yet, but with a review. Implored Rohit, convinced him, and the captain yielded. On first sighting, that's going down leg. Arm-ball that Rahane's trying to sweep. Misses and is hit on the front pad. Ball-tracking suggests that the impact is on leg-stump, so with the left-armer's angle from round the wicket, that must be going down. Is actually. Not out. Review wasted.
Krunal Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, quicker arm-ball that's been pushed out to long-off
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, that's straightening a touch after pitching, but Rahane nicely sits low and swivels the half-sweep half-pull through backward square leg
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, no run, stops on with some turn on Rahane, who checks the shot to mid-on
Markande to Buttler, SIX, that ones with the crowd now. Big hit over long-on there. Markande bowls it a touch slow, and Buttler makes that last-minute room to chidingly loft it away
Markande to Buttler, 2 runs, quicker and fuller on seein' the shimmy, and Buttler finds himself too close to the pitch of the ball. Just two runs round the corner
Markande to Rahane, 1 run, picks the sweep from in front of middle-stump and places that in front of the square leg umpire
Markande to Buttler, 1 run, slow and loopy, with a tiny bit of drift into the batsman. Buttler waits for it to dip and then works a single through mid-wicket
Markande to Buttler, 2 runs, uses his feet and clips this flat delivery to mid-wicket for a couple of runs. Good running there. Nice and early call
Markande to Buttler, no run, very full on leg-stump, Buttler moves his front leg away and digs it out back to Markande
Krunal Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, another flat and quick arm-baller, Buttler is already making room -- which is why that delivery -- and picks a single to long-off
Krunal Pandya to Buttler, no run, that's crying for some Test match action, this delivery. Bounced right over middle-stump. Drifts in, turns away and beats Buttler's straight blade on the outside
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, follows him down leg with another arm-ball. Squeezed out to cover, Kishan takes the bails off but Rohit's throw isn't super quick. Buttler makes it in
Krunal Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, too early to back away there, is Buttler, and that allows Krunal Pandya tro fire it into him. Chopped to backward point in the end
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, pulled off the back foot to wide long-on. Just a touch short there
Krunal Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, onto middle and leg, Buttler pinches a single to long-off
Markande to Buttler, 1 run, quick single to vacant mid-off. Extra cover actually runs across and cuts it off. A flatter leg break, Buttler makes a little bit of room and punches it away
Markande to Rahane, 1 run, googly this time, but Rahane is good with his hands, Reads it off the pitch and hurries into a nudge to backward square leg
Markande to Buttler, 1 run, drifts it slow on leg-stump, worked to square leg
Markande to Buttler, no run, width shunted to point
Markande to Buttler, FOUR, a bit of flight and Buttler goes through the line. Weight on front foot and boom, it's flying over straightitsh long-on already
Markande to Rahane, 1 run, a low full toss in trying to bowl flat from over the wicket, Rahane pats it to long-on to bring the 50-run stand up

Bumrah to Buttler, FOUR, that was an attempted slower delivery but it turned out to be a full toss. Manjrekar on air said how he's never seen Bumrah bowl "such a slower ball." Anyway, Buttler makes a bit of room and thumps that to the fence through long-off
Bumrah to Rahane, 1 run, there's a close-in backward point but Rahane glides it wide of the man there. Using the pace. 3 singles off this over so far
Bumrah to Rahane, no run, he's deep into his crease to play this length ball. Taps it back to Bumrah softly
Bumrah to Rahane, no run, fullish and a touch outside off, Rahane crunches the push-defence to the cover fielder
Bumrah to Buttler, 1 run, saw Buttler's trigger across his stumps and angled it in full. Not much Buttler could do, except push it down to long-on
Bumrah to Rahane, 1 run, angles this in and concedes a single round the corner, only
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, no run, short delivery and it climbs over Buttler's attempted ramp. Good end to the over, just the 7 off it
Hardik Pandya to Buttler, no run, once again tries the paddle and once again is beaten. The off-cutter foxing him and going over the stumps

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, FOUR, that's more like it. Stand and deliver. Gets a length ball in his arc and he gives it his all. In fact it was the knuckle ball and Buttler dispatched it straight back over Hardik

Hardik Pandya to Buttler, no run, oh! That almost kissed the stumps. Buttler walked across to play the scoop, but Hardik had removed the pace off the ball and it does not arrive, no connection made and it lobs over the stumps
Hardik Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, change of pace and Rahane waits to play the clip to deep square leg
Hardik Pandya to Rahane, 2 runs, back of a length and Rahane had the room to play the back foot punch, Cutting at sweeper cover cuts it off
Krunal Pandya to Buttler, no run, once again moves around before staying leg-side, squeezes the drive to cover-point
Krunal Pandya to Buttler, no run, makes room and carves the punch straight to Rohit at extra cover, slight fumble but no risk taken

Krunal Pandya to Buttler, SIX, just over Hardik. The slog sweep and Buttler almost found the only man in the deep on the leg-side, shuffled across and mistimed the sweep towards deep mid-wicket. Hardik jumped but the ball was well over him

Krunal Pandya to Buttler, FOUR, wow! That is a fine shot. Moved away to leg and even a dragged back length didn't deter him, went up and over the infield off the back foot. A very difficult shot to play but Buttler made it look easy
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, quicker and Rahane nudges it to deep mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, no run, on middle and leg, Rahane sweeps and finds Markande at backward square
McClenaghan to Buttler, no run, width offered and Buttler slaps it straight to Cutting at mid-off. Missed out there
McClenaghan to Rahane, 1 run, angled across off and Rahane punches it to wide of mid-off

McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, second boundary and it is to the same area. This was not on leg-stump, but straight enough for Rahane to glance it wristily past short fine leg, just used the pace on the ball

McClenaghan to Rahane, no run, bouncer around leg-stump, Rahane takes it on and the ball climbs over his hook shot, McClenaghan goes up for a caught behind and Kishan joins in, umpire Ravi is unmoved though
McClenaghan to Rahane, wide, once again McClenaghan loses his radar while bowling the slower delivery, down leg and called

McClenaghan to Rahane, no run, banged in and at the batsman, Rahane arched back to play the ramp over short third man, the angle does not come and he is hit on the glove, the ball drops safely near his feet
McClenaghan to Rahane, FOUR, wrong lines. Off-cutter down leg, Rahane tickles it fine past short fine leg. The fast outfield does the rest
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, slower and Rahane works it with the angle towards mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, pushed it through and Buttler is content with a tap into the on-side

Krunal Pandya to Buttler, no run, took it on the half volley. Buttler shuffled across his sticks and played the sweep uppishly to backward square leg, the ball was dipping in front of Markande, he scoops it up after the ball had bounced
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, nice and slow, Rahane greets it with soft hands, into the off-side and Buttler calls him through
Krunal Pandya to Buttler, 1 run, flatter and on leg, knocked with a straight bat to mid-wicket
Krunal Pandya to Rahane, 1 run, round the wicket and drifts on the pads, nudged away towards mid-wicket
McClenaghan to Rahane, leg byes, 1 run, on the hips and Rahane doesn't make contact with the flick, off the thigh pad and into the leg-side
McClenaghan to Rahane, no run, another change up and Rahane watchfully turns it to short mid-wicket
McClenaghan to Buttler, 1 run, off-cutter grips the surface and foils Buttler's attempted drive, inside edge rolls away to deep mid-wicket
McClenaghan to Buttler, wide, bouncer down leg, Buttler has nothing to do with it, called a wide for height
McClenaghan to Rahane, 1 run, back of a length on off, Rahane ekes out an inside edge in front of square leg
McClenaghan to Buttler, 1 run, change of pace and on the legs, glanced to fine leg
McClenaghan to Buttler, no run, back of a length around off, Buttler blocks it into the off-side

Bumrah to Rahane, FOUR, cracking shot! Losing Short might not be the worst thing happening for Rajasthan. Brings Rahane in early and he likes the new ball coming on. Pitched up outside off, Rahane leans forward and creams the drive through the packed off-side field. Off the mark in style

Bumrah to D Arcy Short, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Short is gone. He's had a forgettable IPL season. Could not play spin and now has succumbed to pace as well. Back of a length and seaming away around off, Short goes feeling for the ball and the outside edge is found, it was carrying to first slip, but Kishan decides to dive across and glove it. The much needed early breakthrough for Mumbai. D Arcy Short c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 4(5) [4s-1]
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, no run, shortens the length and Short stands tall before patting it to point
Bumrah to D Arcy Short, no run, once more back of a length and on off, Short blocks it back to Bumrah

Bumrah to D Arcy Short, no run, much better. Dragged back length and gets it to seam away, Short is stuck to the crease and has a needless poke at that. The angle keeps taking it away from the bat, beaten on the outside edge

Bumrah to D Arcy Short, 5 wides, now this is a poor follow-up delivery from Bumrah. He just turns back and walks away. Sprays this way down leg, it didn't even land on the 22-yard strip, no chance for Kishan as well

Bumrah to D Arcy Short, FOUR, streaky! Bumrah thought he had his man, so did Rohit. An curling low full toss right at the stumps, Short does extremely well to bring his bat down and squirt it off the inside edge to the fine leg fence. He was a goner had he missed
Stokes to Cutting, 2 runs, change of pace once again from Stokes and Cutting flat-bats it to wide long-on, some work for the fielder to do and the pair race back for the second. MI finish with 168

Stokes to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Samson!! Stunner from Samson. Wow! The replays show it to be even better. Should be in the top five list. Full and angled in, Pandya whips it with plenty of bottom hand towards deep mid-wicket, Samson runs across to his right, but the ball seemed to be out his reach, that is when he decides to put in the full length dive and the ball sticks in his right hand when he is parallel to the ground. Simply superb! Hardik Pandya c Samson b Stokes 36(21) [4s-3 6s-2]
Stokes to Hardik Pandya, no run, tries to repeat the shot, but this time Stokes ensures that he keeps it away from him, down leg without any pace and Pandya can't make any connection on the scoop

Stokes to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, premeditated. Pandya shuffled across early and Stokes smartly dragged his length back, Pandya still went through with his paddle and got the faintest of connection to beat Buttler to his left
Stokes to Cutting, leg byes, 1 run, conventional length ball and Cutting misses the hoick to the on-side, off the pad and to short third. Struck him well down leg and hence no appeal for LBW
Stokes to Cutting, SIX, Cutting making RR pay for the drop catch. Stokes is slower ball is right in the slot, Cutting delayed his shot for a second and hammered it with a clean swing over long-on

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, no run, bumper following the backing away batsman, Pandya tries a last second ramp, but that is after the ball had flown past him. Good end to the over after conceding 17 off the first three

Unadkat to Cutting, 1 run, dropped! Archer puts down a sitter. Warne is livid in the dugout but he isn't showing any emotions. Cutting was deceived completely by the slower delivery and miscues the big hit towards point, Archer was a bit too casual with his approach and hence spills it

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, in the air and safe. That is the right length to bowl the slower ball - back of a length, Pandya toe-ends the pull and skies it in front of deep mid-wicket, Short couldn't get there in time. Lucky!

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, SIX, Unadkat is dishing out freebies. Another nice juicy full toss outside off, just the right amount of width for Pandya to tonk the loft over extra cover. He didn't overhit; just a lift and off she went into the crowd. 17 already off the over
Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, wide, pressure, pressure! Fired it full and outside off, away from the tramline and the umpire penalizes him

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, now the attempted wide yorker goes wrong, full toss outside off, Pandya crouches a bit and slices it deliberately over backward point, one bounce and over the fence. Wankhede finds its voice again..

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, SIX, into the second tier. Unadkat is predictable with his change of pace and Pandya was waiting for it, cleared his front leg and smashed it straight back over the sightscreen. Mumbai need plenty more of this

Jofra Archer to Cutting, no run, a sniffer at 147ks, Cutting was walking towards the ball and then realised he has to sway away, does so in the nick of time and drops his gloves as well. Another fine outing for Archer, ends with 4-0-16-2. He was the one who started Mumbai's slide
Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, length ball and Pandya has missed out, he lined up for the big mow but went a bit too hard, dragged it off the inner portion of the bat to deep mid-wicket
Jofra Archer to Cutting, 1 run, shortish length outside off and Cutting gives the strike back to Pandya with a steer to third man
Jofra Archer to Cutting, no run, full toss and Cutting timidly turns it to short mid-wicket. Mumbai have missed out on quite a few full tosses today
Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, pounds it short on middle, Pandya runs it down to third man
Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, no run, back of a length on off, blocked back to Archer
Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, wide, slower delivery gone wrong, down leg and wide called
Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, whipped away with a lot of bottom hand through vacant mid-wicket, retains strike

Unadkat to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Gowtham!! Gowtham juggles but manages to hang on. Krunal never looked in. Yes, seven deliveries is enough to judge that. The off-cutter from Unadkat, Pandya had to for the heave and all he could do was sky it up towards long-on. Gowtham settled under it and almost made a mess. Luckily for him it didn't go far from his body and he took it on the second attempt. Krunal Pandya c Gowtham b Unadkat 3(7)

Unadkat to Krunal Pandya, no run, Unadkat might have gotten away with this. Another banged in delivery and it flies past Pandya's flashing blade, umpire Ravi signals this as one for the over. Then what was the last one?
Unadkat to Krunal Pandya, no run, bouncer right at the batsman, Pandya ducked and immediately looked at the square leg umpire, height is fine and that will be one for the over

Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, back of a length and Pandya dabs it to short third man, Krunal calls for the run and had to real sprint, a direct hit from Kulkarni migth have had him short at the striker's end
Unadkat to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, charges down to make his own pace and Unadkat offers a bit of width as well, slapped square on the off-side and calls for the second, good running from the duo

Jofra Archer to Krunal Pandya, no run, crunched straight to Stokes. Pandya made room and got the perfect length to free his arms, creams the drive straight to mid-off. Disappointed and he thuds his bat into the pad
Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, slower and Pandya is happy with a steer to third man
Jofra Archer to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, uses the incoming angle to glide a single down to third man
Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, off-pace short of length delivery, Pandya waits and waits before swatting it to deep square leg
Jofra Archer to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, speared in full and at the stumps, Pandya eases it to long-on
Jofra Archer to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, back of a length close to off, Pandya knocks it to sweeper cover
Stokes to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, fuller and around off, Pandya plays the on-drive uppishly and it races quickly to long-on
Stokes to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, short of length around the hips, tucked past the square leg umpire
Stokes to Krunal Pandya, wide, sprays it down leg, too far down to connect with the glance, wide called
Stokes to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, angling into the pads, flicked to deep square leg
Stokes to Hardik Pandya, no run, sent back. Good call from the elder Pandya. Hardik tapped it in front of point and set off, Krunal wasn't interested and sent his brother back in the nick of time

Stokes to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Samson!! Another one down. What are you doing Mumbai? From 86/0 they have slipped to 119/4. Slower short of length delivery and Kishan didn't have the required room to free his arms on the pull shot, miscues it towards deep mid-wicket. Samson almost overran it, but then leaped back and took it reverse cup. Ishan Kishan c Samson b Stokes 12(11) [4s-1]
Stokes to Ishan Kishan, no run, round the wicket and angled in from back of a length, Kishan checks his flat-bat slap to cover

D Kulkarni to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, cheeky! He plays this shot quite a lot, does Pandya. Banged in and the line being outside off allowed Pandya to periscope the ramp to the third man fence. Got it fine enough to beat the fielder
D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, back of a length and Kishan tucks it through mid-wicket

D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, not timed, but Kishan will collect the boundary. Rushed him with a short delivery and Kishan took it on, pulls off the splice and once it clears the fielder at mid-wicket, the lightning fast outfield does the rest

D Kulkarni to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, Rahane hit the bulls-eye from cover and Pandya did extremely well to get back in, especially without the bat. On a length around off, Kishan defends to cover and Pandya was backing up, the bat slips out of his hand and goes to ground, but he makes it back with a stretch of his wiry legs

D Kulkarni to Lewis, out Caught by Samson!! Big wicket for Rajasthan. A well-set Lewis throws it away. Kulkarni is delighted and his hands arm up. He had a chat with Unadkat before this delivery and whatever it was, it has worked. Nothing but an away angler outside off, Lewis throws his hands at that and slices it towards sweeper cover, Samson covers ground to his right and clings on to a good catch. Royals fighting back after that opening partnership. Lewis c Samson b D Kulkarni 60(42) [4s-4 6s-4]

D Kulkarni to Lewis, SIX, welcome back Kulkarni! Off-speed delivery and Lewis picked the bones out of that, spotted it early and powered straight back over the bowler. He then stood and admired that shot
Stokes to Ishan Kishan, no run, clears his front leg, as if to go inside-out. The length's too full though, has to make his peace with a jam out to mid-off
Stokes to Lewis, 1 run, 140.5kph, too hard on a swat, ungainly, but a single nevertheless to long-on
Stokes to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, 134.3kph. Too leg-sided. Glanced away easily, getting onto his toes in getting it to deep square leg
Stokes to Lewis, 1 run, gives himself room. But Stokes follows him in. Slapped in the end, through sweeper
Stokes to Lewis, no run, 135.5kph, hoppy shuffle, bunting it into the pitch
Stokes to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, turned away, using the angle to take it behind square
Gowtham to Lewis, SIX, full toss. Talk about ruining a quiet over under the radar. Lewis has his muscles blowing them out of here. 88 meters into the stands behind the sightscreen. And it's a fifty

Gowtham to Lewis, wide, slipping down leg, holding the line too. Lewis tries sweeping, and then has to deal with a loud distracting appeal for a strangle down leg. The umpire is smart, experienced to see through these
Gowtham to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, forward, low with a wristy knock to mid-on
Gowtham to Ishan Kishan, no run, in with the arm. Kishan needs a block to calm down the madness
Gowtham to Lewis, 1 run, ugly front legged pull, one-bounced to long-on
Gowtham to Lewis, no run, some grip around middle, Lewis' closed up early, leading-edging it back
Gowtham to Lewis, no run, wide, flat, turning away. Lewis leaves for the wide .. no, he isn't getting these
Jofra Archer to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, 146.1kph. Pitched up, outside off, a careful open-faced drive through sweeper

Jofra Archer to Rohit, out Caught by Unadkat!! And another. Oh Rohit can't score against the Royals .. it's certified. A golden duck in Jaipur. A golden one now. Archer's bouncer ploy consumes him, with Rohit being the compulsive puller going through with the swivelling flat-bat, timing it rather well in fact, but just not right when fine leg is that square. Another wobble, carrying on from the SMS? Rohit c Unadkat b Jofra Archer 0(1)

Jofra Archer to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Unadkat!! All it required was for Archer to come back. Bends his back, digs it into the surface, climbing into Yadav, who given the pace is predictably late into his pull. Off the splice and Unadkat at fine leg almost makes a mess -- loses it in the light, spots it very late and plucks it right off the grass. Suryakumar Yadav c Unadkat b Jofra Archer 38(31) [4s-7]
Jofra Archer to Lewis, leg byes, 1 run, 147.2kph. Cramps him up from wide of the round the wicket crease. Past the glance, off the hips, behind square
Jofra Archer to Lewis, no run, a one-legged front pull. Again, without timing to mid-off
Jofra Archer to Lewis, no run, 114.3kph. Now that's new. Lewis guides, tries, but point intercepts with his dive
Unadkat to Lewis, 1 run, good slower ones, Lewis sets himself for a slog across the line. Well the slog's alright, only without timing to deep square leg
Unadkat to Lewis, no run, 117kph. Slower again, into the pitch in that back of a length spot. Stabbed away to point
Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, 120.3kph, a touch hard for the ball's liking, drilling it off the inside half, straight down the ground
Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, that backlift. And then that drive on the up. So damn predictable. With mid-off in the circle, these are serious runs being leaked
Unadkat to Lewis, 1 run, 137.6kph. In the blockhole, whippy dig out here to long-on
Unadkat to Lewis, no run, sucker slower cutter outside off. Lewis doesn't read, flays, half-heartedly to pull it back in
Shreyas Gopal to Lewis, 1 run, moves away, trying to open up the off-side. An under-chop in the end
Shreyas Gopal to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, pulls the length back. Allows Yadav to get behind the line to punch it back
Shreyas Gopal to Lewis, 1 run, defensively on the legs, lets him out with a single, round the corner
Shreyas Gopal to Lewis, 2 runs, jabs it out to cover. Now there's nobody backing up too .. oh dear
Shreyas Gopal to Lewis, SIX, on the move, Gopal corrects on middle, but Lewis' gone over extra cover. Throws every cell in his body into this hoick
Shreyas Gopal to Lewis, SIX, the launch. Can't bowl down leg, not a googly either. Knee, slog, sweep, backward square leg. It's flatly powerful enough to damage a billboard
Unadkat to Lewis, 1 run, slowed up, carved away to third man
Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, 123.2kph, wristed down the ground, walking as he does it
Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, feet stay stuck, hands hard on the cut, nearly chops it back on
Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, nothing two-paced when you grant out a friendly overpitch. Lovely bat swing, opening up the gap over mid-off and timing the pants off it .. inside-out slap
Unadkat to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, sticking into the surface as Yadav loads up a cut. Doesn't get the timing right
Unadkat to Lewis, 1 run, 120.3kph, on a good length, fourth-stumpish. Lewis stays his ground, sticking his bat out, outside-edging it to third man
Shreyas Gopal to Lewis, 1 run, 87.5kph, dragged down. Mows, in front of square

Rajpoot to Kohli, FOUR, RCB have demolished KXIP! Not the fairytale big hit to finish but a boundary nevertheless. Short ball and Kohli only manages a top edge on the pull. Gets it comfortably over a leaping Rahul and that's the end of that

Rajpoot to Kohli, no ball, dropped at long-off but wouldn't have mattered because it was a waist-high full toss. Kohli mistimed the loft and found the fielder who spilled it. Strange that they didn't take the run, because that would have ended the game
Andrew Tye to Kohli, 1 run, ahh, an anti-climax for the crowd who were waiting for the big shot. So was I. Very full and on middle and off, Kohli checks his punchy drive down to long-on
Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, slower and shortish on middle and leg, pulled away behind square leg. Brings Kohli back on strike. Can he finish it with a big hit?

Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, back to normal pace and Tye suffers. Shortish length and Parthiv waits to ramp it just wide of Rahul. Got it very fine and third man had no chance. Just a hit away now
Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, no run, three slower ones in a row. Parthiv was making room to heave it away. Lost his shape in the end and was nowhere near
Andrew Tye to Kohli, 1 run, another off-pace delivery, Kohli charged down the track for the big shot. Mistimes it down to long-off
Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, slower good length ball well outside off, Parthiv glides it towards third man for a single
Stoinis to Kohli, FOUR, fantastic placement. A trifle too short from Stoinis and Kohli clobbers the pull by standing up tall. Splits deep mid-wicket and long-on with precision
Stoinis to Parthiv Patel, leg byes, 1 run, optimistic LBW appeal, pitched outside leg though. Fuller around leg, Parthiv looks to force it away on the leg-side but wears it on the pads

Stoinis to Parthiv Patel, 2 runs, in the air....just short! Mayank at deep mid-wicket charged forward but in the end, probably didn't time the run well. Eventually, the dive wasn't enough as it sneaked past him. Short of a length ball and Parthiv mistimed the pull completely
Stoinis to Kohli, 1 run, angling in from a shortish length, whipped away down towards long-on

Stoinis to Kohli, FOUR, sublime, really sublime. Oh, he is making this look like an exhibition match. Short of a length, a touch wide and he stands tall to punch it beautifully through backward point. Timed it so sweetly
Stoinis to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, banged in short outside off, flat batted away down the ground towards long-on

Andrew Tye to Kohli, SIX, that's dumped over long-off. RCB cantering away to victory. Just a few blows away if they go at this rate. Too full from Andrew and it's criminal with mid-off up. Kohli launches it over the infield and it goes away for a flat maximum
Andrew Tye to Kohli, FOUR, deft touch from Kohli. Pacy back of a length delivery, he just waits on it and dabs it late. Only had to beat the short third man fielder and he did it with ease
Andrew Tye to Kohli, no run, the effort ball from Tye, dug in short and Kohli sways away from it

Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, stifled LBW shout but that pitched outside leg and there was a faint inside edge as well. Fuller ball around leg, Parthiv wanted to whip it away. Trickles through square leg
Andrew Tye to Kohli, 1 run, full and angling into Kohli who dishes out a punchy drive down to long-on
Andrew Tye to Kohli, no run, walks down the track for the booming drive but has to check his stroke a bit. Finds cover

Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, this has been pummelled away. Banged in short by Mohit and this is the normal pace delivery, sits up nicely for Parthiv who swats the pull through backward square leg. The man from deep square did try hard to get to it but was never going to reach it in time

Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, good adjustment from Parthiv. Seemed like he was early on this slower bouncer but then decided to just control it. Got it wide of short fine leg and that was enough. Brings up the 50 as well
Mohit Sharma to Kohli, 1 run, full and angling in on middle and leg, whipped away past mid-wicket
Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, banged in short and Parthiv was late on the pull. Gets it off the glove and it rolls in front of short fine leg

Mohit Sharma to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, crunched away! Full and quite wide outside off, right up Parthiv's street and he feasts on it. Unfurls a lovely square drive through cover-point. Blazed away in a flash
Mohit Sharma to Kohli, 1 run, starts with a back of a length cutter, Kohli forces it away by standing tall. Towards deep mid-wicket
Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, no run, off the inside edge and it trickles towards short fine leg. Not that wide but Parthiv chose to slash hard. Lucky not to chop on

Andrew Tye to Kohli, leg byes, 1 run, Kohli survives easily in the end. Looked closer to the naked eye but when KXIP reviewed it, Hawk Eye showed it to be missing leg stump comfortably. Fuller ball that angled into Kohli, he was on the shuffle and missed the flick. Looked really close initially, not to be
Andrew Tye to Kohli, no run, dug in short this time and Kohli just sways away from it
Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, fractionally short in length and Parthiv wanted to flat-bat the pull. Mistimed towards mid-on
Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, no run, another slower ball and Parthiv fails to connect. Backed away a touch to slash it away hard but couldn't get bat on it
Andrew Tye to Kohli, 1 run, the canny slower ball from Tye and Kohli is forced to check his shot. He was on the charge to play the big shot and eventually just pushed it softly towards extra cover
Rajpoot to Parthiv Patel, no run, beaten! Good ball from Rajpoot. This was angling across the left-hander from a good length, climbed a bit off the deck to whiz past the outside edge

Rajpoot to Kohli, 1 run, dropped! Finch the culprit at mid-off, was late to trek backward and in the end, he did get a hand on it but spilled it. Low full toss from Rajpoot that Kohli mistimed. The loft came off the toe end and eventually, he got lucky. Second life for the skipper

Rajpoot to Kohli, FOUR, he is on the charge, is Kohli. He doesn't want to let this opportunity of a crushing win slip. Charges down the track and makes some room for this good length delivery. Slaps it away over point comfortably
Rajpoot to Kohli, wide, strays well down the leg-side with this one, Kohli tried to glance it away but missed. Good diving one-handed take by Rahul
Rajpoot to Kohli, no run, angling into Kohli who was backing away just a bit. Adjusts to tap it towards mid-wicket. The RCB skipper wants to finish this as quickly as possible
Rajpoot to Kohli, FOUR, hammered away. Cannot bowl that length at this pace to Kohli. He'll punish you all night. Back of a length from Rajpoot and it's pulled away wide of mid-on. All too easy

Rajpoot to Kohli, SIX, look at the swagger on this shot! With due respect to Rajpoot, the man facing him is just too good. Full and in the slot, it's in the arc for Kohli who nonchalantly clubs this into the stands at cow corner. Cold welcome for the young man

Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, 2 runs, poor from KXIP. Should have been just a single but an overthrow allows the second as well. Short of a length delivery that Parthiv guided towards backward point. There was a slight fumble that allowed the single and Mayank's throw at the keeper's end was wayward. Allowed the second with ease

Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, that's a signature Parthiv Patel stroke. Not all that full but there was width and that's what the southpaw loves. Uses his quick hands to power it on the up through the gap at cover
Andrew Tye to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, gift for Parthiv and he accepts it with glee. Tye strays on the pads with a half-volley, easily glanced away down to the fine leg fence

Andrew Tye to Kohli, 1 run, direct hit would have been close! Ashwin was the fielder at mid-on but couldn't hit the target. Yes, Kohli was a goner if it had hit. Fuller ball that was wristed past the bowler. VK had timed it too well and took the KXIP captain for granted the single. Nearly cost him
Andrew Tye to Kohli, no run, short of a length and Kohli times the back foot punch nicely. Finds backward point
Andrew Tye to Kohli, no run, soft leading edge towards cover-point. Fullish and on off, Kohli was a tad early into the flick
Ashwin to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Parthiv decides to get a move on. On the shorter side from Ashwin and it's leg stumpish as well. Pulled away through the gap between mid-wicket and mid-on. Races away
Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, floats it up around middle and leg, nudged gently in front of square through the leg-side
Ashwin to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, a fraction short and Parthiv sits back to crunch it to the left of extra cover
Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, slower this time and outside off, Kohli reaches out and works it away down the ground to long-on
Ashwin to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, the slider that skids off the track, in line of the stumps and it's bunted down to long-off
Ashwin to Kohli, 1 run, starts with a drifter onto the pads, fullish and Kohli works it through mid-wicket to get the chase underway

Moeen Ali to Axar, out Rajpoot Run Out!! 1 run completed. KXIP have been bowled out for 88. Axar wanted to keep the strike and pushed Rajpoot for a non-existent second. In fact, it was Rajpoot who wanted the second. Axar worked the flatter delivery towards wide long-on, he was content with the single but upon seeing Rajpoot charge across, he relcutantly went for it, nice flat throw right next to the stumps from Southee and Mo did the rest. Rajpoot run out (Southee/Moeen Ali) 1(5)
Siraj to Rajpoot, no run, fuller and attacking the stumps, Rajpoot manages to keep it out with a push to cover
Siraj to Axar, 1 run, short of length angled across, Axar flat-bats the pull to long-on
Siraj to Axar, wide, sprays it down leg and Axar fails to meet with the glance, wide given
Siraj to Rajpoot, 1 run, spears it in almost close to the blockhole, Rajpoot digs it to mid-on and sets off, Southee was a tad slow to react and he misses the direct hit as well
Siraj to Rajpoot, no run, fuller in length and Rajpoot has another swish and miss, he is nowhere close to the ball
Siraj to Rajpoot, no run, Rajpoot is not going to hang around, looks to take on the back of a length delivery and fails to connect
Siraj to Rajpoot, no run, good length ball just outside off, Rajpoot forces it towards backward point

Moeen Ali to Mohit Sharma, out Mohit Sharma Run Out!! A typical number 10 run-out. Mohit works the off-break past mid-wicket, but was not sure whether to go for the run or not, he decides late and AB from mid-wicket runs back, slides and fires a throw to Mo, who deflects the ball onto the stumps. Brilliant bit of work from AB and Mo. Mohit Sharma run out (de Villiers/Moeen Ali) 3(5)
Moeen Ali to Mohit Sharma, no run, floated up outside off, Mohit drives uppishly but well short of mid-off
Moeen Ali to Axar, 1 run, drifting in and Axar uses the round the wicket angle to deep mid-wicket
Moeen Ali to Mohit Sharma, 1 run, shortens the length and is picked away through square leg
Moeen Ali to Axar, 1 run, flighted and Axar is content with a forward push to long-off
Moeen Ali to Mohit Sharma, 1 run, nudged with the spin to the right of mid-wicket

U Yadav to Axar, no run, on a length and angled across, Axar pushes it meekly towards cover. Umesh is done for the night and what a spell from him, he broke the back bone by removing Rahul and Gayle in one over and then returned to nip out Tye, 4-0-23-3
U Yadav to Mohit Sharma, 1 run, back of a length around off, Mohit eases it in front of square on the off-side

U Yadav to Andrew Tye, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! What happened there? Looks like Tye wanted to review. But he's walking back. Not sure what happened. Banged in and with Umesh's pace the ball climbs up awkwardly, Tye goes for the pull and a faint top-edge settles into Parthiv's mitts. Did he run out of time to review? That might be the only reason. Nonetheless, there was a sound as the ball passed the bat. Andrew Tye c Parthiv Patel b U Yadav 0(3)

U Yadav to Andrew Tye, no run, oh! That was a peach. Flies over the off-stump. Back of a length and the delivery holds its line, Tye plays down the wrong line and is beaten neck and crop on the outside edge
U Yadav to Andrew Tye, no run, full and attacking the stumps, Tye pushes it back watchfully
U Yadav to Axar, 1 run, back of a length around the hips, tucked away to deep square leg

Moeen Ali to Ashwin, out Ashwin Run Out!! That's what wickets and pressure do. There was never a single in it and Ashwin wanted the run, Axar was tad late in sending him back and the skipper's dive was in vain. Nothing but a tossed up delivery which Ashwin taps to the left of cover, Axar took a step out before aborting from the run. And with Ashwin not being the swiftest he was always in trouble. Put in a desperate dive but was still short by some distance. Ashwin run out (Negi/Parthiv Patel) 0(1)

Moeen Ali to Finch, out Caught by Kohli!! Moeen Ali strikes. Each of Kohli's moves have paid off today. Brought in Siraj got a wicket, de Grandhomme did the same and Moeen Ali follows. Bit of air on this one and Finch is down on one knee to play the slog sweep, does not get the required elevation to clear deep mid-wicket and finds Kohli to perfection. The skipper had moved himself there after the third ball. KXIP slip further and their chances of getting a good total are gone with Finch. Finch c Kohli b Moeen Ali 26(23) [4s-1 6s-2]
Moeen Ali to Axar, 1 run, flatter and outside off, punched to long-off
Moeen Ali to Finch, 1 run, once more drops it short and Finch doesn't get hold of the pull shot, on the bounce to Siraj at deep mid-wicket
Moeen Ali to Finch, no run, turning in and Finch chops it to the left of Mo, but it was Mandeep who got across from extra cover to stop the single

Moeen Ali to Finch, SIX, welcome to the attack Moeen Ali! Dragged back length and Finch makes room to thump the pull over deep mid-wicket. That is a monster hit from the Aussie and he remains the key for KXIP
de Grandhomme to Axar, no run, back of a length and Axar pushes it back, de Grandhomme dives across to parry it to cover
de Grandhomme to Finch, 1 run, full and on leg-stump, flicked away to deep mid-wicket
de Grandhomme to Finch, no run, once again drifts down leg and gets away with it, Finch tickles it off the pads to Parthiv
de Grandhomme to Axar, 1 run, slants the length delivery across, Axar drives on the up towards sweeper cover
de Grandhomme to Finch, 1 run, harmless short of length delivery and Finch knocks it in front of square on the off-side
de Grandhomme to Finch, wide, sprays it down leg and Finch has nothing to do with it, second wide for de Grandhomme
de Grandhomme to Axar, 1 run, on a length around off, driven down the ground and Southee from mid-off tidies up with a slide
Chahal to Axar, 1 run, too full on the pads, clipped away into the on-side for a single as the man from cow corner hauls it back
Chahal to Finch, 1 run, treks back and punches the ball away through the off-side for a single
Chahal to Finch, no run, fuller length and has been defended into the off-side off the front foot
Chahal to Axar, leg byes, 1 run, tries to land the quicker one with in the sticks but ends up landing it outside leg. The batsman misses the clip and the ball trims the pads away into the on-side
Chahal to Finch, 1 run, slides on to the pads, clipped away into the on-side for a single
Chahal to Finch, no run, flattish ball on the sticks, cut away to the man at point. Again no real turn on it
de Grandhomme to Axar, no run, length ball on the pads and knocked away into the on-side

de Grandhomme to Mayank Agarwal, out Caught by Parthiv Patel!! It cannot get any worse for KXIP and Mayank Agarwal. He is having a terrible season and has only dashed the hopes of a KXIP revival in this game as well. Gentle delivery on the pads and the batsman ended up nicking it to the keeper. The keeper went up almost instantly and RCB have their man. Mayank Agarwal c Parthiv Patel b de Grandhomme 2(6)
de Grandhomme to Mayank Agarwal, no run, shortish ball, flat-bats the pull away towards mid-on. That again did not come on to the bat at a pace at which he wanted it to
de Grandhomme to Finch, 1 run, leading edge and lands no where. No at silly mid-on and they eke out a single. Length ball and the batsman closed the face of the bat on the clip, a little too early
de Grandhomme to Finch, wide, spills the ball down leg and the batsman is happy to take the bargain of an extra run
de Grandhomme to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, back of a length delivery and on to the pads, tucked away into the on-side for a single
de Grandhomme to Mayank Agarwal, no run, shortish delivery outside off, devoid of any pace and the batsman mistimes the cut away to the man at cover

Siraj to Finch, SIX, this is exactly what RCB don't want. That was full and that disappeared. Booming hit over covers for a sixer. Flat and powerful. This landed in the range of the batsman and Finch drop kicked the ball away. Is there Finch magic on the cards?

Siraj to Finch, no run, with a slip in place, Siraj is not holding back. Pitches the ball up and examines the intentions of the batsman. Finch responds with a drive towards mid-off, exactly what RCB want him to do
Siraj to Mayank Agarwal, 1 run, shortish ball decking in and the batsman arches back to steer the ball away towards third man for a single
Siraj to Finch, 1 run, a little movement on the front foot and then the drive into the covers for a single
Siraj to Finch, no run, back of a length delivery outside off and has been pushed out into the off-side as the batsman stood up on his back foot
Siraj to Finch, no run, length ball, going away and almost an edge to the keeper as the batsman tried to drive it on the up
Chahal to Mayank Agarwal, no run, too full, flighted, pushed back to the bowler

Chahal to Stoinis, out Bowled!! The yorker from Chahal. Played it too late and did not pick the length to york himself. The ball sneaking under the bat. How on earth?! That was the googly. KXIP in deep waters now. Stoinis can't believe his luck. That was just a well flighted ball and he fails to pick it up. The LED bails sparkled red and RCB rejoiced more. Where is the fight KXIP? Stoinis b Chahal 2(3)
Chahal to Finch, 1 run, flat-bats the pull away! One bounce and straight to the man at long-on. That was hit flat and hard but with no placement
Chahal to Finch, no run, was it a flipper? The batsman backs away and smashes the cut away to find the man at cover. He took it from the sticks
Chahal to Stoinis, 1 run, preempts a reverse lap off a very full ball but fails to beat the man at short third man
Chahal to Finch, 1 run, drags the ball short at a flat trajectory, chopped away into the covers for a single
Siraj to Finch, 1 run, stays his crease and pushes the ball away into the covers with soft hands for a single
Siraj to Finch, FOUR, tries to land it on a length and is greeted with a drive on the up. Lovely timing and placement on it takes it away to the fence. Finch is away
Siraj to Finch, no run, pushes the ball out in front of the wicket as the ball was again delivered on a short of length spot
Jofra Archer to Karthik, SIX, goes over. And Kolkata keep the 16-pointer dream alive. Shortened length, Karthik deposits it into long-on with an all muscle heave

Jofra Archer to Karthik, FOUR, genuine edge. Zips up off the turf to take the splice on Karthik's lost overused dab. But the pace is enough to run it into third man. Or is it? Gowtham chases, dives, but nope, can't get his hand off the ball while his leg touches the rope
Jofra Archer to Karthik, no run, lines up to the good length, settling into a defensive whip to mid-wicket
Jofra Archer to A Russell, 1 run, 145kph. Another attempted yorker not quite right. This time the drill straight down finds long-on
Jofra Archer to A Russell, FOUR, oh the hammer. Brute. Archer misses the yorker by an inch, Russell takes out a mile. Launching into the overcook to crunch it through the covers
Jofra Archer to Karthik, 1 run, bumped in. Karthik pulls, not quite in control, but enough to ensure that fine leg can only take it on the bounce
Unadkat to Karthik, 1 run, conventional. A driving steer down to third man
Unadkat to Karthik, no run, and again. His dab ditches him again. And DK's angry, let's the stump mic carry up some anger to us
Unadkat to Karthik, no run, another try. Goes to dab, but the ball's just wide enough to evade the poke, never mind the inward nip

Unadkat to Karthik, FOUR, pulls out some deft dabs from his bag of tricks. Unadkat keeps going through with full-paced seam ups .. Karthik's waiting, showing it the opened up face and dabbing it just wide of Buttler's dive
Unadkat to A Russell, 1 run, length now. Front leg out as usual. Almight swing as usual. Skews out an edge to gully
Unadkat to A Russell, FOUR, innocuously short, dishing out full pace. Russell gets back fiercely on his back leg, swings his cut, going over point and almost into deep point .. millimeters
Stokes to Karthik, no run, sees it out. It's been some spell this - 4-1-15-3. A pity the runs weren't there in the bank to give him the MoM. DK does it with a stoic block
Stokes to Karthik, no run, full again, around off this time as Karthik shuffles and knocks it to mid-wicket
Stokes to A Russell, 1 run, gets in the yorker. Russell's ready, squeeze-drilling it straight down

Stokes to Karthik, leg byes, 1 run, it slams the pad. Buttler seems to be jumping up in appeal. Stokes is busy trying to clean up the possible leg bye. Oh Rajasthan have to take it up. It's all up to the angle .. how big is it getting? Okay so DK has missed the glance, he's stuck in front of middle. And yes, HawkEye shows it clipping the edge of the bail. Everyone's happy

Stokes to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Anureet Singh!! Strokes has another. Oh where was he hiding all this while? Anyway, it takes him to dish out a short-slower sticker into the pitch. Lynn as usual can't resist, loads up with a leg-cleared-cut. But doesn't quite adjust to the time the ball takes in getting there, slices off the top-edge and deep point couldn't have been placed better. Chris Lynn c Anureet Singh b Stokes 45(42) [4s-5 6s-1]
Stokes to Karthik, 1 run, good length on middle. Chipped away, quite off the outside half towards mid-on
Ish Sodhi to Chris Lynn, no run, another wide toss up, Lynn drives from his stance. And it's air he gets. It's the end of Sodhi
Ish Sodhi to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, a little too full to be sweeping. But neatly changes his commitment into a lap. Never mind the top-edge, it's safely behind square
Ish Sodhi to Chris Lynn, no run, 85.4kph, teases him with the width. Teases him with the flight. And Lynn being the bully he is wants to launch it straight down. Slogs an entirely different line
Ish Sodhi to Karthik, 1 run, drifting into middle. A watchful dab, softly to cover
Ish Sodhi to Karthik, FOUR, gets cheeky. Picks up the floaty leggie outside off, knows there's nobody at third man. And reverses. Nailing it past slip
Ish Sodhi to Karthik, no run, clears his front leg going into a leaning drive. Straight to extra cover

Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, FOUR, rub in the luck too. Neat bouncer, at the nose, but Lynn's already moving away, putting everything in his hooky-swing. Gets a fat edge that proves just enough to clear the keeper
Jofra Archer to Karthik, 1 run, half a hop again, stays back longer to dab it way too fine for point to cut it off
Jofra Archer to Karthik, no run, 140kph - there comes the pace in a back of a length back-bender. DK hops, tries guiding it through the cordon. Nah, can't
Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, 1 run, slower bouncer. Front-foot-pull. Long-on
Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, no run, almost another. A very similar nothing ball outside off, Lynn cracks, but point's corrected his angle
Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, FOUR, 118.9kph. And then length and width. Lynn gets forward, and rocks back in a fierce cut. Nothing a diving point can do
Anureet Singh to Karthik, FOUR, that's the ruin. All the width put out for Karthik to get .. and he chases, carving it over extra cover
Anureet Singh to Chris Lynn, 1 run, goes yorker. Jammed straight back. Decently quiet this for Anureet
Anureet Singh to Karthik, 1 run, ends up straight. And Karthik's back to taking it into mid-wicket. Those delicate wrists
Anureet Singh to Karthik, 2 runs, back to the floaters outside off. Squeezed out through extra cover
Anureet Singh to Chris Lynn, 1 run, too short. Lynn doesn't want a wide, goes forehand-ed. Cow corner again
Anureet Singh to Karthik, 1 run, slower cutter on middle, nurdled away through mid-wicket
Unadkat to Chris Lynn, no run, angling in to cramp him for room. That adjusted bunt, off-side somewhere
Unadkat to Karthik, 1 run, too straight on the hips. Turned away round the corner
Unadkat to Chris Lynn, 1 run, 124.5kph, reaches out to the width, stabbing it behind point
Unadkat to Chris Lynn, FOUR, 119.3kph. And then half way down the pitch. And then down leg. Well .. well. Lynn swivels, adjusts to the lack of bounce. But pulls, very fine
Unadkat to Chris Lynn, no run, stays beside the line, opening up the bat face in his steer. And a diving point ruins the timing
Unadkat to Chris Lynn, no run, length, fourth-stumpish. Tall defensive punch
Ish Sodhi to Chris Lynn, 1 run, drags it down, Lynn tries making it worse with a rock back in the crease. Half a pull, top-edging that bunt down to long-on
Ish Sodhi to Karthik, 1 run, some floaty width, asks for a drive to cream it through to sweeper
Ish Sodhi to Karthik, no run, presses forward, tapping it to cover

Ish Sodhi to Karthik, no run, oh my. The turn gets sharper, degrees get bigger, starting from down leg, opening Karthik up big time as he jabs in desperation -- ends up guiding it to slip. Does well to his credit to drop his wrists as he does it
Ish Sodhi to Chris Lynn, 1 run, forward, closer to the pitch of it in wristing it straight down
Ish Sodhi to Chris Lynn, no run, big spin. Pitches around off, Lynn reaches to poke. And whizzes past
Unadkat to Karthik, no run, ends the over with an away-angling cutter. Karthik swings and misses
Unadkat to Karthik, FOUR, that's a glorious front-foot punch through covers. Gets on his toes and on top of the bounce to pack a punch through diving cover
Unadkat to Chris Lynn, 1 run, angling away, Chris Lynn opens the bat face and runs it through point for a single
Unadkat to Chris Lynn, no run, Lynn read it late and bailed out. Slower short ball, inviting a pull. Arrived slowly and nearly had Lynn in the trap
Unadkat to Karthik, 1 run, pitches on middle-stump and decks back in, hurrying Karthik into defending it off the inside-half of his bat to backward square leg
Unadkat to Chris Lynn, 1 run, full at 131ks from over the wicket, Chris Lynn checks the push straight down the ground and collects a single

Ish Sodhi to Karthik, 2 runs, that was a very, very late second run. Karthik took off almost when the long-on fielder has gotten rid of the ball, and hence has to dive to get back in. Slow loop from Ish Sodhi outside off, Karthik sits low and fetches the sweep. Drags it wide of long-on, from where the fielder has to move to his right a few paces
Ish Sodhi to Karthik, no run, quick and full, this leg break, meaning Karthik has to come forward and block it
Ish Sodhi to Chris Lynn, 1 run, slow leg break, allowing Chris Lynn to punch that off the back foot through covers
Ish Sodhi to Karthik, 1 run, spinning away from off-stump, and Karthik reaches out to cart that through point

Ish Sodhi to Nitish Rana, out Lbw!! Loud shout for LBW. And Rajasthan go upstairs with the review. Drifted across from over the wicket and it spun into the left-hander, surprising him with the turn. Pitching just outside off-stump -- slowmo replays suggest -- and rapping the front leg near the knee-roll. Impact on middle and that's crashing into the top of leg-stump, says ball-tracking. So Nitish Rana will have to go, as RR hold on to their review. Nitish Rana lbw b Ish Sodhi 21(17) [4s-2 6s-1]
Ish Sodhi to Chris Lynn, 1 run, googly negotiated off the back foot. Turned to mid-wicket for a single
Gowtham to Chris Lynn, 1 run, went wide of the crease and darted that in. Chris Lynn plays with the angle and pats that to long-on
Gowtham to Nitish Rana, 1 run, flatter, quicker, and Nitish Rana was hurried into keeping that out
Gowtham to Nitish Rana, SIX, Gowtham's horror isn't over. Brilliant loft from Nitish Rana, stepping out and timing it over extra cover. Flew into the crowd
Gowtham to Chris Lynn, 1 run, worked to long-on
Gowtham to Nitish Rana, 1 run, steps out, gets too close to the pitch and squeezes it out to wide long-on
Gowtham to Chris Lynn, 1 run, one-legged clip through mid-wicket. On the stumps from Gowtham. He onviously doesn't have Narine now to unsettle him..
Ish Sodhi to Nitish Rana, no run, fuller length, Nitish Rana prods in front and blocks
Ish Sodhi to Nitish Rana, no run, gets an under-edge on the sweep. Didn't read the googly

Ish Sodhi to Nitish Rana, FOUR, that's past backward point's dive. Got the ball to straighten on off-stump, which makes Nitish Rana's shot a good one. Didn't have much room to work, so uses his cocked wrists and thrusts the ball away
Ish Sodhi to Chris Lynn, 1 run, a bit quicker. There's spin on the leg break but Chris Lynn is nicely back, buying time for a nudge to long-on

Ish Sodhi to Chris Lynn, no run, gee, that falls short of Sodhi. Nice and slow leg break that Chris Lynn prods forward to with hard hands. And way too early. Pops back and luckily dips much short of the bowler
Ish Sodhi to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slow googly that angles and then spins across, and Nitish Rana chops his cut to deep backward point
Stokes to Nitish Rana, 1 run, into the pads, nudged to wide long-on. That's the end of powerplay: 51/2
Stokes to Nitish Rana, no run, 135ks on a back of a length -- cages Nitish Rana in the crease, forcing him to go further back and block it dead-batted
Stokes to Nitish Rana, wide, overdoes the ploy to angle it into the pads. Errs down the leg-side and concedes a wide
Stokes to Chris Lynn, 1 run, strewn off-paced and fullish outside off, and here's Chris Lynn, staying on leg-stump and reaching out to slap that through point
Stokes to Nitish Rana, 1 run, getting the ball into Nitish Rana from round the wicket here, with a slip waiting. Nudged to mid-wicket for an easy single
Stokes to Chris Lynn, 1 run, rocks back and across, punching the ball past Rahane's dive at shortish cover
Stokes to Chris Lynn, no run, slower delivery that's dipping on a very full length. Took Chris Lynn by surprise but he's managed to keep it out
Jofra Archer to Nitish Rana, 2 runs, he's not moving his feet much, is Nitish Rana. Throws his hands at the width and chops it through cover-point say
Jofra Archer to Nitish Rana, FOUR, past Samson's one-handed effort at backward point. An uppish cut shot that he placed just wide enough of the fielder
Jofra Archer to Nitish Rana, no run, bit of a push-drive that involved no feet but cover fielder's flown there and stopped it. Gowtham there perhaps. Stokes appreciates it
Jofra Archer to Nitish Rana, no run, beaten on the back foot now. Back of a length and straightening outside off -- Jofra Archer here is from round the wicket

Jofra Archer to Nitish Rana, no run, funny how a good pitch brings the lost values back into the game. A short ball is tailgated by a full one. Entices the drive and beats him outside off. Lovely to see. Perhaps some leftover from Malahide
Jofra Archer to Nitish Rana, no run, bends his back outside off. Got to love this pitch. And I can't be enough tired of saying it. Nitish Rana arches back; KKR need a rebuild

Stokes to Chris Lynn, FOUR, that's a nice drive through covers. Chris Lynn leaning a bit into it and reminding Stokes that he wasn't the batsman who faced the short ball, so a full ball outside off isn't going to work

Stokes to Uthappa, out Caught by R Tripathi!! This is not over yet, folks. Second short ball from Stokes that gets the wicket.
