Got a little big on Uthappa, who agreeably was pirouetting well on the back toe. Ended up top-edging it high to deep backward square, where Tripathy was waiting. Uthappa c R Tripathi b Stokes 4(6)
Stokes to Uthappa, 2 runs, shaves it off his pads and picks a couple through deep mid-wicket
Stokes to Chris Lynn, 1 run, that falls wide of rushing mid-on. A bit of a miscue as Chris Lynn looks to pull a ball that's not short enough to do so. Gets away with it this time

Stokes to Chris Lynn, no run, beaten by pace and some low bounce you'd have to say. Stokes went wide of the crease and angled it in, seeing Chris Lynn make a bit of room early. Skid it on and interrupted Chris Lynn's swivel with a blow near the crotch
Stokes to Uthappa, 1 run, taps it delightfully to mid-on and runs

Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, no run, one-handed fend back to Jofra Archer this time. Bends his back on this back of a length delivery and surprises Chris Lynn with pace and bounce off the deck. Nicely negotiated in the end

Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, FOUR, now over third man. Just bounces inside the ropes and hits the cushions on the half-volley. Jofra Archer bowled it short again but shifted the line to outside off, and Chris Lynn nicely ramps it away

Jofra Archer to Chris Lynn, SIX, a 145ks delivery no good for all-hands Lynn. Moves a little leg-side and scythes this short incoming delivery over backward square leg. Didn't even rock back fully. Didn't need to
Jofra Archer to Uthappa, 1 run, gets a touch more width on this length ball and finally is able to tap that single to third man
Jofra Archer to Uthappa, no run, that's a cross-seamed back of a length delivery outside off. Uthappa trying to glide it to third man but misses
Jofra Archer to Uthappa, no run, starts with a full ball that's blocked towards mid-on
Stokes to Chris Lynn, no run, angled full and is blocked to square leg. Wicket-maiden!
Stokes to Chris Lynn, no run, well short of mid-on. Angled into Chris Lynn who went for the loft but doesn't middle it. Good for him, here
Stokes to Chris Lynn, no run, makes a bit of room but he's drilled that straight to the fielder at cover
Stokes to Chris Lynn, no run, pushed into the off-side

Stokes to Narine, out Caught by Gowtham!! Gowtham is dramatic in his celebration. If you don't know why, scroll down and see how he was taken for runs in the last over. Takes the catch at extra cover and flings the ball at the stumps, and aggressively. A little OTT, the celebrations, but RR will take it. A short ball from Stokes does the trick. Narine is awkward as he goes back but is not really in a position to swat that across. Miscues that in the air and is caught. Narine c Gowtham b Stokes 21(7) [4s-2 6s-2]
Stokes to Narine, no run, bowls it short outside off from over the wicket. Narine makes room but is still cramped on the flash. Doesn't connect
Gowtham to Chris Lynn, no run, flat outside off and Lynn block .He had a slip and FSL for company
Gowtham to Narine, 1 run, oh he fails to get under this and hits it along the ground to long-on
Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, he's an antidote to everything that Gowtham can be tonight. Backs away and lofts one at the stumps, splitting the air-gap between mid-off and extra cover
Gowtham to Narine, SIX, now puts on the wheels. Comes down the track and mauls it over long-on. Gowtham clasps his hands but that's not in appreciation, as you'd have guessed
Gowtham to Narine, FOUR, this flies squarer but he's middled it again somewhat. Swivels a little, carting the ball round the corner
Gowtham to Narine, SIX, how that's! Skid it into Narine, who went with it and swung it over deep mid-wicket

Prasidh to Unadkat, out Bowled!! RR won't play out their quota of overs. That was a slower delivery and the batsman went for the slog sweep but was outdone by the lack of pace on it. The batsman knelt down, may be guessed the pace right, but could not connect at all for the LED bails to lighten up. KKR camp is chuffed. So is the crowd and the entire team. The on-field umpire did check for a no-ball but it is KKR's evening and nothing can go wrong. Unadkat b Prasidh 26(18) [4s-3 6s-1]
Prasidh to Anureet Singh, 1 run, another full toss, a low dipping one and the batsman thwacks the ball away to deep cover for a single. Five singles in the over
Prasidh to Unadkat, 1 run, another full toss and has been on-driven to long-on for a single. Clearly not happy getting these full tosses
Prasidh to Anureet Singh, leg byes, 1 run, angles the ball in and the batsman misses the tuck. Unadkat calls his partner through for a run. 9 balls to go. Can they scale 150?
Prasidh to Unadkat, 1 run, the full toss hits the bat high and limps into the covers for a single to be taken. The batsman tried to back away and drive it through the off-side
Prasidh to Anureet Singh, 1 run, slower ball and has been pushed out into the of-side for a quick single. Over to Unadkat
A Russell to Anureet Singh, 1 run, low dipping full toss and the batsman backs away to crack the ball away into the covers for a single
A Russell to Unadkat, 1 run, fuller delivery at the base of the sticks and has been clipped away into the on-side for a single

A Russell to Unadkat, no run, dropped! That was a short ball, quick one and that big on him. The top-edge ballooned up and the man from cover - Krishna - came in and fluffed it. That should have been gobbled up but RR survive to fight another day

A Russell to Jofra Archer, out Caught by Shubman Gill!! Another one bites the dust. KKR fans find their voices again. Short ball, rising up and the batsman trying to pull it away, managed only a lot of height. The man at deep square leg came in and took it, not exactly with a lot of ease but effectively in the end. Might have lost it in the lights. Jofra Archer c Shubman Gill b A Russell 6(5) [4s-1]
A Russell to Jofra Archer, no run, slower short ball and has been cracked away into the off-side to find the man at cover
A Russell to Unadkat, 1 run, slightly short, angles in and the batsman stands up, rides the bounce and flat-bats the ball away into the covers for a single
Prasidh to Jofra Archer, 2 runs, just a mere chip and over the bowler's head for a couple. That was full and the batsman just put it away without lending any power on the shot
Prasidh to Jofra Archer, no run, short of length delivery and has been blocked out nicely

Prasidh to Jofra Archer, FOUR, not a bad start! Short ball at the body and pulled away into the on-side for a four. The man at fine leg had no chance. He played it slightly late but did well to get enough meat on it

Prasidh to Ish Sodhi, out Caught by Karthik!! The yorkerish delivery was jammed out and it popped up. KKR think it went off the boot and into the keeper's gloves. They may be right!! It seems the batsman did jam it out off the inner half of the bat but into his boot. And then it went up for DK to take it and bring to the notice of the umpires that they should go upstairs. They did, the soft signal was not out but was not to be as the replays were conclusive enough for the third umpire to make the decision. Ish Sodhi c Karthik b Prasidh 1(6)
Prasidh to Ish Sodhi, no run, slower delivery and angles in @103kph. The batsman again looks to hoick across the line and misses it. Very very ordinary from the Kiwi
Prasidh to Ish Sodhi, no run, short, the batsman goes for a wild swing across the line and misses. Poor shot

Narine to Unadkat, FOUR, phew! That was close. Shortish, again slightly turning in and the cut is played off the top-half of the bat. The man at backward point leapt up but still could not even get finger-tips to it. 10 runs of the over and RR fight on thanks to this cameo from Unadkat. Narine ends a decent spell - 4-0-29-1
Narine to Ish Sodhi, 1 run, treks back and tucks the ball away into the on-side. They could have taken a couple but not to be!
Narine to Ish Sodhi, no run, flattish ball outside off and the batsman employs the steer. The man at short third man picks the ball up
Narine to Unadkat, 1 run, shortish, turning in and the batsman stamps back to cut it away into the covers for a single
Narine to Unadkat, FOUR, little short outside off and the batsman latches on to it. Smokes the cut past point and the ball reaches the ropes. These are useful runs on the board
Narine to Unadkat, no run, flattish outswinger? Or a leggie? The batsman pushes the ball out to backward point off the outer half of the bat
Shivam Mavi to Unadkat, 1 run, back footed push into the off-side and a single it is. This time Unadkat runs through
Shivam Mavi to Unadkat, no run, slower ball and blocked into the off-side off the front foot. Sodhi wanted a steal but the batsman sent him back
Shivam Mavi to Unadkat, no run, fuller delivery and the batsman cracks another lovely drive on the up. The man at cover picks the ball up

Shivam Mavi to Unadkat, SIX, short ball and six! That was a splendid hit. More of a reactive shot as he looked like he was slightly late on it but that travelled the entire journey. Over the deep square region and Mavi takes some more punishment
Shivam Mavi to Unadkat, FOUR, just a push..may be an exagerrated punch. But that raced away across the turf past the man at cover. Whatta shot. Not a pushover for sure
Shivam Mavi to Unadkat, no run, length ball, skids on and tucked away to the man mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Ish Sodhi, no run, flighted ball outside off and has been defended into the off-side

Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, out Caught&Bowled!! The last straw is gone. RR will drown it seems. Too full, flighted as well and the toe-ended push finds the bowler. The bowler stays low and pouches it. DK and team erupt. A hattrick against Aussies and now this. Kuldeep can't do anything wrong at the Eden. A 4-fer in a big game. Stokes ends a horron run in the IPL. He has been off-color throughout and it has ended like that as well. Stokes c and b Kuldeep Yadav 11(13)
Kuldeep Yadav to Unadkat, 1 run, a little drop in the length and the batsman is able to read the googly. Punches the ball away past cover for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, 1 run, front footed poke and the inside edge goes away on the on-side for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Unadkat, 1 run, when you don't know about which way it is turning, you sweep! Exactly what Unadkat does. Picks the ball up from the sticks and gets a single into the on-side
Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, 1 run, picks the full ball and drives the ball down to long-off. Easy single

Shivam Mavi to Gowtham, out Caught by Karthik!! The pace has the last laugh. Disconcerting bounce coupled with it forces an almost evasive action from Gowtham, who fails to get his gloves out of the way. The ball flicked the gloves and went up for the keeper to take it with ease. The Eden is alive and noisy. Eden has witnessed many collapses and this one is dear to KKR. Gowtham c Karthik b Shivam Mavi 3(5)
Shivam Mavi to Stokes, 1 run, quick delivery @143kph and the batsman employs a short-arm stab into the off-side to pick up a single. The ball angled across the left-hander

Shivam Mavi to Gowtham, 1 run, back of a length delivery just outside off and the batsman steers the ball away to deep third man. The man gets across to his right and mops the ball up. Only 2 runs of the over so far
Shivam Mavi to Stokes, 1 run, length ball on the pads, the batsman rolls the wrists on it. Powerful ones, and the ball finds the man at deep square leg
Shivam Mavi to Stokes, no run, slower ball @114.2kph and the batsman mistimes the punch on the up. Finds the man at mid-off
Shivam Mavi to Stokes, no run, shortish, skiddy and the welcome to Mavi is less severe. A harmless chop to the man at point
Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, 1 run, stays back, picks the googly( off the deck) and tucks the ball away to the cow corner region for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Gowtham, 1 run, steps back and tickles the ball away fine on the on-side for a single

Kuldeep Yadav to Gowtham, no run, looks to do a Binny here! RR fans breathe easy as he had his back foot grounded. The only good thing he was trying to play it on the off-side and not against the turn. Another googly it was
Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, 1 run, too full and the batsman gets a soft leading edge to mid-on for a single

Kuldeep Yadav to Gowtham, 1 run, DK ain't a happy man. That was misfielded by the bowler and DK makes annoyance known to the bowler. Another flighted ball and the batsman knocked it back to the bowler, who fumnbled it

Kuldeep Yadav to Binny, out Stumped!! The googly and RR implode further. The batsman predictably does not read it. Looks to whip a flighted ball outside off and misses it. The ball turned away past the blade and DK does the rest. He whipped the bails off in a flash. Kuldeep leaps up in his celebratory jump. The spinners are choking their opponents here. You have seen this script from KKR. Haven't you?Binny st Karthik b Kuldeep Yadav 1(4)
Narine to Binny, 1 run, reading Narine off the wicket. Not surprising. And then strides back with the turn to tuck the ball down to long-on for a single
Narine to Binny, no run, now spins in and the batsman with a glued set of bat and pad blocks the ball out off the front foot
Narine to Binny, no run, the away-angler outside off and the batsman shoulders arms to let it go

Narine to Samson, out Lbw!! The flattish ball spun in sharply and hit the batsman high on the back leg. Looks a little high. Was there an inside edge? NO! The height is not an issue. Three Reds. RR are going down like a lead balloon. The ball skidded on and the batsman was late on the attempted swat on the on-side. This is tragedy for RR. From 59 in 4 overs to this. T20 cricket and its speed taking a toll on RR. In dire straits. Samson lbw b Narine 12(10) [4s-2]
Narine to Stokes, 1 run, stamps back and tucks the ball away into the on-side for a single
Narine to Stokes, 2 runs, flattish ball on the pads and clipped away on the on-side for a brace. The batsman stayed ahead on the front foot and knocked it away in the gap for the steal
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, FOUR, perfect length, but it doesn't matter which variation it was, Samson reaches out and sweeps it hard to backward square leg for four. Incredible shot, and four...
Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, 1 run, full delivery on middle and leg, not allowed to turn, Stokes whips it away to long on for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, 1 run, full and loopy outside off, Samson gets forward and swat-drives it down the ground towards long-off for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Stokes, 1 run, cross-seamer variation, full outside off, driven away firmly by Stokes to long-off for a single

Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, out Caught by Searles!! Massive moment! Fullish one, too full to reverse, Buttler goes for it anyway, and gets it off the top half of the bat, and lobs it to Searles at short third man. A tame end to an otherwise excellent innings, and Buttler's streak of 5 consecutive 50s comes to an end. 3 down, and Kuldeep has made an important breakthrough. Buttler c Searles b Kuldeep Yadav 39(22) [4s-5 6s-2]
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, no run, full delivery outside off pushed to cover off the front foot

Prasidh to Samson, no run, very full, falls short of the yorker length,on middle, Samson waits for it and gets under the ball to push it back to the bowler from the crease. An offer to hit the batsman by the bowler, but he pulls out at the last moment. Sanju doesn't flinch...
Prasidh to Samson, no run, back of a length delivery on the stumps, skidding on, Samson taps it off the back foot into the off-side
Prasidh to Samson, FOUR, just a fraction short, a tad outside off, Samson pokes it with an angled bat away to the third man fence for four. Races away...
Prasidh to Buttler, 1 run, yorker length delivery on leg, Buttler digs it out off the toe-end to long-on for a single
Prasidh to Buttler, no run, short and a little wide, Buttler moved away from the stumps and tried to place it behind point, managed to find the only man inside the circle. Missed opportunity.
Prasidh to Samson, 1 run, short of length delivery into the chest, just outside off, Samson gets on his toes and steers it away towards third man for a single. Just a little tap on the head...

Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, 1 run, a tad slower on middle and off, straightening towards middle, slow turn, Samson has time to laze onto the back foot and tuck it away to backward square leg for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Buttler, 1 run, half-cook, on the pads, a whip away to mid-wicket for a scampered single
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, 1 run, fuller length, the orthodox chinaman, whipped away with the turn to deep square leg for a quick single
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, no run, chinaman outside off, attempted sweep, thuds into the pad and rolls into the off-side

Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, out Bowled!! Oh, it's ugly when a batsman with a Test hundred in almost every country tries circus tricks. Kuldeep fires in the googly on middle and leg, Rahane gets across his stumps and tries to whack it away behind point with a reverse sweep, misses it altogether and ends up making a fool of himself. The furniture is knocked over, and a the flashing red bails reflect ominous signs for RR. Rahane b Kuldeep Yadav 11(12) [4s-1]

Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, 2 runs, the orthodox chinaman, headed outside off, Rahane gets on his knees and fetches that with a hard sweep from outside off. Gets it in front of deep square leg for a brace

A Russell to Buttler, no run, how often do you see this? An outswinging full-toss headed for the box, fired in @142.3kmph, Buttler is vigilant as he plays it late and manages to keep it down. Wonder why he looks relieved...
A Russell to Rahane, 1 run, back of a length but the ball forgets to bounce, Rahane is already on the back foot and drops his wrists on the back foot flick to long-on for a single
A Russell to Rahane, 2 runs, very full on middle and leg, clipped away to long-on for a couple
A Russell to Rahane, no run, fuller one on middle, Rahane makes room and whacks it to cover, where Uthappa cuts it off. Saved a certain boundary. Incredibly quick work...
A Russell to Rahane, 2 runs, back of a length delivery just outside off, Rahane fetches it with the drop-flick off the back foot from outside off to mid-wicket for a brace
A Russell to Buttler, 1 run, fuller length delivery outside off, driven away with good timing to sweeper cover for a single
Narine to Rahane, FOUR, shortish off-break, erring in line, drifting into the pads, whipped away off the back foot to the backward square leg fence for four. Threaded the needle there...
Narine to Rahane, no run, fuller delivery turning in, clipped away in front of square, and the fielder inside the circle cuts it off with a dive
Narine to Rahane, no run, off-break outside off, Rahane tries a sweep, terrible shot selection, and it thuds into the keeper's gloves
Narine to Rahane, no run, a tad short outside off, tapped off the back foot towards cover
Narine to Rahane, no run, off-break, a little more air on that, Rahane gets forward and turns it away circumspectly
Narine to Buttler, 1 run, shorter than he'd have liked, carved away off the back foot towards cover for a single
A Russell to Rahane, no run, short of length delivery just outside off, Rahane jumps on the spot and pokes that with an angled vertical bat towards gully

A Russell to R Tripathi, out Caught by Karthik!! Gone! A sigh of relief for the hosts! Short one angling towards the leg-side, and the side-on stance of Tripathi gives him that fraction of a second less to get into the hook. Beaten for pace, and he gets a feather of a glove on it to DK behind the stumps. Is this the breakthrough, or the rhythm-breaker that KKR needed? The crowd would certainly hope so! R Tripathi c Karthik b A Russell 27(15) [4s-4 6s-1]
A Russell to Buttler, 1 run, shortish delivery without much width outside off, Buttler hops to get on top of it and dabs it to gully for a quick single

A Russell to R Tripathi, 1 run, low full toss on middle and leg, R Tripathi misses it (I think) but perhaps there was an inside edge on it. If not, then it was plumb. Missed the flick, beaten for pace, and away to the long stop fence for a single
A Russell to R Tripathi, 2 runs, length ball on the pads, a gift, turned away with a whip of the wrists in front of square leg for a brace
A Russell to R Tripathi, no run, short and wide outside off, Tripathi thinks about going for it, mysteriously pulls out of it...

Narine to Buttler, FOUR, thats almost an inch-perfect yorker outside off, errs marginally, Buttler, with all his hockey experience, gets under it to bottom-hand that away to the deep extra cover fence for four
Narine to Buttler, no run, length ball on middle, not much turn, Buttler gets forward and pushes it back to the bowler...
Narine to Buttler, wide, huge wide down leg, and a good take by DK saves his team 4 runs...
Narine to R Tripathi, 1 run, flatter outside off, not very short, Tripathi crouches low in his stance and late-cuts that to short third man for a quick single
Narine to R Tripathi, no run, flighted delivery outside off, tempting, pushed away to cover
Narine to R Tripathi, FOUR, flatter trajectory, off-break and in the slot, R Tripathi gets on his knees and mows that to wide long-on with a slog-sweep. Up comes the 50 partnership!
Narine to R Tripathi, no run, off-break outside off, tossed up, R Tripathi reaches out and drives it to cover

Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR, full and wide outside off, Buttler reaches out and slices that away to square third man for four, and that's the second time Mavi has conceded more than 28 in an over in this IPL. Surreal hitting...
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, SIX, he moves leg, moves to the off-side again, picks up the good length ball on the stumps to ramp it over fine leg for another six. Last 9 balls: 6 fours, 3 sixes.

Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR, length ball outside off, a cardinal sin in T20, Buttler opens up his stance, clears his front leg, and carts it away cross-battedly to long-on for four. RR bowlers under fire, and Buttler's epiphany continues...
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR, short and fractionally wide, Buttler has a lower and wide stance and has a solid base to execute the perfect cut shot to deep backward point for four. Unbelievable...
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, SIX, fuller length delivery just outside off, Buttler preempts the periscope and laps it over the tiny fine leg boundary for six!
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, FOUR, short and wide, Buttler is about half a meter outside leg reaches out Sehwagesquely to slice it towards the third man boundary for four

Prasidh to R Tripathi, FOUR, why try the helicopter when you can play these? Half-volley, on middle and leg, Tripathi gets slightly forward and push-drives it straight down the ground for four. 19 off the over.
Prasidh to R Tripathi, FOUR, a bit of swing away from a good length outside off, Tripathi tries a preempted helicopter and gets a leading edge to third man for four.
Prasidh to R Tripathi, FOUR, short and a little wide, no power, just a dab off the back foot, placed perfectly behind backward point for four. Surgical precision...
Prasidh to R Tripathi, SIX, full and not too wide, on off-stump in fact, Tripathi makes his own width by making room outside off and slices that over the sweeper cover fence for six! Massive hit!
Prasidh to Buttler, 1 run, back of a length ball delivery, in the hallway of hesitation more suited to the longer form, tapped off the back foot to short extra cover for a single
Prasidh to Buttler, no run, good length delivery in the channel outside off, dropped off the frontfoot towards mid-on

Shivam Mavi to R Tripathi, no run, bumper! A fast bumper into his ribcage @138kmph, and Rahul takes his eyes off the ball and fends it down into the pitch. I don't think he can sight that white cannonball properly. Remember Furiosa from Mad Max?
Shivam Mavi to R Tripathi, no run, another short of length ball angling towards leg, Tripathi tries to clip it away off the back foot but it thuds into his thigh @144kmph and drops into the leg-side

Shivam Mavi to Buttler, 1 run, hitting the deck hard on a length, angling in and Buttler is hurried into a drop to square leg fof the back foot. @142.7kmph, slowest ball of the over. Perhaps 130km/h would be a slower one from this guy. Crazy...

Shivam Mavi to Buttler, no run, back of a length but a little wide, Buttler stays low and scythes that towards point who manages to cut it off and doesn't let it through. Full throttle again, @144kmph...
Shivam Mavi to Buttler, no run, are you kidding me? @149.8kmph. Full delivery outside off, miscued back to the bowler by Buttler. Serious pace, from this young man...

Shivam Mavi to R Tripathi, 1 run, dropped! Fired in on a short of length @144.8kmph, angling in towards leg, Tripathi is intimidated and tentatively defends off the back foot, gets an edge to third man for a single as Rana drops it at slip... Went flying for it two-handed but no dice
McClenaghan to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, short of length delivery at the body, swivelled away past short fine leg. But it doesn't matter. MI clinch this by three runs to stay alive in the tournament

McClenaghan to Axar, byes, 1 run, that's it. McClenaghan seals it. A brave, brave delivery, banging it in short in the knowledge that even top-edges can sail away. But he's banking on the surprise factor, and sure enough, Axar is late on the pull as the ball whistles past him
McClenaghan to Axar, SIX, it's not over yet. Axar has pumped this full toss over the ropes. McClenaghan misses the blockhole, and disappears over mid-wicket

McClenaghan to Yuvraj, out Caught by Lewis!! Full ball outside off, Yuvraj slices it straight to Lewis at sweeper cover. He was right back in the crease expecting the fuller length, and was probably aiming to go inside out over extra cover. But the bat twisted in his hands. A fist-pump from McClenaghan. Yuvraj c Lewis b McClenaghan 1(3)
McClenaghan to Yuvraj, wide, very wide outside off, smartly left alone by Yuvraj. Collects a wide
McClenaghan to Yuvraj, no run, ah, this was in the slot to be swung away, but Yuvraj's so miserably out of touch, he doesn't even get a touch on this as he swings and misses

McClenaghan to Axar, byes, 1 run, oh close. Close call for the umpire. Very wide yorker from McClenaghan which dips under Axar's slog-sweep, but because he had moved across the stumps a touch, the umpire decides to let it go

Bumrah to Axar, 1 run, brilliant finish from Bumrah, gets it pretty close to the yorker length and denies Axar the space to lift the ball. His drive goes all along the ground for a single to long-off. What an over. What a spell. He's made all the difference
Bumrah to Yuvraj, 1 run, skiddy back of length delivery, cramps Yuvraj up and he's pretty late on the shot too. Clearly not in any rhythm. Skews it off an inside edge into the on-side
Bumrah to Axar, 1 run, low full toss, driven hard to the left of long-off where the fielder (Pollard) has cut the angle nicely to prevent the second run

Bumrah to Rahul, out Caught by Cutting!! Bumrah wins the battle with Rahul. He has sent Wankhede rocking. Slower ball, it deceives Rahul as he lofts it right off the toe-end into the grateful hands of Cutting at long-off. So then, is that it for Punjab? Rahul c Cutting b Bumrah 94(60) [4s-10 6s-3]
Bumrah to Axar, 1 run, nails the blockhole once more, another single down the ground
Bumrah to Rahul, 1 run, spot on this time. It was the slower ball from Bumrah which dipped into the blockhole outside off. Rahul jams it down to long-off
Bumrah to Rahul, wide, he sees Rahul backing away and goes for a wide yorker, but misses his line by quite a bit. Called wide by the umpire
Cutting to Rahul, 1 run, nice and full from Cutting this time, smeared away through to sweeper cover

Cutting to Rahul, FOUR, he's done it again. He has done it again. Quite brilliant. Slower ball wide of off, and Rahul puts it over short third man's head. He's whisked into the 90s. Some player this lad

Cutting to Rahul, FOUR, oh my, this is extraordinary. The expression on Rohit's face, rather the blankness of it tells the story. Wide leg-cutter from Cutting, Rahul switches his stance and reverse-scoops it over short third man
Cutting to Rahul, FOUR, Rahul gets this away! This is the man standing between MI and victory. Short of length at the body, Rahul nails the pull backward of square
Cutting to Axar, 1 run, short ball on middle, Axar spoons it off the top-edge as he tries pulling off the front foot. No one inside the ring at mid-wicket though, safe
Cutting to Rahul, 1 run, moved too far away from the line of the ball in an effort to make some room. Has to reach out for it in the end and toe-ends it down to long-off
Bumrah to Axar, no run, length ball slanted across off, Axar drives on the up but straight to cover

Bumrah to Stoinis, out Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Hoho, Stoinis doesn't have a clue of what's happened. He's too slow. This bumper from Bumrah hurries on from the middle of the pitch, and even as Stoinis tries sitting down to it, he leaves his gloves up there. The ball kisses them enroute to Ishan Kishan. A gamechanger this Bumrah over. Stoinis c Ishan Kishan b Bumrah 1(2)
Bumrah to Rahul, 1 run, short of length around off, awkwardly jabbed through mid-wicket

Bumrah to Rahul, 2 runs, low full toss around off, creamed through extra cover by Rahul but he's denied the boundary by a desperate Krunal Pandya. This is excellent commitment to the cause. It galvanizes the crowd into "Mumbai Mumbai" chants
Bumrah to Stoinis, 1 run, full ball, Stoinis absolutely smokes this drive back at Bumrah who has nowhere to go. The ball deflects off him towards long-on

Bumrah to Finch, out Caught by Hardik Pandya!! Outstanding pressure catch from Hardik Pandya in the deep. Finch had skied this up a mile off a top-edge, he had Evin Lewis in the corner of his eye - converging towards him, but Pandya calls for it and takes it much to the delight of the roaring fans at the Wankhede. Length ball, Finch saw the opportunity and cleared his front leg to make the most of it. But his heave came right off the toe-end. Finch c Hardik Pandya b Bumrah 46(35) [4s-3 6s-1]

Markande to Rahul, SIX, and again. Much cleaner, much bigger. The Kings XI dugout is on its feet as Rahul finishes the over off with back-to-back sixes. Puts his dancing shoes on again and swings through the line of the delivery
Markande to Rahul, SIX, this is the ball he wanted. A bit of flight from Markande, Rahul gallops down to the pitch of it and lofts it cleanly over long-on

Markande to Rahul, 2 runs, the reverse-scoop from Rahul, gets it over the man at short third man. Krunal Pandya runs back and cuts it off. Testament to how well Markande is bowling that Rahul is forced to resort to this
Markande to Finch, 1 run, backs away and swings off his feet, but he's nowhere near the pitch. The ball balloons off a thick leading edge and lands between short fine leg and short third man

Markande to Finch, 2 runs, bravely flighted up, and smartly drifted in on leg. Finch drags it away wide of deep mid-wicket and is a bit lazy on the second run, plonking his bat into the crease. He barely got it down in time

Markande to Rahul, 1 run, superbly bowled, probably off the front of the hand. Rahul backed away early, and Markande followed him with a flat delivery which skidded off the surface. Only a single down to long-on
Hardik Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, finishes the over off well does Hardik. Rahul advanced down to this delivery, but got too close to the ball to find any elevation. Drills it to long-off
Hardik Pandya to Finch, 1 run, plants his back knee down and slaps this full ball towards sweeper cover. They're getting a bit twitchy with no boundary coming off the over yet
Hardik Pandya to Finch, no run, good height on the bumper from Hardik, it gets too big on Finch as he tries to take it on. Comfortably zooms over the top-edge
Hardik Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, slower back of length delivery wide of off, Rahul chops it through point

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, no run, oh gee, massive wind-up by Rahul who wanted to smoke this off-cutter into the sea. Perhaps he expected the ball to grip, which it didn't, and so it beat the outside edge
Hardik Pandya to Rahul, wide, and again. Pressure on Hardik here. He falters with the execution of the wide slower ball once more. Well wide outside off
Hardik Pandya to Rahul, wide, wide slower ball from Hardik, but it's way too wide. Rahul lets it go
Hardik Pandya to Finch, 1 run, misses out on the full toss. He had made room for himself and was probably trying to carve it through cover. But mistimes it to long-off instead
Krunal Pandya to Finch, 1 run, well bowled. Saw him coming and pulled the length back. Finch adjusts nicely though and taps it down to long-on
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, leg byes, 1 run, sliding in on leg from a back of length, Rahul tries to paddle it away but it skids on and deflects off his pad
Krunal Pandya to Finch, 1 run, ties him up on leg-stump, Finch is content with a single to long-on

Krunal Pandya to Finch, FOUR, he's hit that with a battering ram! Makes some room, Krunal darts it into the slot for Finch who tonks the leather off it by muscling it back over the bowler's head. Krunal tried going for the catch, but by then the ball was whistling into the fence

Krunal Pandya to Finch, 2 runs, mows this back of length delivery very hard. Deep mid-wicket barely had to move 10 yards to his right but he's forced to put in the dive, such was the ferocity of the strike. He does well to stop it

Krunal Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, uses his feet and works it with the angle through mid-wicket. Krunal is not looking to turn the ball here, which Rahul is aware of and so he doesn't have to worry about going against the spin
McClenaghan to Rahul, 1 run, width on offer for Rahul who throws his hands at it and slaps it to deep point
McClenaghan to Finch, 1 run, clipped off the hips behind square

McClenaghan to Finch, FOUR, mid-off is up so Finch clears his front leg in order to go over the infield. It's a short of length delivery from McClenaghan, not the ideal ball to hit straight down the ground, but Finch had his mind made up. He flat-bats it hard enough, and although it came off the toe-end, it's enough to go over the fielder. Cutting gives good chase and tries hauling it back in with a slide, but his foot was in contact with the ropes
McClenaghan to Rahul, 1 run, slightly behind a good length just outside off, Rahul punches in front of cover for one

McClenaghan to Rahul, FOUR, short fine leg is motionless as Rahul helps this pull shot past him. Poor ball really. Angled into the body from round the wicket, all Rahul has to do is to miss the lone fielder after swivelling across and that's what he does as he leaves Surya a mere statue
McClenaghan to Finch, 1 run, clipped off the pads in front of square leg, they look for the second run but Lewis is quickly onto the ball from deep backward square
Bumrah to Finch, 1 run, short of length, Finch safely plays off the over by patting it down the ground to the right of Bumrah. Only four singles off the over, but they haven't given Bumrah the wicket
Bumrah to Rahul, 1 run, short of length just outside off, runs it off an open face down to third man
Bumrah to Rahul, no run, cramped up by this short of length delivery, inside-edges it onto the body

Bumrah to Finch, 1 run, back of a length, Finch is hopping back in the crease as he defends it to the left of short mid-wicket, so he really has to put the skates on as he bolts towards the non-striker's end. McClenaghan throws himself forward as he releases the ball in one motion along with the dive, but Finch gets there
Bumrah to Finch, no run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Finch groans in frustration as he steers it crisply but straight to backward point
Bumrah to Rahul, 1 run, speared in full on middle, Rahul rushes his bat down to push it towards long-on
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, 102kph, Rahul knocks it down to long-on to bring up yet another fifty this season. What a time he's having
Krunal Pandya to Finch, 1 run, punches it off the back foot down to long-on

Krunal Pandya to Finch, FOUR, that's well done. Finch walked across, expecting Krunal to keep it straight and quick. He got inside the line of the ball and then swept it powerfully past short fine leg
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, full and fast, 101.8kph, pushed down the ground to long-off
Krunal Pandya to Finch, 1 run, darted in on leg, cutting down the room for Finch who nudges it round the corner
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, length ball on middle from round the wicket, 85.6kph, Rahul works it through mid-wicket
Hardik Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, fullish delivery on the 4th stump line, Rahul gets half-forward and check-drives that to long-off for a single...
Hardik Pandya to Rahul, 2 runs, back of a length delivery around off, Rahul gets on the back foot and punches that to deep backward point for a brace. 50 partnership up!
Hardik Pandya to Rahul, no run, skiddy delivery on a back of a length, just outside off, Rahul makes room and scythes that straight to point
Hardik Pandya to Finch, 1 run, short and aimed at the ribcage, a grunt by Hardik, and a Lara-esque (but not as elegant) swivel-pull to backward square leg for a single

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, half-volley in the channel outside off, Rahul gets half-forward and opens the face of the bat to wristily punch that away with his forearms to deep cover point for a single
Hardik Pandya to Finch, 1 run, shortish and wide outside off, looked like it held up in the wicket, Finch waits for it and chops it away in front of point for a quick single
Markande to Finch, 1 run, loopy leg-break, but a half-volley length wide outside off, Finch gets forward and on his knees to reach out and cut off the angle, whacks that away to long-off for a single
Markande to Rahul, 1 run, marginally short and skiddy on middle and leg, Rahul gets deep in his crease and pulls it away to long-on off a low-stance
Markande to Finch, 1 run, another flat leg-break that doesn't turn (seriously), on the pads, and whipped away wristily to fine leg for a single
Markande to Rahul, 1 run, straying on the pads again, nurdledaway to deep mid-wicket off the back foot and they take off for the single
Markande to Rahul, wide, massive off-side wide, slips out of his hand
Markande to Finch, 1 run, gives it a little more air, deceives Finch in the flight, who goes for the full-blooded sweep, gets it off the inside half to backward square leg for a single
Markande to Rahul, 1 run, flat in trajectory and on middle and leg, Rahul cuts off the angle by coming down the track and whips it to long-on for a single
Krunal Pandya to Finch, no run, flat and skiddy on middle and off, Finch stays back and bottom-hand bunts that to point
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, flat length ball on leg and middle, Rahul gets down the wicket and whips it to long-on for a single
Krunal Pandya to Finch, 1 run, on the pads again, ticked away to short fine leg for a single
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, full and flat on the pads, an exaggerated whip to deep mid-wicket for a single
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, no run, good length ball on the stumps, punched away to mid-off
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Rahul carves it away to deep backward point for four. A hit-me delivery and gets the treatment.
Markande to Rahul, 1 run, fullish delivery, the leg-break, Rahul gets as low as possible and reaches out to slice that square of the wicket for a single
Markande to Finch, 1 run, oooh, zippy length ball again, hurrying the batsman, who sits on his crease and whips it to mid-wicket for a single
Markande to Rahul, 1 run, another skidder on the stumps, the flipper I think, whipped to deep mid-wicket for a single
Markande to Finch, 1 run, another flat delivery, not much turn, skiddy, Finch pushes it to mid-on for a single
Markande to Rahul, 1 run, flat delivery pitching on the length and on middle and leg, Rahul comes down the track and whips it away to long-on for a single
Markande to Rahul, FOUR, flat leg-break just around off-stump, Rahul crouches low and cuts that when it was inches from the stumps past backward point for four
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, fired in on off, Rahul gets forward and pushes it on the run to extra cover as they scamper through for a single
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, fired in on the stumps again, lap-swept expertly to fine leg for four. Knew where the short fine fielder was and got it well past him
Krunal Pandya to Finch, 1 run, full delivery on the stumps, whipped away to mid-wicket for a quick single
Krunal Pandya to Finch, no run, length ball just outside off, steers to point
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, slightly short, Rahul is early into it as it stuck in the pitch a little, carved to cover where Cutting makes an excellent effort but drops it!
Krunal Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, a hint of flight, pretty good length, on off stump, Rahul gets down the wicket and lofts it nonchalantly towards long-on for four

Hardik Pandya to Finch, SIX, gigantic, massive, monstrous! Length ball outside off, a huge no-no in T20, Finch gets room to swing his arms, and goes through the line, golf-swings that over wide long-on for six. Monumental hit...
Hardik Pandya to Finch, 2 runs, just a tad short, a hint of width, Finch gets low and carves it away to deep backward point where Krunal Pandya does well to slide and stop it
Hardik Pandya to Finch, 2 runs, another shortish delivery just outside off, skidding on, Finch hurriedly opens the face and steers it to square third man for a brace as MitchMac cuts it off
Hardik Pandya to Rahul, 1 run, short of length delivery in the channel outside off, Rahul taps it off the back foot towards point and they comfortable amble across for a single

Hardik Pandya to Finch, leg byes, 1 run, shortish and skidding and straying on the thighs, Finch misses the glance and it thuds off his thighs towards backward square leg as they sneak a quick leg-bye
Hardik Pandya to Finch, no run, back of a length delivery on off, skidding on towards the batsman, Finch jabs his bat down and defends it from the crease to cover point
McClenaghan to Rahul, no run, fullish delivery slating away from off, Rahul gets forward and punches it crisply to the man stationed at extra cover

McClenaghan to Gayle, out Caught by Cutting!! A short one, outside off, Gayle tries to fetch it and attempts a pull, gets a top-edge. The ball crosses the stratosphere, makes a trip to heaven and lands up in the lap of Ben Cutting coming in from deep mid-wicket. Made it look rather easy. Universe Boss departs. Gayle c Cutting b McClenaghan 18(11) [4s-2 6s-1]
McClenaghan to Gayle, no run, Gayle tries to make room, McClenaghan bowls the short one coming into the batsman, Gayle moves away and lets it go. Looks a little ungainly...
McClenaghan to Rahul, 1 run, good length delivery honing in on off, Rahul gets forward, and opens the bat-face at the point of contact, slices it away to sweeper cover for a single

McClenaghan to Gayle, 1 run, short one, a little skiddy outside off, Gayle clears his front leg again, pulls it away to long-on for a single. Almost lost his balance, did the big man. Didn't fall over though and recovered quickly enough to take the single.

McClenaghan to Gayle, FOUR, geee, that was hit hard. Fuller ball just outside off, Gayle clears his front leg and slugs that over mid-on to the long-on fence for four. Lands just short of the rope. Odd how the top-edge carried and this didn't :O

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, yet another slower one, errs in length this time, half-cook, and Rahul transfers his bodyweight into an elegant extra cover drive for four. Balances himself and poses for the cameras after the shot. Yep, that was right out the meat!

Hardik Pandya to Rahul, FOUR, edged, and gone for four! Fortuitous boundary to third man. Knuckle ball pitching on a length, seaming away, Rahul gets a controlled outside edge with soft hands and it rolls away to the third man fence
Hardik Pandya to Rahul, no run, slower one, just a fraction short, in the channel outside off, a hint of away seam movement, Rahul opens the face of the bat and steers it to backward point
Hardik Pandya to Gayle, 1 run, a tad fuller, still fractionally short, Gayle tucks it away off his pelvis to backward square leg for a single
Hardik Pandya to Gayle, FOUR, another short one, this time across the left-hander, Gayle tries to cut it away, gets a top-edge over the fly slip and towards fine third man for four
Hardik Pandya to Gayle, SIX, abysmal start for Hardik (sans highlights), a lousy half-tracker, Gayle just swivels into an effortless six in front of deep square leg
Bumrah to Rahul, no run, short of length delivery jagging in off the seam towards the off-stump line, Rahul stands tall, opens the face of the bat, lets it come to him, and steers it to gully
Bumrah to Rahul, no run, short, fractionally wide, slower one in fact, 123.7kmph, Rahul makes room and tries a savage cut, misses it altogether
Bumrah to Rahul, no run, half-volley on off, Rahul check-drives that from the crease with supreme timing but fails to find the gap. Straight to mid-off
Bumrah to Gayle, 1 run, slower one pitching on a length and on the middle stump, nudged away from under his eyes and towards short mid-wicket for a single
Bumrah to Gayle, no run, good length delivery, Test match length, pitching in on middle, angling towards off, Gayle uncertainly defends late from the crease and back to the bowler
Bumrah to Gayle, no run, short one by Bumrah, intimidating the Universe Boss, across the left-hander, Gayle sways out of the way
McClenaghan to Rahul, no run, short and angling towards middle and off, Rahul stays back and opens the face of the bat to steer it to backward point. Good start by Big Mac. 8 off the first over.
McClenaghan to Rahul, no run, just a fraction short angling away from off, Rahul crouches low in his stance and carves that into the off-side, and Lewis cuts that off at point
McClenaghan to Rahul, no run, short of length delivery across the right-hander, Rahul pokes at it and tries to steer it away and is beaten on the outside edge

McClenaghan to Rahul, SIX, long stop! Leave the bat regulations alone, they've gotta have some boundary regulations! A 64-meter six! A shortish ball on the hips, Rahul shuffles across and swat-pulls it half-heartedly, gets a top-edge over the long stop fence for six
McClenaghan to Gayle, 1 run, full and directed at the pads, tucked away from the crease in front of square leg for a single. Gayle off the blob too.
McClenaghan to Rahul, 1 run, back of a length delivery skidding on towards off, Rahul opens up his stance and chops it to cover for a quick single. Punjab off the mark...
Mohit Sharma to Markande, 1 run, shuffles to off and scoops the slower ball, falls short of Gayle at short fine, they complete the single meanwhile
Mohit Sharma to McClenaghan, leg byes, 1 run, too full and aiming for off-stump, McClenaghan walks across and misses the flick. Hits the toe and dribbles into the leg-side
Mohit Sharma to Markande, leg byes, 1 run, looks to scoop, but the lack of pace means it lobs up off the pad towards the keeper

Mohit Sharma to McClenaghan, no ball, 1 run, the umpire's arm went up straightaway and tbh, it's a fifty-fifty call. Goes in batsman's favour eventually. McClenaghan stood way outside off stump and swiped at a full toss, straight into the lap of short fine. Free hit coming up
Mohit Sharma to McClenaghan, no run, gets it right, from round the wicket and the cutter dipped just inside the tramline. McClenaghan swings and misses
Mohit Sharma to McClenaghan, wide, bowls full and errs in line, too far outside off stump
Mohit Sharma to Markande, 1 run, slower ball, Markande second guessed the bowler here, stayed still in the crease and tapped it into the leg-side to claim a quick single
Mohit Sharma to Markande, FOUR, seam-up short ball wide of off-stump, Markande waits and opens the bat face to ramp it over short third. Smart batting
Andrew Tye to McClenaghan, no run, another swing and a miss. All hands on this occasion, lost his shape in the process, no pace on that and McClenaghan was way too early into the shot
Andrew Tye to McClenaghan, no run, slower ball angling away from the batsman, McClenaghan swings hard and misses
Andrew Tye to McClenaghan, FOUR, full toss wide of off-stump, McClenaghan thrashes it powerfully square on the off-side. No-one there and it's a boundary
Andrew Tye to Markande, 1 run, floated fuller on off-stump, Markande pushes it to deep mid-on

Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by Ashwin!! Third fourth wicket haul in four games for Andrew Tye. He is increasing the gap for the leading wicket takers tally. Pitched the ball short and got it to grip off the surface, it kept decking away from Hardik's reach, he slapped hard and got a thick toe-edge to short third man. Hardik Pandya c Ashwin b Andrew Tye 9(12)
Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, fullish on off, flicked away through mid-wicket
Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, wide, slower ball, but it spins away wide of off-stump, wided

Ashwin to McClenaghan, SIX, McClenaghan's known for this; hitting biggies at will. Stoops to one knee and gives it a full monty on the slogsweep, found the middle and off she goes. Into the mid-wicket stands

Ashwin to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, clipped to backward square and there's a direct hit at the striker's end. McClenaghan's home though, put his head down dragged his bat in. No worries. Easy call for the TV ump.

Ashwin to Cutting, out Caught by Axar!! Poor shot selection from Ben Cutting. Carrom ball bowled wide of off-stump, Cutting drags the slogsweep from there and hits it straight to the man at deep mid-wicket. Axar trundles forward and gobbles it with ease. Cutting c Axar b Ashwin 4(7)
Ashwin to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, jabs at a flatter delivery and works a single over mid-wicket
Ashwin to Cutting, 1 run, similar channels for Cutting, he pokes it to deep mid-on
Ashwin to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, offbreak, pitches outside leg and spins in, Hardik tucks through mid-wicket
Andrew Tye to Cutting, no run, full on off, driven back at the bowler
Andrew Tye to Cutting, 2 runs, hits the seam, back of a length arrowing into leg-stump, Cutting cleverly manoeuvres it into the mid-wicket pocket and calls for two, makes it with ease
Andrew Tye to Cutting, no run, ups his pace and pounds it short at the batsman, Cutting wasn't prepared to deal with it, just ducks underneath
Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, 115ks around off-stump, Hardik gets across and taps the ball into the leg-side to nab a quick single
Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, no run, off-cutter outside off stump, punched straight to cover
Andrew Tye to Hardik Pandya, no run, knuckle ball at off-stump, Hardik was looking to work it off his hip, the ball catches the leading edge and falls short of cover
Ashwin to Cutting, no run, gets tight on off-stump, Cutting bunts it down with soft hands
Ashwin to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, spins in very slightly, Hardik flick-drives to wide long-on
Ashwin to Cutting, 1 run, preempts the sweep and does well to get inside the line and slot that backwards of square leg

Ashwin to Pollard, out Caught by Finch!! Skipper strikes! Lovely stuff from Ash, didn't get great turn on this but ensured there's no pace and made KP fetch for that by tossing it far of off-stump; KP made room and went hard with his flat-bat swing, straight into the pocket of Finchy at wide long-on. Pollard c Finch b Ashwin 50(23) [4s-5 6s-3]
Ashwin to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, shorter and wider of off-stump, Hardik throws everything on the cut and miscues it through point
Ashwin to Hardik Pandya, no run, carrom ball, straight on the stumps, Hardik defends watchfully with a forward stride

Stoinis to Pollard, SIX, a 22-ball fifty for KP. He pumps his fists and lets out all the excitement. It was full and right in his swinging arc, KP gets underneath that and launches it many-a-mile over long-off
Stoinis to Pollard, FOUR, another wild swing and another edge. Looped up and kept third man interested for a while, Yuvi with the dive to his left, but he fails to flick the ball back into play
Stoinis to Pollard, FOUR, cross-seamer, fuller and wider of off, KP manages enough contact on the rash drive and the edge flies wide of the keeper
Stoinis to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, full toss, seemed a bit high but 'fair enough' according to the square leg umpire. Hardik jabs at it and gets off the mark with a single to long-on

Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by Rajpoot!! Deceived him with the slower short ball there. It never arrived. Krunal decided to go for the pull and he fails to arrest the momentum, ends up feeding the top-edge and offers a dolly of a catch to Rajpoot at short fine. Krunal Pandya c Rajpoot b Stoinis 32(23) [4s-1 6s-2]
Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, lovely yorker, right in the blockhole, Krunal shuffles a tad and manages to get sufficient wood behind the flick

Rajpoot to Krunal Pandya, leg byes, 1 run, another one eerily close to going down leg, Krunal walks inside the line and fails to flick, clips the thigh pad and rolls to the leg-side. Rajpoot was excited and went up, but that pitched outside leg and gave no chance for the umpire to get interested
Rajpoot to Krunal Pandya, wide, down leg, Krunal was shaping to flick, but couldn't reach
Rajpoot to Pollard, 1 run, pumps this full ball to long-off and gets off strike
Rajpoot to Pollard, FOUR, full on the pads, CYA TOMORROW! KP was quick to pounce, just needed to help the ball and he did that with some ease, past square leg with courtesy a magical wristwork

Rajpoot to Pollard, FOUR, sloppy work from Finch. A crisp drive to the left of mid-off, Finchy was late to react and hence the dive came in late, gets some hand on it, but ends up parrying it to the fence

Rajpoot to Pollard, SIX, KP is upping the ante now. A risky shot, but he generated enough power to clear the ropes. A 76-metre six. Short ball wide of KP's off-stump, he fetches from there and hacks the pull over long-on. Manoj Tiwary was interested for a bit, but that was always travelling
Rajpoot to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, slightly fuller and zoning in towards off, Krunal drives off the cue end past the bowler. Rajpoot bent low in his followthrough, but couldn't get anything on it

Axar to Pollard, SIX, becoming too predictable is Axar Patel. The last four balls have been over 100ks. This one's no different either; KP did the smart thing, gave himself room outside off by jumping to the leg-side and tonked this into the cow corner stands with a mighty swing of the bat
Axar to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, flat on off-stump, Krunal chops hurriedly into the off-side
Axar to Pollard, 1 run, 101ks, sliding in, KP lifts it off the inside half towards long-on
Axar to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, drags it short on off-stump, Krunal lifts the pull over mid-wicket, went too hard and lost timing in the process
Axar to Krunal Pandya, 2 runs, 106ks, fizzed out at the pads, Krunal takes it on the full and flicks to the right of deep square
Axar to Pollard, 1 run, slightly short and drifting in, milked down to long-on
Stoinis to Pollard, 1 run, action repeat of the first ball, dug in short and KP - unlike the previous pull - controls  this to deep square by rolling his wrists
Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, fuller and slower outside off, Krunal forces it down to long-off
Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, half-volley, keep 'em coming screams Krunal's willow. Just leans forward slightly and creams it off the middle wide of mid-off
Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, SIX, nothing half-hearted about this. Picked the length (short) early and deposited this over wide long-on with an air of nonchalance. Typical Krunal

Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, SIX, just over the outstreched hand of Ankit Rajpoot at long leg. Just! Krunal went for the pull, didn't get all of it, dragged it off the bottom half and it eluded the fieldsman near the boundary ropes. Rajpoot kept his head still and flung himself backwards, but it fell tantalizingly past his fingertips
Stoinis to Pollard, 1 run, short ball, dug into the pitch, KP pulls fiercely but he finds deep square who collects it on the bounce
Axar to Pollard, 1 run, slider, KP stays on the back foot and punches a single to long-on
Axar to Pollard, no run, flatter around off, pushed back to the bowler
Axar to Pollard, wide, sprayed down leg, very quick too, KP misses the flick
Axar to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, easy for the left-hander with the ball coming in, makes use of the angle and eases a single down to long-on
Axar to Pollard, 1 run, gets it right this time around, stays behind the line and uses those wrists to slot the drive to mid-off
Axar to Pollard, no run, went for the lofty drive, but the ball's angled in and it clips the inside edge before deflecting to backward point off the pad
Axar to Pollard, 2 runs, fires in quicker just outside off, KP push-drives firmly wide of extra cover, easy two
Stoinis to Pollard, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, worked away wide of mid-wicket for a single

Stoinis to Pollard, FOUR, beautifully played, this should give Pollard some confidence, back of a length and wide of off, Pollard stands tall andc punches it in front of square on the off-side, beats cover and races away to the fence
Stoinis to Pollard, no run, on a good length and just outside off, defended towards the off-side
Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, short of a length and on Krunal's pads, tucked away wide of mid-wicket for a single
Stoinis to Krunal Pandya, no run, another nothing shot from Krunal, on a good length and a hint of shape away from the left-hander, drew Krunal into the drive and beat him on the outside edge
Stoinis to Pollard, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, Pollard was looking to drive and gets a thick inside edge towards long-on
Rajpoot to Krunal Pandya, no run, beautifully bowled, short of a good length and seaming across the left-hander. A flat-footed Krunal went wafting at that and is lucky not to have edged it
Rajpoot to Krunal Pandya, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, Krunal prods across and defends it towards the off-side
Rajpoot to Krunal Pandya, no run, back of a length and angling across the left-hander, Krunal stands tall and finds cover with the back-foot punch

Rajpoot to Pollard, 1 run, that's excellent thinking from Rajpoot, nearly had his man here. This was full and tailed back in slightly, Pollard was caught on the move as he flicked, only saved by a big inside edge

Rajpoot to Rohit, out Caught by Yuvraj!! Another low score for Rohit, he's been undone by the short ball once again. This was banged in short and just outside off, skidded through and hurried Rohit with pace, he was in a terrible position as he pulled, got a top-edge and all he managed to do was to find Yuvraj at mid-on. He accepts the chance gleefully and his reaction suggests how pumped up he's for this match. The customary check for the front-foot no-ball and Rajpoot is fine on that count. Off he goes, Rohit. Rohit c Yuvraj b Rajpoot 6(10)

Rajpoot to Rohit, no run, on a length and angling back into the right-hander, Rohit was looking to dab with an angled bat, can't beat backward point though. He wanted a quick single, but is sent back by his partner
Ashwin to Rohit, 1 run, tad too short from Ashwin, lets Rohit stay back and pull it down towards long-on
Ashwin to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, the carrom ball from Ashwin, but he fired it quicker and on Krunal's pads, nudged away behind square on the on-side
Ashwin to Rohit, 1 run, nice bit of flight from Ashwin, Rohit gets forward and eases it down towards long-off
Ashwin to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, tossed up on off, Krunal goes right back and punches it to long-on for a single
Ashwin to Rohit, 1 run, fraction short and just outside off, punched to the right of cover where the fielder makes a tumbling half-stop
Ashwin to Rohit, no run, Ashwin drifts this one across the right-hander, Rohit was looking to work it towards the on-side, closed the bat-face and the leading edge popped wide of cover
Axar to Rohit, 1 run, fraction too short from Axar, allows Rohit to go back and tuck it past mid-wicket for a single
Axar to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, that's cheeky from Krunal, bends down low and plays a reverse paddle to the right of short third man, just a single
Axar to Rohit, 1 run, slower and on off, Rohit drops it wide of cover for a single
Axar to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, flighted on off, Krunal gets close to the ball and works it towards long-on for a single
Axar to Rohit, 1 run, tossed up on off, Rohit gets forward and drives it back past the bowler, off the mark with a single
Axar to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, tossed up on off, Krunal goes back and punches it towards long-on for a single
Andrew Tye to Rohit, no run, on a good length and holding its line outside off, Rohit watches it all along and lets it go
Andrew Tye to Krunal Pandya, 1 run, short of a good length and just outside off, pushed to the left of cover-point for a single

Andrew Tye to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by Rahul!! Back to back wickets and Tye is on fire. This was short and just outside off, Suryakumar was looking to help it on its way with a flap pull, gets a big inside edge that pops up off his knee-roll. KL runs forward and completes the catch, silence at the Wankhede as Tye scalps his 23rd victim of the season, he's on a hat-trick as well. Suryakumar Yadav c Rahul b Andrew Tye 27(15) [4s-3 6s-2]

Andrew Tye to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Stoinis!! Kishan's streaky innings comes to an end and it's that man - Tye, who takes the wicket once again. This was another knuckle ball that angled across the left-hander, Kishan was looking to heave it over mid-wicket, doesn't cover for the angle, gets it high on the bat and spoons it over mid-on. Stoinis was the fielder there - he kept his eyes on the ball as he back tracked and completed a simple catch. Ishan Kishan c Stoinis b Andrew Tye 20(12) [4s-1 6s-2]
Andrew Tye to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, change of pace from Tye, this was the slower ball, dabbed away behind square on the off-side for a single
Andrew Tye to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, length ball on off, Kishan runs down the pitch and pushes it towards mid-off for a quick single
Mohit Sharma to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, Kishan was looking to drive and gets a big edge towards third man. Another expensive over from Mohit - 18 came from it

Mohit Sharma to Ishan Kishan, SIX, back-to-back sixes for Kishan, came charging down the track, Mohit went full and wide of off, Kishan was committed to the drive, gets it off the outside half and still has enough to sail over the ropes - at deep backward point

Mohit Sharma to Ishan Kishan, SIX, massive, too short and the angle worked against Mohit here, Kishan swivels across, doesn't bother to keep the ball down and sends it soaring into the second tier - way over backward square leg for a maximum
Mohit Sharma to Ishan Kishan, no run, Mohit shortened his length as Kishan came down the track, pushed back at the bowler

Mohit Sharma to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, edged and four, unlucky for the bowler, on a good length and a hint of seam away from the left-hander, drew Kishan into the drive and found a thick edge, past the lone slip and races away to the fence

Mohit Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, leg byes, 1 run, short of a length and on Suryakumar's pads, he was late on the flick and missed, the ball clipped the thigh and rolled away behind square on the on-side, they sneak in a leg-bye
Andrew Tye to Ishan Kishan, no run, short of a length and on Kishan's hips, he was looking to flick and missed, the ball brushed his thigh and rolled back at the bowler

Andrew Tye to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, on a good length and on the stumps, Kishan shimmies down the track, gets close to the ball and then flicks it in front of square on the on-side, comes back for the second run
Andrew Tye to Ishan Kishan, no run, this is excellent bowling from Tye, pitched up and in that channel just outside off, made Kishan feel for the ball and beat him on the outside edge
Andrew Tye to Ishan Kishan, no run, this is an excellent start from Tye, on a good length and shaping away from the left-hander, drew Kishan into the drive and beat him on the outside edge
Andrew Tye to Ishan Kishan, no run, another slower ball from Tye, very full and just outside off, Kishan leant forward and pushed it back at the bowler

Andrew Tye to Lewis, out Bowled!! Brilliant from Tye and he has his 21st wicket of IPL 2018. This is deception at its very best, the knuckle ball, pitched around off and seamed back into the left-hander, the length drew Lewis into an expansive drive, the gap between bat and pad was created, the ball snuck through and the off-stump went for a walk. Lewis b Andrew Tye 9(7) [6s-1]

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, cheeky and four, back of a length and just outside off, Suryakumar waits on it, lets the ball come onto him and then defltly glides it past the keeper, third man was square and has no chance, 21 from the over

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, lovely shot, back-to-back sixes for Suryakumar and he was in complete control here. This was the slower ball from Rajpoot, Suryakumar gets forward and thumps it over mid-off, went sailing over the ropes for another maximum
Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, top-edge and six, Suryakumar was done in by the bouncer, was clearly late on the pull, gets a fat top-edge that sailed over the ropes at fine leg
Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, Rajpoot hits the deck hard and the line is just outside off, jabbed back at the bowler

Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, lovely shot, too short from Rajpoot, Suryakumar swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it past square leg, no one in the deep and it's a boundary - Suryakumar's second of the night

Rajpoot to Lewis, 1 run, fraction too short from Rajpoot, Lewis rocks back and pulls it to the left of mid-wicket. I think it was Ashwin who dived and got a hand onto it - can't save the single though
Mohit Sharma to Lewis, 1 run, short of a length and angling back into the left-hander, he didn't get hold of the pull and it pops wide of Gayle at mid-wicket, just a single

Mohit Sharma to Lewis, SIX, the first six of the evening - on a good length and just outside off, Lewis got forward on the lofted drive, didn't time it all that well - ended up slicing it high and over mid-off - has enough to clear the ropes on the full
Mohit Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, tad fuller and just outside off, Suryakumar wasn't fully forward on the drive, doesn't time it all that well but it allows him to sneak in a single to mid-off
Mohit Sharma to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, back of a length and just outside off, Suryakumar gets half-forward and finds mid-off with the back-foot drive
Mohit Sharma to Lewis, leg byes, 1 run, short of a length and on the stumps, Lewis was looking to help it on its way and missed, hit the thigh pad and rolled away behind square on the on-side

Mohit Sharma to Lewis, no run, on a good length and in that channel just outside off, Lewis went way too hard on the drive, mistimes it badly and the ball rolls away towards mid-off - off the splice of the bat
Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, tad fuller and just outside off, Suryakumar leans into the drive but can't place it into the gap - to the left of the man at cover-point
Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, on a good length and just outside off, Suryakumar gets on top of the bounce and finds the fielder at cover-point with the drive
Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, edged and four, width on offer from Rajpoot and Suryakumar threw his bat at that, gets a healthy edge that flies through the vacant second slip region
Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, back of a length and just outside off, Suryakumar prods across and pushes it towards backward point

Rajpoot to Lewis, 1 run, on a good length and a hint of shape back into the left-hander, Lewis was playing with an angled bat and dabbed it behind point. Axar makes a half-stop and keeps them down to a single
Rajpoot to Lewis, wide, Rajpoot sprays this one wide of off, called as a wide by the umpire
Rajpoot to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, Suryakumar Yadav shuffled across and worked it wide of mid-on for a single

Siraj to Manish Pandey, 1 run, RCB are still in this. They move to 12 points. Whatta game of cricket. Again got the heartbeats pulsating at a break neck pace. That was a low full toss and tailing in, the batsman with a closed face of the bat drags the ball away to long-on for a single
Siraj to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, miscues the ball over backward point for a brace

Siraj to Deepak Hooda, 1 run, dropped! How many dropped catches tonight? And second drop for the skipper. The length ball was delivered for the batsman to send it to the moon. But the batsman lifted it up without any distance for the man at long-off to come in but he dropped it

Siraj to Manish Pandey, leg byes, 1 run, full toss and the batsman fails to connect on this. The ball thuds the pad away and bobbles away into the on-side. They take a leg-bye amidst the huge appeal. The fans erupt as they know that even three sixes won't be enough

Siraj to Manish Pandey, no run, what was he trying to do? 20 off 4 balls now. The batsman tries to be cheeky and looks to hit it off the back of his bat and misses it. Pressure on the batting side now

Siraj to Williamson, out Caught by de Grandhomme!! The swirler has been taken at deep fine leg, inches inside the fence. The batsman shuffled across the sticks and swept the ball away high up in the air. The ball went skywards and when it came down, it had a nervous Kiwi under it. The fielder took it really away from his body. He was inches inside the fence though and that played on his mind. Williamson c de Grandhomme b Siraj 81(42) [4s-7 6s-5]

Southee to Manish Pandey, FOUR, four to end! The drama continues. 20 to get in the last over. That was full, more of a half-volley as he missed the mark and the batsman brought all his sinews to play. Muscled past long-off, to his left for a four

Southee to Manish Pandey, no run, just inside the tramline outside off and the batsman lets it go in search of a wide. That was again full and the batsman could not reach it as he was backing away a bit

Southee to Williamson, 1 run, another misfield. Does not cost RCB anything. The wide, full ball was squeezed away to short third man, who fumbled and recovered in time to allow only a single. The throw was a horrible one but good backing up as well
Southee to Manish Pandey, 1 run, blasts the full ball away and the man at long-off picks the ball up. Failed to get under it this time. 25 off 9 balls now
Southee to Manish Pandey, FOUR, mid-off inside the circle and the batsman gets under the fullish ball to nail it over mid-off. That is something SRH would take with open arms

Southee to Manish Pandey, FOUR, slippery conditions or too casual was CDG? The batsman biffed the full and wide ball over the bowler. The man at long-on did the slide well but the ball bobbled away after hitting the torso. Pressure is doing all the talking now. 31 needed now
Southee to Manish Pandey, wide, slower delivery, radars it too wide and wided by the umpire as the batsman let it go
Siraj to Manish Pandey, 1 run, yorkerish delivery just outside off and the batsman blocks the ball out into the third man region for a single

Siraj to Manish Pandey, no run, looks to do the back of the bat act again and misses. That was full and well outside off, could have got under it but tried to be cheeky and misses. That can be a costly miss. 13 off the over so far
Siraj to Manish Pandey, wide, the batsmen tried to steer the ball away with the back of the bat and misses. That was wide and the umpire makes the correct decision. 36 off 14 balls
Siraj to Williamson, leg byes, 1 run, looks to play the paddle after shuffling across his sticks and misses. The ball thuds the pad and drops dead on the centre. The batsmen get a steal
Siraj to Manish Pandey, 1 run, full, almost a yorker as the full toss dipped on the batsman. Manish Pandey flogged the ball away to deep mid-wicket

Siraj to Manish Pandey, FOUR, slower ball, Manish Pandey waits till eternity and upper steers the ball over short third man for a four. 10 off the first two balls. Pressure back on RCB and Siraj as Kohli tries to egg his bowler on

Siraj to Manish Pandey, SIX, Siraj misses the mark and pays the price. Manish Pandey dances across his sticks, exposes all of it and picks the ball over fine leg for a sixer. That was smart, not from the bowler though

Southee to Manish Pandey, 1 run, and again! Accuracy from the Kiwi has been commendable. The batsman inside halves the ball away into the off-side as another inch-perfect wide and full ball was delivered. Not allowing the batsman to get under it. Six of that over only

Southee to Williamson, 1 run, the batsman shuffled a bit, the bowler kept it full and wide. The batsman dragged the drive away and Umesh does the sliding act at mid-off to keep them down to a single. Excellent stuff from Southee
Southee to Manish Pandey, 1 run, charges out too much, fails to get under it and the batsman muscles the ball away to mid-off. Only a single as Umesh steadied himself to pick that up

Southee to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, not perfectly in the yorker zone outside off and the batsman slams the drive to mid-off. Umesh there lets it slip a bit and they take a couple. Not what RCB would want. SRH would take it
Southee to Manish Pandey, no run, two out of two from Southee..Full and wide yorker. The batsman looks to power it but mistimes the ball back to the bowler
Southee to Williamson, 1 run, fullish and widish yorker, the batsman squirts the ball out to squarish deep third man for a single

Chahal to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, fifty of the partnership comes up as Pandey comes back for a brace again. That was on the sticks again, might have been the quicker ball and the batsman turned the ball away between long-on and deep mid for a brace. 55 off the last four overs.
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, that was on the sticks and the batsman stays back to tuck the ball away into the on-side for a single
Chahal to Manish Pandey, 1 run, slightly fuller outside off and has been pushed away into the off-side for a single
Chahal to Manish Pandey, wide, slips it down leg and has been wided

Chahal to Manish Pandey, 2 runs, 'two two' was the call as soon as he hit it on the on-side. The throw from the deep, had it been slightly better and things could have been different. The batsman was on the back foot when he played it away through the deep square region
Chahal to Manish Pandey, FOUR, drags the ball short, bad ball and put away. The batsman decides to drag the pull behind square and gets it past the man at 45 degrees for a four. SRH would take it
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, flattish on the pads and has been tucked away into the on-side for a single

de Grandhomme to Manish Pandey, SIX, gargantuan! More height and enough distance. That was on a length and the batsman dismisses it over long-on for a sixer. Only 67 now off 30 balls as 22 is leaked in that over
de Grandhomme to Williamson, 1 run, full-toss, wide and the batsman chases that one to trim the drive away into the covers for a single

de Grandhomme to Williamson, SIX, low full toss and Williamson goes one step better compared to his mate. That has been drop-kicked over deep square for a maximum. The runs are raining now. RCB ducking for cover but no where to hide
de Grandhomme to Manish Pandey, 1 run, chops the ball down as it was short and wide. Mistimes the ball away into the off-side for a single
de Grandhomme to Manish Pandey, FOUR, low full toss, dipping and the batsman clips the ball away past deep square leg for a four. That was superb from Manish Pandey as he gets it away

de Grandhomme to Manish Pandey, FOUR, anti-climactic end to a superb effort. Put in a pool like dive at deep mid to get to it. But then kept sliding and the ball slipped away. Just touched the ropes and their was dismay on the face of the skipper. The short ball was thumped away between mid-wicket and long-on by the batsman

U Yadav to Williamson, SIX, this guy is amazing! Not a T20 player, they said. Short one outside off, drags that with a pull over deep mid-wicket for a massive six. He's carting sixes on his way to a win.
U Yadav to Manish Pandey, 1 run, length ball angling towards leg and middle, Manish Pandey makes room and whips it away aerially to deep square leg for a single
U Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, length ball on off, uses the pace to extend his compact late-block to third man for a single

U Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, not even close to a half-tracker, just outside off, uses those beautiful wrists and splits that gap surgically behind backward point for four. Class. Yes, even T20 can be classy.
U Yadav to Manish Pandey, 1 run, length delivery headed for leg stump, Manish Pandey walks down and taps it to mid-on, continues to run for a single
U Yadav to Manish Pandey, no run, short and wide outside off, steered to cover where Moeen dives and saves a few runs

de Grandhomme to Williamson, SIX, in the slot, a bit of air too, Williamson gets on his knees, and puts all his might into that slog-sweep over deep mid-wicket for six. Didn't seem to time that perfectly, managed to clear it. How does he look elegant while slogging? 50 partnership is up, and it almost hits a car.
de Grandhomme to Manish Pandey, 1 run, yorker length delivery on middle and leg, dug out off the toe-end to long-on for a single
de Grandhomme to Williamson, 1 run, short and skiddy just outside off, punched away to sweeper cover for a single
de Grandhomme to Williamson, 2 runs, 8th fifty for KW this IPL, his 11th IPL fifty in his 28th game. Flat and shortish, whipped away off the back foot to deep mid-wicket for a brace
de Grandhomme to Manish Pandey, 1 run, fuller on off, on the back foot, used his bodyweight to slug that away to long-on for a single
de Grandhomme to Williamson, 1 run, length ball attacking off, Williamson pucnhes it wristily to sweeper cover off the back foot for a single

Siraj to Manish Pandey, no run, good length delivery angling in towards off, Manish Pandey is on the walk as he steers it to point, but has to get back as Mandeep is on the prowl and he stops it getting through the infield
Siraj to Williamson, 1 run, very full on middle and leg, almost yorker length, dug out to mid-wicket for a single
Siraj to Williamson, FOUR, slower one @117km/h, Williamson waits for it, calm as a cucumber (maybe change the idiom to Dhoni), steers it away to deep backward point for four

Siraj to Williamson, SIX, fractionally short outside off, Williamson stays low and shuffles across, gets under it and pulls it flat to deep mid-wicket. Goes just over the rope for six. Magnificent hitting.
Siraj to Williamson, no run, short, not much wide, Williamson manufactures his width with his bottom-hand, cuts hard to the right of point where Mandeep dives to his right to save it
Siraj to Williamson, no run, short of length delivery, Siraj bending his back, pitching outside off, Williamson shuffles across, drops it into the on-side off the back foot

Chahal to Manish Pandey, no run, goes straight on this time, Manish not picking it from the hand, defends for the leg-break, but it goes straight on and hits his back pad. A stifled appeal, but clearly going down leg...
Chahal to Manish Pandey, no run, fuller one on middle and leg, flat, turning away (straightening), Manish Pandey gets forward and pushes to cover
