Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, flat and skiddy, a flipper I think, whipped away off the back foot to backward square leg for a single

Chahal to Williamson, no run, another in-dipping delivery, deceiving the initial direction at the last moment and turning away, Williamson is compact in his forward defence and plays that late. Respect for a good ball; back to the old virtues of cricket
Chahal to Williamson, 2 runs, fuller in length, punched away with the turn to sweeper cover, inside out for a couple

Chahal to Williamson, no run, wow, is this a Test match? Shane Warne, are you watching? A bit of swerve in, pitching on off, and turn away from the righty. Beaten one of the best and most compact batsmen in the world on the outside edge

Moeen Ali to Williamson, 1 run, dropped a little short again, Williamson crouches low and converts that into a pullable length, and clouts that away cross-batted to the manned deep mid-wicket area for a single
Moeen Ali to Manish Pandey, 1 run, very very slow, on middle, Manish Pandey gets back and forces a flick in front of square leg for a single
Moeen Ali to Williamson, 1 run, dropped a little short, no turn to speak of, whipped off the back foot to deep mid-wicket for a single

Moeen Ali to Williamson, SIX, Wow! Tossed up, in the slot, Williamson keeps a still head and golf-swings it through the line to deep mid-wicket for four. The most underrated of the big four, and he is proving his credentials today
Moeen Ali to Williamson, FOUR, tossed up outside off, pitched up, Williamson comes forward and whips it between mid-wicket and long-on expertly for four. Elegance personified
Moeen Ali to Williamson, FOUR, flat delivery, skidding, Williamson gets low and swat-sweeps that to deep square leg for four
Southee to Williamson, 1 run, a tad short without much width, Williamson waits for it and steers it to third man for a single
Southee to Williamson, FOUR, short and wide outside off, Williamson gets down the wicket and slaps that over deep extra cover for four
Southee to Williamson, FOUR, a tad short and angling into the body, Williamson shuffles across and guides the pull to backward square leg where Sarfraz misfields and lets it through for four
Southee to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short of length delivery on off, dabbed away late to third man for a single
Southee to Manish Pandey, no run, short and wide, Manish Pandey cuts but misses out as he finds point
Southee to Manish Pandey, no run, slightly short, outside off, Manish Pandey punches it off the back foot to cover

Moeen Ali to Hales, out Caught by de Villiers!! No way. He didn't just do that. It's all about the Avengers now, but AB is the only one keeping DC alive. A toss-up outside off, Hales gets down the wicket and bottom-hand swats that flat towards deep mid-wicket, seems to have cleared it till the last moment until Superman arrives from Krypton to pluck that out of thin air. Leaps and grabs that one-handed. Absolutely ridiculous. The right foot was in fact extremely close to the rope and he landed on the right foot and had enough balance at the age of 34 to hold on and he was dancing like a teenager. Absolute magic. Hales c de Villiers b Moeen Ali 37(24) [4s-2 6s-3]
Moeen Ali to Williamson, 1 run, fuller and flatter outside off, Williamson shuffles across and whips it to deep square leg for a single
Moeen Ali to Hales, 1 run, beaten in the flight, tries the sweep, gets it off the inside half to backward square leg for a single. Loud groan of disappointment by the batsman
Moeen Ali to Hales, no run, flight, off-break, a bit of turn from outside off, Hales is stuck on the crease and pokes tentatively, gets a thick inside edge nearly onto his stumps
Moeen Ali to Williamson, 1 run, another flat one angling into the pads, no turn to speak (or type) of, a back foot tuck to backward square leg for a single
Moeen Ali to Hales, 1 run, full and a hint of flight on the pads, clipped away to short mid-wicket for a quick single

U Yadav to Hales, 1 run, another short of length ball angling in towards off, guided away late by Hales towards third man for a comfortable single to retain the strike. A miserly 4-run over by Umesh. He's been amazing for RCB this IPL.
U Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, short of length delivery honing in on off, Williamson gets back, VVSes a backfoot whip mid-on for a single

U Yadav to Hales, 1 run, good length delivery just outside off, Test match length, Hales has learnt some Indian tip-and-run in his time in the subcontinent, opens the face to dab it away to third man for a single
U Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, back of a length delivery around off, Williamson shuffles across, goes deep in the creases, and wristily whips it to deep mid-wicket for a single

U Yadav to Williamson, no run, just a fraction short, a hint of width, Williamson gets low into a square drive, a transfer-of-weight shot in front of point, but Mandeep puts in a dive to stop it at point
U Yadav to Williamson, no run, length delivery in the channel outside off, Williamson stands tall and punches it firmly to mid-off

Chahal to Hales, FOUR, the last ball goes for four. Dragged down and Hales lapped it over short fine's head. Needed to get enough bat to clear the fielder and did so. Poor end to the powerplay for RCB
Chahal to Hales, no run, flatter and on the middle and leg, Hales tucks to square leg, no chance of a quick single
Chahal to Williamson, 1 run, flicked through mid-wicket

Chahal to Williamson, FOUR, that has to be the softest stroke played to get a four this IPL. Unreal actually. Too full and Williamson got forward before wristing it wide of a diving Southee at mid-on. Placed expertly and the ball kissed the turf along its way to the fence. Delightful from KW
Chahal to Williamson, no run, tossed up on middle, pushed to cover off the front foot

Chahal to Dhawan, out Caught&Bowled!! It is Chahal makes the breakthrough. Soft dismissal it must be said. Down the track and chipped back to the bowler. Who throws the ball away in delight. Wakes the crowd up who were starting to get restless. Dhawan c and b Chahal 18(15) [6s-2]
Siraj to Hales, SIX, the next ball goes for six. Length ball on the stumps, Hales heaves and clears deep mid. Just. But that will do

Siraj to Hales, no run, dropped by Kohli diving at mid-on. Dove too far actually. Ended up hitting his wrist. Drilled by Hales and the RCB skipper got both hands and spilled it. Isn't happy with himself at all
Boult to Jadeja, 1 run, length ball outside off, Jadeja slugs it away to wide long-on for a single. And that's an underwhelming loss for CSK, and a dominant consolation win for the Delhi Daredevils.
Boult to Chahar, 1 run, length ball on middle, Chahar gets an edge onto his pads, towards short fine for a single. Stifled appeal from the keeper, but there was bat on that
Boult to Chahar, no run, not given a wide! Length ball from round the wicket, Chahar waiting after shuffling outside off and tries to swing it away  over fine leg, misses, as the ball goes down leg
Boult to Jadeja, 1 run, a tad short outside off, wide-ish, Jadeja tries to chop it away, ends up getting an under-edge towards fine leg for a single

Boult to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by Vijay Shankar! Half-volley on off, Dwayne Bravo swings through the line, once again gets far too much height and hardly any distance, holes out to Vijay Shankar running in from long-off. That ball must have little drops of heaven on it by now, the number of times it has crosses the earth's atmosphere tonight. Dwayne Bravo c Vijay Shankar b Boult 1(2)
Boult to Jadeja, 1 run, full delivery on the stumps, swung away all along the ground to backward square leg for a single

Harshal Patel to Jadeja, leg byes, 1 run, yet another slower one on a back of a length angling in from round the wicket towards the groin, Jadeja misses the tuck into the on-side and it trundles away towards short third man for a leg-bye. Harshal ends with figures of 4-0-23-1, to add to his 36*(16). MoM performance if there ever was one.
Harshal Patel to Jadeja, no run, short and wide outside off, marginally inside the tramline as Jadeja tries to pull and misses. On the bounce to the keeper
Harshal Patel to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, short and slow outside off, Dwayne Bravo gets across and drags a poorly timed pull towards mid-wicket for a single
Harshal Patel to Jadeja, 1 run, fractionally short, very little width, Jadeja jabs that cut, caresses it square of the wicket towards deep point for a single
Harshal Patel to Jadeja, 2 runs, shortish slower one on middle and leg, Jadeja mistimes a guided pull towards fine leg for a brace

Harshal Patel to Jadeja, SIX, first of all, kudos to the cameraman for following that one. Half-volley on middle, in the slot, Jadeja lofts it with every ounce of his power straight down the ground for six. That went through to the stratosphere and back into the sightscreen

Boult to Dhoni, out Caught by Shreyas Iyer!! And the mentalist fails to pull off the unfathomable tonight! Low full toss, Dhoni finally nails the timing on this with a bottom-hand whip, flat and fittingly straight the his opposite number at long-on. A sigh of relief for DD. Dhoni c Shreyas Iyer b Boult 17(23) [4s-1]
Boult to Jadeja, 1 run, full delivery on middle and leg, swung away on the bounce in front of deep square leg for a single

Boult to Dhoni, 3 runs, absolutely ridiculous. Pandemonium out there. Dhoni pulls this short one, gets a feeble top-edge towards mid-on which is unmanned, and the fielder fires in a throw at the striker's end as they ran across for two. The keeper doesn't manage to back up and the ball goes through towards third man as they scamper through for a third. If that had gone through short third man, that was effectively a six
Boult to Dhoni, no run, full and wide, aimed at the tramline, Dhoni tries to reach it and squeeze it out, misses
Boult to Dhoni, no run, slower bouncer @117.5km/h, wide outside off, Dhoni tries to drag the pull from far outside off, gets a thick under-edge to the keeper
Boult to Jadeja, 1 run, shortish and into the body, Jadeja nails the pull towards deep mid-wicket for a single

Harshal Patel to Jadeja, 1 run, length delivery outside off, Jadeja has an almighty heave at it, trying to clear the area code, ends up slicing it aerially. High in the air, and lands in front of Avesh Khan at square third man who just doesn't go for the catch. Might not have reached but it was worth a try. Not enough horizontal momentum to reach the fence anyway
Harshal Patel to Dhoni, 1 run, short and wide, slow as well, no pace to work with for Dhoni, who tries another wristy cut, but only manages to chop it towards point for a scrambled single
Harshal Patel to Dhoni, no run, slower bouncer from deep in the palm, pitching outside off and slanting in towards the stumps, Dhoni pulls it straight to square leg
Harshal Patel to Dhoni, no run, short, slow and wide outside off, Dhoni hops to get on top of it to guide it away towards third man, but only thing is, he misses. Through to the keeper
Harshal Patel to Jadeja, 1 run, length delivery on middle, skidding on, whipped away from the crease in front of square leg for a single
Harshal Patel to Jadeja, no run, back of a length delivery from round the wicket, not quite there for the cut, not enough width, Jadeja tries a late-cut towards backward point, misses it completely

Lamichhane to Dhoni, no run, leg-break pitching on middle and off, Dhoni gets on the back foot and pokes it with an open face towards cover point. Good over comes to an end (other than that six of course)

Lamichhane to Jadeja, 1 run, dragged short, slipped out of his hand, happens when you're nervous and your palms are sweaty (knees weak, arms are heavy), pulled away off the under-edge towards mid-wicket for a single
Lamichhane to Dhoni, 1 run, leg-break on a length, flat in trajectory, Dhoni gets back and checks a semi-copter all along the ground to long-on for a single. Past a diving Lamichhane
Lamichhane to Jadeja, 1 run, full and flat on the pads, whipped away firmly towards mid-wicket for a single
Lamichhane to Jadeja, 2 runs, dragged short and wide, Jadeja backs away and slaps it away to sweeper cover as they scamper through for a couple

Lamichhane to Jadeja, SIX, googly on middle, Jadeja gets down the wicket and tonks it straight down the ground over the sightscreen! Full swing of the blade, >360 degrees, and it sails away for an 89 meter six

Mishra to Dhoni, no run, oh, good ol' Mishraji. Flat one fired in at leg, no scope for Dhoni, who tries a paddle-swat-sweep towards long-stop from way back in his dread-lock days, misses it completely and almost falls over
Mishra to Dhoni, no run, perfect length, flat just outside off, Dhoni reaches out and can only push it back to Mishraji
Mishra to Jadeja, 1 run, fired in on off and middle was that leg-break, clipped away neatly towards mid-on for a single

Mishra to Billings, out Caught by Abhishek Sharma! Mishraji wins the  mind-game. Leg-break just a tad wide outside off, Billings goes for an ill-advised sweep trying to drag it into the on-side, gets a feeble top-edge that lobs into the hands of short fine leg. Mishy is pumped. Billings c Abhishek Sharma b Mishra 1(5)

Mishra to Dhoni, 1 run, the world's strongest bottom hand lays his hands on a low full-toss on middle, swats it flat down to long-on for a single as the ball bounces off the fielder's hands. Such unfathomable power
Mishra to Dhoni, no run, leg-break drifting in towards off, and turning sharply away, Dhoni tries to cut it away off a low stance, gets beaten on the outside edge

Lamichhane to Billings, no run, leg-break tossed up on middle, Billings comes down the track and tries to whip it through mid-wicket against the turn, gets a leading edge towards cover and falls just short of the man diving to his right
Lamichhane to Billings, no run, fractionally short, googly again, outside off, Billings cuts it towards cover point
Lamichhane to Billings, no run, googly angling towards middle, Billings tries to reverse-sweep, wrongly so, gets an under-edge that goes past the leg-stump and then towards the keeper on the bounce
Lamichhane to Dhoni, 1 run, tossed up, Dhoni down the wicket, flat-bats it off the toe-end to the man at long-on on the bounce for a single
Lamichhane to Billings, 1 run, full one on middle and leg, Billings clips it firmly down to long-on for a single

Lamichhane to Raina, out Caught by Vijay Shankar!! Loopy googly on leg-stump, Raina predictably goes for his almighty heave over mid-wicket which has brought him much success over the years. Not tonight though as he flat-bats it straight down the throat of Vijay Shankar at cow corner. That's the end of a the most un-Raina innings of all time. An innings of more than ten balls, with a strike-rate below hundred. *Shaking my head* Raina c Vijay Shankar b Lamichhane 15(18) [4s-1]
Mishra to Dhoni, no run, fuller one on off-stump, Dhoni pushes it back to Mishy from the crease

Mishra to Raina, 1 run, leading edge, a googly on middle, Raina gets forward and tries to flick through the on-side. He gets a leading edge that is in the air for a while and goes through the gap in the cover region for a single
Mishra to Dhoni, 1 run, leg-break on off, tossed up, Dhoni leans forward and pokes that to point, takes off for a quick single. Overthrow, but they decide not to go for the second
Mishra to Dhoni, no run, another zippy leg-break outside off, Dhoni whip-drives that politely towards cover
Mishra to Raina, 1 run, a drag-down, leg-break, slips out of the hand, Raina has all the time in the world but doesn't find the gap and pulls it straight to the man stationed at cow corner
Mishra to Dhoni, 1 run, skiddy slider, the double bluff, Dhoni doesn't read it, but adjusts well enough to drag the pull from outside off-stump to deep mid-wicket for a single
Maxwell to Raina, no run, fractionally short, skidding on outside off, Raina crouches low in his stance and chops it straight to point
Maxwell to Raina, no run, perfect length, flat trajectory, Raina gets forward and pushes to extra cover
Maxwell to Dhoni, 1 run, full delivery, a bit of flight, on the pads, and a soft whip away to deep mid-wicket for a single
Maxwell to Dhoni, FOUR, what amazing placement! Flat one just outside off, not short at all, Dhoni whips a cut between gully and backward point for four. Surgically bisected the field
Maxwell to Raina, 1 run, flatter, shorter, outside off, punched off the back foot towards long-off for a single
Maxwell to Raina, FOUR, vintage Raina! Tossed up outside off, Raina reaches out, gets to the pitch of it, and lofts that inside-out over extra cover for four
Lamichhane to Raina, 1 run, straying on the pads from over the wicket, Raina gets forward and turns it politely away to backward square leg for a single
Lamichhane to Dhoni, 1 run, loopy delivery on off, Dhoni shimmies down and wristily drives that to long-off for a single
Lamichhane to Raina, 1 run, leg-break on off, punched from the crease to short cover for a single
Lamichhane to Dhoni, 1 run, loopy delivery on middle, leg-break, Dhoni is quickly down the wicket and not quite to the pitch, in the air for a while and past the non-striker towards mid-on
Lamichhane to Raina, 1 run, googly pitched a little short across the left-hander, spinning away outside off, tucked away towards mid-on for a comfortable single
Lamichhane to Dhoni, 1 run, full and flighted outside off, swat-driven away to sweeper cover for a single

Harshal Patel to Rayudu, out Caught by Maxwell!! Oh, may I just say that could've hit a plane. A length ball on middle, Rayudu comes down the track and isn't quite to the pitch of it, gets it off the meat but gets the timing just wrong on the lofted whip which makes it gain more height than distance as Maxwell does phenomenally well to sight the ball and settles under it at deep mid-wicket. Lies out on the grass under the heavens, a relieved man. Made it look much easier than it actually was. That went a kilometer up in the air. Rayudu c Maxwell b Harshal Patel 50(29) [4s-4 6s-4]
Harshal Patel to Raina, 1 run, slower bouncer, Achilles heel for Raina, who gets on the back foot and robotically guides a pull to fine leg for a single

Harshal Patel to Rayudu, 1 run, another full one on off-and-middle, and a punch from the crease to long-on for a single, to bring up yet another 50 for Rayudu in this IPL. He's knocked the door down to get into the Indian side, and his batting epiphany continues
Harshal Patel to Raina, 1 run, slower one @123.5kmph, length ball on the thighs, Raina waits for it to reach him, tucks it off the back foot towards mid-wicket for a single
Harshal Patel to Rayudu, 1 run, another full one on middle, Rayudu uses the depth of the crease and turns that into a half-volley, VVSes the whip towards deep square leg for a single
Harshal Patel to Rayudu, FOUR, very quick, almost yorker length on leg, misses by half an inch perhaps, and Rayudu shuffles across to tickle it away to fine leg for four

Unadkat to Siraj, out Caught by Gowtham!! What just happened there? A relay catch! Kohli looks bemused. The length ball and the batsman slogged it away to send it skywards. Samson came charging in and dropped it, but the ball popped up. But Gowtham, who almost collided with his mate kept his wits and took it low and one-handed. Tremendous reflexes after the ball ricocheted off Samson's palm. Siraj c Gowtham b Unadkat 14(12) [4s-2]
Unadkat to Siraj, FOUR, reverse paddle and gets the ball away past short third man. That was on the sticks and the batsman got it away amidst an appeal from the bowler
Jofra Archer to Chahal, no run, 35 off the last over it would be. The yorker was delivered well and the batsman blocked the ball out. He gave an impression that he was trying to thump it back
Jofra Archer to Chahal, no run, short ball, the bumper and the batsman somehow manages a bit of wood on it as he tried to pull it away. Inside edges the ball down into the turf
Jofra Archer to Chahal, no run, right up there and the batsman fails to put it away
Jofra Archer to Siraj, 1 run, hits the ball back to the bowler, who boots it back. Does not try to stop the single as the ball rolled away into the point region for a single
Jofra Archer to Siraj, no run, looks to play the scoop and misses. He moved completely across his sticks to play but missed it

Jofra Archer to Chahal, leg byes, 1 run, that was a comedy of errors? The yorkerish delivery was missed by the batsman and was hit on the boot. It was going down leg and the bowler kept on appealing. Number 10 and Jack decided to steal a single and they did. The keeper could not manage to throw the sticks down at the bowler's end, else it could have been tight

Unadkat to Southee, out Caught by Gowtham!! Final nail in the coffin. Shortish, slower ball and the batsman heaved the pull away to be taken at cow corner. The batsman never connected properly and the mistimed hit was taken. RR only a wicket away from staying in contention for a place in the play-offs. RCB's dreams are over. Well almost. Southee c Gowtham b Unadkat 14(17) [4s-2]

Unadkat to Southee, no run, slower ball. Could it have been anything different? The batsman looks to go across his sticks and fetch it from well outside off. Misses as the ball limps away to the keeper
Unadkat to Siraj, 1 run, just short of the man at deep cover. The length ball outside off held up on the surface a bit and the uppish drive landed short of the man at sweeper cover, who was coming in
Unadkat to Southee, 1 run, low full toss, slogged away into the on-side for a single

Unadkat to Southee, FOUR, flogged away as he picked the slower delivery up like dead meat. Then muscled the ball away between deep mid and deep long-on to pick the bones out of it. Southee was deep in his crease and waiting for the slower ball
Unadkat to Siraj, 1 run, slower delivery outside off and the batsman squares up to push the ball away to point for a single. 43 more needed

Jofra Archer to Southee, FOUR, slaps the low full toss back at the bowler. Archer could not react in time to clasp that and the ball goes through his hands to race away to the long-off fence for a four. 44 off 18 balls is of academic interest. Or is it?
Jofra Archer to Siraj, 1 run, full and tailing in, the batsman clips the ball away to deep square leg for a single
Jofra Archer to Siraj, wide, slower bumper, well wide and too high. Wided for height. The square leg umpire took his time before signalling it
Jofra Archer to Southee, 1 run, back to the yorkerish length and the batsman jams the ball out into the off-side off the inside half of the bat for a  single
Jofra Archer to Southee, no run, tailing in low full toss and the batsman jams the ball out on to his pads. No run
Jofra Archer to Southee, no run, slower delivery and it bobbles over the sticks as the batsman looks to slog it away and misses. Was pretty close to the sticks

Jofra Archer to Siraj, 1 run, a run-out chance missed. That was jammed out into the covers, Rahane there had a shy at the sticks and missed. A direct hit and he was a goner. Straightaway hitting the blockhole spot
Laughlin to Siraj, 1 run, fuller again and has been driven into the off-side for a single
Laughlin to Siraj, FOUR, something to cheer for RCB fans. Short ball and has been pulled away into the on-side past deep square leg. He got hold of the short ball and muscled it away into the on-side
Laughlin to Siraj, no run, back to the quick stuff. Wide, full and quick. The batsman throws the kitchen sink at it and misses
Laughlin to Siraj, no run, slower ball on a yorkerish length and Siraj does well to dig the ball out into the deck

Laughlin to U Yadav, out Bowled!! Golden duck for Umesh. A taste of his own medicine. That was fuller, on a length and the batsman never covered the line of the ball. A little gap was found and the ball traverses between the bat and pad to strike timber. The RR fans erupt. Early finish? Hat-trick ball coming up. U Yadav b Laughlin 0(1)

Laughlin to Sarfaraz Khan, out Caught by Klaasen!! The fat lady's whisper can be heard. That was a terrific take from Klaasen. The slower delivery and the batsman backed away to steer the cut, the shot was not too away from the keeper, who leapt to his right and takes it. Superb day behind the sticks for the RR keeper. First with the bat and now with the ball. RCB fans continue to wear a disappointed look. Sarfaraz Khan c Klaasen b Laughlin 7(8) [4s-1]

Unadkat to Southee, no run, short ball, the batsman gets hit on the helmet. That might have been on the slower side again as the tennis ball bounce on it did not allow him the get on top of the bounce of it and play the pull
Unadkat to Southee, no run, we can rename Unadkat's occupation to SLA..That was another slower ball and the dance down the track, the attempted glory hit, all of it looked pretty out of shape
Unadkat to Sarfaraz Khan, 1 run, bumps the slower ball in and the batsman steers the upper cut away with a lot of control. Only a single as the man at deep third was very fine
Unadkat to Sarfaraz Khan, no run, slower short ball outside off and the batsman fails to wood it. The lack of pace outdid the batsman
Unadkat to Sarfaraz Khan, FOUR, slower ball and drop-kicked over mid-off. Played the drive on the up, did not intend to keep it down and got it over the head of the fielder for a four
Unadkat to Southee, 1 run, slower ball from round the wicket at a back of a length spot and has been punched away into the off-side for a single. No power on it and the man at cover gets to it
Ish Sodhi to Sarfaraz Khan, no run, the googly, the batsman camps back for a nurdle off the pads. Man at short fine leg disallows the single. 63 off 36 balls needed.
Ish Sodhi to Southee, 1 run, looks for a drive and another edge is peeled off. A second slip would be handy? But not to be. The man at short third man picks the ball up but fails to stop the single
Ish Sodhi to Southee, no run, the googly and has been combatted by his Kiwi mate. Southee pressed his front foot forward to defend the ball away. Ensured there was no gap between bat and pad as well

Ish Sodhi to Southee, 2 runs, edge and away. A couple it is as the man at short third fetches it back. A flattish ball and it turned to take the edge on the poke. The ball missed the slip and they get a couple
Ish Sodhi to Southee, no run, tossed up leggie and it rips away to defeat the attempted drive. Lot of turn here
Ish Sodhi to Sarfaraz Khan, 1 run, shortish ball, pulled away off the back foot for a single as long-on mops it up
Shreyas Gopal to Southee, no run, not afraid to toss it up and the batsman drives the ball away to cover. A little fumble but the bowler backs it up
Shreyas Gopal to Southee, no run, tossed up delivery outside off and has been blocked into the off-side

Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, out Stumped!! Game. Set. Match. That is a hugeeeeeeee wicket. The googly is misread. Looks to drive and misses it. The batsman tried to drive it but the ball bent in and the keeper did the rest as the back foot dragged out of the crease. Kohli is shocked. RCB camp cannot believe it. More than that, Gopal has hands on his mouth. He has shocked himself to a massive wicket. RR all over RCB like a rash.  One should compliment Klaasen for his sharp work, so quick with the gloves ala MSD. de Villiers st Klaasen b Shreyas Gopal 53(35) [4s-7]
Shreyas Gopal to Sarfaraz Khan, 1 run, pushes the ball out into the off-side as the ball turned away. A meek push for a single
Shreyas Gopal to Sarfaraz Khan, no run, is pegged inside the crease as he stayed back to push the ball away into the off-side. Inside edges the ball into the deck
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, 1 run, stays back and pushes the ball out into the off-side

Ish Sodhi to de Grandhomme, out Caught by Rahane!! Gone. RCB are impoding here. That was a typical leggie's dismissal. Landed outside off and turned away, lured the batsman for a drive to catch the edge. There was a slip fielder and the captain can give himself a pat on the back. For taking the catch and for having a slip in place. Superb bit of passage for RR. Kohli looks on in shock and dismay. de Grandhomme c Rahane b Ish Sodhi 2(3)
Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, 1 run, the leggie does not turn and the inside half of the bat is found on the push forward. The ball runs away into the on-side off the inner half of the bat
Ish Sodhi to de Grandhomme, 1 run, flattish leggie squares the batsman up as he trekked back. The outer half of the bat is peeled and the ball dribbles away into the off-side
Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, 1 run, tossed up delivery and the batsman drives the ball with the turn into the covers for a single

Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, FOUR, sixth fifty for Mr. 360! That was shortish, the batsman jumped on the opportunity and muscled the ball away past the dive from the man at deep square leg. Superb execution
Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, 2 runs, putting pressure and reaping the dividends. The flighted ball outside off was driven through the covers and the man at deep cover misfielded to allow the couple

Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, 1 run, drops it short, the batsman is back on the back foot in a flash to pull the ball away. The man at deep mid-wicket hurls the throw in at the bowler's end as de Villiers tried to pinch a second. He raced back
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, no run, little shorter outside off and the batsman chops the ball down into the off-side
Shreyas Gopal to de Grandhomme, 1 run, little bit of air again, might have been the googly as the inside half of the bat drives the ball back. The bowler misfields and allows the single

Shreyas Gopal to Mandeep, out Stumped!! Loopy leggie and the batsman is stumped. Jumped out of the crease and tried to go aerial on the off-side but missed it by a mile. Beaten in flight and the rest was done by the keeper. RCB are messing up the chase here. Third wicket for Gopal. The ball dipped on him and the preempted movement deserted him. Mandeep st Klaasen b Shreyas Gopal 3(4)
Shreyas Gopal to Mandeep, no run, flattish ball on the sticks, chopped away into the off-side as the batsman hustled his willow down in a flash
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, 1 run, flighted on the sticks, clipped away into the on-side for a single

Ish Sodhi to Mandeep, 2 runs, pushes the googly off the back foot, KG has a lot of ground to cover from long-on. They take two and almost look for a third as the fielders assume it will be just two. Eventually it is just a couple
Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, 1 run, back to the leggie, tossed up outside off, driven to sweeper cover
Ish Sodhi to Mandeep, 1 run, gosh. Squared up by the leggie, a fat leading edge and well wide of Jinks at slip, they take the single to the left of backward point. Very streaky from Mandeep
Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, 1 run, de Villiers picks the googly, wsa already on the back foot and allowed the ball to spin in, then whipped it to deep mid
Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, 2 runs, slower and tossed up outside off, de Villiers creams the drive wide of sweeper for two
Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, no run, tossed up leggie, de Villiers gets forward to square-drive to backward point

Shreyas Gopal to Moeen Ali, out Caught&Bowled!! Moeen Ali closes his eyes and grimaces. While Shreyas Gopal is being mobbed by his mates. A thick leading edge and Shreyas Gopal timed his leap to perfection and came up with the return catch in two hands. The catch was all about the leap. Two wickets in an over and the pressure multiplies many times on de Villiers. Moeen Ali c and b Shreyas Gopal 1(2)
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, 1 run, tossed up leggie, outside off, de Villiers gets forward to drive to sweeper cover
Shreyas Gopal to Moeen Ali, 1 run, gets off the mark with a turn off the pads

Shreyas Gopal to Parthiv Patel, out Stumped!! Parthiv Patel is walking. Because he knows that he has not got the back foot back inside. A toppie, from the front of the hand, slides on quicker, beats the backing away Patel on the cut, he overbalanced and when Klaasen whipped the bails off, the foot was on the line. Superb keeping from the South African as well. RR needed that wicket. Parthiv Patel st Klaasen b Shreyas Gopal 33(21) [4s-3 6s-2]
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, 1 run, well tossed up and a lot fuller, on the stumps, driven to long-off
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, no run, slower and on off, de Villiers pushes it back to the bowler
Ish Sodhi to Parthiv Patel, no run, Parthiv Patel treks back and cuts, finds backward point
Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, 1 run, skidding on flat outside off, de Villiers rocks back and opens the face of the bat to slice a cut to the sweeper
Ish Sodhi to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, now a leading edge, googly from Ish Sodhi, outside off, Parthiv Patel wanted to work across the line, a fat leading edge lands safely well in front of long-off
Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, 1 run, goes straight on, de Villiers looks to push and the inside edge runs away through square leg

Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, FOUR, Archer is having a nightmare today. Pulled to the left of him at deep mid, he got there and picked up the ball with his left-hand, then inadvartently the right-hand flicked the ball onto the cushions. Tried to scramble and pull the ball back with a dive, to no avail
Ish Sodhi to de Villiers, FOUR, he got out against CSK playing this, but that was to an offie, this is a leggie, reverse-swept and well wide of backward point. Ish Sodhi is welcomed with a boundary
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, 1 run, skids on a tad, de Villiers pushes off the back foot to long-on
Shreyas Gopal to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, calmly knocked to long-on

Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, 3 runs, bottom edge and Jinks at slip was already going down, so had no chance, it goes past his right leg and good running fetches them three runs. Can't call that a dropped catch, half-a-chance - yes
Shreyas Gopal to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, googly on a fuller length, Parthiv Patel sweeps to deep backward square leg, de Villiers is happy with just a single
Shreyas Gopal to de Villiers, 1 run, short and wide outside off, de Villiers cuts hard, but straight to the fielder at sweeper cover
Shreyas Gopal to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, tossed up on the middle and leg, Parthiv Patel gets forward and works a single to long-on
Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, good fielding at short third and it's just a single. Parthiv Patel dabs this slower delivery to the right of the fielder, who dove and half-stopped it
Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, very full, Parthiv Patel crunches a drive between extra cover and mid-off. Really hit it hard and gets another boundary
Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, no run, slugs a slower delivery straight to the fielder mid-wicket

Unadkat to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, superb effort from Samson but he has dropped that and it has rolled to touch the cushions. Length ball on middle, heaved away towards deep mid, Samson was in from the boundary, backtracked and stuck his right hand up on the leap to catch, but it didn't stick. Would've been a competitor to Boult and Rashid Khan's catches had he hung on. Has a wry smile on his face
Unadkat to de Villiers, 1 run, good bowling by Unadkat, followed the backing away de Villiers and all that the South African can do is to pull to deep square leg
Unadkat to de Villiers, no run, slower delivery on off and middle, punched to cover

Laughlin to Parthiv Patel, FOUR, Parthiv Patel gets lucky. Sliced the slower delivery straight up but it had enough elevation to clear the short third man fielder. Came down the track and aimed to go over cover, was beaten by the angle across him
Laughlin to de Villiers, 1 run, another knuckle ball down leg, flicked to deep square

Laughlin to de Villiers, no run, ooh! That has gone over the middle stump. Laughlin can't believe that it hasn't clipped the bail. Cuts de Villiers in half with a delivery that seamed in sharply, left de Villiers clueless
Laughlin to de Villiers, FOUR, again greatness from AB. Got close to the swinging slower knuckle ball, but used his bottom hand to great effect, squeezing down on it hard and beats mid-on to his left
Laughlin to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, full outside off, Parthiv Patel crunches a drive to sweeper cover
Laughlin to Parthiv Patel, no run, Laughlin starts with a dot. Length ball outside off, Parthiv Patel can't connect with the dab

Jofra Archer to de Villiers, FOUR, Jofra Archer ends another expensive over with a good length delivery on off and middle, flicked through mid-wicket, in the air but in the gap. He again looks in the mood today and that's bad news for RR fans
Jofra Archer to de Villiers, FOUR, wow. Wow. What a front foot punch that is. Just a checked punch and look at the ball race away. Extra-cover was wide open and it raced away
Jofra Archer to de Villiers, no run, tried to cut that too hard and the length wasn't there as well, so he finds cover-point
Jofra Archer to de Villiers, no run, short of length and at 148 clicks. de Villiers looks to defend and the ball takes a thick inside edge, rolls behind to Klaasen

Jofra Archer to de Villiers, FOUR, de Villiers is away. How easy he makes it look. Pacy short ball on the hips, he just whipped that wide of short fine, and Jofra Archer is bowling in the high 140s. Only a genius can do things that de Villiers does
Jofra Archer to de Villiers, 2 runs, 150.8KPH and on a short of length on off, de Villiers just defends off the back foot into the deep square leg area, easy two
Gowtham to de Villiers, 1 run, tossed up on off, de Villiers gets forward and shows the full face of the bat to ease it to long-on, off the mark

Gowtham to Kohli, out Bowled!! Kohli is bowled to a spinner. Seen that so often in this IPL. I can recollect Mujeeb, Rashid and now Gowtham. The bowler does a cool fist pump to celebrate the wicket. Kohli knew he had to do something against Gowtham, struggled in the first over, and decided to step out, but cleverly bowled by Gowtham, going wide of the crease and darting in a fast offie, which breaks in through the bat-pad gap to take Kohli's off stump out. They check for the no-ball on the side crease, but Gowtham had his leg up in the air and didn't land. A body blow to RCB. Kohli b Gowtham 4(9)
Gowtham to Parthiv Patel, byes, 1 run, slower and poor from Klaasen, Parthiv Patel backed away to slash through the off-side, misses and the keeper fumbles. They take a bye
Gowtham to Kohli, 1 run, off-break, flicked to deep mid
Gowtham to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, skidding on, Parthiv Patel bunts a pull in front of mid-on and they take the single
Gowtham to Kohli, 1 run, offie on middle, knocked to deep mid
Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, SIX, six again. An action replay of the first six. Just that Baz didn't drop it in the dugout. Using the pace of Jofra Archer to a nicety. Expensive over from the Bajan
Jofra Archer to Kohli, 1 run, short of length around off, Kohli defends and the ball takes a thick inside edge to run in front of square
Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, short one and cramped Parthiv Patel up. But he mistimes the pull and it falls well in front of deep square leg
Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, no run, now backs away to slash this pacy short of length delivery, misses. The ball flies to Klaasen
Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, no run, that was at 148.3 clicks. Length ball and swerving in, Parthiv Patel gets a thick inside edge onto the pad on the drive, rolls back down the wicket

Jofra Archer to Parthiv Patel, SIX, how good is that? Pacy short delivery and at the body, what does Parthiv Patel do? He just ramps it for six. Using the bat as a help, periscope style. I guess it is Baz who caught that? in the RCB dugout. No my colleague - Nikhil tells me Baz has dropped it and he is right

Gowtham to Kohli, no run, ooh! How close was that? Kohli backs away and tries to cut a fast skidder, close to both the edge and the off stump. Klaasen whips the bails off, but Kohli hadn't overbalanced. Great opening over by Gowtham who has his hands on his head
Gowtham to Parthiv Patel, 1 run, hurries on, Parthiv Patel does well to turn it to the vacant mid-wicket region, is off the mark too
Gowtham to Kohli, 1 run, bit slower, and Kohli is off the mark with a push to long-on

Gowtham to Kohli, no run, ooh! Nearly dragged on. This is a nervy Kohli in the middle. Can't say that many times. A nervy dab attempting to run it down to third man, the ball takes the inside edge and rolls near Klaasen's feet. Three dots in a row
Gowtham to Kohli, no run, tucks this offie to square leg, no chance of a quick single
Gowtham to Kohli, no run, almost a bottom edge first ball. Good take by Klaasen too. This length ball skidded on outside off, Kohli was looking to chop and missed

Southee to Gowtham, out Gowtham Run Out!! An anti-climax to end the innings. A yorker outside off that's too quick for Gowtham to squeeze it out. They try to steal a bye but the keeper parries the ball to Southee who does the rest. RR end on a competitive score, nevertheless. Gowtham run out (Parthiv Patel/Southee) 14(5) [6s-2]
Southee to Gowtham, no run, yorker outside off, Gowtham leaves it alone but it's just inside the guideline

Southee to Gowtham, 2 runs, what was Parthiv doing there? This should have been only a single. Gowtham steered the length ball to short third man and as Parthiv didn't come up to the stumps, Gowtham cheekily comes back for the second. Poor game sense by the RCB keeper on that occasion. Each and every run counts in this format
Southee to Gowtham, SIX, excellent shot! Full in length around off, Gowtham stands tall and pumps it over long-off. Back-to-back sixes for Gowtham and the crowd is lovin' it

Southee to Gowtham, SIX, how often has he done that? Makes six hitting so simple, does Gowtham. Wonder why he wasn't sent to open the innings. This was a short delivery and the all-rounder simply pulled it over mid-wicket
Southee to R Tripathi, 1 run, yorker around off, Tripathi squeezes into the off side and takes a single

Siraj to Klaasen, out Caught by Moeen Ali!! Siraj has the last laugh! Conceded a boundary and six earlier in the over but does well to get the better of the South African. Bowls a slower delivery outside off, Klaasen goes ahead with his aggressive loft and holes out at long-off. Moeen Ali won't drop those and he doesn't. Klaasen c Moeen Ali b Siraj 32(21) [4s-3 6s-1]
Siraj to Klaasen, no run, moves away this time and Siraj does well to fire this one outside off, Klaasen tries to reach for it, but it's too far
Siraj to Klaasen, 2 runs, shortish delivery around off, Klaasen pulls it away to deep mid-wicket and manages to come back for two

Siraj to Klaasen, FOUR, improvisation at its best. This was a full toss outside off, Klaasen shuffles across and scoops this gift over short fine leg. On a bounce and into the fence she goes. Has quietly moved into the 30s
Siraj to Klaasen, SIX, this is the class of Klaasen. This is what he can do. This was a full length delivery outside off, Klaasen frees his arms and carves it over third man. Beautiful shot!
Siraj to R Tripathi, 1 run, this is exhibition of death bowling by RCB. Siraj fires this one right into the blockhole, Tripathi squeezes it away to sweeper cover

Southee to R Tripathi, 1 run, 7 runs in this Southee over. Just what his skipper would have expected of him. This was a full length, again slow in pace and Tripathi slugged it to wide long-on. Quick work by the fielder in the deep who denies them the second run. Only 35 runs have come in the last 5 overs. RCB clawing their way back in this game, slowly and steadily. Can they restrict the Royals to 160 or less?

Southee to R Tripathi, 2 runs, Kohli covers a lot of ground and puts in a dive at deep mid-wicket, saves two for his team. It was slower delivery and Tripathi slogged it to the right of Kohli in the deep
Southee to R Tripathi, no run, done by the slower delivery there. Rolls his fingers and bowls a slower one outside off, Tripathi tries to slog, gets beaten all ends up
Southee to Klaasen, 1 run, plays that with hard hands. Whips the yorker length delivery to long-on and moves over to the other end
Southee to Klaasen, wide, slower delivery gone wrong. Sprays it outside off as Klaasen is far away from it. Lifts his bat and waits for the umpire to give his call
Southee to R Tripathi, 1 run, top stuff by Southee. Bowls another yorker length ball around off, Tripathi drills it down to long-off with a squeeze
Southee to Klaasen, 1 run, fires in a yorker on leg, Klaasen flicks it away to deep mid-wicket, only for a run
Chahal to R Tripathi, no run, a forward defensive shot to end the over. Fine over by Chahal at this stage of the innings, concedes only 5 singles in it
Chahal to Klaasen, 1 run, tries for the reverse sweep and gets a top edge towards short third man. Could have gone anywhere, Klaasen seems to be riding his luck today
Chahal to R Tripathi, 1 run, chips the tossed up delivery to gather his second single of the over, again to the same man at long-on
Chahal to Klaasen, 1 run, a lot of bottom hand on that off-drive by Klaasen, down to long-off again
Chahal to R Tripathi, 1 run, full one around leg, Tripathi drives it calmly down to long-on
Chahal to Klaasen, 1 run, drills the floater down to long-on to hand over the strike to the opener

Siraj to Klaasen, 1 run, another full one to end the over. This was fired outside off and Klaasen manages to squeeze it out to long-off. 20 runs off the last 2 overs. That double strike by Umesh hasn't put a halt to the scoring as the batsmen are going along nicely
Siraj to Klaasen, 2 runs, full in length outside off, Klaasen has to reach for his chop to the wide of sweeper cover. Two runs taken eventually

Siraj to Klaasen, FOUR, this is better. Will make him feel better, this shot. Makes room and punches the length delivery through extra-cover. No fielder in the deep as Klaasen collects his second boundary

Siraj to Klaasen, FOUR, that's the french cut. Short of a length around off, Klaasen goes at it with hard hands, pulls and ends up getting an inside edge. Past the off-stump and runs down to the fine leg boundary. Was very close to knocking down the off-pole
Siraj to Klaasen, no run, short of a length around off, Klaasen stays put and bunts it back to the bowler
Siraj to Klaasen, no run, length delivery outside off, keeps low and beats Klaasen as he is late in bringing down the bat

Moeen Ali to R Tripathi, no run, dot to end the over. Flatter in trajectory outside off and Tripathi steers it down to short third man. Good comeback by the bowler to end the over after conceding that six

Moeen Ali to R Tripathi, SIX, that's a massive blow. Nicely done. Was a tossed up delivery outside off, the batsman came down the wicket and went ahead with his loft, right over the bowler's head and over the ropes. The fielder at long-on was a mere spectator
Moeen Ali to R Tripathi, no run, flighted delivery outside off, Tripathi plays it with soft hands to short third man
Moeen Ali to R Tripathi, 2 runs, sloppy work in the field by de Grandhomme. Tripathi turned it away to deep square leg and de Grandomme's misfield allows the batsmen to come back for the second
Moeen Ali to R Tripathi, no run, flatter delivery outside off and it's been knocked back to the bowler
Moeen Ali to Klaasen, 1 run, waits for the delivery and bunts it down to wide long-on
U Yadav to Klaasen, 1 run, a yorker to end the over. Klaasen squeezes it out to mid-on and retains strike

U Yadav to Klaasen, no run, the review was retained and lucky for Royals as Klaasen survives. Decision has to be over-turned! Excellent delivery by Yadav though. He's on fire today. Bowls a full length delivery tailing into the batsman, almost a yorker and Klaasen manages to get an inside edge as he brings his bat down in time.
U Yadav to Klaasen, 2 runs, flicks the length delivery to deep mid-wicket and gets off the mark with a couple of runs. Hasn't been at his best this season
U Yadav to Klaasen, no run, short of a length outside off, eased back to the bowler

U Yadav to Samson, out Caught by Moeen Ali!! Two in two for Umesh. His third wicket of the match, he's on a roll in the past few games. Getting better with every game. Bowls a gentle length delivery first up and Samson flicks it straight to the man at short mid-wicket. A soft dismissal, indeed. Scored 90-odd against RCB earlier in the tournament, walks back for a duck today. Samson c Moeen Ali b U Yadav 0(1)

U Yadav to Rahane, out Lbw!! The impact was marginal but enough to go against Rahane. It was the off-cutter outside off, Rahane moved inside and went for a wild heave. Got beaten and was struck on the pads. The umpire took his time to give his decision but in the end he's right. So, finally Rahane' struggle comes to an end. Might be a blessing in disguise for the Royals. They need someone who can strike the ball well. Rahane lbw b U Yadav 33(31) [4s-3]
Chahal to R Tripathi, 2 runs, floated well outside off, Tripathi reaches for it and square drives this one to the left of sweeper cover for a couple of runs to end the over

Chahal to R Tripathi, no run, this was well outside off, Tripathi shoulders arms and expects a wide, the umpire thinks it's inside the guideline though. For me it was a wide. Chahal lucky to get away with the wide
Chahal to R Tripathi, 2 runs, makes room for himself and creams his off-drive to wide long-off. Gets two as the fielder has to cover a lot of ground

Chahal to R Tripathi, FOUR, the boundaries have started to flow. This was fired outside off, Tripathi came down the track and threw his hands at it. Gets a thick outside edge that flies down to the third man fence
Chahal to R Tripathi, no run, the quicker one this time. Short in length around middle and leg, Tripathi plays it back to the bowler
Chahal to Rahane, 1 run, floated around off, Rahane gets down and sweeps it away for a single

de Grandhomme to R Tripathi, SIX, now he'll try to shift gears. Walks down the track and chips the length ball right over the bowler's head. Such sweet timing on this blow. For a moment I thought this was only a boundary, but no. It's a maximum!

de Grandhomme to R Tripathi, 2 runs, fine knock by Tripathi, his first one of this season. Gets a shortish delivery and has plenty of time to hook it away to deep square leg. As the fielder had to charge in to collect the ball, the batsmen managed to get the second two
de Grandhomme to Rahane, 1 run, the bowler is giving nothing away. No pace at all. Bowls a shortish delivery this time and all Rahane can do is pull it away to long leg
de Grandhomme to R Tripathi, 1 run, slower one again, outside the off-stump channel as Tripathi chops it to the man at point
de Grandhomme to Rahane, 1 run, comes down the wicket and slaps the slower length delivery down to long-off. Good change in pace by Grandhomme on that occasion
de Grandhomme to R Tripathi, 1 run, slower delivery, probably the off-cutter bowled at 108ks, Tripathi does well to whip it down to long-on
Siraj to R Tripathi, 1 run, full in length and outside off, Tripathi chips it over the infield on the off-side as the ball rolls away to sweeper cover

Siraj to Rahane, leg byes, 1 run, howzzat? Rahane tries to play a ramp shot. Walks inside the line and tries to scoop the length delivery but gets undone due to the pace on that. The ball does strike his pads but the impact was well outside off and that is enough to save him. Rahane struggling to get going. Looks desperate to break shackles
Siraj to R Tripathi, 1 run, another shortish delivery around off and Tripathi has plenty of time to swivel and pull it away to the same fielder at deep mid-wicket
Siraj to Rahane, 1 run, shuffles in the crease this time around and drags it away to deep mid-wicket. Was a shortish delivery outside off
Siraj to R Tripathi, 1 run, pitched up around middle and off, tailing into the batsman as Tripathi plays an on-drive. Easy single taken as the ball rolls down to long-on
Siraj to Rahane, 1 run, soft hands. Waits for the length delivery and angles it down to third man to scamper across. Had it played that a bit finer, might have fetched him a boundary
de Grandhomme to Rahane, 1 run, normal-paced pitched up ball, another wristy whip through mid-wicket. Once again, it's Kohli who mops it up
de Grandhomme to R Tripathi, 1 run, another off-paced delivery, wristed firmly to deep mid-wicket
de Grandhomme to R Tripathi, 2 runs, slower delivery, bunted to the right of long-on for a brace
de Grandhomme to Rahane, 1 run, a nudge onto the leg-side with soft hands to a length ball. Long-on charges and mops it up
de Grandhomme to Rahane, wide, third wide of the over. Another one down leg. Parthiv Patel has a word with the bowler
de Grandhomme to R Tripathi, 1 run, Tripathi presses forward to off-drive this fullish ball down to long-off
de Grandhomme to R Tripathi, wide, spilled down the leg-side

de Grandhomme to R Tripathi, 2 runs, full length ball outside off, Tripathi fetches it from there and slugs it through mid-wicket. Kohli runs across from deep mid-wicket and doesn't stop it cleanly. Recovers quickly and it's just a couple for Tripathi
de Grandhomme to R Tripathi, wide, gross ball! A loosener. Could have been a wide to a left-hander too. Way down the leg-side
U Yadav to R Tripathi, 1 run, 141.1kph, short of a good length and slightly outside off, Tripathi runs it down to third man and keeps the strike
Brathwaite to Karthik, 1 run, KKR make it to the play-offs! DK hits the winning runs, working this full toss to mid-on
Brathwaite to Karthik, no run, now a dot ball. Hah, Karthik's missed this fullish one outside off. Touch late on it, you can say

Brathwaite to Nitish Rana, out Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Now this finds the fielder. More like a hoick-pull that Nitish Rana's fallen to. Takes the short ball on, swivels into an attempted glory hit and succumbs to the placement of the fielder at fine leg. Nitish Rana c Bhuvneshwar b Brathwaite 7(5) [4s-1]

Brathwaite to Nitish Rana, FOUR, tries to bowl very full and wide from round the wicket but Nitish Rana's reached out to it. Throws his hands, slices it away, and it's been hit with power. Skittles away, beating Sandeep's dive. Scores level
Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, no run, inswinging low full toss that's been squirted out straight to backward point. No run there
Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, 1 run, makes room and goes with BK's angle from over the wicket to the left-hander. Carves a single over cover-point. 5 off 7
Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, 1 run, slow again, and this time DK connects. Dragged off the under-edge to deep mid-wicket. KKR a maximum away
Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, no run, doesn't read the slow ball. Banged in on a back of a length, and it doesn't quite bounce enough to connect to Karthik's premeditated pull
Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, 2 runs, on the move across his stumps, is Karthik. Works that to long-on and pinches a couple
Bhuvneshwar to Nitish Rana, 1 run, slow low full toss on leg-stump from Bhuvneshwar first up, which is ticked to fine leg
S Kaul to Nitish Rana, 1 run, doesn't quite get the yorker right to the left-hander but the low full toss does the job from over the wicket. Glided to third man. 2/26 for Kaul
S Kaul to Karthik, 1 run, knuckle ball on a length, punched through covers
S Kaul to Karthik, wide, slow but he's went past the off-side tramline. Karthik doesn't even try

S Kaul to A Russell, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Russell has been baited here. All he got until now was a barrage of incoming short balls, so he was going to want to take full toll of this one. Slogs across, totally misreading the slower delivery and offering a steepler to long-on. Manish had to come in a few paces but he was right under the ball. Brilliantly taken. A Russell c Manish Pandey b S Kaul 4(4) [4s-1]

S Kaul to A Russell, FOUR, that top-edge to fine leg has arrived, beaten Sandeep Sharma and run away for a boundary. Sandeep, running to his right, leapt in front, went two-handed but the ball just slid through, deflecting to the ropes. 13 needed, only
S Kaul to A Russell, no run, short ball. A Russell just opens his stance and tries to pull. Never in position. First Brathwaite, and now Kaul -- they are bowling short at him
S Kaul to Karthik, 1 run, misfield at extra cover, so this drive -- played off a slower delivery -- finds a single to long-off

Brathwaite to A Russell, no run, that's rotational dynamics put to waste. He doesn't connect. Stays leg-side and swats his bat around, hoping to connect the pull (and secretly hoping for the top-edge to fly over fine leg)
Brathwaite to Karthik, 1 run, low full toss clipped to long-on. 18 off 19
Brathwaite to Karthik, FOUR, slower delivery sitting up, and the perils of having DK at the death. Hits the pull flat over the mid-wicket region. It's racing away.. it's a four!
Brathwaite to Karthik, wide, that's full but sprayed down leg

Brathwaite to Uthappa, out Caught by Goswami!! Brathwaite is riding a horse in celebration. Or something like that. He's undone Uthappa with a short ball. Weight not quite back, the bounce getting big on the batsman, and we have a top-edge, that the keeper runs around and collects it near say leg gully. Uthappa c Goswami b Brathwaite 45(34) [4s-3 6s-2]
Brathwaite to Karthik, 1 run, pitches this slower delivery full outside off, and DK nicely waits for a carve along the ground through covers
Brathwaite to Uthappa, leg byes, 1 run, jumps out of the crease to Brathwaite, who's clocked 132ks. Hits Uthappa's thigh and concedes an extra
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, 1 run, trying to work a single through mid-wicket but there's some spin on this leg break. Elicits a leading edge that falls in no-man's land around backward point
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, SIX, only fair that Rashid takes the brunt. It's outside off but it's enough for Uthappa. Enough full, enough close. Slogged over deep mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, FOUR, overpitched, and that's flying over Uthappa's scalp. Scooped away straight down the ground

Rashid Khan to Karthik, 1 run, this was out in Test cricket, but there's no FSL. Makes Karthik reach out to a wide googly, gets the inside edge popping in the air. And poof, he's safe. To top it all, he gets a single for it
Rashid Khan to Karthik, 2 runs, DK has exploited the vacant mid-wicket region like a warlord. Pricks a leg-stump googly there, and pushes Uthappa into the second
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, 1 run, reverse-swept to short third man for a sharp single
Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, 2 runs, a direct-hit from extra cover but Uthappa has made it back into the bowler's end with a sharp second. Squeeze-driven by DK that, as BK went full and wide
Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, 2 runs, DK isn't in control again. Almost like in a Bombay local. But he's doing the job. Slower ball chipped it uppishly through covers for two precious runs

Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, SIX, top-edges are the new first aid in cricket. Didn't KKR need that. A back of a length delivery going down leg-side, DK was late on the slog-sweep and ushered a top-edge over fine leg. It was way into the crowd, trust me
Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, no run, now a back of a length delivery that hurries onto Karthik, and miscues his late pull to mid-wicket. The runs are on snooze

Bhuvneshwar to Karthik, no run, this was the fastish inswinger -- reverse? -- that hits DK on the pad. Certainly going down, DK tries to go for the extra, only for Bhuvneshwar to run across and dislodge the bails. DK is in. DK was always not out
Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, 1 run, slow and low full toss clipped to deep mid-wicket
S Kaul to Karthik, no run, a misfield at extra cover means Karthik gets the single. No. Scratch that. Mid-off is there, backing up to deny Karthik's punch any runs. 2 runs and a wicket off this over
S Kaul to Uthappa, 1 run, intended yorker that's a low full toss. But a low full toss alright. Blocked off the toe-end, at the cost of his backbone's comfort zone
S Kaul to Karthik, 1 run, shunted to point. Running it into the ground and then picking the single off the ball's rolling momentum to point
S Kaul to Karthik, no run, beaten. Short of length, Karthik is in no position to get behind it. Dabbles at it and is defeated by the ball straightening a touch off the deck
S Kaul to Karthik, no run, blocked to mid-wicket

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Pandey's run in an arc at long-on and taken an in-out-in catch right at the boundary ropes. It's been referred upstairs, with the soft signal being out. It is out indeed. Just one of Chris Lynn's slogs that goes wrong. Hits it flat and across, seemed to have miscued it -- triggered by the lack of room -- and there Pandey was, running and plucking it out. Realizes he's going to run over the ropes, parries the throw in, hops out, hops back in and then almost steals that out of the hands of Rashid, who was lurking around. Rashid's hands cupped Pandey's -- so close. Chris Lynn c Manish Pandey b S Kaul 55(43) [4s-4 6s-3]
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, fetchin' this slightly fielder from outside off and sweeping it to deep square leg. 54 from 42
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, drills this very full ball through covers. Bit of a loop from Rashid Khan there
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, 1 run, quickish leg break, to which Uthappa goes back for a bottom-handed push to cover
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, leg break, that finds itself paddled from off-stump to fine leg
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, 1 run, goes back to the googly and toe-ends the flat-batted cross-slap to long-on
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, no run, quicker and fuller outside off. And it's good enough to beat Uthappa's ungainly reverse-sweep. There's a slip too, mind you
Shakib to Chris Lynn, no run, blocked with an uncertain forward prod. Gets the inside half of his bat on Shakib's arm-ball. 60 off 48
Shakib to Uthappa, 1 run, speared into the pads, Uthappa collects a single to square leg
Shakib to Uthappa, FOUR, now uses the pace and splits short third man and backward point. Played that delightfully late, with a nice clean lean towards off-side
Shakib to Uthappa, SIX, he's like a scoop of butter today. Reads the length so early that he has the time to get under a Shakib darter. Lifts it over long-on
Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, 50 run stand. Shakib adjusts, bowling this arm-ball slow and full. To long-on for a single
Shakib to Uthappa, 1 run, stays leg-side and slaps this arm-ball away over covers. Just a little short from Shakib
Sandeep Sharma to Chris Lynn, no run, goes a bit wide of the crease to bowl this, does Sandeep Sharma. Chris Lynn pushed this out

Sandeep Sharma to Chris Lynn, SIX, that's just a blatant display of biceps. Comes on the front foot and scythes this length ball over cow corner. Trust me when I say this: it was hammered away disdainfully with a torso torque
Sandeep Sharma to Uthappa, 1 run, on the bounce to long-on. Shuffled across a touch and chipped the cutter over vacant mid-on
Sandeep Sharma to Uthappa, 2 runs, fullish ball clipped to backward square leg

Sandeep Sharma to Uthappa, no run, now that beat Uthappa even before he realized. Slower ball, Uthappa shapes to swat that away and then doesn't pursue the shot. Way early into the shot, which ironically allowed him the time to makeshift the leave too
Sandeep Sharma to Chris Lynn, 1 run, gets the inswinging yorker length delivery on off-stump just right. Dug out for a single
Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, makes room and creams a flatter delivery to deep cover
Shakib to Chris Lynn, no run, armball, drifts in towards middle and leg, Lynn locks himself into a watertight defence
Shakib to Uthappa, 1 run, makes room and punches the short ball wide of extra cover
Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, slider, dips in line with off-stump, driven down to long-off
Shakib to Uthappa, 1 run, opens the bat face and taps the quicker delivery to point
Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, chops a short ball to cover
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, fetches the ball from outside off and swipes it to fine leg to keep strike

Rashid Khan to Uthappa, 1 run, Rashid puts it down. 'Should have allowed one of the ring fielders to go for the catch' opines my colleague Pratyush Sinha. *Hear, Hear* Always tough for the bowler running back. A mighty heave-ho from Uthappa, all in hope. Mistimed it very badly and got a thick top-edge on that, the ball hung in the air for an eternity and lured everyone on and off the field. Rashid says mine, runs back and gets defeated by the swirling motion of the ball. Oh dear!
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, swept down to fine leg
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, no run, googly, Lynn fails to pick and is hit on the pad, spinning down? Tries to flick, but is taken aback by the pace on that. Replays in: Looks tight
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, 1 run, tries the reverse sweep and manages a tiny inside edge onto pad, a quick single round the corner
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, that is Lynn's go-to option against the spinners this season, the sweep. Fetches the ball from outside off and helps it down to fine leg
Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, 1 run, leaves his stumps exposed and mistimes the cut horribly, mid-off attacks the ball, but Lynn makes it in time at the non-striker's end
Brathwaite to Uthappa, 1 run, slower fuller delivery on the stumps, Uthappa eases the drive to long-on
Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, 1 run, yorker length, Lynn squeezes it down to mid-on
Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, no run, cuts the pace and bowls it far from Lynnsanity zone, a swing and a miss from the Queenslander
Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, SIX, length ball in the channel, Lynn feasts on it with a mighty hoick over cow corner. 87-metres to be precise
Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, no run, here's the big man from the Caribbean. Bowls a back of a length delivery around off-stump, Lynn knocks it down with soft hands
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, 2 runs, shorter in length, enables Uthappa to go back and tuck the ball through mid-wicket

Rashid Khan to Uthappa, no run, appeal from the fielders and, of course, the bowler; nothing from the umpire and rightly so. A quicker slider, came back in sharply and hit Uthappa on the thigh pad, the weight of the batsman was going back and in an attempt to cut he lost the balance. No bat involved although KW claimed the catch at slip. Too high to be given out lbw
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, stretches forward and manoeuvres the ball into the mid-wicket pocket to squeeze a quick single
Rashid Khan to Uthappa, 1 run, picks the legbreak, opens the bat face and punches a single to deep point
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, gets forward a touch and taps the ball into the covers
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, no run, legbreak, pitches outside off and spins away further, Lynn slashes and misses
S Kaul to Uthappa, no run, digs it short and gets it way over the batsman's head, should have been a wide but the umpire thinks it's okay
S Kaul to Uthappa, FOUR, no-one at deep mid-wicket and Kaul bowls a rank bad ball. Short on middle, Uthappa swivels and crunches the pull over mid-wicket
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, 1 run, full outside off, Lynn drills to the left of mid-off, a diving stop from the fielder there
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, no run, on the pads, Lynn can't get it away, forcefully bunts to the leg-side
S Kaul to Uthappa, 1 run, good length outside off, guided down to third man

S Kaul to Uthappa, no run, keeper appeals, the bowler just turns back! Splays this down leg and beats Uthappa on the flick, it grazes the pad and carries to the left of Goswami who takes a fine catch, but to no avail
Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, 1 run, plonks his bat outside off, was looking to drive and went with hard hands, educated edge down to third man
Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, no run, didn't have enough room to execute the cut, went a little too hard which results in a chop down to the keeper
Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, no run, 138ks, tad short and nipping in, Uthappa strides across and punches into the leg-side
Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, 1 run, length ball, Lynn slaps it to deep cover. Easy single
Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, wide, short ball outside off stump, too high reckons the square leg umpire
Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, smacks the ball and flexes his muscles. Doesn't move. Whoa, how's that for a confidence! Slightly fuller and wider of off, Lynn cracks it straight past mid-off
Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, no run, gets his yorker right, all Lynn could do was jerk his bat down to kill the venom on that
Shakib to Uthappa, no run, arrowing in towards off, Uthappa strides forward and plays a textbook defence
Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, flatter on off, punched to long-off

Shakib to Narine, out Caught by Manish Pandey!! Not this time. Not again. Narine throws his head down in disappointment. Tried for a encore and failed to find the sweet-spot of the blade, enough air-time for Manish Pandey to run forward and claim a simple catch at long-off. Narine c Manish Pandey b Shakib 29(10) [4s-4 6s-2]

Shakib to Narine, SIX, long-on jumped back in desperation, but he never looked like catching that. Clean swing of the willow from Narine, thumps it from middle-stump channel and deposits it way over the fence
Shakib to Narine, FOUR, half-tracker, the line doesn't matter, Narine rolls his wrists and slambangs it with a swivel pull down to deep square
Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, drifts in with the arm, Lynn looks to push and inside-edges it towards the square leg area
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, leg byes, 1 run, another yorker length delivery, not that full but Kaul succeeded in denying room for Lynn, misses the flick and buys a leg bye after the deflection off the pad
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, no run, yorker, shaping in towards the pads, Lynn brings his bat down quickly to jam it down into the pitch

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, FOUR, smart cricket from Lynny! Knuckle ball, Lynn had all the time in the world to pick his shot, makes room outside off and bludgeons it straight back over the bowler's head for a one-bounce four
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, no run, exposes his stumps, stays leg-side of the ball and open-bat dabs to point

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, SIX, ah! That shoulder seems to functioning just fine. It was short and drifting into leg stump channels, Lynn clears the front leg and smokes it for a 69-metre maximum over mid-wicket
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, no run, hits the deck hard and gets some late away movement, Lynn stays flat-footed and bunts it down under his eyes

Sandeep Sharma to Narine, SIX, 20 off the over. KKR are making the most of the powerplay. Once again, it's in Narine's swinging territory, he clears his front leg and lifts the ball back over the bowler's head for a stunning maximum
Sandeep Sharma to Narine, wide, make that two in a row
Sandeep Sharma to Narine, wide, looks to follow Narine's shuffly movements and sprays this down leg, wided
Sandeep Sharma to Narine, no run, pitched up outside off, slammed straight to mid-off

Sandeep Sharma to Narine, FOUR, that's not the area to be bowling, certainly not to Sunil Narine. He loves width and with the length full it only makes matters easy for him, pumps this over extra cover with ease
Sandeep Sharma to Narine, FOUR, jumps down the pitch and squirts an inside edge on the cross batted swat, no-one in the deep at mid-wicket and he'll claim another boundary
Sandeep Sharma to Narine, FOUR, just over a leaping backward point! Just. Full and wide, Narine drills off the lower half and manages it get it just over the fielder. Lots of oohs and aahs
Sandeep Sharma to Narine, no run, the ploy is crystal-clear from Sandeep Sharma. Wants to test Narine with a short ball and bowls one wide of off-stump, Narine flashes with no success

Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, length and width, that's a harmful combo to serve in the powerplay; Lynn doesn't miss out. Pounces on it with a wielding willow and hits the gap with an air of authority

Bhuvneshwar to Narine, 1 run, excellent bowling and an equally excellent batting on display. A toe-crushing yorker, dips in viciously at middle, Narine opens the bat face just in the nick of time and guides it down to fine third man
Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, 1 run, fuller and wider of Lynn's off peg, he thrashes it to the left of mid-off who makes a diving stop to keep it down to a single
Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, room on offer and Lynn accepts gleefully! Frees his arms and flashes it past cover-point. Absolutely creamed
Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, no run, another one that decks back in, Lynn's treating these as sighters, just pokes into the pitch
Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, no run, inswinger straight up, Lynn was waiting on the back foot, he allows the ball to do its bit and jabs at it with strong bottom hand

Prasidh to Bhuvneshwar, out Bhuvneshwar Run Out!! Wow. Wow. This is exceptional finish from Krishna and KKR. 4 wickets and just 4 runs in the over. Take a bow, Krishna. Ushered it short and gets it to rise over Kumar's attempted hoick. Fails to connect and they try to sneak in a bye. But DK hits the bulls-eye and catches the batsman well short of his crease. Bhuvneshwar run out (Karthik) 0(1)

Prasidh to Rashid Khan, out Caught by Karthik!! Raining wickets for Kolkata. Two in two for Krishna and he becomes the second player from Karnataka to take four wickets so far today, informs my colleague Varun Dixit. Banged in short just outside off, Rashid slogs across the line and gets a thick top-edge that goes high in the air. Skipper takes the matter in his own hands and backtracks, keeps his eyes on the ball and nestles it safely in his glove. Rashid Khan c Karthik b Prasidh 0(1)

Prasidh to Shakib, out Caught by Narine!! And Shakib combusts. Krishna has been pretty impressive today. The slower short ball, angling at Shakib, who in a bid to pull - gets it high on the bat. Skes it to square leg and Narine ain't dropping those. Shakib c Narine b Prasidh 10(7) [4s-2]

Prasidh to Shakib, FOUR, misses the yorker on this occasion and Shakib makes him pay. Fuller length delivery outside off, Shakib plants his front foot across and hammers the drive through extra cover. Rocketed away to the fence
Prasidh to Shakib, no run, wowza! The toe-crusher from Krishna. Shakib has to take his front leg out of the way to jam it out

Prasidh to Manish Pandey, out Caught by (sub)Rinku Singh!! Has that been taken? Oh, it has. It has. The default Sub fielder for KKR - Rinku Singh takes a stunning catch. Another one falls and SRH are losing the plot here. Second wicket for Krishna, who's been brilliant in his fresh spell. The slower ball, that dips and Pandey takes it on the full to mow it towards deep mid-wicket. Doesn't get it off the middle and the ball was dying in front of Rinku - who dives forward and gobbles it up. Manish Pandey c (sub)Rinku Singh b Prasidh 25(22) [4s-2 6s-1]
A Russell to Shakib, no run, superb from Russell. Harpoons in the widish yorker, makes Shakib to reach for it. He threw his bat but was well out of reach
A Russell to Shakib, no run, pacy bouncer, rears off the deck and Shakib looked to ramp it over the keeper. Is defeated by the spicy bounce
A Russell to Shakib, FOUR, Russell persists with short to Shakib, but it was the slower short ball and Shakib read it early. Stayed back and pulled it over square leg
A Russell to Shakib, 2 runs, full on the pads, Shakib whips it to the left of deep mid-wicket and gets a brace as Searles mops it up
A Russell to Manish Pandey, 1 run, full and tailing on leg, Pandey was intending for the downtown loft, ends up squirting it off the inner half to deep square leg

A Russell to Brathwaite, out Caught by Karthik!! KKR are chipping away with wickets as Brathwaite perishes. Russell gets the better of his countryman. Skiddy short ball that tucks Brathwaite for space and hurries onto him, went for the pull and failed to get any timing on it. Splices it up in the air and DK prances forward to grab it. SRH losing gas at the death. Brathwaite c Karthik b A Russell 3(4)
Prasidh to Brathwaite, 1 run, decent finish from Krishna. Gets the yorker right and Brathwaite can only dig it to mid-off. 10 came off it
Prasidh to Manish Pandey, 1 run, shortish outside off, Pandey moves to leg and punches it to sweeper cover

Prasidh to Manish Pandey, SIX, cow corner is Pandey's favourite spot and he dismisses one for a maximum. Krishna misses his yorker, Pandey cleared his front leg and banged it flat, enough timing on it to take it all the way
Prasidh to Brathwaite, 1 run, swerving in, a low full toss gunning on leg. Brathwaite drags it round his pads to short fine leg
Prasidh to Manish Pandey, 1 run, nipping away around fourth stump channel, Pandey opens the bat face and dinks it to third man

Prasidh to Manish Pandey, no run, full and tailing back in, Pandey jams it onto his pad and it balloons up towards Krishna, who collects it and mocks a throw back at Pandey. Oh, they are checking if it's a bump ball or not as both umpires converge. Matter taken upstairs. Clearly a case of bump ball as it comes off the turf and then deflected off the boot. NOT OUT
Narine to Manish Pandey, 1 run, carrom ball, Pandey spots it well and guides it to point
Narine to Manish Pandey, wide, Pandey loses the line and splays it down leg. Wided
Narine to Brathwaite, 1 run, pushed through quicker, Brathwaite gets off the mark with a nudge to deep mid-wicket
Narine to Manish Pandey, leg byes, 1 run, darter on leg, Pandey takes it on the pad and it trickles away to the leg-side
Narine to Manish Pandey, no run, a soft steer to short third man

Narine to Y Pathan, out Caught by Uthappa!! Stunned silence among the Orange army supporters. Pathan departs early as he fails to clear the long-on fence. Floated up and wooed Pathan into a biggie, who fell for the trap. Lofted it high, only height and it sailed into the black sky to long-on. Uthappa sets under it and swallows it. Excellent comeback this from KKR after being under the pump. Y Pathan c Uthappa b Narine 2(4)
Narine to Manish Pandey, 1 run, a jerk of the wrists as Pandey wrists it away to deep mid-wicket
Prasidh to Manish Pandey, 1 run, cutter outside off, Pandey was moving to leg and throws his bat to flay it towards sweeper cover
Prasidh to Y Pathan, 1 run, back of a length and errs it down leg once again, Pathan moves across and tickles it to fine leg
Prasidh to Y Pathan, wide, good bumper from Krishna, the ploy was fine but it was too high as it shot off the deck, looping over Pathan's head. Called a wide
Prasidh to Manish Pandey, 1 run, Karnataka to Karnataka, drifting on leg. Pandey tucks it away to fine leg
Prasidh to Y Pathan, 1 run, Krishna feeds some width for Pathan, who glides it to the right of third man
Prasidh to Y Pathan, no run, wafted on a length just outside off, Pathan stands tall and forces it to into the off-side, straight to the fielder

Prasidh to Dhawan, out Lbw!! Dhawan is given OUT lbw, he's having a discussion with Pandey before eventually walking off. Krishna roars back strongly in his new spell after leaking 11 in his first over. Cuts back in from round the wicket, seemed like the slower ball. Dhawan was lining up for a mow across the line, misses it totally and is hit on the back thigh. Looked pretty adjacent and umpire S Ravi took his time before raising the dreaded finger. so, Dhawan falls right after his fifty. Dhawan lbw b Prasidh 50(39) [4s-5 6s-1]

A Russell to Manish Pandey, FOUR, KKR have been very clumsy and poor in the field. Here's more evidence. Half-volley just outside off, Pandey slammed the drive wide of long-off and called "Two". Chawla was patrolling the fence and sprinted to his left, trips and loses his balance allowing the ball to roll away to the fence. Messy!
