A Russell to Manish Pandey, no run, foxes Pandey again with a slower back of a length ball outside off, Pandey sought to guide it to third man and was too early into the shot and hence missed it
A Russell to Manish Pandey, no run, tigerish comeback by Russell. Digs it in short, follows Pandey's torso and he had to sway out of the firing line

A Russell to Manish Pandey, FOUR, two dots and Pandey breaks free. Employs his dexterous wrists - ala Dhoni. Full and just outside off, Pandey jumped back and wristed it beautifully to bisect long-on and deep mid-wicket
A Russell to Manish Pandey, no run, 137kph, goodish length ball homing on middle, Pandey is glued to the crease and quells it with an angled blade, straight to point
A Russell to Manish Pandey, no run, slower short ball outside off, the leg-cutter and Pandey hops across to horizontally carve it to point
Kuldeep Yadav to Manish Pandey, 1 run, serves a juicy floater outside off, driven crisply to sweeper cover

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, 1 run, buzz in the crowd as Dhawan reaches his fifty. 32nd IPL fifty for the southpaw, mind you he was averaging around 24 against KKR before this game. A flighted delivery just outside off and Dhawan thrashes it to long-off to bring up the milestone
Kuldeep Yadav to Manish Pandey, 1 run, googly to Pandey, who reads it early and pokes it to cover
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, 1 run, fired quicker, flicked away to deep mid-wicket
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, no run, wrong 'un, cramps Dhawan for room and he awkwardly fends it defensively
Kuldeep Yadav to Manish Pandey, 1 run, loopy full ball outside off, Pandey extends his forward push to long-off
Searles to Manish Pandey, 1 run, goes short, well outside off. Pandey uses the pace and runs it down to third man

Searles to Williamson, out Caught by A Russell!! Williamson could'nt have picked the fielder out any better. Surely, will be disappointed. Anyway, Searles retaliates and gets his revenge. Went wide of off, Williamson slashed it hard and straight to deep cover. Russel was under it and he won't drop those. It was an off-pace ball and KW had to generate some power to elevate it over the fielder's head. 2 or 3 inches away from Russel, it would've been a boundary. Nonetheless, KKR will breathe a sigh of relief as they break this dangerous stand. Williamson c A Russell b Searles 36(17) [4s-1 6s-3]
Searles to Williamson, 2 runs, muscles a short ball wide of long-on, collects two with ease

Searles to Williamson, SIX, make that two sixes in two balls for Williamson. This was the shot he attempted against RCB in the previous game and picked out the fine leg fielder. This time he knew the fielder was inside the ring. Moved across his sticks early, stayed low and helped it supremely over the fielder's head for half-a-dozen

Searles to Williamson, SIX, this will hurt KKR. Williamson can play this shot in his sleep. Lenght ball down leg, Williamson gets inside the line and hacks it behind square for a maximum. Easy pickings

Searles to Dhawan, 3 runs, in the airr and Narine puts it down. Never looked like taking it any point, to be honest. So much so that he didn't even get a hand to it. A fat leading edge as Dhawan closes the bat face early on the whip, goes very high into the night sky and took an eternity to descend. The ball was swirling and the West Indian grasses it. Collects the ball and fires a direct-hit at the striker's end, it riochets away and they pinch three runs. They went upstairs for the run-out check but Dhawan was well in
Narine to Williamson, 2 runs, another brisk brace stolen. Williamson is expert at this. Chisels a nudge off his hips in front of square on the leg-side. Hares back for the second
Narine to Dhawan, 1 run, slowish just outside off, Dhawan bends low and fetches the sweep and rolls his wrists to broom it towards deep square leg. Prasidh cuts it off
Narine to Williamson, 1 run, slips in the carrom ball, overpitched on off. Williamson leans into a solid drive to long-off
Narine to Williamson, no run, sharp offie that turns in and beats Williamson's attempted glance. Is hit on the pad as he misses it
Narine to Williamson, no run, spinning in, around off and middle. Williamson is diffident in his forward press, dead bats it into the turf
Narine to Williamson, 2 runs, risk-free cricket from Williamson. Quicker on leg, Williamson places it into acres of gap on the leg-side. Gets an easy two
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, slower and tad short around off, Williamson makes room and punches it square on the off-side
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 2 runs, googly, dropped slightly short outside off. Williamson hangs back and pulls it away to deep square leg

Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, SIX, "That is what form does to you," says Harsha Bhogle on air. Kuldeep gives plenty of air, but it lands as a freebie for Williamson. On the pads and he comfortably dispatches it over cow corner
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, 1 run, tossed up, too full on middle and Dhawan picks it off his pads, towards the vacant square leg region
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, lots of flight, wide of off and Williamson takes it on the full, reaching it out and pushes it away to long-off
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, 1 run, flatter at the stumps, Dhawan stays back and works it away to deep mid-wicket
Chawla to Dhawan, 1 run, dropped short and on the stumps, pulled away to deep mid-wicket for a single

Chawla to Dhawan, 2 runs, Dhawan comes down the track, doesn't get to the pitch of the ball as he went through with the hoick, gets a thick inside edge to the right of short fine, Narine is lazy to bend down and ends up conceding another run
Chawla to Williamson, 1 run, nicely tossed up by Chawla, eased down towards long-off for a single
Chawla to Dhawan, 1 run, flighted on off, Dhawan was looking to defend and gets a thick edge towards short third man, just a single
Chawla to Dhawan, 2 runs, Chawla drops one short and well outside off, punched away wide of long-off and Dhawan comes back for the second run
Chawla to Williamson, 1 run, flighted on the stumps, punched down towards long-on for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, 1 run, the chinaman from Kuldeep, Williamson watches it closely and pushes it wide of point

Kuldeep Yadav to Williamson, FOUR, cracking shot, that's quite a way to get going, dropped short and at the stumps, Williamson gets halfway down and pummels it past square leg. Kuldeep is disappointed, knew immediately that it was a bad first ball to the new batsman

Kuldeep Yadav to Goswami, out Caught by A Russell!! Catching practice for Russell at long-on and SRH have lost their first wicket. This was tossed up nicely by Kuldeep, Goswami came down the track, didn't get close to the ball as he went through with the lofted drive, went off the inside half of the bat and looped towards long-on. Goswami has played his part though, walks off to a decent round of applause. Goswami c A Russell b Kuldeep Yadav 35(26) [4s-4 6s-1]
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, 1 run, very full and on Dhawan's pads, whipped away in front of square on the on-side for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Goswami, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, worked away wide of mid-wicket for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, 1 run, the chinaman from Kuldeep and Dhawan didn't pick it, read it off the surface and the inside edge rolled towards short fine
Searles to Dhawan, 1 run, short and well outside off, Dhawan swivels across and pulls it to deep mid-wicket for a single
Searles to Goswami, 1 run, slower full-toss outside off, eased square past cover for a single

Searles to Dhawan, 1 run, had Searles hit the target, Goswami might have been struggling. Dhawan set off for a quick single after nudging the ball towards short mid-wicket. Searles was quick on his follow-through, ran across Goswami, got to the ball and then fired a throw at the striker's end, he missed with Goswami way short of his crease
Searles to Goswami, 1 run, back of a length and at the stumps, hit Goswami high on the bat as he backed away, steers it towards point for a single
Searles to Goswami, 2 runs, short of a good length and on the stumps, Goswami makes room and places it square on the off-side, comes back for the second run

Searles to Goswami, no run, that's a gentle short ball and Goswami will be angry that he didn't make the most of it, came down the track and only got a big of glove on the pull, rolled away towards the keeper

Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, FOUR, poor ball from Kuldeep, dropped it short and at the stumps, Dhawan had plenty of time as he rocked back and pulled it wide of mid-wicket, even the big dive from Russell can't prevent the ball from hitting the ropes
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, no run, slower and slanting across the left-hander, pushed back at the bowler

Kuldeep Yadav to Goswami, 1 run, excellent comeback from Kuldeep, this was the wrong 'un and Goswami didn't spot it. It was beautifully disguised we ll, Goswami was backing away on the cut and just about got his bat down in time

Kuldeep Yadav to Goswami, FOUR, beautifully played, this was tossed up well outside leg, Goswami went down low, reversed his stance, got on top of the bounce and then found the gap behind square on the off-side
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, 1 run, flighted around the off-stump line, Dhawan was slightly cramped on the cut, mistimes it wide of cover for a single
Kuldeep Yadav to Dhawan, no run, that's a long hop, the attempted wrong 'un from Kuldeep, smashed straight back at him
Narine to Dhawan, 1 run, slower and just outside off, eased down towards long-off for a single
Narine to Dhawan, no run, pushed through flatter and wider of off, Dhawan was looking to cut and missed
Narine to Dhawan, wide, Narine tosses this one well down the leg-side, Dhawan was looking to sweep and missed, called as a wide
Narine to Dhawan, no run, flatter and on the stumps, Dhawan finds mid-wicket with the pull

Narine to Dhawan, SIX, lovely, tad too full from Narine, Dhawan gets a good stride forward, drives it through the line and clears the ropes at long-on with ease. The key was he didn't look to muscle the shot, nor did he play across the line
Narine to Goswami, 1 run, slower and just outside off, dabbed away towards short third man for a single
Narine to Goswami, no run, pushed through on off, Goswami goes back and punches it back at the bowler

Chawla to Dhawan, FOUR, that's all too easy for Dhawan, wrong line from Chawla, drifted this one down the leg-side, the fielder at fine leg was inside the ring and all Dhawan had to do was to find the gap past him, he does so with the sweep and raises SRH's 50
Chawla to Goswami, 1 run, tossed up on the stumps, eased away towards long-on for a single

Chawla to Goswami, 2 runs, Goswami is looking very confident now, slower and wider of off, Goswami gets a good stride forward and chips it over the infield at cover, two men give chase and keep them down to a brace
Chawla to Goswami, no run, slower and on the leg-stump line, nudged away towards the on-side

Chawla to Goswami, FOUR, woeful from the fielder at cover, I think it's Uthappa.  This was tossed up wide of off, Goswami reached out and crashed it towards cover. The ball bounced awkwardly in front of him and Goswami didn't get his body behind it either
Chawla to Goswami, no run, flighted well outside off, Goswami makes room, reaches out and finds cover with the cut
Narine to Dhawan, no run, slower and on off, Dhawan gets half-forward and defends it back at the bowler
Narine to Goswami, 1 run, tossed up on Goswami's pads, nudged away behind square on the on-side for a single
Narine to Dhawan, 1 run, flighted on the stumps, worked away in front of square on the on-side for a single
Narine to Goswami, 1 run, fraction short and at the stumps, Goswami backs away and dabs it towards short third man

Narine to Goswami, no run, excellent stop from Rana at cover-point, saved a boundary for his team. This was tossed up well outside off, Goswami leant into the drive and to the right of Rana - who tumbles and makes a clean stop
Narine to Dhawan, 1 run, flighted well outside off, driven down towards long-off for a single

A Russell to Goswami, FOUR, finesse from Goswami, back of a length and just outside off, Goswami waits on it, plays with an open face and steers it in the gap behind square on the off-side, 20 from the over

A Russell to Goswami, byes, FOUR, that took off from a length, this is turning out to be a big over for SRH. This was a back of a length delivery just outside off, surprised Goswami as it took off from a length, he stabbed and was done in by the bounce, it kept rising and even a leaping keeper can't stop it, four byes added to the total

A Russell to Goswami, FOUR, cracking shot, Goswami is chancing his good luck now, this was full and this was wide of off, Goswami makes room and cracks it square past cover, beats the fielder in the ring and scorches away to the ropes
A Russell to Goswami, no ball, another bouncer from Russell, the second one of the over and it's called as a no-ball for height. Goswami was looking to pull and missed

A Russell to Goswami, SIX, that's adding insult to injury for Russell, on a good length and just outside off, Goswami backs away slightly, plays with an open face and slices it high and over cover, went a long way over the stands

A Russell to Goswami, no run, Goswami has been given out caught at slip, he wants a review. It's a fair ball, it's gone off the helmet, but is there some glove before it? I don't think so, there's daylight between gloves and the ball, should get this decision overturned, Goswami. Ultraedge confirms it as well. NOT OUT is the call. That's a good review from Goswami, he knew there wasn't any bat or glove, the bouncer from Russell and Goswami was way too late on the pull, thudded into his helmet and lobbed towards Rana at slip. Umpire Anil Chaudhary was quick to raise his finger, but he has to change his call
A Russell to Goswami, wide, wrong line from Russell, slips this one well down the leg-side, called as a wide
A Russell to Goswami, no run, on a good length and just outside off, Goswami drives flat-footed and gets an inside edge back at the bowler
Prasidh to Dhawan, no run, Krishna pushes this one fuller and across the left-hander, defended towards the off-side
Prasidh to Dhawan, no run, on a good length and on the off-stump line, Dhawan closes the bat-face as he mistimed the drive back at the bowler

Prasidh to Dhawan, FOUR, was that a half-chance? Short and wide of off, Dhawan got on top of the bounce as he cut, didn't bother to keep it down, went to the right and well wide of Uthappa at backward point, the man in the deep has no chance

Prasidh to Goswami, 1 run, Prasidh shortens his length on middle, gets it slightly big on the left-hander, Goswami rides the bounce and drops it towards the on-side, calls his partner across for a quick single
Prasidh to Goswami, wide, Krishna slips this one full and well down the leg-side, Goswami was looking to flick and missed, called as a wide
Prasidh to Dhawan, 1 run, Krishna shortens his length and gets it to angle across the right-hander, opened up Dhawan as he prodded at that, gets an edge towards third man
Prasidh to Dhawan, FOUR, lashed over backward point, width on offer from Krishna and Dhawan cashed in big time. Reaches out and slaps it over point, a few bounces and over the ropes
Nitish Rana to Dhawan, 1 run, flighted on off, Dhawan gets half-forward and pushes it wide of cover, just a single
Nitish Rana to Dhawan, no run, slower and wider of off, Dhawan has to wait on it and pushes it towards cover
Nitish Rana to Dhawan, no run, Rana tosses this one well down the leg-side, a free-hit for Dhawan as he swept, can't pierce the gap as he finds the fielder at short fine
Nitish Rana to Dhawan, no run, flighted on off, Dhawan makes room and pushes it towards the off-side
Nitish Rana to Dhawan, no run, the arm-ball from Rana, Dhawan waits on it and steers it straight to short third man
Nitish Rana to Dhawan, FOUR, that's a dream start from Dhawan, Rana dropped one short and just wide of off, Dhawan backed away and cracked it square past cover, no need to run for those

Harshal Patel to Bumrah, out Caught by Boult!! Mumbai have been knocked out. Cutting and Rohit take a moment to soak in what has transpired. The Mumbai skipper then gathers himself and shakes hands with his team mates. It is only the fourth time that Mumbai have not made the playoffs. Some happy faces in the Delhi camp as they finish with back to back wins. Another slower delivery and Bumrah had to go for it, miscued it towards long-on and Boult ran in to complete the catch. Bumrah c Boult b Harshal Patel 0(1)

Harshal Patel to Cutting, out Caught by Maxwell!! Patel pumps his fist. Cutting hangs his head down and trudges off. The Mumbai supporters are in shock. That must be the match? The slower delivery and it was right in the arc, but the slow nature made Cutting generate all the power and he could only heave it as far as deep mid-wicket. Maxwell keeps his cool and takes it calmly. Settled nicely under it. Cutting c Maxwell b Harshal Patel 37(20) [4s-2 6s-3]

Harshal Patel to Cutting, SIX, oh my! Cutting has got the best possible start to the over. Patel does not have the pace to bowl short and it sits up nicely for Cutting, who swivels across and sends the pull soaring over the long leg fence

Boult to Markande, out Bowled!! Bowled 'im. Top over under pressure from the Kiwi. Mumbai could get only 5 runs off it. Round the wicket and though he misses the yorker length, his pace makes up for it, Markande does not lay bat on the pacy full toss and has his off-stump uprooted. Markande b Boult 3(10)
Boult to Cutting, 1 run, just a single. Another low full toss outside off, Cutting slices it on the bounce to deep backward point. Boult has bowled to his field and needs to finish it well

Boult to Cutting, 2 runs, very casual from Plunkett. He does not bother to cut the angle and ends up gifting the second. Full toss slanted outside off, Cutting slices the loft over extra cover and Plunkett allows the second

Boult to Markande, 1 run, direct hit and that was over. Cutting went for the single and he was not even in the frame. Full delivery and Markande digs the drive out to cover, the pair had to go and Shaw was the fielder. Took his time and fired a throw at the striker's end. Missed and Mumbai stay alive. Pant also came charging forward and slipped while collecting the ball. Had he stayed on his feet and collected it cleanly, Cutting was still gone
Boult to Markande, no run, round the wicket and a dot. He cramps Markande for room as he backs away, the steer to third man does not come off and the duo are not going to risk a bye
Boult to Cutting, 1 run, yes, that's one way to keep Cutting quiet. Yorker angled outside off, all Cutting can do is squeeze it out to long-off. He takes the single but a bit relcutantly
Plunkett to Markande, no run, denies the single. Rightly so. Back of a length delivery, Markande backs away and steers it to third man, he wanted the single but is sent back quite early
Plunkett to Cutting, 1 run, low full toss and Cutting can only biff it to long-on, happy to take the single and leave Markande with a single delivery
Plunkett to Cutting, no run, slower short ball and Cutting is deceived, through the pull early and it is a dot for Delhi

Plunkett to Cutting, FOUR, 14 runs off the first three balls. Pressure. Pressure! Once again Plunkett goes full with a pacy delivery, Cutting says thank you very much and smashes the leather off the ball, right over Markande and giving long-on no chance. Even Rohit could afford a clap with that boundary

Plunkett to Cutting, SIX, wow! That's gone a long way. This match ain't over. Mumbai's season ain't over. Until Cutting is there. Plunkett is bowling length and Cutting is waiting for it, muscles the loft well over the long-on fence

Plunkett to Cutting, FOUR, good way to start the over. Shade too straight from Plunkett, on off and middle, Cutting gets inside the line and whips it backward of square leg. He ensured that he got it past the man at short fine leg

Boult to Cutting, 1 run, direct hit and Markande was a goner. Low full toss and Cutting shuffled across and tried to help it round the corner, found the fielder at short fine and pushed Markande for the single, he wanted to retain the strike. Markande was not even in the frame as Lamichhane missed the sticks

Boult to Cutting, SIX, that's more like it. Right in the slot and it is a 83 meter six from Cutting. Just a bit of shuffle to off and got nicely underneath the length ball, the big forearms then took over to smash it over long-on

Boult to Cutting, 2 runs, dropped? Yes. Just got his fingertips to it. The slower delivery is slanted in and Cutting uses the angle to heave it over backward square, Patel charges across to his right and puts in the slide, only gets a finger to it
Boult to Cutting, no run, off-speed delivery that refuses to bounce, Cutting has a swipe across the line and the ball sneaks underneath the bat
Boult to Markande, leg byes, 1 run, drifting on leg and Markande misses the glance, off the pad and to the left of Pant
Boult to Cutting, 1 run, round the wicket and angled in, Cutting eases it past Boult and down to long-off

Lamichhane to Markande, 2 runs, another googly and Markande reads it off the surface, nudges it into the on-side and Cutting pushes for the second. Plunkett had some ground to cover and they get it with ease

Lamichhane to Markande, no run, wrong 'un and Markande had no clue about it, he was on the back foot looking to play the punch/cut, but is all cramped up and hit on the glove, the ball drops safely in front of him
Lamichhane to Markande, no run, flighted outside off, Markande drives and picks out the cover fielder
Lamichhane to Markande, no run, tossed up on off, Markande blocks it into the off-side, no chance of a single
Lamichhane to Markande, wide, drifting down leg and Markande misses the tickle. Nandan makes a late call for wide
Lamichhane to Cutting, 1 run, bit of hesitation but no harm done. Cutting backs away and taps the leg-break wide of backward point, Markande was charging across and Cutting was a bit late to take off
Lamichhane to Cutting, no run, flatter and on off, Cutting makes room and punches it to cover

Mishra to Markande, no run, Mishra is done for the day. What a spell! The veteran showing he still has it in him. His performance in the last few games has been top drawer. Today ends with 4-0-19-3. This is a fraction short and Markande chops the cut towards backward point

Mishra to Hardik Pandya, out Caught by (sub)Rahul Tewatia!! Is that the game? Ishan Kishan thinks so as he has his hands on his head. One of the MI cheerleaders did not like Pandya's shot selection either. Needless from Pandya. Last over for Mishra and he should have tried to play him out, but that is not the sort of batsman he is. Saw the floaty delivery outside off and went for the big loft downtown, sliced it off the outer half to backward point, where Tewatia picks up his second catch. Hardik Pandya c (sub)Rahul Tewatia b Mishra 27(17) [4s-2 6s-1]
Mishra to Hardik Pandya, no run, quicker and Pandya has to settle with a toe-end push towards cover-point
Mishra to Cutting, 1 run, googly turns back in, Cutting picks it off the surface and eases it to long-off

Mishra to Cutting, no run, premeditation from Cutting. Bent his back knee even before the ball was bowled and attempted the paddle, the leg-break spun across the bat face. Smart bowling from Mishra, kept it out of Cutting's reach
Mishra to Cutting, no run, flighted on the stumps, Cutting watchfully knocks it back to Mishra

Harshal Patel to Hardik Pandya, no run, walked across his stumps and missed the glance, has a look at the umpire for a wide and gets nothing in return. Went too far towards off and that made Nandan rule in favour of Patel

Harshal Patel to Rohit, out Caught by Boult!! It is the Maxwell-Boult partnership again. Seemed like a replay of the Pollard dismissal. The duo even have a laugh together. This was much more easily done by Maxwell. The third umpire has a check and there's nothing to overturn the soft signal. Another failure for Rohit. He's had a terrible season. More importantly leaves his team in a spot of bother. The slower off-cutter grips the surface and deceives Rohit compeletly, he was into the shot early and went through with it, the bottom hand comes off and the ball skies towards long-on, Maxwell runs across and takes the catch, but with the momentum taking him out, he lobs the ball to Boult, who came running from long-off. Rohit c Boult b Harshal Patel 13(11) [4s-1]
Harshal Patel to Rohit, no run, slower length ball and Rohit taps it softly in front of mid-wicket

Harshal Patel to Hardik Pandya, 2 wides, excellent stop by Pant. Poor from Patel though. Splays it well down leg, no chance for Pandya to reach that, Pant dived full length to his left and got a glove to it, saved three

Harshal Patel to Hardik Pandya, no run, dot. Delhi need a bit of those to keep the partnership in check. Nothing but a back of a length delivery which Pandya looks to run it down to third man, misses and is beaten on the outside edge
Harshal Patel to Rohit, 1 run, full and around off, Rohit wrists it down to long-on

Harshal Patel to Rohit, 2 runs, intelligent cricket from Rohit. Saw no one at mid-wicket and nudged the slower delivery in that region, called for two as soon as he played it and Pandya was more than happy to oblige. Easy!

Boult to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, 17 off the over and that releases the pressure that Mishra and Lamichhane built up. Full and on the pads, easy pickings for Pandya, who flicks it nonchalantly past the diving short fine leg fielder. It was just the matter of putting it in the gap and Pandya did it to perfection
Boult to Rohit, 1 run, off-cutter angled across the right-hander, Rohit drives on the up to deep extra cover

Boult to Hardik Pandya, 5 runs, needless from the Delhi skipper. Should have been a dot and instead it is five bonus runs. Slower delivery that holds up and Pandya has to check his back foot punch to cover, Iyer sees a backing up Rohit and has shy at the bowler's end. The backing up is not great and even though Harshal Patel tried to flick the ball in play, he was in contact with the ad cushions
Boult to Rohit, 1 run, slower ball on the stumps, chipped through the vacant mid-wicket region

Boult to Rohit, FOUR, there's the boundary for the over Mumbai need. Low full toss outside off, Rohit crouches a bit and uses the pace of Boult, opens the bat face and steers it between backward point and short third man
Boult to Rohit, wide, slow, wide yorker gone wrong for Boult, sprays it too far across and Rohit lets it pass
Boult to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, back of a length on the hips, tucked through mid-wicket to bring up Mumbai's 100. 75 off 47 needed

Lamichhane to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, that left shoulder will certainly be tested with the dive. Pushed it through and got the ball to grip, Pandya squirts it off the outer half to the left of Iyer at cover, Rohit called for the single and had to put in the dive to make his ground. Direct hit might have made things more interesting
Lamichhane to Hardik Pandya, no run, googly and Pandya read it off the surface, camped back and worked it with the spin to mid-wicket
Lamichhane to Rohit, 1 run, wrong 'un and Rohit chops the cut to backward point, Pandya is off and they steal the single easily
Lamichhane to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, darted into the pads and Pandya whips it with a lot of bottom hand to deep mid-wicket

Lamichhane to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, hammered! Pressure on the teenager. Lamichhane tries to fire it full and outside off, Pandya did well to get under that and drill the drive through extra cover. No chance for Boult from long-off to cut it off

Lamichhane to Hardik Pandya, SIX, but that is not the way Hardik thinks.. Anything with flight and in his arc, Hardik will go for it, through the line and with a clean bat swing sends it soaring over the long-on fence, into the second tier
Mishra to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, quicker and at the stumps, punched to long-on
Mishra to Rohit, 1 run, flatter and around off, wristy punch from Rohit down to long-on
Mishra to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, another drag down and Pandya slaps it along the ground to sweeper cover
Mishra to Hardik Pandya, 2 runs, shortens the length and Pandya stands tall before punching it past the cover fielder, two added
Mishra to Hardik Pandya, no run, tossed up on off, Pandya offers a solid forward block
Mishra to Rohit, 1 run, gentle tap into the off-side and Rohit calms the nerves with a single
Lamichhane to Rohit, 1 run, overpitched outside off, driven to sweeper cover
Lamichhane to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, eases a single down to long-on, does Hardik

Lamichhane to Krunal Pandya, out Caught by (sub)Rahul Tewatia!! In the air and taken. Mumbai crumbling as they lose half their side. Phew! Look out for Lamichhane, he's off for a celebratory run. Googly again, in the driving spot. Krunal went for it and spooned it uppishly to cover. The sub fielder Tewatia, does a fine job. Sprawls across and pouches it safely. Krunal Pandya c (sub)Rahul Tewatia b Lamichhane 4(3) [4s-1]
Lamichhane to Krunal Pandya, no run, lovely googly from Sandeep. Pitched on off and spun past a prodding Krunal's blade
Lamichhane to Krunal Pandya, FOUR, Krunal is off the mark with a boundary. Floated on leg, Krunal sinks low and sweeps, gets it much finer and collects a boundary

Lamichhane to Pollard, out Caught by Boult!!  Wowza! Maxi-Boult combo pulls off a replica of Mayank-Tiwary's catch. But hang on, they have referred it to the third umpire. No issues with the front foot and no issues with the catch too, looks pretty clean and Pollard can continue his long walk back to the pavilion. Two in two for Delhi and what a comeback. Jitters in the Mumbai camp as they lose their fourth. Tossed up on the stumps, Pollard lifts it with a straight bat. Doesn't get enough power to clear long-on. Maxi stays at the edge of the ropes, grabs it and realises that he is going over the ropes. Throws the ball to Boult - who was waiting to gobble it up. Talk about tag-team effort. Outstanding. Pollard c Boult b Lamichhane 7(7)

Mishra to Lewis, out Stumped!! Mishra has the last laugh and pumps his fists. Just when Lewis was looking more threatening, DD have sent him packing back to the hut. The wrong 'un from Mishra that foxes Lewis, stepped forward and aimed to for a cross-batted slog over long-on. The ball dips and turns in to slider under his bat. Pant was waiting behind and breaks the stumps in time. Lewis st Pant b Mishra 48(31) [4s-3 6s-4]

Mishra to Lewis, SIX, Lewis gets underneath this flighted delivery and sweeps it straight into the ad-cushions behind square on the leg-side. Mishra looped it on leg-stump and Lewis went low in time to connect it beautifully to smash it for a maximum
Mishra to Pollard, 1 run, darter on leg, clipped away to deep mid-wicket
Mishra to Lewis, 1 run, gives more air does Mishra, Lewis takes a stride forward and drills it to long-off
Mishra to Lewis, no run, beautiful from Mishra. Tosses a googly temptingly for Lewis, who went low on the swipe and connects only thin air. Misses it altogther as he didn't read the googly
Mishra to Lewis, no run, 80kph, turning in from leg. Lewis stays back and wrists it to mid-wicket

Plunkett to Pollard, 2 runs, nervy from Shaw. He's having a tough time in the field. Pollard nudges it away in front of square, Shaw from deep square leg moved to his left, messes up a bit and that will allow the pair to steal the second
Plunkett to Lewis, 1 run, full on the pads, whisked neatly to fine leg

Plunkett to Lewis, no run, nasty! A rip-roaring short ball from Plunkett and Lewis takes a blow on the back of his helmet. Kicked off from a length and Lewis took his eyes off the ball on the pull. Cops a blow and he's in some discomfort. The DD players gang up to check on him and the physio rushes out. Looks like just a change of helmet for Lewis, nothing alarming. Ready to resume

Plunkett to Pollard, 1 run, in the airrr once again and another drop. Dropped catches are contagious. One more lifeline for Pollard. Plunkett had his hands on his head as Abhishek Sharma grasses a difficult chance. Full and tailed away late, Pollard was lunging forward and ekes out a leading edge which flew to point. Sharma dived across to his left, got both hands but the ball pops out
Plunkett to Lewis, 1 run, shortish, albeit no pace on the ball which meant Lewis had to generate some power to fetch it from outside off and pull it away to deep square leg
Plunkett to Lewis, no run, off-cutter, fuller on off. Lewis jams it off the front foot to mid-off
Mishra to Lewis, 1 run, slower on middle, Lewis sweeps it away through square leg
Mishra to Lewis, no run, punched back to the bowler

Mishra to Pollard, 3 runs, edged and put down by Shaw. Mishra is not happy with the effort. Slips in the leggie and lured Pollard once again, who outside-edged it to first slip. Shaw leapt, it was sailing over his head. Gets a finger-tip to it and it runs away towards third man. What a miss for Delhi!

Mishra to Pollard, no run, oh jeez! How did it miss the stumps? So, so close. Googly again, Pollard went for a flashing drive with no feet and doesn't pick the wrong 'un either, leaving a huge gap between his bat and pad. Straight through the gate and goes over the stumps
Mishra to Pollard, no run, googly to greet Pollard, spins and raps him on the thigh pad

Mishra to Ishan Kishan, out Caught by Vijay Shankar!! First ball wicket after the break. Mishra strikes gold. But wouldn't have been possible without Vijay Shankar - who has pulled off a blinder at long-on. Compensates for his earlier blip where he dropped Lewis at cover. Flighted teasingly from Mishra, Kishan took the bait -- had to because he was struggling a bit. Meets the pitch in a hurry and smashed it flat towards long-on. Vijay Shankar at the edge of the ropes, judges it well and clings onto it above his head. Made sure, he didn't topple over the ropes despite one leg balancing in the air. Ishan Kishan c Vijay Shankar b Mishra 5(13)

Plunkett to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, direct-hit at the non-striker's end and Kishan was struggling. Flat-batted along the turf to mid-off, the fielder collects the ball and rifles a throw, misses the target and I reckon Kishan would've been short of his crease
Plunkett to Lewis, 1 run, tad fuller, on middle and leg. Lewis jerks his front leg out of the way to flick it away to deep square leg
Plunkett to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, fuller and attacking the stumps, Kishan with an extention of his forward defence to mid-off
Plunkett to Ishan Kishan, no run, slanting and homing around off, Kishan after prodding forward quells it to cover. Was looking for a single but Lewis says no
Plunkett to Lewis, 1 run, strays on leg, Lewis gets inside the line to tuck it through square leg
Plunkett to Lewis, wide, second blemish by Plunkett in the over. A back of a length moving down the leg-side, wided
Plunkett to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, smart from Kishan. Pats a full ball to point and hares across to the other end
Plunkett to Ishan Kishan, wide, Plunkett starts with a wide down the leg-side. Slipped in the off-cutter, Kishan tries to get a tickle on it but fails

Maxwell to Lewis, SIX, a six off the final ball and 16 runs to cap off the over. Lewis is getting a move on here. Motions out of his crease to meet the pitch and allows his bottom hand to take over. Blasted disdainfully over long-off
Maxwell to Lewis, FOUR, two dots and Lewis breaks free. Flat and short down leg, Lewis swivels across and helps it behind square for a boundary
Maxwell to Lewis, no run, tad slower and Lewis drops it with soft hands to the off-side
Maxwell to Lewis, no run, quicker, sliding just outside off. Poked into the off-side

Maxwell to Lewis, SIX, in the slot and Lewis makes Maxwell pay the penalty. Flighted full outside off, Lewis chips out of his crease, flexes his muscles and smokes it over long-off. Stand and dismiss stuff

Maxwell to Lewis, no run, woah. A run-out chance at the non-striker's end but nah, Kishan gets back in safely. Tapped defensively into the off-side, Kishan was keen for the single but Lewis with a loud "No" and he gets back in without any trouble
Harshal Patel to Lewis, 1 run, another miscue and he is riding his luck. Goes hard on the airy drive, manages to get it over the in-field on the off-side

Harshal Patel to Lewis, SIX, Lewis is wading into Patel now. Overbakes and bangs it short, Lewis can deal with short balls with ease. Sits back and muscles it way back into the deep mid-wicket stands. Into the second tier

Harshal Patel to Lewis, FOUR, ungainly loft but Lewis manages to clear the in-field on the off-side. Cutter outside off, Lewis threw it all, lost his shape but the power of his willow takes it all the way to the fence. Iyer with a desperate chase, but in vain
Harshal Patel to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, full and jagging away outside off, Kishan with a slightly angled bat face runs it to third man

Harshal Patel to Lewis, 1 run, in the airr and Vijay Shankar shells it down. It was a tough chance as Lewis had hammered it hard. And guess what? Lewis could've still been dismissed had Iyer - who was backing up, effected a direct-hit at the non-striker's end. Lewis had given up
Harshal Patel to Lewis, FOUR, Lewis was waiting for this. Half-volley begging to be smashed and Lewis accepts it with glee. Planting his front foot across and belts it through cover

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, SIX, finishes it off by pulling this short ball over the long leg boundary, and then calmly tips the bails over. And that's how the IPL 2018 league stages end, with SRH, CSK, KKR and RR going through
Andrew Tye to Raina, no run, oh well, length ball on off, Raina presents a perfect forward defence. The honour of finishing the game falls upon Dhoni again
Andrew Tye to Raina, FOUR, short ball at the head, Raina swivels across nicely and helps the pull away to the fine leg boundary. Just one more needed. What a late assault

Andrew Tye to Raina, FOUR, sliced away in front of deep point, where the fielder dashes in only to find that he's badly misjudged it. Then he doesn't put his body behind it either, allowing it to slip past the side of him

Andrew Tye to Raina, SIX, pops Tye over long-on to raise his fifty! The equation has come down to a run-a-ball. Don't think he got this one off the middle either, but got enough to just clear the leaping fielder
Andrew Tye to Raina, 2 runs, length ball, dragged away off the inside half between long-on and deep mid-wicket

Andrew Tye to Raina, SIX, finally gets hold of one! He waited just a moment longer to account for the knuckle ball, and then heaved it away for a flat six. Even this had come more off the bottom of his bat actually, but again, these are short boundaries

Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, FOUR, Dhoni absolutely nails this! Spoils what was turning out to be a good over. Brings up 4000 IPL runs for himself as well. Back of length at the stumps, he opens himself up and swings into a brutal cross-batted smite through square leg

Mohit Sharma to Raina, 1 run, Raina's timing is just not there. Not always easy to hit out after nurdling the ball for so long. Length ball outside off, he slogs hard and miscues it off the outside half. So terrible is the timing that it falls well in front of deep mid-wicket
Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, 1 run, Dhoni skips out of the crease, only to be greeted with a brilliant yorker length delivery. Can only jam it out to mid-off
Mohit Sharma to Raina, 1 run, length ball outside off, Raina opens himself up to carve it over extra cover, but can't find the middle this time either. Thick inside edge past leg-stump

Mohit Sharma to Raina, 2 runs, desperate effort from Ankit Rajpoot, who does well in the end to shove his hands behind the ball. Length ball slanted outside off, Raina aims for a hoick through mid-wicket but sends it in a diagonally opposite direction through an outside edge. It was in the air for a while, but fell well short of the charging Rajpoot
Mohit Sharma to Raina, wide, bangs the slower bouncer in way too short, loops over Raina's head
Mohit Sharma to Dhoni, 1 run, back of a length delivery on middle, poked back past the bowler
Ashwin to Dhoni, 1 run, waits on this length delivery before dabbing it to short third man
Ashwin to Dhoni, 2 runs, rocks back to the carrom ball and cracks the cut away through point. Good diving effort from Axar in the deep to save the boundary
Ashwin to Raina, 1 run, turned away with the angle through mid-wicket
Ashwin to Dhoni, 1 run, 93.8kph, pretty full outside off. Dhoni shimmies to the pitch of it and pushes a single to long-on
Ashwin to Raina, 1 run, flat length ball, pushes it into the off-side

Ashwin to Chahar, out Caught by Mohit Sharma!! Sliced up off a thick edge, Mohit Sharma gets underneath it comfortably at cover. So Chahar's joyride comes to an end. The carrom ball was cleverly fired out of his arc, and his leg-side swipe was always vulnerable to the ball turning away. He's done his job though. He's done more than what could've been asked of him. Chahar c Mohit Sharma b Ashwin 39(20) [4s-1 6s-3]
Axar to Raina, 2 runs, bit of a helicopter flourish from Raina as he whips this off the back foot wide of long-on. Scurries back for the second run
Axar to Chahar, 1 run, fired in very full outside off, Chahar swings hard but gets a thick inside edge wide of short fine leg
Axar to Raina, 1 run, picks length early, steps back in the crease and cuts to point where there's a fumble
Axar to Chahar, 1 run, driven down to long-on
Axar to Chahar, SIX, my word does he have some ability with the bat! This is a stunning shot. Makes some room to a length ball and flat-bats it over long-off. Wow Deepak Chahar
Axar to Raina, 1 run, wow, Raina is playing second fiddle here. Knocks the ball down to long-on
Ashwin to Chahar, 2 runs, and finishes the over by softly nudging the length ball wide of long-on for two. 21 off the over. It knocks Punjab out of the playoffs, sending RR through
Ashwin to Chahar, FOUR, short and wide, Chahar stretches out to reach it and then cuts it away to the point boundary. He's taking Ashwin apart
Ashwin to Raina, 1 run, played down the ground for a single
Ashwin to Chahar, 1 run, full and fast at the stumps, Chahar knocks it to long-on
Ashwin to Chahar, wide, absolutely fired in by Ashwin, very quick. But it's very short and very wide, well beyond the marker
Ashwin to Chahar, SIX, now a blistering strike over long-off. Wow. Ashwin had fired this pretty wide of off, so Chahar had to reach out slightly, but the timing is still so sublime

Ashwin to Chahar, SIX, he has whacked this carrom ball over deep square leg's head. Not long boundaries here, so even a decent contact comfortably takes it over the ropes. Walked across the stumps, sat down low and got a great length for the slog-sweep
Axar to Chahar, 1 run, sliding in on middle and leg, nudged through the on-side
Axar to Chahar, no run, eyes another slog-sweep, but inside-edges it onto pad

Axar to Chahar, 2 runs, jumps across the stumps, gets down low and hits the slog-sweep to the left of deep mid-wicket. That's an outstanding effort from Mohit Sharma. The ball was always dropping in front of him, but he throws himself across and stops it on the bounce
Axar to Chahar, no run, hits the back-cut nicely but straight to backward point
Axar to Raina, 1 run, on leg-stump, fired flat, clipped away to mid-wicket for a quick single
Axar to Raina, 2 runs, flat delivery angled in on middle, Raina nudges it towards deep mid-wicket for a brace
Ashwin to Raina, 1 run, back of length outside off, punched to the left of backward point
Ashwin to Raina, no run, played with the angle to short mid-wicket
Ashwin to Raina, no run, prods forward and defends the length ball to short cover
Ashwin to Raina, no run, bit round-arm from Ashwin, slides it into middle and leg from round the wicket, Raina defends to short mid-wicket
Ashwin to Chahar, 1 run, carrom ball on middle and leg, Chahar picks it and tucks it through backward square
Ashwin to Raina, 1 run, punched away through the covers

Andrew Tye to Chahar, 2 runs, slower ball outside off, sliced away through backward point. With sweeper cover having to cover some ground to his left, they come back for the second run and make it easily
Andrew Tye to Raina, 1 run, full ball on off, Raina drives down to long-on with a bit of whip on it
Andrew Tye to Chahar, 1 run, knuckle ball which ends up as a low full toss, Chahar knocks it down to long-on
Andrew Tye to Raina, 1 run, full at the stumps, flicked down to long-on
Andrew Tye to Chahar, 1 run, opens the bat-face and runs this back of length delivery down to third man
Andrew Tye to Raina, 1 run, bumper aimed for Raina's head, he swivels across as he pulls but isn't in control of the shot. The ball drops in front of deep backward square though
Andrew Tye to Raina, wide, short of length delivery down leg, Raina misses out on the pull
Ashwin to Chahar, 2 runs, played softly in front of long-on, they scamper back for the second run
Ashwin to Raina, 1 run, skidding on from a back of length, Raina punches to long-on
Ashwin to Chahar, 1 run, camps on the back foot and nudges the carrom ball away through mid-wicket
Ashwin to Raina, 1 run, sliding into leg stump, played round the corner
Ashwin to Chahar, 1 run, low full toss on leg, flicked past short fine

Ashwin to Harbhajan, out Lbw!! Ashwin strikes first ball! This was plumb. A carrom ball which pitches in line with middle and straightens. Harbhajan kneeled down to slog-sweep but in vain, to be hit on the back leg. Only one way that was headed. Harbhajan lbw b Ashwin 19(22) [4s-2 6s-1]
Axar to Harbhajan, 1 run, tonks the ball down the ground to long-on after clearing his front leg. There's nothing much in the pitch for Axar, who's not known to be a big spinner of the ball anyway
Axar to Raina, 1 run, clipped away off the pads through square leg

Axar to Harbhajan, byes, 1 run, big wind-up from Harbhajan in his efforts to swipe the ball away through mid-wicket. It was in his arc too. But there's no connection with the willow. However, he did enough to put the keeper off. Rahul's fumble gives them a bye
Axar to Raina, 1 run, nurdled round the corner. This ball at 101kph from Axar
Axar to Harbhajan, 1 run, gets a thick inside edge onto pad as he tries flicking the ball away through mid-wicket, will get a single to cover
Axar to Raina, 1 run, 96.7kph, slipping into the pads, easily nudged through backward square
Andrew Tye to Raina, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, steered down to third man
Andrew Tye to Raina, no run, short of length delivery outside off, turned to short mid-wicket
Andrew Tye to Harbhajan, 1 run, full ball at the stumps, flicked to deep mid-wicket. KXIP have less than 50 runs to play with
Andrew Tye to Raina, 1 run, back of a length delivery, Raina picks it from outside off and turns it through mid-wicket
Andrew Tye to Raina, wide, short and wide outside off, Raina tries reaching out to meet it but fails. Another wide
Andrew Tye to Harbhajan, 1 run, leg-cutter on a back of length, knocked away in front of point
Andrew Tye to Harbhajan, wide, full toss down leg, Harbhajan misses out. He'll still get the wide of course
Andrew Tye to Raina, 1 run, knuckle ball on middle and leg, Raina shuffles across and clips it off his hips through square leg
Axar to Harbhajan, no run, flat back of length delivery outside off, another swing and a miss from Bhajji. He wanted to swipe this through mid-wicket, missed out
Axar to Harbhajan, no run, slashes hard at this back of length delivery outside off, but the extra bounce in this pitch beats him
Axar to Harbhajan, FOUR, wants to drag the sweep shot from well wide of off, but only manages an under-edge. Cruelly for Axar though, it's gone between the keeper's legs for four
Axar to Harbhajan, no run, it was on the shorter side, but the ball came in with the arm to deny Harbhajan the room on the cut. Hence the timing isn't quite there, cut off by backward point
Axar to Raina, 1 run, length ball on middle, 90.4kph, worked away through mid-wicket
Axar to Raina, no run, flat ball on leg-stump, Raina tucks it to short fine
Rajpoot to Harbhajan, no run, to compensate the umpire hasn't signaled a wide. This was full and outside the guideline too, left alone by the batsman
Rajpoot to Harbhajan, no run, banged short around off, Harbhajan plays this back to the bowler
Rajpoot to Harbhajan, SIX, finally gets some bat on it! Was trying to do this since ages. Clears his front leg and pumps the length delivery over long-off for a flat six
Rajpoot to Harbhajan, no run, another swing and a miss! Length ball outside off, Harbhajan swings and misses

Rajpoot to Harbhajan, no ball, second bouncer of the over! Wasn't that short, to be honest. Harbhajan went for the heave but got beaten again. He was down the wicket too, so this shouldn't have been a no ball
Rajpoot to Harbhajan, no run, short and wide outside off, Harbhajan tries to reach it but gets done by the bounce and pace

Rajpoot to Harbhajan, no run, how did that miss the leg stump? This was so close! Length delivery on middle and leg, Harbhajan walks down the wicket and tries to flick it, but misses. The ball misses the leg stump by a whisker too

Mohit Sharma to Harbhajan, 1 run, full toss on middle and leg, Harbhajan heaves it to short mid-wicket and retains strike. Went for the yorker but ended up bowling a juicy full toss. That should have been put away
Mohit Sharma to Harbhajan, FOUR, this is what he's here for! Short of a length around off, Harbhajan clears his front leg and slashes this over backward point. One bounce and into the hoardings
Mohit Sharma to Harbhajan, no run, gets his front leg out of the way and smacks this one to mid-on

Mohit Sharma to Raina, 1 run, tucks the length delivery to square leg and calls for a risky single. Had this been a direct hit at the striker's end, Bhajji was gone. Miller was the fielder and he could have taken some more time before having a go
Mohit Sharma to Raina, no run, full in length around off, Raina tentatively defends it. He's under pressure it seems. The CSK dug-out would be!
Mohit Sharma to Raina, no run, length ball around off, Raina stays in his crease and fends it to the right of the bowler

Rajpoot to Harbhajan, no run, dropped! Rajpoot almost gets another one. Finch the culprit on this occasion. Squared him up completely with the length delivery and induced an outside edge too. However, Finch at second slip makes a mess of it! This was a straight-forward catch for Gayle. Double wicket-maiden for Rajpoot. Absolute gold!
Rajpoot to Harbhajan, no run, comes down the track and fends the shortish delivery to the right of the bowler

Rajpoot to Billings, out Bowled!! Jaffa. Peach. Ripper. Call it whatever. This was unplayable, indeed. Pitched on off and snakes away a tad to beat Billings defence. Hits the top of off and Billings is a dead duck. Rajpoot is on a hat-trick and he can might well get it. It's Harbhajan Singh who walks out to bat ahead of Dhoni, Bravo and Jadeja. Billings b Rajpoot 0(1)

Rajpoot to du Plessis, out Caught by Gayle!! That's gone! Have to give full marks to Gayle for this effort. Both openers are back in the pavilion without doing much. Was short of a length and outside off, du Plessis went hard at it and got an outside edge. Gayle at first slip was quick to get down and reverse cup it just before the ball was about to hit ground. Had his fingers beneath and the replays confirm it. du Plessis c Gayle b Rajpoot 14(15) [4s-3]
Rajpoot to du Plessis, no run, goes fishing against an away swinging delivery and almost nicks it behind. So close to that outside edge again
Rajpoot to du Plessis, no run, full length ball outside off, moving away from the batsman as du Plessis creams his drive to the man at cover
Andrew Tye to Raina, no run, Tiwary saves a certain boundary with this effort. Raina had timed his cover-drive to perfection but Tiwary put in the dive and stopped it with his right hand
Andrew Tye to Raina, no run, better by Tye. Pitches this one up and makes it to swing away from the batsman, left alone
Andrew Tye to Raina, wide, quite similar to the previous delivery. Short and down the leg side again, Raina goes for the flick and fails to connect
Andrew Tye to Raina, wide, short one but down the leg side, Raina tries to put it away but misses

Andrew Tye to Raina, FOUR, what a fine shot! This is what he's known for. Charges down the wicket and drills this one past the bowler. Tye had no chance to stop it, nor did any of the fielders out there
Andrew Tye to Raina, FOUR, width on offer and Raina pounces on it. Was short and wide outside off, Raina reached for it and carved it over point. Third man is too fine to cut this down
Andrew Tye to Raina, no run, length delivery around off, Raina bunts it towards short mid-wicket
Andrew Tye to Raina, no run, short and wide outside off, Raina cuts it hard but finds the man at point

Rajpoot to du Plessis, FOUR, first convincing shot of the day by du Plessis. Thinks he's had enough of Rajpoot! Dances down the wicket and chips the back of a length ball over cover. That'll make him feel much better
Rajpoot to du Plessis, no run, he's teasing the batsman. Bowls it outside the off stump again and du Plessis thinks it's better to shoulder arms. The skipper likes it and applauds

Rajpoot to du Plessis, FOUR, du Plessis is riding his luck! This was a length delivery snaking away, he tried to punch it on the up and got a thick outside edge. Past the man at second slip and into the third man fence. As a result of this, Ashwin has decided to bring in the third slip too
Rajpoot to du Plessis, no run, almost squares him up. Pitched up on middle and leg, du Plessis tries to flick it away, ends up getting a leading edge to mid-off
Rajpoot to du Plessis, no run, jagging away from the batsman outside off, du Plessis throws his hands at it but gets beaten
Rajpoot to Raina, 1 run, on the pads as Raina flicks it away to fine leg
Mohit Sharma to du Plessis, FOUR, in the air... but safe! Length ball around off, du Plessis checks his drive and manages to elude the bowler. Any other day and this would have been a catch
Mohit Sharma to du Plessis, no run, 'wait on' is the cry from du Plessis as he defends the length ball to mid-off
Mohit Sharma to Raina, 1 run, gets on his toe and tucks that off his hips, Raina's off the mark
Mohit Sharma to Raina, no run, back of a length delivery angled away from the batsman, Raina stays in his crease and taps it to wide mid-off

Mohit Sharma to Rayudu, out Caught by Rahul!! Edged and taken! Mohit gets the man in form. Swing does the trick once again. Short of a length around off, with a bit of away swing written on it. Rayudu tries to fend it down but gets an outside edge and Rahul doesn't make any mistake. Can Mohit get one more? Rayudu c Rahul b Mohit Sharma 1(3)
Mohit Sharma to Rayudu, no run, a skiddy length delivery that keeps low, Rayudu just in time brings his bat down and dabs it to point
Rajpoot to du Plessis, no run, only 3 runs off the first over! Ideal start for Punjab. Ends the over with a length delivery outside off that moves away to beat du Plessis' tentative poke yet again
Rajpoot to du Plessis, no run, another ripper by Rajpoot. Pitches on a length around off and du Plessis looks to fend it but can't connect it once again
Rajpoot to du Plessis, no run, snaking away from the batsman but well outside off, the batsman lifts his bat and lets it through
Rajpoot to du Plessis, 2 runs, hops a bit in the crease and tucks the shortish delivery to deep square leg for two
Rajpoot to du Plessis, no run, that's a jaffa! On a length in that corridor of uncertainty, du Plessis offers a feeble poke only to get beaten. Could have easily nicked that
Rajpoot to Rayudu, 1 run, swing on offer straightaway. Full in length around off, swings away a tad but Rayudu gets his bat down in time and steers it down to third man

SN Thakur to Rajpoot, out Caught by du Plessis!! du Plessis takes a clean catch at long-on and that's the end of Punjab. Reckon, this total is not good enough to take them through to the playoffs. Was a short delivery that was swatted away to long-on by Rajpoot. du Plessis was the man near the fence who took it and managed to stay inside the boundary. Rajpoot c du Plessis b SN Thakur 2(4)
SN Thakur to Mohit Sharma, 1 run, times his cover-drive but finds the man in the deep
SN Thakur to Rajpoot, 1 run, very full and outside off, Rajpoot swings hard again and gets an outside edge to third man
SN Thakur to Rajpoot, no run, short of a length outside off, Rajpoot swings and misses
Dwayne Bravo to Rajpoot, 1 run, whips the length delivery to short mid-wicket for a single

Dwayne Bravo to Nair, out Caught by Chahar!! He's disappointed, disappointed at throwing his wicket away. He has done his job though. Tries to chip the low full toss over mid-off but gets it off the toe end and Chahar at mid-off completes the formalities. Should have waited for the last over, would have made some difference to the end score. Nair c Chahar b Dwayne Bravo 54(26) [4s-3 6s-5]
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, SIX, fifty for Karun Nair! Preity Zinta in the stands loves it. Was a short delivery around off, Nair comes down the wicket and slaps the slower one over long-on
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, SIX, he's getting better as this innings is progressing. Gets down on his knee and picks the length delivery over fine leg. Good enough to reach the distance

Dwayne Bravo to Nair, FOUR, that's a fantastic shot by Nair. Full length delivery on leg, Nair improvises at the last moment and reverse whips it over backward point. Just eludes the man stationed in that position
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, no run, slower delivery outside off, Nair shuffles a bit and then scythes it to point
Lungi Ngidi to Nair, 1 run, 4-1-10-4, the figures of Ngidi. What a match defining spell this has been. Nair knocks it down to long-on and retains strike
Lungi Ngidi to Mohit Sharma, 1 run, single to get off the mark, on a length outside off and Sharma fends it in front of cover-point to scamper across
Lungi Ngidi to Mohit Sharma, no run, back of a length outside off, Sharma punches it to point

Lungi Ngidi to Andrew Tye, out Caught by Raina!! Another one for Ngidi. He's taking down Punjab single handedly tonight. Got Rahul and Gayle earlier, gets Ashwin and Tye now. This was short of a length around off, Tye tried to punch it off his back foot but his bottom hand came off and he ended up miscuing it to mid-off. Can't get any easier for Raina! Andrew Tye c Raina b Lungi Ngidi 0(2)
Lungi Ngidi to Andrew Tye, no run, low full toss around off, Tye does well to dig that out in time

Lungi Ngidi to Ashwin, out Caught by Dhoni!! Full marks to the bowler there. He was sure that the batsman had nicked it and Ashwin has to walk back for a golden duck. Short delivery outside off, Ashwin tries to run it down to third man but gets a slight feather on its way to the keeper. Even he wasn't sure that if had nicked it. UltraEdge confirms with a spike! Ashwin c Dhoni b Lungi Ngidi 0(1)
Lungi Ngidi to Ashwin, wide, short one but down the leg side, Ashwin tries to flick it away but misses

SN Thakur to Nair, FOUR, 18 runs off the over! Just what the doctor ordered for Punjab. This was full and outside off, Nair threw his bat at it and got an outside edge that eluded Dhoni and found the fence
SN Thakur to Nair, wide, pressure on the bowler! Short and way outside off, Nair leaves it for the keeper
SN Thakur to Nair, SIX, shot! This is what KXIP exactly want. Short again on middle and leg, Nair stays in his crease and swings it over square leg. Way into the stands, such sweet was the timing

SN Thakur to Nair, FOUR, Nair continues to march on. The wicket won't make a difference to him. A full length delivery around off, Nair moves away and chips it over covers. Billings can't get there in time

SN Thakur to Axar, out Caught by Billings!! Terrific catch by Billings! Short delivery around off, Axar goes for the pull and miscues it to deep mid-wicket. Billings comes running in and just as the ball is about to die in front of him, he puts in a dive and pulls off a ripper. The wicket belongs to the fielder, more than the bowler. Axar c Billings b SN Thakur 14(12) [6s-1]

SN Thakur to Axar, 2 runs, sloppy work by Chahar, must have stopped this. A length delivery outside off and Axar slapped it hard to mid-off. Chahar the culprit who misfields and allows them to come back for the second
SN Thakur to Nair, leg byes, 1 run, quicker delivery on leg, Nair tries to heave that away but gets struck on the pads. Got thinking by Shardul who followed the batsman
Jadeja to Nair, 1 run, another single at long-off. The boundaries have started to flow and they're taking the singles two
Jadeja to Axar, 1 run, rotates strike with a gentle knock to long-off
Jadeja to Axar, SIX, lovely shot! Picks the length early on the short one, backs away and nonchalantly lofts it over long-off. Has enough on it to evade the man in the deep
Jadeja to Nair, 1 run, moves away and punches it firmly to sweeper cover, was a shortish delivery
Jadeja to Axar, 1 run, shortish delivery around middle, Axar slogs it hard but finds the man in the deep
Jadeja to Nair, 1 run, intial call was for two but on seeing the long-on fielder charge in, the batsmen had to settle for a single. It was bunted down to long-on
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, 1 run, 11 runs off the Bravo over. This was very full in length again, Nair drove it down to long-on and ended the over with a single
Dwayne Bravo to Axar, 1 run, yorker on middle and Axar does well to bring his bat down in time and flick it away to mid-wicket
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, 1 run, waits for the slower one and angles it down to third man
Dwayne Bravo to Axar, 1 run, the slower delivery on leg, Axar nudges it to square leg and scampers across to the other end. He wanted the second run but was sent back by Karun
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, 1 run, short delivery outside off, Nair steers it down to third man for a single. Sensible batting

Dwayne Bravo to Nair, SIX, excellent lofted shot. Full in length around off, Nair moves away, makes room for himself and times his loft over long-off. Right from the meat and comfortably over the ropes
Jadeja to Axar, no run, short and flat around off, Axar bunts it back to the bowler
Jadeja to Nair, 1 run, short in length again, Nair drags it down to square leg and gets a single more
Jadeja to Axar, 1 run, flat and quick on leg, Axar tucks it towards short fine and takes a single
Jadeja to Nair, 1 run, bunts the floater down to long-off and moves across to the other end

Jadeja to Nair, SIX, just clears the man in the deep. Flatter around middle and leg, Nair goes down on his knee and slog sweeps it over square leg. Ngidi is the man in the deep who tries hard to grab it in left hand but it's way above him
Jadeja to Nair, no run, darted around off, Nair rocks back and chops it to the man at point
Dwayne Bravo to Axar, no run, fuller length ball, driven back to the bowler. Just 2 runs a wicket off the over

Dwayne Bravo to Axar, no run, ah! How did that miss the edge? Wasn't far away from the off-pole as well. Seam-up delivery from a short of length that holds it line just outside off. Axar Patel plays outside the line and gets beaten on the inside edge
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, 1 run, eases the drive down to long-on
Dwayne Bravo to Nair, no run, short of length delivery with a bit of extra bounce, turned to mid-wicket
Dwayne Bravo to Axar, 1 run, driven firmly to long-off

Dwayne Bravo to Miller, out Bowled!! The zing bails light up and then there's the jig from Bravo. Perfect yorker from the West Indian, Miller slightly moved leg-side to create room. He is too late to bring his bat down and the ball crashes into the middle stump. KXIP in deep trouble here - 80/5! Miller b Dwayne Bravo 24(22) [4s-1 6s-1]
Jadeja to Miller, 1 run, quick in-turner, Miller adjusts and whips it through mid-wicket. Miller wants the second run too, but is sent back by Nair
Jadeja to Nair, 1 run, plays with soft hands and drops it in front of point for a quick single
Jadeja to Nair, no run, turned to short mid-wicket
Jadeja to Miller, leg byes, 1 run, fires on the pads of the lefty, who is late on his glance. The ball dies down on the leg-side off his pad
Jadeja to Nair, 1 run, flat ball on middle, bunted towards mid-on

Jadeja to Manoj Tiwary, out Caught by Dhoni!! Have CSK forgotten to appeal? Didn't appeal for Gayle, he walked. This time a timid appeal for the sake of it from RJ and the umpire raises his finger. A wicket off his first ball for Ravindra Jadeja. Gave a bit of flight on this ball from round the wicket did RJ and the ball doesn't spin much after pitching outside off. Tiwary is down on his knee to swipe and gets a faint edge to the keeper. Off the toe end. That threatened to bobble out of the keeper's hand, but MS doesn't make any mistake. Manoj Tiwary c Dhoni b Jadeja 35(30) [4s-3 6s-1]
SN Thakur to Miller, no run, slower ball, a low full toss and well outside off. A backing away Miller can't reach there. Not wided as it was just inside the tramline

SN Thakur to Miller, 2 runs, another top edge that falls safe. Head-high bouncer cramping Miller for room. Miller top-edges the pull and the ball falls safely in the fine leg region. The fielder in the deep was squarer
SN Thakur to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, Thakur shortens his length and bowls it too straight, Tiwary shuffles across to tuck it to fine leg
SN Thakur to Manoj Tiwary, no run, fuller than a good length, a push towards extra cover
SN Thakur to Miller, 1 run, mistimed pull shot. Miller was late into his shot against this short ball. Off the top portion of the bat to long-on for a single
SN Thakur to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, short of a good length, dabbed off the back foot towards point for a single
Dwayne Bravo to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, 10 off the over. Normal-paced short of length delivery wide of off, Tiwary runs it down to third man

Dwayne Bravo to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, edged and four. Tiwary didn't see a short ball coming ball. Got big on the batsman and Tiwary persisted with the pull shot. The top edge flies over Dhoni's head for a boundary
Dwayne Bravo to Miller, 1 run, slower ball, full on leg, wristed to mid-wicket and the charging in fielder - Thakur slides and loses his balance. Luckily, no damage

Dwayne Bravo to Manoj Tiwary, leg byes, 1 run, short of length delivery on leg, Tiwary misses the tuck after a shuffle. Goes to Dhoni's left off the batsman's pad and they nab a run via byes. MS decided not to throw the ball
Dwayne Bravo to Miller, 1 run, fuller in length, Miller walks forward and was actually looking to flick it through mid-wicket. Gets a leading edge and the ball rolls down the ground
Dwayne Bravo to Miller, 2 runs, 132.3kph back of a length delivery wide of off, Miller opens his bat-face to force it behind backward point. Third man mops up
SN Thakur to Miller, 1 run, inswinger, tucked away towards square leg

SN Thakur to Manoj Tiwary, 3 runs, comedy of errors! A push to mid-off and Tiwary sets off for a quick single. Jadeja misses the stumps at the bowler's end with a rifle throw and that allows the batsmen to nab another. The action doesn't stop there as the fielder backing up, flings it towards the keeper's end. Dhoni misses and there is another fielder behind him backing up - who allows it to go through as well. End result - 3 runs. Just don't release the ball!
SN Thakur to Manoj Tiwary, no run, good ball! Bangs it short and cramps Tiwary for room. Tiwary hops and awkwardly fends it into the leg-side
SN Thakur to Manoj Tiwary, wide, wasted delivery down the leg-side

SN Thakur to Manoj Tiwary, no run, taps a length ball to backward point and the batsmen decide against a risky single. Rayudu fires a throw at the bowler's end. Fails to hit the target. Miller was anyway in

SN Thakur to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, not sure if he intened to go there. Fuller length ball swinging in on leg, Tiwary's bat turns at the point of impact as he looks to on-drive. The ball races away to deep square leg off the inside half of the bat
SN Thakur to Manoj Tiwary, no run, pacy in-angling delivery on the stumps. 140.3kph, on a good-ish length and Tiwary offers a straight bat to defend

Harbhajan to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, more air on this delivery and this was bowled wide of off. Tiwary goes down on a knee for a premeditated sweep. Drags it to short fine leg off the inside edge. Could have easily dragged it onto his stumps
Harbhajan to Miller, 1 run, slower through the air and Miller inside-edges it to square leg
Harbhajan to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, flatter in trajectory, bunted down to long-on

Harbhajan to Manoj Tiwary, SIX, Jadeja can only get a hand on it and he parries it over the ropes. Would be very harsh to call it a drop. Tiwary danced down the track and slug in the direction of the turn. Just over RJ at long-on, who timed his jump to perfection and went for a one-handed catch
Harbhajan to Manoj Tiwary, no run, Harbhajan saw the batter come down and shortened his length. Tiwary is nowhere close to the pitch and blocks

Harbhajan to Manoj Tiwary, FOUR, horror ball to begin. Short, wide asking to be punished. Tiwary stays leg-side of the ball as he goes deep in his crease. Then employs the cut shot behind square on the off-side

Chahar to Miller, SIX, for a moment, I thought that he had mishit that. How wrong was I? Pitched up delivery outside off, Miller reaches out, bends the back knee and lofts it over long-off. High and handsome. A six off the free-hit
Chahar to Miller, no ball, second bouncer of the over and it's a no-ball. Miller was out of his crease and got into an awkward position. Manages to duck under it. Free-hit coming up
Chahar to Miller, no run, poor shot selection. Seam-up delivery angling across, Miller attempts the ugly swipe across the line and the ball goes underneath the bat
Chahar to Miller, wide, bangs it short, but gets it to bounce it well over the batsman's head. Wided
Chahar to Miller, no run, walks forward and across does Miller and then wrists this length ball to mid-on. A slight fumble from Jadeja, but they don't risk the single
Chahar to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, tap-and-run. Chahar persists with the good length delivery that nibbles away ever so lightly, Tiwary drops it in front of cover with soft hands for a quick single
Chahar to Manoj Tiwary, no run, out-shaper, that slightly squares up the batsman. Tiwary stays back in his crease and pokes it to cover
Chahar to Miller, 1 run, back of a length delivery from round the wicket, Miller walks down and dinks it to mid-on
Lungi Ngidi to Miller, 1 run, 140.3kph, on a good length and on off, Miller gets an inside edge on his block that deflects towards the off-side off his pad. Powerplay done - 29/3!
Lungi Ngidi to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, good length delivery that swings away slightly, tapped to the left of Bhajji at mid-off
Lungi Ngidi to Miller, 1 run, very unlike Jadeja. Miller sees the line outside off and drive firmly, but straight to mid-off. A misfield allows the batters to rotate strike
Lungi Ngidi to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, sprayed full and wide of off, Tiwary employs the square drive. Uppish, but well wide of the man at backward point. A single
Lungi Ngidi to Manoj Tiwary, 2 runs, too straight, on the ribs and that's been tucked around the corner
Lungi Ngidi to Manoj Tiwary, no run, Ngidi sports a bright smile as he beats Tiwary on the outside edge. Pitched up delivery wide of off, Tiwary misses the drive
Chahar to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, outswinging good length delivery around off, Tiwary plays with soft hands. Slightly opens his bat-face. The ball trims the outside edge and runs down to third man
Chahar to Miller, 1 run, shortish ball, Miller walks down and dabs it towards third man
Chahar to Miller, no run, Chahar now attacks the stumps and Miller turns it to mid-wicket

Chahar to Miller, FOUR, good shot to get going. He is out of his crease to negate swing. Chahar's inswinger ends up on his pads and Miller doesn't miss out. Leans across and flicks it beautifully through backward square leg
Chahar to Miller, no run, back of a length delivery around off, Miller defends it towards cover from the crease
Chahar to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, a wristy push towards mid-on for a quick single

Lungi Ngidi to Rahul, out Bowled!! Wow! This is excellent bowling from Lungi Ngidi. After all those away-going deliveries, he gets one to shape in. Rahul shoulders arms and loses his off-stump. Top-class bowling. A goodish length from over the wicket and Rahul anticipating the ball swing away raised his bat. It was however,, the inswinger. Hits the top of off. KXIP's best batsman this season departs for a cheap score. Rahul b Lungi Ngidi 7(11) [4s-1]
Lungi Ngidi to Rahul, no run, seam-up delivery, in that nagging zone outside off, nips away too to make matters worse for the batsman. A tentative Rahul sticks his bat out to block. Beaten

Lungi Ngidi to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, length ball, Tiwary defends off the inside edge and looks for a quick single. He is sent back by his partner. The mid-on fielder attacks and has a shy at the striker's end. Misses and the Tiwary gets off the mark via overthrows
Lungi Ngidi to Manoj Tiwary, no run, 140.2kph, decks in from a short of length, defended into the leg-side
Lungi Ngidi to Manoj Tiwary, no run, seam-up delivery decking away, Tiwary pokes with an open face of the bat, beaten
Lungi Ngidi to Manoj Tiwary, no run, 141.5kph, angling in, defended
Chahar to Manoj Tiwary, 1 run, turned off his hips to backward square leg

Chahar to Finch, out Caught by Raina!! Superb catch from Raina at first slip. Moved swiftly to his left and catches it above his head. A nothing shot from Finch. He knew that the ball is swinging, still flirts with a ball outside off sans any feet movement. Short of good length and nipping away from the right-hander, Finch gets squared up and can only manage an outside edge that finds the safe palms of Raina. Finch c Raina b Chahar 4(6) [4s-1]
Chahar to Rahul, 1 run, too straight, tucked to deep square leg
Chahar to Finch, leg byes, 1 run, in-tucker from a shortened length, Finch misses the glance. The ball thuds his pad and dies down on the leg-side
Chahar to Finch, no run, half-appeal for lbw, turned down. Chahar pitches one up and gets it to swing into the right-hander, Finch misses the flick and gets rapped on the front leg. Missing leg​
Chahar to Finch, FOUR, seam-up delivery swinging away, Finch rocks back and punches it beautifully through covers, beating a diving Faf. First boundary for Finch
Lungi Ngidi to Rahul, no run, flirty! Away-shaper from a back of a length and Rahul hops to run it down towards third man. A risky shot and he gets beaten on the outside edge
Lungi Ngidi to Rahul, no run, short of a good length delivery on middle, turned to mid-wicket

Lungi Ngidi to Finch, byes, 1 run, an extravagant drive attempted from Finch - against an outswinger outside off and gets beaten. No feet movement either. Dhoni fails to gather it cleanly and the batsmen nab a run via byes
Lungi Ngidi to Finch, no run, short of length delivery on the stumps, nudged into the leg-side

Lungi Ngidi to Gayle, out Caught by Dhoni!! What was that? A half-hearted appeal for caught-behind, the umpire doesn't raise his finger, but Gayle walks. Well, CSK have the breakthrough. And, it's a big wicket. A harmless ball sliding down leg from a back of a length, Gayle gets a glove on it, trying to tuck. The Jamaican stood for a while and decided to go off. Gayle c Dhoni b Lungi Ngidi 0(2)

Lungi Ngidi to Gayle, no run, good ball, first up from Ngidi. Short of a length delivery in that nagging zone outside off. Got it to nip away slightly and Gayle sans any feet movement flirts. Beaten on the outside edge
Chahar to Rahul, no run, back of a length delivery on off, Rahul pats it to point off the back foot
Chahar to Rahul, wide, Chahar over-corrects now. Shortens his length and spills one down the leg-side
Chahar to Rahul, FOUR, magnificent stroke! Not a bad ball by any means. A good length outswinger, Rahul leans forward and creams the drive through extra cover. No need to run for shots like that
Chahar to Rahul, no run, back of a length delivery, Rahul stays back and defends with an open face of the bat
Chahar to Rahul, no run, banged short around the off-stump channel, Rahul stands tall and blocks it
Chahar to Rahul, 2 runs, gets off the mark. A length delivery on middle and leg, Rahul tucks it to deep square leg and manages to get two
Chahar to Rahul, no run, good length delivery around off, Rahul has played it to the man at cover-point

Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, SIX, Faf du Plessis, you champion! He takes just one ball to do it. Slower ball on a length, whacks it back down the ground to smash those LED boards before raising his arms and letting out a huge roar

S Kaul to SN Thakur, FOUR, Shardul Thakur, are you kidding me! He's making up for all the punishment he took from the hands of Carlos Brathwaite. Wankhede erupts. Full ball at the stumps, drilled back past the bowler's head. Swirls away into the fence

S Kaul to SN Thakur, 2 runs, full ball on off, Thakur barrels it with a big back-lift straight down the ground. There's a bit of ground for Dhawan to cover to his right from long-off, and that's enough for du Plessis to put his head down and head back to the non-striker's end. What a finish this
S Kaul to du Plessis, 1 run, this is cool batting from Faf du Plessis. Knocks this length ball to cover for one
S Kaul to du Plessis, wide, misfires with this leg-cutter. It's well wide of off. Faf keeps his mind and doesn't go chasing after it
S Kaul to SN Thakur, 1 run, full ball, driven hard down to long-off
S Kaul to SN Thakur, FOUR, would you believe it? Another french cut for four. Kaul doesn't know how to react. Back of length, cramps Thakur up and takes the inside edge to the fine leg boundary

S Kaul to SN Thakur, FOUR, forget turning the strike over, Thakur has squirted this for four. It's running CSK's way. Kaul's so terribly unlucky though. Beaut of a yorker on off, Thakur gets it right off the toe-end, and with third man up, it runs away

Brathwaite to du Plessis, FOUR, he's got the boundary. Full ball outside off, the field is set in a way that there are three fielders to the left of point in a ring, and sweeper cover is pretty straight. So Faf carves this full ball square enough of Rashid in the deep to beat him. What a knock he's playing

Brathwaite to du Plessis, out Harbhajan Run Out!! 1 run completed. This is stunning bit of work in the outfield from Rashid Khan. Faf had absolutely drilled this drive to his right at deep extra cover. But not only does he race across and slide to stop it, he also fires in a rocket throw back to Brathwaite to catch Harbhajan well short. Harbhajan run out (Rashid Khan/Brathwaite) 2(9)
Brathwaite to du Plessis, FOUR, four more. Just the over CSK need. Leg-cutter on a back of length, and although he's deceived by it, he's able to drag it away past short fine leg

Brathwaite to du Plessis, SIX, oh what a shot. He's picked the bones out of it. An 87-metre six pumps up the CSK dugout while raising the fifty for the South African player. Brathwaite offers it in the slot again, and gets smoked away
Brathwaite to du Plessis, FOUR, he's successfully targetted extra cover again. Full ball outside off, pretty short of the blockhole, so Faf has enough space to get it over Williamson's head
