Brathwaite to Harbhajan, 1 run, leg-cutter on a back of length, Harbhajan goes hard flat-batted but hits it limply down the ground to long-on
S Kaul to Harbhajan, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, 116kph, Harbhajan clips it away to deep backward square. He will keep strike. Not sure if CSK want that
S Kaul to Harbhajan, no run, nails the yorker outside off, Harbhajan tries slicing it down to third man but fails

S Kaul to du Plessis, 1 run, can't get it through. Uses his feet to convert this intended yorker into a low full toss. He had width at his disposal too, but he carves this in the vicinity of Williamson at extra cover
S Kaul to Harbhajan, leg byes, 1 run, zips on from a length on middle and leg, beats Harbhajan's flick and deflects off his pad into the on-side
S Kaul to Harbhajan, no run, knuckle ball on a good length outside off, Harbhajan flashes a drive at it and misses. Bit of spongy bounce there which took it over the bat
S Kaul to du Plessis, 1 run, lobbed right off the toe-end from Faf, who dropped his head as soon as he hit it. But luckily, the ball drops well in front of Brathwaite at long-on

Rashid Khan to Harbhajan, no run, pretty much clueless. Pokes at a length ball away from the body, it's the leg-break from Rashid which turns away at a quick pace and beats the outside edge. Rashid finishes with extraordinary figures of 2/11
Rashid Khan to Harbhajan, no run, length ball sliding on from a length outside off, Harbhajan lunges forward and defends back
Rashid Khan to Harbhajan, no run, pretty full just outside off, squeezed out to cover
Rashid Khan to Harbhajan, no run, lunges out to meet this length ball, doesn't pick it. It's a googly which spins in and takes a thick inside edge to short fine leg
Rashid Khan to du Plessis, 1 run, full and quick on off, Faf goes for the flick and the ball goes off his leading edge to long-off

Rashid Khan to du Plessis, no run, and this call, if upheld, could seal the game. Faf given out LBW to a googly from Rashid. He's gone for the review. This is shady, as the ball seems to be a bit leg-sidish. You can see middle and off stump when it hit the pad. Williamson has already got his fielders in position, so he doesn't seem very confident. Yes, as expected, it's missing leg stump. Faf survives. CSK still alive, if only just

Sandeep Sharma to Chahar, out Caught by Brathwaite!! Has Brathwaite taken this? It will be a sensational catch if he has. Tom Moody gets on his feet in the dugout. Big moment. The soft signal is out. And it doesn't take long for the third umpire to uphold the onfield call. Dhoni looks a bit miffed as he crosses his arms. Full ball, not an easy length to get under, which is why Chahar's loft hardly finds much elevation. It's a flat hit in front of long-on, with the ball dipping on Brathwaite and making him the second favourite. But he charges in while covering great ground and dives forward to get his fingers underneath. What a game he's had. Chahar c Brathwaite b Sandeep Sharma 10(6) [6s-1]
Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, 1 run, squared up by the knuckle ball, pokes it off the leading edge to cover

Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, FOUR, carved away over extra-cover, and all of a sudden CSK have the momentum. Full ball outside off, Faf somehow manages to get under it and lifts it over Williamson in the infield
Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, no run, slower back of length delivery outside off, stops on Faf's attempted back-foot cover drive. He inside-edges it back down the pitch to Sandeep's right
Sandeep Sharma to Chahar, 1 run, yorker on off, rushes his bat down and jams it to long-off. Excellent response from Sandeep

Sandeep Sharma to Chahar, SIX, and Chahar goes bang. Well, not quite a BANG, but bang enough. Off-pace back of length delivery, he swipes cross-batted and clears the mid-wicket boundary. It came off the toe-end, but these are short boundary

Shakib to du Plessis, SIX, straight down the ground from Faf, clean strike. He's got to pick his bowlers now, and he's got 10 off two balls from Shakib. Swings through the line of the full ball and sends it soaring over long-on

Shakib to du Plessis, FOUR, backs away against this arm-ball and hacks it through mid-wicket. He's got it between long-on and deep mid-wicket, and despite a committed dive from Manish Pandey, he can only parry the ball into the ropes

Shakib to Chahar, 1 run, pulls the length back around off and allows the ball to grip a touch more. Chahar works it softly in front of long-on. Shakib gives chase himself and puts in a desperate, and rather unnecessary, dive
Shakib to du Plessis, 1 run, full on middle and leg, worked down to long-on
Shakib to Chahar, 1 run, Shakib's been a bit too full this spell. Chahar smears the ball down to long-off
Shakib to du Plessis, 1 run, clears the front leg and carves this overpitched delivery to sweeper cover
Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, 1 run, 111.4kph, another slower ball from Sandeep, this one on a short of length outside off. Faf taps it in front of backward point

Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, 2 runs, slower length ball outside off, picked away softly through the vacant mid-wicket region. The deftness of the shot gave Faf enough time to hare back for the second
Sandeep Sharma to Chahar, 1 run, slower ball, Chahar pats it in front of backward point and scampers to the other end. Gets in the way of the throw from the fielder

Sandeep Sharma to Jadeja, out Caught&Bowled!! Not anymore he's not. Dear me. He's chipped this knuckle ball straight back to Sandeep, completely bamboozled. Beautifully disguised on a good length around middle, Jadeja tries working it through the on-side but he's way too early into the shot. SRH are turning a defence of 140 into a one-sided affair. Quite unbelievable turn of events here. Jadeja c and b Sandeep Sharma 3(5)
Sandeep Sharma to Jadeja, no run, back of a length delivery on off, blocked to short cover
Sandeep Sharma to du Plessis, 1 run, slower length ball on middle, glanced to short fine leg. Picked that variation late, did Faf, but adjusted well

Rashid Khan to Jadeja, no run, this is tough. Jadeja's feet are stuck at the crease due to Rashid's quickness through the air, but despite being back to it, he still doesn't have the time to cope. The leg-break hurries onto him from a back of length, cramps him up and hits him high on the pad
Rashid Khan to du Plessis, 1 run, slightly on the shorter side, cut away off the back foot to sweeper cover
Rashid Khan to Jadeja, 1 run, picks the googly and steers it with the turn through the covers
Rashid Khan to Jadeja, 2 runs, 94.2kph, full on middle and leg and turning in, Jadeja just gets his bat across in time to work it through square leg

Rashid Khan to Dwayne Bravo, out Caught by Dhawan!! Pouched at slip by Dhawan. Rashid Khan jogs away with his arms spread. Oh he loves bowling at the Wankhede. The extra fizz off the surface works wonders for him. Pushed through on a good length outside off, Bravo wafts at it and perishes to the turn and bite. SRH on a roll. Dwayne Bravo c Dhawan b Rashid Khan 7(11)
Rashid Khan to du Plessis, 1 run, pushed through the air on a back of length, Faf has enough time to read it off the pitch. He's on the back foot as he clips the leg-break through mid-wicket
Shakib to du Plessis, 1 run, skidding on from a length, Faf goes deep in the crease and shovels it with the angle to deep mid-wicket
Shakib to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, too full from Shakib, right under Bravo's bat as he eases it down to long-off
Shakib to du Plessis, 1 run, floated up full outside off, driven to long-off
Shakib to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, sliding in from a length from outside off, Bravo works it down to long-on
Shakib to Dwayne Bravo, no run, prods forward to this length ball and defends to short cover
Shakib to Dwayne Bravo, 2 runs, tossed up at the stumps, whipped wide of the fielder at deep mid-wicket

Rashid Khan to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, another wrong 'un and this nearly cleaned up Bravo, he didn't spot it one bit - went for his flamboyant on the up cover drive, didn't get anywhere close to the pitch of the ball, lucky that the fat inside edge rolled past his leg-stump
Rashid Khan to Dwayne Bravo, no run, pushed through flatter and quicker - on Bravo's pads, he was looking to flick and missed
Rashid Khan to du Plessis, 1 run, the wrong 'un arrives and du Plessis was very tentative as he pushed forward, gets an inside edge towards short fine for a single
Rashid Khan to du Plessis, no run, very full and just outside off, du Plessis was looking to drive and missed, Goswami grabbed at the ball and missed as well, but there was no edge on that
Rashid Khan to du Plessis, no run, flighted delivery and well outside off, du Plessis reaches across and nudges it towards backward point
Rashid Khan to du Plessis, no run, tossed up on off, du Plessis works it to the left of mid-wicket where Manish gets across quickly to make the stop

Brathwaite to Dwayne Bravo, no run, appeal for LBW and SRH will not review. Think there was an inside edge, looked high to the naked eye as well. On a good length and angling back into the right-hander, Bravo was shuffling across on the flick and took one on his pads
Brathwaite to du Plessis, 1 run, short of a length and well outside off, cracked away square on the off-side for a single

Brathwaite to du Plessis, SIX, risky but much needed for du Plessis, banged in short and just outside off, du Plessis was on the back-foot, didn't get hold of the cross-batted slap, just about has enough to clear the man at long leg
Brathwaite to du Plessis, no run, short of a length and angling into du Plessis's hips, he's late on the flick and the ball lobs off his pads towards the on-side
Brathwaite to du Plessis, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, hurried onto du Plessis as he went for the pull, mistimes it towards mid-wicket
Brathwaite to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, short of a length and just outside off, Bravo runs it down towards third man
Rashid Khan to Dwayne Bravo, 1 run, Rashid drops this one short and wide of off, cracked away square on the off-side for a single

Rashid Khan to Dwayne Bravo, no run, another wrong 'un and there's a slight delayed appeal for LBW, might have been slipping down the leg-side, Bravo was prodding forward in defence and missed, struck in front of middle and leg

Rashid Khan to Dhoni, out Bowled!! That's big, that's huge and that might have just won this match for SRH. The wrong 'un from Rashid and MS didn't read it, he was lunging forward, was perhaps looking to push it too square, the ball grazed the inside edge, went through the huge gap between bat and pad and disturbed the stumps. Rashid is thrilled to bits, so are the SRH camp. They are defending a modest target with elan once again. Dhoni b Rashid Khan 9(18) [4s-1]
Rashid Khan to du Plessis, 1 run, the wrong 'un from Rashid, not sure du Plessis read it as he prodded forward, gets a thick inside edge towards mid-on for a single
Rashid Khan to Dhoni, 1 run, tossed up wide of off, Dhoni reaches forward and works it into the gap past cover, just a single
Rashid Khan to Dhoni, no run, pushed through flatter and quicker, Dhoni goes back and finds cover with the punch
Brathwaite to Dhoni, leg byes, 1 run, length ball on Dhoni's pads, he was looking to work it towards the on-side and missed, went off his pads towards long leg and the batsmen sneak in a leg-bye
Brathwaite to Dhoni, no run, short and wide of off, Dhoni reaches out, gets on top of the bounce and finds backward point with the tap
Brathwaite to Dhoni, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, Dhoni hops across and mistimes the cut towards cover-point
Brathwaite to du Plessis, 1 run, on a good length and coming back into the right-hander, clipped away past square leg for a single

Brathwaite to du Plessis, no run, that's another stunning stop from Manish, saved at least one run. Short and wide of off, du Plessis chopped it hard onto the ground and to the right of point - where Manish went full-stretched to his right on the dive and stopped the ball
Brathwaite to Dhoni, 1 run, back of a length and on Dhoni's thigh, he was looking to nudge and gets an inside edge onto the pads, rolled away behind square on the on-side
Brathwaite to Dhoni, wide, gentle start from Brathwaite, short and angling down the leg-side, Dhoni was looking to help it on its way and missed, called as a wide

S Kaul to du Plessis, no run, short of a good length and in that channel just outside off, du Plessis plays with a closed face and to the left of backward point, wants a single but is sensibly sent back
S Kaul to Dhoni, 1 run, another short ball from Kaul and this was just outside off, Dhoni was cramped on the pull and mistimes it behind square on the on-side
S Kaul to Dhoni, FOUR, lovely shot, too short from Kaul and he can't afford it at his pace, Dhoni swivels across, rolls his wrists and pulls it over square leg, no chance for the fielder at long leg

S Kaul to Dhoni, 2 runs, streaky, Dhoni is living on the edge here, comes down the track on the drive, doesn't get close to the ball and the inside edge went perilously past the leg-stump, back for the second run
S Kaul to Dhoni, no run, MS is taking his time to settle, on a good length and in that channel outside off, left alone

S Kaul to du Plessis, 1 run, good stop from Shakib at mid-wicket, saved three runs for his team. Too straight from Kaul and du Plessis whipped it to the left of mid-wicket. The ball is deflected towards the path of mid-on and the batsmen sneak in a run
Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, no run, another leave from Dhoni, short of a good length and holding its line outside off, left alone
Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, no run, Dhoni is walking all around the crease in an effect to nullify Bhuvneshwar, he keeps his wits and keeps it on a good length outside off, left alone
Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, no run, Bhuvneshwar shortens his length outside off and gets it to hold its line, left alone
Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, no run, short of a good length and just outside off, Dhoni presses across and pushes it towards the off-side
Bhuvneshwar to Dhoni, no run, short of a length and angling back into the right-hander, Dhoni was prodding across on the flick and gets an inside edge onto the thigh pad
Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, 1 run, on a good length and on the stumps, driven towards mid-on and du Plessis scampers across for a quick single
S Kaul to Dhoni, no run, Kaul keeps it full and on the stumps, Dhoni shuffles across and pushes it towards mid-on. Two wickets in the over and SRH would believe they have a fair chance now
S Kaul to Dhoni, no run, on  a good length and just outside off, Dhoni leans forward and pushes it towards mid-off

S Kaul to Rayudu, out Bowled!! Two in two for Kaul and SRH are back in business. Not sure what Rayudu could have done here, this is simply sensational from Siddarth, the slower ball yorker, moved away off the seam as well, opened up Rayudu completely as he played for the original angle. The ball curved in and then shaped away beautifully, Rayudu was through with the shot, the ball gently seamed past the closed bat face and crashed into the base of middle and off-stump. A duck for Rayudu and Siddarth is on a hat-trick. Rayudu b S Kaul 0(1)

S Kaul to Raina, out Bowled!! Oh dear! The fear of the short ball has consumed Raina once again, a nice little cameo, but nothing else. He pre-empted that Kaul would bowl a short ball and shuffled across his stumps, in the process, he left the leg-stump exposed. This wasn't a short ball, just a length delivery that was heading towards the leg-stump, once Raina clipped and missed, it was curtains for the left-hander. Raina b S Kaul 22(13) [4s-4]

S Kaul to Raina, FOUR, lovely, sublime timing from Raina, full toss outside off, he waits on it, uses the pace on the ball, plays with an open face and guides it behind square on the off-side, beats Manish and runs away to the fence

S Kaul to Raina, no run, good diving stop at backward point, think it was Manish, saved a run for his team. This was a yorker length delivery outside off, Raina was backing away and had to get his bat down as he jammed it behind square on the off-side
Bhuvneshwar to Raina, 1 run, short of a length and around the off-stump line, Raina presses across and pushes it in front of mid-on, calls his partner across for a quick single
Bhuvneshwar to Raina, wide, wrong line from Bhuvneshwar, kept going with the angle and slid down the leg-side, called as a wide
Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, 1 run, much better from Bhuvneshwar, tad fuller and wider of off, du Plessis wasn't committed on the drive as he stabbed forward, gets a thick edge towards third man

Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, no run, fraction too short from Bhuvneshwar, he's not giving the ball a chance to swing, du Plessis presses across, brings his bottom hand into play and turns it towards the on-side
Bhuvneshwar to du Plessis, no run, short of a length and just outside off, du Plessis prods across and tucks it towards the on-side
Bhuvneshwar to Raina, 1 run, back of a length and on the stumps, Raina hops across and nudges it down towards long leg for a single
Bhuvneshwar to Raina, 2 runs, Raina is off and away at the Wankhede, fraction short and on Raina's hips, he hops across and pulls it past square leg, comes back for the second run
Sandeep Sharma to Raina, 1 run, too straight from Sandeep, ends up drifting onto Raina's pads, whipped away behind square on the on-side for a single
Sandeep Sharma to Raina, no run, tad fuller and on the stumps, Raina works it towards mid-wicket
Sandeep Sharma to Raina, no run, much better from Sandeep, shortens his length and gets it to angle across the left-hander, left alone

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, cracking shot, this is the best of the lot, full and just outside off, Raina leans forward, presents the full face of the bat and drives it back past the non-striker, no need to run for those

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, lovely shot, too full and too wide from Sandeep, he hasn't found the right line and length so far. Raina leans into the drive, didn't get close to the ball, as a result it was in the air for a long time, but he found the gap to the left of cover and it scooted away

Sandeep Sharma to Raina, FOUR, too short and too wide from Sandeep, that's a loosener and that's been put away with ease. Had to reach out - Raina, but he got on top of the bounce and found the gap past cover-point

Bhuvneshwar to Raina, 1 run, wrong line from Bhuvneshwar, length ball on Raina's pads and he clips it away towards long leg. Just one run and a wicket from the first over, superb start from Bhuvneshwar

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, out Caught by Goswami!! Edged and caught! The perfect start from Bhuvneshwar, an absolute peach and he has gobbled Watson up. Fraction short in length and a hint of shape away from outside off, made Watson feel for the ball, found the tiniest of bat and Goswami does the rest. Defending 140, they needed early wickets and Bhuvneshwar has just got them one. Watson c Goswami b Bhuvneshwar 0(5)
Bhuvneshwar to Watson, no run, back of a length and on the stumps, Watson gets behind the line and punches it back at the bowler
Bhuvneshwar to Watson, no run, Bhuvneshwar shortens his length outside off, Watson stands tall and defends it with soft hands

Bhuvneshwar to Watson, no run, 'great skill from Bhuvi, says Smith on air'. This was the inswinger and Watson didn't have a clue at that, brought his bat down late and squeezes an inside edge onto the thigh pad
Bhuvneshwar to Watson, no run, a beauty to start with, on a good length and a hint of shape away from the right-hander, drew Watson forward into the defensive push and beat him on the outside edge

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, out Bhuvneshwar Run Out!! Bhuvneshwar is run-out trying to steal a bye. MS does not miss out on the opportunity. Bouncer on middle and leg, Brathwaite shuffled across, got inside the line and failed to connect with the pull shot, Bhuvneshwar called for the run and he was caught well short. Dhoni hitting the sticks with an under-arm throw. Excellent finish to the SRH innings though, 20 runs off the final over. Bhuvneshwar run out (Dhoni) 7(11)

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, SIX, Brathwaite is walking off thinking it is the end of the over. But someone tells him there's a ball to go. He was off there thinking the job is done. Short and outside off, Brathwaite stands tall and flat-bats it straight over Thakur
SN Thakur to Brathwaite, wide, sprays the back of a length delivery down leg, Brathwaite can't connect with the glance. Never mind he has a wide

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, FOUR, wow! What power! This was close to yorker length, but Brathwaite used the depth of the crease nicely, went deep to get underneath it and hammered it over extra cover. There was a fielder in the deep but he had no chance

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, SIX, small margins for errors. Thakur missed his yorker and bowled a friendly full toss, Brathwaite was waiting for it with a cleared front leg, nice clean swing of the bat and off she goes sailing over the long-on fence
SN Thakur to Brathwaite, 2 runs, walks across his stumps and takes it on the full, cue-ends the scoop towards deep mid-wicket and they take on Jadeja on the second run, completed it easily in the end
SN Thakur to Brathwaite, wide, this time misses the wide yorker and sprays it outside off, Brathwaite swings and misses. But it was well away from the tramline
SN Thakur to Brathwaite, no run, yorker outside off, Brathwaite squeezes the drive to mid-off and denies the single

Lungi Ngidi to Brathwaite, 1 run, just a single to cap off the 19th over. Short of length and outside off, Brathwaite runs it down to third man and retains strike. Top spell from the South African, 4-0-20-1
Lungi Ngidi to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, on a length outside off, clears his front leg and slices the loft on the bounce to sweeper cover. Rayudu thought about going for the catch, but thought otherwise

Lungi Ngidi to Bhuvneshwar, no run, swing and a miss. Back of a length and just outside off, Bhuvneshwar swings off his feet and only connects with thin air. The pace and bounce that Ngidi extracts making life difficult
Lungi Ngidi to Brathwaite, 1 run, back of a length close to off, Brathwaite steers it to third man

Lungi Ngidi to Brathwaite, no run, once again misses on the paddle. Brathwaite needs to play to his strengths. Walks across his sticks to play the scoop and fails to connect, the back of a length delivery flies over the stumps. He is disappointed and remains on his knee for some time

Lungi Ngidi to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, slower short of length outside off, Bhuvneshwar wanted to carve it over the off-side but ends up dragging it off the cue-end to long-on. Brathwaite is back on strike

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, 2 runs, MS misses another one of his deflections onto the stumps. Brathwaite slices the full delivery off the toe-end towards deep extra cover, Bhajji fires a flat throw to the striker's end and Dhoni tries to parry it on the stumps, misses and Brathwaite is safe
SN Thakur to Brathwaite, wide, Thakur sprays it well outside off and Brathwaite lets it go to pocket a wide

SN Thakur to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, good length ball and Bhuvi has missed out, winds up for the big hit and slices it uppishly to mid-off, on the bounce to the fielder. That was another delivery right in the swinging zone
SN Thakur to Brathwaite, 1 run, very full and close to yorker range, squeezed out to extra cover and Brathwaite had to hurry

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, no run, needless. That is a very poor shot selection. Why go for the cheeky scoop when you have all the power? Brathwaite sat down and missed the full delivery by quite some distance

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, SIX, back to back sixes. Thakur overcorrects by dragging the length back, but Brathwaite was up for it. In fact, he might have been waiting for it, stands tall and murders the pull over deep mid-wicket

SN Thakur to Brathwaite, SIX, first six of the innings, taken SRH 17 overs to smack one out of the park. Brathwaite gets the perfect length delivery, right in his arc to swing it over the deep mid-wicket fence. Went a long way back

Dwayne Bravo to Brathwaite, 1 run, slow yorker and Brathwaite digs it into the on-side, for a single. Bravo for once has bowled out before the 20th over and it is another top spell from the West Indian all-rounder, 4-0-25-2

Dwayne Bravo to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, excellent bit of work from Jaddu. Short delivery at normal pace and Bhuvneshwar rolls his wrists on the pull, places it in front of square and any thoughts about the second are changed because of Jaddu. Runs across, gets to the ball quickly and releases it quicker

Dwayne Bravo to Bhuvneshwar, no run, the teasing off-cutter from Bravo, Bhuvi thought it was in the slot and went for the big loft down the ground, but he was tad early and the ball lobbed past his swinging blade
Dwayne Bravo to Bhuvneshwar, no run, low full toss and Bhuvi jams it back to Bravo
Dwayne Bravo to Brathwaite, 1 run, short and outside off, Brathwaite cuts it on the bounce to Bhajji at backward point, quick single stolen
Dwayne Bravo to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, slow dipping full delivery and Bhuvi clips it to deep square leg

Dwayne Bravo to Bhuvneshwar, wide, Bravo went up for another strangle down leg, but MS wasn't interested. Back of a length down leg, Bhuvneshwar hops and misses the glance, right call from umpire Shamsuddin
Dwayne Bravo to Bhuvneshwar, wide, sprays it down leg and Bhuvi has no chance to connect with the flick, wide called
Lungi Ngidi to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, tap and run, dropped it between point and cover and set off, singles won't hurt CSK
Lungi Ngidi to Brathwaite, 1 run, back of a length and Brathwaite runs it down to third man

Lungi Ngidi to Brathwaite, no run, wow! Nice carry through to Dhoni. The ball thudded into the gloves. Back of a length and zips off the surface, Brathwaite goes feeling for the ball and is beaten on the outside edge
Lungi Ngidi to Bhuvneshwar, 1 run, this time just outside off and Bhuvi glides it off the bat face to third man
Lungi Ngidi to Bhuvneshwar, no run, no space to free the arms and Bhuvneshwar has to be content with a block back
Lungi Ngidi to Brathwaite, 1 run, back of a length around off, Brathwaite steers it down to third man

Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, out Caught&Bowled!! You go boy! That is a stunner and deserves the dance moves. Bravo starts his trademark Run The World jig as soon as he completes the catch. Full delivery and Pathan's eyes lit up on seeing it, went full throttle on the drive and didn't even bother to keep it down the ground, struck it hard and low towards Bravo, who had very little time to react, but he did. Went down with both hands but the force was such that it got stuck in the right hand. Another crucial breakthrough for CSK as they get rid of a set batsman. Y Pathan c and b Dwayne Bravo 24(29) [4s-3]

Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, FOUR, Pathan has slowly started to up the ante. Slower short of length delivery and it sat up nicely for Pathan, who forehands the slap in front of square and gives sweeper cover no chance
Dwayne Bravo to Brathwaite, 1 run, yorker close to off, Brathwaite squeezes it past the point fielder

Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, 1 run, once again slight hesitation between the duo. Pathan tucks the back of a length delivery in front of deep mid-wicket and wanted the second, but aborted as he saw Jaddu charging towards the ball
Dwayne Bravo to Brathwaite, 1 run, slower delivery on the pads, clipped backward of square leg
Dwayne Bravo to Brathwaite, wide, splays it down leg, Brathwaite shuffles and gets inside the line, but fails to connect with the glance
Dwayne Bravo to Brathwaite, no run, missed out on a leg-stump length delivery, off the pad to short fine leg and Brathwaite is sent back. These two need to get their calling right

Jadeja to Y Pathan, FOUR, excellent placement from Pathan. Waited for the quicker delivery and then back cut it past a diving backward point. Once it beat Bhajji there was no stopping that. Superb spell from Jadeja, who has come into his own as the tournament has progressed, ends with 4-0-13-1
Jadeja to Y Pathan, no run, quicker and around off, Pathan pushes it towards cover, where Raina runs across and saves the single
Jadeja to Y Pathan, no run, drifts in and Pathan misses the nudge, struck on the under part of the thigh pad
Jadeja to Y Pathan, no run, pushed firmly to cover
Jadeja to Brathwaite, 1 run, worked with soft hands into the vacant mid-wicket pocket, just a single
Jadeja to Brathwaite, no run, moves across and sweeps the darter from the stumps to short fine leg. He was a goner had he missed

SN Thakur to Y Pathan, FOUR, boundary after ages. Much needed one for SRH. They need to get a move on here. Full and sliding on the pads, Pathan gets enough on the flick to clear Watto at mid-wicket. No chance for the fielder in the deep to cut it off
SN Thakur to Y Pathan, no run, bouncer and Pathan has nothing to do with it, umpire Marais Erasmus from square leg signals one for the over
SN Thakur to Y Pathan, no run, fuller and outside off, Pathan knocks it to cover
SN Thakur to Brathwaite, 1 run, steps out to meet the back of a length delivery and tucks it wide of mid-wicket
SN Thakur to Brathwaite, no run, short of length close to off, defended to backward point
SN Thakur to Y Pathan, 1 run, back of a length around off, Pathan opens the bat face and runs it past the diving backward point fielder, third man tidies up
Jadeja to Brathwaite, no run, slower and a shade short in length, Brathwaite knocks it back to Jadeja

Jadeja to Brathwaite, no run, run-out chance missed. Brathwaite taps the flatter delivery into the on-side and sets off, Pathan is not interested and the big bloke has to turn and run back, Dhoni runs forward, picks the ball and has a shy, misses and Brathwaite survives
Jadeja to Brathwaite, no run, quicker and on the stumps, blocked back

Jadeja to Manish Pandey, out Caught&Bowled!! Easy peasy! SRH lose another. Pandey's woeful season continues. Nothing but a dart on middle and leg, might have slightly gripped the surface, Pandey wanted to work it into the on-side and closed the bat face, the leading edge lobs up to the right of Jadeja, who moves across and ahead of Pathan to gobble that up. Manish Pandey c and b Jadeja 8(16)
Jadeja to Y Pathan, 1 run, drifting in and Pathan uses the angle to nurdle a single backward of square leg
Jadeja to Manish Pandey, 1 run, darted in on off, Pandey eases the drive to long-off

Chahar to Y Pathan, no run, knuckle ball to end the over and Pathan is early into his leg-side swat, off the toe-end and back to Chahar. He is done for the innings, 4-0-31-1 - set it up nicely for his team
Chahar to Y Pathan, wide, this time the slower bouncer is well over the head and Chahar is called for it. Not happy with the decision but will have to rebowl
Chahar to Y Pathan, no run, banged in and the bouncer floats across Pathan, who holds his position and watches the ball pass him
Chahar to Y Pathan, no run, yorker right in the blockhole and all Pathan could do was jam it back to Chahar
Chahar to Y Pathan, wide, knuckle ball down leg and luckily an SRH batsman doesn't get something on it, misses everything and goes on the bounce to Dhoni
Chahar to Y Pathan, no run, back of a length and Pathan directs it with an open bat face to backward point
Chahar to Manish Pandey, 1 run, shortens the length and offers no space, a tap down to long-on

Chahar to Manish Pandey, no run, missed out there. Nice juicy full toss on the pads, Pandey flicks it straight to short mid-wicket. Found Watto to perfection there. SRH need such deliveries to go to the boundary
Jadeja to Y Pathan, no run, flatter and quicker outside off, Pathan cuts but can't find the gap on the off-side
Jadeja to Manish Pandey, 1 run, short on off, Pandey pulls in the air and towards deep square who collects it on the bounce
Jadeja to Y Pathan, 1 run, sits on the backfoot and works the armball into the leg-side
Jadeja to Y Pathan, no run, slider on middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
Jadeja to Manish Pandey, 1 run, tucked round the corner
Jadeja to Manish Pandey, no run, jumps down the pitch, opens the bat face and dabs to backward point, did well to get some bat despite being beaten in the flight
Dwayne Bravo to Manish Pandey, 1 run, full and dipping at 131ks outside off, Pandey squirts it towards deep point off the bottom half of the blade
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, 1 run, pitched fuller and straighter, Pathan slams the drive to the left of mid-off, buys an easy single
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, 2 runs, nicely punched off the back foot, the length enabled a smooth footwork for Pathan there, sweeper mops it up to his left
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, 2 runs, jumps across and drops the ball in the mid-wicket pocket to squeeze a couple of crucial runs
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, no run, another lifter, just outside Pathan's off stump, he waits and watches it sail past him
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, wide, and it would have flown straight to legslip had Pathan made any contact. On a length and swerving down leg, Pathan's late on the flick-pull and missed
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, no run, bouncer first up, Pathan ducks under it
Jadeja to Manish Pandey, no run, straighter one, forward and blocked back to the bowler
Jadeja to Manish Pandey, no run, plonks forward and runs the ball off the inside edge towards short fine
Jadeja to Y Pathan, 1 run, on the front foot, as the ball angles in he nudges it close to his pad into the leg-side. A smart single that
Jadeja to Manish Pandey, 1 run, a big stride forward and drives the ball through the line down to long-off
Jadeja to Y Pathan, 1 run, angling in once again, Pathan prods forward and pushes to the left of mid-on where Rayudu fumbles to enable a single
Jadeja to Y Pathan, no run, 92ks, fired in with the arm, Pathan drives to mid-off
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, 1 run, stands tall and punches the ball off the splice towards  backward point, off the mark with a single
Dwayne Bravo to Y Pathan, no run, dug in short and way outside off, Pathan plays a belated ramp and misses

Dwayne Bravo to Shakib, out Caught by Dhoni!! Strangle down leg episode 2!! CSK are literally strangling SRH here. Another SRH batsman gets out to a poor delivery. It was slow, down leg and asking to be whacked, Shakib swivels and tries to oblige, ends up dragging it off his glove which makes a tiny tickle off his thigh pad before nestling into Dhoni's mitts. CSK are on fire.... Shakib c Dhoni b Dwayne Bravo 12(10) [4s-2]
Dwayne Bravo to Shakib, 2 runs, sloppy work from Ngidi at fine leg. Slips and concedes an extra run. All that after Shakib flicked one off his pads

Prasidh to Gowtham, FOUR, mark the calendar! KKR vs SRH - 25th May! KKR win this by 25 runs as they did the choking act much better than RR in the death overs. RR's dream run has been stalled. The last ball was short, the pull was not controlled but went fine on the on-side for a four. Did not matter
Prasidh to Klaasen, 1 run, right up there. This man has been metronomical with his deliveries at the end. Dragged away to long-on
Prasidh to Gowtham, 1 run, slower ball outside off and what a find this man has been! The batsman outer-edges the ball away towards the short third man region for a single
Prasidh to Gowtham, no run, that was not signalled a wide! The batsman went across his sticks and the bowler spilled it down leg. Did not miss the sticks by much but that should have been wided
Prasidh to Gowtham, 2 runs, slices the ball away. A couple of drops and the man at deep cover hauls it back. 32 off the last 4 balls
Prasidh to Gowtham, no run, now mathematics will also find it difficult to win it for RR. Length and wide outside off, the batsman goes for a big whirlwind hit and misses it

A Russell to Klaasen, no run, 34 it would be off the last over! Russell held his nerves and read the mind of the batsman, who expected a fuller length but out came the bumper. Klaasen was not too pleased as he felt that was a wide. Not to be
A Russell to Klaasen, 2 runs, low dipping full toss and the batsman hacks the ball away to deep mid for a couple
A Russell to Gowtham, 1 run, inside edges the length ball away into the on-side. Anotehr single only
A Russell to Klaasen, 1 run, clears his front leg and biffs the ball away to long-off. 37 off 9 looks herculean. KKR fans are almost sure of the win now
A Russell to Gowtham, 1 run, squirts the uppish ball away towards deep third man. A couple of bounces and Narine does the rest. Another harmless single
A Russell to Klaasen, 1 run, inside edges the ball to square leg as he tried to slog the length ball away. Only a single. KKR fans have found their voices

Prasidh to Binny, out Caught by Chris Lynn!! Slower dipping full toss and the slog sweep, sans any power, finds the man at square leg. Huge wicket or a blessing in disguise for KKR? Tough to say. It would bring in Gowtham. Three dot balls from him will hurt RR. But my word, this boy is special. Nailed the blockhole stuff and slower balls to perfection. Binny c Chris Lynn b Prasidh 0(3)

Prasidh to Binny, no run, why Binny why? That was short, he goes for a pull without even looking at it. A shot, more in hope, brings no result for RR. This over has gone for only 3 runs so far. Why was it not Gowtham ahead of Binny?
Prasidh to Binny, no run, right up there in the blockhole outside off and the batsman fails to squeeze the ball away. Dot ball
Prasidh to Klaasen, 1 run, Krishna has been terrific! Bowls it in the blockhole and the best that the batsman could do is toe-end the ball away to mid-off

Prasidh to Klaasen, 2 runs, cramps the batsman with the shortish and skiddy ball. Drags the ball away into the on-side for a couple. Overthrows it could have been but Binny was backing up too far as the man at deep cover did the mopping up job
Prasidh to Klaasen, no run, slower ball wide outside off. Very close to the tramline. That should have been a wide. The batsman went for the whirlwind hit and missed it
Chawla to Klaasen, 1 run, waits on the back foot and tucks the ball down to long-on for a single

Chawla to Samson, out Caught by Searles!! Gone. Taken at long-on. That was dragged short, quicker as well. The batsman went for the pull but there was no distance on it. A lot of elevation though and was taken in the deep. Huge strike again from KKR. They keep dragging this back. The batsman got a bit carried away with the length I guess but the half-trackers have done the job in this edition of the IPL. Samson c Searles b Chawla 50(38) [4s-4 6s-2]
Chawla to Klaasen, 1 run, backs away and slices the ball uppishly towards the point region for a single
Chawla to Samson, 1 run, uppish tuck, awkwardly done but fifty it is from the young man. In the night of the eliminator, he has come good. Gutsy knock from him

Chawla to Samson, FOUR, low full toss, trying for a yorker but gets it wrong. That was 120kph! The batsman though stays calm, maintains his shape and open-faces the ball over cover for a four. The deep cover was too straight. Three men were around the point region
Chawla to Klaasen, 1 run, wide of the crease, at the sticks and has been clipped away into the on-side to deep mid for a single

Narine to Klaasen, 1 run, backs away, allows the ball turn in and slaps the ball down to long-off for a single. 51 needed off the last four overs. Recent IPL trends have shown that is chaseable. The RR for RR is close to 13 now
Narine to Klaasen, FOUR, the reverse sweep! Played with disdain as he lofted it high over short third man for a four. He did it against the Indian spinners in South Africa. Rang a bell?
Narine to Samson, 1 run, the carrom ball outside off and has been nurdled away into the on-side, just behind square for a single. 56 now..
Narine to Samson, no run, picked the turn, that was the offie but did it late. The ball hit the pads as that was going down leg. Dot ball
Narine to Klaasen, 1 run, flattish at the sticks and worked away into the on-side, with the turn
Narine to Samson, 1 run, dragged short and almost a wicket of the half-tracker as the ball lands just short of the man at deep mid. The batsman pulled it away but did not time it
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, 1 run, too full, driven down to long-off with the full face of the bat. 2 runs and an important wicket. Kuldeep can never it wrong at the Eden!
Kuldeep Yadav to Klaasen, 1 run, waits for the ball to complete its revs and tucks the googly away into the on-side to open his account
Kuldeep Yadav to Klaasen, no run, pushes the ball out to cover as that was a quicker one

Kuldeep Yadav to Klaasen, no run, huge appeal! That was missing off. The googly confuses him and he was hit on the back leg. The height was an issue and the impact as well. The vociferous appeal was turned down
Kuldeep Yadav to Klaasen, no run, the googly again and the batsman is beaten outside off as he tried to push at it. Did not drag his back foot outside his crease

Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, out Caught&Bowled!! The time-out has struck. That was a flighted ball, the batsman skews the sweep back and the bowler does the rest. Caught and bowled is trending. The googly dipped, spun a little and the lack of pace from the wicket also helped. Huge strike for KKR. They are back in this. Rahane c and b Kuldeep Yadav 46(41) [4s-4 6s-1]
Narine to Samson, no run, almost a wicket! The leading edge land short of the man at cover, who was at the edge of the circle. The flattish ball outside off forced the mistake

Narine to Samson, SIX, that is a jail-break from Samson! Retaliation from the batter as he camped back to smoke a sixer over deep mid. That was gargantuan from the young man and 61 is needed now. RR, more importantly Samson, needed that

Narine to Samson, no run, this is amazing. The slower offie and turns in big. The batsman looks to slog and misses as the lack of pace did him in. Gets hit high on his front leg. The spin magician has the batsman at his mercy
Narine to Samson, no run, picked up the carrom ball a little too late and pushes the ball back to the left of the bowler
Narine to Samson, no run, inside edges the ball on to the pads as he looked to close the face of the bat on the clip
Narine to Samson, no run, flattish on a length and has been pushed back

A Russell to Rahane, 2 runs, another two and RR are playing the 'who blinks first' game to perfection here. That was on the sticks and the batsman knocks the ball away into the on-side. Before the man at long-on could get there, they had hoodwinked a couple
A Russell to Rahane, no run, short ball, closer to the body and the batsman plays the shot a bit too early. Misses it as he jumped on the gauntlet a bit too early

A Russell to Samson, 1 run, leading edge but no one at short cover ensures an easy passage for a single. Bumped in the shortish ball and the batsman trying  to close the face of the bat, got it off the leading edge
A Russell to Rahane, 1 run, slower delivery on the sticks and waits on it, to tuck the ball away into the on-side for a single

A Russell to Rahane, 2 runs, stands up tall and tucks the ball away into the on-side. He immediately called 'two' and makes it in the end. Superb bit of batting. They have been diligent in their shot selection
A Russell to Samson, 1 run, the partnership between Samson and Rahane is now 50. Uppish tuck to an in-ducker and has been fielded at deep mid. A single

Chawla to Samson, 1 run, goes back to a flatter googly which landed much fuller than what the batsman expected. The slash attempted manages an under edge into the off-side for a single. 74 needed off 48. Pressure on KKR for a wicket?
Chawla to Samson, no run, too full, quickish as well and has been jammed back to the bowler

Chawla to Samson, 2 runs, wristy tuck off the inner half of the bat and they get a couple this time. The man at deep mid had to do too much. There could have been a third but not to be as there was no one backing up. In the end, the man at deep cover had to haul it back
Chawla to Rahane, 1 run, too full, almost yorking the batsman as he clipped the ball away. Rahane called 'two' as he hit it but settles down for a single
Chawla to Samson, 1 run, floated wide outside off and has been driven away off the toe-end of the bat to long-off
Chawla to Rahane, 1 run, goes wide of the crease and lands it in line with the sticks. The batsman on-drives the ball away to long-on
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, no run, was it the quicker one? The ball skids on and the batsman played it off the back foot as he again picked it late. Pushed back off the cue-end of the bat to the bowler
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, 1 run, too full, jammed down the ground to long-off
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, no run, another googly and the batsman aborts his clip to push the ball away on the off-side as he picked the turn on the ball, a little late
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, no run, the ball turns away, the googly! The batsman looks to poke at it and misses
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, 1 run, Samson is living dangerously here. Looks for a paddle scoop and gets it just over the keeper's head. Single
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, 1 run, slog swept along the carpet to deep mid for a single. Failed to pierce the gap as he fetched it from the sticks. Another tossed up delivery it was from Kuldeep
Searles to Rahane, 1 run, gets into an arch back, guiding it out to short third. And some running confusion. Poor throws don't quite help
Searles to Samson, 1 run, slower cutter. Samson mistimes his cut, under-halving it through to cover
Searles to Samson, FOUR, more width. Samson's as good as most with flat-bats. This time he's carving them behind point. Absolute crunch
Searles to Samson, no run, tries going on the up again with a drive. High elbows, timing, but spits up off the sticker towards point
Searles to Samson, SIX, 122.9kph of a filthy nothing. Samson stays up tall, swinging horizontally. Picks up the empty mid-wicket and a 68-meter hit will do
Searles to Rahane, 1 run, whacked away, flat-batted through to sweeper
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, FOUR, rubs in some more elegance. Clears his back leg, reads the flight, reads the googly and inside-outs it over extra cover. Oh Kolkata need the breather .. time-out
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, 1 run, drifty toss up again, drawing Rahane forward outside off as he strokes it to long-off
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, no run, pitched up. Rahane's closer to it, digging it to leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, no run, googly. Rahane stays flat-footed, sticking his bat out, searching for the spin. Nah, beaten
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, 1 run, tickled away off the legs, square leg
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, FOUR, juicy half tracker. Samson waits, waits some more. And some more. Loads up a pull, with all the muscle to swat it away through mid-wicket

Narine to Rahane, FOUR, no Rahane ain't cheeky enough for these late cuts. Just can't line himself up right, just about fetches it out of DK's gloves as he outside-edges it past the cordon. Ah, never mind
Narine to Samson, 1 run, 94kph, another whip. This time there's some normalcy, into mid-wicket the way Narine would've intended, for singles
Narine to Samson, 2 runs, lovely soft hands, back to dragging it from outside off into cow corner
Narine to Samson, no run, 84.2kph. Ripper off-break. Starts outside off, Samson looks to deal off the back foot again. And despite the style, he's late. Pads
Narine to Samson, 2 runs, oh the style. Stays put on his back foot, whipping it down to long-on
Narine to Rahane, 1 run, spinning, sticking into the surface as it does so. Rahane lines up to cut, ending up with a steery-punch square
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, no run, reads the wrong 'un, getting to the pitch of it to pat it to cover-point
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, 2 runs, goes flat, down leg too. And Samson's quick to get inside the line and lap it down fine. Big gap down there
Kuldeep Yadav to Samson, no run, chips out a leading-edge in trying to run it to mid-on. Point eventually
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, 1 run, overcooked outside off. Drilled back down the pitch

Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, no run, misses the flick, plays down the wrong line hoping for bigger turn. And is stuck somewhere in front of off, but with Yadav's angle starting from over the wicket, it better be sharp to make an appeal out of it. Kolkata try, in vain
Kuldeep Yadav to Rahane, no run, a slider to start. Teasing him wide outside off and Rahane hides his bat, stalking it with his pad
Chawla to Samson, no run, throws up some air on middle. Samson wants a block. Ignore this over, Rajasthan have aced the powerplay
Chawla to Rahane, 1 run, fuller. Neat push, keeping long-on busy
Chawla to Samson, 1 run, big spin into the thighs. Behind square it is
Chawla to Rahane, 1 run, googly again, from wide of the crease. Another back foot work down the ground
Chawla to Samson, 1 run, 96.5kph. Back foot wrist, straight down

Chawla to R Tripathi, out Caught&Bowled!! Oh Chawla. Ignore that stout frame, he has a habit of plucking one-handed stunners - surely when he's the bowler. Tripathi couldn't have defended it with harder hands, he gets all traditional in a front foot block. And the ball instead of dying down, ends up being the wrong 'un, takes the splice and pops up to Chawla's right, who's palm stuck out is enough. R Tripathi c and b Chawla 20(13) [4s-1 6s-2]
Narine to R Tripathi, 1 run, uses the angle drifting down leg to help it to 45

Narine to R Tripathi, no run, massive inside edge. But DK's desperation in the carnage forces him to go upstairs. So Tripathi's pinned on the back foot. And yes .. it's a big chunk of the wood onto his pad
Narine to R Tripathi, SIX, it can get longer. Tripathi makes his 'V' bigger, clears his leg, sits as usual. And it's for cow corner's crowds to try and grab that lakh
Narine to R Tripathi, SIX, there's long-on. But why bother when you can time it like this. Narine tosses his carrom ball full, Tripathi's down on a knee already. And smoking it .. 20 rows back
Narine to R Tripathi, no run, skidding into the thighs as Tripathi wants to flick it from deep in the crease. Misses
Narine to Rahane, 1 run, 92.9kph, leg-lined again, nudged away carefully behind square
Narine to Rahane, wide, offie. Pitching on leg, going well down
Prasidh to R Tripathi, no run, slows it up outside off. Tripathi's foxed in for the lack of pace, tries slicing it away. And he'll find air
Prasidh to Rahane, 1 run, 142.2kph. A miscued push, and that lack of timing works in his favour to take on mid-off
Prasidh to R Tripathi, 1 run, on a back of a length. A cramped Tripathi jabs it in front of cover
Prasidh to Rahane, 1 run, presses forward, head on ball in wristing it in front of square

Prasidh to Rahane, FOUR, typical overcompensate. After a drifter into the pads, Krishna goes into a bouncer, wide outside off. Rahane has his timing tonight, and enough on it to jump-cut it square. The powerplay's enough to do its bit

Prasidh to Rahane, FOUR, 134.1kph. Sitting up in the slot, nicely getting onto the hips at a good height for Rahane to latch. Does it with a swiping glance, getting airborne and pinching the mid-wicket gap
Chawla to R Tripathi, no run, can't quite back away in a cheeky sort of a guide behind point. The turn gets big, so does the bounce and graps the upper half on his attempt
Chawla to Rahane, 1 run, pads again. This time he gets his bat down, clipping it behind square

Chawla to Rahane, no run, quick skidder. Rahane's done in, struck on his pad. And the umpire gives into Chawla's celebratory LBW appeal. Tripathi doesn't allow him to leave, forces him to review. So Rahane's well deep in the crease, doesn't read the googly, is beaten on pace as well. But he's struck on the front pad. And yes .. the angle is enough to take it down leg.
Chawla to Rahane, no run, 96.6kph, googly, short and wide enough to let Rahane read it on his back foot. Tapped towards cover
Chawla to R Tripathi, 1 run, and typically into the pads. Turned away, round the corner

Chawla to R Tripathi, FOUR, rare float up. So unlike Chawla .. wide, asking for treatment. And obliged. Tripathi reaches out to the pitch, clearing his back leg and then full flowing hands as he drills it through the covers
Prasidh to Rahane, no run, 144.3kph, and keeps it on the stumps denying room. Rahane just can't force matters in trying to go leg-sided. He'll settle for the mistime
Prasidh to Rahane, no run, corrects his line getting it just outside off. Politely poked to point
Prasidh to Rahane, FOUR, feeds the pads. Rahane gets on his toes, shuffling inside the line and whippy hands in flicking it in front of square. The class .. sheer tons of it

Prasidh to R Tripathi, 1 run, backs away, but Krishna's not leaving him alone. Follows him as Tripathi does his best to keep it out. And his soft grip ensures the bat pops out as he steals the drop just past the pitch
Prasidh to Rahane, 1 run, thick outside half, in a flashy carve down to third man
Prasidh to Rahane, no run, 140.4kph. Half a shuffle across as he checks a defence down the pitch
A Russell to R Tripathi, no run, 138.2kph, gets it to seam back into Tripathi's tummy. Who's happy to bunt it down
A Russell to Rahane, 1 run, on his toes to close his bat face and flick it into a vacant mid-wicket
A Russell to Rahane, SIX, ah Jinks. Gets a wide-short combo, Rahane rocks back, sways, but the hands are quick to pounce on. Cuts, airy and that Centurion-2003 moment as it flies into deep point
A Russell to Rahane, no run, 138.4kph, nipping in on middle. Softly nudged to leg
A Russell to Rahane, no run, tumbles in his followthrough, but the line's tight outside off. Rahane just doesn't get the room he wants to cut, under-edging it back to the keeper
A Russell to Rahane, 2 runs, damn. Streaky start. A full length, drifting well down leg and Rahane's early in his clip. The result - a leading edge, fat, wide of extra cover's reach
Laughlin to A Russell, 1 run, gets the yorker right. Russell can just dig it into the off-side. 12 off the final over
Laughlin to A Russell, FOUR, wow! Bludgeoned away. Russell gets deep in his crease, Laughlin fails to nail the yorker. And Russell caresses it through extra cover

Laughlin to Searles, out Caught by Jofra Archer!! Laughlin hoodwinking the batsmen with his canny slower balls. This was on a length around off, Searles swung it hard, lost his shape and skied it as far as long-off. Two fielders were converging and Archer completes the catch in the end running forward. A dot ball but Russell gets back on strike. Blessing in disguise? Eh? Searles c Jofra Archer b Laughlin 2(5)
Laughlin to A Russell, 1 run, hammered away along the ground to deep mid-wicket
Laughlin to A Russell, no run, tailing in, a low full toss. Russell hacks and gets an inside edge onto his pad. Rolls towards the keeper

Laughlin to A Russell, FOUR, misses the length and Russell makes him pay. Clears his front leg, unleashes his bottom hand and whacks it across the line, the practice pitches help his cause. Trickles away wide of long-on
Laughlin to A Russell, wide, corrects the line, still gets punished. A marginal call. Back of a length just outside off, stalking the tramlines and the umpire calls it a wide. Kind of harsh there
Laughlin to A Russell, wide, the intent was good but the execution was bad. Follows Russell, who backed away and splayed it further down leg
Jofra Archer to A Russell, 1 run, thrashed hard, can't find the gap. Directs it to sweeper cover

Jofra Archer to A Russell, SIX, phew! That bat-speed and the muscle power from Russell. Didn't get it off the middle but it hardly matters to him. The back of the hand slower ball, rising up and Russell forehand swats it over long-off. Sends it a long way over long-off. Came off the bottom, still dispatched it for a maximum. How?
Jofra Archer to A Russell, no run, this is turning out to be an outstanding over from Archer. Full, in the blockhole and Russell can't do much. Jammed back to the bowler
Jofra Archer to Searles, 1 run, short and at the body, pulled away to deep mid-wicket

Jofra Archer to Searles, no run, superb stuff from Archer. Is aware he has to keep Russel off strike. Wafts a full ball outside off, Searles moves across his sticks with a lowered stance and slogs. It dips and slides under his willow
Jofra Archer to Searles, no run, swing and a miss from Searles. Should just hand the strike to Russel. Off-pace delivery, planted out of Searles's reach. A blind slog and comes up with zilch

Laughlin to A Russell, SIX, woah. Change up from Laughlin, ushers in the pacy bouncer at Russell's torso. Took the gamble but didn't come off well. Russell pulls it over his head and dismisses it over fine leg. All the way!
Laughlin to A Russell, no run, a rare dot ball. 134kph, length ball following Russell, who was moving away to leg to carve it through point. Is cramped for room and fails to connect
Laughlin to Searles, 1 run, razor-sharp yorker from Laughlin, gunning on off. Searles squeezes it to mid-wicket
Laughlin to A Russell, 1 run, this back of a length delivery skids off the deck and Russell tried the Flamingo pull, misses and wears it on the thigh pad

Laughlin to A Russell, SIX, incredible! How do you bowl to this guy? Laughlin digs in the slower short ball, Russell stayed back but had to generate some power to clear the deep mid-wicket fielder. Gets more than enough to power it into the crowd

Laughlin to Karthik, out Caught by Rahane!! Eden Gardens is shellshocked. Reason - Karthik perishes. Laughlin strikes gold and is pumped. The top-of-the-hand slower ball, on a fuller length. Karthik was shaping up for a biff across the line, loses his shape and loses his timing as well. Slicing it up in the air towards extra cover. Rahane keeps his eyes on the ball, back-pedals and holds on. Karthik c Rahane b Laughlin 52(38) [4s-4 6s-2]
Unadkat to Karthik, 1 run, fuller and attacking the stumps from round the wicket, clipped gracefully to deep mid-wicket
Unadkat to A Russell, 1 run, shortish length outside off, Russell goes hard and chops it to cover
Unadkat to A Russell, FOUR, Unadkat is not learning. Just shortens his length and keeps it outside off, Russell reaches out and slaps it through extra cover. Rocketed away to the fence

Unadkat to A Russell, SIX, Unadkat's nightmarish day continues. Cutter to Russell? Too full and Russell feasts on it. Sets up a low stance and hacks it violently through mid-wicket. Flat and the deep mid-wicket fielder was lining up, but it cleared Samson in the end. Hits his fingertips and parries over. Brutal
Unadkat to Karthik, 1 run, sledge-hammered through cover

Unadkat to Karthik, SIX, top-edge but it's that sort of an edge that batsman loves. Unorthodoxy by Karthik, moves across to hoick it across the line with a horizontal bat. A fat top-edge is found and it's going only one way. Over the keeper's head and off she goes for half-a-dozen. Fifty up for the skipper, much vital this for the team. Raises his bat and the dug-out in all applauses
Ish Sodhi to A Russell, no run, flattish outside off, Russell goes deep and cuts, finds point

Ish Sodhi to A Russell, no run, 79kph, googly. Russell saw and went back, but the ball took ages to reach Russell and he misses it altogther to take it on the tummy. Sodhi is down on his haunches - in chuckles, of course
Ish Sodhi to A Russell, no run, Spitting Cobra. Lands a leg-break on leg, gets it to rip towards off and middle. Russell's defends meets the outer half
Ish Sodhi to Karthik, 1 run, short, turning just outside off. Karthik was early into the shot and ends up flat-batting it to long-on
Ish Sodhi to A Russell, 1 run, leg-break, turning away outside off. Russell makes room and punches it through cover
Ish Sodhi to A Russell, no run, alarming turn for Sodhi. Pitched up and spuns a mile, Russell watches it all staying on the back foot and wisely defends it
Jofra Archer to A Russell, 1 run, better. Length ball on leg, tickled through square leg

Jofra Archer to A Russell, SIX, wades into Archer. Just cannot bowl there for Russell. Goes full and at the stumps, Russell takes his front leg out of the way and dismisses it over long-on. Sheer disdain
Jofra Archer to A Russell, no ball, and again. But this time it's too high. Russell didn't bother to offer any shot. No-ball called, free-hit time for Russell
Jofra Archer to A Russell, no run, digging it in, Russell spots it and backs out of the line
Jofra Archer to A Russell, no run, back of a length just outside off, pushed to point

Jofra Archer to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Klaasen!! And does him next ball. Archer retaliates. Sticks to his strengths. Keeps it short and cramps Gill for room and space. Gill was backing away, in a bid to slash it through point. Is defeated by the extra bounce and zip. Gets a faint nick and Klaasen nestles it in his gloves. The partnership has been broken and KKR lose half their side. Shubman Gill c Klaasen b Jofra Archer 28(17) [4s-3 6s-1]

Jofra Archer to Shubman Gill, FOUR, Eden Gardens is loving it. Fearsome striking by Gill. No margin for error at all, Archer errs by giving him the width, Gill stands tall and crashes it through extra cover. Fierce!

Shreyas Gopal to Karthik, SIX, this maximum brings the 50-stand up for the duo. Another drag down delivery from Gopal, comes off the final ball of his spell. Karthik sees it early, pivots back and smacks it over cow corner. Feel for Gopal, he's bowled so well, just that lost his line and lengths in his last over

Brathwaite to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, full ball, slapped down to long-off and the duo don't bother to run. SRH are through to the IPL final, and they owe a great deal of thanks to their Afghanistani sensation Rashid Khan
Brathwaite to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, now skips across the stumps for the paddle, and misses. The ball goes behind his legs, while still being far enough of off

Brathwaite to Kuldeep Yadav, no run, they've gone up for a review, but whatever the result, it will be a dot ball. KKR are almost done. Brilliant yorker outside off, Kuldeep looks to slice it away, but can only bump it back off a thick inside edge. Definite bump-ball back to the bowler

Brathwaite to Shubman Gill, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Rashid Khan has gobbled this up like a candy in the deep. What ridiculous ease. Full ball on leg stump from round the wicket, Brathwaite's round the wicket angle cramped Gill up meaning that there was no power behind the shot. He merely chipped it up. Rashid settles under it, around five yards in front of the boundary, and swallows it. Shubman Gill c Rashid Khan b Brathwaite 30(20) [4s-2 6s-1]

Brathwaite to Shivam Mavi, out Caught by Rashid Khan!! Slogs, connects hard and flat, but picks out deep mid-wicket, and who should it be there. Of course Rashid Khan. To Brathwaite's credit, he bowled this pretty full and prevented Mavi from getting much elevation. KKR will at least have Gill on strike. Shivam Mavi c Rashid Khan b Brathwaite 6(4) [4s-1]
Brathwaite to Shivam Mavi, FOUR, how are the nerves now SRH? How are the nerves now Carlos? Full ball outside off, Mavi slices it away over backward point

S Kaul to Shubman Gill, SIX, and clears long-off! Gill has ensured that there will still be some pressure on the weaker bowling option - whoever that is, when the final over starts. Full ball outside off, Gill is deep in the crease to smash it back down the ground. Powers it into the crowd
S Kaul to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, full ball just outside off, slices it up off the outside half and it balloons over Williamson's head at extra cover
S Kaul to Shivam Mavi, 1 run, overpitched on off, and it's enough to prevent Mavi from getting under it. He backs to leg, and then smears it to deep point
S Kaul to Shubman Gill, 1 run, it was there to be hit this full toss, but Gill merely whips it to deep mid-wicket

S Kaul to Shivam Mavi, 1 run, this is unbelievable bowling under pressure. Yorker on off, Mavi jams it to short cover and then they run, because they have to, and not because it was on. Direct-hit would have ended Gill and with him, KKR's hopes

S Kaul to Chawla, out Bowled!! Off-stump ripped off! Kaul points to the heavens. Williamson claps. SRH leap closer. Full ball on middle, Chawla eyes an inside-out drive after clearing his front leg but only gets an outside edge to send the ball smashing into the off pole. Chawla b S Kaul 12(12) [6s-1]

Bhuvneshwar to Shubman Gill, FOUR, Bhuvneshwar dared to put his hands up, but he wasn't stopping this. A bit short of the blockhole this time, Gill accentuates the error by going deep in his crease and drills it hard and straight. Keeps KKR breathing
Bhuvneshwar to Chawla, 1 run, Chawla does try something different, goes for the lap-scoop but fine leg is back at the boundary. Only a single

Bhuvneshwar to Shubman Gill, 1 run, they have to try something here. Bhuvneshwar will keep hitting that mark otherwise. Near yorker on leg, cramps Gill up and restricts him to a timid flick through mid-wicket

Bhuvneshwar to Chawla, 1 run, brilliant, brilliant, brilliant. Yorker on leg-stump, Chawla - despite all the shuffling in the crease - can only manage a limp hit back towards Bhuvi who fumbles and allows the run
Bhuvneshwar to Shubman Gill, 1 run, 140kph, drilled into the blockhole. Silence deafening at Eden. Gill jams this off the toe-end towards long-on
Bhuvneshwar to Chawla, 1 run, and he starts brilliantly. Yorker on off, Chawla can only squeeze it to backward point
S Kaul to Chawla, 1 run, oh it was there to be biffed, Kaul has missed his length, but Chawla mistimes the full toss through mid-wicket

S Kaul to Shubman Gill, 1 run, his yorker-bowling at the death has been a revelation this season, and he plants another one in there. Jammed away wide of cover by Gill. Just three singles off the over so far. Pressure mounting
S Kaul to Shubman Gill, no run, nailed into the blockhole on off, Gill backs away and squeezes it to cover
S Kaul to Chawla, 1 run, length ball at the stumps, Chawla makes room to it and drives down the ground towards mid-off. Got it high on the bat there
S Kaul to Chawla, no run, short ball on off, wants to ramp it over the keeper's head but makes no contact
S Kaul to Shubman Gill, 1 run, pitched up at the stumps, whipped away to deep mid-wicket
K Khaleel Ahmed to Chawla, SIX, clears the front leg to this length ball and muscles it over mid-wicket. Length ball from Khaleel, right into Chawla's arc. 14 off the over to revive KKR's chase
K Khaleel Ahmed to Chawla, wide, awful delivery down leg, credit to Saha for stopping it
K Khaleel Ahmed to Shubman Gill, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off from round the wicket, punched through the covers

K Khaleel Ahmed to Shubman Gill, FOUR, stunning timing from Shubman Gill! Back of length outside off, Gill didn't even go through with this back foot punch. He checks the shot late, but it skims off the sweet spot to beat Williamson at extra cover
K Khaleel Ahmed to Chawla, 1 run, steered away down to third man
K Khaleel Ahmed to Chawla, no run, slanted in on leg, cramps Chawla up and takes his inside edge onto pad
K Khaleel Ahmed to Shubman Gill, 1 run, length ball outside off, flashes a drive and squirts it off a thick edge down to third man
Rashid Khan to Chawla, no run, flat leg-break on off, Chawla hangs back and blocks. KKR can breathe with whatever's left of them, Rashid is done. What a magical player
Rashid Khan to Chawla, no run, he's unplayable out there. Length ball on leg, turns back in and hits Chawla high on the pad

Rashid Khan to A Russell, out Caught by Dhawan!! What has Russell done here. What has he done? He can't believe it. Takes a moment to himself, before striding back into the pavilion. Flat googly turning in from outside off, Russell decides to go for a big cut, just unable to resist his attacking instincts. He's too cramped up to get it away, the ball fizzes off the edge, straight into the hands of Dhawan at slip. Rashid Khan, wow. A Russell c Dhawan b Rashid Khan 3(7)

Rashid Khan to A Russell, no run, prepared to play Rashid out here which is the smart thing to do. Fizzing on from a back of length, Russell is well back in the crease and brings out the straight BLOCK
Rashid Khan to A Russell, no run, hangs back and pats the leg-break to backward point
Rashid Khan to Shubman Gill, 1 run, beautifully uses his reach and flat-bats the drive to sweeper cover

Shakib to A Russell, no run, is that a drop? Arm-ball, slides back in and probably takes an inside-edge onto pad before popping towards Saha who never gets his gloves in the right place. Shakib with a priceless reaction, collapsing at the bowler's end

Shakib to Shubman Gill, 1 run, there was hesitation there, but Dhawan fumbles at short mid-wicket and the opportunity never materializes for SRH. Punched to the right of the fielder by Gill, and both of them stuttered for a bit
Shakib to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, waits for the length ball to come to him, and then back-cuts through backward point. Confident shot to play in the circumstances
Shakib to Shubman Gill, no run, nudged into the on-side
Shakib to A Russell, 1 run, Russell has casually bunted this back over Shakib's head, getting his teammates to skip a beat. Shakib leapt high, but it was just out of his reach
Shakib to Shubman Gill, 1 run, trifle short outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
Rashid Khan to Shubman Gill, 1 run, works the googly away through mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to A Russell, 1 run, opens the bat-face to steer the leg-break through point
Rashid Khan to Shubman Gill, 1 run, flat leg-break turning away from a back of length on off, Gill punches down to long-on
Rashid Khan to A Russell, 1 run, stays back to this googly, gives himself enough time to pick it off the wicket and works it through the on-side

Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, out Lbw!! Lynn falls sweeping. That was his ploy against spin. He was aware of the dangers associated with it, and was willing to take them anyway. Rashid's googly skids back in sharply and hits him on the knee-roll in front of off and middle. Plumb. What a turnaround this. Chris Lynn lbw b Rashid Khan 48(31) [4s-6 6s-2]
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, no run, sweeps this length ball to square leg

Shakib to Karthik, out Bowled!! What a massive wicket! Sunrisers are absolutely pumped, with Shakib furiously swinging his hand in celebration. Oh, this form. Such a tricky thing. Karthik gets carried away a touch, tries cutting a ball from off-stump and chops it back onto leg. The length wasn't short either, and his balance just wasn't there as he was leaning backward in trying to manufacture the room which wasn't there. This match is well and truly alive. Karthik b Shakib 8(6) [4s-1]
Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, length ball sliding in on off, punched down to long-off
Shakib to Chris Lynn, no run, length ball outside off, Lynn wafts at it and almost chips it to short cover. It stopped on him slightly
Shakib to Karthik, 1 run, works it through the on-side with the angle

Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, advances looking for a loft down the ground, but Shakib's delivery keeps drifting in from round the wicket to cramp him up. Eventually, Lynn is too close to the pitch and is cramped up, drags it away wide of long-on
Shakib to Karthik, 1 run, flat round-arm delivery outside off, Karthik cuts it to deep point
Rashid Khan to Karthik, 1 run, swatted away through mid-wicket for one
Rashid Khan to Karthik, FOUR, beautiful footwork from Karthik, so nimble. He's been in such sublime form. The length is short, which he picks in a flash, and pummels the pull through mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, length ball, the googly turns in towards the stumps. Lynn drags the sweep away behind square

Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, FOUR, Lynn has made his mind up. He isn't deviating from it. This is what he'll do, live or die. Length ball at the stumps, and he sweeps it away through square leg. It was uppish, and there was a fielder in the ring, but he got it to his left
Rashid Khan to Karthik, 1 run, 91kph, pushed through on middle. Probably the googly which snakes in and takes a thick inside edge in Karthik's defence

Rashid Khan to Uthappa, out Bowled!! That's not very smart from Uthappa, his flattened leg-stump tells him the same. The very first ball he faces from Rashid, he tries to reverse-sweep him premeditatedly. It was too full to be doing that. The ball slid on under his bat and crashed his wicket away. Off you go, says Rashid with a twirl of his wrist. Uthappa b Rashid Khan 2(8)

Bhuvneshwar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, no frickin' way! Lady luck can't possibly be so mean! Back of a length outside off, jumps up and catches Chris Lynn by surprise, who gets a leading edge which, believe me, goes through the gap at deep backward point for four
Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, 1 run, back of a length delivery just outside off, Uthappa steers it down to third man with an open bat-face for a quick single
Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, no run, perfect Test match length ball, outside off, Uthappa gets forward, waits and taps it on the head into the off-side

Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, no run, back of a length delivery in the channel outside off, Uthappa has already shuffled across and tries to steer it through the cordon, forgets that there is a slip in place. Oops.
Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, no run, good length delivery just outside off, steered with an angled bat towards backward point
Bhuvneshwar to Uthappa, no run, back of a length delivery on middle, Uthappa gets back in the crease and wristily whips it towards mid-on
Shakib to Chris Lynn, no run, fuller one tossed up towards off, rather brave of Shaks, Lynn push-drives it towards mid-off
Shakib to Uthappa, 1 run, a tad short, flat trajectory, sits up, Uthappa gets deep in the crease and whips it to deep mid-wicket for a single
Shakib to Uthappa, no run, tossed up, on middle and leg, Uthappa drops it off the front foot towards the on-side

Shakib to Nitish Rana, out Nitish Rana Run Out!! 1 run completed. You've gotta be kidding me! Full ball nurdled away towards deep mid-wicket, Rashid (who can't be kept out of the game) fires in the throw at the keeper's end. Rana, who slipped at the non-striker's end, ran to the danger end (the striker's end) for the fatal second run and was caught just marginally short. Throws his bat in disgust as he walks back, embarrassed. Nitish Rana run out (Rashid Khan/Saha) 22(16) [4s-1 6s-2]
Shakib to Nitish Rana, FOUR, flat and angling towards middle, Nitish Rana switches his stance into a right-hander's, reverse-sweeps to third man for four
Shakib to Chris Lynn, 1 run, flat and full outside off, pucnhed to long-off for a single

Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, 1 run, just a fraction short outside off, Chris Lynn is into position for the pull and adjusts for the line with his wrists, maneuvres it towards deep square leg for a single
Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, FOUR, wide half-volley outside off, Chris Lynn has his feet glued to the turf and lofts it towards sweeper cover for four. Lands about a centimeter short of the rope

Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, no run, good length and wide outside off, Chris Lynn tries to reach out and smash it away, but perhaps his bad back is preventing him from leaning into it. Doesn't reach it. NO contact
Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, FOUR, short and wide, Chris Lynn slashes at it, gets it over the infield towards third man for four

Brathwaite to Nitish Rana, 1 run, back of a length delivery on the hips, dropped off the back foot to square leg where Williamson picks up and throws at the non-striker's end. He wasn't even in the frame when the ball crossed the stumps. Terrible running from Rana
Brathwaite to Chris Lynn, 1 run, length delivery just outside off, tapped to cover for a sneaky single
Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, 2 runs, full delivery on off, Nitish Rana is on his knee and slugs it straight down the ground where Kane dives and saves two valuable runs for SRH
Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, no run, skiddy flipper outside off, Nitish Rana gets low and cuts, nearly chops it onto his stumps, gets it to backward point

Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, no run, leg-break from over the wicket, Nitish Rana plays down the wrong line and it spins past his inside edge onto the pad. Crashing into leg, or missing it? Either way, no review
Rashid Khan to Nitish Rana, no run, googly turning away outside off, beaten on the outside edge
Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, 1 run, fired in towards leg, Chris Lynn goes for the sweep again (to the disgust of my co-commentator) towards fine leg for a single

Rashid Khan to Chris Lynn, no run, interesting stuff. SRH have gone for the review for LBW. Leg-break straightening and the sweep takes the glove on it's way! The appeal was for an LBW, but there was glove on it. It actually came off the glove, but the keeper has dropped it.
S Kaul to Chris Lynn, 1 run, abominable full-toss on off, Chris Lynn moves towards leg and punches it towards cover as they scamper through for a single.

S Kaul to Chris Lynn, no run, length delivery heading for middle, Chris Lynn moves away from leg-stump and cross-bats it towards Bhuvi at mid-on. Not short enough for the pull, and he gets it off the under-edge of the bat

Brathwaite to Rayudu, FOUR, that's it! Chennai Super Kings are champions of IPL for the third time. What a brilliant return to the stage this is from CSK after a two-year ban. The players rush to the middle to mob Watson. Meanwhile, captain Dhoni is gently walking around with a gentle smile of his
Brathwaite to Rayudu, no run, very full again, Rayudu drives and finds mid-off
Brathwaite to Rayudu, no run, yorker and on the stumps, Rayudu digs it out towards the on-side
S Kaul to Watson, no run, defended off the front foot

S Kaul to Watson, FOUR, and he's doing it in style. Kaul tries the yorker and Watson drives it straight and hard, Kaul takes his leg out of the way to save himself and the ball rockets to the boundary
S Kaul to Watson, FOUR, oh that's a bowler-killer. Luckily it didn't come very straight at Kaul. Very full from Kaul, Watson drills it hard and beats long-off
S Kaul to Rayudu, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Rayudu punches to sweeper cover
S Kaul to Watson, 1 run, low full toss and Watson tries to hit it hard, doesn't get the connection right, hit to long-off
S Kaul to Rayudu, 1 run, shortish from Kaul, Rayudu pulls it to fine leg

Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR, the fielder at deep backward square leg has misjudged this. Watson slogged this in the air, the fielder dived but couldn't get there. On the biggest night, CSK have negated Rashid Khan without a wicket
Rashid Khan to Watson, FOUR, cheeky, gets inside the line of this googly and paddles it past the man at short fine leg, this is clever batting from Watson
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, 1 run, driven to mid-on

Rashid Khan to Watson, 1 run, take a bow, Shane Robert Watson. He becomes the fourth player to have two or more hundreds in an IPL season. If at all you are struggling in life, just watch this innings folks. This is a serious life lesson. He couldn't time the ball, was only hitting it to hand, was getting beaten, his first run came off the 11th ball he faced, but he didn't lose heart. Backed himself like his captain always does and he now has a hundred off 51 balls. When his trigger is that slight movement backwards with a gentle hop of the front leg, you know as a bowler he's in the zone. He switched gears and muscled all the bowlers around. The hundred ball though was just a gentle push to the left of cover and off comes the helmet, great applause from the crowd and the CSK dugout and soaks them all in with his hands aloft
Rashid Khan to Rayudu, 1 run, gentle drive to long-off and a big roar as Watson heads to take strike
